/home/nathan/Projects/arbiter/tests/e2e-docker-compose/tests dir     46.00 B 2025-09-19 19:02:00

/home/nathan/Projects/arbiter/tests/e2e-docker-compose/tsconfig.json file   357.00 B 2025-09-19 19:02:00
/home/nathan/Projects/arbiter/tsconfig.json                  file    1.32 KB 2025-09-19 21:32:39
📄 packages/cli/src/validation/warnings.ts
/**
 * Validation Warning System
 *
 * This module provides a comprehensive warning system that checks CUE specifications
 * for completeness and forces agents to create detailed, production-ready specs.
 *
 * Warnings block generation unless --force flag is used.
 */

import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;

// Normalized spec interface for validation
interface NormalizedSpec {
  product?: { name?: string; goals?: string[] };
  metadata?: { name?: string; version?: string; description?: string };
  services?: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
  ui?: { routes?: any[] };
  tests?: any[];
  epics?: any[];
  security?: any;
  performance?: any;
  observability?: any;
  environments?: any;
  locators?: any;
  data?: any;
  docs?: any;
}

export interface ValidationWarning {
  category: string;
  severity: &#39;warning&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
  message: string;
  suggestion: string;
  path?: string;
}

export interface ValidationResult {
  hasWarnings: boolean;
  hasErrors: boolean;
  warnings: ValidationWarning[];
  errors: ValidationWarning[];
}

/**
 * Main validation function - checks all warning categories
 */
export function validateSpecification(spec: any): ValidationResult {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Normalize spec to ensure we have a consistent interface
  const normalizedSpec = normalizeSpec(spec);

  // Run all validators
  warnings.push(...validateTestDefinitions(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateEpicsAndTasks(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateServiceCompleteness(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateDocumentation(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateSecurity(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validatePerformanceSpecs(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateUICompleteness(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateDataManagement(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateObservability(normalizedSpec));
  warnings.push(...validateEnvironmentConfig(normalizedSpec));

  const errors = warnings.filter(w =&gt; w.severity === &#39;error&#39;);
  const warningList = warnings.filter(w =&gt; w.severity === &#39;warning&#39;);

  return {
    hasWarnings: warningList.length &gt; 0,
    hasErrors: errors.length &gt; 0,
    warnings: warningList,
    errors,
  };
}

/**
 * Normalize any spec format to a consistent interface
 */
function normalizeSpec(spec: any): NormalizedSpec {
  if (!spec) return {};

  return {
    product: spec.product,
    metadata: spec.metadata,
    services: spec.services,
    ui: spec.ui,
    tests: spec.tests,
    epics: spec.epics,
    security: spec.security,
    performance: spec.performance,
    observability: spec.observability,
    environments: spec.environments,
    locators: spec.locators,
    data: spec.data,
    docs: spec.docs,
  };
}

/**
 * Check if specification has comprehensive test definitions
 */
function validateTestDefinitions(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Check for missing test suites
  if (!spec.tests || spec.tests.length === 0) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Testing&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;No test suites defined&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Add comprehensive test coverage with unit, integration, and e2e tests&#39;,
      path: &#39;tests&#39;,
    });
  } else {
    // Check for test coverage completeness
    const hasUnit = spec.tests.some(t =&gt; t.type === &#39;unit&#39;);
    const hasIntegration = spec.tests.some(t =&gt; t.type === &#39;integration&#39;);
    const hasE2E = spec.tests.some(t =&gt; t.type === &#39;e2e&#39;);

    if (!hasUnit) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Testing&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Missing unit tests&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Add unit test suite to validate individual components&#39;,
        path: &#39;tests&#39;,
      });
    }

    if (!hasIntegration) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Testing&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Missing integration tests&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Add integration test suite to validate service interactions&#39;,
        path: &#39;tests&#39;,
      });
    }

    if (!hasE2E) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Testing&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Missing end-to-end tests&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Add e2e test suite to validate complete user workflows&#39;,
        path: &#39;tests&#39;,
      });
    }

    // Check for test cases without assertions
    spec.tests.forEach((testSuite, idx) =&gt; {
      if (!testSuite.cases || testSuite.cases.length === 0) {
        warnings.push({
          category: &#39;Testing&#39;,
          severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
          message: `Test suite &#39;${testSuite.name}&#39; has no test cases`,
          suggestion: &#39;Add specific test cases with clear assertions&#39;,
          path: `tests[${idx}].cases`,
        });
      }
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check for missing epics and tasks for source services
 */
function validateEpicsAndTasks(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Check if epics/tasks are defined
  const hasEpics = spec.epics &amp;&amp; spec.epics.length &gt; 0;
  const hasTasks = spec.epics?.some(epic =&gt; epic.tasks &amp;&amp; epic.tasks.length &gt; 0);

  // Find source services (not pre-existing containers)
  const sourceServices = Object.entries(spec.services || {}).filter(
    ([_, service]) =&gt;
      service.type === &#39;deployment&#39; &amp;&amp; service.serviceType === &#39;bespoke&#39; &amp;&amp; !service.image // No pre-built image = source code
  );

  if (sourceServices.length &gt; 0) {
    if (!hasEpics) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Project Management&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Source services found but no epics defined&#39;,
        suggestion: `Add epics to track implementation of custom services: ${sourceServices.map(([name]) =&gt; name).join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
        path: &#39;epics&#39;,
      });
    }

    if (!hasTasks) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Project Management&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Source services found but no implementation tasks defined&#39;,
        suggestion: `Add detailed tasks with dependencies for implementing: ${sourceServices.map(([name]) =&gt; name).join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
        path: &#39;epics[].tasks&#39;,
      });
    }

    // Check each source service has corresponding epic/tasks
    sourceServices.forEach(([serviceName, service]) =&gt; {
      const hasServiceEpic = spec.epics?.some(
        epic =&gt;
          epic.name.toLowerCase().includes(serviceName.toLowerCase()) ||
          epic.description?.toLowerCase().includes(serviceName.toLowerCase())
      );

      if (!hasServiceEpic) {
        warnings.push({
          category: &#39;Project Management&#39;,
          severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
          message: `Source service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; has no corresponding epic`,
          suggestion: `Add epic for implementing ${serviceName} service with detailed tasks`,
          path: `services.${serviceName}`,
        });
      }
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check service definitions for completeness
 */
function validateServiceCompleteness(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  Object.entries(spec.services || {}).forEach(([serviceName, service]) =&gt; {
    const basePath = `services.${serviceName}`;

    // Check for missing essential service properties
    if (!service.language) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Service Definition&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; missing language specification`,
        suggestion: &#39;Specify the programming language (typescript, python, rust, go, etc.)&#39;,
        path: `${basePath}.language`,
      });
    }

    if (!service.ports || service.ports.length === 0) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Service Definition&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; has no port definitions`,
        suggestion: &#39;Define exposed ports with protocol and target port&#39;,
        path: `${basePath}.ports`,
      });
    }

    // Check for missing health checks on source services
    if (service.serviceType === &#39;bespoke&#39; &amp;&amp; !service.healthCheck) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Service Definition&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Source service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; missing health check configuration`,
        suggestion: &#39;Add health check endpoint and configuration for monitoring&#39;,
        path: `${basePath}.healthCheck`,
      });
    }

    // Check for missing resource limits
    if (!service.resources) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Service Definition&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; missing resource specifications`,
        suggestion: &#39;Define CPU and memory limits for proper resource management&#39;,
        path: `${basePath}.resources`,
      });
    }

    // Check for missing environment configuration
    if (
      service.serviceType === &#39;bespoke&#39; &amp;&amp;
      (!service.env || Object.keys(service.env).length === 0)
    ) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Service Definition&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Source service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; missing environment configuration`,
        suggestion: &#39;Define environment variables for configuration management&#39;,
        path: `${basePath}.env`,
      });
    }
  });

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check for missing documentation
 */
function validateDocumentation(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  if (!spec.product?.goals || spec.product.goals.length === 0) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Documentation&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing product goals and objectives&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define clear product goals to guide development decisions&#39;,
      path: &#39;product.goals&#39;,
    });
  }

  if (!spec.metadata?.description) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Documentation&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing project description&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Add comprehensive project description in metadata&#39;,
      path: &#39;metadata.description&#39;,
    });
  }

  // Check for missing API documentation
  const hasApiServices = Object.values(spec.services || {}).some(s =&gt;
    s.ports?.some(p =&gt; p.name?.includes(&#39;http&#39;) || p.name?.includes(&#39;api&#39;))
  );

  if (hasApiServices &amp;&amp; (!spec.docs || !spec.docs.api)) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Documentation&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;API services found but no API documentation specified&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Add API documentation configuration (OpenAPI, endpoints, etc.)&#39;,
      path: &#39;docs.api&#39;,
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check for security configurations
 */
function validateSecurity(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Check for missing authentication on UI routes
  if (spec.ui?.routes &amp;&amp; spec.ui.routes.length &gt; 0) {
    const unprotectedRoutes = spec.ui.routes.filter(
      route =&gt; route.capabilities?.includes(&#39;admin&#39;) &amp;&amp; !route.requiresAuth
    );

    if (unprotectedRoutes.length &gt; 0) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Security&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Admin routes found without authentication requirements&#39;,
        suggestion: `Add requiresAuth: true to admin routes: ${unprotectedRoutes.map(r =&gt; r.path).join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
        path: &#39;ui.routes&#39;,
      });
    }
  }

  // Check for missing security configuration
  if (!spec.security) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Security&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing security configuration&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define authentication, authorization, and security policies&#39;,
      path: &#39;security&#39;,
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check for performance specifications
 */
function validatePerformanceSpecs(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  if (!spec.performance) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Performance&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing performance specifications&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define SLAs, response time targets, and throughput requirements&#39;,
      path: &#39;performance&#39;,
    });
  }

  // Check services for missing performance configuration
  Object.entries(spec.services || {}).forEach(([serviceName, service]) =&gt; {
    if (service.serviceType === &#39;bespoke&#39; &amp;&amp; !service.resources?.limits) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Performance&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: `Service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; missing resource limits`,
        suggestion: &#39;Define CPU and memory limits for performance predictability&#39;,
        path: `services.${serviceName}.resources.limits`,
      });
    }
  });

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check UI completeness
 */
function validateUICompleteness(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  if (spec.ui?.routes &amp;&amp; spec.ui.routes.length &gt; 0) {
    spec.ui.routes.forEach((route, idx) =&gt; {
      const basePath = `ui.routes[${idx}]`;

      if (!route.components || route.components.length === 0) {
        warnings.push({
          category: &#39;UI Design&#39;,
          severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
          message: `Route &#39;${route.path}&#39; missing component specifications`,
          suggestion: &#39;Define UI components needed for this route&#39;,
          path: `${basePath}.components`,
        });
      }

      if (!route.capabilities || route.capabilities.length === 0) {
        warnings.push({
          category: &#39;UI Design&#39;,
          severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
          message: `Route &#39;${route.path}&#39; missing capability definitions`,
          suggestion: &#39;Define user capabilities/permissions for this route&#39;,
          path: `${basePath}.capabilities`,
        });
      }
    });

    // Check for missing locators (test automation)
    if (!spec.locators || Object.keys(spec.locators).length === 0) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;UI Design&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;UI routes defined but no test locators specified&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Add CSS selectors/test IDs for automated testing&#39;,
        path: &#39;locators&#39;,
      });
    }
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check data management completeness
 */
function validateDataManagement(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Check for database usage without proper configuration
  const hasDatabaseServices = Object.values(spec.services || {}).some(
    s =&gt;
      s.image?.includes(&#39;postgres&#39;) ||
      s.image?.includes(&#39;mysql&#39;) ||
      s.image?.includes(&#39;mongo&#39;) ||
      s.serviceType === &#39;database&#39;
  );

  if (hasDatabaseServices) {
    if (!spec.data) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Data Management&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Database services found but no data schema defined&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Add data models, migrations, and backup strategies&#39;,
        path: &#39;data&#39;,
      });
    }

    // Check for missing migration strategy
    if (!spec.data?.migrations) {
      warnings.push({
        category: &#39;Data Management&#39;,
        severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
        message: &#39;Database services found but no migration strategy defined&#39;,
        suggestion: &#39;Define database migration and versioning approach&#39;,
        path: &#39;data.migrations&#39;,
      });
    }
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check observability configuration
 */
function validateObservability(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  const hasServices = Object.keys(spec.services || {}).length &gt; 0;

  if (hasServices &amp;&amp; !spec.observability) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Observability&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Services defined but no observability configuration&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Add logging, monitoring, and alerting configuration&#39;,
      path: &#39;observability&#39;,
    });
  }

  if (hasServices &amp;&amp; !spec.observability?.logging) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Observability&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing logging configuration&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define log levels, formats, and aggregation strategy&#39;,
      path: &#39;observability.logging&#39;,
    });
  }

  if (hasServices &amp;&amp; !spec.observability?.monitoring) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Observability&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing monitoring configuration&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define metrics collection and health monitoring&#39;,
      path: &#39;observability.monitoring&#39;,
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Check environment configuration
 */
function validateEnvironmentConfig(spec: NormalizedSpec): ValidationWarning[] {
  const warnings: ValidationWarning[] = [];

  // Check for missing environment definitions
  if (!spec.environments || Object.keys(spec.environments).length === 0) {
    warnings.push({
      category: &#39;Environment Config&#39;,
      severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
      message: &#39;Missing environment configurations&#39;,
      suggestion: &#39;Define development, staging, and production environments&#39;,
      path: &#39;environments&#39;,
    });
  } else {
    const requiredEnvs = [&#39;development&#39;, &#39;production&#39;];
    const definedEnvs = Object.keys(spec.environments);

    requiredEnvs.forEach(env =&gt; {
      if (!definedEnvs.includes(env)) {
        warnings.push({
          category: &#39;Environment Config&#39;,
          severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
          message: `Missing ${env} environment configuration`,
          suggestion: `Add ${env} environment with proper configuration`,
          path: `environments.${env}`,
        });
      }
    });
  }

  return warnings;
}

/**
 * Format warnings for CLI output
 */
export function formatWarnings(result: ValidationResult): string {
  const lines: string[] = [];

  if (result.hasErrors) {
    lines.push(chalk.red.bold(&#39;\n❌ ERRORS (must fix):&#39;));
    result.errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
      lines.push(chalk.red(`  • ${error.category}: ${error.message}`));
      lines.push(chalk.gray(`    ${error.suggestion}`));
      if (error.path) lines.push(chalk.gray(`    Path: ${error.path}`));
    });
  }

  if (result.hasWarnings) {
    lines.push(chalk.yellow.bold(&#39;\n⚠️  WARNINGS (recommend fixing):&#39;));
    result.warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; {
      lines.push(chalk.yellow(`  • ${warning.category}: ${warning.message}`));
      lines.push(chalk.gray(`    ${warning.suggestion}`));
      if (warning.path) lines.push(chalk.gray(`    Path: ${warning.path}`));
    });
  }

  if (result.hasWarnings || result.hasErrors) {
    lines.push(chalk.blue.bold(&#39;\n💡 Use --force to generate anyway&#39;));
    lines.push(chalk.red.bold(&#39;\n🚨 IMPORTANT FOR AI AGENTS:&#39;));
    lines.push(
      chalk.yellow(
        &#39;IF YOU NEED INFORMATION TO COMPLETE THE SPEC, ASK THE PRODUCT OWNER (USER) FOR IT.&#39;
      )
    );
    lines.push(chalk.yellow(&#39;YOU MUST REQUEST APPROVAL FROM THE USER BEFORE USING `--force`.&#39;));
  }

  return lines.join(&#39;\n&#39;);
}
📄 apps/api/src/ir.ts
/**
 * Intermediate Representation (IR) generator for diagrams and visualizations
 */
import type { IRKind, IRResponse } from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { getCurrentTimestamp, logger } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

export class IRGenerator {
  /**
   * Generate IR for different diagram types
   */
  async generateIR(kind: IRKind, resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Promise&lt;IRResponse&gt; {
    const startTime = Date.now();

    try {
      let data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;

      switch (kind) {
        case &#39;flow&#39;:
          data = this.generateFlowIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;fsm&#39;:
          data = this.generateFsmIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;view&#39;:
          data = this.generateViewIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;site&#39;:
          data = this.generateSiteIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;capabilities&#39;:
          data = this.generateCapabilitiesIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;flows&#39;:
          data = this.generateFlowsIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;dependencies&#39;:
          data = this.generateDependenciesIR(resolved);
          break;
        case &#39;coverage&#39;:
          data = this.generateCoverageIR(resolved);
          break;
        default:
          throw new Error(`Unknown IR kind: ${kind}`);
      }

      const duration = Date.now() - startTime;

      // Reduced logging - only log for debug level when enabled
      // logger.debug(&quot;Generated IR&quot;, {
      //   kind,
      //   nodeCount: this.getNodeCount(data),
      //   duration,
      // });

      return {
        kind,
        data,
        generated_at: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      };
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;IR generation failed&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined, { kind });

      throw new Error(
        `Failed to generate ${kind} IR: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;}`
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * Generate flow IR for Mermaid (flowchart/sequence) - from TODO.md specification
   */
  private generateFlowIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const flows = this.extractFlows(resolved);
    const flowIRs: any[] = [];

    Object.entries(flows).forEach(([flowId, flow]) =&gt; {
      const nodes: any[] = [];
      const edges: any[] = [];

      if (Array.isArray(flow.steps)) {
        flow.steps.forEach((step: any, index: number) =&gt; {
          const nodeId = step.id || `${index}`;
          const kind = this.getFlowStepKind(step);
          const label = this.getFlowStepLabel(step, index);

          nodes.push({
            id: nodeId,
            kind,
            label,
          });

          // Create edges based on dependsOn relationships
          if (step.dependsOn &amp;&amp; Array.isArray(step.dependsOn)) {
            step.dependsOn.forEach((depId: string) =&gt; {
              edges.push({
                from: depId,
                to: nodeId,
                label: step.transition || &#39;&#39;,
              });
            });
          }
        });
      }

      flowIRs.push({
        id: flowId,
        nodes,
        edges,
      });
    });

    return {
      specHash: this.computeSpecHash(resolved),
      flows: flowIRs,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate FSM IR for XState - from TODO.md specification
   */
  private generateFsmIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    // Handle both CUE format (states) and legacy format (stateModels)
    const stateModels =
      (resolved.states as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) ||
      (resolved.stateModels as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) ||
      {};
    const fsms: any[] = [];

    Object.entries(stateModels).forEach(([fsmId, model]) =&gt; {
      const states: Record&lt;string, any&gt; = {};

      if (model.states &amp;&amp; typeof model.states === &#39;object&#39;) {
        Object.entries(model.states).forEach(([stateId, state]: [string, any]) =&gt; {
          states[stateId] = {
            actions: state.actions || [],
            transitions: state.transitions || state.on || {},
          };
        });
      }

      fsms.push({
        id: fsmId,
        name: model.name || fsmId,
        initial: model.initialState || model.initial || &#39;idle&#39;,
        states,
      });
    });

    return {
      specHash: this.computeSpecHash(resolved),
      fsms,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate view IR for wireframes - from TODO.md specification
   */
  private generateViewIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    // Handle both CUE format (routes) and legacy format (ui.routes)
    const routes = (resolved.routes as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || (resolved.ui as any)?.routes || {};
    const locators = (resolved.locators as Record&lt;string, string&gt;) || {};
    const views: any[] = [];

    Object.entries(routes).forEach(([path, route]: [string, any]) =&gt; {
      const widgets: any[] = [];

      // Extract widgets from route components and map with locators
      if (route.components &amp;&amp; Array.isArray(route.components)) {
        route.components.forEach((component: any) =&gt; {
          if (component.type === &#39;button&#39; &amp;&amp; component.token) {
            widgets.push({
              type: &#39;button&#39;,
              token: component.token,
              text: component.text || component.token,
            });
          } else if (component.type === &#39;input&#39; &amp;&amp; component.token) {
            widgets.push({
              type: &#39;input&#39;,
              token: component.token,
              label: component.label || component.token,
            });
          } else if (component.type === &#39;table&#39; &amp;&amp; component.token) {
            widgets.push({
              type: &#39;table&#39;,
              token: component.token,
              columns: component.columns || [],
            });
          }
        });
      }

      // Also extract widgets from referenced locators
      Object.entries(locators).forEach(([token, _selector]) =&gt; {
        if (token.startsWith(&#39;btn:&#39;)) {
          widgets.push({
            type: &#39;button&#39;,
            token,
            text: token.replace(&#39;btn:&#39;, &#39;&#39;),
          });
        } else if (token.startsWith(&#39;input:&#39;)) {
          widgets.push({
            type: &#39;input&#39;,
            token,
            label: token.replace(&#39;input:&#39;, &#39;&#39;),
          });
        }
      });

      // Create view for each route (even without widgets for navigation structure)
      views.push({
        id: path,
        name: route.name || path,
        component: route.component,
        layout: route.layout,
        requiresAuth: route.requiresAuth || false,
        widgets,
      });
    });

    return {
      specHash: this.computeSpecHash(resolved),
      views,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate site IR (DAG of routes) for Graphviz - from TODO.md specification
   */
  private generateSiteIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const routes = (resolved.ui as any)?.routes || [];
    const nodes: any[] = [];
    const edges: any[] = [];

    // Create nodes for each route
    routes.forEach((route: any) =&gt; {
      nodes.push({
        id: route.id || route.path,
        label: route.name || route.path,
        path: route.path,
        capabilities: route.capabilities || [],
      });
    });

    // Create edges based on route relationships and navigation patterns
    routes.forEach((route: any, index: number) =&gt; {
      const routeId = route.id || route.path;

      // Connect routes that share capabilities (simplified relationship detection)
      routes.forEach((otherRoute: any, otherIndex: number) =&gt; {
        if (index !== otherIndex &amp;&amp; route.capabilities &amp;&amp; otherRoute.capabilities) {
          const sharedCaps = route.capabilities.filter((cap: string) =&gt;
            otherRoute.capabilities.includes(cap)
          );

          if (sharedCaps.length &gt; 0) {
            const otherRouteId = otherRoute.id || otherRoute.path;
            edges.push({
              from: routeId,
              to: otherRouteId,
              label: sharedCaps.join(&#39;, &#39;),
              type: &#39;capability&#39;,
            });
          }
        }
      });
    });

    return {
      specHash: this.computeSpecHash(resolved),
      routes: {
        nodes,
        edges,
      },
    };
  }

  private extractFlows(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, any&gt; {
    return (resolved.flows as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};
  }

  private getNodeCount(data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): number {
    const nodes = data.nodes;
    return Array.isArray(nodes) ? nodes.length : 0;
  }

  // New helper methods for TODO.md specification compliance
  private getFlowStepKind(step: any): string {
    // Handle CUE specification format
    if (step.type) return step.type;

    // Fallback to legacy test format
    if (step.visit) return &#39;visit&#39;;
    if (step.click) return &#39;click&#39;;
    if (step.fill) return &#39;fill&#39;;
    if (step.expect) return &#39;expect&#39;;
    if (step.expect_api) return &#39;expect_api&#39;;
    return &#39;process&#39;;
  }

  private getFlowStepLabel(step: any, index: number): string {
    // Handle CUE specification format
    if (step.name) return step.name;

    // Fallback to legacy test format
    if (step.visit) return `Visit: ${step.visit}`;
    if (step.click) return `Click: ${step.click}`;
    if (step.fill) return `Fill: ${step.fill}`;
    if (step.expect) return `Expect: ${step.expect.locator || step.expect}`;
    if (step.expect_api) return `API: ${step.expect_api.method} ${step.expect_api.path}`;
    return `Step ${index + 1}`;
  }

  private computeSpecHash(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): string {
    // Simple hash computation - in production you&#39;d want a proper hash like SHA-256
    return `sha256-${JSON.stringify(resolved).length.toString(16)}`;
  }

  /**
   * Generate capabilities IR for dependency graph visualization
   */
  private generateCapabilitiesIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const capabilities = (resolved.capabilities as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};
    const nodes: any[] = [];
    const edges: any[] = [];
    const groups: any[] = [];
    const domains = new Set&lt;string&gt;();

    // Process capabilities into nodes
    Object.entries(capabilities).forEach(([capId, capability]) =&gt; {
      const domain = capId.split(&#39;.&#39;)[0];
      domains.add(domain);

      nodes.push({
        id: capId,
        label: capability.name || capId,
        type: &#39;capability&#39;,
        domain: domain,
        properties: {
          complexity: capability.complexity || &#39;medium&#39;,
          priority: capability.priority || &#39;medium&#39;,
          owner: capability.owner || &#39;unknown&#39;,
        },
      });

      // Create dependency edges
      if (capability.depends_on &amp;&amp; Array.isArray(capability.depends_on)) {
        capability.depends_on.forEach((depId: string) =&gt; {
          edges.push({
            source: depId,
            target: capId,
            type: &#39;dependency&#39;,
          });
        });
      }
    });

    // Create domain groups
    domains.forEach(domain =&gt; {
      const domainNodes = nodes.filter(n =&gt; n.domain === domain);
      groups.push({
        id: domain,
        label: domain.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + domain.slice(1),
        nodeIds: domainNodes.map(n =&gt; n.id),
      });
    });

    return {
      type: &#39;directed_graph&#39;,
      nodes,
      edges,
      groups,
      metadata: {
        totalCapabilities: nodes.length,
        dependencies: edges.length,
        domains: domains.size,
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate flows IR for flowchart visualization (alias for flow)
   */
  private generateFlowsIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const flows = (resolved.flows as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};
    const flowList: any[] = [];

    Object.entries(flows).forEach(([flowId, flow]) =&gt; {
      flowList.push({
        id: flowId,
        name: flow.name || flowId,
        steps: flow.steps || [],
      });
    });

    return {
      type: &#39;flowchart&#39;,
      flows: flowList,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate dependencies IR for layered graph visualization
   */
  private generateDependenciesIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const capabilities = (resolved.capabilities as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};
    const layers: any[] = [];
    const processed = new Set&lt;string&gt;();
    let layerIndex = 0;

    // Build dependency layers (topological sort)
    while (processed.size &lt; Object.keys(capabilities).length &amp;&amp; layerIndex &lt; 10) {
      const currentLayer: any[] = [];

      Object.entries(capabilities).forEach(([capId, capability]) =&gt; {
        if (processed.has(capId)) return;

        const dependencies = capability.depends_on || [];
        const allDepsProcessed = dependencies.every((dep: string) =&gt; processed.has(dep));

        if (allDepsProcessed) {
          currentLayer.push({
            id: capId,
            label: capability.name || capId,
            dependencies: dependencies,
          });
          processed.add(capId);
        }
      });

      if (currentLayer.length &gt; 0) {
        layers.push({
          level: layerIndex,
          nodes: currentLayer,
        });
      }

      layerIndex++;
    }

    return {
      type: &#39;layered_graph&#39;,
      layers,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate coverage IR for test coverage visualization
   */
  private generateCoverageIR(resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    const capabilities = (resolved.capabilities as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};
    const tests = (resolved.tests as Record&lt;string, any&gt;) || {};

    const totalCapabilities = Object.keys(capabilities).length;
    let coveredCapabilities = 0;
    const coverage: Record&lt;string, any&gt; = {};

    // Calculate coverage for each capability
    Object.entries(capabilities).forEach(([capId, capability]) =&gt; {
      const coveringTests = Object.entries(tests).filter(([_, test]) =&gt; {
        const covers = test.covers || [];
        return covers.includes(capId);
      });

      const isCovered = coveringTests.length &gt; 0;
      if (isCovered) coveredCapabilities++;

      coverage[capId] = {
        covered: isCovered,
        testCount: coveringTests.length,
        tests: coveringTests.map(([testId, _]) =&gt; testId),
      };
    });

    const overallCoverage =
      totalCapabilities &gt; 0 ? (coveredCapabilities / totalCapabilities) * 100 : 0;

    return {
      type: &#39;coverage_graph&#39;,
      coverage: {
        overall: Math.round(overallCoverage),
        capabilities: coverage,
        summary: {
          total: totalCapabilities,
          covered: coveredCapabilities,
          uncovered: totalCapabilities - coveredCapabilities,
        },
      },
    };
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/core.ts
import { EventEmitter } from &#39;node:events&#39;;
import { performance } from &#39;node:perf_hooks&#39;;

/**
 * Constraint violation error with specific failure details
 */
export class ConstraintViolationError extends Error {
  constructor(
    public readonly constraint: string,
    public readonly actual: unknown,
    public readonly expected: unknown,
    public readonly details?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ) {
    super(`Constraint violation: ${constraint} - Expected ${expected}, got ${actual}`);
    this.name = &#39;ConstraintViolationError&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Core constraint types that must be enforced across all operations
 */
export interface Constraints {
  /** Maximum payload size in bytes (≤64 KB) */
  maxPayloadSize: number;
  /** Maximum operation duration in milliseconds (≤750 ms) */
  maxOperationTime: number;
  /** Rate limit in requests per second (~1 rps) */
  rateLimit: {
    requests: number;
    windowMs: number;
  };
  /** API version for schema validation */
  apiVersion: string;
  /** Maximum symlink depth (0 = no symlinks allowed) */
  maxSymlinkDepth: number;
}

/**
 * Default constraint values from TODO.md section 13
 */
export const DEFAULT_CONSTRAINTS: Constraints = {
  maxPayloadSize: 64 * 1024, // 64 KB
  maxOperationTime: 750, // 750 ms
  rateLimit: {
    requests: 1,
    windowMs: 1000, // 1 second window for ~1 rps
  },
  apiVersion: &#39;2024-12-26&#39;, // Latest as of implementation
  maxSymlinkDepth: 0, // No symlinks allowed
};

/**
 * Operation context for tracking constraint violations
 */
export interface OperationContext {
  operation: string;
  startTime: number;
  payloadSize?: number;
  apiVersion?: string;
  metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

/**
 * Rate limiting state tracker
 */
interface RateLimitState {
  requests: number;
  windowStart: number;
}

/**
 * Constraint monitoring and enforcement system
 * Implements fail-fast behavior with real-time violation detection
 */
export class ConstraintEnforcer extends EventEmitter {
  private readonly constraints: Constraints;
  private readonly rateLimitState: RateLimitState;
  private readonly operations = new Map&lt;string, OperationContext&gt;();

  constructor(constraints: Partial&lt;Constraints&gt; = {}) {
    super();
    this.constraints = { ...DEFAULT_CONSTRAINTS, ...constraints };
    this.rateLimitState = {
      requests: 0,
      windowStart: Date.now(),
    };
  }

  /**
   * Start tracking an operation for constraint enforcement
   */
  startOperation(operation: string, metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): string {
    const operationId = `${operation}-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`;
    const context: OperationContext = {
      operation,
      startTime: performance.now(),
      metadata,
    };

    this.operations.set(operationId, context);

    // Check rate limiting before operation starts
    this.enforceRateLimit();

    this.emit(&#39;operation:start&#39;, { operationId, context });
    return operationId;
  }

  /**
   * End tracking an operation and enforce time constraints
   */
  endOperation(operationId: string): void {
    const context = this.operations.get(operationId);
    if (!context) {
      throw new Error(`Operation ${operationId} not found`);
    }

    const duration = performance.now() - context.startTime;

    // Enforce maximum operation time
    if (duration &gt; this.constraints.maxOperationTime) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;maxOperationTime&#39;,
        `${Math.round(duration)}ms`,
        `≤${this.constraints.maxOperationTime}ms`,
        {
          operationId,
          operation: context.operation,
          duration,
          metadata: context.metadata,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;maxOperationTime&#39;,
        violation,
        context,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    this.operations.delete(operationId);
    this.emit(&#39;operation:end&#39;, { operationId, duration, context });
  }

  /**
   * Validate payload size constraint
   */
  validatePayloadSize(data: unknown, operationId?: string): void {
    const payloadSize = this.calculatePayloadSize(data);

    if (payloadSize &gt; this.constraints.maxPayloadSize) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;maxPayloadSize&#39;,
        `${this.formatBytes(payloadSize)}`,
        `≤${this.formatBytes(this.constraints.maxPayloadSize)}`,
        {
          operationId,
          payloadSize,
          dataType: typeof data,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;maxPayloadSize&#39;,
        violation,
        payloadSize,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Update operation context with payload size
    if (operationId) {
      const context = this.operations.get(operationId);
      if (context) {
        context.payloadSize = payloadSize;
      }
    }

    this.emit(&#39;payload:validated&#39;, { operationId, payloadSize });
  }

  /**
   * Validate API version constraint (must use latest)
   */
  validateApiVersion(version: string, operationId?: string): void {
    if (version !== this.constraints.apiVersion) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;apiVersion&#39;,
        version,
        this.constraints.apiVersion,
        {
          operationId,
          message: &#39;Must use latest API version in envelope schema&#39;,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;apiVersion&#39;,
        violation,
        providedVersion: version,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Update operation context with API version
    if (operationId) {
      const context = this.operations.get(operationId);
      if (context) {
        context.apiVersion = version;
      }
    }

    this.emit(&#39;apiVersion:validated&#39;, { operationId, version });
  }

  /**
   * Validate that operation uses server endpoints (sandbox constraint)
   */
  validateSandboxCompliance(
    operationType: string,
    isDirectToolExecution: boolean,
    operationId?: string
  ): void {
    if (isDirectToolExecution) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;sandboxCompliance&#39;,
        &#39;direct tool execution&#39;,
        &#39;server endpoint usage&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operationType,
          message: &#39;All analyze/validate operations must use server endpoints&#39;,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;sandboxCompliance&#39;,
        violation,
        operationType,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    this.emit(&#39;sandbox:validated&#39;, { operationId, operationType });
  }

  /**
   * Validate idempotent operation constraint
   */
  validateIdempotency(
    operation: string,
    inputs: unknown,
    expectedOutput: unknown,
    actualOutput: unknown,
    operationId?: string
  ): void {
    if (!this.deepEqual(expectedOutput, actualOutput)) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        &#39;non-deterministic output&#39;,
        &#39;identical output for identical inputs&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          inputs,
          expectedOutput,
          actualOutput,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        violation,
        operation,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    this.emit(&#39;idempotency:validated&#39;, { operationId, operation });
  }

  /**
   * Get current constraint status and metrics
   */
  getConstraintStatus(): {
    constraints: Constraints;
    activeOperations: number;
    rateLimitStatus: {
      current: number;
      limit: number;
      windowStart: number;
      windowEnd: number;
    };
    violations: {
      total: number;
      byType: Record&lt;string, number&gt;;
    };
  } {
    return {
      constraints: { ...this.constraints },
      activeOperations: this.operations.size,
      rateLimitStatus: {
        current: this.rateLimitState.requests,
        limit: this.constraints.rateLimit.requests,
        windowStart: this.rateLimitState.windowStart,
        windowEnd: this.rateLimitState.windowStart + this.constraints.rateLimit.windowMs,
      },
      violations: {
        total: this.listenerCount(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;),
        byType: {}, // Would be populated by violation tracking
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Enforce rate limiting constraint
   */
  private enforceRateLimit(): void {
    const now = Date.now();

    // Reset window if expired
    if (now - this.rateLimitState.windowStart &gt;= this.constraints.rateLimit.windowMs) {
      this.rateLimitState.requests = 0;
      this.rateLimitState.windowStart = now;
    }

    // Check if rate limit exceeded
    if (this.rateLimitState.requests &gt;= this.constraints.rateLimit.requests) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;rateLimit&#39;,
        `${this.rateLimitState.requests + 1} requests`,
        `≤${this.constraints.rateLimit.requests} requests per ${this.constraints.rateLimit.windowMs}ms`,
        {
          windowStart: this.rateLimitState.windowStart,
          windowEnd: this.rateLimitState.windowStart + this.constraints.rateLimit.windowMs,
          currentRequests: this.rateLimitState.requests,
        }
      );

      this.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;rateLimit&#39;,
        violation,
        rateLimitState: { ...this.rateLimitState },
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Increment request count
    this.rateLimitState.requests++;
    this.emit(&#39;rateLimit:checked&#39;, {
      requests: this.rateLimitState.requests,
      limit: this.constraints.rateLimit.requests,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Calculate payload size in bytes
   */
  private calculatePayloadSize(data: unknown): number {
    if (typeof data === &#39;string&#39;) {
      return Buffer.byteLength(data, &#39;utf8&#39;);
    }

    if (Buffer.isBuffer(data)) {
      return data.length;
    }

    // For objects, serialize to JSON and calculate size
    const serialized = JSON.stringify(data);
    return Buffer.byteLength(serialized, &#39;utf8&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Format bytes in human-readable format
   */
  private formatBytes(bytes: number): string {
    if (bytes === 0) return &#39;0 B&#39;;

    const k = 1024;
    const sizes = [&#39;B&#39;, &#39;KB&#39;, &#39;MB&#39;, &#39;GB&#39;];
    const i = Math.floor(Math.log(bytes) / Math.log(k));

    return `${Number.parseFloat((bytes / k ** i).toFixed(2))} ${sizes[i]}`;
  }

  /**
   * Deep equality comparison for idempotency validation
   */
  private deepEqual(a: unknown, b: unknown): boolean {
    if (a === b) return true;

    if (a == null || b == null) return a === b;

    if (typeof a !== typeof b) return false;

    if (typeof a !== &#39;object&#39;) return false;

    const aObj = a as Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
    const bObj = b as Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;

    const keysA = Object.keys(aObj);
    const keysB = Object.keys(bObj);

    if (keysA.length !== keysB.length) return false;

    for (const key of keysA) {
      if (!keysB.includes(key)) return false;
      if (!this.deepEqual(aObj[key], bObj[key])) return false;
    }

    return true;
  }
}

/**
 * Global constraint enforcer instance
 */
export const globalConstraintEnforcer = new ConstraintEnforcer();

/**
 * Decorator for automatic constraint enforcement on async functions
 */
export function withConstraints(operation: string) {
  return &lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;&gt;(
    _target: any,
    propertyName: string,
    descriptor: TypedPropertyDescriptor&lt;T&gt;
  ) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value!;

    descriptor.value = async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) {
      const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(operation, {
        method: propertyName,
        args: args.length,
      });

      try {
        const result = await method.apply(this, args);
        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        throw error;
      }
    } as T;

    return descriptor;
  };
}

/**
 * Utility function to wrap any async operation with constraints
 */
export async function constrainedOperation&lt;T&gt;(
  operation: string,
  fn: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;,
  metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(operation, metadata);

  try {
    const result = await fn();
    globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
    return result;
  } catch (error) {
    globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
    throw error;
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/db.ts
/**
 * SQLite database layer using Bun&#39;s native sqlite driver
 */
import { Database } from &#39;bun:sqlite&#39;;
import { createHash, randomUUID } from &#39;node:crypto&#39;;
import type {
  Event,
  EventType,
  Fragment,
  FragmentRevision,
  Project,
  ServerConfig,
  Version,
} from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;

export class SpecWorkbenchDB {
  private db: Database;

  constructor(config: ServerConfig) {
    this.db = new Database(config.database_path, { create: true });
    this.initializeSchema();
  }

  /**
   * Configure SQLite pragmas for optimal performance
   */
  private configurePragmas(): void {
    // Enable WAL mode for better concurrent access
    this.db.exec(&#39;PRAGMA journal_mode = WAL&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;PRAGMA synchronous = NORMAL&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;PRAGMA cache_size = 1000&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;PRAGMA temp_store = memory&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Handle schema migrations (add columns if needed)
   */
  private handleSchemaMigrations(): void {
    // Schema migration - add head_revision_id column if it doesn&#39;t exist
    try {
      this.db.exec(&#39;ALTER TABLE fragments ADD COLUMN head_revision_id TEXT&#39;);
    } catch (error) {
      // Column already exists or table doesn&#39;t exist yet, ignore
    }
  }

  /**
   * Create the projects table
   */
  private createProjectsTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS projects (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        name TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        updated_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;))
      )
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Create the fragments table
   */
  private createFragmentsTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fragments (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        path TEXT NOT NULL,
        content TEXT NOT NULL,
        head_revision_id TEXT,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        updated_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
        UNIQUE (project_id, path)
      )
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Create the fragment_revisions table
   */
  private createFragmentRevisionsTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fragment_revisions (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        fragment_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        revision_number INTEGER NOT NULL,
        content TEXT NOT NULL,
        content_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
        author TEXT,
        message TEXT,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (fragment_id) REFERENCES fragments (id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
        UNIQUE (fragment_id, revision_number)
      )
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Create the versions table
   */
  private createVersionsTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS versions (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        spec_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
        resolved_json TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
        UNIQUE (project_id, spec_hash)
      )
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Create the events table
   */
  private createEventsTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS events (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        event_type TEXT NOT NULL,
        data TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE
      )
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Create all database tables
   */
  private createTables(): void {
    this.createProjectsTable();
    this.createFragmentsTable();
    this.createFragmentRevisionsTable();
    this.createVersionsTable();
    this.createEventsTable();
  }

  /**
   * Create performance indices for tables
   */
  private createIndices(): void {
    // Fragment indices
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragments_project_id ON fragments (project_id)&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragments_path ON fragments (project_id, path)&#39;);

    // Fragment revision indices
    this.db.exec(
      &#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragment_revisions_fragment_id ON fragment_revisions (fragment_id)&#39;
    );
    this.db.exec(
      &#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragment_revisions_revision_number ON fragment_revisions (fragment_id, revision_number)&#39;
    );
    this.db.exec(
      &#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragment_revisions_content_hash ON fragment_revisions (content_hash)&#39;
    );

    // Version indices
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_versions_project_id ON versions (project_id)&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_versions_hash ON versions (spec_hash)&#39;);

    // Event indices
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_events_project_id ON events (project_id)&#39;);
    this.db.exec(&#39;CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_events_created_at ON events (created_at DESC)&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Create database triggers for automatic timestamp updates
   */
  private createTriggers(): void {
    // Trigger to update updated_at on projects
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS update_projects_updated_at
      AFTER UPDATE ON projects
      FOR EACH ROW
      BEGIN
        UPDATE projects SET updated_at = datetime(&#39;now&#39;) WHERE id = NEW.id;
      END
    `);

    // Trigger to update updated_at on fragments
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS update_fragments_updated_at
      AFTER UPDATE ON fragments
      FOR EACH ROW
      BEGIN
        UPDATE fragments SET updated_at = datetime(&#39;now&#39;) WHERE id = NEW.id;
      END
    `);
  }

  /**
   * Initialize database schema with proper indices
   */
  private initializeSchema(): void {
    this.configurePragmas();
    this.handleSchemaMigrations();
    this.createTables();
    this.createIndices();
    this.createTriggers();
  }

  // Project operations
  async createProject(id: string, name: string): Promise&lt;Project&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      INSERT INTO projects (id, name) VALUES (?, ?)
      RETURNING id, name, created_at, updated_at
    `);

    const result = stmt.get(id, name) as Project;
    if (!result) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Failed to create project&#39;);
    }
    return result;
  }

  async getProject(id: string): Promise&lt;Project | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM projects WHERE id = ?&#39;);
    return stmt.get(id) as Project | null;
  }

  async listProjects(): Promise&lt;Project[]&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM projects ORDER BY created_at DESC&#39;);
    return stmt.all() as Project[];
  }

  async deleteProject(id: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;DELETE FROM projects WHERE id = ?&#39;);
    const result = stmt.run(id);
    if (result.changes === 0) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Project not found&#39;);
    }
  }

  // Fragment operations
  async createFragment(
    id: string,
    projectId: string,
    path: string,
    content: string,
    author?: string,
    message?: string
  ): Promise&lt;Fragment&gt; {
    return this.transaction(() =&gt; {
      // Create fragment
      const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
        INSERT INTO fragments (id, project_id, path, content) 
        VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
        RETURNING id, project_id, path, content, head_revision_id, created_at, updated_at
      `);

      const fragment = stmt.get(id, projectId, path, content) as Fragment;
      if (!fragment) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Failed to create fragment&#39;);
      }

      // Create initial revision
      const revisionId = this.generateId();
      const contentHash = createHash(&#39;sha256&#39;).update(content).digest(&#39;hex&#39;);

      this.createFragmentRevision(
        revisionId,
        id,
        1, // Initial revision number
        content,
        contentHash,
        author,
        message || &#39;Initial fragment creation&#39;
      );

      // Update fragment with head revision pointer
      const updateStmt = this.db.prepare(`
        UPDATE fragments SET head_revision_id = ? WHERE id = ?
      `);
      updateStmt.run(revisionId, id);

      // Return updated fragment
      const getStmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM fragments WHERE id = ?&#39;);
      return getStmt.get(id) as Fragment;
    });
  }

  async updateFragment(
    projectId: string,
    path: string,
    content: string,
    author?: string,
    message?: string
  ): Promise&lt;Fragment&gt; {
    return this.transaction(() =&gt; {
      // Get existing fragment
      const existingFragment = this.getFragment(projectId, path);
      if (!existingFragment) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Fragment not found&#39;);
      }

      // Create content hash for deduplication
      const contentHash = createHash(&#39;sha256&#39;).update(content).digest(&#39;hex&#39;);

      // Check if content has actually changed
      if (existingFragment.content === content) {
        return existingFragment; // No change, return existing
      }

      // Get next revision number
      const nextRevisionNumber = this.getNextRevisionNumber(existingFragment.id);

      // Create new revision
      const revisionId = this.generateId();
      const revision = this.createFragmentRevision(
        revisionId,
        existingFragment.id,
        nextRevisionNumber,
        content,
        contentHash,
        author,
        message
      );

      // Update fragment with new content and head revision pointer
      const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
        UPDATE fragments 
        SET content = ?, head_revision_id = ?
        WHERE project_id = ? AND path = ?
        RETURNING id, project_id, path, content, head_revision_id, created_at, updated_at
      `);

      const result = stmt.get(content, revisionId, projectId, path) as Fragment | undefined;
      if (!result) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Failed to update fragment&#39;);
      }
      return result;
    });
  }

  getFragment(projectId: string, path: string): Fragment | null {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM fragments WHERE project_id = ? AND path = ?&#39;);
    return stmt.get(projectId, path) as Fragment | null;
  }

  async getFragmentById(id: string): Promise&lt;Fragment | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM fragments WHERE id = ?&#39;);
    return stmt.get(id) as Fragment | null;
  }

  async listFragments(projectId: string): Promise&lt;Fragment[]&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM fragments WHERE project_id = ? ORDER BY path&#39;);
    return stmt.all(projectId) as Fragment[];
  }

  async deleteFragment(projectId: string, path: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;DELETE FROM fragments WHERE project_id = ? AND path = ?&#39;);
    const result = stmt.run(projectId, path);
    if (result.changes === 0) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Fragment not found&#39;);
    }
  }

  // Fragment revision operations
  private generateId(): string {
    return randomUUID();
  }

  private getNextRevisionNumber(fragmentId: string): number {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      SELECT COALESCE(MAX(revision_number), 0) + 1 as next_revision
      FROM fragment_revisions 
      WHERE fragment_id = ?
    `);
    const result = stmt.get(fragmentId) as { next_revision: number };
    return result.next_revision;
  }

  async createFragmentRevision(
    id: string,
    fragmentId: string,
    revisionNumber: number,
    content: string,
    contentHash: string,
    author?: string,
    message?: string
  ): Promise&lt;FragmentRevision&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      INSERT INTO fragment_revisions (id, fragment_id, revision_number, content, content_hash, author, message)
      VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)
      RETURNING id, fragment_id, revision_number, content, content_hash, author, message, created_at
    `);

    const result = stmt.get(
      id,
      fragmentId,
      revisionNumber,
      content,
      contentHash,
      author,
      message
    ) as FragmentRevision;
    if (!result) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Failed to create fragment revision&#39;);
    }
    return result;
  }

  async getFragmentRevision(
    fragmentId: string,
    revisionNumber: number
  ): Promise&lt;FragmentRevision | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(
      &#39;SELECT * FROM fragment_revisions WHERE fragment_id = ? AND revision_number = ?&#39;
    );
    return stmt.get(fragmentId, revisionNumber) as FragmentRevision | null;
  }

  async listFragmentRevisions(fragmentId: string): Promise&lt;FragmentRevision[]&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      SELECT * FROM fragment_revisions 
      WHERE fragment_id = ? 
      ORDER BY revision_number DESC
    `);
    return stmt.all(fragmentId) as FragmentRevision[];
  }

  async getLatestFragmentRevision(fragmentId: string): Promise&lt;FragmentRevision | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      SELECT * FROM fragment_revisions 
      WHERE fragment_id = ? 
      ORDER BY revision_number DESC 
      LIMIT 1
    `);
    return stmt.get(fragmentId) as FragmentRevision | null;
  }

  // Version operations
  async createVersion(
    id: string,
    projectId: string,
    specHash: string,
    resolvedJson: string
  ): Promise&lt;Version&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      INSERT INTO versions (id, project_id, spec_hash, resolved_json)
      VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
      RETURNING id, project_id, spec_hash, resolved_json, created_at
    `);

    const result = stmt.get(id, projectId, specHash, resolvedJson) as Version;
    if (!result) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Failed to create version&#39;);
    }
    return result;
  }

  async getVersionByHash(projectId: string, specHash: string): Promise&lt;Version | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT * FROM versions WHERE project_id = ? AND spec_hash = ?&#39;);
    return stmt.get(projectId, specHash) as Version | null;
  }

  async getLatestVersion(projectId: string): Promise&lt;Version | null&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      SELECT * FROM versions 
      WHERE project_id = ? 
      ORDER BY created_at DESC 
      LIMIT 1
    `);
    return stmt.get(projectId) as Version | null;
  }

  async listVersions(projectId: string): Promise&lt;Version[]&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      SELECT * FROM versions 
      WHERE project_id = ? 
      ORDER BY created_at DESC
    `);
    return stmt.all(projectId) as Version[];
  }

  // Event operations
  async createEvent(
    id: string,
    projectId: string,
    eventType: EventType,
    data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;Event&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(`
      INSERT INTO events (id, project_id, event_type, data)
      VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
      RETURNING id, project_id, event_type, data, created_at
    `);

    const result = stmt.get(id, projectId, eventType, JSON.stringify(data)) as Event &amp; {
      data: string;
    };

    if (!result) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Failed to create event&#39;);
    }

    return {
      ...result,
      data: JSON.parse(result.data),
    };
  }

  async getEvents(projectId: string, limit = 100, since?: string): Promise&lt;Event[]&gt; {
    let query = `
      SELECT * FROM events 
      WHERE project_id = ?
    `;
    const params: any[] = [projectId];

    if (since) {
      query += &#39; AND created_at &gt; ?&#39;;
      // Convert ISO timestamp to SQLite datetime format
      const sqliteTimestamp = new Date(since)
        .toISOString()
        .replace(&#39;T&#39;, &#39; &#39;)
        .replace(&#39;Z&#39;, &#39;&#39;)
        .split(&#39;.&#39;)[0];
      params.push(sqliteTimestamp);
    }

    query += &#39; ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT ?&#39;;
    params.push(limit);

    const stmt = this.db.prepare(query);
    const results = stmt.all(...params) as (Event &amp; { data: string })[];

    return results.map(event =&gt; ({
      ...event,
      data: JSON.parse(event.data),
    }));
  }

  // Transaction support
  transaction&lt;T&gt;(fn: () =&gt; T): T {
    return this.db.transaction(fn)();
  }

  // Cleanup and maintenance
  async vacuum(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.db.exec(&#39;VACUUM&#39;);
  }

  close(): void {
    this.db.close();
  }

  // Health check
  async healthCheck(): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    try {
      const result = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT 1 as ok&#39;).get();
      return (result as any)?.ok === 1;
    } catch {
      return false;
    }
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/config.ts
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import { fileURLToPath } from &#39;node:url&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import yaml from &#39;yaml&#39;;
import { z } from &#39;zod&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

const __filename = fileURLToPath(import.meta.url);
const __dirname = path.dirname(__filename);

/**
 * Default CLI configuration
 * Updated to match Arbiter specification constraints
 */
export const DEFAULT_CONFIG: CLIConfig = {
  apiUrl: &#39;http://localhost:5050&#39;, // Standardized to match server default
  timeout: 750, // Enforce spec maximum (≤750ms)
  format: &#39;table&#39;,
  color: true,
  projectDir: process.cwd(),
};

/**
 * Common ports to try for server auto-discovery
 * Listed in order of preference
 */
export const COMMON_PORTS = [5050, 3000, 4000, 8080] as const;

/**
 * Configuration file schema for validation
 * Enforces Arbiter specification constraints
 */
const gitHubRepoSchema = z.object({
  owner: z.string().optional(), // Made optional for auto-detection
  repo: z.string().optional(), // Made optional for auto-detection
  token: z.string().optional(),
  baseUrl: z.string().url().optional(),
  tokenEnv: z.string().optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateFieldSchema = z.object({
  name: z.string(),
  label: z.string(),
  required: z.boolean().optional(),
  type: z.enum([&#39;text&#39;, &#39;number&#39;, &#39;date&#39;, &#39;select&#39;, &#39;boolean&#39;]).optional(),
  default: z.string().optional(),
  pattern: z.string().optional(),
  help: z.string().optional(),
});

const gitHubFieldValidationSchema = z.object({
  field: z.string(),
  required: z.boolean().optional(),
  minLength: z.number().optional(),
  maxLength: z.number().optional(),
  pattern: z.string().optional(),
  enum: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
  validator: z.string().optional(),
  errorMessage: z.string().optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateSectionsSchema = z.object({
  description: z.string(),
  details: z.array(gitHubTemplateFieldSchema).optional(),
  acceptanceCriteria: z.string().optional(),
  dependencies: z.string().optional(),
  additional: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateValidationSchema = z.object({
  fields: z.array(gitHubFieldValidationSchema).optional(),
  custom: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateSetSchema = z.object({
  name: z.string(),
  description: z.string().optional(),
  sections: gitHubTemplateSectionsSchema,
  labels: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
  validation: gitHubTemplateValidationSchema.optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateOptionsSchema = z.object({
  includeMetadata: z.boolean().optional(),
  includeArbiterIds: z.boolean().optional(),
  includeAcceptanceCriteria: z.boolean().optional(),
  includeDependencies: z.boolean().optional(),
  includeEstimations: z.boolean().optional(),
  customFields: z.record(z.string()).optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplateConfigSchema = z.object({
  inherits: z.string().optional(),
  name: z.string().optional(),
  title: z.string().optional(),
  description: z.string().optional(),
  sections: gitHubTemplateSectionsSchema.partial().optional(),
  labels: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
  assignees: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
  validation: gitHubTemplateValidationSchema.optional(),
  options: gitHubTemplateOptionsSchema.optional(),
});

const gitHubLabelSchema = z.object({
  name: z.string(),
  color: z.string(),
  description: z.string().optional(),
});

const gitHubRepoConfigSchema = z.object({
  issueConfig: z
    .object({
      blankIssuesEnabled: z.boolean().optional(),
      contactLinks: z
        .array(
          z.object({
            name: z.string(),
            url: z.string().url(),
            about: z.string(),
          })
        )
        .optional(),
    })
    .optional(),
  labels: z.array(gitHubLabelSchema).optional(),
  pullRequestTemplate: z.string().optional(),
});

const gitHubTemplatesConfigSchema = z.object({
  base: gitHubTemplateSetSchema.optional(),
  epic: gitHubTemplateConfigSchema.optional(),
  task: gitHubTemplateConfigSchema.optional(),
  bugReport: gitHubTemplateConfigSchema.optional(),
  featureRequest: gitHubTemplateConfigSchema.optional(),
  repositoryConfig: gitHubRepoConfigSchema.optional(),
});

const gitHubSyncSchema = z.object({
  repository: gitHubRepoSchema,
  mapping: z
    .object({
      epicLabels: z.record(z.array(z.string())).optional(),
      taskLabels: z.record(z.array(z.string())).optional(),
      defaultLabels: z.array(z.string()).optional(),
      epicPrefix: z.string().optional(),
      taskPrefix: z.string().optional(),
    })
    .optional(),
  behavior: z
    .object({
      createMilestones: z.boolean().optional(),
      autoClose: z.boolean().optional(),
      syncAcceptanceCriteria: z.boolean().optional(),
      syncAssignees: z.boolean().optional(),
    })
    .optional(),
  templates: gitHubTemplatesConfigSchema.optional(),
});

const configSchema = z.object({
  apiUrl: z.string().url().optional(),
  timeout: z.number().min(100).max(750).optional(), // Enforce spec maximum (≤750ms)
  format: z.enum([&#39;table&#39;, &#39;json&#39;, &#39;yaml&#39;]).optional(),
  color: z.boolean().optional(),
  projectDir: z.string().optional(),
  github: gitHubSyncSchema.optional(),
});

/**
 * Possible configuration file names
 */
const CONFIG_FILES = [
  &#39;.arbiter/config.json&#39;,
  &#39;.arbiter/config.yaml&#39;,
  &#39;.arbiter/config.yml&#39;,
  // Legacy paths for backward compatibility
  &#39;.arbiter.json&#39;,
  &#39;.arbiter.yaml&#39;,
  &#39;.arbiter.yml&#39;,
  &#39;arbiter.json&#39;,
  &#39;arbiter.yaml&#39;,
  &#39;arbiter.yml&#39;,
];

/**
 * Load CLI configuration from file or use defaults
 */
export async function loadConfig(configPath?: string): Promise&lt;CLIConfig&gt; {
  const baseConfig = { ...DEFAULT_CONFIG };

  if (configPath) {
    return await loadSpecificConfigFile(configPath, baseConfig);
  }

  return await searchForConfigFile(baseConfig);
}

/**
 * Load configuration with Git auto-detection integration
 * This is called after the initial config load to enhance with Git info
 */
export async function loadConfigWithGitDetection(
  baseConfig: CLIConfig,
  options: {
    useConfig?: boolean;
    useGitRemote?: boolean;
    verbose?: boolean;
  } = {}
): Promise&lt;CLIConfig&gt; {
  const { getSmartRepositoryConfig } = await import(&#39;./utils/git-detection.js&#39;);

  // Always try to get smart repository config, which handles conflicts
  const smartRepoConfig = getSmartRepositoryConfig(baseConfig.github?.repository, options);

  if (smartRepoConfig) {
    // Merge detected repository info into config
    const enhancedConfig: CLIConfig = {
      ...baseConfig,
      github: {
        ...baseConfig.github,
        repository: {
          ...baseConfig.github?.repository,
          owner: smartRepoConfig.repo.owner,
          repo: smartRepoConfig.repo.repo,
        },
      },
    };

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(
        chalk.green(
          `✅ Enhanced config with ${smartRepoConfig.source} repository: ${smartRepoConfig.repo.owner}/${smartRepoConfig.repo.repo}`
        )
      );
    }

    return enhancedConfig;
  }

  // If no smart config found, return original
  return baseConfig;
}

/**
 * Load a specific configuration file
 */
async function loadSpecificConfigFile(
  configPath: string,
  baseConfig: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;CLIConfig&gt; {
  if (!(await fs.pathExists(configPath))) {
    throw new Error(`Configuration file not found: ${configPath}`);
  }

  const userConfig = await loadConfigFile(configPath);
  return { ...baseConfig, ...userConfig };
}

/**
 * Search for configuration files up the directory tree
 */
async function searchForConfigFile(baseConfig: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;CLIConfig&gt; {
  let currentDir = process.cwd();
  const root = path.parse(currentDir).root;

  while (currentDir !== root) {
    const foundConfig = await findConfigInDirectory(currentDir);
    if (foundConfig) {
      return { ...baseConfig, ...foundConfig };
    }
    currentDir = path.dirname(currentDir);
  }

  return baseConfig;
}

/**
 * Find configuration file in a specific directory
 */
async function findConfigInDirectory(directory: string): Promise&lt;Partial&lt;CLIConfig&gt; | null&gt; {
  for (const fileName of CONFIG_FILES) {
    const configFile = path.join(directory, fileName);
    if (await fs.pathExists(configFile)) {
      return await loadConfigFile(configFile);
    }
  }
  return null;
}

/**
 * Load and parse a configuration file
 */
async function loadConfigFile(filePath: string): Promise&lt;Partial&lt;CLIConfig&gt;&gt; {
  const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
  const ext = path.extname(filePath).toLowerCase();

  let parsed: unknown;

  if (ext === &#39;.json&#39;) {
    parsed = JSON.parse(content);
  } else if (ext === &#39;.yaml&#39; || ext === &#39;.yml&#39;) {
    parsed = yaml.parse(content);
  } else {
    throw new Error(`Unsupported configuration file format: ${ext}`);
  }

  // Validate configuration
  const result = configSchema.safeParse(parsed);
  if (!result.success) {
    throw new Error(`Invalid configuration: ${result.error.message}`);
  }

  return result.data as unknown as Partial&lt;CLIConfig&gt;;
}

/**
 * Save configuration to file
 */
export async function saveConfig(config: Partial&lt;CLIConfig&gt;, filePath: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const ext = path.extname(filePath).toLowerCase();
  let content: string;

  if (ext === &#39;.json&#39;) {
    content = JSON.stringify(config, null, 2);
  } else if (ext === &#39;.yaml&#39; || ext === &#39;.yml&#39;) {
    content = yaml.stringify(config);
  } else {
    throw new Error(`Unsupported configuration file format: ${ext}`);
  }

  // Ensure the directory exists
  await fs.ensureDir(path.dirname(filePath));
  await fs.writeFile(filePath, content, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
}

/**
 * Get default configuration file path
 */
export function getDefaultConfigPath(): string {
  return path.join(process.cwd(), &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;config.json&#39;);
}

export type Config = CLIConfig;
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/sharded-storage.ts
/**
 * Sharded CUE Storage Implementation
 *
 * Manages CUE files across multiple shards for better organization and performance.
 * Each shard contains a subset of epics and their tasks, with ordering preserved.
 */

import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { createCUEManipulator, formatCUE, validateCUE } from &#39;../cue/index.js&#39;;

// Types for sharded storage management
export interface ShardManifest {
  shardId: string;
  fileName: string;
  epics: Array&lt;{
    id: string;
    status: string;
    lastModified: string;
  }&gt;;
  size: number;
  totalTasks: number;
  created: string;
  lastModified: string;
}

export interface Epic {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  description?: string;
  priority: &#39;critical&#39; | &#39;high&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;low&#39;;
  status: &#39;planning&#39; | &#39;in_progress&#39; | &#39;completed&#39; | &#39;cancelled&#39;;
  owner?: string;
  assignee?: string;
  estimatedHours?: number;
  actualHours?: number;
  startDate?: string;
  dueDate?: string;
  completedDate?: string;
  tasks: Task[];
  dependencies?: string[];
  labels?: string[];
  tags?: string[];
  config?: {
    allowParallelTasks?: boolean;
    autoProgress?: boolean;
    requireAllTasks?: boolean;
  };
  arbiter?: {
    shard?: string;
    generatedFrom?: string;
    cuePackage?: string;
  };
}

export interface Task {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  description?: string;
  type: &#39;feature&#39; | &#39;bug&#39; | &#39;refactor&#39; | &#39;test&#39; | &#39;docs&#39; | &#39;devops&#39; | &#39;research&#39;;
  priority: &#39;critical&#39; | &#39;high&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;low&#39;;
  status: &#39;todo&#39; | &#39;in_progress&#39; | &#39;review&#39; | &#39;testing&#39; | &#39;completed&#39; | &#39;cancelled&#39;;
  assignee?: string;
  reviewer?: string;
  estimatedHours?: number;
  actualHours?: number;
  dependsOn?: string[];
  acceptanceCriteria?: string[];
  order?: number;
  config?: {
    canRunInParallel?: boolean;
    requiresReview?: boolean;
    requiresTesting?: boolean;
    blocksOtherTasks?: boolean;
  };
  arbiter?: {
    cueManipulation?: {
      operation: string;
      target?: string;
      parameters?: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
    };
    generatedCode?: {
      language?: string;
      outputPath?: string;
      template?: string;
    };
    testing?: {
      testTypes?: string[];
      coverage?: number;
    };
  };
}

export interface ShardedStorageConfig {
  baseDir: string;
  manifestFile: string;
  shardPrefix: string;
  maxEpicsPerShard: number;
  autoCreateShards: boolean;
  cuePackage: string;
}

/**
 * Manages sharded CUE storage for epics and tasks
 */
export class ShardedCUEStorage {
  private config: ShardedStorageConfig;
  private manifests: Map&lt;string, ShardManifest&gt; = new Map();
  private cueManipulator: any;

  constructor(config: Partial&lt;ShardedStorageConfig&gt; = {}) {
    this.config = {
      baseDir: &#39;.arbiter/epics&#39;,
      manifestFile: &#39;.arbiter/shard-manifest.cue&#39;,
      shardPrefix: &#39;epic-shard&#39;,
      maxEpicsPerShard: 10,
      autoCreateShards: true,
      cuePackage: &#39;epics&#39;,
      ...config,
    };

    this.cueManipulator = createCUEManipulator();
  }

  /**
   * Initialize sharded storage directory structure
   */
  async initialize(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await fs.ensureDir(this.config.baseDir);

    // Create initial manifest if it doesn&#39;t exist
    if (!fs.existsSync(this.config.manifestFile)) {
      await this.createInitialManifest();
    }

    // Load existing manifests
