    await this.loadManifests();
  }

  /**
   * Create initial manifest file
   */
  private async createInitialManifest(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const initialManifest = `package ${this.config.cuePackage}

// Shard manifest tracking epic distribution across CUE files
shardManifests: []

// Project configuration
project: {
  name: &quot;Project Epics&quot;
  version: &quot;1.0.0&quot;
  description: &quot;Sharded epic and task storage&quot;
}

config: {
  defaultEpicShard: &quot;epic-shard-1&quot;
  maxEpicsPerShard: ${this.config.maxEpicsPerShard}
  autoCreateShards: ${this.config.autoCreateShards}
}`;

    const formatted = await formatCUE(initialManifest);
    await fs.writeFile(this.config.manifestFile, formatted);
  }

  /**
   * Load all shard manifests from the manifest file
   */
  private async loadManifests(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      const manifestContent = await fs.readFile(this.config.manifestFile, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      const ast = await this.cueManipulator.parse(manifestContent);

      if (ast.shardManifests) {
        for (const manifest of ast.shardManifests) {
          this.manifests.set(manifest.shardId, manifest);
        }
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Could not load shard manifests: ${error}`));
    }
  }

  /**
   * Save manifest changes back to file
   */
  private async saveManifests(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      const manifestContent = await fs.readFile(this.config.manifestFile, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      const manifestArray = Array.from(this.manifests.values());

      const updatedContent = await this.cueManipulator.addToSection(
        manifestContent,
        &#39;shardManifests&#39;,
        &#39;&#39;,
        manifestArray
      );

      const formatted = await formatCUE(updatedContent);
      await fs.writeFile(this.config.manifestFile, formatted);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to save shard manifests: ${error}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Find the appropriate shard for a new epic
   */
  private findAvailableShard(): string | null {
    // Find a shard with space
    for (const [shardId, manifest] of this.manifests) {
      if (manifest.size &lt; this.config.maxEpicsPerShard) {
        return shardId;
      }
    }

    // No available shard found
    return null;
  }

  /**
   * Create a new shard
   */
  private async createNewShard(): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    const shardNumber = this.manifests.size + 1;
    const shardId = `${this.config.shardPrefix}-${shardNumber}`;
    const fileName = `${shardId}.cue`;
    const filePath = path.join(this.config.baseDir, fileName);

    // Create the shard file
    const shardContent = `package ${this.config.cuePackage}

// Epic Shard ${shardNumber}
// This file contains a subset of epics for better organization

epics: {
  // Epics in this shard will be added here
}`;

    const formatted = await formatCUE(shardContent);
    await fs.writeFile(filePath, formatted);

    // Create manifest entry
    const manifest: ShardManifest = {
      shardId,
      fileName,
      epics: [],
      size: 0,
      totalTasks: 0,
      created: new Date().toISOString(),
      lastModified: new Date().toISOString(),
    };

    this.manifests.set(shardId, manifest);
    await this.saveManifests();

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Created new shard: ${shardId}`));
    return shardId;
  }

  /**
   * Add an epic to the appropriate shard
   */
  async addEpic(epic: Epic): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    // Find available shard or create new one
    let targetShard = epic.arbiter?.shard || this.findAvailableShard();

    if (!targetShard) {
      if (this.config.autoCreateShards) {
        targetShard = await this.createNewShard();
      } else {
        throw new Error(&#39;No available shards and auto-creation is disabled&#39;);
      }
    }

    const manifest = this.manifests.get(targetShard);
    if (!manifest) {
      throw new Error(`Shard ${targetShard} not found in manifests`);
    }

    // Ensure epic has shard information
    epic.arbiter = {
      ...epic.arbiter,
      shard: targetShard,
      cuePackage: this.config.cuePackage,
    };

    // Validate task dependencies
    this.validateTaskDependencies(epic.tasks);

    // Sort tasks by dependency order
    epic.tasks = this.sortTasksByDependencies(epic.tasks);

    // Load shard file and add epic
    const shardPath = path.join(this.config.baseDir, manifest.fileName);
    let shardContent = &#39;&#39;;

    if (fs.existsSync(shardPath)) {
      shardContent = await fs.readFile(shardPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    } else {
      // Create shard file if it doesn&#39;t exist
      shardContent = `package ${this.config.cuePackage}\n\nepics: {}`;
    }

    // Add epic using CUE manipulation
    const updatedContent = await this.cueManipulator.addToSection(
      shardContent,
      &#39;epics&#39;,
      epic.id,
      epic
    );

    // Validate and save
    const validationResult = await validateCUE(updatedContent);
    if (!validationResult.valid) {
      throw new Error(`CUE validation failed: ${validationResult.errors.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);
    }

    const formatted = await formatCUE(updatedContent);
    await fs.writeFile(shardPath, formatted);

    // Update manifest
    manifest.epics.push({
      id: epic.id,
      status: epic.status,
      lastModified: new Date().toISOString(),
    });
    manifest.size = manifest.epics.length;
    manifest.totalTasks = manifest.epics.reduce((sum, e) =&gt; sum + (epic.tasks?.length || 0), 0);
    manifest.lastModified = new Date().toISOString();

    await this.saveManifests();

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Added epic &quot;${epic.name}&quot; to shard ${targetShard}`));
    return targetShard;
  }

  /**
   * Get an epic from its shard
   */
  async getEpic(epicId: string): Promise&lt;Epic | null&gt; {
    // Find which shard contains the epic
    let targetShard: string | null = null;

    for (const [shardId, manifest] of this.manifests) {
      if (manifest.epics.some(e =&gt; e.id === epicId)) {
        targetShard = shardId;
        break;
      }
    }

    if (!targetShard) {
      return null;
    }

    const manifest = this.manifests.get(targetShard)!;
    const shardPath = path.join(this.config.baseDir, manifest.fileName);

    if (!fs.existsSync(shardPath)) {
      throw new Error(`Shard file ${manifest.fileName} not found`);
    }

    const shardContent = await fs.readFile(shardPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    const ast = await this.cueManipulator.parse(shardContent);

    return ast.epics?.[epicId] || null;
  }

  /**
   * Update an epic in its shard
   */
  async updateEpic(epic: Epic): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const existingEpic = await this.getEpic(epic.id);
    if (!existingEpic) {
      throw new Error(`Epic ${epic.id} not found`);
    }

    const targetShard = existingEpic.arbiter?.shard;
    if (!targetShard) {
      throw new Error(`Epic ${epic.id} has no shard information`);
    }

    // Validate task dependencies and sort by dependency order
    this.validateTaskDependencies(epic.tasks);
    epic.tasks = this.sortTasksByDependencies(epic.tasks);

    const manifest = this.manifests.get(targetShard)!;
    const shardPath = path.join(this.config.baseDir, manifest.fileName);

    const shardContent = await fs.readFile(shardPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    const updatedContent = await this.cueManipulator.addToSection(
      shardContent,
      &#39;epics&#39;,
      epic.id,
      epic
    );

    // Validate and save
    const validationResult = await validateCUE(updatedContent);
    if (!validationResult.valid) {
      throw new Error(`CUE validation failed: ${validationResult.errors.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);
    }

    const formatted = await formatCUE(updatedContent);
    await fs.writeFile(shardPath, formatted);

    // Update manifest
    const epicManifest = manifest.epics.find(e =&gt; e.id === epic.id);
    if (epicManifest) {
      epicManifest.status = epic.status;
      epicManifest.lastModified = new Date().toISOString();
    }

    manifest.lastModified = new Date().toISOString();
    await this.saveManifests();

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Updated epic &quot;${epic.name}&quot; in shard ${targetShard}`));
  }

  /**
   * List all epics across all shards
   */
  async listEpics(status?: string): Promise&lt;Epic[]&gt; {
    const epics: Epic[] = [];

    for (const [shardId, manifest] of this.manifests) {
      const shardPath = path.join(this.config.baseDir, manifest.fileName);

      if (!fs.existsSync(shardPath)) {
        console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Shard file ${manifest.fileName} not found`));
        continue;
      }

      try {
        const shardContent = await fs.readFile(shardPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
        const ast = await this.cueManipulator.parse(shardContent);

        if (ast.epics) {
          for (const epicId of Object.keys(ast.epics)) {
            const epic = ast.epics[epicId];
            if (!status || epic.status === status) {
              // Sort tasks by dependency order
              if (epic.tasks) {
                epic.tasks = this.sortTasksByDependencies(epic.tasks);
              }
              epics.push(epic);
            }
          }
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Could not parse shard ${shardId}: ${error}`));
      }
    }

    return epics;
  }

  /**
   * Get dependency-ordered tasks across all epics
   */
  async getOrderedTasks(epicId?: string): Promise&lt;Task[]&gt; {
    if (epicId) {
      const epic = await this.getEpic(epicId);
      return epic?.tasks ? this.sortTasksByDependencies(epic.tasks) : [];
    }

    const allEpics = await this.listEpics();
    const allTasks: Task[] = [];

    for (const epic of allEpics) {
      if (epic.tasks) {
        // Add epic context to tasks for cross-epic dependencies
        const tasksWithEpicContext = epic.tasks.map(task =&gt; ({
          ...task,
          epicId: epic.id,
        }));
        allTasks.push(...tasksWithEpicContext);
      }
    }

    // Sort by dependencies within each epic, then by epic priority
    return this.sortTasksByDependencies(allTasks);
  }

  /**
   * Get storage statistics
   */
  async getStats(): Promise&lt;{
    totalShards: number;
    totalEpics: number;
    totalTasks: number;
    avgEpicsPerShard: number;
    shardUtilization: number;
  }&gt; {
    const totalShards = this.manifests.size;
    let totalEpics = 0;
    let totalTasks = 0;

    for (const manifest of this.manifests.values()) {
      totalEpics += manifest.size;
      totalTasks += manifest.totalTasks;
    }

    const avgEpicsPerShard = totalShards &gt; 0 ? totalEpics / totalShards : 0;
    const shardUtilization =
      totalShards &gt; 0 ? (totalEpics / (totalShards * this.config.maxEpicsPerShard)) * 100 : 0;

    return {
      totalShards,
      totalEpics,
      totalTasks,
      avgEpicsPerShard,
      shardUtilization,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Validate task dependencies for cycles and missing references
   */
  private validateTaskDependencies(tasks: Task[]): void {
    const taskIds = new Set(tasks.map(t =&gt; t.id));

    // Check for missing dependencies
    for (const task of tasks) {
      if (task.dependsOn) {
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          if (!taskIds.has(depId)) {
            throw new Error(`Task &quot;${task.id}&quot; depends on non-existent task &quot;${depId}&quot;`);
          }
        }
      }
    }

    // Check for circular dependencies using DFS
    const visited = new Set&lt;string&gt;();
    const recursionStack = new Set&lt;string&gt;();

    const hasCycle = (taskId: string): boolean =&gt; {
      if (recursionStack.has(taskId)) {
        return true; // Found cycle
      }

      if (visited.has(taskId)) {
        return false; // Already processed
      }

      visited.add(taskId);
      recursionStack.add(taskId);

      const task = tasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === taskId);
      if (task?.dependsOn) {
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          if (hasCycle(depId)) {
            return true;
          }
        }
      }

      recursionStack.delete(taskId);
      return false;
    };

    for (const task of tasks) {
      if (!visited.has(task.id) &amp;&amp; hasCycle(task.id)) {
        throw new Error(`Circular dependency detected involving task &quot;${task.id}&quot;`);
      }
    }
  }

  /**
   * Sort tasks by dependencies using topological sorting
   */
  private sortTasksByDependencies(tasks: Task[]): Task[] {
    if (tasks.length === 0) return [];

    // Create adjacency list and in-degree count
    const adjList = new Map&lt;string, string[]&gt;();
    const inDegree = new Map&lt;string, number&gt;();

    // Initialize
    for (const task of tasks) {
      adjList.set(task.id, []);
      inDegree.set(task.id, 0);
    }

    // Build graph
    for (const task of tasks) {
      if (task.dependsOn) {
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          // Only consider dependencies within this task set
          if (adjList.has(depId)) {
            adjList.get(depId)?.push(task.id);
            inDegree.set(task.id, inDegree.get(task.id)! + 1);
          }
        }
      }
    }

    // Kahn&#39;s algorithm for topological sorting
    const queue: string[] = [];
    const result: Task[] = [];

    // Find all tasks with no dependencies
    for (const [taskId, degree] of inDegree) {
      if (degree === 0) {
        queue.push(taskId);
      }
    }

    while (queue.length &gt; 0) {
      const currentId = queue.shift()!;
      const currentTask = tasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === currentId)!;
      result.push(currentTask);

      // Process dependents
      for (const dependentId of adjList.get(currentId)!) {
        inDegree.set(dependentId, inDegree.get(dependentId)! - 1);
        if (inDegree.get(dependentId) === 0) {
          queue.push(dependentId);
        }
      }
    }

    // If result doesn&#39;t contain all tasks, there was a cycle (shouldn&#39;t happen due to validation)
    if (result.length !== tasks.length) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Unable to sort tasks - circular dependency detected&#39;);
    }

    return result;
  }

  /**
   * Get dependency graph for visualization
   */
  getDependencyGraph(tasks: Task[]): {
    nodes: Array&lt;{ id: string; name: string; type: string; status: string }&gt;;
    edges: Array&lt;{ from: string; to: string }&gt;;
  } {
    const nodes = tasks.map(task =&gt; ({
      id: task.id,
      name: task.name,
      type: task.type,
      status: task.status,
    }));

    const edges: Array&lt;{ from: string; to: string }&gt; = [];

    for (const task of tasks) {
      if (task.dependsOn) {
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          edges.push({ from: depId, to: task.id });
        }
      }
    }

    return { nodes, edges };
  }

  /**
   * Get tasks that can be started (no incomplete dependencies)
   */
  getReadyTasks(tasks: Task[]): Task[] {
    return tasks.filter(task =&gt; {
      if (task.status === &#39;completed&#39; || task.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) {
        return false;
      }

      if (!task.dependsOn || task.dependsOn.length === 0) {
        return true;
      }

      // Check if all dependencies are completed
      return task.dependsOn.every(depId =&gt; {
        const depTask = tasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === depId);
        return depTask?.status === &#39;completed&#39;;
      });
    });
  }

  /**
   * Get blocked tasks (have incomplete dependencies)
   */
  getBlockedTasks(tasks: Task[]): Task[] {
    return tasks.filter(task =&gt; {
      if (task.status === &#39;completed&#39; || task.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) {
        return false;
      }

      if (!task.dependsOn || task.dependsOn.length === 0) {
        return false;
      }

      // Check if any dependencies are not completed
      return task.dependsOn.some(depId =&gt; {
        const depTask = tasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === depId);
        return depTask?.status !== &#39;completed&#39;;
      });
    });
  }

  /**
   * Cleanup and close storage
   */
  async close(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await this.cueManipulator.cleanup?.();
  }
}

// Export default instance with standard configuration
export const shardedStorage = new ShardedCUEStorage();
📄 apps/api/src/events.ts
/**
 * Real-time events and WebSocket management
 */
import type { ServerWebSocket } from &#39;bun&#39;;
import { NatsService } from &#39;./nats.ts&#39;;
import type { AuthContext, Event, ServerConfig, WebSocketMessage } from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { generateId, getCurrentTimestamp, logger } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

interface WebSocketConnection {
  id: string;
  ws: ServerWebSocket&lt;{ connectionId: string; authContext: AuthContext }&gt;;
  authContext: AuthContext;
  projectSubscriptions: Set&lt;string&gt;;
  lastPing: number;
}

export class EventService {
  private connections = new Map&lt;string, WebSocketConnection&gt;();
  private projectSubscriptions = new Map&lt;string, Set&lt;string&gt;&gt;(); // projectId -&gt; Set&lt;connectionId&gt;
  private pingInterval?: Timer;
  private nats: NatsService;

  constructor(private config: ServerConfig) {
    this.nats = new NatsService(config.nats);
    this.startPingInterval();
  }

  /**
   * Start WebSocket ping interval to keep connections alive
   */
  private startPingInterval(): void {
    this.pingInterval = setInterval(() =&gt; {
      this.pingAllConnections();
    }, this.config.websocket.ping_interval_ms);
  }

  /**
   * Handle new WebSocket connection
   */
  handleConnection(
    ws: ServerWebSocket&lt;{ connectionId: string; authContext: AuthContext }&gt;,
    authContext: AuthContext
  ): string {
    const connectionId = generateId();

    const connection: WebSocketConnection = {
      id: connectionId,
      ws,
      authContext,
      projectSubscriptions: new Set(),
      lastPing: Date.now(),
    };

    this.connections.set(connectionId, connection);

    // Set connection data for WebSocket
    ws.data = { connectionId, authContext };

    // Reduced logging - only log if debug level enabled
    // logger.info(&quot;WebSocket connection established&quot;, {
    //   connectionId,
    //   userId: authContext.user_id,
    //   totalConnections: this.connections.size,
    // });

    // Send welcome message
    this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
      type: &#39;event&#39;,
      data: {
        event_type: &#39;connection_established&#39;,
        connection_id: connectionId,
        timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      },
    });

    return connectionId;
  }

  /**
   * Handle WebSocket disconnection
   */
  handleDisconnection(connectionId: string): void {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (connection) {
      // Remove from all project subscriptions
      for (const projectId of connection.projectSubscriptions) {
        this.unsubscribeFromProject(connectionId, projectId);
      }

      this.connections.delete(connectionId);

      // Reduced logging - only log if debug level enabled
      // logger.info(&quot;WebSocket connection closed&quot;, {
      //   connectionId,
      //   userId: connection.authContext.user_id,
      //   totalConnections: this.connections.size,
      // });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Handle incoming WebSocket message
   */
  async handleMessage(connectionId: string, message: WebSocketMessage): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (!connection) {
      logger.warn(&#39;Message from unknown connection&#39;, { connectionId });
      return;
    }

    try {
      switch (message.type) {
        case &#39;ping&#39;:
          this.handlePing(connectionId);
          break;

        case &#39;event&#39;:
          await this.handleEventMessage(connectionId, message);
          break;

        default:
          logger.warn(&#39;Unknown message type&#39;, {
            connectionId,
            messageType: message.type,
          });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;Error handling WebSocket message&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined, {
        connectionId,
        messageType: message.type,
      });

      this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
        type: &#39;error&#39;,
        data: {
          error: &#39;Failed to process message&#39;,
          originalMessage: message,
        },
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Handle ping message
   */
  private handlePing(connectionId: string): void {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (connection) {
      connection.lastPing = Date.now();

      this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
        type: &#39;pong&#39;,
        data: { timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp() },
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Handle event-type message (subscribe/unsubscribe)
   */
  private async handleEventMessage(connectionId: string, message: WebSocketMessage): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);
    if (!connection) return;

    const { data } = message;
    const action = data.action as string;
    const projectId = data.project_id as string;

    switch (action) {
      case &#39;subscribe&#39;:
        if (projectId) {
          await this.subscribeToProject(connectionId, projectId);
        }
        break;

      case &#39;unsubscribe&#39;:
        if (projectId) {
          this.unsubscribeFromProject(connectionId, projectId);
        }
        break;

      default:
        logger.warn(&#39;Unknown event action&#39;, { connectionId, action });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Subscribe connection to project events
   */
  private async subscribeToProject(connectionId: string, projectId: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (!connection) {
      return;
    }

    // Check if user has access to project
    if (
      !connection.authContext.project_access.includes(&#39;*&#39;) &amp;&amp;
      !connection.authContext.project_access.includes(projectId)
    ) {
      this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
        type: &#39;error&#39;,
        data: {
          error: &#39;Access denied&#39;,
          project_id: projectId,
        },
      });
      return;
    }

    // Add to project subscriptions
    connection.projectSubscriptions.add(projectId);

    if (!this.projectSubscriptions.has(projectId)) {
      this.projectSubscriptions.set(projectId, new Set());
    }
    this.projectSubscriptions.get(projectId)?.add(connectionId);

    logger.info(&#39;Subscribed to project&#39;, {
      connectionId,
      projectId,
      userId: connection.authContext.user_id,
    });

    // Acknowledge subscription
    this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
      type: &#39;event&#39;,
      project_id: projectId,
      data: {
        event_type: &#39;subscription_confirmed&#39;,
        project_id: projectId,
        timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      },
    });
  }

  /**
   * Unsubscribe connection from project events
   */
  private unsubscribeFromProject(connectionId: string, projectId: string): void {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (connection) {
      connection.projectSubscriptions.delete(projectId);
    }

    const projectConnections = this.projectSubscriptions.get(projectId);
    if (projectConnections) {
      projectConnections.delete(connectionId);

      // Clean up empty project subscriptions
      if (projectConnections.size === 0) {
        this.projectSubscriptions.delete(projectId);
      }
    }

    logger.debug(&#39;Unsubscribed from project&#39;, { connectionId, projectId });
  }

  /**
   * Broadcast event to all subscribers of a project
   */
  /**
   * Create WebSocket message from event
   */
  private createWebSocketMessage(
    projectId: string,
    event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;
  ): WebSocketMessage {
    return {
      type: &#39;event&#39;,
      project_id: projectId,
      data: {
        ...event,
        id: generateId(),
        created_at: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Publish event to NATS (non-blocking)
   */
  private async publishToNats(
    projectId: string,
    event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;,
    specHash?: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.nats.publishEvent(projectId, event, specHash).catch(_error =&gt; {
      // Already logged in NatsService, but ensure it doesn&#39;t affect WebSocket flow
      logger.debug(&#39;NATS publish completed with potential error&#39;, {
        projectId,
        eventType: event.event_type,
      });
    });
  }

  /**
   * Check if there are subscribers for the project
   */
  private hasProjectSubscribers(projectId: string): boolean {
    const subscribers = this.projectSubscriptions.get(projectId);
    return !!(subscribers &amp;&amp; subscribers.size &gt; 0);
  }

  /**
   * Get project subscribers
   */
  private getProjectSubscribers(projectId: string): Set&lt;string&gt; | undefined {
    return this.projectSubscriptions.get(projectId);
  }

  /**
   * Send message to individual connection with error handling
   */
  private async sendToConnectionSafe(
    connectionId: string,
    message: WebSocketMessage,
    projectId: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ success: boolean }&gt; {
    try {
      await this.sendToConnection(connectionId, message);
      return { success: true };
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(
        &#39;Failed to send message to connection&#39;,
        error instanceof Error ? error : undefined,
        {
          connectionId,
          projectId,
        }
      );
      return { success: false };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Broadcast message to all WebSocket subscribers
   */
  private async broadcastToSubscribers(
    subscribers: Set&lt;string&gt;,
    message: WebSocketMessage,
    projectId: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ successCount: number; errorCount: number }&gt; {
    const promises = Array.from(subscribers).map(connectionId =&gt;
      this.sendToConnectionSafe(connectionId, message, projectId)
    );

    const results = await Promise.all(promises);
    const successCount = results.filter(r =&gt; r.success).length;
    const errorCount = results.length - successCount;

    return { successCount, errorCount };
  }

  /**
   * Log broadcast results and performance
   */
  private logBroadcastResults(
    projectId: string,
    event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;,
    subscriberCount: number,
    successCount: number,
    errorCount: number,
    duration: number
  ): void {
    logger.info(&#39;Broadcasted event to project&#39;, {
      projectId,
      eventType: event.event_type,
      subscriberCount,
      successCount,
      errorCount,
      duration,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Check and warn about broadcast performance
   */
  private checkBroadcastPerformance(projectId: string, duration: number, targetMs = 100): void {
    if (duration &gt; targetMs) {
      logger.warn(&#39;Broadcast exceeded target time&#39;, {
        projectId,
        duration,
        target: targetMs,
      });
    }
  }

  async broadcastToProject(
    projectId: string,
    event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;,
    specHash?: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const startTime = Date.now();

    // Create WebSocket message
    const message = this.createWebSocketMessage(projectId, event);

    // Publish to NATS (async, non-blocking)
    await this.publishToNats(projectId, event, specHash);

    // Check for WebSocket subscribers
    if (!this.hasProjectSubscribers(projectId)) {
      logger.debug(&#39;No WebSocket subscribers for project&#39;, { projectId });
      return;
    }

    const subscribers = this.getProjectSubscribers(projectId)!;

    // Broadcast to all WebSocket subscribers
    const { successCount, errorCount } = await this.broadcastToSubscribers(
      subscribers,
      message,
      projectId
    );

    // Log results and check performance
    const duration = Date.now() - startTime;
    this.logBroadcastResults(
      projectId,
      event,
      subscribers.size,
      successCount,
      errorCount,
      duration
    );
    this.checkBroadcastPerformance(projectId, duration);
  }

  /**
   * Send message to specific connection
   */
  private async sendToConnection(connectionId: string, message: WebSocketMessage): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const connection = this.connections.get(connectionId);

    if (!connection) {
      throw new Error(`Connection ${connectionId} not found`);
    }

    try {
      const messageStr = JSON.stringify(message);
      connection.ws.send(messageStr);
    } catch (error) {
      // Connection might be closed, remove it
      this.handleDisconnection(connectionId);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Ping all connections to keep them alive
   */
  private pingAllConnections(): void {
    const now = Date.now();
    const timeout = this.config.websocket.ping_interval_ms * 2;
    const staleConnections: string[] = [];

    for (const [connectionId, connection] of this.connections.entries()) {
      if (now - connection.lastPing &gt; timeout) {
        staleConnections.push(connectionId);
      } else {
        this.sendToConnection(connectionId, {
          type: &#39;ping&#39;,
          data: { timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp() },
        }).catch(() =&gt; {
          // Connection error, mark for removal
          staleConnections.push(connectionId);
        });
      }
    }

    // Clean up stale connections
    staleConnections.forEach(connectionId =&gt; {
      logger.info(&#39;Removing stale connection&#39;, { connectionId });
      this.handleDisconnection(connectionId);
    });
  }

  /**
   * Get connection statistics
   */
  getStats(): {
    totalConnections: number;
    totalProjects: number;
    connectionsByProject: Record&lt;string, number&gt;;
    nats: {
      enabled: boolean;
      connected: boolean;
      eventsPublished: number;
    };
  } {
    const connectionsByProject: Record&lt;string, number&gt; = {};

    for (const [projectId, connections] of this.projectSubscriptions.entries()) {
      connectionsByProject[projectId] = connections.size;
    }

    return {
      totalConnections: this.connections.size,
      totalProjects: this.projectSubscriptions.size,
      connectionsByProject,
      nats: this.nats.getStats(),
    };
  }

  /**
   * Close all connections and cleanup
   */
  async cleanup(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.pingInterval) {
      clearInterval(this.pingInterval);
    }

    // Close all connections
    for (const connection of this.connections.values()) {
      try {
        connection.ws.close();
      } catch {
        // Ignore close errors
      }
    }

    this.connections.clear();
    this.projectSubscriptions.clear();

    // Cleanup NATS connection
    await this.nats.cleanup();

    logger.info(&#39;EventService cleanup completed&#39;);
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/nats.ts
/**
 * NATS integration service for external agent communication
 * Publishes spec events to NATS topics for external AI agents to consume
 */
import { type ConnectionOptions, type NatsConnection, connect } from &#39;nats&#39;;
import type { Event, NatsConfig, NatsSpecEvent } from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { getCurrentTimestamp, logger } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

export class NatsService {
  private connection: NatsConnection | null = null;
  private config: NatsConfig;
  private isConnected = false;
  private reconnectAttempts = 0;
  private eventSequence = 0;
  private reconnectTimer?: Timer;

  constructor(config?: NatsConfig) {
    this.config = {
      url: process.env.NATS_URL || &#39;nats://localhost:4222&#39;,
      enabled: !!process.env.NATS_URL || false,
      reconnectTimeWait: 2000, // Start with 2 seconds
      maxReconnectAttempts: 10,
      topicPrefix: &#39;spec&#39;,
      ...config,
    };

    if (this.config.enabled) {
      this.initialize();
    } else {
      logger.info(&#39;NATS integration disabled - no NATS_URL configured&#39;);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Initialize NATS connection
   */
  private async initialize(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config.enabled) {
      return;
    }

    try {
      const connectionOptions: ConnectionOptions = {
        servers: [this.config.url!],
        reconnectTimeWait: this.config.reconnectTimeWait,
        maxReconnectAttempts: this.config.maxReconnectAttempts,
        pingInterval: 60000, // 60 seconds
        maxPingOut: 2,
      };

      logger.info(&#39;Connecting to NATS server&#39;, {
        url: this.config.url,
        options: connectionOptions,
      });

      this.connection = await connect(connectionOptions);
      this.isConnected = true;
      this.reconnectAttempts = 0;

      logger.info(&#39;Successfully connected to NATS server&#39;, {
        server: this.connection.getServer(),
      });

      // Set up event listeners
      this.setupConnectionListeners();
    } catch (error) {
      this.isConnected = false;

      logger.error(&#39;Failed to connect to NATS server&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined, {
        url: this.config.url,
        attempts: this.reconnectAttempts,
      });

      this.scheduleReconnect();
    }
  }

  /**
   * Setup connection event listeners
   */
  private setupConnectionListeners(): void {
    if (!this.connection) return;

    // Monitor connection state
    this.connection.closed().then(error =&gt; {
      this.isConnected = false;

      if (error) {
        logger.error(
          &#39;NATS connection closed with error&#39;,
          error instanceof Error ? error : undefined
        );
        this.scheduleReconnect();
      } else {
        logger.info(&#39;NATS connection closed normally&#39;);
      }
    });
  }

  /**
   * Schedule a reconnection attempt with exponential backoff
   */
  private scheduleReconnect(): void {
    if (this.reconnectAttempts &gt;= this.config.maxReconnectAttempts) {
      logger.error(&#39;Max NATS reconnect attempts reached, giving up&#39;, undefined, {
        maxAttempts: this.config.maxReconnectAttempts,
      });
      return;
    }

    const delay = Math.min(
      this.config.reconnectTimeWait * 2 ** this.reconnectAttempts,
      30000 // Max 30 seconds
    );

    this.reconnectAttempts++;

    logger.info(&#39;Scheduling NATS reconnect&#39;, {
      attempt: this.reconnectAttempts,
      delay,
      maxAttempts: this.config.maxReconnectAttempts,
    });

    this.reconnectTimer = setTimeout(() =&gt; {
      this.initialize();
    }, delay);
  }

  /**
   * Publish event to NATS topic for external agents
   */
  async publishEvent(
    projectId: string,
    event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;,
    specHash?: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Always return early if NATS is disabled - no impact on core functionality
    if (!this.config.enabled || !this.connection || !this.isConnected) {
      return;
    }

    try {
      // Map event type to topic suffix
      const topicSuffix = this.getTopicSuffix(event.event_type);
      const topic = `${this.config.topicPrefix}.${projectId}.${topicSuffix}.updated`;

      const natsEvent: NatsSpecEvent = {
        topic,
        projectId,
        event,
        metadata: {
          timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp(),
          specHash,
          sequence: ++this.eventSequence,
        },
      };

      // Publish to NATS (fire and forget for performance)
      this.connection.publish(topic, JSON.stringify(natsEvent));

      logger.debug(&#39;Published event to NATS&#39;, {
        topic,
        projectId,
        eventType: event.event_type,
        sequence: this.eventSequence,
      });
    } catch (error) {
      // Log error but don&#39;t throw - NATS failures should never break core functionality
      logger.error(&#39;Failed to publish event to NATS&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined, {
        projectId,
        eventType: event.event_type,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Map event types to NATS topic suffixes
   */
  private getTopicSuffix(eventType: string): string {
    switch (eventType) {
      case &#39;fragment_created&#39;:
      case &#39;fragment_updated&#39;:
      case &#39;fragment_deleted&#39;:
        return &#39;fragment&#39;;

      case &#39;validation_started&#39;:
      case &#39;validation_completed&#39;:
      case &#39;validation_failed&#39;:
        return &#39;validation&#39;;

      case &#39;version_frozen&#39;:
        return &#39;version&#39;;

      default:
        return &#39;general&#39;;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Health check for NATS connection
   */
  getHealthStatus(): {
    enabled: boolean;
    connected: boolean;
    server?: string;
    reconnectAttempts: number;
    eventsPublished: number;
  } {
    return {
      enabled: this.config.enabled,
      connected: this.isConnected,
      server: this.connection?.getServer(),
      reconnectAttempts: this.reconnectAttempts,
      eventsPublished: this.eventSequence,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Get connection statistics
   */
  getStats(): {
    enabled: boolean;
    connected: boolean;
    eventsPublished: number;
    config: NatsConfig;
  } {
    return {
      enabled: this.config.enabled,
      connected: this.isConnected,
      eventsPublished: this.eventSequence,
      config: this.config,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Manually trigger reconnection (for testing/admin)
   */
  async reconnect(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer);
      this.reconnectTimer = undefined;
    }

    this.reconnectAttempts = 0;
    await this.initialize();
  }

  /**
   * Close NATS connection and cleanup
   */
  async cleanup(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer);
      this.reconnectTimer = undefined;
    }

    if (this.connection) {
      try {
        await this.connection.close();
        logger.info(&#39;NATS connection closed successfully&#39;);
      } catch (error) {
        logger.error(&#39;Error closing NATS connection&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);
      }

      this.connection = null;
      this.isConnected = false;
    }
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/api-client.ts
import type { IRResponse, ValidationRequest, ValidationResponse } from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
import { COMMON_PORTS } from &#39;./config.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, CommandResult } from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

/**
 * Rate-limited HTTP API client for Arbiter server
 * Implements rate limiting (≤1 RPS), payload size limits (≤64KB), and timeout compliance (≤750ms)
 * according to the Arbiter specification
 */
export class ApiClient {
  private baseUrl: string;
  private timeout: number;
  private lastRequestTime = 0;
  private discoveredUrl: string | null = null;
  private readonly MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE = 64 * 1024; // 64KB
  private readonly MIN_REQUEST_INTERVAL = 1000; // 1 second (1 RPS)
  private readonly MAX_TIMEOUT = 750; // 750ms per spec

  constructor(config: CLIConfig) {
    this.baseUrl = config.apiUrl.replace(/\/$/, &#39;&#39;); // Remove trailing slash
    // Ensure timeout compliance with spec (≤750ms)
    this.timeout = Math.min(config.timeout, this.MAX_TIMEOUT);
  }

  /**
   * Auto-discover server by trying common ports
   */
  async discoverServer(): Promise&lt;{ success: boolean; url?: string; error?: string }&gt; {
    const hostname = new URL(this.baseUrl).hostname;
    const protocol = new URL(this.baseUrl).protocol;

    for (const port of COMMON_PORTS) {
      const testUrl = `${protocol}//${hostname}:${port}`;

      try {
        const controller = new AbortController();
        const timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), 2000); // Quick discovery timeout

        const response = await fetch(`${testUrl}/health`, {
          signal: controller.signal,
          method: &#39;GET&#39;,
        });

        clearTimeout(timeoutId);

        if (response.ok) {
          this.discoveredUrl = testUrl;
          return { success: true, url: testUrl };
        }
      } catch {}
    }

    return {
      success: false,
      error: `No Arbiter server found on common ports [${COMMON_PORTS.join(&#39;, &#39;)}]. Please ensure the server is running.`,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Get the effective base URL (discovered or configured)
   */
  private getEffectiveBaseUrl(): string {
    return this.discoveredUrl || this.baseUrl;
  }

  /**
   * Enforce rate limiting (≤1 RPS) with exponential backoff
   */
  private async enforceRateLimit(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const now = Date.now();
    const timeSinceLastRequest = now - this.lastRequestTime;

    if (timeSinceLastRequest &lt; this.MIN_REQUEST_INTERVAL) {
      const waitTime = this.MIN_REQUEST_INTERVAL - timeSinceLastRequest;
      await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, waitTime));
    }

    this.lastRequestTime = Date.now();
  }

  /**
   * Validate payload size (≤64KB)
   */
  private validatePayloadSize(payload: string): void {
    const size = new TextEncoder().encode(payload).length;
    if (size &gt; this.MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE) {
      throw new Error(
        `Payload size ${size} bytes exceeds maximum allowed ${this.MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE} bytes (64KB)`
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate CUE content using the /api/validate endpoint
   */
  async validate(
    content: string,
    _options: {
      schema?: string;
      strict?: boolean;
    } = {}
  ): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;ValidationResponse&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      await this.enforceRateLimit();
      this.validatePayloadSize(content);

      const request: ValidationRequest = {
        text: content,
        files: [], // Empty files array for text-based validation
        projectId: &#39;cli-project&#39;, // Use a default project ID for CLI
      };

      const requestPayload = JSON.stringify(request);
      this.validatePayloadSize(requestPayload);

      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/api/validate&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        body: requestPayload,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        const errorText = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `API error: ${response.status} ${errorText}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data: ValidationResponse = await response.json();

      return {
        success: data.success,
        data,
        exitCode: data.success ? 0 : 1,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Network error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get intermediate representation using the /api/ir endpoint
   */
  async getIR(content: string): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;IRResponse&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      await this.enforceRateLimit();
      this.validatePayloadSize(content);

      const requestPayload = JSON.stringify({ text: content });
      this.validatePayloadSize(requestPayload);

      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/api/ir&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        body: requestPayload,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        const errorText = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `API error: ${response.status} ${errorText}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data: IRResponse = await response.json();

      return {
        success: true,
        data,
        exitCode: 0,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Network error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Lightweight helper for ad-hoc API requests
   */
  async request(path: string, init: RequestInit = {}): Promise&lt;Response&gt; {
    await this.enforceRateLimit();
    return this.fetch(path, init);
  }

  /**
   * List fragments for a project
   */
  async listFragments(projectId = &#39;default&#39;): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;any[]&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      await this.enforceRateLimit();

      const response = await this.fetch(
        `/api/fragments?projectId=${encodeURIComponent(projectId)}`
      );

      if (!response.ok) {
        const errorText = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `API error: ${response.status} ${errorText}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();

      return {
        success: true,
        data,
        exitCode: 0,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Network error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Update or create a fragment
   */
  async updateFragment(
    projectId: string,
    path: string,
    content: string,
    options?: { author?: string; message?: string }
  ): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;any&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      await this.enforceRateLimit();
      this.validatePayloadSize(content);

      const requestPayload = JSON.stringify({
        projectId,
        path,
        content,
        author: options?.author,
        message: options?.message,
      });
      this.validatePayloadSize(requestPayload);

      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/api/fragments&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        body: requestPayload,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        const errorText = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `API error: ${response.status} ${errorText}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();

      return {
        success: true,
        data,
        exitCode: 0,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Network error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Store CUE specification in service database with sharding support
   */
  async storeSpecification(spec: {
    content: string;
    type: string;
    path: string;
    shard?: string;
  }): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;{ success: boolean; id: string; shard?: string }&gt;&gt; {
    await this.enforceRateLimit();

    try {
      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/api/specifications&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39; },
        body: JSON.stringify({
          ...spec,
          sharded: true, // Indicate this should use sharded storage
        }),
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        const error = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          data: null,
          error: `Failed to store specification: ${error}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();
      return { success: true, data, error: null, exitCode: 0 };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        data: null,
        error: `Network error storing specification: ${error}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get CUE specification from service database
   */
  async getSpecification(type: string, path: string): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;{ content: string }&gt;&gt; {
    await this.enforceRateLimit();

    try {
      const params = new URLSearchParams({ type, path });
      const response = await this.fetch(`/api/specifications?${params}`);

      if (!response.ok) {
        if (response.status === 404) {
          return {
            success: false,
            data: null,
            error: &#39;Specification not found&#39;,
            exitCode: 1,
          };
        }
        const error = await response.text();
        return {
          success: false,
          data: null,
          error: `Failed to get specification: ${error}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();
      return { success: true, data, error: null, exitCode: 0 };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        data: null,
        error: `Network error getting specification: ${error}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Check server health using the /health endpoint
   * Automatically attempts discovery if initial connection fails
   */
  async health(): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;{ status: string; timestamp: string }&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      await this.enforceRateLimit();

      // First try the configured URL
      let response = await this.fetch(&#39;/health&#39;);

      // If it fails, try auto-discovery
      if (!response.ok || response.status === 404) {
        console.warn(
          `Initial connection to ${this.baseUrl} failed. Attempting server discovery...`
        );
        const discovery = await this.discoverServer();

        if (discovery.success &amp;&amp; discovery.url) {
          console.log(`✓ Found server at ${discovery.url}`);
          // Retry with discovered URL
          response = await this.fetch(&#39;/health&#39;);
        } else {
          return {
            success: false,
            error: discovery.error || `Cannot reach server at ${this.baseUrl}`,
            exitCode: 2,
          };
        }
      }

      if (!response.ok) {
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `Server unhealthy: ${response.status}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();

      return {
        success: true,
        data,
        exitCode: 0,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      // Try auto-discovery on any connection error
      const discovery = await this.discoverServer();

      if (discovery.success) {
        return this.health(); // Retry after discovery
      }

      return {
        success: false,
        error:
          discovery.error ||
          `Cannot reach server: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Export CUE content to various formats using the dedicated /export endpoint
   */
  async export(
    content: string,
    format: string,
    options: {
      strict?: boolean;
      includeExamples?: boolean;
      outputMode?: &#39;single&#39; | &#39;multiple&#39;;
    } = {}
  ): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;any&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/export&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        body: JSON.stringify({
          text: content,
          format,
          strict: options.strict || false,
          includeExamples: options.includeExamples || false,
          outputMode: options.outputMode || &#39;single&#39;,
        }),
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        const errorData = await response.json().catch(() =&gt; ({ error: &#39;Unknown error&#39; }));
        return {
          success: false,
          error: errorData.error || `Export failed: ${response.status}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();

      if (!data.success) {
        return {
          success: false,
          error: data.error || &#39;Export failed&#39;,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      return {
        success: true,
        data,
        exitCode: 0,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Export error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get supported export formats from the API
   */
  async getSupportedFormats(): Promise&lt;CommandResult&lt;any&gt;&gt; {
    try {
      const response = await this.fetch(&#39;/export/formats&#39;);

      if (!response.ok) {
        return {
          success: false,
          error: `Failed to get formats: ${response.status}`,
          exitCode: 1,
        };
      }

      const data = await response.json();

      return {
        success: data.success,
        data: data.formats,
        exitCode: data.success ? 0 : 1,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        success: false,
        error: `Network error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
        exitCode: 2,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Internal fetch wrapper with timeout and error handling
   */
  private async fetch(endpoint: string, options: RequestInit = {}): Promise&lt;Response&gt; {
    const baseUrl = this.getEffectiveBaseUrl();
    const url = `${baseUrl}${endpoint}`;

    const controller = new AbortController();
    const timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), this.timeout);

    try {
      const response = await fetch(url, {
        ...options,
        signal: controller.signal,
      });

      clearTimeout(timeoutId);
      return response;
    } catch (error) {
      clearTimeout(timeoutId);

      if (error instanceof Error &amp;&amp; error.name === &#39;AbortError&#39;) {
        throw new Error(`Request timeout after ${this.timeout}ms connecting to ${baseUrl}`);
      }

      // Enhance error message with connection details
      if (
        error instanceof Error &amp;&amp;
        (error.message.includes(&#39;ECONNREFUSED&#39;) || error.message.includes(&#39;fetch failed&#39;))
      ) {
        throw new Error(`Connection failed to ${baseUrl}. Is the Arbiter server running?`);
      }

      throw error;
    }
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/handlers/services.ts
/**
 * Handler Services - Provide secure, sandboxed services for custom handlers
 */

import { mkdir } from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import nodemailer from &#39;nodemailer&#39;;
import type { Transporter } from &#39;nodemailer&#39;;
import { logger as defaultLogger } from &#39;../utils.js&#39;;
import { HandlerSandbox } from &#39;./sandbox.js&#39;;
import type {
  FileDiff,
  GitService,
  HttpClient,
  HttpResponse,
  Logger,
  NotificationService,
  RequestOptions,
  SlackMessage,
} from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

type EmailMode = &#39;disabled&#39; | &#39;log&#39; | &#39;smtp&#39;;

export interface HandlerEmailConfig {
  mode?: EmailMode;
  from?: string;
  smtp?: {
    host?: string;
    port?: number;
    secure?: boolean;
    user?: string;
    pass?: string;
  };
}

/**
 * HTTP Client for handlers with built-in security and rate limiting
 */
export class HandlerHttpClient implements HttpClient {
  private requestCounts = new Map&lt;string, { count: number; resetTime: number }&gt;();
  private readonly maxRequestsPerMinute = 60;
  private readonly allowedDomains = new Set([
    &#39;api.github.com&#39;,
    &#39;gitlab.com&#39;,
    &#39;hooks.slack.com&#39;,
    &#39;api.slack.com&#39;,
    &#39;discord.com&#39;,
    &#39;api.trello.com&#39;,
    &#39;api.atlassian.com&#39;,
  ]);

  constructor(private logger: Logger) {}

  async get(url: string, options: RequestOptions = {}): Promise&lt;HttpResponse&gt; {
    return this.makeRequest(&#39;GET&#39;, url, undefined, options);
  }

  async post(url: string, data?: unknown, options: RequestOptions = {}): Promise&lt;HttpResponse&gt; {
    return this.makeRequest(&#39;POST&#39;, url, data, options);
  }

  async put(url: string, data?: unknown, options: RequestOptions = {}): Promise&lt;HttpResponse&gt; {
    return this.makeRequest(&#39;PUT&#39;, url, data, options);
  }

  async delete(url: string, options: RequestOptions = {}): Promise&lt;HttpResponse&gt; {
    return this.makeRequest(&#39;DELETE&#39;, url, undefined, options);
  }

  private async makeRequest(
    method: string,
    url: string,
    data?: unknown,
    options: RequestOptions = {}
  ): Promise&lt;HttpResponse&gt; {
    // Validate URL
    this.validateUrl(url);

    // Rate limiting
    this.checkRateLimit();

    const { timeout = 10000, retries = 0 } = options;
    let lastError: Error | undefined;

    for (let attempt = 0; attempt &lt;= retries; attempt++) {
      try {
        const controller = new AbortController();
        const timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), timeout);

        const requestOptions: RequestInit = {
          method,
          headers: {
            &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
            &#39;User-Agent&#39;: &#39;Arbiter-Webhook-Handler/1.0&#39;,
            ...options.headers,
          },
          signal: controller.signal,
        };

        if (data &amp;&amp; (method === &#39;POST&#39; || method === &#39;PUT&#39;)) {
          requestOptions.body = JSON.stringify(data);
        }

        this.logger.debug(&#39;Making HTTP request&#39;, { method, url, attempt });

        const response = await fetch(url, requestOptions);
        clearTimeout(timeoutId);

        let responseData: unknown;
        const contentType = response.headers.get(&#39;content-type&#39;) || &#39;&#39;;

        if (contentType.includes(&#39;application/json&#39;)) {
          responseData = await response.json();
        } else {
          responseData = await response.text();
        }

        const result: HttpResponse = {
          status: response.status,
          statusText: response.statusText,
          data: responseData,
          headers: Object.fromEntries(response.headers.entries()),
        };

        // Log result
        this.logger.info(&#39;HTTP request completed&#39;, {
          method,
          url: this.sanitizeUrl(url),
          status: response.status,
          attempt,
        });

        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        lastError = error as Error;

        if (attempt === retries) {
          this.logger.error(&#39;HTTP request failed&#39;, lastError, {
            method,
            url: this.sanitizeUrl(url),
            attempt,
          });
          throw lastError;
        }

        // Exponential backoff for retries
        const delay = Math.min(1000 * 2 ** attempt, 5000);
        await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, delay));
      }
    }

    throw lastError || new Error(&#39;HTTP request failed&#39;);
  }

  private validateUrl(url: string): void {
    try {
      const parsedUrl = new URL(url);

      // Only allow HTTPS (except localhost for development)
      if (parsedUrl.protocol !== &#39;https:&#39; &amp;&amp; !parsedUrl.hostname.includes(&#39;localhost&#39;)) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Only HTTPS URLs are allowed&#39;);
      }

      // Check allowed domains
      if (
        !this.allowedDomains.has(parsedUrl.hostname) &amp;&amp;
        !parsedUrl.hostname.includes(&#39;localhost&#39;)
      ) {
        throw new Error(`Domain not allowed: ${parsedUrl.hostname}`);
      }

      // Prevent SSRF attacks
      if (parsedUrl.hostname.includes(&#39;metadata&#39;) || parsedUrl.hostname.includes(&#39;169.254&#39;)) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Blocked URL pattern detected&#39;);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid URL: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;}`);
    }
  }

  private checkRateLimit(): void {
    const now = Date.now();
    const minute = Math.floor(now / 60000);

    const current = this.requestCounts.get(String(minute)) || { count: 0, resetTime: minute };

    if (current.count &gt;= this.maxRequestsPerMinute) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Rate limit exceeded: too many HTTP requests&#39;);
    }

    current.count++;
    this.requestCounts.set(String(minute), current);

    // Clean up old entries
    for (const [key, value] of this.requestCounts) {
      if (value.resetTime &lt; minute - 5) {
        // Keep last 5 minutes
        this.requestCounts.delete(key);
      }
    }
  }

  private sanitizeUrl(url: string): string {
    try {
      const parsedUrl = new URL(url);
      return `${parsedUrl.protocol}//${parsedUrl.hostname}${parsedUrl.pathname}`;
    } catch {
      return &#39;[invalid-url]&#39;;
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Notification service for handlers
 */
export class HandlerNotificationService implements NotificationService {
  private emailMode: EmailMode;
  private emailFrom?: string;
  private transporter?: Transporter;

  constructor(private logger: Logger, private emailConfig: HandlerEmailConfig = {}) {
    this.emailMode = this.resolveEmailMode(emailConfig.mode);
    this.emailFrom = emailConfig.from ?? process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_FROM;

    if (this.emailMode === &#39;smtp&#39;) {
      this.configureSmtpTransport(emailConfig.smtp);
    }
  }

  async sendSlack(webhookUrl: string, message: SlackMessage): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!webhookUrl.includes(&#39;hooks.slack.com&#39;)) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Invalid Slack webhook URL&#39;);
    }

    const payload = {
      text: message.text,
      blocks: message.blocks,
      channel: message.channel,
      username: message.username || &#39;Arbiter Webhook&#39;,
      icon_emoji: message.iconEmoji || &#39;:robot_face:&#39;,
    };

    try {
      const response = await fetch(webhookUrl, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
        body: JSON.stringify(payload),
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(`Slack webhook failed: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
      }

      this.logger.info(&#39;Slack notification sent successfully&#39;);
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Failed to send Slack notification&#39;, error as Error);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  async sendEmail(to: string, subject: string, body: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const sanitizedTo = this.sanitizeEmail(to);

    if (this.emailMode === &#39;disabled&#39;) {
      const message =
        &#39;Email notifications are disabled. Set HANDLER_EMAIL_MODE=log or smtp to enable.&#39;;
      this.logger.warn(message, { to: sanitizedTo });
      throw new Error(message);
    }

    if (this.emailMode === &#39;log&#39;) {
      this.logger.info(&#39;Email notification logged (log mode)&#39;, {
        to: sanitizedTo,
        subject,
      });
      return;
    }

    if (!this.transporter || !this.emailFrom) {
      const message = &#39;Email transporter not configured. Check SMTP credentials and from address.&#39;;
      this.logger.error(message, undefined, { to: sanitizedTo });
      throw new Error(message);
    }

    try {
      await this.transporter.sendMail({
        from: this.emailFrom,
        to,
        subject,
        text: body,
        html: this.renderEmailHtml(subject, body),
      });

      this.logger.info(&#39;Email notification sent successfully&#39;, { to: sanitizedTo, subject });
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Failed to send email notification&#39;, error as Error, {
        to: sanitizedTo,
      });
      throw error;
    }
  }

  async sendWebhook(url: string, payload: unknown): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      const response = await fetch(url, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
          &#39;User-Agent&#39;: &#39;Arbiter-Webhook-Handler/1.0&#39;,
        },
        body: JSON.stringify(payload),
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(`Webhook failed: ${response.status} ${response.statusText}`);
      }

      this.logger.info(&#39;Webhook notification sent successfully&#39;, {
        url: this.sanitizeUrl(url),
      });
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Failed to send webhook notification&#39;, error as Error, {
        url: this.sanitizeUrl(url),
      });
      throw error;
    }
  }

  private resolveEmailMode(override?: EmailMode): EmailMode {
    if (override) return override;

    const fromEnv = (process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_MODE || &#39;&#39;).toLowerCase();
    if (fromEnv === &#39;smtp&#39; || fromEnv === &#39;log&#39;) {
      return fromEnv;
    }
    return &#39;disabled&#39;;
  }

  private configureSmtpTransport(smtpConfig?: HandlerEmailConfig[&#39;smtp&#39;]): void {
    const host = smtpConfig?.host ?? process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_SMTP_HOST;
    const port = smtpConfig?.port ?? Number(process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_SMTP_PORT || 587);
    const secure = smtpConfig?.secure ?? process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_SMTP_SECURE === &#39;true&#39;;
    const user = smtpConfig?.user ?? process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_SMTP_USER;
    const pass = smtpConfig?.pass ?? process.env.HANDLER_EMAIL_SMTP_PASS;

    if (!host || !user || !pass) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;SMTP email mode enabled but configuration is incomplete&#39;, undefined, {
        missing: {
          host: !host,
          user: !user,
          pass: !pass,
        },
      });
      this.emailMode = &#39;disabled&#39;;
      return;
    }

    if (!this.emailFrom) {
      this.logger.warn(&#39;SMTP email mode enabled but HANDLER_EMAIL_FROM is not set. Using user.&#39;);
      this.emailFrom = user;
    }

    this.transporter = nodemailer.createTransport({
      host,
      port,
      secure: secure ?? port === 465,
      auth: {
        user,
        pass,
      },
    });
  }

  private renderEmailHtml(subject: string, body: string): string {
    const safeSubject = this.escapeHtml(subject);
    const safeBody = this.escapeHtml(body);
    return `&lt;!doctype html&gt;&lt;html&gt;&lt;head&gt;&lt;meta charset=&quot;utf-8&quot;&gt;&lt;title&gt;${safeSubject}&lt;/title&gt;&lt;/head&gt;&lt;body&gt;&lt;pre style=&quot;font-family: monospace; white-space: pre-wrap;&quot;&gt;${safeBody}&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;/body&gt;&lt;/html&gt;`;
  }

  private sanitizeEmail(email: string): string {
    const parts = email.split(&#39;@&#39;);
    if (parts.length !== 2) return &#39;[invalid-email]&#39;;
    return `${parts[0].substring(0, 2)}***@${parts[1]}`;
  }

  private sanitizeUrl(url: string): string {
    try {
      const parsedUrl = new URL(url);
      return `${parsedUrl.protocol}//${parsedUrl.hostname}${parsedUrl.pathname}`;
    } catch {
      return &#39;[invalid-url]&#39;;
    }
  }

  private escapeHtml(value: string): string {
    return value.replace(/&amp;/g, &#39;&amp;amp;&#39;).replace(/&lt;/g, &#39;&amp;lt;&#39;).replace(/&gt;/g, &#39;&amp;gt;&#39;);
  }
}

/**
 * Git service for handlers (limited read-only operations)
 */
export class HandlerGitService implements GitService {
  private readonly baseDir: string;

  constructor(private logger: Logger) {
    this.baseDir = process.env.HANDLER_GIT_ROOT ?? &#39;/tmp/arbiter-handler-git&#39;;
  }

  async cloneRepository(url: string, target: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const validatedUrl = this.validateRepoUrl(url);
    const targetPath = await this.resolveTargetPath(target);

    await this.runGit([&#39;clone&#39;, &#39;--depth&#39;, &#39;1&#39;, validatedUrl, targetPath], process.cwd());
    this.logger.info(&#39;Repository cloned for handler&#39;, {
      url: this.sanitizeUrl(validatedUrl),
      target: targetPath,
    });
  }

  async getCommitDiff(sha: string): Promise&lt;FileDiff[]&gt; {
    const repoPath = this.resolveRepoPath();
    const output = await this.runGitOutput(
      [&#39;diff&#39;, `${sha}^`, sha, &#39;--name-status&#39;, &#39;--stat&#39;],
      repoPath
    );

    return this.parseDiff(output.stdout);
  }

  async getFileContent(path: string, ref = &#39;HEAD&#39;): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    const repoPath = this.resolveRepoPath();
    const result = await this.runGitOutput([&#39;show&#39;, `${ref}:${path}`], repoPath);
    return result.stdout;
  }

  async createBranch(name: string, from = &#39;HEAD&#39;): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const repoPath = this.resolveRepoPath();
    await this.runGit([&#39;branch&#39;, name, from], repoPath);
    this.logger.info(&#39;Created branch for handler&#39;, { name, from });
  }

  async createPullRequest(): Promise&lt;unknown&gt; {
    throw new Error(&#39;Pull request creation requires provider integration&#39;);
  }

  private resolveRepoPath(): string {
    return process.env.HANDLER_GIT_REPO_PATH ?? process.cwd();
  }

  private async resolveTargetPath(target: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    const absolute = path.isAbsolute(target) ? target : path.join(this.baseDir, target);
    if (!absolute.startsWith(this.baseDir)) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Target path outside allowed git directory&#39;);
    }
    await mkdir(path.dirname(absolute), { recursive: true });
    return absolute;
  }

  private validateRepoUrl(url: string): string {
    try {
      const parsed = new URL(url);
      if (![&#39;https:&#39;, &#39;git:&#39;].includes(parsed.protocol)) {
        throw new Error(&#39;Only HTTPS/GIT URLs are allowed&#39;);
      }
      return parsed.toString();
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Invalid repository URL: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;}`);
    }
  }

  private async runGit(args: string[], cwd: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const result = Bun.spawnSync([&#39;git&#39;, ...args], { cwd, stderr: &#39;pipe&#39;, stdout: &#39;pipe&#39; });
    if (result.exitCode !== 0) {
      const error = new TextDecoder().decode(result.stderr);
      throw new Error(error || `git ${args.join(&#39; &#39;)} failed`);
    }
  }

  private async runGitOutput(args: string[], cwd: string): Promise&lt;{ stdout: string; stderr: string }&gt; {
    const result = Bun.spawnSync([&#39;git&#39;, ...args], { cwd, stderr: &#39;pipe&#39;, stdout: &#39;pipe&#39; });
    const stdout = new TextDecoder().decode(result.stdout).trim();
    const stderr = new TextDecoder().decode(result.stderr).trim();
    if (result.exitCode !== 0) {
      throw new Error(stderr || `git ${args.join(&#39; &#39;)} failed`);
    }
    return { stdout, stderr };
  }

  private parseDiff(output: string): FileDiff[] {
    const diffs: FileDiff[] = [];
    const lines = output.split(&#39;\n&#39;);

    for (const line of lines) {
      if (!line || !/^[AMDCRTU]/.test(line)) continue;
      const [status, filePath] = line.split(/\s+/);
      diffs.push({
        path: filePath,
        status: this.mapStatus(status),
        additions: 0,
        deletions: 0,
      });
    }

    return diffs;
  }

  private mapStatus(status: string): FileDiff[&#39;status&#39;] {
    switch (status[0]) {
      case &#39;A&#39;:
        return &#39;added&#39;;
      case &#39;D&#39;:
        return &#39;deleted&#39;;
      case &#39;R&#39;:
        return &#39;renamed&#39;;
      default:
        return &#39;modified&#39;;
    }
  }

  private sanitizeUrl(url: string): string {
    try {
      const parsedUrl = new URL(url);
      return `${parsedUrl.protocol}//${parsedUrl.hostname}${parsedUrl.pathname}`;
    } catch {
      return &#39;[invalid-url]&#39;;
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Security validator for handler services
 */
export class HandlerSecurityValidator {
  static validateHandlerCode(code: string, logger: Logger = defaultLogger): {
    safe: boolean;
    violations: string[];
  } {
    const sandbox = new HandlerSandbox(logger);
    return sandbox.validate(code);
  }

  static sanitizeEnvironment(env: Record&lt;string, string&gt;): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
    const sanitized: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {};
    const allowedKeys = [&#39;NODE_ENV&#39;, &#39;LOG_LEVEL&#39;];

    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(env)) {
      if (allowedKeys.includes(key) || key.startsWith(&#39;HANDLER_&#39;)) {
        sanitized[key] = value;
      }
    }

    return sanitized;
  }

  static validateSecrets(secrets: Record&lt;string, string&gt;): { valid: boolean; errors: string[] } {
    const errors: string[] = [];

    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(secrets)) {
      if (!key.startsWith(&#39;HANDLER_&#39;)) {
        errors.push(`Secret key must start with &#39;HANDLER_&#39;: ${key}`);
      }

      if (value.length &lt; 10) {
        errors.push(`Secret value too short: ${key}`);
      }
    }

    return {
      valid: errors.length === 0,
      errors,
    };
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/language-plugins/python.ts
/**
 * Python Language Plugin - FastAPI + SQLAlchemy 2.0+ + Modern Async Stack
 * Supports: FastAPI 0.100+, SQLAlchemy 2.0+, Pydantic v2, asyncio, pytest
 */

import type {
  BuildConfig,
  ComponentConfig,
  GeneratedFile,
  GenerationResult,
  LanguagePlugin,
  ProjectConfig,
  ServiceConfig,
} from &#39;./index.js&#39;;

export class PythonPlugin implements LanguagePlugin {
  readonly name = &#39;Python Plugin&#39;;
  readonly language = &#39;python&#39;;
  readonly version = &#39;1.0.0&#39;;
  readonly description = &#39;Modern Python with FastAPI, SQLAlchemy 2.0+, and async best practices&#39;;
  readonly supportedFeatures = [
    &#39;api&#39;,
    &#39;async-services&#39;,
    &#39;database-orm&#39;,
    &#39;validation&#39;,
    &#39;authentication&#39;,
    &#39;testing&#39;,
    &#39;dependency-injection&#39;,
    &#39;background-tasks&#39;,
    &#39;websockets&#39;,
  ];
  readonly capabilities = {
    services: true,
    api: true,
    testing: true,
  };

  // Python doesn&#39;t have UI components like frontend frameworks
  async generateComponent(config: ComponentConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    throw new Error(&#39;Component generation not supported for Python. Use generateService instead.&#39;);
  }

  async generateService(config: ServiceConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];
    const dependencies: string[] = [];

    switch (config.type) {
      case &#39;api&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `app/routers/${config.name}.py`,
          content: this.generateAPIRouter(config),
        });
        dependencies.push(&#39;fastapi&#39;, &#39;uvicorn&#39;);
        break;
      case &#39;service&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `app/services/${config.name}_service.py`,
          content: this.generateBusinessService(config),
        });
        break;
      case &#39;model&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `app/models/${config.name}.py`,
          content: this.generateModel(config),
        });
        dependencies.push(&#39;sqlalchemy&#39;);
        break;
      case &#39;handler&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `app/handlers/${config.name}_handler.py`,
          content: this.generateHandler(config),
        });
        break;
    }

    if (config.validation) {
      dependencies.push(&#39;pydantic&#39;);
      files.push({
        path: `app/schemas/${config.name}_schema.py`,
        content: this.generatePydanticSchema(config),
      });
    }

    if (config.database) {
      dependencies.push(&#39;sqlalchemy&#39;, &#39;asyncpg&#39;);
    }

    return { files, dependencies };
  }

  async initializeProject(config: ProjectConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];
    const dependencies = [
      &#39;fastapi&gt;=0.100.0&#39;,
      &#39;uvicorn[standard]&gt;=0.22.0&#39;,
      &#39;pydantic&gt;=2.0.0&#39;,
      &#39;python-multipart&gt;=0.0.6&#39;,
    ];

    // Requirements file
    files.push({
      path: &#39;requirements.txt&#39;,
      content: this.generateRequirements(config, dependencies),
    });

    // Development requirements
    files.push({
      path: &#39;requirements-dev.txt&#39;,
      content: this.generateDevRequirements(config),
    });

    // Main application file
    files.push({
      path: &#39;app/main.py&#39;,
      content: this.generateMainApp(config),
    });

    // Application configuration
    files.push({
      path: &#39;app/core/config.py&#39;,
      content: this.generateConfig(config),
    });

    // Core package init
    files.push({
      path: &#39;app/__init__.py&#39;,
      content: &#39;&#39;,
    });

    files.push({
      path: &#39;app/core/__init__.py&#39;,
      content: &#39;&#39;,
    });

    // Database setup (if needed)
    if (config.database) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;app/core/database.py&#39;,
        content: this.generateDatabase(config),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;app/models/__init__.py&#39;,
        content: &#39;&#39;,
      });
      dependencies.push(&#39;sqlalchemy&gt;=2.0.0&#39;, &#39;asyncpg&gt;=0.28.0&#39;);
    }

    // Authentication setup (if needed)
    if (config.auth) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;app/core/security.py&#39;,
        content: this.generateSecurity(config),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;app/core/auth.py&#39;,
        content: this.generateAuth(config),
      });
      dependencies.push(&#39;python-jose[cryptography]&#39;, &#39;passlib[bcrypt]&#39;);
    }

    // Testing setup
    if (config.testing) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;tests/__init__.py&#39;,
        content: &#39;&#39;,
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;tests/conftest.py&#39;,
        content: this.generateTestConfig(config),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;tests/test_main.py&#39;,
        content: this.generateMainTest(config),
      });
    }

    // Docker setup (if requested)
    if (config.docker) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;Dockerfile&#39;,
        content: this.generateDockerfile(config),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;docker-compose.yml&#39;,
        content: this.generateDockerCompose(config),
      });
    }

    // Project metadata
    files.push({
      path: &#39;pyproject.toml&#39;,
      content: this.generatePyprojectToml(config),
    });

    return {
      files,
      dependencies,
      scripts: {
        dev: &#39;uvicorn app.main:app --reload --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000&#39;,
        start: &#39;uvicorn app.main:app --host 0.0.0.0 --port 8000&#39;,
        test: &#39;pytest&#39;,
        &#39;test:watch&#39;: &#39;pytest --watch&#39;,
        format: &#39;black . &amp;&amp; isort .&#39;,
        lint: &#39;flake8 app tests&#39;,
        &#39;type-check&#39;: &#39;mypy app&#39;,
      },
    };
  }

  async generateBuildConfig(config: BuildConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];

    // Production dockerfile
    if (config.target === &#39;production&#39;) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;Dockerfile.prod&#39;,
        content: this.generateProductionDockerfile(config),
      });
    }

    // CI/CD configuration
    files.push({
      path: &#39;.github/workflows/python-app.yml&#39;,
      content: this.generateGitHubActions(config),
    });

    return { files };
  }

  private generateAPIRouter(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const endpoints = config.endpoints || [
      &#39;GET /&#39;,
      &#39;POST /&#39;,
      &#39;GET /{id}&#39;,
      &#39;PUT /{id}&#39;,
      &#39;DELETE /{id}&#39;,
    ];
    const routerMethods = endpoints
      .map(endpoint =&gt; {
        const [method, path] = endpoint.split(&#39; &#39;);
        const methodName = method.toLowerCase();
        const safePath = path.replace(&#39;{&#39;, &#39;{&#39;).replace(&#39;}&#39;, &#39;}&#39;); // Ensure proper formatting

        return `
@router.${methodName}(&quot;${safePath}&quot;)
async def ${methodName}_${config.name}(${path.includes(&#39;{id}&#39;) ? &#39;id: int&#39; : &#39;&#39;}):
    &quot;&quot;&quot;${method} ${path} endpoint for ${config.name}&quot;&quot;&quot;
    # TODO: Implement endpoint logic
    return {&quot;message&quot;: &quot;${method} ${config.name} endpoint&quot;, ${path.includes(&#39;{id}&#39;) ? &#39;&quot;id&quot;: id&#39; : &#39;&#39;}}`;
      })
      .join(&#39;\n&#39;);

    return `&quot;&quot;&quot;
${config.name} Router
FastAPI router for ${config.name} endpoints
&quot;&quot;&quot;
from fastapi import APIRouter, HTTPException, Depends
from typing import List, Optional
