	IsActive    bool           \`gorm:&quot;default:true&quot; json:&quot;is_active&quot;\`
	CreatedAt   time.Time      \`json:&quot;created_at&quot;\`
	UpdatedAt   time.Time      \`json:&quot;updated_at&quot;\`
	DeletedAt   gorm.DeletedAt \`gorm:&quot;index&quot; json:&quot;-&quot;\`
}

// Create${structName}Request represents the request payload for creating a ${config.name}
type Create${structName}Request struct {
	Name        string  \`json:&quot;name&quot; validate:&quot;required,min=1,max=100&quot;\`
	Description *string \`json:&quot;description,omitempty&quot; validate:&quot;omitempty,max=500&quot;\`
}

// Update${structName}Request represents the request payload for updating a ${config.name}
type Update${structName}Request struct {
	Name        string  \`json:&quot;name,omitempty&quot; validate:&quot;omitempty,min=1,max=100&quot;\`
	Description *string \`json:&quot;description,omitempty&quot; validate:&quot;omitempty,max=500&quot;\`
	IsActive    *bool   \`json:&quot;is_active,omitempty&quot;\`
}

// ${structName}Response represents the response payload for ${config.name}
type ${structName}Response struct {
	ID          uint      \`json:&quot;id&quot;\`
	Name        string    \`json:&quot;name&quot;\`
	Description *string   \`json:&quot;description,omitempty&quot;\`
	IsActive    bool      \`json:&quot;is_active&quot;\`
	CreatedAt   time.Time \`json:&quot;created_at&quot;\`
	UpdatedAt   time.Time \`json:&quot;updated_at&quot;\`
}

// TableName specifies the table name for GORM
func (${structName}) TableName() string {
	return &quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}s&quot;
}

// BeforeCreate is a GORM hook that runs before creating a record
func (item *${structName}) BeforeCreate(tx *gorm.DB) (err error) {
	// Add any pre-creation logic here
	return nil
}

// BeforeUpdate is a GORM hook that runs before updating a record
func (item *${structName}) BeforeUpdate(tx *gorm.DB) (err error) {
	// Add any pre-update logic here
	return nil
}
`;
  }

  private generateMiddleware(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const middlewareName = this.toPascalCase(config.name);

    return `package middleware

import (
	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap&quot;
)

// ${middlewareName} creates a new ${config.name} middleware
func ${middlewareName}(logger *zap.Logger) gin.HandlerFunc {
	return gin.HandlerFunc(func(c *gin.Context) {
		// Pre-processing logic
		logger.Info(&quot;${middlewareName} middleware - before request&quot;)

		// Process request
		c.Next()

		// Post-processing logic
		logger.Info(&quot;${middlewareName} middleware - after request&quot;)
	})
}
`;
  }

  private generateGoMod(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `module ${config.name.toLowerCase()}

go 1.21

require (
	github.com/gin-gonic/gin v1.9.1
	github.com/joho/godotenv v1.5.1
	go.uber.org/zap v1.26.0
)
`;
  }

  private generateMainApp(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `package main

import (
	&quot;context&quot;
	&quot;log&quot;
	&quot;net/http&quot;
	&quot;os&quot;
	&quot;os/signal&quot;
	&quot;syscall&quot;
	&quot;time&quot;

	&quot;go.uber.org/zap&quot;

	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/config&quot;
	${config.database ? `&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/database&quot;` : &#39;&#39;}
	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/logger&quot;
	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/server&quot;
)

func main() {
	// Initialize logger
	zapLogger, err := logger.NewLogger()
	if err != nil {
		log.Fatalf(&quot;Failed to initialize logger: %v&quot;, err)
	}
	defer zapLogger.Sync()

	// Load configuration
	cfg, err := config.Load()
	if err != nil {
		zapLogger.Fatal(&quot;Failed to load configuration&quot;, zap.Error(err))
	}

	${
    config.database
      ? `// Initialize database
	db, err := database.Connect(cfg.DatabaseURL)
	if err != nil {
		zapLogger.Fatal(&quot;Failed to connect to database&quot;, zap.Error(err))
	}

	// Auto-migrate database schemas
	if err := database.Migrate(db); err != nil {
		zapLogger.Fatal(&quot;Failed to migrate database&quot;, zap.Error(err))
	}`
      : &#39;&#39;
  }

	// Initialize server
	srv := server.New(cfg, ${config.database ? &#39;db, &#39; : &#39;&#39;}zapLogger)

	// Start server
	go func() {
		zapLogger.Info(&quot;Starting server&quot;, zap.String(&quot;address&quot;, cfg.Address))
		if err := srv.ListenAndServe(); err != nil &amp;&amp; err != http.ErrServerClosed {
			zapLogger.Fatal(&quot;Failed to start server&quot;, zap.Error(err))
		}
	}()

	// Wait for interrupt signal to gracefully shutdown the server
	quit := make(chan os.Signal, 1)
	signal.Notify(quit, syscall.SIGINT, syscall.SIGTERM)
	&lt;-quit

	zapLogger.Info(&quot;Shutting down server...&quot;)

	// Give outstanding requests a deadline for completion
	ctx, cancel := context.WithTimeout(context.Background(), 30*time.Second)
	defer cancel()

	// Shutdown server
	if err := srv.Shutdown(ctx); err != nil {
		zapLogger.Fatal(&quot;Server forced to shutdown&quot;, zap.Error(err))
	}

	zapLogger.Info(&quot;Server exited&quot;)
}
`;
  }

  private generateConfig(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `package config

import (
	&quot;os&quot;
	&quot;strconv&quot;

	&quot;github.com/joho/godotenv&quot;
)

// Config holds all configuration for the application
type Config struct {
	Address     string
	Environment string
	${config.database ? &#39;DatabaseURL string&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
	${config.auth ? &#39;JWTSecret   string&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
	LogLevel    string
}

// Load reads configuration from environment variables
func Load() (*Config, error) {
	// Load .env file if it exists
	_ = godotenv.Load()

	cfg := &amp;Config{
		Address:     getEnv(&quot;ADDRESS&quot;, &quot;:8080&quot;),
		Environment: getEnv(&quot;ENVIRONMENT&quot;, &quot;development&quot;),
		${config.database ? `DatabaseURL: getEnv(&quot;DATABASE_URL&quot;, &quot;postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/${config.name.toLowerCase()}?sslmode=disable&quot;),` : &#39;&#39;}
		${config.auth ? &#39;JWTSecret:   getEnv(&quot;JWT_SECRET&quot;, &quot;your-secret-key&quot;),&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
		LogLevel:    getEnv(&quot;LOG_LEVEL&quot;, &quot;info&quot;),
	}

	return cfg, nil
}

// getEnv gets an environment variable with a fallback value
func getEnv(key, fallback string) string {
	if value, exists := os.LookupEnv(key); exists {
		return value
	}
	return fallback
}

// getEnvAsInt gets an environment variable as integer with a fallback value
func getEnvAsInt(key string, fallback int) int {
	if value, exists := os.LookupEnv(key); exists {
		if intValue, err := strconv.Atoi(value); err == nil {
			return intValue
		}
	}
	return fallback
}

// getEnvAsBool gets an environment variable as boolean with a fallback value
func getEnvAsBool(key string, fallback bool) bool {
	if value, exists := os.LookupEnv(key); exists {
		if boolValue, err := strconv.ParseBool(value); err == nil {
			return boolValue
		}
	}
	return fallback
}
`;
  }

  private generateDatabase(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `package database

import (
	&quot;fmt&quot;
	&quot;time&quot;

	&quot;gorm.io/driver/postgres&quot;
	&quot;gorm.io/gorm&quot;
	&quot;gorm.io/gorm/logger&quot;

	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/models&quot;
)

// Connect establishes a database connection
func Connect(databaseURL string) (*gorm.DB, error) {
	config := &amp;gorm.Config{
		Logger: logger.Default.LogMode(logger.Info),
		NowFunc: func() time.Time {
			return time.Now().UTC()
		},
	}

	db, err := gorm.Open(postgres.Open(databaseURL), config)
	if err != nil {
		return nil, fmt.Errorf(&quot;failed to connect to database: %w&quot;, err)
	}

	// Configure connection pool
	sqlDB, err := db.DB()
	if err != nil {
		return nil, fmt.Errorf(&quot;failed to get database instance: %w&quot;, err)
	}

	sqlDB.SetMaxIdleConns(10)
	sqlDB.SetMaxOpenConns(100)
	sqlDB.SetConnMaxLifetime(time.Hour)

	return db, nil
}

// Migrate runs database migrations
func Migrate(db *gorm.DB) error {
	return db.AutoMigrate(
		// Add your models here
		// &amp;models.User{},
		// &amp;models.Item{},
	)
}
`;
  }

  private generateLogger(): string {
    return `package logger

import (
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap&quot;
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap/zapcore&quot;
)

// NewLogger creates a new zap logger
func NewLogger() (*zap.Logger, error) {
	config := zap.NewProductionConfig()
	config.Level = zap.NewAtomicLevelAt(zap.InfoLevel)
	config.Encoding = &quot;json&quot;
	config.EncoderConfig.TimeKey = &quot;timestamp&quot;
	config.EncoderConfig.EncodeTime = zapcore.ISO8601TimeEncoder
	config.EncoderConfig.StacktraceKey = &quot;&quot; // Disable stacktrace in logs

	logger, err := config.Build()
	if err != nil {
		return nil, err
	}

	return logger, nil
}

// NewDevelopmentLogger creates a development logger with console output
func NewDevelopmentLogger() (*zap.Logger, error) {
	config := zap.NewDevelopmentConfig()
	config.EncoderConfig.EncodeLevel = zapcore.CapitalColorLevelEncoder

	logger, err := config.Build()
	if err != nil {
		return nil, err
	}

	return logger, nil
}
`;
  }

  private generateServer(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `package server

import (
	&quot;net/http&quot;

	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap&quot;
	${config.database ? `&quot;gorm.io/gorm&quot;` : &#39;&#39;}

	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/config&quot;
	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/handlers&quot;
	&quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}/internal/middleware&quot;
)

// Server represents the HTTP server
type Server struct {
	config *config.Config
	${config.database ? &#39;db     *gorm.DB&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
	logger *zap.Logger
	router *gin.Engine
}

// New creates a new server instance
func New(cfg *config.Config, ${config.database ? &#39;db *gorm.DB, &#39; : &#39;&#39;}logger *zap.Logger) *http.Server {
	// Set gin mode
	if cfg.Environment == &quot;production&quot; {
		gin.SetMode(gin.ReleaseMode)
	}

	// Create router
	router := gin.New()

	// Add middleware
	router.Use(middleware.LoggerMiddleware(logger))
	router.Use(middleware.CORSMiddleware())
	router.Use(gin.Recovery())

	// Health check
	router.GET(&quot;/health&quot;, handlers.HealthCheck)

	// API v1 routes
	v1 := router.Group(&quot;/api/v1&quot;)
	{
		// Add your routes here
		// Example: routes.SetupUserRoutes(v1, userService, logger)
		v1.GET(&quot;/ping&quot;, func(c *gin.Context) {
			c.JSON(http.StatusOK, gin.H{&quot;message&quot;: &quot;pong&quot;})
		})
	}

	return &amp;http.Server{
		Addr:    cfg.Address,
		Handler: router,
	}
}
`;
  }

  private generateCORSMiddleware(): string {
    return `package middleware

import (
	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
)

// CORSMiddleware handles CORS headers
func CORSMiddleware() gin.HandlerFunc {
	return func(c *gin.Context) {
		c.Writer.Header().Set(&quot;Access-Control-Allow-Origin&quot;, &quot;*&quot;)
		c.Writer.Header().Set(&quot;Access-Control-Allow-Credentials&quot;, &quot;true&quot;)
		c.Writer.Header().Set(&quot;Access-Control-Allow-Headers&quot;, &quot;Content-Type, Content-Length, Accept-Encoding, X-CSRF-Token, Authorization, accept, origin, Cache-Control, X-Requested-With&quot;)
		c.Writer.Header().Set(&quot;Access-Control-Allow-Methods&quot;, &quot;POST, OPTIONS, GET, PUT, DELETE&quot;)

		if c.Request.Method == &quot;OPTIONS&quot; {
			c.AbortWithStatus(204)
			return
		}

		c.Next()
	}
}
`;
  }

  private generateLoggerMiddleware(): string {
    return `package middleware

import (
	&quot;time&quot;

	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap&quot;
)

// LoggerMiddleware creates a gin middleware for logging requests
func LoggerMiddleware(logger *zap.Logger) gin.HandlerFunc {
	return gin.LoggerWithFormatter(func(param gin.LogFormatterParams) string {
		logger.Info(&quot;Request&quot;,
			zap.String(&quot;client_ip&quot;, param.ClientIP),
			zap.String(&quot;method&quot;, param.Method),
			zap.String(&quot;path&quot;, param.Path),
			zap.Int(&quot;status&quot;, param.StatusCode),
			zap.Duration(&quot;latency&quot;, param.Latency),
			zap.String(&quot;user_agent&quot;, param.Request.UserAgent()),
			zap.String(&quot;error&quot;, param.ErrorMessage),
		)
		return &quot;&quot;
	})
}
`;
  }

  private generateHealthHandler(): string {
    return `package handlers

import (
	&quot;net/http&quot;
	&quot;time&quot;

	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
)

// HealthCheck handles health check requests
func HealthCheck(c *gin.Context) {
	c.JSON(http.StatusOK, gin.H{
		&quot;status&quot;:    &quot;healthy&quot;,
		&quot;timestamp&quot;: time.Now().UTC(),
		&quot;service&quot;:   &quot;api&quot;,
		&quot;version&quot;:   &quot;1.0.0&quot;,
	})
}
`;
  }

  private generateEnvExample(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `# Application Configuration
ADDRESS=:8080
ENVIRONMENT=development
LOG_LEVEL=info

${
  config.database
    ? `# Database Configuration
DATABASE_URL=postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/${config.name.toLowerCase()}?sslmode=disable`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

${
  config.auth
    ? `# Authentication
JWT_SECRET=your-super-secret-jwt-key-change-in-production`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

# Additional configuration as needed
`;
  }

  private generateTestUtils(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `package testutils

import (
	&quot;bytes&quot;
	&quot;encoding/json&quot;
	&quot;net/http&quot;
	&quot;net/http/httptest&quot;
	&quot;testing&quot;

	&quot;github.com/gin-gonic/gin&quot;
	&quot;github.com/stretchr/testify/assert&quot;
	&quot;go.uber.org/zap/zaptest&quot;
	${
    config.database
      ? `&quot;gorm.io/driver/sqlite&quot;
	&quot;gorm.io/gorm&quot;`
      : &#39;&#39;
  }
)

// SetupTestRouter creates a test router
func SetupTestRouter() *gin.Engine {
	gin.SetMode(gin.TestMode)
	return gin.New()
}

// SetupTestLogger creates a test logger
func SetupTestLogger(t *testing.T) *zap.Logger {
	return zaptest.NewLogger(t)
}

${
  config.database
    ? `// SetupTestDB creates an in-memory SQLite database for testing
func SetupTestDB(t *testing.T) *gorm.DB {
	db, err := gorm.Open(sqlite.Open(&quot;:memory:&quot;), &amp;gorm.Config{})
	assert.NoError(t, err)

	// Auto-migrate test models here
	// err = db.AutoMigrate(&amp;models.User{}, &amp;models.Item{})
	// assert.NoError(t, err)

	return db
}`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

// MakeRequest makes an HTTP request for testing
func MakeRequest(router *gin.Engine, method, url string, body interface{}) *httptest.ResponseRecorder {
	var reqBody []byte
	if body != nil {
		reqBody, _ = json.Marshal(body)
	}

	req, _ := http.NewRequest(method, url, bytes.NewBuffer(reqBody))
	req.Header.Set(&quot;Content-Type&quot;, &quot;application/json&quot;)

	w := httptest.NewRecorder()
	router.ServeHTTP(w, req)

	return w
}

// AssertJSONResponse asserts that the response body matches expected JSON
func AssertJSONResponse(t *testing.T, w *httptest.ResponseRecorder, expected interface{}) {
	var actual interface{}
	err := json.Unmarshal(w.Body.Bytes(), &amp;actual)
	assert.NoError(t, err)
	assert.Equal(t, expected, actual)
}
`;
  }

  private generateMakefile(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `.PHONY: build run test clean dev help

# Variables
APP_NAME=${config.name.toLowerCase()}
BINARY_DIR=bin
BINARY_NAME=\${BINARY_DIR}/\${APP_NAME}

# Default target
help: ## Show this help message
	@echo &#39;Available targets:&#39;
	@grep -E &#39;^[a-zA-Z_-]+:.*?## .*$$&#39; \$(MAKEFILE_LIST) | awk &#39;BEGIN {FS = &quot;:.*?## &quot;}; {printf &quot;  \\033[36m%-20s\\033[0m %s\\n&quot;, $$1, $$2}&#39;

build: ## Build the application
	@echo &quot;Building \${APP_NAME}...&quot;
	@mkdir -p \${BINARY_DIR}
	@go build -o \${BINARY_NAME} cmd/main.go
	@echo &quot;Build complete: \${BINARY_NAME}&quot;

run: build ## Build and run the application
	@echo &quot;Running \${APP_NAME}...&quot;
	@./\${BINARY_NAME}

dev: ## Run the application in development mode
	@echo &quot;Running \${APP_NAME} in development mode...&quot;
	@go run cmd/main.go

test: ## Run tests
	@echo &quot;Running tests...&quot;
	@go test -v ./...

test-coverage: ## Run tests with coverage
	@echo &quot;Running tests with coverage...&quot;
	@go test -coverprofile=coverage.out ./...
	@go tool cover -html=coverage.out -o coverage.html
	@echo &quot;Coverage report generated: coverage.html&quot;

fmt: ## Format Go code
	@echo &quot;Formatting code...&quot;
	@go fmt ./...

vet: ## Run go vet
	@echo &quot;Running go vet...&quot;
	@go vet ./...

lint: ## Run golangci-lint
	@echo &quot;Running linter...&quot;
	@golangci-lint run

tidy: ## Tidy go modules
	@echo &quot;Tidying go modules...&quot;
	@go mod tidy

clean: ## Clean build artifacts
	@echo &quot;Cleaning...&quot;
	@rm -rf \${BINARY_DIR}
	@rm -f coverage.out coverage.html

deps: ## Download dependencies
	@echo &quot;Downloading dependencies...&quot;
	@go mod download

${
  config.docker
    ? `docker-build: ## Build Docker image
	@echo &quot;Building Docker image...&quot;
	@docker build -t \${APP_NAME}:latest .

docker-run: docker-build ## Build and run Docker container
	@echo &quot;Running Docker container...&quot;
	@docker run --rm -p 8080:8080 \${APP_NAME}:latest`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

# Development database commands (if using Docker)
${
  config.database
    ? `db-up: ## Start database container
	@echo &quot;Starting database...&quot;
	@docker-compose up -d database

db-down: ## Stop database container
	@echo &quot;Stopping database...&quot;
	@docker-compose down database

db-migrate: ## Run database migrations
	@echo &quot;Running migrations...&quot;
	@go run cmd/migrate.go`
    : &#39;&#39;
}
`;
  }

  private generateDockerfile(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `# Multi-stage build for Go application
FROM golang:1.21-alpine AS builder

# Install git and ca-certificates (needed for private repos and HTTPS)
RUN apk add --no-cache git ca-certificates

# Set working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy go mod files
COPY go.mod go.sum ./

# Download dependencies
RUN go mod download

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build the application
RUN CGO_ENABLED=0 GOOS=linux go build -a -installsuffix cgo -o main cmd/main.go

# Final stage
FROM alpine:latest

# Install ca-certificates for HTTPS requests
RUN apk --no-cache add ca-certificates

# Create non-root user
RUN addgroup -g 1001 -S appgroup &amp;&amp; \\
    adduser -u 1001 -S appuser -G appgroup

WORKDIR /root/

# Copy the binary from builder stage
COPY --from=builder /app/main .

# Copy any additional files (config, migrations, etc.)
# COPY --from=builder /app/migrations ./migrations

# Change ownership to non-root user
RUN chown -R appuser:appgroup /root
USER appuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8080

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \\
    CMD wget --no-verbose --tries=1 --spider http://localhost:8080/health || exit 1

# Run the application
CMD [&quot;./main&quot;]
`;
  }

  private generateDockerCompose(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    const dbService =
      config.database === &#39;postgres&#39;
        ? `
  database:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${config.name.toLowerCase()}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: password
      POSTGRES_DB: ${config.name.toLowerCase()}
    ports:
      - &quot;5432:5432&quot;
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    healthcheck:
      test: [&quot;CMD-SHELL&quot;, &quot;pg_isready -U ${config.name.toLowerCase()}&quot;]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5`
        : &#39;&#39;;

    return `version: &#39;3.8&#39;

services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - &quot;8080:8080&quot;
    environment:
      - ENVIRONMENT=development
      ${config.database ? `- DATABASE_URL=postgres://${config.name.toLowerCase()}:password@database:5432/${config.name.toLowerCase()}?sslmode=disable` : &#39;&#39;}
    ${
      config.database
        ? `depends_on:
      database:
        condition: service_healthy`
        : &#39;&#39;
    }
    restart: unless-stopped
${dbService}

${
  config.database === &#39;postgres&#39;
    ? `volumes:
  postgres_data:`
    : &#39;&#39;
}
`;
  }

  private generateProductionDockerfile(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `# Production multi-stage build
FROM golang:1.21-alpine AS builder

# Install build dependencies
RUN apk add --no-cache git ca-certificates gcc musl-dev

WORKDIR /app

# Copy go mod files
COPY go.mod go.sum ./
RUN go mod download

# Copy source code
COPY . .

# Build with optimizations
RUN CGO_ENABLED=0 GOOS=linux go build \\
    -a -installsuffix cgo \\
    -ldflags=&#39;-w -s -extldflags &quot;-static&quot;&#39; \\
    -o main cmd/main.go

# Final minimal stage
FROM scratch

# Copy ca-certificates from builder
COPY --from=builder /etc/ssl/certs/ca-certificates.crt /etc/ssl/certs/

# Copy the binary
COPY --from=builder /app/main /main

# Expose port
EXPOSE 8080

# Run the application
ENTRYPOINT [&quot;/main&quot;]
`;
  }

  private generateGitHubActions(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `name: Go Application CI/CD

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test
        options: &gt;-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Set up Go
      uses: actions/setup-go@v4
      with:
        go-version: &#39;1.21&#39;
        
    - name: Cache Go modules
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: ~/go/pkg/mod
        key: \${{ runner.os }}-go-\${{ hashFiles(&#39;**/go.sum&#39;) }}
        restore-keys: |
          \${{ runner.os }}-go-
    
    - name: Download dependencies
      run: go mod download
    
    - name: Verify dependencies
      run: go mod verify
    
    - name: Format check
      run: |
        if [ &quot;$(gofmt -s -l . | wc -l)&quot; -gt 0 ]; then
          echo &quot;Code is not formatted. Please run &#39;gofmt -s -w .&#39;&quot;
          gofmt -s -l .
          exit 1
        fi
    
    - name: Vet
      run: go vet ./...
    
    - name: Lint
      uses: golangci/golangci-lint-action@v3
      with:
        version: latest
    
    - name: Test
      env:
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test?sslmode=disable
      run: go test -race -coverprofile=coverage.out -covermode=atomic ./...
    
    - name: Upload coverage to Codecov
      uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3
      with:
        file: ./coverage.out
        flags: unittests
        name: codecov-umbrella

  ${
    config.target === &#39;production&#39;
      ? `build:
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == &#39;refs/heads/main&#39;
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Set up Go
      uses: actions/setup-go@v4
      with:
        go-version: &#39;1.21&#39;
    
    - name: Build binary
      run: |
        CGO_ENABLED=0 GOOS=linux go build -a -installsuffix cgo \\
          -ldflags=&#39;-w -s -extldflags &quot;-static&quot;&#39; \\
          -o bin/app cmd/main.go
    
    - name: Build Docker image
      run: |
        docker build -f Dockerfile.prod -t your-registry/app:$` +
        &#39;{{ github.sha }}&#39; +
        ` .
        docker tag your-registry/app:$` +
        &#39;{{ github.sha }}&#39; +
        ` your-registry/app:latest
    
    - name: Push Docker image
      run: |
        echo &quot;$` +
        &#39;{{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}&#39; +
        `&quot; | docker login -u &quot;$` +
        &#39;{{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}&#39; +
        `&quot; --password-stdin
        docker push your-registry/app:$` +
        `{{ github.sha }}
        docker push your-registry/app:latest`
      : &#39;&#39;
  }
`;
  }

  private generateGoReleaser(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `# GoReleaser configuration
project_name: ${config.target}

before:
  hooks:
    - go mod tidy
    - go generate ./...

builds:
  - env:
      - CGO_ENABLED=0
    goos:
      - linux
      - windows
      - darwin
    goarch:
      - amd64
      - arm64
    main: ./cmd/main.go
    binary: app
    ldflags:
      - -s -w -X main.version={{.Version}} -X main.commit={{.Commit}} -X main.date={{.Date}}

archives:
  - format: tar.gz
    name_template: &gt;-
      {{ .ProjectName }}_
      {{- title .Os }}_
      {{- if eq .Arch &quot;amd64&quot; }}x86_64
      {{- else if eq .Arch &quot;386&quot; }}i386
      {{- else }}{{ .Arch }}{{ end }}
    format_overrides:
      - goos: windows
        format: zip

checksum:
  name_template: &#39;checksums.txt&#39;

snapshot:
  name_template: &quot;{{ incpatch .Version }}-next&quot;

changelog:
  sort: asc
  filters:
    exclude:
      - &#39;^docs:&#39;
      - &#39;^test:&#39;

dockers:
  - image_templates:
      - &quot;your-registry/{{.ProjectName}}:{{ .Tag }}&quot;
      - &quot;your-registry/{{.ProjectName}}:latest&quot;
    dockerfile: Dockerfile.prod
    build_flag_templates:
      - &quot;--platform=linux/amd64&quot;
`;
  }

  private toPascalCase(str: string): string {
    return str.replace(/(?:^|[-_])(\w)/g, (_, c) =&gt; c.toUpperCase());
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/sandbox.ts
import { performance } from &quot;node:perf_hooks&quot;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &quot;../types.js&quot;;
import { ConstraintViolationError, globalConstraintEnforcer } from &quot;./core.js&quot;;

/**
 * Operation types that must use server endpoints
 */
export type SandboxedOperation =
  | &quot;validate&quot;
  | &quot;analyze&quot;
  | &quot;export&quot;
  | &quot;transform&quot;
  | &quot;check&quot;
  | &quot;import&quot;
  | &quot;diff&quot;
  | &quot;migrate&quot;;

/**
 * Server endpoint configuration for sandboxed operations
 */
export interface ServerEndpoint {
  path: string;
  method: &quot;GET&quot; | &quot;POST&quot; | &quot;PUT&quot; | &quot;DELETE&quot;;
  requiresPayload: boolean;
  maxResponseTime: number;
}

/**
 * Mapping of operations to their required server endpoints
 */
export const REQUIRED_ENDPOINTS: Record&lt;SandboxedOperation, ServerEndpoint&gt; = {
  validate: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/validate&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 500, // Must be within 750ms total constraint
  },
  analyze: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/analyze&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 600,
  },
  export: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/export&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 700,
  },
  transform: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/transform&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 600,
  },
  check: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/check&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 500,
  },
  import: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/import&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 400,
  },
  diff: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/diff&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 300,
  },
  migrate: {
    path: &quot;/api/v1/migrate&quot;,
    method: &quot;POST&quot;,
    requiresPayload: true,
    maxResponseTime: 700,
  },
};

/**
 * Execution context tracking for sandbox validation
 */
interface ExecutionContext {
  operation: SandboxedOperation;
  startTime: number;
  endpointUsed?: string;
  isDirectExecution: boolean;
  callStack: string[];
}

/**
 * Sandbox compliance validator
 * Ensures all operations go through server endpoints, not direct tool execution
 */
export class SandboxValidator {
  private readonly executionStack: ExecutionContext[] = [];
  private readonly config: CLIConfig;
  private readonly allowedDirectOperations = new Set&lt;string&gt;([
    // Only these operations can execute directly (non-sandboxed)
    &quot;init&quot;,
    &quot;config&quot;,
    &quot;help&quot;,
    &quot;version&quot;,
    &quot;template&quot;,
  ]);

  constructor(config: CLIConfig) {
    this.config = config;
  }

  /**
   * Start tracking a potentially sandboxed operation
   */
  startOperation(operation: SandboxedOperation, callStack: string[] = []): string {
    const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(`sandbox:${operation}`, {
      operation,
      callStack,
    });

    const context: ExecutionContext = {
      operation,
      startTime: performance.now(),
      isDirectExecution: false,
      callStack,
    };

    this.executionStack.push(context);

    return operationId;
  }

  /**
   * Mark that an operation is using server endpoint (compliant)
   */
  markServerEndpointUsage(
    operation: SandboxedOperation,
    endpoint: string,
    operationId: string,
  ): void {
    const context = this.executionStack.find((ctx) =&gt; ctx.operation === operation);
    if (!context) {
      throw new Error(`No active context found for operation: ${operation}`);
    }

    context.endpointUsed = endpoint;
    context.isDirectExecution = false;

    // Validate that the correct endpoint is being used
    const requiredEndpoint = REQUIRED_ENDPOINTS[operation];
    const expectedPath = requiredEndpoint.path;

    if (!endpoint.includes(expectedPath)) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
        `endpoint: ${endpoint}`,
        `endpoint containing: ${expectedPath}`,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          providedEndpoint: endpoint,
          expectedEndpoint: expectedPath,
        },
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;constraint:violation&quot;, {
        constraint: &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
        violation,
        operation,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Validate endpoint compliance with global constraint enforcer
    globalConstraintEnforcer.validateSandboxCompliance(
      operation,
      false, // Not direct execution
      operationId,
    );
  }

  /**
   * Mark that an operation is attempting direct execution (violation)
   */
  markDirectExecution(operation: SandboxedOperation, _toolName: string, operationId: string): void {
    const context = this.executionStack.find((ctx) =&gt; ctx.operation === operation);
    if (!context) {
      throw new Error(`No active context found for operation: ${operation}`);
    }

    context.isDirectExecution = true;

    // This will throw a ConstraintViolationError
    globalConstraintEnforcer.validateSandboxCompliance(
      operation,
      true, // Direct execution detected
      operationId,
    );
  }

  /**
   * End operation tracking and validate compliance
   */
  endOperation(operation: SandboxedOperation, operationId: string): void {
    const contextIndex = this.executionStack.findIndex((ctx) =&gt; ctx.operation === operation);
    if (contextIndex === -1) {
      throw new Error(`No active context found for operation: ${operation}`);
    }

    const context = this.executionStack[contextIndex];

    // Validate that server endpoint was used
    if (!context.endpointUsed &amp;&amp; !context.isDirectExecution) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
        &quot;no endpoint usage detected&quot;,
        &quot;server endpoint usage&quot;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          message: &quot;Operation completed without using required server endpoint&quot;,
        },
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;constraint:violation&quot;, {
        constraint: &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
        violation,
        operation,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Remove context from stack
    this.executionStack.splice(contextIndex, 1);

    // End global constraint tracking
    globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
  }

  /**
   * Validate that a function/tool call is allowed to execute directly
   */
  validateDirectExecution(functionName: string, operation?: string): void {
    if (operation &amp;&amp; this.isOperationSandboxed(operation as SandboxedOperation)) {
      throw new ConstraintViolationError(
        &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
        `direct execution of ${functionName}`,
        &quot;server endpoint usage&quot;,
        {
          operation,
          functionName,
          message: `Function ${functionName} cannot be called directly during sandboxed operation ${operation}`,
        },
      );
    }

    if (!this.allowedDirectOperations.has(functionName)) {
      const currentOperations = this.executionStack.map((ctx) =&gt; ctx.operation);
      if (currentOperations.some((op) =&gt; this.isOperationSandboxed(op))) {
        throw new ConstraintViolationError(
          &quot;sandboxCompliance&quot;,
          `direct execution of ${functionName}`,
          &quot;server endpoint usage&quot;,
          {
            functionName,
            activeOperations: currentOperations,
            message: `Function ${functionName} cannot be called directly during active sandboxed operations`,
          },
        );
      }
    }
  }

  /**
   * Check if an operation requires sandboxing
   */
  isOperationSandboxed(operation: string): operation is SandboxedOperation {
    return Object.keys(REQUIRED_ENDPOINTS).includes(operation);
  }

  /**
   * Get required endpoint information for an operation
   */
  getRequiredEndpoint(operation: SandboxedOperation): ServerEndpoint {
    return REQUIRED_ENDPOINTS[operation];
  }

  /**
   * Construct full endpoint URL for an operation
   */
  getEndpointUrl(operation: SandboxedOperation): string {
    const endpoint = REQUIRED_ENDPOINTS[operation];
    const baseUrl = this.config.apiUrl.replace(/\/+$/, &quot;&quot;); // Remove trailing slashes
    return `${baseUrl}${endpoint.path}`;
  }

  /**
   * Get current sandbox status
   */
  getSandboxStatus(): {
    activeOperations: ExecutionContext[];
    violations: number;
    complianceRate: number;
  } {
    const violations = this.executionStack.filter((ctx) =&gt; ctx.isDirectExecution).length;
    const total = this.executionStack.length;
    const complianceRate = total &gt; 0 ? ((total - violations) / total) * 100 : 100;

    return {
      activeOperations: [...this.executionStack],
      violations,
      complianceRate,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Decorator to automatically enforce sandbox compliance
 */
export function sandboxed(operation: SandboxedOperation) {
  return &lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;&gt;(
    _target: any,
    _propertyName: string,
    descriptor: TypedPropertyDescriptor&lt;T&gt;,
  ) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value!;

    descriptor.value = async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) {
      // Get sandbox validator from context or create new one
      const config = this.config || globalSandboxConfig;
      const validator = new SandboxValidator(config);

      const callStack = new Error().stack?.split(&quot;\n&quot;).slice(2, 6) || [];
      const operationId = validator.startOperation(operation, callStack);

      try {
        const result = await method.apply(this, args);
        validator.endOperation(operation, operationId);
        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        validator.endOperation(operation, operationId);
        throw error;
      }
    } as T;

    return descriptor;
  };
}

/**
 * Global sandbox configuration - should be set by CLI initialization
 */
let globalSandboxConfig: CLIConfig;

/**
 * Initialize global sandbox configuration
 */
export function initializeSandboxConfig(config: CLIConfig): void {
  globalSandboxConfig = config;
}

/**
 * Create a sandbox validator instance
 */
export function createSandboxValidator(config: CLIConfig): SandboxValidator {
  return new SandboxValidator(config);
}

/**
 * Utility to wrap API client calls with automatic endpoint tracking
 */
export function withEndpointTracking&lt;T&gt;(
  validator: SandboxValidator,
  operation: SandboxedOperation,
  operationId: string,
  apiCall: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;,
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  return new Promise(async (resolve, reject) =&gt; {
    try {
      // Track that we&#39;re using the server endpoint
      const endpoint = validator.getEndpointUrl(operation);
      validator.markServerEndpointUsage(operation, endpoint, operationId);

      // Execute the API call
      const result = await apiCall();
      resolve(result);
    } catch (error) {
      reject(error);
    }
  });
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/github-template-config.ts
/**
 * Configuration-based GitHub Template System
 *
 * This module provides a flexible, configuration-driven approach to GitHub templates
 * that supports inheritance, customization, and dynamic generation.
 */

import type {
  GitHubFieldValidation,
  GitHubFileTemplateRef,
  GitHubLabel,
  GitHubTemplateConfig,
  GitHubTemplateOptions,
  GitHubTemplateSections,
  GitHubTemplateSet,
  GitHubTemplateSetSource,
  GitHubTemplatesConfig,
} from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import type { Epic, Task } from &#39;./sharded-storage.js&#39;;

export interface GeneratedTemplate {
  title: string;
  body: string;
  labels: string[];
  assignees?: string[];
  milestone?: number;
  projects?: number[];
}

export interface TemplateFiles {
  [filePath: string]: string;
}

/**
 * Default template configuration for backward compatibility
 */
export const DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG: GitHubTemplatesConfig = {
  base: {
    name: &#39;arbiter-default&#39;,
    description: &#39;Default Arbiter template set&#39;,
    sections: {
      description: &#39;## 📋 Description\n\n{{description}}\n\n&#39;,
      details: [
        { name: &#39;priority&#39;, label: &#39;Priority&#39;, required: true, type: &#39;select&#39; },
        { name: &#39;status&#39;, label: &#39;Status&#39;, required: true, type: &#39;select&#39; },
        { name: &#39;assignee&#39;, label: &#39;Assignee&#39;, type: &#39;text&#39; },
        { name: &#39;estimatedHours&#39;, label: &#39;Estimated Hours&#39;, type: &#39;number&#39; },
      ],
      acceptanceCriteria:
        &#39;## ✅ Acceptance Criteria\n\n{{#each acceptanceCriteria}}\n- [ ] {{this}}\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
      dependencies: &#39;## 🔗 Dependencies\n\n{{#each dependencies}}\n- [ ] {{this}}\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
    },
    labels: [&#39;arbiter-managed&#39;],
    validation: {
      fields: [
        {
          field: &#39;name&#39;,
          required: true,
          minLength: 5,
          maxLength: 80,
          errorMessage: &#39;Name must be 5-80 characters&#39;,
        },
        {
          field: &#39;description&#39;,
          required: true,
          minLength: 10,
          errorMessage: &#39;Description must be at least 10 characters&#39;,
        },
      ],
    },
  },
  epic: {
    inherits: &#39;arbiter-default&#39;,
    name: &#39;Epic&#39;,
    title: &#39;[EPIC] {{priority}}: {{name}}&#39;,
    labels: [&#39;epic&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;],
    sections: {
      description:
        &#39;## 📋 Epic Description\n\n**Summary:** {{description}}\n\n**Success Criteria:** {{successCriteria}}\n\n&#39;,
      additional: {
        scope:
          &#39;## 🎯 Scope\n\n**In Scope:**\n{{#each inScope}}\n- {{this}}\n{{/each}}\n\n**Out of Scope:**\n{{#each outOfScope}}\n- {{this}}\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
        tasks:
          &#39;## ✅ Tasks Overview\n\n**Total Tasks:** {{tasks.length}}\n\n{{#each tasks}}\n- [ ] {{this.name}} ({{this.status}})\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
      },
    },
    validation: {
      fields: [
        {
          field: &#39;priority&#39;,
          required: true,
          enum: [&#39;critical&#39;, &#39;high&#39;, &#39;medium&#39;, &#39;low&#39;],
          errorMessage: &#39;Priority must be one of: critical, high, medium, low&#39;,
        },
        {
          field: &#39;owner&#39;,
          required: true,
          errorMessage: &#39;Epic must have an assigned owner&#39;,
        },
      ],
    },
  },
  task: {
    inherits: &#39;arbiter-default&#39;,
    name: &#39;Task&#39;,
    title: &#39;[{{type}}] {{priority}}: {{name}}&#39;,
    labels: [&#39;type:{{type}}&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;, &#39;epic:{{epicId}}&#39;],
    sections: {
      description:
        &#39;## 📋 Task Description\n\n**Summary:** {{description}}\n\n**Context:** {{context}}\n\n&#39;,
      additional: {
        implementation: &#39;## 📝 Implementation Notes\n\n{{implementationNotes}}\n\n&#39;,
        testing:
          &#39;## 🧪 Testing Requirements\n\n- [ ] Unit tests added/updated\n- [ ] Integration tests added/updated\n- [ ] Manual testing completed\n- [ ] Documentation updated\n\n&#39;,
      },
    },
    validation: {
      fields: [
        {
          field: &#39;type&#39;,
          required: true,
          enum: [&#39;feature&#39;, &#39;bug&#39;, &#39;refactor&#39;, &#39;test&#39;, &#39;docs&#39;, &#39;devops&#39;, &#39;research&#39;],
          errorMessage:
            &#39;Task type must be one of: feature, bug, refactor, test, docs, devops, research&#39;,
        },
        {
          field: &#39;acceptanceCriteria&#39;,
          required: true,
          errorMessage: &#39;Task must have at least one acceptance criterion&#39;,
        },
      ],
    },
  },
  bugReport: {
    name: &#39;Bug Report&#39;,
    title: &#39;[BUG] {{priority}}: {{title}}&#39;,
    labels: [&#39;type:bug&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
    sections: {
      description:
        &#39;## 🐛 Bug Description\n\n**Summary:** {{summary}}\n\n**Expected Behavior:** {{expectedBehavior}}\n\n**Actual Behavior:** {{actualBehavior}}\n\n&#39;,
      additional: {
        reproduction:
          &#39;## 🔄 Steps to Reproduce\n\n{{#each steps}}\n{{@index}. {{this}}\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
        environment:
          &#39;## 🌍 Environment\n\n- **OS:** {{os}}\n- **Browser:** {{browser}}\n- **Version:** {{version}}\n\n&#39;,
        impact:
          &#39;## 📊 Impact Assessment\n\n- **Priority:** {{priority}}\n- **Affected Users:** {{affectedUsers}}\n- **Workaround Available:** {{workaround}}\n\n&#39;,
      },
    },
  },
  featureRequest: {
    name: &#39;Feature Request&#39;,
    title: &#39;[FEATURE] {{title}}&#39;,
    labels: [&#39;type:feature&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
    sections: {
      description:
        &#39;## 💡 Feature Description\n\n**Summary:** {{summary}}\n\n**Problem Statement:** {{problemStatement}}\n\n**Proposed Solution:** {{proposedSolution}}\n\n&#39;,
      additional: {
        useCases:
          &#39;## 🎯 Use Cases\n\n{{#each useCases}}\n{{@index}}. **As a {{userType}}, I want {{goal}} so that {{benefit}}**\n{{/each}}\n\n&#39;,
        alternatives: &#39;## 🔄 Alternatives Considered\n\n{{alternatives}}\n\n&#39;,
        impact:
          &#39;## 📊 Impact Assessment\n\n- **Priority:** {{priority}}\n- **Effort Estimate:** {{effortEstimate}}\n- **Potential Users:** {{potentialUsers}}\n\n&#39;,
      },
    },
  },
  repositoryConfig: {
    issueConfig: {
      blankIssuesEnabled: false,
      contactLinks: [
        {
          name: &#39;📚 Documentation&#39;,
          url: &#39;https://github.com/{{owner}}/{{repo}}/wiki&#39;,
          about: &#39;Check our documentation for common questions&#39;,
        },
        {
          name: &#39;💬 Discussions&#39;,
          url: &#39;https://github.com/{{owner}}/{{repo}}/discussions&#39;,
          about: &#39;Ask questions and discuss with the community&#39;,
        },
      ],
    },
    labels: [
      // Type labels
      { name: &#39;type:feature&#39;, color: &#39;0e8a16&#39;, description: &#39;New feature or enhancement&#39; },
      { name: &#39;type:bug&#39;, color: &#39;d73a49&#39;, description: &#39;Something is not working&#39; },
      {
        name: &#39;type:refactor&#39;,
        color: &#39;fbca04&#39;,
        description: &#39;Code improvement without new features&#39;,
      },
      { name: &#39;type:test&#39;, color: &#39;c5def5&#39;, description: &#39;Testing related changes&#39; },
      { name: &#39;type:docs&#39;, color: &#39;0052cc&#39;, description: &#39;Documentation improvements&#39; },
      { name: &#39;type:devops&#39;, color: &#39;5319e7&#39;, description: &#39;DevOps and infrastructure changes&#39; },
      { name: &#39;type:research&#39;, color: &#39;d4c5f9&#39;, description: &#39;Research and exploration task&#39; },

      // Priority labels
      {
        name: &#39;priority:critical&#39;,
        color: &#39;b60205&#39;,
        description: &#39;Critical priority - must be addressed immediately&#39;,
      },
      {
        name: &#39;priority:high&#39;,
        color: &#39;ff9500&#39;,
        description: &#39;High priority - should be addressed soon&#39;,
      },
      {
        name: &#39;priority:medium&#39;,
        color: &#39;fbca04&#39;,
        description: &#39;Medium priority - normal timeline&#39;,
      },
      { name: &#39;priority:low&#39;, color: &#39;0e8a16&#39;, description: &#39;Low priority - can wait&#39; },

      // Status labels
      { name: &#39;status:planning&#39;, color: &#39;f0f0f0&#39;, description: &#39;In planning phase&#39; },
      { name: &#39;status:in_progress&#39;, color: &#39;0052cc&#39;, description: &#39;Currently being worked on&#39; },
      { name: &#39;status:review&#39;, color: &#39;fbca04&#39;, description: &#39;In review&#39; },
      { name: &#39;status:testing&#39;, color: &#39;c5def5&#39;, description: &#39;In testing phase&#39; },
      { name: &#39;status:completed&#39;, color: &#39;0e8a16&#39;, description: &#39;Completed&#39; },
      { name: &#39;status:cancelled&#39;, color: &#39;d93f0b&#39;, description: &#39;Cancelled&#39; },

      // Special labels
      { name: &#39;epic&#39;, color: &#39;5319e7&#39;, description: &#39;Large feature epic&#39; },
      { name: &#39;needs-review&#39;, color: &#39;fbca04&#39;, description: &#39;Requires code review&#39; },
      { name: &#39;needs-testing&#39;, color: &#39;c5def5&#39;, description: &#39;Requires testing&#39; },
      {
        name: &#39;parallel-safe&#39;,
        color: &#39;0e8a16&#39;,
        description: &#39;Can run in parallel with other tasks&#39;,
      },
      { name: &#39;arbiter-managed&#39;, color: &#39;d4c5f9&#39;, description: &#39;Managed by Arbiter CLI&#39; },
    ],
  },
};

export class ConfigurableTemplateManager {
  private config: GitHubTemplatesConfig;
  private baseTemplates: Map&lt;string, GitHubTemplateSet&gt; = new Map();

  constructor(config?: GitHubTemplatesConfig) {
    this.config = config || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG;
    this.loadBaseTemplates();
  }

  private isFileTemplateRef(
    value: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef
  ): value is GitHubFileTemplateRef {
    return (value as GitHubFileTemplateRef).file !== undefined;
  }

  private isTemplateSet(value: GitHubTemplateSetSource): value is GitHubTemplateSet {
    return (
      typeof (value as GitHubTemplateSet).name === &#39;string&#39; &amp;&amp;
      value !== undefined &amp;&amp;
      typeof (value as GitHubTemplateSet).sections?.description === &#39;string&#39;
    );
  }

  private ensureTemplateConfig(
    value: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef
  ): GitHubTemplateConfig {
    if (this.isFileTemplateRef(value)) {
      throw new Error(
        `File-based templates are not supported by ConfigurableTemplateManager. Use FileBasedTemplateManager for ${value.file}.`
      );
    }
    return value;
  }

  private extractTemplateMetadata(
    value: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef | undefined
  ): { name?: string; description?: string } {
    if (!value) return {};
    if (this.isFileTemplateRef(value)) {
      return {
        name: value.metadata?.name,
        description: value.metadata?.description,
      };
    }

    return {
      name: value.name,
      description: value.description,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Load base templates for inheritance
   */
  private loadBaseTemplates(): void {
    if (this.config.base &amp;&amp; this.isTemplateSet(this.config.base)) {
      this.baseTemplates.set(this.config.base.name, this.config.base);
    }

    // Load default base template if not overridden
    if (!this.baseTemplates.has(&#39;arbiter-default&#39;)) {
      this.baseTemplates.set(&#39;arbiter-default&#39;, DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.base as GitHubTemplateSet);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Generate epic template using configuration
   */
  generateEpicTemplate(epic: Epic, options: GitHubTemplateOptions = {}): GeneratedTemplate {
    const templateConfig = this.config.epic || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.epic!;
    const resolvedConfig = this.resolveTemplateConfig(templateConfig);

    // Validate epic data
    this.validateData(epic, resolvedConfig.validation);

    // Generate template content
    const context = this.createTemplateContext(epic, options);
    const title = this.renderTemplate(resolvedConfig.title || &#39;{{name}}&#39;, context);
    const body = this.generateTemplateBody(resolvedConfig.sections, context);
    const labels = this.renderLabels(resolvedConfig.labels || [], context);
    const assignees = this.getAssignees(epic, resolvedConfig.assignees);

    return {
      title,
      body,
      labels,
      assignees,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate task template using configuration
   */
  generateTaskTemplate(
    task: Task,
    epic: Epic,
    options: GitHubTemplateOptions = {}
  ): GeneratedTemplate {
    const templateConfig = this.config.task || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.task!;
    const resolvedConfig = this.resolveTemplateConfig(templateConfig);

    // Validate task data
    this.validateData(task, resolvedConfig.validation);

    // Generate template content
    const context = this.createTemplateContext({ ...task, epic }, options);
    const title = this.renderTemplate(resolvedConfig.title || &#39;{{name}}&#39;, context);
    const body = this.generateTemplateBody(resolvedConfig.sections, context);
    const labels = this.renderLabels(resolvedConfig.labels || [], context);
    const assignees = this.getAssignees(task, resolvedConfig.assignees);

    return {
      title,
      body,
      labels,
      assignees,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate repository template files
   */
  generateRepositoryTemplates(): TemplateFiles {
    const files: TemplateFiles = {};

    // Generate issue templates
    files[&#39;.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/epic.md&#39;] = this.generateIssueTemplateFile(
      this.config.epic || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.epic!,
      &#39;epic&#39;
    );

    files[&#39;.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/task.md&#39;] = this.generateIssueTemplateFile(
      this.config.task || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.task!,
      &#39;task&#39;
    );

    files[&#39;.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/bug_report.md&#39;] = this.generateIssueTemplateFile(
      this.config.bugReport || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.bugReport!,
      &#39;bug&#39;
    );

    files[&#39;.github/ISSUE_TEMPLATE/feature_request.md&#39;] = this.generateIssueTemplateFile(
      this.config.featureRequest || DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG.featureRequest!,
      &#39;feature&#39;
    );

    // Generate configuration files
    if (this.config.repositoryConfig?.issueConfig) {
      files[&#39;.github/config.yml&#39;] = this.generateConfigFile();
    }

    if (this.config.repositoryConfig?.labels) {
      files[&#39;.github/labels.yml&#39;] = this.generateLabelsFile();
    }

    return files;
  }

  /**
   * Resolve template configuration with inheritance
   */
  private resolveTemplateConfig(
    config: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef
  ): GitHubTemplateConfig {
    const normalizedConfig = this.ensureTemplateConfig(config);

    if (!normalizedConfig.inherits) {
      return normalizedConfig;
    }

    const baseTemplate = this.baseTemplates.get(normalizedConfig.inherits);
    if (!baseTemplate) {
      throw new Error(`Base template &quot;${normalizedConfig.inherits}&quot; not found`);
    }

    // Merge base template with current config
    return {
      ...baseTemplate,
      ...normalizedConfig,
      sections: {
        ...baseTemplate.sections,
        ...normalizedConfig.sections,
        additional: {
          ...baseTemplate.sections.additional,
          ...normalizedConfig.sections?.additional,
        },
      },
      labels: [...(baseTemplate.labels || []), ...(normalizedConfig.labels || [])],
      validation: {
        fields: [
          ...(baseTemplate.validation?.fields || []),
          ...(normalizedConfig.validation?.fields || []),
        ],
        custom: [
          ...(baseTemplate.validation?.custom || []),
          ...(normalizedConfig.validation?.custom || []),
        ],
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Create template context from data
   */
  private createTemplateContext(data: any, options: GitHubTemplateOptions): Record&lt;string, any&gt; {
    return {
      ...data,
      ...options.customFields,
      // Helper functions for templates
      helpers: {
        capitalize: (str: string) =&gt; str.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + str.slice(1),
        formatDate: (date: string) =&gt; new Date(date).toLocaleDateString(),
        statusEmoji: (status: string) =&gt; this.getStatusEmoji(status),
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Render template string with context
   */
  private renderTemplate(template: string, context: Record&lt;string, any&gt;): string {
    let result = template;

    // Simple template rendering (replace {{variable}} with context values)
    result = result.replace(/\{\{(\w+)\}\}/g, (match, key) =&gt; {
      const value = this.getNestedValue(context, key);
      return value !== undefined ? String(value) : match;
    });

    // Handle conditional blocks {{#if condition}}...{{/if}}
    result = result.replace(
      /\{\{#if\s+(\w+)\}\}(.*?)\{\{\/if\}\}/gs,
      (match, condition, content) =&gt; {
        const value = this.getNestedValue(context, condition);
        return value ? content : &#39;&#39;;
      }
    );

    // Handle each blocks {{#each array}}...{{/each}}
    result = result.replace(
      /\{\{#each\s+(\w+)\}\}(.*?)\{\{\/each\}\}/gs,
      (match, arrayKey, content) =&gt; {
        const array = this.getNestedValue(context, arrayKey);
        if (!Array.isArray(array)) return &#39;&#39;;

        return array
          .map((item, index) =&gt; {
            let itemContent = content;
            itemContent = itemContent.replace(/\{\{this\}\}/g, String(item));
            itemContent = itemContent.replace(/\{\{@index\}\}/g, String(index + 1));
            return itemContent;
          })
          .join(&#39;&#39;);
      }
    );

    return result.trim();
  }

  /**
   * Get nested value from context
   */
  private getNestedValue(obj: any, path: string): any {
    return path.split(&#39;.&#39;).reduce((current, key) =&gt; current?.[key], obj);
  }

  /**
   * Generate template body from sections
   */
  private generateTemplateBody(
    sections: Partial&lt;GitHubTemplateSections&gt; | undefined,
    context: Record&lt;string, any&gt;
  ): string {
    if (!sections) return &#39;&#39;;

    let body = &#39;&#39;;

    // Add description section
    if (sections.description) {
      body += this.renderTemplate(sections.description, context);
    }

    // Add details table
    if (sections.details &amp;&amp; sections.details.length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## 📊 Details\n\n&#39;;
      body += &#39;| Field | Value |\n&#39;;
      body += &#39;|-------|-------|\n&#39;;

      sections.details.forEach(field =&gt; {
        const value = this.getNestedValue(context, field.name);
        const displayValue = value !== undefined ? String(value) : field.default || &#39;Not specified&#39;;
        body += `| **${field.label}** | \`${displayValue}\` |\n`;
      });

      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Add acceptance criteria section
    if (sections.acceptanceCriteria) {
      body += this.renderTemplate(sections.acceptanceCriteria, context);
    }

    // Add dependencies section
    if (sections.dependencies) {
      body += this.renderTemplate(sections.dependencies, context);
    }

    // Add additional sections
    if (sections.additional) {
      Object.entries(sections.additional).forEach(([key, template]) =&gt; {
        body += this.renderTemplate(template, context);
      });
    }

    return body;
  }

  /**
   * Render labels with context
   */
  private renderLabels(labelTemplates: string[], context: Record&lt;string, any&gt;): string[] {
    return labelTemplates
      .map(template =&gt; this.renderTemplate(template, context))
      .filter(label =&gt; label.length &gt; 0);
  }

  /**
   * Get assignees for template
   */
  private getAssignees(data: any, configAssignees?: string[]): string[] | undefined {
    const assignees: string[] = [];

    if (data.assignee) {
      assignees.push(data.assignee);
    }

    if (data.owner &amp;&amp; data.owner !== data.assignee) {
      assignees.push(data.owner);
    }

    if (configAssignees) {
      assignees.push(...configAssignees);
    }

    return assignees.length &gt; 0 ? [...new Set(assignees)] : undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Validate data against template validation rules
   */
  private validateData(data: any, validation?: GitHubTemplateConfig[&#39;validation&#39;]): void {
    if (!validation?.fields) return;

    const errors: string[] = [];

    validation.fields.forEach(rule =&gt; {
      const value = this.getNestedValue(data, rule.field);

      if (rule.required &amp;&amp; (!value || (Array.isArray(value) &amp;&amp; value.length === 0))) {
        errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} is required`);
        return;
      }

      if (value) {
        if (rule.minLength &amp;&amp; String(value).length &lt; rule.minLength) {
          errors.push(
            rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} must be at least ${rule.minLength} characters`
          );
        }

        if (rule.maxLength &amp;&amp; String(value).length &gt; rule.maxLength) {
          errors.push(
            rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} must be at most ${rule.maxLength} characters`
          );
        }

        if (rule.pattern &amp;&amp; !new RegExp(rule.pattern).test(String(value))) {
          errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} does not match required pattern`);
        }

        if (rule.enum &amp;&amp; !rule.enum.includes(String(value))) {
          errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} must be one of: ${rule.enum.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);
        }
      }
    });

    if (errors.length &gt; 0) {
      throw new Error(`Template validation failed:\n${errors.map(e =&gt; `  • ${e}`).join(&#39;\n&#39;)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Generate issue template file
   */
  private generateIssueTemplateFile(
    config: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef,
    type: string
  ): string {
    const resolvedConfig = this.resolveTemplateConfig(config);

    let template = &#39;---\n&#39;;
    template += `name: ${resolvedConfig.name || type}\n`;
    template += `about: Create a new ${resolvedConfig.name || type}\n`;
    template += `title: &#39;${resolvedConfig.title?.replace(/\{\{.*?\}\}/g, &#39;&#39;)}&#39;\n`;
    template += `labels: &#39;${(resolvedConfig.labels || []).join(&#39;,&#39;).replace(/\{\{.*?\}\}/g, &#39;&#39;)}&#39;\n`;
    template += `assignees: &#39;${(resolvedConfig.assignees || []).join(&#39;,&#39;)}&#39;\n`;
    template += &#39;---\n\n&#39;;

    // Add template body structure
    template += &#39;&lt;!-- DO NOT EDIT: Arbiter ID will be filled automatically --&gt;\n&#39;;
    template += &#39;&lt;!-- arbiter-id:  --&gt;\n&#39;;
    template += `&lt;!-- arbiter-type: ${type} --&gt;\n\n`;

    // Add template sections as placeholders
    if (resolvedConfig.sections) {
      template += this.generateTemplateBody(resolvedConfig.sections, {});
    }

    return template;
  }

  /**
   * Generate config.yml file
   */
  private generateConfigFile(): string {
    const config = this.config.repositoryConfig?.issueConfig;
    if (!config) return &#39;&#39;;

    let content = &#39;# Configuration for GitHub features\n\n&#39;;
    content += `blank_issues_enabled: ${config.blankIssuesEnabled || false}\n`;

    if (config.contactLinks) {
      content += &#39;contact_links:\n&#39;;
      config.contactLinks.forEach(link =&gt; {
        content += `  - name: ${link.name}\n`;
        content += `    url: ${link.url}\n`;
        content += `    about: ${link.about}\n`;
      });
    }

    return content;
  }

  /**
   * Generate labels.yml file
   */
  private generateLabelsFile(): string {
    const labels = this.config.repositoryConfig?.labels;
    if (!labels) return &#39;&#39;;

    let content = &#39;# GitHub Labels for Arbiter-managed projects\n\n&#39;;

    labels.forEach(label =&gt; {
      content += `- name: &#39;${label.name}&#39;\n`;
      content += `  color: &#39;${label.color}&#39;\n`;
      if (label.description) {
        content += `  description: &#39;${label.description}&#39;\n`;
      }
    });

    return content;
  }

  /**
   * Get status emoji for display
   */
  private getStatusEmoji(status: string): string {
    const emojis: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {
      todo: &#39;📋&#39;,
      planning: &#39;📋&#39;,
      in_progress: &#39;🚧&#39;,
      review: &#39;👀&#39;,
      testing: &#39;🧪&#39;,
      completed: &#39;✅&#39;,
      cancelled: &#39;❌&#39;,
    };
    return emojis[status] || &#39;❓&#39;;
  }

  /**
   * Get available templates
   */
  getAvailableTemplates(): Array&lt;{ name: string; type: string; description?: string }&gt; {
    const templates = [];

    if (this.config.epic) {
      const meta = this.extractTemplateMetadata(this.config.epic);
      templates.push({
        name: meta.name || &#39;epic&#39;,
        type: &#39;epic&#39;,
        description: meta.description,
      });
    }

    if (this.config.task) {
      const meta = this.extractTemplateMetadata(this.config.task);
      templates.push({
        name: meta.name || &#39;task&#39;,
        type: &#39;task&#39;,
        description: meta.description,
      });
    }

    if (this.config.bugReport) {
      const meta = this.extractTemplateMetadata(this.config.bugReport);
      templates.push({
        name: meta.name || &#39;bug_report&#39;,
        type: &#39;bug&#39;,
        description: meta.description,
      });
    }

    if (this.config.featureRequest) {
      const meta = this.extractTemplateMetadata(this.config.featureRequest);
      templates.push({
        name: meta.name || &#39;feature_request&#39;,
        type: &#39;feature&#39;,
        description: meta.description,
      });
    }

    return templates;
  }

  /**
   * Validate template configuration
   */
  validateTemplateConfig(): Array&lt;{ field: string; message: string }&gt; {
    const errors: Array&lt;{ field: string; message: string }&gt; = [];

    // Validate base template references
    const templateConfigs = [
      { name: &#39;epic&#39;, config: this.config.epic },
      { name: &#39;task&#39;, config: this.config.task },
      { name: &#39;bugReport&#39;, config: this.config.bugReport },
      { name: &#39;featureRequest&#39;, config: this.config.featureRequest },
    ];

    templateConfigs.forEach(({ name, config }) =&gt; {
      if (config?.inherits &amp;&amp; !this.baseTemplates.has(config.inherits)) {
        errors.push({
          field: `${name}.inherits`,
          message: `Base template &quot;${config.inherits}&quot; not found`,
        });
      }
    });

    return errors;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/language-plugins/rust.ts
/**
 * Rust Language Plugin - Axum + SQLx + Modern Rust Patterns
 * Supports: Rust 1.70+, Axum, SQLx, Tokio, Serde, modern async patterns
 */

import type {
  BuildConfig,
  ComponentConfig,
  GeneratedFile,
  GenerationResult,
  LanguagePlugin,
  ProjectConfig,
  ServiceConfig,
} from &#39;./index.js&#39;;

export class RustPlugin implements LanguagePlugin {
  readonly name = &#39;Rust Plugin&#39;;
  readonly language = &#39;rust&#39;;
  readonly version = &#39;1.0.0&#39;;
  readonly description = &#39;Modern Rust with Axum, SQLx, and zero-cost abstractions&#39;;
  readonly supportedFeatures = [
    &#39;web-server&#39;,
    &#39;api&#39;,
    &#39;database&#39;,
    &#39;async-runtime&#39;,
    &#39;memory-safety&#39;,
    &#39;performance&#39;,
    &#39;testing&#39;,
    &#39;serialization&#39;,
    &#39;error-handling&#39;,
  ];
  readonly capabilities = {
    services: true,
    api: true,
    testing: true,
  };

  // Rust doesn&#39;t have UI components like frontend frameworks
  async generateComponent(config: ComponentConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    throw new Error(&#39;Component generation not supported for Rust. Use generateService instead.&#39;);
  }

  async generateService(config: ServiceConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];
    const dependencies: string[] = [];

    switch (config.type) {
      case &#39;api&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `src/handlers/${config.name.toLowerCase()}.rs`,
          content: this.generateAPIHandler(config),
        });
        files.push({
          path: `src/routes/${config.name.toLowerCase()}.rs`,
          content: this.generateRoutes(config),
        });
        dependencies.push(&#39;axum&#39;, &#39;tokio&#39;, &#39;serde&#39;);
        break;
      case &#39;service&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `src/services/${config.name.toLowerCase()}.rs`,
          content: this.generateBusinessService(config),
        });
        break;
      case &#39;model&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `src/models/${config.name.toLowerCase()}.rs`,
          content: this.generateModel(config),
        });
        dependencies.push(&#39;sqlx&#39;, &#39;serde&#39;, &#39;uuid&#39;);
        break;
      case &#39;middleware&#39;:
        files.push({
          path: `src/middleware/${config.name.toLowerCase()}.rs`,
          content: this.generateMiddleware(config),
        });
        break;
    }

    if (config.validation) {
      dependencies.push(&#39;validator&#39;);
    }

    if (config.database) {
      dependencies.push(&#39;sqlx&#39;, &#39;uuid&#39;);
    }

    return { files, dependencies };
  }

  async initializeProject(config: ProjectConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];
    const dependencies = [
      &#39;axum&#39;,
      &#39;tokio&#39;,
      &#39;serde&#39;,
      &#39;serde_json&#39;,
      &#39;tracing&#39;,
      &#39;tracing-subscriber&#39;,
      &#39;tower&#39;,
      &#39;tower-http&#39;,
    ];

    // Cargo.toml
    files.push({
      path: &#39;Cargo.toml&#39;,
      content: this.generateCargoToml(config),
    });

    // Main application
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/main.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateMainApp(config),
    });

    // Application state and configuration
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/config.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateConfig(config),
    });

    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/app.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateAppState(config),
    });

    // Database setup (if needed)
    if (config.database) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;src/database.rs&#39;,
        content: this.generateDatabase(config),
      });
      dependencies.push(&#39;sqlx&#39;);
    }

    // Error handling
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/errors.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateErrors(),
    });

    // Models module
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/models/mod.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateModelsModule(),
    });

    // Services module
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/services/mod.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateServicesModule(),
    });

    // Handlers module
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/handlers/mod.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateHandlersModule(),
    });

    // Routes module
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/routes/mod.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateRoutesModule(config),
    });

    // Middleware module
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/middleware/mod.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateMiddlewareModule(),
    });

    // Health check
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/handlers/health.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateHealthHandler(),
    });

    // Library file
    files.push({
      path: &#39;src/lib.rs&#39;,
      content: this.generateLibFile(config),
    });

    // Environment file
    files.push({
      path: &#39;.env.example&#39;,
      content: this.generateEnvExample(config),
    });

    // Testing setup (if requested)
    if (config.testing) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;src/tests/mod.rs&#39;,
        content: this.generateTestModule(),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;src/tests/integration.rs&#39;,
        content: this.generateIntegrationTests(config),
      });
    }

    // Docker setup (if requested)
    if (config.docker) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;Dockerfile&#39;,
        content: this.generateDockerfile(config),
      });
      files.push({
        path: &#39;docker-compose.yml&#39;,
        content: this.generateDockerCompose(config),
      });
    }

    // Justfile for common tasks
    files.push({
      path: &#39;justfile&#39;,
      content: this.generateJustfile(config),
    });

    return {
      files,
      dependencies,
      scripts: {
        dev: &#39;cargo watch -x run&#39;,
        build: &#39;cargo build --release&#39;,
        test: &#39;cargo test&#39;,
        &#39;test:coverage&#39;: &#39;cargo tarpaulin --out html&#39;,
        lint: &#39;cargo clippy -- -D warnings&#39;,
        format: &#39;cargo fmt&#39;,
        check: &#39;cargo check&#39;,
      },
    };
  }

  async generateBuildConfig(config: BuildConfig): Promise&lt;GenerationResult&gt; {
    const files: GeneratedFile[] = [];

    // Production dockerfile
    if (config.target === &#39;production&#39;) {
      files.push({
        path: &#39;Dockerfile.prod&#39;,
        content: this.generateProductionDockerfile(config),
      });
    }

    // CI/CD configuration
    files.push({
      path: &#39;.github/workflows/rust.yml&#39;,
      content: this.generateGitHubActions(config),
    });

    // Cargo configuration
    files.push({
      path: &#39;.cargo/config.toml&#39;,
      content: this.generateCargoConfig(config),
    });

    return { files };
  }

  private generateAPIHandler(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const structName = this.toPascalCase(config.name);
    const moduleName = config.name.toLowerCase();

    return `use axum::{
    extract::{Path, Query, State},
    response::Json,
    http::StatusCode,
};
use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
use uuid::Uuid;
use tracing::{info, error};

use crate::{
    app::AppState,
    errors::AppError,
    models::${moduleName}::{${structName}, Create${structName}Request, Update${structName}Request},
    services::${moduleName}::${structName}Service,
};

#[derive(Debug, Deserialize)]
pub struct QueryParams {
    pub page: Option&lt;u32&gt;,
    pub limit: Option&lt;u32&gt;,
}

#[derive(Debug, Serialize)]
pub struct ${structName}Response {
    pub data: Vec&lt;${structName}&gt;,
    pub total: u64,
    pub page: u32,
    pub limit: u32,
}

/// Get all ${config.name} items
pub async fn get_all_${moduleName}(
    State(app_state): State&lt;AppState&gt;,
    Query(params): Query&lt;QueryParams&gt;,
) -&gt; Result&lt;Json&lt;${structName}Response&gt;, AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Fetching all ${config.name} items&quot;);
    
    let page = params.page.unwrap_or(1);
    let limit = params.limit.unwrap_or(20);
    
    let service = ${structName}Service::new(${config.database ? &#39;&amp;app_state.db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});
    
    let (items, total) = service.get_all(page, limit).await?;
    
    let response = ${structName}Response {
        data: items,
        total,
        page,
        limit,
    };
    
    Ok(Json(response))
}

/// Get ${config.name} by ID
pub async fn get_${moduleName}_by_id(
    State(app_state): State&lt;AppState&gt;,
    Path(id): Path&lt;Uuid&gt;,
) -&gt; Result&lt;Json&lt;${structName}&gt;, AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Fetching ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
    
    let service = ${structName}Service::new(${config.database ? &#39;&amp;app_state.db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});
    let item = service.get_by_id(id).await?;
    
    Ok(Json(item))
}

/// Create new ${config.name}
pub async fn create_${moduleName}(
    State(app_state): State&lt;AppState&gt;,
    Json(payload): Json&lt;Create${structName}Request&gt;,
) -&gt; Result&lt;(StatusCode, Json&lt;${structName}&gt;), AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Creating new ${config.name}&quot;);
    
    // Validate payload if validation is enabled
    ${config.validation ? &#39;payload.validate()?;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    
    let service = ${structName}Service::new(${config.database ? &#39;&amp;app_state.db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});
    let item = service.create(payload).await?;
    
    Ok((StatusCode::CREATED, Json(item)))
}

/// Update ${config.name}
pub async fn update_${moduleName}(
    State(app_state): State&lt;AppState&gt;,
    Path(id): Path&lt;Uuid&gt;,
    Json(payload): Json&lt;Update${structName}Request&gt;,
) -&gt; Result&lt;Json&lt;${structName}&gt;, AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Updating ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
    
    // Validate payload if validation is enabled
    ${config.validation ? &#39;payload.validate()?;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    
    let service = ${structName}Service::new(${config.database ? &#39;&amp;app_state.db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});
    let item = service.update(id, payload).await?;
    
    Ok(Json(item))
}

/// Delete ${config.name}
pub async fn delete_${moduleName}(
    State(app_state): State&lt;AppState&gt;,
    Path(id): Path&lt;Uuid&gt;,
) -&gt; Result&lt;StatusCode, AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Deleting ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
    
    let service = ${structName}Service::new(${config.database ? &#39;&amp;app_state.db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});
    service.delete(id).await?;
    
    Ok(StatusCode::NO_CONTENT)
}
`;
  }

  private generateRoutes(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const moduleName = config.name.toLowerCase();

    return `use axum::{
    routing::{get, post, put, delete},
    Router,
};

use crate::{
    app::AppState,
    handlers::${moduleName}::{
        get_all_${moduleName},
        get_${moduleName}_by_id,
        create_${moduleName},
        update_${moduleName},
        delete_${moduleName},
    },
};

/// Create ${config.name} routes
pub fn create_${moduleName}_routes() -&gt; Router&lt;AppState&gt; {
    Router::new()
        .route(&quot;/&quot;, get(get_all_${moduleName}).post(create_${moduleName}))
        .route(&quot;/:id&quot;, get(get_${moduleName}_by_id).put(update_${moduleName}).delete(delete_${moduleName}))
}
`;
  }

  private generateBusinessService(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const structName = this.toPascalCase(config.name);
    const moduleName = config.name.toLowerCase();

    return `use uuid::Uuid;
use tracing::{info, error};
${config.database ? &#39;use sqlx::{PgPool, Row};&#39; : &#39;&#39;}

use crate::{
    errors::AppError,
    models::${moduleName}::{${structName}, Create${structName}Request, Update${structName}Request},
};

/// Service for ${config.name} business logic
pub struct ${structName}Service${config.database ? &quot;&lt;&#39;a&gt;&quot; : &#39;&#39;} {
    ${config.database ? &quot;db_pool: &amp;&#39;a PgPool,&quot; : &#39;&#39;}
}

impl${config.database ? &quot;&lt;&#39;a&gt;&quot; : &#39;&#39;} ${structName}Service${config.database ? &quot;&lt;&#39;a&gt;&quot; : &#39;&#39;} {
    /// Create a new service instance
    pub fn new(${config.database ? &quot;db_pool: &amp;&#39;a PgPool&quot; : &#39;&#39;}) -&gt; Self {
        Self {
            ${config.database ? &#39;db_pool,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
        }
    }

    /// Get all ${config.name} items with pagination
    pub async fn get_all(&amp;self, page: u32, limit: u32) -&gt; Result&lt;(Vec&lt;${structName}&gt;, u64), AppError&gt; {
        info!(&quot;Fetching all ${config.name} items (page: {}, limit: {})&quot;, page, limit);
        
        ${
          config.database
            ? `
        let offset = (page - 1) * limit;
        
        // Get total count
        let count_row = sqlx::query!(
            &quot;SELECT COUNT(*) as count FROM ${moduleName}s WHERE deleted_at IS NULL&quot;
        )
        .fetch_one(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to count ${config.name} items: {}&quot;, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

        let total = count_row.count.unwrap_or(0) as u64;

        // Get paginated items
        let items = sqlx::query_as!(
            ${structName},
            &quot;SELECT id, name, description, is_active, created_at, updated_at 
             FROM ${moduleName}s 
             WHERE deleted_at IS NULL 
             ORDER BY created_at DESC 
             LIMIT $1 OFFSET $2&quot;,
            limit as i32,
            offset as i32
        )
        .fetch_all(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to fetch ${config.name} items: {}&quot;, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

        Ok((items, total))
        `
            : `
        // Placeholder implementation without database
        let items = vec![];
        let total = 0;
        Ok((items, total))
        `
        }
    }

    /// Get ${config.name} by ID
    pub async fn get_by_id(&amp;self, id: Uuid) -&gt; Result&lt;${structName}, AppError&gt; {
        info!(&quot;Fetching ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
        
        ${
          config.database
            ? `
        let item = sqlx::query_as!(
            ${structName},
            &quot;SELECT id, name, description, is_active, created_at, updated_at 
             FROM ${moduleName}s 
             WHERE id = $1 AND deleted_at IS NULL&quot;,
            id
        )
        .fetch_optional(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to fetch ${config.name} {}: {}&quot;, id, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?
        .ok_or_else(|| {
            error!(&quot;${config.name} not found: {}&quot;, id);
            AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id))
        })?;

        Ok(item)
        `
            : `
        // Placeholder implementation without database
        Err(AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id)))
        `
        }
    }

    /// Create new ${config.name}
    pub async fn create(&amp;self, request: Create${structName}Request) -&gt; Result&lt;${structName}, AppError&gt; {
        info!(&quot;Creating new ${config.name}&quot;);
        
        ${
          config.database
            ? `
        let id = Uuid::new_v4();
        let now = chrono::Utc::now();

        let item = sqlx::query_as!(
            ${structName},
            &quot;INSERT INTO ${moduleName}s (id, name, description, is_active, created_at, updated_at)
             VALUES ($1, $2, $3, true, $4, $4)
             RETURNING id, name, description, is_active, created_at, updated_at&quot;,
            id,
            request.name,
            request.description,
            now,
        )
        .fetch_one(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to create ${config.name}: {}&quot;, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

        Ok(item)
        `
            : `
        // Placeholder implementation without database
        let item = ${structName} {
            id: Uuid::new_v4(),
            name: request.name,
