            description: request.description,
            is_active: true,
            created_at: chrono::Utc::now(),
            updated_at: chrono::Utc::now(),
        };
        Ok(item)
        `
        }
    }

    /// Update ${config.name}
    pub async fn update(&amp;self, id: Uuid, request: Update${structName}Request) -&gt; Result&lt;${structName}, AppError&gt; {
        info!(&quot;Updating ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
        
        ${
          config.database
            ? `
        let now = chrono::Utc::now();

        let item = sqlx::query_as!(
            ${structName},
            &quot;UPDATE ${moduleName}s 
             SET name = COALESCE($2, name),
                 description = COALESCE($3, description),
                 is_active = COALESCE($4, is_active),
                 updated_at = $5
             WHERE id = $1 AND deleted_at IS NULL
             RETURNING id, name, description, is_active, created_at, updated_at&quot;,
            id,
            request.name,
            request.description,
            request.is_active,
            now,
        )
        .fetch_optional(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to update ${config.name} {}: {}&quot;, id, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?
        .ok_or_else(|| {
            error!(&quot;${config.name} not found for update: {}&quot;, id);
            AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id))
        })?;

        Ok(item)
        `
            : `
        // Placeholder implementation without database
        Err(AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id)))
        `
        }
    }

    /// Delete ${config.name} (soft delete)
    pub async fn delete(&amp;self, id: Uuid) -&gt; Result&lt;(), AppError&gt; {
        info!(&quot;Deleting ${config.name} with ID: {}&quot;, id);
        
        ${
          config.database
            ? `
        let now = chrono::Utc::now();

        let result = sqlx::query!(
            &quot;UPDATE ${moduleName}s SET deleted_at = $1 WHERE id = $2 AND deleted_at IS NULL&quot;,
            now,
            id
        )
        .execute(self.db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to delete ${config.name} {}: {}&quot;, id, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

        if result.rows_affected() == 0 {
            error!(&quot;${config.name} not found for deletion: {}&quot;, id);
            return Err(AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id)));
        }

        Ok(())
        `
            : `
        // Placeholder implementation without database
        Err(AppError::NotFound(format!(&quot;${config.name} with ID {} not found&quot;, id)))
        `
        }
    }
}
`;
  }

  private generateModel(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const structName = this.toPascalCase(config.name);

    return `use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
use uuid::Uuid;
use chrono::{DateTime, Utc};
${config.validation ? &#39;use validator::Validate;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}

/// ${structName} model
#[derive(Debug, Clone, Serialize, Deserialize)]
${config.database ? &#39;#[derive(sqlx::FromRow)]&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
pub struct ${structName} {
    pub id: Uuid,
    pub name: String,
    pub description: Option&lt;String&gt;,
    pub is_active: bool,
    pub created_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
    pub updated_at: DateTime&lt;Utc&gt;,
}

/// Request payload for creating a ${structName}
#[derive(Debug, Deserialize${config.validation ? &#39;, Validate&#39; : &#39;&#39;})]
pub struct Create${structName}Request {
    ${config.validation ? &#39;#[validate(length(min = 1, max = 100))]&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    pub name: String,
    ${config.validation ? &#39;#[validate(length(max = 500))]&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    pub description: Option&lt;String&gt;,
}

/// Request payload for updating a ${structName}
#[derive(Debug, Deserialize${config.validation ? &#39;, Validate&#39; : &#39;&#39;})]
pub struct Update${structName}Request {
    ${config.validation ? &#39;#[validate(length(min = 1, max = 100))]&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    pub name: Option&lt;String&gt;,
    ${config.validation ? &#39;#[validate(length(max = 500))]&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    pub description: Option&lt;String&gt;,
    pub is_active: Option&lt;bool&gt;,
}

impl ${structName} {
    /// Create a new ${structName} instance
    pub fn new(name: String, description: Option&lt;String&gt;) -&gt; Self {
        let now = Utc::now();
        Self {
            id: Uuid::new_v4(),
            name,
            description,
            is_active: true,
            created_at: now,
            updated_at: now,
        }
    }

    /// Check if the ${structName} is active
    pub fn is_active(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
        self.is_active
    }

    /// Update the ${structName} with new data
    pub fn update(&amp;mut self, request: Update${structName}Request) {
        if let Some(name) = request.name {
            self.name = name;
        }
        if let Some(description) = request.description {
            self.description = Some(description);
        }
        if let Some(is_active) = request.is_active {
            self.is_active = is_active;
        }
        self.updated_at = Utc::now();
    }
}

#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    use super::*;

    #[test]
    fn test_${config.name.toLowerCase()}_creation() {
        let name = &quot;Test ${structName}&quot;.to_string();
        let description = Some(&quot;Test description&quot;.to_string());
        let ${config.name.toLowerCase()} = ${structName}::new(name.clone(), description.clone());

        assert_eq!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.name, name);
        assert_eq!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.description, description);
        assert!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.is_active);
        assert!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.created_at &lt;= Utc::now());
        assert!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.updated_at &lt;= Utc::now());
    }

    #[test]
    fn test_${config.name.toLowerCase()}_update() {
        let mut ${config.name.toLowerCase()} = ${structName}::new(
            &quot;Original Name&quot;.to_string(),
            Some(&quot;Original Description&quot;.to_string())
        );

        let update_request = Update${structName}Request {
            name: Some(&quot;Updated Name&quot;.to_string()),
            description: Some(&quot;Updated Description&quot;.to_string()),
            is_active: Some(false),
        };

        ${config.name.toLowerCase()}.update(update_request);

        assert_eq!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.name, &quot;Updated Name&quot;);
        assert_eq!(${config.name.toLowerCase()}.description, Some(&quot;Updated Description&quot;.to_string()));
        assert!(!${config.name.toLowerCase()}.is_active);
    }
}
`;
  }

  private generateMiddleware(config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const middlewareName = this.toPascalCase(config.name);

    return `use axum::{
    extract::Request,
    middleware::Next,
    response::Response,
};
use tracing::{info, warn};

/// ${middlewareName} middleware
pub async fn ${config.name.toLowerCase()}_middleware(
    request: Request,
    next: Next,
) -&gt; Response {
    // Pre-processing logic
    info!(&quot;${middlewareName} middleware - processing request&quot;);

    // Extract request information if needed
    let method = request.method().clone();
    let uri = request.uri().clone();

    // Process the request
    let response = next.run(request).await;

    // Post-processing logic
    let status = response.status();
    info!(&quot;${middlewareName} middleware - request completed: {} {} -&gt; {}&quot;,
          method, uri, status);

    response
}
`;
  }

  private generateCargoToml(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    type CargoDependency = string | { version: string; features?: string[] };

    const dependencies: Record&lt;string, CargoDependency&gt; = {
      axum: &#39;0.7&#39;,
      tokio: { version: &#39;1.0&#39;, features: [&#39;full&#39;] },
      serde: { version: &#39;1.0&#39;, features: [&#39;derive&#39;] },
      serde_json: &#39;1.0&#39;,
      tracing: &#39;0.1&#39;,
      &#39;tracing-subscriber&#39;: { version: &#39;0.3&#39;, features: [&#39;env-filter&#39;] },
      tower: &#39;0.4&#39;,
      &#39;tower-http&#39;: { version: &#39;0.5&#39;, features: [&#39;cors&#39;, &#39;trace&#39;] },
      uuid: { version: &#39;1.0&#39;, features: [&#39;v4&#39;, &#39;serde&#39;] },
      chrono: { version: &#39;0.4&#39;, features: [&#39;serde&#39;] },
      anyhow: &#39;1.0&#39;,
      thiserror: &#39;1.0&#39;,
    };

    if (config.database) {
      dependencies.sqlx = {
        version: &#39;0.7&#39;,
        features: [&#39;runtime-tokio-rustls&#39;, &#39;postgres&#39;, &#39;uuid&#39;, &#39;chrono&#39;, &#39;macros&#39;],
      };
    }

    if (config.auth) {
      dependencies.jsonwebtoken = &#39;9.0&#39;;
      dependencies.bcrypt = &#39;0.15&#39;;
    }

    if (config.testing) {
      dependencies[&#39;tokio-test&#39;] = &#39;0.4&#39;;
    }

    return `[package]
name = &quot;${config.name.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9-_]/g, &#39;-&#39;)}&quot;
version = &quot;0.1.0&quot;
edition = &quot;2021&quot;
description = &quot;${config.description || `Modern Rust application: ${config.name}`}&quot;

[dependencies]
${Object.entries(dependencies)
  .map(([name, version]) =&gt; {
    if (typeof version === &#39;string&#39;) {
      return `${name} = &quot;${version}&quot;`;
    }
    const versionStr = version.version ? `version = &quot;${version.version}&quot;` : &#39;&#39;;
    const featuresStr = version.features
      ? `features = [${version.features.map((f: string) =&gt; `&quot;${f}&quot;`).join(&#39;, &#39;)}]`
      : &#39;&#39;;
    const parts = [versionStr, featuresStr].filter(Boolean);
    return `${name} = { ${parts.join(&#39;, &#39;)} }`;
  })
  .join(&#39;\n&#39;)}

[dev-dependencies]
tower-test = &quot;0.4&quot;
hyper = { version = &quot;1.0&quot;, features = [&quot;full&quot;] }
${config.testing ? `tokio-test = &quot;0.4&quot;` : &#39;&#39;}

[[bin]]
name = &quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}&quot;
path = &quot;src/main.rs&quot;

[profile.release]
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
panic = &quot;abort&quot;
strip = true
`;
  }

  private generateMainApp(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `use std::net::SocketAddr;

use axum::Server;
use tracing::{info, error};
use tracing_subscriber::{layer::SubscriberExt, util::SubscriberInitExt};

use ${config.name.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9_]/g, &#39;_&#39;)}::{
    app::create_app,
    config::Config,
    ${config.database ? &#39;database::create_pool,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
};

#[tokio::main]
async fn main() -&gt; Result&lt;(), Box&lt;dyn std::error::Error&gt;&gt; {
    // Initialize tracing
    tracing_subscriber::registry()
        .with(
            tracing_subscriber::EnvFilter::try_from_default_env()
                .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;${config.name.toLowerCase()}=debug,tower_http=debug&quot;.into()),
        )
        .with(tracing_subscriber::fmt::layer())
        .init();

    info!(&quot;Starting ${config.name} application&quot;);

    // Load configuration
    let config = Config::from_env()?;
    
    ${
      config.database
        ? `// Create database connection pool
    let db_pool = create_pool(&amp;config.database_url).await?;
    info!(&quot;Database connection pool created&quot;);

    // Run migrations
    sqlx::migrate!(&quot;./migrations&quot;)
        .run(&amp;db_pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to run migrations: {}&quot;, e);
            e
        })?;
    info!(&quot;Database migrations completed&quot;);`
        : &#39;&#39;
    }

    // Create application
    let app = create_app(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}).await?;

    // Setup server
    let addr = SocketAddr::from(([0, 0, 0, 0], config.port));
    info!(&quot;Server listening on {}&quot;, addr);

    // Start server
    let listener = tokio::net::TcpListener::bind(&amp;addr).await?;
    axum::serve(listener, app)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Server error: {}&quot;, e);
            e
        })?;

    Ok(())
}
`;
  }

  private generateConfig(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `use std::env;

/// Application configuration
#[derive(Debug, Clone)]
pub struct Config {
    pub port: u16,
    pub environment: String,
    ${config.database ? &#39;pub database_url: String,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    ${config.auth ? &#39;pub jwt_secret: String,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    pub log_level: String,
}

impl Config {
    /// Load configuration from environment variables
    pub fn from_env() -&gt; Result&lt;Self, Box&lt;dyn std::error::Error&gt;&gt; {
        let port = env::var(&quot;PORT&quot;)
            .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;3000&quot;.to_string())
            .parse::&lt;u16&gt;()
            .unwrap_or(3000);

        let environment = env::var(&quot;ENVIRONMENT&quot;)
            .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;development&quot;.to_string());

        ${
          config.database
            ? `let database_url = env::var(&quot;DATABASE_URL&quot;)
            .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;postgres://user:password@localhost:5432/${config.name.toLowerCase()}&quot;.to_string());`
            : &#39;&#39;
        }

        ${
          config.auth
            ? `let jwt_secret = env::var(&quot;JWT_SECRET&quot;)
            .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;your-secret-key&quot;.to_string());`
            : &#39;&#39;
        }

        let log_level = env::var(&quot;LOG_LEVEL&quot;)
            .unwrap_or_else(|_| &quot;info&quot;.to_string());

        Ok(Self {
            port,
            environment,
            ${config.database ? &#39;database_url,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
            ${config.auth ? &#39;jwt_secret,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
            log_level,
        })
    }

    /// Check if running in production
    pub fn is_production(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
        self.environment == &quot;production&quot;
    }

    /// Check if running in development
    pub fn is_development(&amp;self) -&gt; bool {
        self.environment == &quot;development&quot;
    }
}
`;
  }

  private generateAppState(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `use axum::{
    http::{
        header::{ACCEPT, AUTHORIZATION, CONTENT_TYPE},
        HeaderValue, Method,
    },
    Router,
};
use tower::ServiceBuilder;
use tower_http::{
    cors::CorsLayer,
    trace::TraceLayer,
};
${config.database ? &#39;use sqlx::PgPool;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}

use crate::{
    routes::create_routes,
    errors::AppError,
};

/// Application state
#[derive(Clone)]
pub struct AppState {
    ${config.database ? &#39;pub db_pool: PgPool,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
}

impl AppState {
    /// Create new application state
    pub fn new(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool: PgPool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}) -&gt; Self {
        Self {
            ${config.database ? &#39;db_pool,&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
        }
    }
}

/// Create the main application with all routes and middleware
pub async fn create_app(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool: PgPool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}) -&gt; Result&lt;Router, AppError&gt; {
    // Create application state
    let app_state = AppState::new(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;});

    // Create CORS layer
    let cors = CorsLayer::new()
        .allow_origin(&quot;http://localhost:3000&quot;.parse::&lt;HeaderValue&gt;().unwrap())
        .allow_methods([Method::GET, Method::POST, Method::PATCH, Method::DELETE])
        .allow_credentials(true)
        .allow_headers([AUTHORIZATION, ACCEPT, CONTENT_TYPE]);

    // Build the application
    let app = Router::new()
        .merge(create_routes())
        .layer(
            ServiceBuilder::new()
                .layer(TraceLayer::new_for_http())
                .layer(cors),
        )
        .with_state(app_state);

    Ok(app)
}
`;
  }

  private generateDatabase(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    if (config.database !== &#39;postgres&#39;) {
      return &#39;// Database configuration not implemented for this database type&#39;;
    }

    return `use sqlx::{PgPool, postgres::PgPoolOptions};
use tracing::{info, error};

use crate::errors::AppError;

/// Create database connection pool
pub async fn create_pool(database_url: &amp;str) -&gt; Result&lt;PgPool, AppError&gt; {
    info!(&quot;Creating database connection pool&quot;);

    let pool = PgPoolOptions::new()
        .max_connections(10)
        .connect(database_url)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to create database pool: {}&quot;, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

    // Test the connection
    sqlx::query(&quot;SELECT 1&quot;)
        .execute(&amp;pool)
        .await
        .map_err(|e| {
            error!(&quot;Failed to test database connection: {}&quot;, e);
            AppError::DatabaseError(e.to_string())
        })?;

    info!(&quot;Database connection pool created successfully&quot;);
    Ok(pool)
}
`;
  }

  private generateErrors(): string {
    return `use axum::{
    http::StatusCode,
    response::{IntoResponse, Response},
    Json,
};
use serde_json::json;
use thiserror::Error;
${this.supportedFeatures.includes(&#39;validation&#39;) ? &#39;use validator::ValidationErrors;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}

/// Application error types
#[derive(Error, Debug)]
pub enum AppError {
    #[error(&quot;Not found: {0}&quot;)]
    NotFound(String),

    #[error(&quot;Bad request: {0}&quot;)]
    BadRequest(String),

    #[error(&quot;Unauthorized: {0}&quot;)]
    Unauthorized(String),

    #[error(&quot;Forbidden: {0}&quot;)]
    Forbidden(String),

    #[error(&quot;Internal server error: {0}&quot;)]
    InternalServerError(String),

    #[error(&quot;Database error: {0}&quot;)]
    DatabaseError(String),

    ${
      this.supportedFeatures.includes(&#39;validation&#39;)
        ? `#[error(&quot;Validation error&quot;)]
    ValidationError(#[from] ValidationErrors),`
        : &#39;&#39;
    }

    #[error(&quot;Serialization error: {0}&quot;)]
    SerializationError(String),
}

impl IntoResponse for AppError {
    fn into_response(self) -&gt; Response {
        let (status, error_message) = match &amp;self {
            AppError::NotFound(msg) =&gt; (StatusCode::NOT_FOUND, msg.clone()),
            AppError::BadRequest(msg) =&gt; (StatusCode::BAD_REQUEST, msg.clone()),
            AppError::Unauthorized(msg) =&gt; (StatusCode::UNAUTHORIZED, msg.clone()),
            AppError::Forbidden(msg) =&gt; (StatusCode::FORBIDDEN, msg.clone()),
            AppError::DatabaseError(_) =&gt; (
                StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
                &quot;Database error occurred&quot;.to_string(),
            ),
            ${
              this.supportedFeatures.includes(&#39;validation&#39;)
                ? `AppError::ValidationError(errors) =&gt; (
                StatusCode::BAD_REQUEST,
                format!(&quot;Validation error: {}&quot;, errors),
            ),`
                : &#39;&#39;
            }
            AppError::SerializationError(_) =&gt; (
                StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
                &quot;Serialization error occurred&quot;.to_string(),
            ),
            AppError::InternalServerError(_) =&gt; (
                StatusCode::INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR,
                &quot;Internal server error occurred&quot;.to_string(),
            ),
        };

        let body = Json(json!({
            &quot;error&quot;: error_message,
            &quot;status&quot;: status.as_u16()
        }));

        (status, body).into_response()
    }
}

// Helper function for database errors
impl From&lt;sqlx::Error&gt; for AppError {
    fn from(error: sqlx::Error) -&gt; Self {
        match error {
            sqlx::Error::RowNotFound =&gt; AppError::NotFound(&quot;Resource not found&quot;.to_string()),
            _ =&gt; AppError::DatabaseError(error.to_string()),
        }
    }
}

// Helper function for serialization errors
impl From&lt;serde_json::Error&gt; for AppError {
    fn from(error: serde_json::Error) -&gt; Self {
        AppError::SerializationError(error.to_string())
    }
}
`;
  }

  private generateModelsModule(): string {
    return `//! Data models for the application

pub mod health;

// Add your model modules here
// pub mod user;
// pub mod item;
`;
  }

  private generateServicesModule(): string {
    return `//! Business logic services

// Add your service modules here
// pub mod user;
// pub mod item;
`;
  }

  private generateHandlersModule(): string {
    return `//! HTTP request handlers

pub mod health;

// Add your handler modules here
// pub mod user;
// pub mod item;
`;
  }

  private generateRoutesModule(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `//! Application routes

use axum::{
    routing::get,
    Router,
};

use crate::{
    app::AppState,
    handlers::health::health_check,
};

/// Create all application routes
pub fn create_routes() -&gt; Router&lt;AppState&gt; {
    Router::new()
        .route(&quot;/health&quot;, get(health_check))
        // API v1 routes
        .nest(&quot;/api/v1&quot;, create_api_v1_routes())
}

/// Create API v1 routes
fn create_api_v1_routes() -&gt; Router&lt;AppState&gt; {
    Router::new()
        .route(&quot;/ping&quot;, get(ping))
        // Add your API routes here
        // .nest(&quot;/users&quot;, user_routes())
        // .nest(&quot;/items&quot;, item_routes())
}

/// Ping endpoint
async fn ping() -&gt; &amp;&#39;static str {
    &quot;pong&quot;
}
`;
  }

  private generateMiddlewareModule(): string {
    return `//! Application middleware

// Add your middleware modules here
// pub mod auth;
// pub mod cors;
// pub mod logging;
`;
  }

  private generateHealthHandler(): string {
    return `use axum::{response::Json, http::StatusCode};
use serde_json::{json, Value};
use chrono::Utc;

/// Health check endpoint
pub async fn health_check() -&gt; (StatusCode, Json&lt;Value&gt;) {
    let health_info = json!({
        &quot;status&quot;: &quot;healthy&quot;,
        &quot;timestamp&quot;: Utc::now(),
        &quot;service&quot;: &quot;api&quot;,
        &quot;version&quot;: env!(&quot;CARGO_PKG_VERSION&quot;)
    });

    (StatusCode::OK, Json(health_info))
}

#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    use super::*;
    use axum_test::TestServer;
    use crate::app::create_app;

    #[tokio::test]
    async fn test_health_check() {
        let app = create_app(/* db_pool if needed */).await.unwrap();
        let server = TestServer::new(app).unwrap();

        let response = server.get(&quot;/health&quot;).await;
        
        assert_eq!(response.status_code(), StatusCode::OK);
        
        let json: serde_json::Value = response.json();
        assert_eq!(json[&quot;status&quot;], &quot;healthy&quot;);
        assert!(json[&quot;timestamp&quot;].is_string());
    }
}
`;
  }

  private generateLibFile(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `//! ${config.name} - ${config.description || &#39;A modern Rust application&#39;}

pub mod app;
pub mod config;
${config.database ? &#39;pub mod database;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
pub mod errors;
pub mod handlers;
pub mod middleware;
pub mod models;
pub mod routes;
pub mod services;

pub use config::Config;
${config.database ? &#39;pub use database::create_pool;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
pub use errors::AppError;

// Re-export commonly used types
pub use axum::{
    extract::{Path, Query, State},
    http::StatusCode,
    response::Json,
    Router,
};
pub use serde::{Deserialize, Serialize};
pub use uuid::Uuid;
`;
  }

    ${
      this.supportedFeatures.includes(&#39;database&#39;)
        ? `/// Create a test database pool
    pub async fn create_test_db_pool() -&gt; PgPool {
        // Implementation would create a test database connection
        // This is a placeholder
        todo!(&quot;Implement test database setup&quot;)
    }`
        : &#39;&#39;
    }
}
`;

  private generateIntegrationTests(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `use axum::http::StatusCode;
use axum_test::TestServer;
${config.database ? &#39;use sqlx::PgPool;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}

use crate::tests::common::{create_test_server${config.database ? &#39;, create_test_db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}};

#[tokio::test]
async fn test_health_endpoint() {
    ${config.database ? &#39;let db_pool = create_test_db_pool().await;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    let server = create_test_server(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}).await;

    let response = server.get(&quot;/health&quot;).await;
    
    assert_eq!(response.status_code(), StatusCode::OK);
    
    let json: serde_json::Value = response.json();
    assert_eq!(json[&quot;status&quot;], &quot;healthy&quot;);
}

#[tokio::test]
async fn test_ping_endpoint() {
    ${config.database ? &#39;let db_pool = create_test_db_pool().await;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    let server = create_test_server(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}).await;

    let response = server.get(&quot;/api/v1/ping&quot;).await;
    
    assert_eq!(response.status_code(), StatusCode::OK);
    assert_eq!(response.text(), &quot;pong&quot;);
}

#[tokio::test]
async fn test_not_found() {
    ${config.database ? &#39;let db_pool = create_test_db_pool().await;&#39; : &#39;&#39;}
    let server = create_test_server(${config.database ? &#39;db_pool&#39; : &#39;&#39;}).await;

    let response = server.get(&quot;/nonexistent&quot;).await;
    
    assert_eq!(response.status_code(), StatusCode::NOT_FOUND);
}
`;
  }

  private generateJustfile(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `# Justfile for ${config.name}

# Show available commands
default:
    @just --list

# Run the application in development mode
dev:
    cargo watch -x run

# Build the application
build:
    cargo build --release

# Run tests
test:
    cargo test

# Run tests with coverage
test-coverage:
    cargo tarpaulin --out html

# Check code without building
check:
    cargo check

# Run clippy lints
lint:
    cargo clippy -- -D warnings

# Format code
fmt:
    cargo fmt

# Fix code formatting and lints
fix:
    cargo fix --allow-dirty --allow-staged
    cargo fmt

# Clean build artifacts
clean:
    cargo clean

# Install development dependencies
install-dev:
    cargo install cargo-watch cargo-tarpaulin

${
  config.database
    ? `# Run database migrations
migrate:
    sqlx migrate run

# Create a new migration
migrate-create name:
    sqlx migrate add {{name}}

# Revert the last migration
migrate-revert:
    sqlx migrate revert`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

${
  config.docker
    ? `# Build Docker image
docker-build:
    docker build -t ${config.name.toLowerCase()}:latest .

# Run Docker container
docker-run:
    docker run --rm -p 3000:3000 ${config.name.toLowerCase()}:latest

# Build and run with Docker Compose
docker-up:
    docker-compose up --build

# Stop Docker Compose
docker-down:
    docker-compose down`
    : &#39;&#39;
}

# Run all checks (format, lint, test)
ci: fmt lint test

# Prepare for commit
pre-commit: fix test
`;
  }

  private generateDockerfile(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    return `# Multi-stage build for Rust application
FROM rust:1.70 as builder

# Create app directory
WORKDIR /app

# Copy manifests
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./

# Build dependencies (this is the caching Docker layer!)
RUN mkdir src &amp;&amp; echo &quot;fn main() {}&quot; &gt; src/main.rs
RUN cargo build --release
RUN rm src/main.rs

# Copy source code
COPY src ./src

# Build application
RUN touch src/main.rs &amp;&amp; cargo build --release

# Runtime stage
FROM debian:bookworm-slim

# Install runtime dependencies
RUN apt-get update &amp;&amp; apt-get install -y \\
    ca-certificates \\
    &amp;&amp; rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Create non-root user
RUN useradd -m -u 1001 appuser

# Copy the binary from builder stage
COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/${config.name.toLowerCase()} /usr/local/bin/app

# Change to non-root user
USER appuser

# Expose port
EXPOSE 3000

# Health check
HEALTHCHECK --interval=30s --timeout=10s --start-period=5s --retries=3 \\
    CMD curl -f http://localhost:3000/health || exit 1

# Run the application
CMD [&quot;app&quot;]
`;
  }

  private generateDockerCompose(config: ProjectConfig): string {
    const dbService =
      config.database === &#39;postgres&#39;
        ? `
  database:
    image: postgres:15-alpine
    environment:
      POSTGRES_USER: ${config.name.toLowerCase()}
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: password
      POSTGRES_DB: ${config.name.toLowerCase()}
    ports:
      - &quot;5432:5432&quot;
    volumes:
      - postgres_data:/var/lib/postgresql/data
    healthcheck:
      test: [&quot;CMD-SHELL&quot;, &quot;pg_isready -U ${config.name.toLowerCase()}&quot;]
      interval: 10s
      timeout: 5s
      retries: 5`
        : &#39;&#39;;

    return `version: &#39;3.8&#39;

services:
  app:
    build: .
    ports:
      - &quot;3000:3000&quot;
    environment:
      - ENVIRONMENT=development
      ${config.database ? `- DATABASE_URL=postgres://${config.name.toLowerCase()}:password@database:5432/${config.name.toLowerCase()}` : &#39;&#39;}
    ${
      config.database
        ? `depends_on:
      database:
        condition: service_healthy`
        : &#39;&#39;
    }
    restart: unless-stopped
${dbService}

${
  config.database === &#39;postgres&#39;
    ? `volumes:
  postgres_data:`
    : &#39;&#39;
}
`;
  }

  private generateProductionDockerfile(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `# Production multi-stage build with distroless
FROM rust:1.70 as builder

WORKDIR /app

# Install build dependencies
RUN apt-get update &amp;&amp; apt-get install -y \\
    pkg-config \\
    libssl-dev \\
    &amp;&amp; rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists/*

# Copy manifests
COPY Cargo.toml Cargo.lock ./

# Build dependencies
RUN mkdir src &amp;&amp; echo &quot;fn main() {}&quot; &gt; src/main.rs
RUN cargo build --release
RUN rm src/main.rs

# Copy source code
COPY src ./src

# Build application with optimizations
RUN touch src/main.rs &amp;&amp; cargo build --release

# Final stage with distroless
FROM gcr.io/distroless/cc-debian12

# Copy the binary from builder stage
COPY --from=builder /app/target/release/app /app

EXPOSE 3000

USER nonroot:nonroot

ENTRYPOINT [&quot;/app&quot;]
`;
  }

  private generateGitHubActions(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `name: Rust Application CI/CD

on:
  push:
    branches: [ main, develop ]
  pull_request:
    branches: [ main ]

env:
  CARGO_TERM_COLOR: always

jobs:
  test:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    
    services:
      postgres:
        image: postgres:15
        env:
          POSTGRES_PASSWORD: postgres
          POSTGRES_DB: test
        options: &gt;-
          --health-cmd pg_isready
          --health-interval 10s
          --health-timeout 5s
          --health-retries 5
        ports:
          - 5432:5432

    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
      with:
        components: rustfmt, clippy
        
    - name: Cache dependencies
      uses: actions/cache@v3
      with:
        path: |
          ~/.cargo/registry
          ~/.cargo/git
          target
        key: \${{ runner.os }}-cargo-\${{ hashFiles(&#39;**/Cargo.lock&#39;) }}
        restore-keys: |
          \${{ runner.os }}-cargo-
    
    - name: Check formatting
      run: cargo fmt -- --check
    
    - name: Run clippy
      run: cargo clippy -- -D warnings
    
    - name: Run tests
      env:
        DATABASE_URL: postgres://postgres:postgres@localhost:5432/test
      run: cargo test --verbose

  ${
    config.target === &#39;production&#39;
      ? `build:
    needs: test
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    if: github.ref == &#39;refs/heads/main&#39;
    
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    
    - name: Install Rust
      uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
    
    - name: Build binary
      run: cargo build --release
    
    - name: Build Docker image
      run: |
        docker build -f Dockerfile.prod -t your-registry/app:$` +
        &#39;{{ github.sha }}&#39; +
        ` .
        docker tag your-registry/app:$` +
        &#39;{{ github.sha }}&#39; +
        ` your-registry/app:latest
    
    - name: Push Docker image
      run: |
        echo &quot;$` +
        &#39;{{ secrets.DOCKER_PASSWORD }}&#39; +
        `&quot; | docker login -u &quot;$` +
        &#39;{{ secrets.DOCKER_USERNAME }}&#39; +
        `&quot; --password-stdin
        docker push your-registry/app:$` +
        `{{ github.sha }}
        docker push your-registry/app:latest`
      : &#39;&#39;
  }

  security-audit:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - uses: actions/checkout@v4
    - uses: dtolnay/rust-toolchain@stable
    - name: Install cargo-audit
      run: cargo install cargo-audit
    - name: Run security audit
      run: cargo audit
`;
  }

  private generateCargoConfig(config: BuildConfig): string {
    return `[target.x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu]
linker = &quot;clang&quot;
rustflags = [&quot;-C&quot;, &quot;link-arg=-fuse-ld=lld&quot;]

[build]
rustc-wrapper = &quot;sccache&quot;

[registries.crates-io]
protocol = &quot;sparse&quot;

${
  config.optimization
    ? `[profile.release]
lto = true
codegen-units = 1
panic = &quot;abort&quot;
strip = true
opt-level = 3`
    : &#39;&#39;
}
`;
  }

  private toPascalCase(str: string): string {
    return str.replace(/(?:^|[-_])(\w)/g, (_, c) =&gt; c.toUpperCase());
  }
}
📄 packages/shared/src/utils.ts
/**
 * Shared utilities for Arbiter CLI and API
 */

/**
 * Format validation errors into a human-readable string
 */
export function formatValidationErrors(
  errors: Array&lt;{
    message: string;
    line?: number;
    column?: number;
    path?: string;
  }&gt;
): string {
  return errors
    .map(error =&gt; {
      let formatted = error.message;
      if (error.path) {
        formatted = `${error.path}: ${formatted}`;
      }
      if (error.line !== undefined) {
        formatted = `${formatted} (line ${error.line}${error.column ? `, column ${error.column}` : &#39;&#39;})`;
      }
      return formatted;
    })
    .join(&#39;\n&#39;);
}

/**
 * Check if a path is relative
 */
export function isRelativePath(path: string): boolean {
  return !path.startsWith(&#39;/&#39;) &amp;&amp; !path.match(/^[a-zA-Z]:\\/);
}

/**
 * Normalize path separators to forward slashes
 */
export function normalizePath(path: string): string {
  return path.replace(/\\/g, &#39;/&#39;);
}

/**
 * Simple debounce utility
 */
export function debounce&lt;T extends (...args: unknown[]) =&gt; void&gt;(
  func: T,
  wait: number
): (...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) =&gt; void {
  let timeout: NodeJS.Timeout;
  return (...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) =&gt; {
    clearTimeout(timeout);
    timeout = setTimeout(() =&gt; func(...args), wait);
  };
}

/**
 * Translate CUE error messages into more user-friendly messages
 */
export function translateCueErrors(
  errorMessage: string
): Array&lt;{ friendlyMessage: string; category: string }&gt; {
  // Simple translation for common CUE error patterns
  const translations = [
    {
      pattern: /.*undefined field.*/i,
      friendlyMessage: &#39;This field is not defined in the schema&#39;,
      category: &#39;schema&#39;,
    },
    {
      pattern: /.*conflicting values.*/i,
      friendlyMessage: &#39;Values conflict with schema requirements&#39;,
      category: &#39;validation&#39;,
    },
    {
      pattern: /.*cannot unify.*/i,
      friendlyMessage: &#39;Cannot combine these values according to the schema&#39;,
      category: &#39;type&#39;,
    },
    {
      pattern: /.*incomplete value.*/i,
      friendlyMessage: &#39;This value is missing required information&#39;,
      category: &#39;validation&#39;,
    },
  ];

  for (const translation of translations) {
    if (translation.pattern.test(errorMessage)) {
      return [
        {
          friendlyMessage: translation.friendlyMessage,
          category: translation.category,
        },
      ];
    }
  }

  // If no pattern matches, return the original message
  return [
    {
      friendlyMessage: errorMessage,
      category: &#39;validation&#39;,
    },
  ];
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/filesystem.ts
import path from &quot;node:path&quot;;
import fs from &quot;fs-extra&quot;;
import { ConstraintViolationError, globalConstraintEnforcer } from &quot;./core.js&quot;;

/**
 * File system operation types that must be constrained
 */
export type FileSystemOperation =
  | &quot;read&quot;
  | &quot;write&quot;
  | &quot;copy&quot;
  | &quot;move&quot;
  | &quot;delete&quot;
  | &quot;create&quot;
  | &quot;bundle&quot;
  | &quot;export&quot;;

/**
 * File system path validation result
 */
export interface PathValidationResult {
  isValid: boolean;
  resolvedPath: string;
  isSymlink: boolean;
  symlinkTarget?: string;
  securityIssues: string[];
}

/**
 * File system constraint enforcer
 * Implements &quot;Don&#39;t emit symlinks&quot; and &quot;standalone/bundle copy files&quot; constraints
 */
export class FileSystemConstraints {
  private readonly maxPathLength = 4096; // Maximum path length
  private readonly maxSymlinkDepth = 0; // No symlinks allowed per constraints
  private readonly allowedExtensions = new Set([
    &quot;.cue&quot;,
    &quot;.json&quot;,
    &quot;.yaml&quot;,
    &quot;.yml&quot;,
    &quot;.md&quot;,
    &quot;.txt&quot;,
    &quot;.ts&quot;,
    &quot;.js&quot;,
    &quot;.py&quot;,
    &quot;.rs&quot;,
    &quot;.go&quot;,
  ]);

  /**
   * Validate a file path for constraint compliance
   */
  async validatePath(
    filePath: string,
    operation: FileSystemOperation,
    operationId?: string,
  ): Promise&lt;PathValidationResult&gt; {
    const result: PathValidationResult = {
      isValid: true,
      resolvedPath: &quot;&quot;,
      isSymlink: false,
      securityIssues: [],
    };

    try {
      // Resolve the path to handle relative paths and symlinks
      const resolvedPath = path.resolve(filePath);
      result.resolvedPath = resolvedPath;

      // Check path length
      if (resolvedPath.length &gt; this.maxPathLength) {
        result.isValid = false;
        result.securityIssues.push(`Path too long: ${resolvedPath.length} &gt; ${this.maxPathLength}`);
      }

      // Check for path traversal attempts
      if (this.hasPathTraversal(resolvedPath)) {
        result.isValid = false;
        result.securityIssues.push(&quot;Path traversal detected&quot;);
      }

      // Check if path exists
      const exists = await fs.pathExists(resolvedPath);
      if (!exists &amp;&amp; (operation === &quot;read&quot; || operation === &quot;copy&quot; || operation === &quot;move&quot;)) {
        result.isValid = false;
        result.securityIssues.push(&quot;Path does not exist&quot;);
      }

      if (exists) {
        // Check for symlinks (not allowed)
        const stats = await fs.lstat(resolvedPath);
        if (stats.isSymbolicLink()) {
          result.isSymlink = true;
          result.symlinkTarget = await fs.readlink(resolvedPath);

          // Symlinks are forbidden per constraint
          result.isValid = false;
          result.securityIssues.push(&quot;Symlinks are not allowed&quot;);

          const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
            &quot;symlinkPrevention&quot;,
            `symlink: ${filePath} -&gt; ${result.symlinkTarget}`,
            &quot;standalone file copy (no symlinks)&quot;,
            {
              operationId,
              operation,
              filePath,
              symlinkTarget: result.symlinkTarget,
              resolvedPath,
            },
          );

          globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;constraint:violation&quot;, {
            constraint: &quot;symlinkPrevention&quot;,
            violation,
            filePath,
          });

          throw violation;
        }

        // Check file extension for security
        const ext = path.extname(resolvedPath).toLowerCase();
        if (ext &amp;&amp; !this.allowedExtensions.has(ext)) {
          result.securityIssues.push(`File extension ${ext} not allowed`);
        }
      }

      // Validate the result
      if (!result.isValid) {
        const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
          &quot;fileSystemValidation&quot;,
          `invalid path: ${filePath}`,
          &quot;valid file system path&quot;,
          {
            operationId,
            operation,
            filePath,
            resolvedPath,
            securityIssues: result.securityIssues,
          },
        );

        globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;constraint:violation&quot;, {
          constraint: &quot;fileSystemValidation&quot;,
          violation,
          filePath,
        });

        throw violation;
      }

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;filesystem:validated&quot;, {
        operationId,
        operation,
        filePath,
        resolvedPath,
      });

      return result;
    } catch (error) {
      if (error instanceof ConstraintViolationError) {
        throw error; // Re-throw constraint violations
      }

      // Convert other errors to constraint violations
      result.isValid = false;
      result.securityIssues.push(
        `File system error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
      );

      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &quot;fileSystemError&quot;,
        error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        &quot;successful file system access&quot;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          filePath,
          originalError: error,
        },
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;constraint:violation&quot;, {
        constraint: &quot;fileSystemError&quot;,
        violation,
        filePath,
      });

      throw violation;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Copy a file ensuring no symlinks are created (standalone copies only)
   */
  async copyFileStandalone(src: string, dest: string, operationId?: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Validate source path
    await this.validatePath(src, &quot;copy&quot;, operationId);

    // Validate destination path (create operation)
    const destDir = path.dirname(dest);
    await fs.ensureDir(destDir);

    try {
      // Read source file content (this dereferences any symlinks)
      const content = await fs.readFile(src);

      // Write content directly to destination (no symlink creation)
      await fs.writeFile(dest, content);

      // Verify the copy was successful and is not a symlink
      const destStats = await fs.lstat(dest);
      if (destStats.isSymbolicLink()) {
        // This should not happen with writeFile, but check anyway
        await fs.remove(dest);
        throw new ConstraintViolationError(
          &quot;symlinkPrevention&quot;,
          &quot;symlink created during copy&quot;,
          &quot;standalone file copy&quot;,
          {
            operationId,
            src,
            dest,
          },
        );
      }

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;filesystem:copied&quot;, {
        operationId,
        src,
        dest,
        size: content.length,
      });
    } catch (error) {
      if (error instanceof ConstraintViolationError) {
        throw error;
      }

      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &quot;fileSystemCopy&quot;,
        error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        &quot;successful standalone file copy&quot;,
        {
          operationId,
          src,
          dest,
          originalError: error,
        },
      );

      throw violation;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Bundle files into a directory ensuring all are standalone copies
   */
  async bundleFiles(files: string[], outputDir: string, operationId?: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Ensure output directory exists
    await fs.ensureDir(outputDir);

    const bundleId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(`bundle:${outputDir}`, {
      fileCount: files.length,
      outputDir,
    });

    try {
      // Process files in parallel with concurrency limit
      const concurrency = 5;
      const chunks = this.chunkArray(files, concurrency);

      for (const chunk of chunks) {
        await Promise.all(
          chunk.map(async (file) =&gt; {
            const fileName = path.basename(file);
            const destPath = path.join(outputDir, fileName);

            // Ensure unique names to prevent conflicts
            const uniqueDestPath = await this.ensureUniqueFileName(destPath);

            await this.copyFileStandalone(file, uniqueDestPath, bundleId);
          }),
        );
      }

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;filesystem:bundled&quot;, {
        operationId,
        bundleId,
        fileCount: files.length,
        outputDir,
      });
    } finally {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(bundleId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Export files with constraint validation
   */
  async exportFiles(
    files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
    outputDir: string,
    operationId?: string,
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await fs.ensureDir(outputDir);

    const exportId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(`export:${outputDir}`, {
      fileCount: Object.keys(files).length,
      outputDir,
    });

    try {
      // Validate and write each file
      for (const [relativePath, content] of Object.entries(files)) {
        const fullPath = path.join(outputDir, relativePath);
        const dir = path.dirname(fullPath);

        // Ensure directory exists
        await fs.ensureDir(dir);

        // Validate the output path
        await this.validatePath(fullPath, &quot;export&quot;, exportId);

        // Validate content size
        globalConstraintEnforcer.validatePayloadSize(content, exportId);

        // Write file (never create symlinks)
        await fs.writeFile(fullPath, content, &quot;utf8&quot;);

        // Verify no symlink was created
        const stats = await fs.lstat(fullPath);
        if (stats.isSymbolicLink()) {
          await fs.remove(fullPath);
          throw new ConstraintViolationError(
            &quot;symlinkPrevention&quot;,
            &quot;symlink created during export&quot;,
            &quot;standalone file&quot;,
            {
              operationId: exportId,
              filePath: fullPath,
            },
          );
        }
      }

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&quot;filesystem:exported&quot;, {
        operationId,
        exportId,
        fileCount: Object.keys(files).length,
        outputDir,
      });
    } finally {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(exportId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Check for path traversal attempts
   */
  private hasPathTraversal(filePath: string): boolean {
    const normalized = path.normalize(filePath);
    return normalized.includes(&quot;../&quot;) || normalized.includes(&quot;..\\&quot;);
  }

  /**
   * Ensure unique file name to prevent conflicts during bundling
   */
  private async ensureUniqueFileName(filePath: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    let uniquePath = filePath;
    let counter = 1;

    while (await fs.pathExists(uniquePath)) {
      const ext = path.extname(filePath);
      const base = path.basename(filePath, ext);
      const dir = path.dirname(filePath);
      uniquePath = path.join(dir, `${base}_${counter}${ext}`);
      counter++;
    }

    return uniquePath;
  }

  /**
   * Chunk array for parallel processing
   */
  private chunkArray&lt;T&gt;(array: T[], size: number): T[][] {
    const chunks: T[][] = [];
    for (let i = 0; i &lt; array.length; i += size) {
      chunks.push(array.slice(i, i + size));
    }
    return chunks;
  }

  /**
   * Get file system constraint status
   */
  getConstraintStatus(): {
    maxPathLength: number;
    maxSymlinkDepth: number;
    allowedExtensions: string[];
    violations: {
      symlinks: number;
      pathTraversal: number;
      invalidPaths: number;
    };
  } {
    return {
      maxPathLength: this.maxPathLength,
      maxSymlinkDepth: this.maxSymlinkDepth,
      allowedExtensions: Array.from(this.allowedExtensions),
      violations: {
        symlinks: 0, // Would be tracked via event listeners
        pathTraversal: 0,
        invalidPaths: 0,
      },
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Global file system constraints instance
 */
export const globalFileSystemConstraints = new FileSystemConstraints();

/**
 * Decorator for automatic file system constraint enforcement
 */
export function withFileSystemConstraints(operation: FileSystemOperation) {
  return &lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;&gt;(
    _target: any,
    propertyName: string,
    descriptor: TypedPropertyDescriptor&lt;T&gt;,
  ) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value!;

    descriptor.value = async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) {
      const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(`fs:${operation}`, {
        method: propertyName,
        args: args.length,
      });

      try {
        // Validate file paths in arguments if they exist
        for (const arg of args) {
          if (typeof arg === &quot;string&quot; &amp;&amp; (arg.includes(&quot;/&quot;) || arg.includes(&quot;\\&quot;))) {
            await globalFileSystemConstraints.validatePath(arg, operation, operationId);
          }
        }

        const result = await method.apply(this, args);
        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        throw error;
      }
    } as T;

    return descriptor;
  };
}

/**
 * Utility function for safe file operations with constraint enforcement
 */
export async function safeFileOperation&lt;T&gt;(
  operation: FileSystemOperation,
  filePath: string,
  fn: (validatedPath: string) =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;,
  operationId?: string,
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  const validation = await globalFileSystemConstraints.validatePath(
    filePath,
    operation,
    operationId,
  );
  return await fn(validation.resolvedPath);
}

/**
 * Utility to copy files ensuring no symlinks (implements &quot;standalone/bundle copy files&quot; constraint)
 */
export async function copyStandalone(
  src: string,
  dest: string,
  operationId?: string,
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  return globalFileSystemConstraints.copyFileStandalone(src, dest, operationId);
}

/**
 * Utility to bundle multiple files ensuring all are standalone copies
 */
export async function bundleStandalone(
  files: string[],
  outputDir: string,
  operationId?: string,
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  return globalFileSystemConstraints.bundleFiles(files, outputDir, operationId);
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/surface.ts
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { glob } from &#39;glob&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { withStepProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;
import { resolveSmartNaming } from &#39;../utils/smart-naming.js&#39;;
import {
  type SurfaceOutput,
  createOutputManager,
  shouldUseAgentMode,
} from &#39;../utils/standardized-output.js&#39;;

import type { APISurface, APISymbol, SurfaceOptions } from &#39;../surface-extraction/types.js&#39;;
import { getExtractor } from &#39;../surface-extraction/index.js&#39;;
import { calculateSurfaceDelta } from &#39;../surface-extraction/delta.js&#39;;

export type { APISurface } from &#39;../surface-extraction/types.js&#39;;

/**
 * Surface command implementation
 * Extracts API surface from source code and generates surface.json for diff analysis
 */
export async function surfaceCommand(options: SurfaceOptions, _config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const agentMode = shouldUseAgentMode(options);
  const outputManager = createOutputManager(&#39;surface&#39;, agentMode, options.ndjsonOutput);

  // Define the steps for surface extraction
  const steps = [
    &#39;Resolving project configuration&#39;,
    &#39;Scanning source files&#39;,
    &#39;Analyzing code structure&#39;,
    &#39;Extracting API symbols&#39;,
    &#39;Generating surface definition&#39;,
    &#39;Writing output file&#39;,
  ];

  return withStepProgress(
    {
      title: `Extracting ${options.language} API surface`,
      steps,
      color: &#39;blue&#39;,
    },
    async progress =&gt; {
      try {
        // Step 1: Resolve smart naming for output file
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(&#39;Resolving project configuration&#39;);
        } else {
          progress.log(&#39;Resolving project configuration&#39;);
        }
        const namingResult = await resolveSmartNaming(&#39;surface&#39;, {
          output: options.output,
          outputDir: options.outputDir,
          projectName: options.projectName,
          useGenericNames: options.genericNames ?? false,
        });

        // Emit start event for agent mode
        outputManager.emitEvent({
          phase: &#39;surface&#39;,
          status: &#39;start&#39;,
          data: {
            language: options.language,
            outputFile: namingResult.filename,
            projectName: namingResult.context.name,
          },
        });

        if (!agentMode &amp;&amp; namingResult.context.name) {
          console.log(chalk.dim(`   Project: ${namingResult.context.name}`));
          console.log(chalk.dim(`   Output: ${namingResult.filename}`));
        }

        // Step 2: Scan source files
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(&#39;Scanning source files&#39;);
        } else {
          progress.log(&#39;Scanning source files&#39;);
        }
        const sourceFiles = await findSourceFiles(options.language);

        if (sourceFiles.length === 0) {
          if (&#39;failCurrentStep&#39; in progress) {
            progress.failCurrentStep(`No ${options.language} files found`);
          } else {
            progress.error(`No ${options.language} files found`);
          }
          return 1;
        }

        // Step 3: Analyze code structure
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(`Analyzing code structure (${sourceFiles.length} files)`);
        } else {
          progress.log(`Analyzing code structure (${sourceFiles.length} files)`);
        }

        // Step 4: Extract API symbols
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(&#39;Extracting API symbols&#39;);
        } else {
          progress.log(&#39;Extracting API symbols&#39;);
        }
        const surface = await extractAPISurface(options, sourceFiles);

        if (!surface) {
          if (&#39;failCurrentStep&#39; in progress) {
            progress.failCurrentStep(&#39;Failed to extract API surface&#39;);
          } else {
            progress.error(&#39;Failed to extract API surface&#39;);
          }
          outputManager.emitEvent({
            phase: &#39;surface&#39;,
            status: &#39;error&#39;,
            error: &#39;Failed to extract API surface&#39;,
          });
          return 1;
        }

        // Step 5: Generate surface definition and calculate delta if requested
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(&#39;Generating surface definition&#39;);
        } else {
          progress.log(&#39;Generating surface definition&#39;);
        }
        let delta;
        if (options.diff) {
          delta = await calculateSurfaceDelta(surface, namingResult.fullPath);
        }

        // Create standardized surface output
        const surfaceOutput: SurfaceOutput = {
          apiVersion: &#39;arbiter.dev/v2&#39;,
          timestamp: Date.now(),
          command: &#39;surface&#39;,
          kind: &#39;Surface&#39;,
          language: options.language,
          surface: {
            symbols: surface.symbols.map(s =&gt; ({
              name: s.name,
              type: s.type,
              visibility: s.visibility,
              signature: s.signature,
              location: s.location,
            })),
            statistics: surface.statistics,
          },
          delta,
        };

        // Step 6: Write output file
        if (&#39;nextStep&#39; in progress) {
          progress.nextStep(&#39;Writing output file&#39;);
        } else {
          progress.log(&#39;Writing output file&#39;);
        }
        await outputManager.writeSurfaceFile(surfaceOutput, namingResult.fullPath);

        if (!agentMode) {
          console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nStatistics:&#39;));
          console.log(`  Total symbols: ${surface.statistics.totalSymbols}`);
          console.log(`  Public symbols: ${surface.statistics.publicSymbols}`);
          console.log(`  Private symbols: ${surface.statistics.privateSymbols}`);

          // Show breakdown by type
          for (const [type, count] of Object.entries(surface.statistics.byType)) {
            console.log(`  ${type}: ${count}`);
          }

          if (delta) {
            console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n⚠️  API changes detected:&#39;));
            if (delta.added &gt; 0) {
              console.log(chalk.green(`  + ${delta.added} added symbols`));
            }
            if (delta.removed &gt; 0) {
              console.log(chalk.red(`  - ${delta.removed} removed symbols`));
            }
            if (delta.breaking) {
              console.log(
                chalk.red(`  🚨 Breaking changes detected - ${delta.requiredBump} bump recommended`)
              );
            }
          }
        }

        // Emit completion event
        outputManager.emitEvent({
          phase: &#39;surface&#39;,
          status: &#39;complete&#39;,
          data: {
            symbols: surface.statistics.totalSymbols,
            delta,
          },
        });

        outputManager.close();
        return 0;
      } catch (error) {
        const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);

        if (!agentMode) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Surface command failed:&#39;), errorMessage);
        }

        outputManager.emitEvent({
          phase: &#39;surface&#39;,
          status: &#39;error&#39;,
          error: errorMessage,
        });

        outputManager.close();
        return 1;
      }
    }
  );
}

/**
 * Find source files for the specified language
 */
async function findSourceFiles(language: string): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
  const patterns: Record&lt;string, string[]&gt; = {
    typescript: [&#39;**/*.ts&#39;, &#39;**/*.tsx&#39;],
    python: [&#39;**/*.py&#39;],
    rust: [&#39;**/*.rs&#39;],
    go: [&#39;**/*.go&#39;],
    bash: [&#39;**/*.sh&#39;, &#39;**/*.bash&#39;],
  };

  const ignorePatterns = [
    &#39;node_modules/**&#39;,
    &#39;dist/**&#39;,
    &#39;build/**&#39;,
    &#39;target/**&#39;,
    &#39;**/*.test.*&#39;,
    &#39;**/*.spec.*&#39;,
    &#39;**/*_test.*&#39;,
    &#39;**/__tests__/**&#39;,
    &#39;**/.git/**&#39;,
  ];

  const files = await glob(patterns[language] || [], {
    ignore: ignorePatterns,
  });

  return files;
}

/**
 * Extract API surface based on language
 */
async function extractAPISurface(
  options: SurfaceOptions,
  sourceFiles: string[]
): Promise&lt;APISurface | null&gt; {
  const extractor = getExtractor(options.language);
  if (extractor) {
    return extractor(options, sourceFiles);
  }

  switch (options.language) {
    default:
      throw new Error(`Unsupported language: ${options.language}`);
  }
}

/**
 * Calculate surface delta between current and previous versions
 */
📄 packages/cli/src/connection-validator.ts
import { COMMON_PORTS } from &#39;./config.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

/**
 * Connection validation and auto-discovery utility
 */
export class ConnectionValidator {
  constructor(private config: CLIConfig) {}

  /**
   * Validate server connection with auto-discovery fallback
   */
  async validateConnection(): Promise&lt;{
    success: boolean;
    url?: string;
    port?: number;
    error?: string;
    suggestions?: string[];
  }&gt; {
    const baseUrl = new URL(this.config.apiUrl);
    const hostname = baseUrl.hostname;
    const protocol = baseUrl.protocol;
    const configuredPort = Number.parseInt(baseUrl.port, 10) || (protocol === &#39;https:&#39; ? 443 : 80);

    // First try configured URL
    const configuredResult = await this.testConnection(
      `${protocol}//${hostname}:${configuredPort}`
    );
    if (configuredResult.success) {
      return {
        success: true,
        url: `${protocol}//${hostname}:${configuredPort}`,
        port: configuredPort,
      };
    }

    // Try common ports for auto-discovery
    const suggestions: string[] = [];
    for (const port of COMMON_PORTS) {
      const testUrl = `${protocol}//${hostname}:${port}`;
      const result = await this.testConnection(testUrl);

      if (result.success) {
        return {
          success: true,
          url: testUrl,
          port: port,
        };
      }

      if (result.partialSuccess) {
        suggestions.push(`Port ${port}: ${result.error}`);
      }
    }

    return {
      success: false,
      error: `No Arbiter server found at ${hostname}`,
      suggestions: [
        `Tried ports: ${COMMON_PORTS.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
        &#39;Make sure the server is running with: bun run dev&#39;,
        &#39;Or with Docker: docker-compose up&#39;,
        ...suggestions,
      ],
    };
  }

  /**
   * Test connection to a specific URL
   */
  private async testConnection(url: string): Promise&lt;{
    success: boolean;
    partialSuccess: boolean;
    error?: string;
  }&gt; {
    try {
      const controller = new AbortController();
      const timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), 3000);

      const response = await fetch(`${url}/health`, {
        signal: controller.signal,
        method: &#39;GET&#39;,
      });

      clearTimeout(timeoutId);

      if (response.ok) {
        const data = await response.json();
        // Verify it&#39;s actually an Arbiter server
        if (data.status &amp;&amp; typeof data.timestamp === &#39;string&#39;) {
          return { success: true, partialSuccess: true };
        }
      }

      return {
        success: false,
        partialSuccess: true,
        error: `Server responded with ${response.status}`,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      if (error instanceof Error) {
        if (error.name === &#39;AbortError&#39;) {
          return {
            success: false,
            partialSuccess: true,
            error: &#39;Connection timeout&#39;,
          };
        }

        if (error.message.includes(&#39;ECONNREFUSED&#39;)) {
          return {
            success: false,
            partialSuccess: false,
            error: &#39;Connection refused&#39;,
          };
        }
      }

      return {
        success: false,
        partialSuccess: false,
        error: &#39;Network error&#39;,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get diagnostic information for troubleshooting
   */
  async getDiagnostics(): Promise&lt;{
    configuredUrl: string;
    commonPorts: readonly number[];
    networkTests: Array&lt;{
      port: number;
      status: &#39;success&#39; | &#39;timeout&#39; | &#39;refused&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
      responseTime?: number;
      error?: string;
    }&gt;;
  }&gt; {
    const baseUrl = new URL(this.config.apiUrl);
    const hostname = baseUrl.hostname;
    const protocol = baseUrl.protocol;

    const networkTests = await Promise.all(
      COMMON_PORTS.map(async port =&gt; {
        const startTime = Date.now();
        const testUrl = `${protocol}//${hostname}:${port}`;

        try {
          const controller = new AbortController();
          const timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; controller.abort(), 2000);

          const response = await fetch(`${testUrl}/health`, {
            signal: controller.signal,
          });

          clearTimeout(timeoutId);
          const responseTime = Date.now() - startTime;

          return {
            port,
            status: response.ok ? (&#39;success&#39; as const) : (&#39;error&#39; as const),
            responseTime,
            error: response.ok ? undefined : `HTTP ${response.status}`,
          };
        } catch (error) {
          const responseTime = Date.now() - startTime;

          if (error instanceof Error) {
            if (error.name === &#39;AbortError&#39;) {
              return { port, status: &#39;timeout&#39; as const, responseTime };
            }

            if (error.message.includes(&#39;ECONNREFUSED&#39;)) {
              return { port, status: &#39;refused&#39; as const, responseTime };
            }
          }

          return {
            port,
            status: &#39;error&#39; as const,
            responseTime,
            error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
          };
        }
      })
    );

    return {
      configuredUrl: this.config.apiUrl,
      commonPorts: COMMON_PORTS,
      networkTests,
    };
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/diff.ts
import fs from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;

export interface DiffOptions {
  migration?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;text&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  context?: number;
  summary?: boolean;
}

export interface SchemaChange {
  type: &#39;added&#39; | &#39;removed&#39; | &#39;modified&#39;;
  category: &#39;constraint&#39; | &#39;field&#39; | &#39;import&#39; | &#39;package&#39; | &#39;comment&#39;;
  location: string;
  old_value?: string;
  new_value?: string;
  impact: &#39;breaking&#39; | &#39;compatible&#39; | &#39;neutral&#39;;
  description: string;
  line_number?: number;
  migration_hint?: string;
}

export interface SchemaDiff {
  summary: {
    total_changes: number;
    breaking_changes: number;
    added: number;
    removed: number;
    modified: number;
  };
  changes: SchemaChange[];
  migration_needed: boolean;
  compatibility_score: number; // 0-100, higher is more compatible
}

/**
 * Parse CUE file and extract structural information
 */
async function parseCueStructure(filePath: string): Promise&lt;Map&lt;string, string&gt;&gt; {
  const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
  const lines = content.split(&#39;\n&#39;);
  const structure = new Map&lt;string, string&gt;();

  const currentPath: string[] = [];
  let inMultiLineComment = false;
  let _braceDepth = 0;

  for (let i = 0; i &lt; lines.length; i++) {
    const line = lines[i];
    const trimmed = line.trim();
    const _lineNumber = i + 1;

    // Skip empty lines
    if (!trimmed) continue;

    // Handle multi-line comments
    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;/*&#39;)) {
      inMultiLineComment = true;
      continue;
    }
    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;*/&#39;)) {
      inMultiLineComment = false;
      continue;
    }
    if (inMultiLineComment) continue;

    // Skip single-line comments
    if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;//&#39;)) continue;

    // Package declaration
    if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;package &#39;)) {
      const packageName = trimmed.replace(&#39;package &#39;, &#39;&#39;);
      structure.set(&#39;package&#39;, packageName);
      continue;
    }

    // Import statements
    if (trimmed.startsWith(&#39;import &#39;)) {
      const importMatch = trimmed.match(/import\s+(?:(\w+)\s+)?&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;/);
      if (importMatch) {
        const importPath = importMatch[2];
        const importAlias = importMatch[1] || path.basename(importPath);
        structure.set(`import.${importAlias}`, importPath);
      }
      continue;
    }

    // Field definitions and constraints
    const fieldMatch = trimmed.match(/^(\w+):\s*(.+)$/);
    if (fieldMatch) {
      const fieldName = fieldMatch[1];
      const fieldValue = fieldMatch[2];
      const fullPath = currentPath.length &gt; 0 ? `${currentPath.join(&#39;.&#39;)}.${fieldName}` : fieldName;
      structure.set(fullPath, fieldValue);
      continue;
    }

    // Constraint definitions (starting with #)
    const constraintMatch = trimmed.match(/^#(\w+):\s*\{?(.*)$/);
    if (constraintMatch) {
      const constraintName = constraintMatch[1];
      const constraintValue = constraintMatch[2];
      structure.set(`constraint.${constraintName}`, constraintValue);
      if (trimmed.endsWith(&#39;{&#39;)) {
        currentPath.push(`constraint.${constraintName}`);
        _braceDepth++;
      }
      continue;
    }

    // Handle braces for nesting
    const openBraces = (line.match(/\{/g) || []).length;
    const closeBraces = (line.match(/\}/g) || []).length;

    _braceDepth += openBraces - closeBraces;

    if (closeBraces &gt; 0) {
      // Pop from current path for each closing brace
      for (let j = 0; j &lt; closeBraces; j++) {
        if (currentPath.length &gt; 0) {
          currentPath.pop();
        }
      }
    }

    if (openBraces &gt; closeBraces) {
      // This line opened more braces than it closed
      const fieldName = trimmed.replace(/\s*\{.*$/, &#39;&#39;).replace(/:.*$/, &#39;&#39;);
      if (fieldName &amp;&amp; fieldName !== trimmed) {
        const fullPath =
          currentPath.length &gt; 0 ? `${currentPath.join(&#39;.&#39;)}.${fieldName}` : fieldName;
        currentPath.push(fullPath);
      }
    }
  }

  return structure;
}

/**
 * Compare two schema structures and generate diff
 */
function compareSchemas(
  oldStructure: Map&lt;string, string&gt;,
  newStructure: Map&lt;string, string&gt;
): SchemaChange[] {
  const changes: SchemaChange[] = [];
  const allKeys = new Set([...oldStructure.keys(), ...newStructure.keys()]);

  for (const key of allKeys) {
    const oldValue = oldStructure.get(key);
    const newValue = newStructure.get(key);

    if (oldValue &amp;&amp; !newValue) {
      // Field was removed
      const change: SchemaChange = {
        type: &#39;removed&#39;,
        category: getCategoryFromKey(key),
        location: key,
        old_value: oldValue,
        impact: getRemovalImpact(key, oldValue),
        description: `Removed ${getCategoryFromKey(key)}: ${key}`,
        migration_hint: getRemovalMigrationHint(key, oldValue),
      };
      changes.push(change);
    } else if (!oldValue &amp;&amp; newValue) {
      // Field was added
      const change: SchemaChange = {
        type: &#39;added&#39;,
        category: getCategoryFromKey(key),
        location: key,
        new_value: newValue,
        impact: getAdditionImpact(key, newValue),
        description: `Added ${getCategoryFromKey(key)}: ${key}`,
        migration_hint: getAdditionMigrationHint(key, newValue),
      };
      changes.push(change);
    } else if (oldValue &amp;&amp; newValue &amp;&amp; oldValue !== newValue) {
      // Field was modified
      const change: SchemaChange = {
        type: &#39;modified&#39;,
        category: getCategoryFromKey(key),
        location: key,
        old_value: oldValue,
        new_value: newValue,
        impact: getModificationImpact(key, oldValue, newValue),
        description: `Modified ${getCategoryFromKey(key)}: ${key}`,
        migration_hint: getModificationMigrationHint(key, oldValue, newValue),
      };
      changes.push(change);
    }
  }

  return changes.sort((a, b) =&gt; {
    // Sort by impact (breaking first), then by location
    const impactOrder = { breaking: 0, compatible: 1, neutral: 2 };
    if (impactOrder[a.impact] !== impactOrder[b.impact]) {
      return impactOrder[a.impact] - impactOrder[b.impact];
    }
    return a.location.localeCompare(b.location);
  });
}

/**
 * Determine category from key path
 */
function getCategoryFromKey(key: string): SchemaChange[&#39;category&#39;] {
  if (key === &#39;package&#39;) return &#39;package&#39;;
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;import.&#39;)) return &#39;import&#39;;
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;constraint.&#39;)) return &#39;constraint&#39;;
  if (key.includes(&#39;validation&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;rules&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;limit&#39;))
    return &#39;constraint&#39;;
  return &#39;field&#39;;
}

/**
 * Determine impact of removal
 */
function getRemovalImpact(key: string, _value: string): SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;] {
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;constraint.&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;validation&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;required&#39;)) {
    return &#39;breaking&#39;;
  }
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;import.&#39;)) {
    return &#39;breaking&#39;;
  }
  return &#39;compatible&#39;;
}

/**
 * Determine impact of addition
 */
function getAdditionImpact(key: string, value: string): SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;] {
  if (key.includes(&#39;required&#39;) || (key.includes(&#39;constraint&#39;) &amp;&amp; value.includes(&#39;&amp;&#39;))) {
    return &#39;breaking&#39;;
  }
  return &#39;compatible&#39;;
}

/**
 * Determine impact of modification
 */
function getModificationImpact(
  key: string,
  oldValue: string,
  newValue: string
): SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;] {
  // Check for constraint tightening
  if (key.includes(&#39;limit&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;constraint&#39;)) {
    if (isConstraintTighter(oldValue, newValue)) {
      return &#39;breaking&#39;;
    }
  }

  // Check for type changes
  if (hasTypeChange(oldValue, newValue)) {
    return &#39;breaking&#39;;
  }

  return &#39;compatible&#39;;
}

/**
 * Check if constraint became tighter
 */
function isConstraintTighter(oldValue: string, newValue: string): boolean {
  // Extract numeric limits
  const oldLimit = extractNumericValue(oldValue);
  const newLimit = extractNumericValue(newValue);

  if (oldLimit !== null &amp;&amp; newLimit !== null) {
    // Check if limit became stricter
    if (oldValue.includes(&#39;&gt;&#39;) &amp;&amp; newValue.includes(&#39;&gt;&#39;)) {
      return newLimit &gt; oldLimit; // Higher minimum is stricter
    }
    if (oldValue.includes(&#39;&lt;&#39;) &amp;&amp; newValue.includes(&#39;&lt;&#39;)) {
      return newLimit &lt; oldLimit; // Lower maximum is stricter
    }
  }

  // Check for additional constraints
  const oldConstraints = oldValue.split(&#39;&amp;&#39;).length;
  const newConstraints = newValue.split(&#39;&amp;&#39;).length;
  return newConstraints &gt; oldConstraints;
}

/**
 * Check if there&#39;s a type change
 */
function hasTypeChange(oldValue: string, newValue: string): boolean {
  const oldType = extractType(oldValue);
  const newType = extractType(newValue);
  return oldType !== newType &amp;&amp; oldType !== null &amp;&amp; newType !== null;
}

/**
 * Extract numeric value from constraint
 */
function extractNumericValue(value: string): number | null {
  const numMatch = value.match(/([&gt;&lt;]=?)\s*([0-9]+(?:\.[0-9]+)?)/);
  return numMatch ? Number.parseFloat(numMatch[2]) : null;
}

/**
 * Extract type from value
 */
function extractType(value: string): string | null {
  const typeMatch = value.match(/\b(string|number|bool|int|float)\b/);
  return typeMatch ? typeMatch[1] : null;
}

/**
 * Generate migration hints
 */
function getRemovalMigrationHint(key: string, value: string): string {
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;constraint.&#39;)) {
    return `Update existing data to work without the ${key.replace(&#39;constraint.&#39;, &#39;&#39;)} constraint`;
  }
  if (key.startsWith(&#39;import.&#39;)) {
    return `Remove usage of ${value} from dependent schemas`;
  }
  return `Remove references to ${key} from configuration values`;
}

function getAdditionMigrationHint(key: string, _value: string): string {
  if (key.includes(&#39;required&#39;) || key.includes(&#39;constraint&#39;)) {
    return `Ensure existing data satisfies the new ${key} constraint`;
  }
  return `New field ${key} is available for use`;
}

function getModificationMigrationHint(key: string, oldValue: string, newValue: string): string {
  if (isConstraintTighter(oldValue, newValue)) {
    return `Update existing data to satisfy stricter constraint: ${newValue}`;
  }
  if (hasTypeChange(oldValue, newValue)) {
    return `Convert existing values from ${extractType(oldValue)} to ${extractType(newValue)}`;
  }
  return `Update references to ${key} to use new value: ${newValue}`;
}

/**
 * Calculate compatibility score
 */
function calculateCompatibilityScore(changes: SchemaChange[]): number {
  if (changes.length === 0) return 100;

  let score = 100;
  for (const change of changes) {
    switch (change.impact) {
      case &#39;breaking&#39;:
        score -= 20;
        break;
      case &#39;compatible&#39;:
        score -= 5;
        break;
      case &#39;neutral&#39;:
        score -= 1;
        break;
    }
  }

  return Math.max(0, Math.min(100, score));
}

/**
 * Generate diff summary
 */
function generateSummary(changes: SchemaChange[]): SchemaDiff[&#39;summary&#39;] {
  const summary = {
    total_changes: changes.length,
    breaking_changes: changes.filter(c =&gt; c.impact === &#39;breaking&#39;).length,
    added: changes.filter(c =&gt; c.type === &#39;added&#39;).length,
    removed: changes.filter(c =&gt; c.type === &#39;removed&#39;).length,
    modified: changes.filter(c =&gt; c.type === &#39;modified&#39;).length,
  };

  return summary;
}

/**
 * Format diff for text output
 */
function formatDiffText(diff: SchemaDiff, options: DiffOptions): string {
  let output = &#39;&#39;;

  // Header
  output += chalk.cyan(&#39;Schema Evolution Analysis\n&#39;);
  output += `${chalk.dim(&#39;=&#39;.repeat(50))}\n\n`;

  // Summary
  output += chalk.bold(&#39;Summary:\n&#39;);
  output += `  Total changes: ${diff.summary.total_changes}\n`;
  output += `  Breaking changes: ${chalk.red(diff.summary.breaking_changes)}\n`;
  output += `  Added: ${chalk.green(diff.summary.added)}\n`;
  output += `  Removed: ${chalk.red(diff.summary.removed)}\n`;
  output += `  Modified: ${chalk.yellow(diff.summary.modified)}\n`;
  output += `  Compatibility score: ${getCompatibilityColor(diff.compatibility_score)}${diff.compatibility_score}/100${chalk.reset()}\n`;
  output += `  Migration needed: ${diff.migration_needed ? chalk.red(&#39;Yes&#39;) : chalk.green(&#39;No&#39;)}\n\n`;

  if (options.summary) {
    return output;
  }

  // Changes
  if (diff.changes.length &gt; 0) {
    output += chalk.bold(&#39;Changes:\n\n&#39;);

    for (const change of diff.changes) {
      const icon = getChangeIcon(change.type, change.impact);
      const color = getChangeColor(change.impact);

      output += `${icon} ${color}${change.description}${chalk.reset()}\n`;
      output += `  Location: ${chalk.dim(change.location)}\n`;

      if (change.old_value) {
        output += `  Old: ${chalk.red(change.old_value)}\n`;
      }
      if (change.new_value) {
        output += `  New: ${chalk.green(change.new_value)}\n`;
      }

      output += `  Impact: ${getImpactLabel(change.impact)}\n`;

      if (options.migration &amp;&amp; change.migration_hint) {
        output += `  Migration: ${chalk.yellow(change.migration_hint)}\n`;
      }

      output += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }
  } else {
    output += chalk.green(&#39;✓ No changes detected\n&#39;);
  }

  return output;
}

/**
 * Get appropriate color for compatibility score
 */
function getCompatibilityColor(score: number): string {
  if (score &gt;= 80) return chalk.green.toString();
  if (score &gt;= 60) return chalk.yellow.toString();
  return chalk.red.toString();
}

/**
 * Get icon for change type and impact
 */
function getChangeIcon(type: SchemaChange[&#39;type&#39;], impact: SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;]): string {
  if (impact === &#39;breaking&#39;) return chalk.red(&#39;💥&#39;);

  switch (type) {
    case &#39;added&#39;:
      return chalk.green(&#39;➕&#39;);
    case &#39;removed&#39;:
      return chalk.red(&#39;➖&#39;);
    case &#39;modified&#39;:
      return chalk.yellow(&#39;🔧&#39;);
    default:
      return &#39;•&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Get color for change impact
 */
