function getChangeColor(impact: SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;]): typeof chalk.green {
  switch (impact) {
    case &#39;breaking&#39;:
      return chalk.red;
    case &#39;compatible&#39;:
      return chalk.green;
    case &#39;neutral&#39;:
      return chalk.dim;
    default:
      return chalk.white;
  }
}

/**
 * Get impact label
 */
function getImpactLabel(impact: SchemaChange[&#39;impact&#39;]): string {
  switch (impact) {
    case &#39;breaking&#39;:
      return chalk.red(&#39;BREAKING&#39;);
    case &#39;compatible&#39;:
      return chalk.green(&#39;Compatible&#39;);
    case &#39;neutral&#39;:
      return chalk.dim(&#39;Neutral&#39;);
    default:
      return &#39;Unknown&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Generate migration script
 */
function generateMigrationScript(diff: SchemaDiff): string {
  const breakingChanges = diff.changes.filter(c =&gt; c.impact === &#39;breaking&#39;);
  if (breakingChanges.length === 0) {
    return &#39;# No migration needed - all changes are backward compatible\n&#39;;
  }

  let script = &#39;# Schema Migration Script\n&#39;;
  script += `# Generated: ${new Date().toISOString()}\n\n`;
  script += &#39;# Breaking changes require manual review and data migration\n\n&#39;;

  for (const change of breakingChanges) {
    script += `# ${change.description}\n`;
    script += `# Location: ${change.location}\n`;
    if (change.migration_hint) {
      script += `# Action required: ${change.migration_hint}\n`;
    }
    script += &#39;\n&#39;;
  }

  return script;
}

/**
 * Diff command - Compare two schema versions
 */
export async function diffCommand(
  oldFile: string,
  newFile: string,
  options: DiffOptions = {}
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    // Check if files exist
    try {
      await fs.access(oldFile);
      await fs.access(newFile);
    } catch (error) {
      console.error(
        chalk.red(&#39;File not found:&#39;),
        error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
      );
      return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.dim(`Comparing ${oldFile} → ${newFile}`));
    console.log();

    // Parse both schemas
    const oldStructure = await parseCueStructure(oldFile);
    const newStructure = await parseCueStructure(newFile);

    // Generate diff
    const changes = compareSchemas(oldStructure, newStructure);
    const summary = generateSummary(changes);
    const compatibilityScore = calculateCompatibilityScore(changes);
    const migrationNeeded = changes.some(c =&gt; c.impact === &#39;breaking&#39;);

    const diff: SchemaDiff = {
      summary,
      changes,
      migration_needed: migrationNeeded,
      compatibility_score: compatibilityScore,
    };

    // Output results
    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(JSON.stringify(diff, null, 2));
    } else {
      console.log(formatDiffText(diff, options));
    }

    // Generate migration script if requested
    if (options.migration &amp;&amp; diff.migration_needed) {
      const migrationScript = generateMigrationScript(diff);
      const migrationPath = `${path.basename(newFile, &#39;.cue&#39;)}-migration.md`;
      await fs.writeFile(migrationPath, migrationScript, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

      console.log(chalk.green(`✓ Migration guide created: ${migrationPath}`));
    }

    return diff.migration_needed ? 1 : 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error comparing schemas:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/idempotency.ts
import { createHash } from &#39;node:crypto&#39;;
import { ConstraintViolationError, globalConstraintEnforcer } from &#39;./core.js&#39;;

/**
 * Operation types that must be idempotent
 */
export type IdempotentOperation =
  | &#39;validate&#39;
  | &#39;export&#39;
  | &#39;transform&#39;
  | &#39;analyze&#39;
  | &#39;generate&#39;
  | &#39;bundle&#39;
  | &#39;diff&#39;
  | &#39;migrate&#39;;

/**
 * Idempotency cache entry
 */
interface IdempotencyRecord {
  operation: string;
  inputHash: string;
  outputHash: string;
  timestamp: number;
  metadata: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

/**
 * Idempotency validation options
 */
interface IdempotencyOptions {
  /** Maximum cache age in milliseconds */
  maxCacheAge?: number;
  /** Whether to ignore timestamp differences in comparison */
  ignoreTimestamps?: boolean;
  /** Custom comparison function */
  customComparator?: (a: unknown, b: unknown) =&gt; boolean;
}

/**
 * Idempotent operation validator
 * Implements &quot;Don&#39;t generate non-idempotent edits&quot; constraint
 */
export class IdempotencyValidator {
  private readonly cache = new Map&lt;string, IdempotencyRecord&gt;();
  private readonly defaultOptions: Required&lt;IdempotencyOptions&gt; = {
    maxCacheAge: 5 * 60 * 1000, // 5 minutes
    ignoreTimestamps: true,
    customComparator: this.defaultComparator.bind(this),
  };

  /**
   * Validate that an operation produces idempotent results
   */
  async validateIdempotency&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    options: IdempotencyOptions = {},
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
    const opts = { ...this.defaultOptions, ...options };
    const cacheKey = this.generateCacheKey(operation, inputs);
    const cached = this.cache.get(cacheKey);

    if (cached &amp;&amp; this.isCacheValid(cached, opts.maxCacheAge)) {
      return await this.validateCachedResult(
        cached,
        executor,
        inputs,
        operation,
        operationId,
        cacheKey
      );
    }

    return await this.executeAndCacheOperation(
      operation,
      inputs,
      executor,
      operationId,
      cacheKey,
      cached
    );
  }

  /**
   * Validate cached result by re-executing operation and comparing outputs
   */
  private async validateCachedResult&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    cached: IdempotencyRecord,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    inputs: TInput,
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    operationId?: string,
    cacheKey?: string
  ): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
    const newResult = await executor(inputs);
    const newOutputHash = this.hashValue(newResult);

    if (cached.outputHash !== newOutputHash) {
      this.throwIdempotencyViolation(&#39;different output&#39;, newOutputHash, cached.outputHash, {
        operationId,
        operation,
        cacheKey,
        cachedTimestamp: cached.timestamp,
        currentTimestamp: Date.now(),
        inputHash: cached.inputHash,
      });
    }

    this.emitIdempotencyVerified(operationId, operation, cacheKey);
    return newResult;
  }

  /**
   * Execute operation and cache the result
   */
  private async executeAndCacheOperation&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    operationId?: string,
    cacheKey?: string,
    cached?: IdempotencyRecord
  ): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
    const result = await executor(inputs);
    const record = this.createCacheRecord(operation, inputs, result, operationId);

    this.cache.set(cacheKey!, record);
    this.handleExpiredCacheValidation(cached, record, operation, operationId, cacheKey);
    this.emitCacheEvent(operationId, operation, cacheKey, record);

    return result;
  }

  /**
   * Create cache record for storing operation result
   */
  private createCacheRecord&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    result: TOutput,
    operationId?: string
  ): IdempotencyRecord {
    return {
      operation,
      inputHash: this.hashValue(inputs),
      outputHash: this.hashValue(result),
      timestamp: Date.now(),
      metadata: {
        operationId,
        inputType: typeof inputs,
        outputType: typeof result,
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Handle validation when cache was expired
   */
  private handleExpiredCacheValidation(
    cached: IdempotencyRecord | undefined,
    currentRecord: IdempotencyRecord,
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    operationId?: string,
    cacheKey?: string
  ): void {
    if (cached &amp;&amp; cached.outputHash !== currentRecord.outputHash) {
      this.emitConstraintViolation(
        &#39;cache expired but results differ&#39;,
        &#39;consistent results across time&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          cacheKey,
          previousHash: cached.outputHash,
          currentHash: currentRecord.outputHash,
        }
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * Throw idempotency violation with proper error structure
   */
  private throwIdempotencyViolation(
    message: string,
    actual: string,
    expected: string,
    metadata: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): never {
    const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
      &#39;idempotency&#39;,
      `${message}: ${actual}`,
      `consistent output: ${expected}`,
      metadata
    );

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
      constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
      violation,
      operation: metadata.operation,
    });

    throw violation;
  }

  /**
   * Emit constraint violation event
   */
  private emitConstraintViolation(
    message: string,
    expected: string,
    metadata: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): void {
    const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(&#39;idempotency&#39;, message, expected, metadata);

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
      constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
      violation,
      operation: metadata.operation,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Emit idempotency verified event
   */
  private emitIdempotencyVerified(
    operationId?: string,
    operation?: IdempotentOperation,
    cacheKey?: string
  ): void {
    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;idempotency:verified&#39;, {
      operationId,
      operation,
      cacheKey,
      consistent: true,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Emit cache event for successful operation
   */
  private emitCacheEvent(
    operationId?: string,
    operation?: IdempotentOperation,
    cacheKey?: string,
    record?: IdempotencyRecord
  ): void {
    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;idempotency:cached&#39;, {
      operationId,
      operation,
      cacheKey,
      inputHash: record?.inputHash,
      outputHash: record?.outputHash,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Validate that repeated execution produces identical results
   */
  async validateRepeatedExecution&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    repetitions = 2,
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
    const validatedRepetitions = this.validateAndGetRepetitions(repetitions);
    const executionResults = await this.performRepeatedExecution(
      operation,
      inputs,
      executor,
      validatedRepetitions,
      operationId
    );

    return this.processExecutionResults(
      executionResults,
      operation,
      validatedRepetitions,
      operationId
    );
  }

  /**
   * Validate and return the repetition count
   */
  private validateAndGetRepetitions(repetitions: number): number {
    this.validateRepetitionCount(repetitions);
    return repetitions;
  }

  /**
   * Perform the repeated execution and collect results
   */
  private async performRepeatedExecution&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ results: TOutput[]; hashes: string[] }&gt; {
    return await this.executeRepeatedOperations(
      operation,
      inputs,
      executor,
      repetitions,
      operationId
    );
  }

  /**
   * Process execution results and return the first result
   */
  private processExecutionResults&lt;TOutput&gt;(
    executionResults: { results: TOutput[]; hashes: string[] },
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): TOutput {
    this.validateResultConsistency(executionResults.hashes, operation, repetitions, operationId);

    this.emitValidationSuccess(operation, repetitions, operationId, executionResults.hashes[0]);

    return executionResults.results[0];
  }

  /**
   * Validate repetition count is sufficient for testing
   */
  private validateRepetitionCount(repetitions: number): void {
    if (repetitions &lt; 2) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Repetitions must be at least 2 for idempotency validation&#39;);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Execute operation multiple times and collect results
   */
  private async executeRepeatedOperations&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ results: TOutput[]; hashes: string[] }&gt; {
    const results: TOutput[] = [];
    const hashes: string[] = [];

    for (let i = 0; i &lt; repetitions; i++) {
      const result = await this.executeSingleIteration(
        operation,
        inputs,
        executor,
        i,
        repetitions,
        operationId
      );

      const resultHash = this.hashValue(result);
      results.push(result);
      hashes.push(resultHash);
    }

    return { results, hashes };
  }

  /**
   * Execute a single iteration with proper error handling
   */
  private async executeSingleIteration&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    inputs: TInput,
    executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
    iteration: number,
    totalRepetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
    const iterationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(
      `${operation}:repeat:${iteration}`,
      {
        operationId,
        iteration,
        totalRepetitions,
      }
    );

    try {
      const result = await executor(inputs);
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(iterationId);
      return result;
    } catch (error) {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(iterationId);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate that all execution results are consistent
   */
  private validateResultConsistency(
    hashes: string[],
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): void {
    const firstHash = hashes[0];

    for (let i = 1; i &lt; hashes.length; i++) {
      if (hashes[i] !== firstHash) {
        this.handleInconsistentResult(i, hashes, firstHash, operation, repetitions, operationId);
      }
    }
  }

  /**
   * Handle inconsistent result by creating and throwing violation
   */
  private handleInconsistentResult(
    divergentIteration: number,
    allHashes: string[],
    expectedHash: string,
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId?: string
  ): never {
    const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
      &#39;idempotency&#39;,
      `iteration ${divergentIteration} hash: ${allHashes[divergentIteration]}`,
      `consistent hash: ${expectedHash}`,
      {
        operationId,
        operation,
        repetitions,
        allHashes,
        divergentIteration,
      }
    );

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
      constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
      violation,
      operation,
    });

    throw violation;
  }

  /**
   * Emit success event for validated repeated execution
   */
  private emitValidationSuccess(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    repetitions: number,
    operationId: string | undefined,
    resultHash: string
  ): void {
    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;idempotency:repeated_validated&#39;, {
      operationId,
      operation,
      repetitions,
      consistent: true,
      resultHash,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Track edit operations to ensure they produce idempotent results
   */
  async validateEditIdempotency&lt;TInput, TEdit&gt;(
    operation: IdempotentOperation,
    baseContent: TInput,
    editFunction: (content: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TEdit&gt;,
    applyEdit: (content: TInput, edit: TEdit) =&gt; Promise&lt;TInput&gt;,
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ finalContent: TInput; edit: TEdit }&gt; {
    // Generate edit
    const edit = await editFunction(baseContent);

    // Apply edit to get result
    const editedContent = await applyEdit(baseContent, edit);

    // Re-apply the same edit to verify idempotency
    const secondEdit = await editFunction(baseContent);
    const secondEditedContent = await applyEdit(baseContent, secondEdit);

    // Compare edit operations
    const editHash1 = this.hashValue(edit);
    const editHash2 = this.hashValue(secondEdit);

    if (editHash1 !== editHash2) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        &#39;non-deterministic edit generation&#39;,
        &#39;consistent edit operations&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          firstEditHash: editHash1,
          secondEditHash: editHash2,
          baseContentHash: this.hashValue(baseContent),
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        violation,
        operation,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Compare final results
    const resultHash1 = this.hashValue(editedContent);
    const resultHash2 = this.hashValue(secondEditedContent);

    if (resultHash1 !== resultHash2) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        &#39;non-deterministic edit application&#39;,
        &#39;consistent edit results&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          firstResultHash: resultHash1,
          secondResultHash: resultHash2,
          editHash: editHash1,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;idempotency&#39;,
        violation,
        operation,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;idempotency:edit_validated&#39;, {
      operationId,
      operation,
      editHash: editHash1,
      resultHash: resultHash1,
      consistent: true,
    });

    return { finalContent: editedContent, edit };
  }

  /**
   * Clear expired cache entries
   */
  clearExpiredCache(): number {
    const _now = Date.now();
    let cleared = 0;

    for (const [key, record] of this.cache.entries()) {
      if (!this.isCacheValid(record, this.defaultOptions.maxCacheAge)) {
        this.cache.delete(key);
        cleared++;
      }
    }

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;idempotency:cache_cleared&#39;, {
      entriesCleared: cleared,
      remainingEntries: this.cache.size,
    });

    return cleared;
  }

  /**
   * Get idempotency validation statistics
   */
  getValidationStats(): {
    cacheSize: number;
    validations: number;
    violations: number;
    cacheHitRate: number;
  } {
    return {
      cacheSize: this.cache.size,
      validations: 0, // Would be tracked via event listeners
      violations: 0, // Would be tracked via event listeners
      cacheHitRate: 0, // Would be calculated from event data
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate cache key for operation and inputs
   */
  private generateCacheKey&lt;T&gt;(operation: string, inputs: T): string {
    const inputHash = this.hashValue(inputs);
    return `${operation}:${inputHash}`;
  }

  /**
   * Hash any value for consistent comparison
   */
  private hashValue(value: unknown): string {
    let serialized: string;

    if (typeof value === &#39;string&#39;) {
      serialized = value;
    } else if (Buffer.isBuffer(value)) {
      serialized = value.toString(&#39;base64&#39;);
    } else {
      // Normalize object for consistent hashing
      serialized = JSON.stringify(this.normalizeForHashing(value));
    }

    return createHash(&#39;sha256&#39;).update(serialized, &#39;utf8&#39;).digest(&#39;hex&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Normalize value for consistent hashing (sort keys, handle timestamps)
   */
  private normalizeForHashing(value: unknown): unknown {
    if (value === null || value === undefined) {
      return value;
    }

    if (typeof value !== &#39;object&#39;) {
      return value;
    }

    if (Array.isArray(value)) {
      return value.map(item =&gt; this.normalizeForHashing(item));
    }

    if (value instanceof Date) {
      // Optionally ignore timestamps for idempotency
      return this.defaultOptions.ignoreTimestamps ? &#39;[TIMESTAMP]&#39; : value.toISOString();
    }

    const obj = value as Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
    const normalized: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; = {};

    // Sort keys for consistent ordering
    const sortedKeys = Object.keys(obj).sort();

    for (const key of sortedKeys) {
      // Skip timestamp fields if configured to ignore them
      if (this.defaultOptions.ignoreTimestamps &amp;&amp; this.isTimestampField(key)) {
        normalized[key] = &#39;[TIMESTAMP]&#39;;
      } else {
        normalized[key] = this.normalizeForHashing(obj[key]);
      }
    }

    return normalized;
  }

  /**
   * Check if a field name represents a timestamp
   */
  private isTimestampField(fieldName: string): boolean {
    const timestampFields = [
      &#39;timestamp&#39;,
      &#39;createdAt&#39;,
      &#39;updatedAt&#39;,
      &#39;modifiedAt&#39;,
      &#39;date&#39;,
      &#39;time&#39;,
      &#39;created_at&#39;,
      &#39;updated_at&#39;,
      &#39;modified_at&#39;,
      &#39;processed_at&#39;,
    ];

    return timestampFields.includes(fieldName.toLowerCase());
  }

  /**
   * Check if cache entry is still valid
   */
  private isCacheValid(record: IdempotencyRecord, maxAge: number): boolean {
    return Date.now() - record.timestamp &lt;= maxAge;
  }

  /**
   * Default comparison function
   */
  private defaultComparator(a: unknown, b: unknown): boolean {
    return this.hashValue(a) === this.hashValue(b);
  }
}

/**
 * Global idempotency validator instance
 */
export const globalIdempotencyValidator = new IdempotencyValidator();

/**
 * Decorator for automatic idempotency validation
 */
export function idempotent(operation: IdempotentOperation, options: IdempotencyOptions = {}) {
  return &lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;&gt;(
    _target: any,
    propertyName: string,
    descriptor: TypedPropertyDescriptor&lt;T&gt;
  ) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value!;

    descriptor.value = async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) {
      const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(`idempotent:${operation}`, {
        method: propertyName,
        args: args.length,
      });

      try {
        const result = await globalIdempotencyValidator.validateIdempotency(
          operation,
          args, // Use args as inputs
          async () =&gt; method.apply(this, args),
          options,
          operationId
        );

        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        return result;
      } catch (error) {
        globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
        throw error;
      }
    } as T;

    return descriptor;
  };
}

/**
 * Utility function to wrap any operation with idempotency validation
 */
export async function withIdempotencyValidation&lt;TInput, TOutput&gt;(
  operation: IdempotentOperation,
  inputs: TInput,
  executor: (inputs: TInput) =&gt; Promise&lt;TOutput&gt;,
  options: IdempotencyOptions = {}
): Promise&lt;TOutput&gt; {
  return globalIdempotencyValidator.validateIdempotency(operation, inputs, executor, options);
}

/**
 * Utility for validating edit operations are idempotent
 */
export async function validateIdempotentEdits&lt;TContent, TEdit&gt;(
  operation: IdempotentOperation,
  baseContent: TContent,
  editFunction: (content: TContent) =&gt; Promise&lt;TEdit&gt;,
  applyEdit: (content: TContent, edit: TEdit) =&gt; Promise&lt;TContent&gt;
): Promise&lt;{ finalContent: TContent; edit: TEdit }&gt; {
  return globalIdempotencyValidator.validateEditIdempotency(
    operation,
    baseContent,
    editFunction,
    applyEdit
  );
}
📄 apps/api/src/auth.ts
/**
 * Authentication and authorization module
 */
import type { AuthContext, ServerConfig } from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { logger, parseBearerToken } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

export class AuthService {
  private validTokens: Set&lt;string&gt; = new Set();
  private tokenToUserMap: Map&lt;string, string&gt; = new Map();
  private userProjectAccess: Map&lt;string, string[]&gt; = new Map();

  constructor(private config: ServerConfig) {
    // Initialize with some default tokens for development
    if (process.env.NODE_ENV === &#39;development&#39;) {
      this.addToken(&#39;dev-token&#39;, &#39;dev-user&#39;, [&#39;*&#39;]);
      logger.info(&#39;Development mode: added default auth token&#39;);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a valid token with user and project access
   */
  addToken(token: string, userId: string, projectAccess: string[] = []): void {
    this.validTokens.add(token);
    this.tokenToUserMap.set(token, userId);
    this.userProjectAccess.set(userId, projectAccess);

    logger.info(&#39;Token added for user&#39;, {
      userId,
      projectCount: projectAccess.length,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Remove a token
   */
  removeToken(token: string): void {
    const userId = this.tokenToUserMap.get(token);

    this.validTokens.delete(token);
    this.tokenToUserMap.delete(token);

    if (userId) {
      this.userProjectAccess.delete(userId);
      logger.info(&#39;Token removed for user&#39;, { userId });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate token and return auth context
   */
  validateToken(token: string): AuthContext | null {
    if (!this.validTokens.has(token)) {
      return null;
    }

    const userId = this.tokenToUserMap.get(token);
    const projectAccess = userId ? (this.userProjectAccess.get(userId) ?? []) : [];

    return {
      token,
      user_id: userId,
      project_access: projectAccess,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Check if user has access to a specific project
   */
  hasProjectAccess(authContext: AuthContext, projectId: string): boolean {
    // Wildcard access
    if (authContext.project_access.includes(&#39;*&#39;)) {
      return true;
    }

    // Specific project access
    return authContext.project_access.includes(projectId);
  }

  /**
   * Extract and validate auth context from request headers
   */
  async authenticateRequest(headers: Headers): Promise&lt;AuthContext | null&gt; {
    if (!this.config.auth_required) {
      // Return a default context when auth is disabled
      return {
        token: &#39;no-auth&#39;,
        user_id: &#39;anonymous&#39;,
        project_access: [&#39;*&#39;],
      };
    }

    const authHeader = headers.get(&#39;authorization&#39;);
    const token = parseBearerToken(authHeader ?? undefined);

    if (!token) {
      return null;
    }

    return this.validateToken(token);
  }

  /**
   * Create auth middleware for HTTP requests
   */
  createAuthMiddleware() {
    return async (
      request: Request
    ): Promise&lt;{
      authorized: boolean;
      authContext?: AuthContext;
      response?: Response;
    }&gt; =&gt; {
      try {
        const authContext = await this.authenticateRequest(request.headers);

        if (!authContext) {
          return {
            authorized: false,
            response: new Response(
              JSON.stringify({
                type: &#39;https://httpstatuses.com/401&#39;,
                title: &#39;Unauthorized&#39;,
                status: 401,
                detail: &#39;Valid bearer token required&#39;,
              }),
              {
                status: 401,
                headers: {
                  &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/problem+json&#39;,
                  &#39;WWW-Authenticate&#39;: &#39;Bearer&#39;,
                },
              }
            ),
          };
        }

        return { authorized: true, authContext };
      } catch (error) {
        logger.error(&#39;Auth middleware error&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);

        return {
          authorized: false,
          response: new Response(
            JSON.stringify({
              type: &#39;https://httpstatuses.com/500&#39;,
              title: &#39;Internal Server Error&#39;,
              status: 500,
              detail: &#39;Authentication service error&#39;,
            }),
            {
              status: 500,
              headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/problem+json&#39; },
            }
          ),
        };
      }
    };
  }

  /**
   * Create project access middleware
   */
  createProjectAccessMiddleware() {
    return (
      authContext: AuthContext,
      projectId: string
    ): {
      authorized: boolean;
      response?: Response;
    } =&gt; {
      if (!this.hasProjectAccess(authContext, projectId)) {
        return {
          authorized: false,
          response: new Response(
            JSON.stringify({
              type: &#39;https://httpstatuses.com/403&#39;,
              title: &#39;Forbidden&#39;,
              status: 403,
              detail: `Access denied to project: ${projectId}`,
            }),
            {
              status: 403,
              headers: { &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/problem+json&#39; },
            }
          ),
        };
      }

      return { authorized: true };
    };
  }

  /**
   * Get user info for a token
   */
  getUserInfo(token: string): { userId?: string; projectAccess: string[] } | null {
    const userId = this.tokenToUserMap.get(token);
    if (!userId) {
      return null;
    }

    return {
      userId,
      projectAccess: this.userProjectAccess.get(userId) ?? [],
    };
  }

  /**
   * List all active tokens (for admin purposes)
   */
  listTokens(): Array&lt;{
    token: string;
    userId?: string;
    projectCount: number;
  }&gt; {
    return Array.from(this.validTokens).map(token =&gt; {
      const userId = this.tokenToUserMap.get(token);
      const projectAccess = userId ? (this.userProjectAccess.get(userId) ?? []) : [];

      return {
        token: `${token.substring(0, 8)}...`, // Partial token for security
        userId,
        projectCount: projectAccess.length,
      };
    });
  }

  /**
   * Start OAuth service if enabled (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  async startOAuthService(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // OAuth functionality requires SuperTokens integration
    // Currently disabled - no OAuth service to start
  }

  /**
   * Stop OAuth service if enabled (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  async stopOAuthService(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // OAuth functionality requires SuperTokens integration
    // Currently disabled - no OAuth service to stop
  }

  /**
   * Get OAuth service instance (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  getOAuthService(): undefined {
    return undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Get protected resource metadata for OAuth (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  getProtectedResourceMetadata(): undefined {
    return undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Get OAuth authorization server instance (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  getAuthorizationServer(): undefined {
    return undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Get OAuth provider instance (placeholder when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  getOAuthProvider(): undefined {
    return undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Create OAuth-aware auth middleware (falls back to regular auth when OAuth is disabled)
   */
  createOAuthAwareAuthMiddleware() {
    // When OAuth is disabled, fall back to regular auth middleware
    return this.createAuthMiddleware();
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/sync.ts
import crypto from &#39;node:crypto&#39;;
import fs from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import packageJson from &#39;../../package.json&#39; with { type: &#39;json&#39; };
import type { CLIConfig, SyncOptions } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

interface ManifestFile {
  path: string;
  type: &#39;package.json&#39; | &#39;pyproject.toml&#39; | &#39;Cargo.toml&#39; | &#39;Makefile&#39;;
  exists: boolean;
  language: string;
}

interface ConflictResolution {
  path: string;
  type: &#39;value_conflict&#39; | &#39;section_exists&#39; | &#39;section_replaced&#39; | &#39;merge_required&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
  resolution:
    | &#39;merged&#39;
    | &#39;preserved_existing&#39;
    | &#39;replaced_with_template&#39;
    | &#39;replaced_with_source&#39;
    | &#39;failed&#39;;
  applied?: boolean;
  details: string;
}

interface SyncResult {
  modified: boolean;
  conflicts: ConflictResolution[];
  checksum: string;
  backupPath?: string;
}

interface ChangeSet {
  added: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
  modified: Record&lt;string, { from: any; to: any }&gt;;
  removed: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
}

/**
 * Detect manifest files in the project
 */
async function detectManifestFiles(projectPath: string): Promise&lt;ManifestFile[]&gt; {
  const manifests: ManifestFile[] = [
    { path: &#39;package.json&#39;, type: &#39;package.json&#39;, exists: false, language: &#39;typescript&#39; },
    { path: &#39;pyproject.toml&#39;, type: &#39;pyproject.toml&#39;, exists: false, language: &#39;python&#39; },
    { path: &#39;Cargo.toml&#39;, type: &#39;Cargo.toml&#39;, exists: false, language: &#39;rust&#39; },
    { path: &#39;Makefile&#39;, type: &#39;Makefile&#39;, exists: false, language: &#39;bash&#39; },
  ];

  for (const manifest of manifests) {
    const fullPath = path.join(projectPath, manifest.path);
    try {
      await fs.access(fullPath);
      manifest.exists = true;
    } catch {
      manifest.exists = false;
    }
  }

  return manifests.filter(m =&gt; m.exists);
}

/**
 * Calculate file checksum for idempotency validation
 */
function calculateChecksum(content: string): string {
  return crypto.createHash(&#39;sha256&#39;).update(content).digest(&#39;hex&#39;).substring(0, 16);
}

/**
 * Create backup of a file with timestamp
 */
async function createBackup(filePath: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const timestamp = new Date().toISOString().replace(/[:.]/g, &#39;-&#39;);
  const backupPath = `${filePath}.backup.${timestamp}`;
  await fs.copyFile(filePath, backupPath);
  return backupPath;
}

/**
 * Deep merge objects, handling conflicts intelligently
 */
function deepMerge(
  target: any,
  source: any,
  conflicts: ConflictResolution[],
  path = &#39;&#39;,
  force = false
): any {
  const result = { ...target };

  for (const key in source) {
    const currentPath = path ? `${path}.${key}` : key;

    if (!(key in result)) {
      // New property - safe to add
      result[key] = source[key];
    } else if (
      typeof source[key] === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp;
      typeof result[key] === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp;
      !Array.isArray(source[key])
    ) {
      // Both objects - recursive merge
      result[key] = deepMerge(result[key], source[key], conflicts, currentPath, force);
    } else if (JSON.stringify(result[key]) !== JSON.stringify(source[key])) {
      // Conflict detected
      if (force) {
        conflicts.push({
          path: currentPath,
          type: &#39;value_conflict&#39;,
          resolution: &#39;replaced_with_source&#39;,
          applied: true,
          details: `Overwrote ${currentPath}: ${JSON.stringify(result[key])} → ${JSON.stringify(source[key])}`,
        });
        result[key] = source[key];
      } else {
        conflicts.push({
          path: currentPath,
          type: &#39;value_conflict&#39;,
          resolution: &#39;preserved_existing&#39;,
          applied: false,
          details: `Preserved existing ${currentPath}: ${JSON.stringify(result[key])} (would be ${JSON.stringify(source[key])})`,
        });
      }
    }
  }

  return result;
}

/**
 * Generate change set showing what would be modified
 */
function generateChangeSet(original: any, modified: any): ChangeSet {
  const changeSet: ChangeSet = {
    added: {},
    modified: {},
    removed: {},
  };

  // Find added and modified keys
  for (const key in modified) {
    if (!(key in original)) {
      changeSet.added[key] = modified[key];
    } else if (JSON.stringify(original[key]) !== JSON.stringify(modified[key])) {
      changeSet.modified[key] = {
        from: original[key],
        to: modified[key],
      };
    }
  }

  // Find removed keys
  for (const key in original) {
    if (!(key in modified)) {
      changeSet.removed[key] = original[key];
    }
  }

  return changeSet;
}

/**
 * Validate that sync operation is idempotent
 */
async function validateIdempotency(filePath: string, expectedChecksum: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
  try {
    const currentContent = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;);
    const currentChecksum = calculateChecksum(currentContent);
    return currentChecksum === expectedChecksum;
  } catch {
    return false;
  }
}

/**
 * Enhanced sync package.json with intelligent conflict resolution
 */
/**
 * Load and parse package.json content
 */
async function loadPackageJson(filePath: string): Promise&lt;{
  originalContent: string;
  originalPkg: any;
  originalChecksum: string;
}&gt; {
  const originalContent = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;);
  const originalPkg = JSON.parse(originalContent);
  const originalChecksum = calculateChecksum(originalContent);

  return { originalContent, originalPkg, originalChecksum };
}

/**
 * Get Arbiter configuration updates for package.json
 */
function getArbiterPackageUpdates() {
  return {
    scripts: {
      &#39;arbiter:check&#39;: &#39;arbiter check&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:watch&#39;: &#39;arbiter watch&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:surface&#39;: &#39;arbiter surface typescript --output surface.json&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:test:scaffold&#39;: &#39;arbiter tests scaffold --language typescript&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:test:cover&#39;: &#39;arbiter tests cover --threshold 0.8&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:version:plan&#39;: &#39;arbiter version plan --strict&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter:sync&#39;: &#39;arbiter sync --language typescript&#39;,
    },
    devDependencies: {
      &#39;@arbiter/cli&#39;: `^${packageJson.version}`,
    },
    arbiter: {
      profiles: [&#39;library&#39;],
      coverage: {
        threshold: 0.8,
      },
      surface: {
        language: &#39;typescript&#39;,
        output: &#39;surface.json&#39;,
      },
    },
  };
}

/**
 * Apply Arbiter updates to package object
 */
function applyArbiterUpdates(
  pkg: any,
  arbiterUpdates: ReturnType&lt;typeof getArbiterPackageUpdates&gt;,
  force: boolean
): ConflictResolution[] {
  const conflicts: ConflictResolution[] = [];

  // Initialize sections if not present
  if (!pkg.scripts) pkg.scripts = {};
  if (!pkg.devDependencies) pkg.devDependencies = {};

  // Use intelligent merge for each section
  pkg.scripts = deepMerge(pkg.scripts, arbiterUpdates.scripts, conflicts, &#39;scripts&#39;, force);
  pkg.devDependencies = deepMerge(
    pkg.devDependencies,
    arbiterUpdates.devDependencies,
    conflicts,
    &#39;devDependencies&#39;,
    force
  );
  pkg.arbiter = deepMerge(pkg.arbiter || {}, arbiterUpdates.arbiter, conflicts, &#39;arbiter&#39;, force);

  return conflicts;
}

/**
 * Report changes that would be made
 */
function reportPotentialChanges(changeSet: any, conflicts: ConflictResolution[]): void {
  // Report changes
  if (Object.keys(changeSet.added).length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;  ✨ Would add:&#39;));
    for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(changeSet.added)) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`    ${key}: ${JSON.stringify(value, null, 2).split(&#39;\n&#39;)[0]}...`));
    }
  }

  if (Object.keys(changeSet.modified).length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;  🔄 Would modify:&#39;));
    for (const [key, change] of Object.entries(changeSet.modified) as Array&lt;[string, any]&gt;) {
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(`    ${key}: ${JSON.stringify(change.from)} → ${JSON.stringify(change.to)}`)
      );
    }
  }

  // Report conflicts
  if (conflicts.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(`  ⚠️  ${conflicts.length} conflict(s) detected:`));
    for (const conflict of conflicts) {
      const status = conflict.applied ? chalk.green(&#39;RESOLVED&#39;) : chalk.red(&#39;PRESERVED&#39;);
      console.log(chalk.dim(`    ${status}: ${conflict.details}`));
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Apply changes to package.json file
 */
async function applyPackageChanges(
  filePath: string,
  newContent: string,
  backup: boolean,
  newChecksum: string
): Promise&lt;string | undefined&gt; {
  let backupPath: string | undefined;

  if (backup) {
    backupPath = await createBackup(filePath);
    console.log(chalk.dim(`  📦 Created backup: ${path.basename(backupPath)}`));
  }

  await fs.writeFile(filePath, newContent);

  // Validate idempotency
  const isIdempotent = await validateIdempotency(filePath, newChecksum);
  if (!isIdempotent) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;  ⚠️  Warning: File was modified by external process during sync&#39;));
  }

  return backupPath;
}

async function syncPackageJson(
  filePath: string,
  dryRun: boolean,
  backup: boolean,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;SyncResult&gt; {
  try {
    // Load package.json content
    const { originalContent, originalPkg, originalChecksum } = await loadPackageJson(filePath);

    // Create working copy and apply updates
    const pkg = JSON.parse(originalContent);
    const arbiterUpdates = getArbiterPackageUpdates();
    const conflicts = applyArbiterUpdates(pkg, arbiterUpdates, force);

    // Check if anything actually changed
    const newContent = `${JSON.stringify(pkg, null, 2)}\n`;
    const newChecksum = calculateChecksum(newContent);
    const modified = originalChecksum !== newChecksum;

    // Generate change set for reporting
    const changeSet = generateChangeSet(originalPkg, pkg);

    // Report changes in dry-run mode
    if (modified) {
      reportPotentialChanges(changeSet, conflicts);
    }

    // Apply changes if not dry run
    let backupPath: string | undefined;
    if (modified &amp;&amp; !dryRun) {
      backupPath = await applyPackageChanges(filePath, newContent, backup, newChecksum);
    }

    return {
      modified,
      conflicts,
      checksum: newChecksum,
      backupPath,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`  ❌ Failed to sync ${filePath}:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return {
      modified: false,
      conflicts: [],
      checksum: &#39;&#39;,
      backupPath: undefined,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Sync pyproject.toml with Arbiter configuration
 */
async function syncPyprojectToml(
  filePath: string,
  dryRun: boolean,
  backup: boolean,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;SyncResult&gt; {
  try {
    const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;);
    let modified = false;

    // Check if tool.arbiter section exists
    const arbiterSectionRegex = /\[tool\.arbiter\]/;
    const hasArbiterSection = arbiterSectionRegex.test(content);

    const conflicts: ConflictResolution[] = [];
    let backupPath: string | undefined;

    if (hasArbiterSection &amp;&amp; !force) {
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;[tool.arbiter]&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_exists&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;preserved_existing&#39;,
        details: &#39;Use --force to overwrite existing Arbiter section&#39;,
      });
      console.log(
        chalk.yellow(
          &#39;⚠️  pyproject.toml already has [tool.arbiter] section. Use --force to overwrite.&#39;
        )
      );
      return {
        modified: false,
        conflicts,
        checksum: calculateChecksum(content),
      };
    }

    const arbiterConfig = `
[tool.arbiter]
profiles = [&quot;library&quot;]
surface_language = &quot;python&quot;
surface_output = &quot;surface.json&quot;

[tool.arbiter.coverage]
threshold = 0.8

[tool.arbiter.scripts]
check = &quot;arbiter check&quot;
watch = &quot;arbiter watch&quot;
surface = &quot;arbiter surface python --output surface.json&quot;
test_scaffold = &quot;arbiter tests scaffold --language python&quot;
test_cover = &quot;arbiter tests cover --threshold 0.8&quot;
version_plan = &quot;arbiter version plan --strict&quot;
sync = &quot;arbiter sync --language python&quot;
`;

    let newContent = content;

    if (!hasArbiterSection) {
      // Add to end of file
      newContent = `${content.trim()}\n${arbiterConfig}`;
      modified = true;
    } else if (force) {
      // Replace existing section
      const sectionEnd = content.indexOf(&#39;[&#39;, content.indexOf(&#39;[tool.arbiter]&#39;) + 1);
      if (sectionEnd === -1) {
        // Section is at the end of the file
        newContent = content.substring(0, content.indexOf(&#39;[tool.arbiter]&#39;)) + arbiterConfig.trim();
      } else {
        // Section is in the middle
        newContent = `${
          content.substring(0, content.indexOf(&#39;[tool.arbiter]&#39;)) + arbiterConfig.trim()
        }\n\n${content.substring(sectionEnd)}`;
      }
      modified = true;
    }

    if (modified &amp;&amp; !dryRun) {
      if (backup) {
        backupPath = await createBackup(filePath);
        console.log(chalk.dim(`📦 Created backup: ${backupPath}`));
      }

      await fs.writeFile(filePath, newContent);
    }

    if (modified &amp;&amp; force &amp;&amp; hasArbiterSection) {
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;[tool.arbiter]&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_replaced&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;replaced_with_template&#39;,
        details: &#39;Existing section replaced due to --force flag&#39;,
      });
    }

    const newChecksum = calculateChecksum(modified ? newContent : content);
    return {
      modified,
      conflicts,
      checksum: newChecksum,
      backupPath,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`❌ Failed to sync ${filePath}:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return {
      modified: false,
      conflicts: [
        {
          path: filePath,
          type: &#39;error&#39;,
          resolution: &#39;failed&#39;,
          details: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        },
      ],
      checksum: &#39;&#39;,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Sync Cargo.toml with Arbiter metadata
 */
async function syncCargoToml(
  filePath: string,
  dryRun: boolean,
  backup: boolean,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;SyncResult&gt; {
  try {
    const originalContent = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;);
    let newContent = originalContent;
    let modified = false;
    const conflicts: ConflictResolution[] = [];
    let backupPath: string | undefined;

    // Check if [package.metadata.arbiter] section exists
    const arbiterSectionRegex = /\[package\.metadata\.arbiter\]/;
    const hasArbiterSection = arbiterSectionRegex.test(originalContent);

    const arbiterConfig = `
[package.metadata.arbiter]
profiles = [&quot;library&quot;]
surface_language = &quot;rust&quot;
surface_output = &quot;surface.json&quot;
coverage_threshold = 0.8

[package.metadata.arbiter.scripts]
check = &quot;arbiter check&quot;
watch = &quot;arbiter watch&quot;
surface = &quot;arbiter surface rust --output surface.json&quot;
test_scaffold = &quot;arbiter tests scaffold --language rust&quot;
test_cover = &quot;arbiter tests cover --threshold 0.8&quot;
version_plan = &quot;arbiter version plan --strict&quot;
sync = &quot;arbiter sync --language rust&quot;
`;

    if (!hasArbiterSection) {
      // Add after [package] section
      const packageSectionEnd = originalContent.indexOf(
        &#39;\n[&#39;,
        originalContent.indexOf(&#39;[package]&#39;) + 1
      );
      if (packageSectionEnd === -1) {
        // No other sections after [package]
        newContent = `${originalContent.trim()}\n${arbiterConfig}`;
      } else {
        // Insert before next section
        newContent = `${originalContent.substring(0, packageSectionEnd)}\n${arbiterConfig.trim()}${originalContent.substring(packageSectionEnd)}`;
      }
      modified = true;
    } else if (!force) {
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;[package.metadata.arbiter]&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_exists&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;preserved_existing&#39;,
        details: &#39;Use --force to overwrite existing Arbiter section&#39;,
      });
      console.log(
        chalk.yellow(
          &#39;⚠️  Cargo.toml already has [package.metadata.arbiter] section. Use --force to overwrite.&#39;
        )
      );
    } else {
      // Replace existing section with force
      const sectionStart = originalContent.indexOf(&#39;[package.metadata.arbiter]&#39;);
      const nextSection = originalContent.indexOf(&#39;\n[&#39;, sectionStart + 1);

      if (nextSection === -1) {
        newContent = originalContent.substring(0, sectionStart) + arbiterConfig.trim();
      } else {
        newContent = `${
          originalContent.substring(0, sectionStart) + arbiterConfig.trim()
        }\n${originalContent.substring(nextSection)}`;
      }
      modified = true;
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;[package.metadata.arbiter]&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_replaced&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;replaced_with_template&#39;,
        details: &#39;Existing section replaced due to --force flag&#39;,
      });
    }

    if (modified &amp;&amp; !dryRun) {
      if (backup) {
        backupPath = await createBackup(filePath);
        console.log(chalk.dim(`📦 Created backup: ${backupPath}`));
      }

      await fs.writeFile(filePath, newContent);
    }

    return {
      modified,
      conflicts,
      checksum: calculateChecksum(newContent),
      backupPath,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`❌ Failed to sync ${filePath}:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return {
      modified: false,
      conflicts: [
        {
          path: filePath,
          type: &#39;error&#39;,
          resolution: &#39;failed&#39;,
          details: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        },
      ],
      checksum: &#39;&#39;,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Sync Makefile with Arbiter targets
 */
async function syncMakefile(
  filePath: string,
  dryRun: boolean,
  backup: boolean,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;SyncResult&gt; {
  try {
    const originalContent = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;);
    let newContent = originalContent;
    let modified = false;
    const conflicts: ConflictResolution[] = [];
    let backupPath: string | undefined;

    // Check if Arbiter targets exist
    const hasArbiterTargets = originalContent.includes(&#39;# Arbiter targets&#39;);

    const arbiterTargets = `
# Arbiter targets
.PHONY: arbiter-check arbiter-watch arbiter-surface arbiter-test-scaffold arbiter-test-cover arbiter-version-plan arbiter-sync

arbiter-check:
	arbiter check

arbiter-watch:
	arbiter watch

arbiter-surface:
	arbiter surface bash --output surface.json

arbiter-test-scaffold:
	arbiter tests scaffold --language bash

arbiter-test-cover:
	arbiter tests cover --threshold 0.8

arbiter-version-plan:
	arbiter version plan --strict

arbiter-sync:
	arbiter sync --language bash
`;

    if (!hasArbiterTargets) {
      // Add to end of file
      newContent = `${originalContent.trim()}\n${arbiterTargets}`;
      modified = true;
    } else if (!force) {
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;# Arbiter targets&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_exists&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;preserved_existing&#39;,
        details: &#39;Use --force to overwrite existing Arbiter targets&#39;,
      });
      console.log(
        chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  Makefile already has Arbiter targets. Use --force to overwrite.&#39;)
      );
    } else {
      // Replace existing Arbiter section with force
      const sectionStart = originalContent.indexOf(&#39;# Arbiter targets&#39;);
      const nextSection = originalContent.indexOf(&#39;\n# &#39;, sectionStart + 1);

      if (nextSection === -1) {
        // Section is at the end
        newContent = originalContent.substring(0, sectionStart) + arbiterTargets.trim();
      } else {
        // Section is in the middle
        newContent = `${
          originalContent.substring(0, sectionStart) + arbiterTargets.trim()
        }\n\n${originalContent.substring(nextSection)}`;
      }
      modified = true;
      conflicts.push({
        path: &#39;# Arbiter targets&#39;,
        type: &#39;section_replaced&#39;,
        resolution: &#39;replaced_with_template&#39;,
        details: &#39;Existing targets replaced due to --force flag&#39;,
      });
    }

    if (modified &amp;&amp; !dryRun) {
      if (backup) {
        backupPath = await createBackup(filePath);
        console.log(chalk.dim(`📦 Created backup: ${backupPath}`));
      }

      await fs.writeFile(filePath, newContent);
    }

    return {
      modified,
      conflicts,
      checksum: calculateChecksum(newContent),
      backupPath,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`❌ Failed to sync ${filePath}:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return {
      modified: false,
      conflicts: [
        {
          path: filePath,
          type: &#39;error&#39;,
          resolution: &#39;failed&#39;,
          details: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        },
      ],
      checksum: &#39;&#39;,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Sync command implementation
 */
export async function syncCommand(options: SyncOptions, _config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const context = await initializeSyncContext(options);
    if (!context) return 1;

    const syncResults = await executeSynchronization(context);
    displaySynchronizationResults(context, syncResults);
    displayNextStepsGuidance(context, syncResults);

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;❌ Synchronization failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

interface SyncContext {
  projectPath: string;
  targetManifests: ManifestFile[];
  dryRun: boolean;
  backup: boolean;
  force: boolean;
}

async function initializeSyncContext(options: SyncOptions): Promise&lt;SyncContext | null&gt; {
  const projectPath = process.cwd();
  displaySyncHeader(projectPath);

  const manifests = await detectAndDisplayManifests(projectPath);
  if (!manifests) return null;

  const targetManifests = filterManifestsByLanguage(manifests, options.language);
  if (!targetManifests) return null;

  const syncOptions = extractSyncOptions(options);
  displaySyncMode(syncOptions.dryRun);

  return {
    projectPath,
    targetManifests,
    ...syncOptions,
  };
}

function displaySyncHeader(projectPath: string): void {
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔄 Arbiter manifest synchronization&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(`Project: ${projectPath}`));
}

async function detectAndDisplayManifests(projectPath: string): Promise&lt;ManifestFile[] | null&gt; {
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔍 Detecting manifest files...&#39;));
  const manifests = await detectManifestFiles(projectPath);

  if (manifests.length === 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  No supported manifest files found&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Supported: package.json, pyproject.toml, Cargo.toml, Makefile&#39;));
    return null;
  }

  console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Found ${manifests.length} manifest file(s):`));
  for (const manifest of manifests) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(`  • ${manifest.path} (${manifest.language})`));
  }

  return manifests;
}

function filterManifestsByLanguage(
  manifests: ManifestFile[],
  language?: string
): ManifestFile[] | null {
  if (!language || language === &#39;all&#39;) {
    return manifests;
  }

  const filtered = manifests.filter(m =&gt; m.language === language);
  if (filtered.length === 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  No ${language} manifest files found`));
    return null;
  }

  return filtered;
}

function extractSyncOptions(options: SyncOptions): {
  dryRun: boolean;
  backup: boolean;
  force: boolean;
} {
  return {
    dryRun: options.dryRun || false,
    backup: options.backup || false,
    force: options.force || false,
  };
}

function displaySyncMode(dryRun: boolean): void {
  if (dryRun) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;📋 Dry run mode - no files will be modified&#39;));
  }
}

async function executeSynchronization(context: SyncContext): Promise&lt;SyncResult[]&gt; {
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n🔄 Synchronizing manifests...&#39;));
  const syncResults: SyncResult[] = [];

  for (const manifest of context.targetManifests) {
    const result = await processSingleManifest(manifest, context);
    syncResults.push(result);
    displayManifestResult(manifest, result, context.dryRun);
  }

  return syncResults;
}

async function processSingleManifest(
  manifest: ManifestFile,
  context: SyncContext
): Promise&lt;SyncResult&gt; {
  const filePath = path.join(context.projectPath, manifest.path);
  console.log(chalk.cyan(`\n📝 Processing ${manifest.path}...`));

  const manifestProcessors = {
    &#39;package.json&#39;: syncPackageJson,
    &#39;pyproject.toml&#39;: syncPyprojectToml,
    &#39;Cargo.toml&#39;: syncCargoToml,
    Makefile: syncMakefile,
  };

  const processor = manifestProcessors[manifest.type];
  if (processor) {
    return await processor(filePath, context.dryRun, context.backup, context.force);
  }

  return { modified: false, conflicts: [], checksum: &#39;&#39; };
}

function displayManifestResult(manifest: ManifestFile, result: SyncResult, dryRun: boolean): void {
  if (result.modified) {
    const status = dryRun ? &#39;Would modify&#39; : &#39;Modified&#39;;
    const conflictCount = result.conflicts.filter(c =&gt; c.applied).length;
    if (conflictCount &gt; 0) {
      console.log(
        chalk.green(`✅ ${status} ${manifest.path} (${conflictCount} conflict(s) resolved)`)
      );
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.green(`✅ ${status} ${manifest.path}`));
    }
  } else {
    console.log(chalk.dim(`⏭️  No changes needed for ${manifest.path}`));
  }
}

function displaySynchronizationResults(context: SyncContext, syncResults: SyncResult[]): void {
  const totalModified = syncResults.filter(r =&gt; r.modified).length;

  console.log(chalk.green(&#39;\n🎉 Synchronization complete!&#39;));
  console.log(
    chalk.cyan(
      `📊 Summary: ${totalModified}/${context.targetManifests.length} files ${context.dryRun ? &#39;would be&#39; : &#39;were&#39;} modified`
    )
  );
}

function displayNextStepsGuidance(context: SyncContext, syncResults: SyncResult[]): void {
  const totalModified = syncResults.filter(r =&gt; r.modified).length;

  if (totalModified &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; !context.dryRun) {
    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nNext steps:&#39;));
    displayLanguageSpecificGuidance(context.targetManifests);
  }

  if (context.dryRun &amp;&amp; totalModified &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n💡 Run without --dry-run to apply these changes&#39;));
  }
}

function displayLanguageSpecificGuidance(manifests: ManifestFile[]): void {
  const guidanceMap = {
    &#39;package.json&#39;: [
      &#39;  • Run &quot;npm install&quot; to install new dev dependencies&#39;,
      &#39;  • Use &quot;npm run arbiter:check&quot; to validate CUE files&#39;,
    ],
    &#39;pyproject.toml&#39;: [&#39;  • Run &quot;pip install -e .&quot; to install in development mode&#39;],
    &#39;Cargo.toml&#39;: [&#39;  • Run &quot;cargo build&quot; to update dependencies&#39;],
    Makefile: [&#39;  • Use &quot;make arbiter-check&quot; to validate CUE files&#39;],
  };

  for (const [manifestType, guidance] of Object.entries(guidanceMap)) {
    if (manifests.some(m =&gt; m.type === manifestType)) {
      guidance.forEach(line =&gt; console.log(chalk.dim(line)));
    }
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/handlers/executor.ts
/**
 * Handler execution pipeline
 * Executes custom webhook handlers with sandboxing and error handling
 */

import { setTimeout } from &#39;node:timers/promises&#39;;
import type { SpecWorkbenchDB } from &#39;../db.js&#39;;
import type { EventService } from &#39;../events.js&#39;;
import { logger as defaultLogger, generateId, getCurrentTimestamp } from &#39;../utils.js&#39;;
import { HandlerLoader } from &#39;./loader.js&#39;;
import { HandlerSecurityValidator } from &#39;./services.js&#39;;
import type { HandlerDiscovery } from &#39;./discovery.js&#39;;
import type {
  EnhancedWebhookPayload,
  HandlerContext,
  HandlerExecution,
  HandlerResult,
  HandlerServices,
  Logger,
  RegisteredHandler,
  WebhookHandler,
  WebhookPayload,
  WebhookRequest,
} from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

export class HandlerExecutor {
  private activeExecutions = new Map&lt;string, AbortController&gt;();
  private executionHistory: HandlerExecution[] = [];
  private loader: HandlerLoader;

  constructor(
    private discovery: HandlerDiscovery,
    private services: HandlerServices,
    private logger: Logger = defaultLogger
  ) {
    this.loader = new HandlerLoader(this.logger);
  }

  /**
   * Execute handlers for a webhook event
   */
  async executeHandlers(projectId: string, request: WebhookRequest): Promise&lt;HandlerResult[]&gt; {
    const { provider, event } = request;

    // Get handlers for this event
    const handlers = this.discovery.getHandlersForEvent(provider, event);

    if (handlers.length === 0) {
      this.logger.debug(&#39;No handlers found for event&#39;, { provider, event });
      return [];
    }

    this.logger.info(&#39;Executing handlers for webhook event&#39;, {
      projectId,
      provider,
      event,
      handlerCount: handlers.length,
    });

    // Enhance payload with parsed data
    const enhancedPayload = await this.enhancePayload(request);

    // Execute handlers in parallel
    const executions = handlers.map(handler =&gt;
      this.executeHandler(projectId, handler, enhancedPayload)
    );

    const results = await Promise.allSettled(executions);

    // Process results
    const handlerResults: HandlerResult[] = [];
    for (let i = 0; i &lt; results.length; i++) {
      const result = results[i];
      const handler = handlers[i];

      if (result.status === &#39;fulfilled&#39;) {
        handlerResults.push(result.value.result);
        this.updateHandlerStats(handler.id, result.value.result);
      } else {
        const errorResult: HandlerResult = {
          success: false,
          message: `Handler execution failed: ${result.reason}`,
          errors: [
            {
              code: &#39;EXECUTION_FAILED&#39;,
              message: result.reason?.message || &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
              stack: result.reason?.stack,
            },
          ],
        };
        handlerResults.push(errorResult);
        this.updateHandlerStats(handler.id, errorResult);
      }
    }

    return handlerResults;
  }

  /**
   * Execute a single handler with timeout and error handling
   */
  private async executeHandler(
    projectId: string,
    handler: RegisteredHandler,
    payload: EnhancedWebhookPayload
  ): Promise&lt;{ result: HandlerResult; execution: HandlerExecution }&gt; {
    const executionId = generateId();
    const startTime = Date.now();
    const startedAt = getCurrentTimestamp();

    this.logger.debug(&#39;Starting handler execution&#39;, {
      executionId,
      handlerId: handler.id,
      handlerName: handler.metadata?.name,
      projectId,
    });

    // Create abort controller for timeout
    const abortController = new AbortController();
    this.activeExecutions.set(executionId, abortController);

    let result: HandlerResult;
    let completedAt: string;
    let duration: number;

    try {
      // Load handler module
      const handlerModule = await this.loadHandlerModule(handler);

      // Create execution context
      const context = await this.createHandlerContext(
        projectId,
        handler,
        executionId,
        abortController.signal
      );

      // Execute with timeout
      const timeoutPromise = setTimeout(handler.config.timeout, null, {
        signal: abortController.signal,
      });

      const executionPromise = this.executeWithRetries(
        handlerModule.handler,
        payload,
        context,
        handler.config.retries
      );

      const raceResult = await Promise.race([executionPromise, timeoutPromise]);

      if (raceResult === null) {
        throw new Error(`Handler execution timed out after ${handler.config.timeout}ms`);
      }

      result = raceResult as HandlerResult;

      // Add timing information
      const endTime = Date.now();
      duration = endTime - startTime;
      completedAt = getCurrentTimestamp();
      result.duration = duration;

      this.logger.info(&#39;Handler execution completed&#39;, {
        executionId,
        handlerId: handler.id,
        success: result.success,
        duration,
        actionsCount: result.actions?.length || 0,
      });
    } catch (error) {
      const endTime = Date.now();
      duration = endTime - startTime;
      completedAt = getCurrentTimestamp();

      this.logger.error(&#39;Handler execution failed&#39;, error as Error, {
        executionId,
        handlerId: handler.id,
        projectId,
        duration,
      });

      result = {
        success: false,
        message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
        duration,
        errors: [
          {
            code: &#39;HANDLER_EXECUTION_ERROR&#39;,
            message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
            stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined,
          },
        ],
      };
    } finally {
      // Clean up
      this.activeExecutions.delete(executionId);
      abortController.abort();
    }

    // Record execution
    const execution: HandlerExecution = {
      id: executionId,
      handlerId: handler.id,
      projectId,
      provider: payload.repository.full_name.includes(&#39;gitlab&#39;) ? &#39;gitlab&#39; : &#39;github&#39;,
      event: payload.parsed.eventType,
      payload,
      result,
      startedAt,
      completedAt,
      duration,
    };

    this.executionHistory.push(execution);

    // Trim history to prevent memory leaks (keep last 1000 executions)
    if (this.executionHistory.length &gt; 1000) {
      this.executionHistory = this.executionHistory.slice(-1000);
    }

    return { result, execution };
  }

  /**
   * Execute handler with retry logic
   */
  private async executeWithRetries(
    handler: WebhookHandler,
    payload: EnhancedWebhookPayload,
    context: HandlerContext,
    retries: number
  ): Promise&lt;HandlerResult&gt; {
    let lastError: Error | undefined;

    for (let attempt = 0; attempt &lt;= retries; attempt++) {
      try {
        if (attempt &gt; 0) {
          const delay = Math.min(1000 * 2 ** (attempt - 1), 5000); // Exponential backoff
          await setTimeout(delay);

          this.logger.info(&#39;Retrying handler execution&#39;, {
            attempt,
            maxRetries: retries,
            delay,
          });
        }

        const result = await handler(payload, context);

        // If successful or explicitly non-retryable, return immediately
        if (result.success || !this.isRetryableError(result)) {
          return result;
        }

        lastError = new Error(result.message);
      } catch (error) {
        lastError = error as Error;

        // If not retryable, fail immediately
        if (!this.isRetryableError(error)) {
          throw error;
        }
      }
    }

    // All retries exhausted
    throw new Error(`Handler failed after ${retries + 1} attempts: ${lastError?.message}`);
  }

  /**
   * Check if an error is retryable
   */
  private isRetryableError(error: unknown): boolean {
    if (error instanceof Error) {
      const message = error.message.toLowerCase();

      // Network/timeout errors are retryable
      if (
        message.includes(&#39;timeout&#39;) ||
        message.includes(&#39;network&#39;) ||
        message.includes(&#39;connection&#39;) ||
        message.includes(&#39;econnreset&#39;) ||
        message.includes(&#39;enotfound&#39;)
      ) {
        return true;
      }

      // HTTP 5xx errors are retryable
      if (message.includes(&#39;5&#39;) &amp;&amp; message.includes(&#39;error&#39;)) {
        return true;
      }
    }

    if (typeof error === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp; error !== null) {
      const result = error as HandlerResult;
      if (result.errors) {
        return result.errors.some(e =&gt;
          [&#39;TIMEOUT&#39;, &#39;NETWORK_ERROR&#39;, &#39;SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE&#39;].includes(e.code)
        );
      }
    }

    return false;
  }

  /**
   * Load handler module dynamically
   */
  private async loadHandlerModule(handler: RegisteredHandler): Promise&lt;any&gt; {
    return this.loader.load(handler);
  }

  /**
   * Create handler execution context
   */
  private async createHandlerContext(
    projectId: string,
    handler: RegisteredHandler,
    executionId: string,
    abortSignal: AbortSignal
  ): Promise&lt;HandlerContext&gt; {
    const sanitizedEnvironment = HandlerSecurityValidator.sanitizeEnvironment(
      handler.config.environment
    );

    const secretsValidation = HandlerSecurityValidator.validateSecrets(handler.config.secrets);
    if (!secretsValidation.valid) {
      throw new Error(
        `Handler secrets configuration invalid: ${secretsValidation.errors.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`
      );
    }

    const sanitizedConfig = {
      ...handler.config,
      environment: sanitizedEnvironment,
      secrets: { ...handler.config.secrets },
    } as HandlerContext[&#39;config&#39;];

    return {
      projectId,
      config: sanitizedConfig,
      logger: this.createHandlerLogger(handler.id, executionId),
      services: this.services,
      metadata: {
        handlerPath: handler.handlerPath,
        version: handler.metadata?.version || &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
        executionId,
        timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Create scoped logger for handler
   */
  private createHandlerLogger(handlerId: string, executionId: string): Logger {
    return {
      info: (message: string, meta?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) =&gt; {
        this.logger.info(message, { ...meta, handlerId, executionId });
      },
      warn: (message: string, meta?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) =&gt; {
        this.logger.warn(message, { ...meta, handlerId, executionId });
      },
      error: (message: string, error?: Error, meta?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) =&gt; {
        this.logger.error(message, error, { ...meta, handlerId, executionId });
      },
      debug: (message: string, meta?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) =&gt; {
        this.logger.debug(message, { ...meta, handlerId, executionId });
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Enhance webhook payload with parsed data
   */
  private async enhancePayload(request: WebhookRequest): Promise&lt;EnhancedWebhookPayload&gt; {
    const { provider, event, payload } = request;

    // Parse payload based on provider and event type
    const parsed = await this.parsePayload(provider, event, payload);

    return {
      ...payload,
      parsed,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Parse webhook payload into standardized format
   */
  private async parsePayload(
    provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;,
    event: string,
    payload: WebhookPayload
  ): Promise&lt;EnhancedWebhookPayload[&#39;parsed&#39;]&gt; {
    const parsed: EnhancedWebhookPayload[&#39;parsed&#39;] = {
      eventType: event,
      author: {
        name: &#39;Unknown&#39;,
        email: undefined,
        username: undefined,
      },
      repository: {
        name: payload.repository?.full_name?.split(&#39;/&#39;).pop() || &#39;unknown&#39;,
        fullName: payload.repository?.full_name || &#39;unknown&#39;,
        owner: payload.repository?.full_name?.split(&#39;/&#39;)[0] || &#39;unknown&#39;,
        url: payload.repository?.clone_url || &#39;&#39;,
        defaultBranch: payload.repository?.default_branch || &#39;main&#39;,
        isPrivate: false,
      },
    };

    // Provider-specific parsing
    if (provider === &#39;github&#39;) {
      await this.parseGitHubPayload(event, payload, parsed);
    } else if (provider === &#39;gitlab&#39;) {
      await this.parseGitLabPayload(event, payload, parsed);
    }

    return parsed;
  }

  /**
   * Parse GitHub webhook payload
   */
  private async parseGitHubPayload(
    event: string,
    payload: any,
    parsed: EnhancedWebhookPayload[&#39;parsed&#39;]
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Common GitHub fields
    if (payload.sender) {
      parsed.author.username = payload.sender.login;
      parsed.author.name = payload.sender.login;
    }

    if (payload.repository) {
      parsed.repository.isPrivate = payload.repository.private;
      parsed.repository.url = payload.repository.html_url;
    }

    // Event-specific parsing
    switch (event) {
      case &#39;push&#39;:
        if (payload.commits) {
          parsed.commits = payload.commits.map((commit: any) =&gt; ({
            sha: commit.id,
            message: commit.message,
            author: commit.author.name,
            url: commit.url,
            timestamp: commit.timestamp,
            added: commit.added || [],
            modified: commit.modified || [],
            removed: commit.removed || [],
          }));
        }
        break;

      case &#39;pull_request&#39;:
        if (payload.pull_request) {
          parsed.action = payload.action;
          parsed.pullRequest = {
            id: payload.pull_request.number,
            title: payload.pull_request.title,
            body: payload.pull_request.body || &#39;&#39;,
            state: payload.pull_request.state,
            baseBranch: payload.pull_request.base.ref,
            headBranch: payload.pull_request.head.ref,
            url: payload.pull_request.html_url,
            merged: payload.pull_request.merged,
            mergeable: payload.pull_request.mergeable,
          };
        }
        break;

      case &#39;issues&#39;:
        if (payload.issue) {
          parsed.action = payload.action;
          parsed.issue = {
            id: payload.issue.number,
            title: payload.issue.title,
            body: payload.issue.body || &#39;&#39;,
            state: payload.issue.state,
            labels: payload.issue.labels?.map((l: any) =&gt; l.name) || [],
            assignees: payload.issue.assignees?.map((a: any) =&gt; a.login) || [],
            url: payload.issue.html_url,
          };
        }
        break;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Parse GitLab webhook payload
   */
  private async parseGitLabPayload(
    event: string,
    payload: any,
    parsed: EnhancedWebhookPayload[&#39;parsed&#39;]
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Common GitLab fields
    if (payload.user) {
      parsed.author.username = payload.user.username;
      parsed.author.name = payload.user.name;
      parsed.author.email = payload.user.email;
    }

    if (payload.project) {
      parsed.repository.name = payload.project.name;
      parsed.repository.fullName = payload.project.path_with_namespace;
      parsed.repository.url = payload.project.web_url;
      parsed.repository.isPrivate = payload.project.visibility_level &lt; 20;
      parsed.repository.defaultBranch = payload.project.default_branch;
    }

    // Event-specific parsing
    switch (event) {
      case &#39;Push Hook&#39;:
        if (payload.commits) {
          parsed.commits = payload.commits.map((commit: any) =&gt; ({
            sha: commit.id,
            message: commit.message,
            author: commit.author.name,
            url: commit.url,
            timestamp: commit.timestamp,
            added: commit.added || [],
            modified: commit.modified || [],
            removed: commit.removed || [],
          }));
        }
        break;

      case &#39;Merge Request Hook&#39;:
        if (payload.merge_request) {
          parsed.action = payload.action;
          parsed.pullRequest = {
            id: payload.merge_request.iid,
            title: payload.merge_request.title,
            body: payload.merge_request.description || &#39;&#39;,
            state: payload.merge_request.state,
            baseBranch: payload.merge_request.target_branch,
            headBranch: payload.merge_request.source_branch,
            url: payload.merge_request.url,
            merged: payload.merge_request.state === &#39;merged&#39;,
            mergeable: payload.merge_request.merge_status === &#39;can_be_merged&#39;,
          };
        }
        break;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Update handler statistics
   */
  private updateHandlerStats(handlerId: string, result: HandlerResult): void {
    const handler = this.discovery.getHandler(handlerId);
    if (handler) {
      handler.executionCount++;
      handler.lastExecuted = getCurrentTimestamp();

      if (!result.success) {
        handler.errorCount++;
      }

      this.discovery.updateHandlerConfig(handlerId, {
        executionCount: handler.executionCount,
        errorCount: handler.errorCount,
        lastExecuted: handler.lastExecuted,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get execution history
   */
  getExecutionHistory(limit = 100): HandlerExecution[] {
    return this.executionHistory.slice(-limit);
  }

  /**
   * Get active executions count
   */
  getActiveExecutionCount(): number {
    return this.activeExecutions.size;
  }

  /**
   * Cancel all active executions
   */
  cancelAllExecutions(): void {
    for (const [executionId, controller] of this.activeExecutions) {
      controller.abort();
      this.logger.info(&#39;Cancelled handler execution&#39;, { executionId });
    }
    this.activeExecutions.clear();
  }

  /**
   * Clean up resources
   */
  dispose(): void {
    this.cancelAllExecutions();
    this.executionHistory.length = 0;
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/handlers/manager.ts
/**
 * Handler Manager - Integrates custom handlers with existing webhook system
 * This is the main integration point that extends the WebhookService
 */

import { access, mkdir, writeFile } from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import { join } from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import type { SpecWorkbenchDB } from &#39;../db.js&#39;;
import type { EventService } from &#39;../events.js&#39;;
import type { ServerConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { logger as defaultLogger } from &#39;../utils.js&#39;;
import { HandlerDiscovery } from &#39;./discovery.js&#39;;
import { HandlerExecutor } from &#39;./executor.js&#39;;
import {
  HandlerGitService,
  HandlerHttpClient,
  HandlerNotificationService,
  type HandlerEmailConfig,
} from &#39;./services.js&#39;;
import type {
  HandlerDiscoveryConfig,
  HandlerExecution,
  HandlerResult,
  HandlerServices,
  Logger,
  RegisteredHandler,
  WebhookRequest,
  HandlerCreationOptions,
} from &#39;./types.js&#39;;

export class CustomHandlerManager {
  private discovery: HandlerDiscovery;
  private executor: HandlerExecutor;
  private services: HandlerServices;
  private initialized = false;

  constructor(
    private config: ServerConfig,
    private events: EventService,
    private db: SpecWorkbenchDB,
    private logger: Logger = defaultLogger
  ) {
    // Initialize handler services
    const emailConfig = this.config.handlers?.notifications?.email as
      | HandlerEmailConfig
      | undefined;

    this.services = {
      events: this.events,
      db: this.db,
      http: new HandlerHttpClient(this.logger),
