      notifications: new HandlerNotificationService(this.logger, emailConfig),
      git: new HandlerGitService(this.logger),
    };

    // Configure discovery
    const discoveryConfig: HandlerDiscoveryConfig = {
      handlersDirectory: join(process.cwd(), &#39;arbiter&#39;, &#39;handlers&#39;),
      enableAutoReload: this.config.handlers?.enableAutoReload ?? false,
      maxConcurrentExecutions: this.config.handlers?.maxConcurrentExecutions ?? 10,
      defaultTimeout: this.config.handlers?.defaultTimeout ?? 30000,
      defaultRetries: this.config.handlers?.defaultRetries ?? 2,
      sandboxEnabled: this.config.handlers?.sandboxEnabled ?? true,
      allowedModules: this.config.handlers?.allowedModules ?? [
        &#39;node:crypto&#39;,
        &#39;node:util&#39;,
        &#39;node:url&#39;,
        &#39;node:path&#39;,
      ],
      enableMetrics: this.config.handlers?.enableMetrics ?? true,
    };

    this.discovery = new HandlerDiscovery(discoveryConfig, this.logger);
    this.executor = new HandlerExecutor(this.discovery, this.services, this.logger);
  }

  /**
   * Initialize the handler system
   */
  async initialize(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.initialized) return;

    this.logger.info(&#39;Initializing custom handler manager&#39;);

    try {
      // Discover and load all handlers
      const handlers = await this.discovery.discoverHandlers();

      this.logger.info(&#39;Custom handler manager initialized&#39;, {
        handlersCount: handlers.length,
        enabledHandlers: handlers.filter(h =&gt; h.enabled).length,
      });

      this.initialized = true;
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Failed to initialize custom handler manager&#39;, error as Error);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Process webhook with custom handlers (integrates with existing WebhookService)
   */
  async processWebhookWithCustomHandlers(
    projectId: string,
    request: WebhookRequest
  ): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
    if (!this.initialized) {
      await this.initialize();
    }

    const actions: string[] = [];

    try {
      this.logger.info(&#39;Processing webhook with custom handlers&#39;, {
        projectId,
        provider: request.provider,
        event: request.event,
      });

      // Execute custom handlers
      const handlerResults = await this.executor.executeHandlers(projectId, request);

      // Process results and extract actions
      for (const result of handlerResults) {
        if (result.success &amp;&amp; result.actions) {
          actions.push(...result.actions);
        } else if (!result.success) {
          actions.push(`Custom handler failed: ${result.message}`);

          // Log handler errors
          if (result.errors) {
            for (const error of result.errors) {
              this.logger.error(&#39;Custom handler error&#39;, new Error(error.message), {
                projectId,
                errorCode: error.code,
                errorDetails: error.details,
              });
            }
          }
        }
      }

      // Broadcast custom handler events
      if (handlerResults.length &gt; 0) {
        await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
          project_id: projectId,
          event_type: &#39;webhook_received&#39;,
          data: {
            provider: request.provider,
            event: request.event,
            customHandlersExecuted: handlerResults.length,
            successfulHandlers: handlerResults.filter(r =&gt; r.success).length,
            failedHandlers: handlerResults.filter(r =&gt; !r.success).length,
            totalActions: actions.length,
          },
        });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Custom handler processing failed&#39;, error as Error, {
        projectId,
        provider: request.provider,
        event: request.event,
      });

      actions.push(&#39;Custom handler processing failed&#39;);
    }

    return actions;
  }

  /**
   * Create and register a new handler on disk
   */
  async createHandler(options: HandlerCreationOptions): Promise&lt;RegisteredHandler&gt; {
    if (!options.code || options.code.trim().length === 0) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Handler code must not be empty&#39;);
    }

    if (options.provider !== &#39;github&#39; &amp;&amp; options.provider !== &#39;gitlab&#39;) {
      throw new Error(`Unsupported provider: ${options.provider}`);
    }

    if (!this.initialized) {
      await this.initialize();
    }

    const normalizedEvent = this.normalizeEventName(options.event);
    const handlersRoot = join(process.cwd(), &#39;arbiter&#39;, &#39;handlers&#39;, options.provider);
    await mkdir(handlersRoot, { recursive: true });

    const extension = this.detectFileExtension(options.code);
    let fileName = `${normalizedEvent}${extension}`;
    let handlerPath = join(handlersRoot, fileName);
    let counter = 1;

    while (await this.pathExists(handlerPath)) {
      fileName = `${normalizedEvent}-${counter++}${extension}`;
      handlerPath = join(handlersRoot, fileName);
    }

    const source = this.buildHandlerModuleSource(options, normalizedEvent);
    await writeFile(handlerPath, source, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

    const handler = await this.discovery.registerHandlerFromFile(
      handlerPath,
      options.provider,
      normalizedEvent
    );

    this.logger.info(&#39;Custom handler created&#39;, {
      id: handler.id,
      provider: handler.provider,
      event: handler.event,
      path: handler.handlerPath,
    });

    return handler;
  }

  /**
   * Get all registered handlers
   */
  getHandlers(): RegisteredHandler[] {
    return this.discovery.getHandlers();
  }

  /**
   * Get handlers for specific provider/event
   */
  getHandlersForEvent(provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;, event: string): RegisteredHandler[] {
    return this.discovery.getHandlersForEvent(provider, event);
  }

  /**
   * Get handler by ID
   */
  getHandler(id: string): RegisteredHandler | undefined {
    return this.discovery.getHandler(id);
  }

  /**
   * Update handler configuration
   */
  updateHandlerConfig(id: string, updates: Partial&lt;RegisteredHandler&gt;): boolean {
    return this.discovery.updateHandlerConfig(id, updates);
  }

  /**
   * Enable/disable handler
   */
  setHandlerEnabled(id: string, enabled: boolean): boolean {
    return this.discovery.setHandlerEnabled(id, enabled);
  }

  /**
   * Remove handler
   */
  removeHandler(id: string): boolean {
    return this.discovery.removeHandler(id);
  }

  /**
   * Reload handler from file
   */
  async reloadHandler(id: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    return await this.discovery.reloadHandler(id);
  }

  /**
   * Get execution history
   */
  getExecutionHistory(limit = 100): HandlerExecution[] {
    return this.executor.getExecutionHistory(limit);
  }

  /**
   * Get handler statistics
   */
  getHandlerStats(): {
    totalHandlers: number;
    enabledHandlers: number;
    activeExecutions: number;
    totalExecutions: number;
    failedExecutions: number;
  } {
    const handlers = this.discovery.getHandlers();
    const executions = this.executor.getExecutionHistory();

    return {
      totalHandlers: handlers.length,
      enabledHandlers: handlers.filter(h =&gt; h.enabled).length,
      activeExecutions: this.executor.getActiveExecutionCount(),
      totalExecutions: executions.length,
      failedExecutions: executions.filter(e =&gt; !e.result.success).length,
    };
  }



  private normalizeEventName(event: string): string {
    const trimmed = event.trim().toLowerCase();
    if (trimmed.length === 0) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Event name is required&#39;);
    }

    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;/&#39;) || trimmed.includes(&#39;\\&#39;)) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Event name cannot contain path separators&#39;);
    }

    return trimmed.replace(/[^a-z0-9._-]/g, &#39;-&#39;);
  }

  private detectFileExtension(code: string): &#39;.ts&#39; | &#39;.js&#39; {
    const trimmed = code.trim();
    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;module.exports&#39;) || trimmed.includes(&#39;require(&#39;)) {
      return &#39;.js&#39;;
    }

    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;export &#39;) || trimmed.includes(&#39;import &#39;)) {
      return &#39;.ts&#39;;
    }

    return &#39;.ts&#39;;
  }

  private async pathExists(target: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    try {
      await access(target);
      return true;
    } catch {
      return false;
    }
  }

  private buildHandlerModuleSource(
    options: HandlerCreationOptions,
    normalizedEvent: string
  ): string {
    const trimmed = options.code.trim();

    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;export default&#39;)) {
      const transformed = trimmed.replace(/export\s+default/, &#39;module.exports =&#39;);
      return transformed.endsWith(&#39;\n&#39;) ? transformed : `${transformed}\n`;
    }

    if (trimmed.includes(&#39;module.exports&#39;) || trimmed.includes(&#39;exports.&#39;)) {
      return trimmed.endsWith(&#39;\n&#39;) ? trimmed : `${trimmed}\n`;
    }

    const defaultTimeout = this.config.handlers?.defaultTimeout ?? 30000;
    const defaultRetries = this.config.handlers?.defaultRetries ?? 2;

    const config = {
      enabled: options.config?.enabled ?? true,
      timeout: options.config?.timeout ?? defaultTimeout,
      retries: options.config?.retries ?? defaultRetries,
      environment: options.config?.environment ?? {},
      secrets: options.config?.secrets ?? {},
    };

    const metadata = {
      name: options.metadata?.name ?? `${options.provider} ${normalizedEvent} handler`,
      description:
        options.metadata?.description ?? &#39;Custom webhook handler generated by Arbiter&#39;,
      version: options.metadata?.version ?? &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
      author: options.metadata?.author ?? &#39;Arbiter&#39;,
      supportedEvents: [normalizedEvent],
      requiredPermissions: [],
    };

    const defaultBody = [
      &#39;return {&#39;,
      &quot;  success: true,&quot;,
      &quot;  message: &#39;Handler executed successfully&#39;,&quot;,
      &#39;  actions: [],&#39;,
      &#39;};&#39;,
    ].join(&quot;\n&quot;);

    const body = trimmed.length &gt; 0 ? this.indentSnippet(trimmed) : this.indentSnippet(defaultBody);

    return `module.exports = {
  config: ${this.formatObjectLiteral(config, 4)},
  metadata: ${this.formatObjectLiteral(metadata, 4)},
  handler: async (payload, context) =&gt; {
${body}
  },
};
`;
  }

  private formatObjectLiteral(value: unknown, indent: number): string {
    const json = JSON.stringify(value, null, 2);
    const lines = json.split(&quot;\n&quot;);
    return lines
      .map((line, index) =&gt; {
        if (index === 0 || index === lines.length - 1) {
          return line;
        }
        return `${&#39; &#39;.repeat(indent)}${line.trimStart()}`;
      })
      .join(&#39;\n&#39;);
  }

  private indentSnippet(snippet: string, indentSize = 4): string {
    const indent = &#39; &#39;.repeat(indentSize);
    return snippet
      .split(&#39;\n&#39;)
      .map(line =&gt; `${indent}${line.trimEnd()}`)
      .join(&#39;\n&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Create a new handler directory structure
   */
  async createHandlerStructure(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const { promises: fs } = await import(&#39;node:fs&#39;);
    const path = await import(&#39;node:path&#39;);

    const handlersDir = path.join(process.cwd(), &#39;arbiter&#39;, &#39;handlers&#39;);

    try {
      // Create directory structure
      await fs.mkdir(path.join(handlersDir, &#39;github&#39;), { recursive: true });
      await fs.mkdir(path.join(handlersDir, &#39;gitlab&#39;), { recursive: true });
      await fs.mkdir(path.join(handlersDir, &#39;shared&#39;), { recursive: true });
      await fs.mkdir(path.join(handlersDir, &#39;examples&#39;), { recursive: true });

      // Create example configuration
      const configExample = {
        $schema: &#39;./handler-config.schema.json&#39;,
        defaults: {
          timeout: 30000,
          retries: 2,
          enabled: true,
        },
        handlers: {
          &#39;github/push&#39;: {
            enabled: true,
            timeout: 15000,
            environment: {
              NODE_ENV: &#39;production&#39;,
            },
            secrets: {
              SLACK_WEBHOOK: &#39;${HANDLER_SLACK_WEBHOOK}&#39;,
              JIRA_TOKEN: &#39;${HANDLER_JIRA_TOKEN}&#39;,
            },
          },
        },
      };

      await fs.writeFile(
        path.join(handlersDir, &#39;.handlers-config.json&#39;),
        JSON.stringify(configExample, null, 2)
      );

      // Create shared utilities example
      const utilsExample = `/**
 * Shared utilities for webhook handlers
 */

export function formatSlackMessage(title: string, details: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) {
  return {
    blocks: [
      {
        type: &#39;section&#39;,
        text: {
          type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
          text: \`*\${title}*\`
        }
      },
      {
        type: &#39;section&#39;,
        fields: Object.entries(details).map(([key, value]) =&gt; ({
          type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
          text: \`*\${key}:* \${value}\`
        }))
      }
    ]
  };
}

export function extractSpecFiles(filePaths: string[]): string[] {
  return filePaths.filter(path =&gt; path.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;) || path.endsWith(&#39;.spec.ts&#39;));
}

export function shouldNotify(branch: string, defaultBranch: string): boolean {
  return branch === \`refs/heads/\${defaultBranch}\` || branch.includes(&#39;release&#39;);
}
`;

      await fs.writeFile(path.join(handlersDir, &#39;shared&#39;, &#39;utils.ts&#39;), utilsExample);

      this.logger.info(&#39;Handler directory structure created&#39;, { path: handlersDir });
    } catch (error) {
      this.logger.error(&#39;Failed to create handler structure&#39;, error as Error);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate handler file
   */
  async validateHandler(filePath: string): Promise&lt;{
    valid: boolean;
    errors: string[];
    warnings: string[];
  }&gt; {
    const result = {
      valid: true,
      errors: [] as string[],
      warnings: [] as string[],
    };

    try {
      // Basic file validation
      const { promises: fs } = await import(&#39;node:fs&#39;);
      const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

      // Check for required exports
      if (!content.includes(&#39;export default&#39;) &amp;&amp; !content.includes(&#39;exports.handler&#39;)) {
        result.errors.push(&#39;Handler must export a default handler module&#39;);
        result.valid = false;
      }

      // Check for async handler function
      if (!content.includes(&#39;async&#39;) || !content.includes(&#39;Promise&#39;)) {
        result.warnings.push(&#39;Handler should be async and return a Promise&lt;HandlerResult&gt;&#39;);
      }

      // Check for proper error handling
      if (!content.includes(&#39;try&#39;) || !content.includes(&#39;catch&#39;)) {
        result.warnings.push(&#39;Handler should include proper error handling (try/catch)&#39;);
      }

      // Check for context usage
      if (!content.includes(&#39;context.logger&#39;) &amp;&amp; !content.includes(&#39;logger&#39;)) {
        result.warnings.push(&#39;Handler should use context.logger for logging&#39;);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      result.errors.push(
        `Failed to read handler file: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;}`
      );
      result.valid = false;
    }

    return result;
  }

  /**
   * Shutdown handler manager
   */
  async dispose(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.logger.info(&#39;Shutting down custom handler manager&#39;);

    this.executor.dispose();
    this.discovery.dispose();

    this.initialized = false;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/github-templates.ts
/**
 * GitHub Templates and Field Management
 *
 * Provides structured templates for GitHub issues and proper field organization
 * instead of just putting everything in the body text.
 *
 * @deprecated Use ConfigurableTemplateManager from github-template-config.ts instead
 */

import {
  ConfigurableTemplateManager,
  DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG,
  type GeneratedTemplate,
  type TemplateFiles,
} from &#39;./github-template-config.js&#39;;
import type { Epic, Task } from &#39;./sharded-storage.js&#39;;

export interface GitHubEpicTemplate {
  title: string;
  body: string;
  labels: string[];
  assignees?: string[];
  milestone?: number;
  projects?: number[];
}

export interface GitHubTaskTemplate {
  title: string;
  body: string;
  labels: string[];
  assignees?: string[];
  milestone?: number;
  projects?: number[];
}

export interface GitHubTemplateOptions {
  includeMetadata?: boolean;
  includeArbiterIds?: boolean;
  includeAcceptanceCriteria?: boolean;
  includeDependencies?: boolean;
  includeEstimations?: boolean;
  customFields?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
}

export interface ValidationRule {
  field: string;
  required: boolean;
  validator?: (value: any) =&gt; boolean;
  errorMessage?: string;
}

export interface TemplateValidationConfig {
  epic: ValidationRule[];
  task: ValidationRule[];
  milestone: ValidationRule[];
}

/**
 * Default validation rules for GitHub templates
 */
export const DEFAULT_VALIDATION_CONFIG: TemplateValidationConfig = {
  epic: [
    {
      field: &#39;name&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt;= 5 &amp;&amp; value.length &lt;= 80,
      errorMessage: &#39;Epic name must be 5-80 characters&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;description&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt;= 20,
      errorMessage: &#39;Epic description must be at least 20 characters&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;priority&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; [&#39;critical&#39;, &#39;high&#39;, &#39;medium&#39;, &#39;low&#39;].includes(value),
      errorMessage: &#39;Priority must be one of: critical, high, medium, low&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;owner&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt; 0,
      errorMessage: &#39;Epic must have an assigned owner&#39;,
    },
  ],
  task: [
    {
      field: &#39;name&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt;= 5 &amp;&amp; value.length &lt;= 80,
      errorMessage: &#39;Task name must be 5-80 characters&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;description&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt;= 10,
      errorMessage: &#39;Task description must be at least 10 characters&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;type&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt;
        [&#39;feature&#39;, &#39;bug&#39;, &#39;refactor&#39;, &#39;test&#39;, &#39;docs&#39;, &#39;devops&#39;, &#39;research&#39;].includes(value),
      errorMessage:
        &#39;Task type must be one of: feature, bug, refactor, test, docs, devops, research&#39;,
    },
    {
      field: &#39;acceptanceCriteria&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string[]) =&gt; Array.isArray(value) &amp;&amp; value.length &gt; 0,
      errorMessage: &#39;Task must have at least one acceptance criterion&#39;,
    },
  ],
  milestone: [
    {
      field: &#39;name&#39;,
      required: true,
      validator: (value: string) =&gt; value.length &gt;= 5 &amp;&amp; value.length &lt;= 80,
      errorMessage: &#39;Milestone name must be 5-80 characters&#39;,
    },
  ],
};

export class GitHubTemplateManager {
  private validationConfig: TemplateValidationConfig;

  constructor(validationConfig: TemplateValidationConfig = DEFAULT_VALIDATION_CONFIG) {
    this.validationConfig = validationConfig;
  }

  /**
   * Generate epic template with proper structured fields
   */
  generateEpicTemplate(epic: Epic, options: GitHubTemplateOptions = {}): GitHubEpicTemplate {
    // Validate epic before generating template
    this.validateEpic(epic);

    const title = this.generateEpicTitle(epic);
    const body = this.generateEpicBody(epic, options);
    const labels = this.generateEpicLabels(epic);
    const assignees = this.generateEpicAssignees(epic);

    return {
      title,
      body,
      labels,
      assignees,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate task template with proper structured fields
   */
  generateTaskTemplate(
    task: Task,
    epic: Epic,
    options: GitHubTemplateOptions = {}
  ): GitHubTaskTemplate {
    // Validate task before generating template
    this.validateTask(task);

    const title = this.generateTaskTitle(task, epic);
    const body = this.generateTaskBody(task, epic, options);
    const labels = this.generateTaskLabels(task, epic);
    const assignees = this.generateTaskAssignees(task);

    return {
      title,
      body,
      labels,
      assignees,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Validate epic against configured rules
   */
  validateEpic(epic: Epic): void {
    const errors: string[] = [];

    for (const rule of this.validationConfig.epic) {
      const value = (epic as any)[rule.field];

      if (rule.required &amp;&amp; (!value || (Array.isArray(value) &amp;&amp; value.length === 0))) {
        errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} is required`);
        continue;
      }

      if (value &amp;&amp; rule.validator &amp;&amp; !rule.validator(value)) {
        errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} is invalid`);
      }
    }

    if (errors.length &gt; 0) {
      throw new Error(`Epic validation failed:\n${errors.map(e =&gt; `  • ${e}`).join(&#39;\n&#39;)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate task against configured rules
   */
  validateTask(task: Task): void {
    const errors: string[] = [];

    for (const rule of this.validationConfig.task) {
      const value = (task as any)[rule.field];

      if (rule.required &amp;&amp; (!value || (Array.isArray(value) &amp;&amp; value.length === 0))) {
        errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} is required`);
        continue;
      }

      if (value &amp;&amp; rule.validator &amp;&amp; !rule.validator(value)) {
        errors.push(rule.errorMessage || `${rule.field} is invalid`);
      }
    }

    if (errors.length &gt; 0) {
      throw new Error(`Task validation failed:\n${errors.map(e =&gt; `  • ${e}`).join(&#39;\n&#39;)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Generate properly structured epic title
   */
  private generateEpicTitle(epic: Epic): string {
    const prefix = &#39;[EPIC]&#39;;
    const priority = epic.priority?.toUpperCase() || &#39;MEDIUM&#39;;
    return `${prefix} ${priority}: ${epic.name}`;
  }

  /**
   * Generate properly structured task title
   */
  private generateTaskTitle(task: Task, epic: Epic): string {
    const prefix = `[${task.type?.toUpperCase() || &#39;TASK&#39;}]`;
    const priority = task.priority?.toUpperCase() || &#39;MEDIUM&#39;;
    return `${prefix} ${priority}: ${task.name}`;
  }

  /**
   * Generate structured epic body using GitHub&#39;s field formatting
   */
  private generateEpicBody(epic: Epic, options: GitHubTemplateOptions): string {
    let body = &#39;&#39;;

    // Add hidden Arbiter ID for tracking
    if (options.includeArbiterIds !== false) {
      body += `&lt;!-- arbiter-id: ${epic.id} --&gt;\n&lt;!-- arbiter-type: epic --&gt;\n\n`;
    }

    // Description section
    body += `## 📋 Description\n\n${epic.description || &#39;No description provided&#39;}\n\n`;

    // Epic Details section
    body += &#39;## 📊 Epic Details\n\n&#39;;
    body += &#39;| Field | Value |\n&#39;;
    body += &#39;|-------|-------|\n&#39;;
    body += `| **Priority** | \`${epic.priority}\` |\n`;
    body += `| **Status** | \`${epic.status}\` |\n`;
    body += `| **Owner** | ${epic.owner ? `@${epic.owner}` : &#39;Unassigned&#39;} |\n`;
    body += `| **Assignee** | ${epic.assignee ? `@${epic.assignee}` : &#39;Unassigned&#39;} |\n`;

    if (options.includeEstimations !== false) {
      if (epic.estimatedHours) {
        body += `| **Estimated Hours** | ${epic.estimatedHours}h |\n`;
      }
      if (epic.actualHours) {
        body += `| **Actual Hours** | ${epic.actualHours}h |\n`;
      }
    }

    if (epic.startDate) {
      body += `| **Start Date** | ${epic.startDate} |\n`;
    }
    if (epic.dueDate) {
      body += `| **Due Date** | ${epic.dueDate} |\n`;
    }

    body += &#39;\n&#39;;

    // Tasks Overview section
    if (epic.tasks.length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## ✅ Tasks Overview\n\n&#39;;
      body += `**Total Tasks:** ${epic.tasks.length}\n\n`;

      const tasksByStatus = epic.tasks.reduce(
        (acc, task) =&gt; {
          acc[task.status] = (acc[task.status] || 0) + 1;
          return acc;
        },
        {} as Record&lt;string, number&gt;
      );

      body += &#39;**Status Breakdown:**\n&#39;;
      Object.entries(tasksByStatus).forEach(([status, count]) =&gt; {
        const emoji = this.getStatusEmoji(status);
        body += `- ${emoji} ${status}: ${count} tasks\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Dependencies section
    if (
      options.includeDependencies !== false &amp;&amp;
      epic.dependencies &amp;&amp;
      epic.dependencies.length &gt; 0
    ) {
      body += &#39;## 🔗 Dependencies\n\n&#39;;
      epic.dependencies.forEach(dep =&gt; {
        body += `- [ ] ${dep}\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Labels and Tags section
    if (epic.labels &amp;&amp; epic.labels.length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## 🏷️ Labels\n\n&#39;;
      epic.labels.forEach(label =&gt; {
        body += `\`${label}\` `;
      });
      body += &#39;\n\n&#39;;
    }

    // Custom fields
    if (options.customFields &amp;&amp; Object.keys(options.customFields).length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## 🔧 Additional Information\n\n&#39;;
      Object.entries(options.customFields).forEach(([key, value]) =&gt; {
        body += `**${key}:** ${value}\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    return body.trim();
  }

  /**
   * Generate structured task body using GitHub&#39;s field formatting
   */
  private generateTaskBody(task: Task, epic: Epic, options: GitHubTemplateOptions): string {
    let body = &#39;&#39;;

    // Add hidden Arbiter ID for tracking
    if (options.includeArbiterIds !== false) {
      body += `&lt;!-- arbiter-id: ${task.id} --&gt;\n&lt;!-- arbiter-type: task --&gt;\n`;
      body += `&lt;!-- arbiter-epic-id: ${epic.id} --&gt;\n\n`;
    }

    // Description section
    body += `## 📋 Description\n\n${task.description || &#39;No description provided&#39;}\n\n`;

    // Task Details section
    body += &#39;## 📊 Task Details\n\n&#39;;
    body += &#39;| Field | Value |\n&#39;;
    body += &#39;|-------|-------|\n&#39;;
    body += `| **Epic** | [${epic.name}](../issues) |\n`;
    body += `| **Type** | \`${task.type}\` |\n`;
    body += `| **Priority** | \`${task.priority}\` |\n`;
    body += `| **Status** | \`${task.status}\` |\n`;
    body += `| **Assignee** | ${task.assignee ? `@${task.assignee}` : &#39;Unassigned&#39;} |\n`;
    body += `| **Reviewer** | ${task.reviewer ? `@${task.reviewer}` : &#39;TBD&#39;} |\n`;

    if (options.includeEstimations !== false) {
      if (task.estimatedHours) {
        body += `| **Estimated Hours** | ${task.estimatedHours}h |\n`;
      }
      if (task.actualHours) {
        body += `| **Actual Hours** | ${task.actualHours}h |\n`;
      }
    }

    body += &#39;\n&#39;;

    // Acceptance Criteria section
    if (
      options.includeAcceptanceCriteria !== false &amp;&amp;
      task.acceptanceCriteria &amp;&amp;
      task.acceptanceCriteria.length &gt; 0
    ) {
      body += &#39;## ✅ Acceptance Criteria\n\n&#39;;
      task.acceptanceCriteria.forEach((criteria, index) =&gt; {
        body += `${index + 1}. [ ] ${criteria}\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Dependencies section
    if (options.includeDependencies !== false &amp;&amp; task.dependsOn &amp;&amp; task.dependsOn.length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## 🔗 Dependencies\n\n&#39;;
      body += &#39;This task depends on the following:\n\n&#39;;
      task.dependsOn.forEach(dep =&gt; {
        body += `- [ ] ${dep}\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Configuration section
    if (task.config) {
      body += &#39;## ⚙️ Configuration\n\n&#39;;
      if (task.config.canRunInParallel) {
        body += &#39;- ✅ Can run in parallel with other tasks\n&#39;;
      }
      if (task.config.requiresReview) {
        body += &#39;- 👀 Requires code review before completion\n&#39;;
      }
      if (task.config.requiresTesting) {
        body += &#39;- 🧪 Requires testing before completion\n&#39;;
      }
      if (task.config.blocksOtherTasks) {
        body += &#39;- 🚧 Blocks other tasks until completed\n&#39;;
      }
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    // Custom fields
    if (options.customFields &amp;&amp; Object.keys(options.customFields).length &gt; 0) {
      body += &#39;## 🔧 Additional Information\n\n&#39;;
      Object.entries(options.customFields).forEach(([key, value]) =&gt; {
        body += `**${key}:** ${value}\n`;
      });
      body += &#39;\n&#39;;
    }

    return body.trim();
  }

  /**
   * Generate epic labels with proper categorization
   */
  private generateEpicLabels(epic: Epic): string[] {
    const labels: string[] = [];

    // Type label
    labels.push(&#39;epic&#39;);

    // Priority label
    labels.push(`priority:${epic.priority}`);

    // Status label
    labels.push(`status:${epic.status}`);

    // Custom labels from epic
    if (epic.labels &amp;&amp; epic.labels.length &gt; 0) {
      labels.push(...epic.labels);
    }

    return [...new Set(labels)]; // Remove duplicates
  }

  /**
   * Generate task labels with proper categorization
   */
  private generateTaskLabels(task: Task, epic: Epic): string[] {
    const labels: string[] = [];

    // Type label
    labels.push(`type:${task.type}`);

    // Priority label
    labels.push(`priority:${task.priority}`);

    // Status label
    labels.push(`status:${task.status}`);

    // Epic reference
    labels.push(`epic:${epic.id}`);

    // Configuration-based labels
    if (task.config?.requiresReview) {
      labels.push(&#39;needs-review&#39;);
    }
    if (task.config?.requiresTesting) {
      labels.push(&#39;needs-testing&#39;);
    }
    if (task.config?.canRunInParallel) {
      labels.push(&#39;parallel-safe&#39;);
    }

    return [...new Set(labels)]; // Remove duplicates
  }

  /**
   * Generate epic assignees
   */
  private generateEpicAssignees(epic: Epic): string[] | undefined {
    const assignees: string[] = [];

    if (epic.assignee) {
      assignees.push(epic.assignee);
    }
    if (epic.owner &amp;&amp; epic.owner !== epic.assignee) {
      assignees.push(epic.owner);
    }

    return assignees.length &gt; 0 ? assignees : undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Generate task assignees
   */
  private generateTaskAssignees(task: Task): string[] | undefined {
    const assignees: string[] = [];

    if (task.assignee) {
      assignees.push(task.assignee);
    }

    return assignees.length &gt; 0 ? assignees : undefined;
  }

  /**
   * Get status emoji for display
   */
  private getStatusEmoji(status: string): string {
    const emojis: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {
      todo: &#39;📋&#39;,
      planning: &#39;📋&#39;,
      in_progress: &#39;🚧&#39;,
      review: &#39;👀&#39;,
      testing: &#39;🧪&#39;,
      completed: &#39;✅&#39;,
      cancelled: &#39;❌&#39;,
    };
    return emojis[status] || &#39;❓&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Create GitHub issue template files for repositories
 * @deprecated Use ConfigurableTemplateManager.generateRepositoryTemplates() instead
 */
export function generateGitHubIssueTemplates(): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
  const manager = new ConfigurableTemplateManager();
  return manager.generateRepositoryTemplates();
}

/**
 * Generate repository configuration for GitHub templates
 * @deprecated Use ConfigurableTemplateManager.generateRepositoryTemplates() instead
 */
export function generateGitHubConfiguration(): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
  const manager = new ConfigurableTemplateManager();
  const allFiles = manager.generateRepositoryTemplates();

  // Return only configuration files (not template files)
  const configFiles: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {};
  Object.entries(allFiles).forEach(([path, content]) =&gt; {
    if (path.includes(&#39;config.yml&#39;) || path.includes(&#39;labels.yml&#39;)) {
      configFiles[path] = content;
    }
  });

  return configFiles;
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/monitoring.ts
import { EventEmitter } from &#39;node:events&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import type { ConstraintViolationError } from &#39;./core.js&#39;;

/**
 * Violation event data
 */
export interface ViolationEvent {
  constraint: string;
  violation: ConstraintViolationError;
  timestamp: number;
  operation?: string;
  context?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

/**
 * Performance metrics
 */
export interface PerformanceMetrics {
  operationCount: number;
  totalDuration: number;
  averageDuration: number;
  maxDuration: number;
  minDuration: number;
  violationsCount: number;
  successRate: number;
}

/**
 * Monitoring configuration
 */
export interface MonitoringConfig {
  enableMetrics: boolean;
  enableViolationTracking: boolean;
  metricsRetentionDays: number;
  violationLogPath?: string;
  metricsLogPath?: string;
  alertThresholds: {
    maxViolationsPerHour: number;
    maxAverageResponseTime: number;
    minSuccessRate: number;
  };
}

/**
 * Default monitoring configuration
 */
export const DEFAULT_MONITORING_CONFIG: MonitoringConfig = {
  enableMetrics: true,
  enableViolationTracking: true,
  metricsRetentionDays: 7,
  alertThresholds: {
    maxViolationsPerHour: 10,
    maxAverageResponseTime: 500, // 500ms
    minSuccessRate: 95, // 95%
  },
};

/**
 * Comprehensive constraint monitoring and reporting system
 */
export class ConstraintMonitor extends EventEmitter {
  private readonly config: MonitoringConfig;
  private readonly violations: ViolationEvent[] = [];
  private readonly operationMetrics = new Map&lt;string, PerformanceMetrics&gt;();
  private readonly startTime = Date.now();

  private violationCounts = {
    total: 0,
    lastHour: 0,
    byConstraint: new Map&lt;string, number&gt;(),
    byOperation: new Map&lt;string, number&gt;(),
  };

  constructor(config: Partial&lt;MonitoringConfig&gt; = {}) {
    super();
    this.config = { ...DEFAULT_MONITORING_CONFIG, ...config };

    if (this.config.enableMetrics || this.config.enableViolationTracking) {
      this.startMonitoring();
    }
  }

  /**
   * Record a constraint violation
   */
  recordViolation(event: ViolationEvent): void {
    if (!this.config.enableViolationTracking) return;

    // Store violation
    this.violations.push(event);

    // Update counts
    this.violationCounts.total++;
    this.violationCounts.lastHour++; // Will be reset hourly

    const constraintCount = this.violationCounts.byConstraint.get(event.constraint) || 0;
    this.violationCounts.byConstraint.set(event.constraint, constraintCount + 1);

    if (event.operation) {
      const operationCount = this.violationCounts.byOperation.get(event.operation) || 0;
      this.violationCounts.byOperation.set(event.operation, operationCount + 1);
    }

    // Emit alert if thresholds exceeded
    this.checkAlertThresholds();

    // Log violation
    this.logViolation(event);

    // Emit monitoring event
    this.emit(&#39;violation_recorded&#39;, event);
  }

  /**
   * Record operation performance metrics
   */
  recordOperation(
    operation: string,
    duration: number,
    success: boolean,
    context?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): void {
    if (!this.config.enableMetrics) return;

    const metrics = this.operationMetrics.get(operation) || {
      operationCount: 0,
      totalDuration: 0,
      averageDuration: 0,
      maxDuration: 0,
      minDuration: Number.POSITIVE_INFINITY,
      violationsCount: 0,
      successRate: 100,
    };

    // Update metrics
    metrics.operationCount++;
    metrics.totalDuration += duration;
    metrics.averageDuration = metrics.totalDuration / metrics.operationCount;
    metrics.maxDuration = Math.max(metrics.maxDuration, duration);
    metrics.minDuration = Math.min(metrics.minDuration, duration);

    if (!success) {
      metrics.violationsCount++;
    }

    metrics.successRate =
      ((metrics.operationCount - metrics.violationsCount) / metrics.operationCount) * 100;

    this.operationMetrics.set(operation, metrics);

    // Log performance data
    this.logPerformanceMetric(operation, duration, success, context);

    // Check performance alerts
    this.checkPerformanceAlerts(operation, metrics);

    // Emit monitoring event
    this.emit(&#39;operation_recorded&#39;, { operation, duration, success, metrics });
  }

  /**
   * Generate report header
   */
  private generateReportHeader(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];
    const uptime = Date.now() - this.startTime;

    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;🔍 Constraint System Monitoring Report&#39;));
    lines.push(chalk.dim(`Generated: ${new Date().toISOString()}`));
    lines.push(chalk.dim(`Uptime: ${this.formatDuration(uptime)}`));
    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate violations summary section
   */
  private generateViolationsSummary(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Violations Summary:&#39;));
    lines.push(
      `Total Violations: ${this.getViolationColor(this.violationCounts.total)}${this.violationCounts.total}`
    );
    lines.push(
      `Last Hour: ${this.getViolationColor(this.violationCounts.lastHour)}${this.violationCounts.lastHour}`
    );
    lines.push(`Violation Rate: ${this.calculateViolationRate()} violations/hour`);
    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate violations by constraint section
   */
  private generateViolationsByConstraint(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    if (this.violationCounts.byConstraint.size &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Violations by Constraint:&#39;));
      const sortedConstraints = Array.from(this.violationCounts.byConstraint.entries()).sort(
        ([, a], [, b]) =&gt; b - a
      );

      for (const [constraint, count] of sortedConstraints) {
        const percentage = ((count / this.violationCounts.total) * 100).toFixed(1);
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.red(constraint)}: ${count} (${percentage}%)`);
      }
      lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
    }

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate violations by operation section
   */
  private generateViolationsByOperation(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    if (this.violationCounts.byOperation.size &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Violations by Operation:&#39;));
      const sortedOperations = Array.from(this.violationCounts.byOperation.entries()).sort(
        ([, a], [, b]) =&gt; b - a
      );

      for (const [operation, count] of sortedOperations.slice(0, 10)) {
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.yellow(operation)}: ${count}`);
      }
      lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
    }

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate performance metrics section
   */
  private generatePerformanceMetrics(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    if (this.operationMetrics.size &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Performance Metrics:&#39;));
      const sortedMetrics = Array.from(this.operationMetrics.entries()).sort(
        ([, a], [, b]) =&gt; b.operationCount - a.operationCount
      );

      for (const [operation, metrics] of sortedMetrics.slice(0, 10)) {
        const successColor =
          metrics.successRate &gt;= 95
            ? chalk.green
            : metrics.successRate &gt;= 80
              ? chalk.yellow
              : chalk.red;
        const avgColor =
          metrics.averageDuration &lt;= 500
            ? chalk.green
            : metrics.averageDuration &lt;= 750
              ? chalk.yellow
              : chalk.red;

        lines.push(`  ${operation}:`);
        lines.push(`    Operations: ${metrics.operationCount}`);
        lines.push(`    Success Rate: ${successColor(`${metrics.successRate.toFixed(1)}%`)}`);
        lines.push(`    Avg Duration: ${avgColor(`${Math.round(metrics.averageDuration)}ms`)}`);
        lines.push(`    Max Duration: ${Math.round(metrics.maxDuration)}ms`);
      }
      lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
    }

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate recent violations section
   */
  private generateRecentViolations(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    if (this.violations.length &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Recent Violations (Last 10):&#39;));
      const recentViolations = this.violations.slice(-10).reverse();

      for (const violation of recentViolations) {
        const timeAgo = this.formatTimeAgo(violation.timestamp);
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.red(violation.constraint)} - ${timeAgo}`);
        lines.push(`    ${chalk.dim(violation.violation.message)}`);
        if (violation.operation) {
          lines.push(`    Operation: ${chalk.yellow(violation.operation)}`);
        }
      }
      lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
    }

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate health status section
   */
  private generateHealthStatus(): string[] {
    const lines: string[] = [];

    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;System Health:&#39;));
    const healthStatus = this.getSystemHealth();
    const healthColor = healthStatus.isHealthy ? chalk.green : chalk.red;
    lines.push(`Overall Status: ${healthColor(healthStatus.isHealthy ? &#39;HEALTHY&#39; : &#39;UNHEALTHY&#39;)}`);

    if (healthStatus.issues.length &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(&#39;Issues:&#39;);
      for (const issue of healthStatus.issues) {
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.red(&#39;•&#39;)} ${issue}`);
      }
    }

    if (healthStatus.recommendations.length &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(&#39;Recommendations:&#39;);
      for (const rec of healthStatus.recommendations) {
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.yellow(&#39;•&#39;)} ${rec}`);
      }
    }

    return lines;
  }

  /**
   * Generate comprehensive monitoring report
   */
  generateReport(): string {
    const sections = this.collectReportSections();
    return this.formatReportSections(sections);
  }

  /**
   * Collect all report sections in order
   */
  private collectReportSections(): string[][] {
    return [
      this.generateReportHeader(),
      this.generateViolationsSummary(),
      this.generateViolationsByConstraint(),
      this.generateViolationsByOperation(),
      this.generatePerformanceMetrics(),
      this.generateRecentViolations(),
      this.generateHealthStatus(),
    ];
  }

  /**
   * Format and join all report sections
   */
  private formatReportSections(sections: string[][]): string {
    return sections.flat().join(&#39;\n&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Export monitoring data for external analysis
   */
  async exportData(outputPath: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const data = {
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
      uptime: Date.now() - this.startTime,
      violationCounts: {
        total: this.violationCounts.total,
        lastHour: this.violationCounts.lastHour,
        byConstraint: Object.fromEntries(this.violationCounts.byConstraint),
        byOperation: Object.fromEntries(this.violationCounts.byOperation),
      },
      performanceMetrics: Object.fromEntries(this.operationMetrics),
      recentViolations: this.violations.slice(-100), // Last 100 violations
      systemHealth: this.getSystemHealth(),
    };

    await fs.ensureDir(path.dirname(outputPath));
    await fs.writeJson(outputPath, data, { spaces: 2 });

    this.emit(&#39;data_exported&#39;, { outputPath, recordCount: this.violations.length });
  }

  /**
   * Clear old data based on retention policy
   */
  cleanup(): void {
    const retentionMs = this.config.metricsRetentionDays * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000;
    const cutoff = Date.now() - retentionMs;

    // Remove old violations
    const beforeCount = this.violations.length;
    const filtered = this.violations.filter(v =&gt; v.timestamp &gt;= cutoff);
    this.violations.length = 0;
    this.violations.push(...filtered);

    const cleaned = beforeCount - this.violations.length;

    if (cleaned &gt; 0) {
      this.emit(&#39;cleanup_completed&#39;, {
        recordsCleaned: cleaned,
        remaining: this.violations.length,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get current system health status
   */
  getSystemHealth(): {
    isHealthy: boolean;
    issues: string[];
    recommendations: string[];
    scores: {
      violationScore: number;
      performanceScore: number;
      availabilityScore: number;
      overallScore: number;
    };
  } {
    const issues: string[] = [];
    const recommendations: string[] = [];

    // Check violation rate
    const violationRate = this.calculateViolationRate();
    const violationScore = Math.max(0, 100 - violationRate * 10);

    if (violationRate &gt; this.config.alertThresholds.maxViolationsPerHour) {
      issues.push(`High violation rate: ${violationRate.toFixed(1)}/hour`);
      recommendations.push(&#39;Review constraint configurations and operation patterns&#39;);
    }

    // Check performance metrics
    let performanceScore = 100;
    for (const [operation, metrics] of this.operationMetrics.entries()) {
      if (metrics.averageDuration &gt; this.config.alertThresholds.maxAverageResponseTime) {
        issues.push(`Slow operation: ${operation} (${Math.round(metrics.averageDuration)}ms avg)`);
        recommendations.push(`Optimize ${operation} performance`);
        performanceScore = Math.min(performanceScore, 80);
      }

      if (metrics.successRate &lt; this.config.alertThresholds.minSuccessRate) {
        issues.push(`Low success rate: ${operation} (${metrics.successRate.toFixed(1)}%)`);
        recommendations.push(`Investigate ${operation} reliability issues`);
        performanceScore = Math.min(performanceScore, 70);
      }
    }

    // Calculate availability score
    const totalOperations = Array.from(this.operationMetrics.values()).reduce(
      (sum, m) =&gt; sum + m.operationCount,
      0
    );
    const successfulOperations = Array.from(this.operationMetrics.values()).reduce(
      (sum, m) =&gt; sum + (m.operationCount - m.violationsCount),
      0
    );

    const availabilityScore =
      totalOperations &gt; 0 ? (successfulOperations / totalOperations) * 100 : 100;

    // Overall health score
    const overallScore = (violationScore + performanceScore + availabilityScore) / 3;

    return {
      isHealthy: issues.length === 0 &amp;&amp; overallScore &gt;= 90,
      issues,
      recommendations,
      scores: {
        violationScore,
        performanceScore,
        availabilityScore,
        overallScore,
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Start monitoring background tasks
   */
  private startMonitoring(): void {
    // Reset hourly counters
    setInterval(
      () =&gt; {
        this.violationCounts.lastHour = 0;
      },
      60 * 60 * 1000
    ); // Every hour

    // Cleanup old data
    setInterval(
      () =&gt; {
        this.cleanup();
      },
      24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
    ); // Daily

    // Performance monitoring
    setInterval(
      () =&gt; {
        this.checkSystemHealth();
      },
      5 * 60 * 1000
    ); // Every 5 minutes
  }

  /**
   * Check alert thresholds and emit alerts
   */
  private checkAlertThresholds(): void {
    const violationRate = this.calculateViolationRate();

    if (violationRate &gt; this.config.alertThresholds.maxViolationsPerHour) {
      this.emit(&#39;alert&#39;, {
        type: &#39;high_violation_rate&#39;,
        message: `Violation rate exceeded threshold: ${violationRate.toFixed(1)}/hour`,
        threshold: this.config.alertThresholds.maxViolationsPerHour,
        actual: violationRate,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Check performance alerts for specific operations
   */
  private checkPerformanceAlerts(operation: string, metrics: PerformanceMetrics): void {
    if (metrics.averageDuration &gt; this.config.alertThresholds.maxAverageResponseTime) {
      this.emit(&#39;alert&#39;, {
        type: &#39;slow_operation&#39;,
        message: `${operation} average response time exceeded threshold`,
        operation,
        threshold: this.config.alertThresholds.maxAverageResponseTime,
        actual: metrics.averageDuration,
      });
    }

    if (metrics.successRate &lt; this.config.alertThresholds.minSuccessRate) {
      this.emit(&#39;alert&#39;, {
        type: &#39;low_success_rate&#39;,
        message: `${operation} success rate below threshold`,
        operation,
        threshold: this.config.alertThresholds.minSuccessRate,
        actual: metrics.successRate,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Check overall system health periodically
   */
  private checkSystemHealth(): void {
    const health = this.getSystemHealth();

    if (!health.isHealthy) {
      this.emit(&#39;alert&#39;, {
        type: &#39;system_health&#39;,
        message: &#39;System health degraded&#39;,
        issues: health.issues,
        score: health.scores.overallScore,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Log violation to file
   */
  private async logViolation(event: ViolationEvent): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config.violationLogPath) return;

    try {
      const logEntry = {
        timestamp: new Date(event.timestamp).toISOString(),
        constraint: event.constraint,
        message: event.violation.message,
        operation: event.operation,
        details: event.violation.details,
      };

      const logLine = `${JSON.stringify(logEntry)}\n`;
      await fs.appendFile(this.config.violationLogPath, logLine);
    } catch (error) {
      this.emit(&#39;error&#39;, { type: &#39;log_violation_failed&#39;, error });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Log performance metric to file
   */
  private async logPerformanceMetric(
    operation: string,
    duration: number,
    success: boolean,
    context?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config.metricsLogPath) return;

    try {
      const logEntry = {
        timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
        operation,
        duration,
        success,
        context,
      };

      const logLine = `${JSON.stringify(logEntry)}\n`;
      await fs.appendFile(this.config.metricsLogPath, logLine);
    } catch (error) {
      this.emit(&#39;error&#39;, { type: &#39;log_metric_failed&#39;, error });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Calculate current violation rate per hour
   */
  private calculateViolationRate(): number {
    const uptimeHours = (Date.now() - this.startTime) / (1000 * 60 * 60);
    return uptimeHours &gt; 0 ? this.violationCounts.total / uptimeHours : 0;
  }

  /**
   * Get appropriate color for violation count
   */
  private getViolationColor(count: number): typeof chalk.green {
    if (count === 0) return chalk.green;
    if (count &lt;= 5) return chalk.yellow;
    return chalk.red;
  }

  /**
   * Format duration in human-readable format
   */
  private formatDuration(ms: number): string {
    const seconds = Math.floor(ms / 1000);
    const minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
    const hours = Math.floor(minutes / 60);
    const days = Math.floor(hours / 24);

    if (days &gt; 0) return `${days}d ${hours % 24}h`;
    if (hours &gt; 0) return `${hours}h ${minutes % 60}m`;
    if (minutes &gt; 0) return `${minutes}m ${seconds % 60}s`;
    return `${seconds}s`;
  }

  /**
   * Format time ago in human-readable format
   */
  private formatTimeAgo(timestamp: number): string {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - timestamp;
    const seconds = Math.floor(elapsed / 1000);
    const minutes = Math.floor(seconds / 60);
    const hours = Math.floor(minutes / 60);
    const days = Math.floor(hours / 24);

    if (days &gt; 0) return `${days}d ago`;
    if (hours &gt; 0) return `${hours}h ago`;
    if (minutes &gt; 0) return `${minutes}m ago`;
    return `${seconds}s ago`;
  }
}

/**
 * Global monitoring instance
 */
export const globalConstraintMonitor = new ConstraintMonitor();

/**
 * Create monitoring instance with configuration
 */
export function createConstraintMonitor(config?: Partial&lt;MonitoringConfig&gt;): ConstraintMonitor {
  return new ConstraintMonitor(config);
}
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/schema.ts
import { z } from &#39;zod&#39;;
import { ConstraintViolationError, globalConstraintEnforcer } from &#39;./core.js&#39;;

/**
 * Latest API version - must be updated when schema changes
 * This enforces the &quot;Don&#39;t write older schemas&quot; constraint
 */
export const LATEST_API_VERSION = &#39;2024-12-26&#39;;

/**
 * Version compatibility matrix
 * Defines which versions are compatible for reading/writing
 */
export const VERSION_COMPATIBILITY = {
  // Current version (write operations must use this)
  current: LATEST_API_VERSION,

  // Supported versions for read operations
  supported: [
    &#39;2024-12-26&#39;,
    &#39;2024-12-25&#39;, // Previous version for migration support
  ],

  // Deprecated versions (read-only, warn on usage)
  deprecated: [&#39;2024-12-24&#39;, &#39;2024-12-23&#39;],

  // Unsupported versions (reject all operations)
  unsupported: [&#39;2024-12-22&#39;, &#39;2024-12-21&#39;],
};

/**
 * Base envelope schema that all API responses must conform to
 */
export const envelopeBaseSchema = z.object({
  apiVersion: z
    .string()
    .refine(
      version =&gt;
        VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.supported.includes(version) ||
        VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.deprecated.includes(version),
      {
        message: `API version must be one of: ${[...VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.supported, ...VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.deprecated].join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
      }
    ),
  kind: z.string(),
  metadata: z
    .object({
      name: z.string().optional(),
      createdAt: z.string().datetime().optional(),
      version: z.string().optional(),
      migrationNotes: z.string().optional(),
    })
    .optional(),
});

/**
 * Schema for validation results with version enforcement
 */
export const validationResultSchema = envelopeBaseSchema.extend({
  kind: z.literal(&#39;ValidationResult&#39;),
  spec: z.object({
    success: z.boolean(),
    errors: z
      .array(
        z.object({
          line: z.number(),
          column: z.number(),
          message: z.string(),
          severity: z.enum([&#39;error&#39;, &#39;warning&#39;]),
          category: z.string(),
        })
      )
      .optional(),
    warnings: z
      .array(
        z.object({
          line: z.number(),
          column: z.number(),
          message: z.string(),
          category: z.string(),
        })
      )
      .optional(),
  }),
});

/**
 * Schema for export results with version enforcement
 */
export const exportResultSchema = envelopeBaseSchema.extend({
  kind: z.literal(&#39;ExportResult&#39;),
  spec: z.object({
    format: z.string(),
    content: z.string(),
    metadata: z.record(z.unknown()).optional(),
  }),
});

/**
 * Schema for analysis results with version enforcement
 */
export const analysisResultSchema = envelopeBaseSchema.extend({
  kind: z.literal(&#39;AnalysisResult&#39;),
  spec: z.object({
    summary: z.string(),
    issues: z
      .array(
        z.object({
          type: z.string(),
          severity: z.enum([&#39;low&#39;, &#39;medium&#39;, &#39;high&#39;, &#39;critical&#39;]),
          message: z.string(),
          location: z
            .object({
              line: z.number(),
              column: z.number(),
            })
            .optional(),
        })
      )
      .optional(),
    metrics: z.record(z.number()).optional(),
  }),
});

/**
 * Union type for all valid envelope schemas
 */
export const envelopeSchema = z.discriminatedUnion(&#39;kind&#39;, [
  validationResultSchema,
  exportResultSchema,
  analysisResultSchema,
]);

export type EnvelopeData = z.infer&lt;typeof envelopeSchema&gt;;
export type ValidationResult = z.infer&lt;typeof validationResultSchema&gt;;
export type ExportResult = z.infer&lt;typeof exportResultSchema&gt;;
export type AnalysisResult = z.infer&lt;typeof analysisResultSchema&gt;;

/**
 * Schema version validator and enforcer
 */
export class SchemaVersionValidator {
  /**
   * Validate that data conforms to the latest envelope schema for write operations
   */
  validateWriteSchema(data: unknown, operationId?: string): EnvelopeData {
    // First validate that it has the correct structure
    const parseResult = envelopeSchema.safeParse(data);
    if (!parseResult.success) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;schemaValidation&#39;,
        &#39;invalid envelope structure&#39;,
        &#39;valid envelope schema&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          validationErrors: parseResult.error.errors,
          providedData: typeof data === &#39;object&#39; ? Object.keys(data as object) : typeof data,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;schemaValidation&#39;,
        violation,
        data,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    const envelope = parseResult.data;

    // Enforce that write operations use the latest API version
    globalConstraintEnforcer.validateApiVersion(envelope.apiVersion, operationId);

    // Additional validation for specific envelope types
    this.validateEnvelopeContent(envelope, operationId);

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:validated&#39;, {
      operationId,
      kind: envelope.kind,
      apiVersion: envelope.apiVersion,
    });

    return envelope;
  }

  /**
   * Validate envelope for read operations (more permissive)
   */
  validateReadSchema(data: unknown, operationId?: string): EnvelopeData {
    const parseResult = envelopeSchema.safeParse(data);
    if (!parseResult.success) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;schemaValidation&#39;,
        &#39;invalid envelope structure&#39;,
        &#39;valid envelope schema&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          validationErrors: parseResult.error.errors,
          providedData: typeof data === &#39;object&#39; ? Object.keys(data as object) : typeof data,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;schemaValidation&#39;,
        violation,
        data,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    const envelope = parseResult.data;

    // Check version compatibility for read operations
    this.validateVersionCompatibility(envelope.apiVersion, &#39;read&#39;, operationId);

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:validated&#39;, {
      operationId,
      kind: envelope.kind,
      apiVersion: envelope.apiVersion,
      operation: &#39;read&#39;,
    });

    return envelope;
  }

  /**
   * Create a new envelope with the latest API version
   */
  createEnvelope&lt;T extends EnvelopeData&gt;(
    kind: T[&#39;kind&#39;],
    spec: T[&#39;spec&#39;],
    metadata?: T[&#39;metadata&#39;]
  ): T {
    const envelope = {
      apiVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
      kind,
      spec,
      metadata: {
        createdAt: new Date().toISOString(),
        ...metadata,
      },
    } as T;

    // Validate the created envelope
    this.validateWriteSchema(envelope);

    return envelope;
  }

  /**
   * Migrate an older envelope to the latest version
   */
  migrateToLatest(envelope: EnvelopeData, operationId?: string): EnvelopeData {
    if (envelope.apiVersion === LATEST_API_VERSION) {
      return envelope; // Already latest
    }

    // Check if migration is supported
    if (!this.isMigrationSupported(envelope.apiVersion)) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;versionMigration&#39;,
        envelope.apiVersion,
        &#39;supported version for migration&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          currentVersion: envelope.apiVersion,
          latestVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
          supportedVersions: VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.supported,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;versionMigration&#39;,
        violation,
        envelope,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Perform version migration
    const migrated = {
      ...envelope,
      apiVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
      metadata: {
        ...envelope.metadata,
        migratedFrom: envelope.apiVersion,
        migratedAt: new Date().toISOString(),
      },
    };

    // Apply version-specific migrations
    const fullyMigrated = this.applyVersionMigrations(migrated, envelope.apiVersion);

    globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:migrated&#39;, {
      operationId,
      fromVersion: envelope.apiVersion,
      toVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
      kind: envelope.kind,
    });

    return fullyMigrated;
  }

  /**
   * Check if a version supports migration
   */
  private isMigrationSupported(version: string): boolean {
    return (
      VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.supported.includes(version) ||
      VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.deprecated.includes(version)
    );
  }

  /**
   * Validate version compatibility for different operations
   */
  private validateVersionCompatibility(
    version: string,
    operation: &#39;read&#39; | &#39;write&#39;,
    operationId?: string
  ): void {
    if (VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.unsupported.includes(version)) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;versionCompatibility&#39;,
        version,
        &#39;supported API version&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          version,
          supportedVersions: VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.supported,
          reason: &#39;Version is no longer supported&#39;,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;versionCompatibility&#39;,
        violation,
        version,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    if (operation === &#39;write&#39; &amp;&amp; version !== LATEST_API_VERSION) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;versionCompatibility&#39;,
        version,
        LATEST_API_VERSION,
        {
          operationId,
          operation,
          version,
          latestVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
          reason: &#39;Write operations must use latest API version&#39;,
        }
      );

      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, {
        constraint: &#39;versionCompatibility&#39;,
        violation,
        version,
      });

      throw violation;
    }

    // Warn about deprecated versions
    if (VERSION_COMPATIBILITY.deprecated.includes(version)) {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:deprecated_version&#39;, {
        operationId,
        version,
        latestVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
        message: `API version ${version} is deprecated. Please upgrade to ${LATEST_API_VERSION}`,
      });
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate envelope content based on kind
   */
  private validateEnvelopeContent(envelope: EnvelopeData, operationId?: string): void {
    switch (envelope.kind) {
      case &#39;ValidationResult&#39;:
        this.validateValidationResult(envelope, operationId);
        break;
      case &#39;ExportResult&#39;:
        this.validateExportResult(envelope, operationId);
        break;
      case &#39;AnalysisResult&#39;:
        this.validateAnalysisResult(envelope, operationId);
        break;
      default:
        // Extensibility for future envelope types
        break;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Apply version-specific migration logic
   */
  private applyVersionMigrations(envelope: EnvelopeData, fromVersion: string): EnvelopeData {
    let migrated = envelope;

    // Apply migrations in sequence based on version
    if (fromVersion === &#39;2024-12-25&#39;) {
      migrated = this.migrateFrom20241225(migrated);
    }

    if (fromVersion === &#39;2024-12-24&#39;) {
      migrated = this.migrateFrom20241224(migrated);
    }

    return migrated;
  }

  /**
   * Migration from version 2024-12-25 to latest
   */
  private migrateFrom20241225(envelope: EnvelopeData): EnvelopeData {
    // Add any specific migration logic here
    // For now, just update metadata
    return {
      ...envelope,
      metadata: {
        ...envelope.metadata,
        migrationNotes: &#39;Migrated from 2024-12-25 - no structural changes required&#39;,
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Migration from version 2024-12-24 to latest
   */
  private migrateFrom20241224(envelope: EnvelopeData): EnvelopeData {
    // Add any specific migration logic here
    return {
      ...envelope,
      metadata: {
        ...envelope.metadata,
        migrationNotes: &#39;Migrated from 2024-12-24 - deprecated fields removed&#39;,
      },
    };
  }

  private validateValidationResult(envelope: ValidationResult, operationId?: string): void {
    // Additional validation for ValidationResult envelopes
    if (!envelope.spec.success &amp;&amp; (!envelope.spec.errors || envelope.spec.errors.length === 0)) {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:warning&#39;, {
        operationId,
        message: &#39;ValidationResult marked as unsuccessful but no errors provided&#39;,
        envelope: envelope.kind,
      });
    }
  }

  private validateExportResult(envelope: ExportResult, operationId?: string): void {
    // Additional validation for ExportResult envelopes
    if (!envelope.spec.content || envelope.spec.content.trim() === &#39;&#39;) {
      const violation = new ConstraintViolationError(
        &#39;schemaValidation&#39;,
        &#39;empty export content&#39;,
        &#39;non-empty export content&#39;,
        {
          operationId,
          format: envelope.spec.format,
        }
      );

      throw violation;
    }
  }

  private validateAnalysisResult(envelope: AnalysisResult, operationId?: string): void {
    // Additional validation for AnalysisResult envelopes
    if (!envelope.spec.summary || envelope.spec.summary.trim() === &#39;&#39;) {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.emit(&#39;schema:warning&#39;, {
        operationId,
        message: &#39;AnalysisResult has empty summary&#39;,
        envelope: envelope.kind,
      });
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Global schema validator instance
 */
export const globalSchemaValidator = new SchemaVersionValidator();

/**
 * Utility function to ensure data is written with latest schema
 */
export function ensureLatestSchema&lt;T extends EnvelopeData&gt;(data: T, operationId?: string): T {
  return globalSchemaValidator.validateWriteSchema(data, operationId) as T;
}

/**
 * Utility function to validate read data with version compatibility
 */
export function validateReadData(data: unknown, operationId?: string): EnvelopeData {
  return globalSchemaValidator.validateReadSchema(data, operationId);
}

/**
 * Decorator to automatically enforce schema validation on API responses
 */
export function withSchemaValidation(operation: &#39;read&#39; | &#39;write&#39;) {
  return &lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; Promise&lt;any&gt;&gt;(
    _target: any,
    _propertyName: string,
    descriptor: TypedPropertyDescriptor&lt;T&gt;
  ) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value!;

    descriptor.value = async function (this: any, ...args: any[]) {
      const result = await method.apply(this, args);

      // Validate the result based on operation type
      if (operation === &#39;write&#39;) {
        return globalSchemaValidator.validateWriteSchema(result);
      }
      return globalSchemaValidator.validateReadSchema(result);
    } as T;

    return descriptor;
  };
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/git-detection.ts
import { execSync } from &#39;node:child_process&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import type { GitHubRepo } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

export interface GitRemoteInfo {
  owner: string;
  repo: string;
  url: string;
  type: &#39;https&#39; | &#39;ssh&#39;;
}

export interface GitDetectionResult {
  detected: boolean;
  remote?: GitRemoteInfo;
  error?: string;
}

export interface RepositoryConflict {
  configRepo: GitHubRepo;
  detectedRepo: GitRemoteInfo;
  conflictType: &#39;owner&#39; | &#39;repo&#39; | &#39;both&#39;;
}

export interface ConflictResolution {
  useConfig: boolean;
  useDetected: boolean;
  updateConfig: boolean;
  selectedRepo: GitHubRepo;
}

/**
 * Auto-detect GitHub repository information from Git remote
 */
export function detectGitHubRepository(): GitDetectionResult {
  try {
    // Get the origin remote URL
    const remoteUrl = execSync(&#39;git remote get-url origin&#39;, {
      encoding: &#39;utf8&#39;,
      stdio: [&#39;pipe&#39;, &#39;pipe&#39;, &#39;ignore&#39;], // Suppress stderr to avoid noise
    }).trim();

    // Parse GitHub URLs (both HTTPS and SSH formats)
    const remote = parseGitHubUrl(remoteUrl);

    if (!remote) {
      return {
        detected: false,
        error: &#39;Remote origin is not a GitHub repository&#39;,
      };
    }

    return {
      detected: true,
      remote,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    return {
      detected: false,
      error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Failed to detect Git remote&#39;,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Parse a Git URL to extract GitHub repository information
 */
export function parseGitHubUrl(url: string): GitRemoteInfo | null {
  // HTTPS format: https://github.com/owner/repo.git
  const httpsMatch = url.match(/https:\/\/github\.com\/([^/]+)\/([^/.]+)(?:\.git)?$/);
  if (httpsMatch) {
    const [, owner, repo] = httpsMatch;
    return {
      owner,
      repo,
      url,
      type: &#39;https&#39;,
    };
  }

  // SSH format: git@github.com:owner/repo.git
  const sshMatch = url.match(/git@github\.com:([^/]+)\/([^/.]+)(?:\.git)?$/);
  if (sshMatch) {
    const [, owner, repo] = sshMatch;
    return {
      owner,
      repo,
      url,
      type: &#39;ssh&#39;,
    };
  }

  return null;
}

/**
 * Check for conflicts between configured and detected repository info
 */
export function detectRepositoryConflicts(
  configRepo: GitHubRepo,
  detectedRepo: GitRemoteInfo
): RepositoryConflict | null {
  const ownerConflict = configRepo.owner !== detectedRepo.owner;
  const repoConflict = configRepo.repo !== detectedRepo.repo;

  if (!ownerConflict &amp;&amp; !repoConflict) {
    return null; // No conflict
  }

  let conflictType: &#39;owner&#39; | &#39;repo&#39; | &#39;both&#39;;
  if (ownerConflict &amp;&amp; repoConflict) {
    conflictType = &#39;both&#39;;
  } else if (ownerConflict) {
    conflictType = &#39;owner&#39;;
  } else {
    conflictType = &#39;repo&#39;;
  }

  return {
    configRepo,
    detectedRepo,
    conflictType,
  };
}

/**
 * Display a conflict resolution prompt and get user choice
 */
export function displayConflictResolution(conflict: RepositoryConflict): void {
  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n⚠️  Repository Configuration Conflict&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Found different repository information in config vs Git remote:\n&#39;));

  // Display comparison table
  const configInfo = `${conflict.configRepo.owner}/${conflict.configRepo.repo}`;
  const detectedInfo = `${conflict.detectedRepo.owner}/${conflict.detectedRepo.repo}`;

  console.log(&#39;┌─────────────────┬─────────────────────────────┐&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;│ Source          │ Repository                  │&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;├─────────────────┼─────────────────────────────┤&#39;);
  console.log(`│ Config file     │ ${configInfo.padEnd(27)} │`);
  console.log(`│ Git remote      │ ${detectedInfo.padEnd(27)} │`);
  console.log(&#39;└─────────────────┴─────────────────────────────┘&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nOptions:&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  1. Use config file values (keep current configuration)&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  2. Use Git remote values (auto-detected from repository)&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  3. Use Git remote and update config file&#39;));

  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;\nFor non-interactive use:&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  --use-config      Use config file values&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  --use-git-remote  Use Git remote values&#39;));
}

/**
 * Resolve repository selection based on options
 */
export function resolveRepositorySelection(
  conflict: RepositoryConflict,
  options: {
    useConfig?: boolean;
    useGitRemote?: boolean;
  }
): ConflictResolution {
  if (options.useConfig) {
    return {
      useConfig: true,
      useDetected: false,
      updateConfig: false,
      selectedRepo: conflict.configRepo,
    };
  }

  if (options.useGitRemote) {
    return {
      useConfig: false,
      useDetected: true,
      updateConfig: false,
      selectedRepo: {
        owner: conflict.detectedRepo.owner,
        repo: conflict.detectedRepo.repo,
        baseUrl: conflict.configRepo.baseUrl,
        tokenEnv: conflict.configRepo.tokenEnv,
      },
    };
  }

  // Default to using Git remote without updating config (safest option)
  return {
    useConfig: false,
    useDetected: true,
    updateConfig: false,
    selectedRepo: {
      owner: conflict.detectedRepo.owner,
      repo: conflict.detectedRepo.repo,
      baseUrl: conflict.configRepo.baseUrl,
      tokenEnv: conflict.configRepo.tokenEnv,
    },
  };
}

/**
 * Smart repository configuration that combines config and Git detection
 */
export function getSmartRepositoryConfig(
  configRepo?: GitHubRepo,
  options: {
    useConfig?: boolean;
    useGitRemote?: boolean;
    verbose?: boolean;
  } = {}
): { repo: GitHubRepo; source: &#39;config&#39; | &#39;detected&#39; | &#39;merged&#39; } | null {
  const detection = detectGitHubRepository();

  // If Git detection failed
  if (!detection.detected) {
    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Git detection failed:&#39;, detection.error));
    }

    if (configRepo) {
      if (options.verbose) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Using repository from config file&#39;));
      }
      return { repo: configRepo, source: &#39;config&#39; };
    }

    return null;
  }

  // If no config repo, use detected
  if (!configRepo) {
    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(
          `Auto-detected GitHub repository: ${detection.remote?.owner}/${detection.remote?.repo}`
        )
      );
    }
    return {
      repo: {
        owner: detection.remote?.owner,
        repo: detection.remote?.repo,
      },
      source: &#39;detected&#39;,
    };
  }

  // Check for conflicts
  const conflict = detectRepositoryConflicts(configRepo, detection.remote!);

  if (!conflict) {
    // No conflict - config and detected match
    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(`Repository configuration validated: ${configRepo.owner}/${configRepo.repo}`)
      );
    }
    return { repo: configRepo, source: &#39;config&#39; };
  }

  // Handle conflict
  if (options.verbose) {
    displayConflictResolution(conflict);
  }

  const resolution = resolveRepositorySelection(conflict, options);

  return {
    repo: resolution.selectedRepo,
    source: resolution.useConfig ? &#39;config&#39; : &#39;detected&#39;,
  };
}

/**
 * Create repository configuration with intelligent defaults
 */
export function createRepositoryConfig(
  owner: string,
  repo: string,
  baseConfig?: Partial&lt;GitHubRepo&gt;
): GitHubRepo {
  return {
    owner,
    repo,
    baseUrl: baseConfig?.baseUrl,
    tokenEnv: baseConfig?.tokenEnv || &#39;GITHUB_TOKEN&#39;,
  };
}

/**
 * Validate repository configuration and suggest fixes
 */
export function validateRepositoryConfig(repo: GitHubRepo): {
  valid: boolean;
  errors: string[];
  suggestions: string[];
} {
  const errors: string[] = [];
  const suggestions: string[] = [];

  if (!repo.owner) {
    errors.push(&#39;Repository owner is required&#39;);
  }

  if (!repo.repo) {
    errors.push(&#39;Repository name is required&#39;);
  }

  if (repo.baseUrl &amp;&amp; !repo.baseUrl.startsWith(&#39;https://&#39;)) {
    errors.push(&#39;Base URL must start with https://&#39;);
  }

  // Check for common owner/repo format issues
  if (repo.owner?.includes(&#39;/&#39;)) {
    errors.push(&#39;Owner should not contain forward slashes&#39;);
    suggestions.push(
      `Did you mean owner: &quot;${repo.owner.split(&#39;/&#39;)[0]}&quot;, repo: &quot;${repo.owner.split(&#39;/&#39;)[1]}&quot;?`
    );
  }

  if (repo.repo?.includes(&#39;/&#39;)) {
    errors.push(&#39;Repository name should not contain forward slashes&#39;);
  }

  if (repo.repo?.endsWith(&#39;.git&#39;)) {
    suggestions.push(
      `Repository name should not include .git extension: &quot;${repo.repo.replace(&#39;.git&#39;, &#39;&#39;)}&quot;`
    );
  }

  return {
    valid: errors.length === 0,
    errors,
    suggestions,
  };
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/file-based-template-manager.ts
/**
 * File-Based GitHub Template Manager
 *
 * This module provides file-based template loading with inheritance support
 * for GitHub issue templates using Handlebars.
 */

import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import Handlebars from &#39;handlebars&#39;;
import type {
  GitHubFileTemplateRef,
  GitHubTemplateConfig,
  GitHubTemplateOptions,
  GitHubTemplateSet,
  GitHubTemplateSetSource,
  GitHubTemplatesConfig,
  IssueSpec,
} from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { validateIssue } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import type { Epic, Task } from &#39;./sharded-storage.js&#39;;

/** Generated template following exact issue schema specification */
export interface GeneratedTemplate extends IssueSpec {
  /** Additional GitHub-specific fields */
  assignees?: string[];
  milestone?: number;
  projects?: number[];
}

export interface TemplateLoadResult {
  content: string;
  metadata?: {
    name?: string;
    description?: string;
    labels?: string[];
    assignees?: string[];
    inherits?: string;
  };
}

export interface TemplateDiscoveryResult {
  templatePath: string;
  metadata: TemplateLoadResult[&#39;metadata&#39;];
}

/**
 * File-based template manager with inheritance support
 */
export class FileBasedTemplateManager {
  private config: GitHubTemplatesConfig;
  private templateCache: Map&lt;string, TemplateLoadResult&gt; = new Map();
  private compiledTemplateCache: Map&lt;string, HandlebarsTemplateDelegate&gt; = new Map();
  private baseDir: string;

  constructor(config: GitHubTemplatesConfig, baseDir: string = process.cwd()) {
    this.config = config;
    this.baseDir = baseDir;
    this.registerHelpers();
  }

  private isFileReference(value: unknown): value is GitHubFileTemplateRef {
    return typeof value === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp; value !== null &amp;&amp; &#39;file&#39; in value;
  }

  private isTemplateSet(value: unknown): value is GitHubTemplateSet {
    return (
      typeof value === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp;
      value !== null &amp;&amp;
      &#39;sections&#39; in value &amp;&amp;
      typeof (value as GitHubTemplateSet).sections?.description === &#39;string&#39;
    );
  }

  private isTemplateConfigCandidate(value: unknown): value is GitHubTemplateConfig {
    if (typeof value !== &#39;object&#39; || value === null) return false;
    if (this.isFileReference(value)) return false;

    return (
      &#39;templateFile&#39; in value || &#39;sections&#39; in value || &#39;title&#39; in value || &#39;description&#39; in value
    );
  }

  /**
   * Generate epic template from file
   */
  async generateEpicTemplate(
    epic: Epic,
    options: GitHubTemplateOptions = {}
  ): Promise&lt;GeneratedTemplate&gt; {
    const templateRef = this.config.epic;
    if (!templateRef) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Epic template not configured&#39;);
    }
