    await fs.writeFile(fullPath, processedContent, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
  }

  // Create .arbiter/config.json config file
  const configContent = {
    apiUrl: &#39;http://localhost:8080&#39;,
    format: &#39;table&#39;,
    color: true,
  };

  const arbiterDir = path.join(targetDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;);
  await fs.ensureDir(arbiterDir);
  await fs.writeFile(
    path.join(arbiterDir, &#39;config.json&#39;),
    JSON.stringify(configContent, null, 2),
    &#39;utf-8&#39;
  );
}

/**
 * List available templates
 */
export function listTemplates(): void {
  console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Available templates:&#39;));
  console.log();

  Object.entries(TEMPLATES).forEach(([key, template]) =&gt; {
    console.log(`${chalk.green(key.padEnd(12))} ${template.description}`);
  });
}
📄 apps/api/src/handlers/examples/slack-notification.ts
/**
 * Example: Slack notification handler
 * Sends formatted notifications to Slack channels on webhook events
 */

import type { HandlerModule, WebhookHandler } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

const handleSlackNotification: WebhookHandler = async (payload, context) =&gt; {
  const { logger, services, config } = context;
  const { parsed } = payload;

  logger.info(&#39;Processing Slack notification handler&#39;, {
    event: parsed.eventType,
    repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
  });

  const slackWebhook = config.secrets.SLACK_WEBHOOK;
  if (!slackWebhook) {
    return {
      success: false,
      message: &#39;SLACK_WEBHOOK secret not configured&#39;,
      errors: [
        {
          code: &#39;MISSING_CONFIGURATION&#39;,
          message: &#39;Slack webhook URL is required in handler configuration&#39;,
        },
      ],
    };
  }

  try {
    let message = &#39;&#39;;
    let blocks: unknown[] = [];

    // Format message based on event type
    switch (parsed.eventType) {
      case &#39;push&#39;:
        if (parsed.commits &amp;&amp; parsed.commits.length &gt; 0) {
          message = `📝 ${parsed.commits.length} new commit(s) pushed to ${parsed.repository.fullName}`;

          blocks = [
            {
              type: &#39;header&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;plain_text&#39;,
                text: &#39;📝 New commits pushed&#39;,
              },
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              fields: [
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Repository:* &lt;${parsed.repository.url}|${parsed.repository.fullName}&gt;`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Commits:* ${parsed.commits.length}`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Author:* ${parsed.author.name}`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Branch:* ${payload.ref?.replace(&#39;refs/heads/&#39;, &#39;&#39;) || &#39;unknown&#39;}`,
                },
              ],
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                text: &#39;*Recent commits:*&#39;,
              },
            },
          ];

          // Add up to 5 recent commits
          const recentCommits = parsed.commits.slice(0, 5);
          for (const commit of recentCommits) {
            blocks.push({
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                text: `• &lt;${commit.url}|${commit.sha.substring(0, 7)}&gt; ${commit.message}\n  _by ${commit.author}_`,
              },
            });
          }

          if (parsed.commits.length &gt; 5) {
            blocks.push({
              type: &#39;context&#39;,
              elements: [
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `_and ${parsed.commits.length - 5} more commits..._`,
                },
              ],
            });
          }
        }
        break;

      case &#39;pull_request&#39;:
        if (parsed.pullRequest &amp;&amp; parsed.action) {
          const pr = parsed.pullRequest;
          const emoji =
            parsed.action === &#39;opened&#39;
              ? &#39;🔀&#39;
              : parsed.action === &#39;closed&#39; &amp;&amp; pr.merged
                ? &#39;✅&#39;
                : parsed.action === &#39;closed&#39;
                  ? &#39;❌&#39;
                  : &#39;📝&#39;;

          message = `${emoji} Pull request ${parsed.action}: ${pr.title}`;

          blocks = [
            {
              type: &#39;header&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;plain_text&#39;,
                text: `${emoji} Pull request ${parsed.action}`,
              },
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              fields: [
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Repository:* &lt;${parsed.repository.url}|${parsed.repository.fullName}&gt;`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*PR:* &lt;${pr.url}|#${pr.id}&gt;`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Author:* ${parsed.author.name}`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Branches:* ${pr.headBranch} → ${pr.baseBranch}`,
                },
              ],
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                text: `*${pr.title}*\n${pr.body ? pr.body.substring(0, 300) + (pr.body.length &gt; 300 ? &#39;...&#39; : &#39;&#39;) : &#39;_No description provided_&#39;}`,
              },
            },
          ];

          if (parsed.action === &#39;closed&#39; &amp;&amp; pr.merged) {
            blocks.push({
              type: &#39;context&#39;,
              elements: [
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: &#39;✅ This pull request was merged successfully&#39;,
                },
              ],
            });
          }
        }
        break;

      case &#39;issues&#39;:
        if (parsed.issue &amp;&amp; parsed.action) {
          const issue = parsed.issue;
          const emoji =
            parsed.action === &#39;opened&#39; ? &#39;🐛&#39; : parsed.action === &#39;closed&#39; ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;📝&#39;;

          message = `${emoji} Issue ${parsed.action}: ${issue.title}`;

          blocks = [
            {
              type: &#39;header&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;plain_text&#39;,
                text: `${emoji} Issue ${parsed.action}`,
              },
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              fields: [
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Repository:* &lt;${parsed.repository.url}|${parsed.repository.fullName}&gt;`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Issue:* &lt;${issue.url}|#${issue.id}&gt;`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Author:* ${parsed.author.name}`,
                },
                {
                  type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                  text: `*Labels:* ${issue.labels.length &gt; 0 ? issue.labels.join(&#39;, &#39;) : &#39;None&#39;}`,
                },
              ],
            },
            {
              type: &#39;section&#39;,
              text: {
                type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
                text: `*${issue.title}*\n${issue.body ? issue.body.substring(0, 300) + (issue.body.length &gt; 300 ? &#39;...&#39; : &#39;&#39;) : &#39;_No description provided_&#39;}`,
              },
            },
          ];
        }
        break;

      default:
        message = `🔔 ${parsed.eventType} event in ${parsed.repository.fullName}`;
        blocks = [
          {
            type: &#39;section&#39;,
            text: {
              type: &#39;mrkdwn&#39;,
              text: `🔔 Received *${parsed.eventType}* event from &lt;${parsed.repository.url}|${parsed.repository.fullName}&gt;`,
            },
          },
        ];
    }

    // Send Slack notification
    await services.notifications.sendSlack(slackWebhook, {
      text: message,
      blocks,
      username: &#39;Arbiter Webhook&#39;,
      iconEmoji: &#39;:robot_face:&#39;,
    });

    logger.info(&#39;Slack notification sent successfully&#39;, {
      event: parsed.eventType,
      repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
    });

    return {
      success: true,
      message: &#39;Slack notification sent successfully&#39;,
      actions: [&#39;Sent Slack notification&#39;],
      data: {
        slackMessage: message,
        blocksCount: blocks.length,
      },
    };
  } catch (error) {
    logger.error(&#39;Slack notification failed&#39;, error as Error);

    return {
      success: false,
      message: &#39;Failed to send Slack notification&#39;,
      errors: [
        {
          code: &#39;NOTIFICATION_FAILED&#39;,
          message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
          stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined,
        },
      ],
    };
  }
};

const handlerModule: HandlerModule = {
  handler: handleSlackNotification,
  config: {
    enabled: true,
    timeout: 15000,
    retries: 1,
    environment: {},
    secrets: {},
  },
  metadata: {
    name: &#39;Slack Notification Handler&#39;,
    description: &#39;Sends formatted notifications to Slack channels for webhook events&#39;,
    version: &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
    author: &#39;Arbiter Team&#39;,
    supportedEvents: [
      &#39;push&#39;,
      &#39;pull_request&#39;,
      &#39;merge_request&#39;,
      &#39;issues&#39;,
      &#39;Push Hook&#39;,
      &#39;Merge Request Hook&#39;,
    ],
    requiredPermissions: [&#39;notifications:send&#39;],
  },
};

export default handlerModule;
📄 apps/api/src/webhooks.ts
/**
 * Webhook service for handling GitLab and GitHub webhooks
 */
import { createHash, createHmac, timingSafeEqual } from &#39;node:crypto&#39;;
import type { SpecWorkbenchDB } from &#39;./db.ts&#39;;
import type { EventService } from &#39;./events.ts&#39;;
import { CustomHandlerManager } from &#39;./handlers/manager.js&#39;;
import type {
  EventType,
  ServerConfig,
  WebhookConfig,
  WebhookEventType,
  WebhookPayload,
  WebhookRequest,
  WebhookResponse,
} from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { generateId, getCurrentTimestamp, logger } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

export class WebhookService {
  private handlerManager: CustomHandlerManager;

  constructor(
    private config: ServerConfig,
    private events: EventService,
    private db: SpecWorkbenchDB
  ) {
    this.handlerManager = new CustomHandlerManager(this.config, this.events, this.db, logger);
  }

  /**
   * Process incoming webhook from GitLab or GitHub
   */
  async processWebhook(
    provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;,
    event: string,
    signature: string | undefined,
    payload: WebhookPayload,
    headers: Record&lt;string, string&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;WebhookResponse&gt; {
    try {
      logger.info(&#39;Processing webhook&#39;, {
        provider,
        event,
        repository: payload.repository?.full_name,
        ref: payload.ref,
      });

      // Verify webhook signature
      const verification = await this.verifySignature(provider, signature, JSON.stringify(payload));
      if (!verification.valid) {
        logger.warn(&#39;Webhook signature verification failed&#39;, {
          provider,
          repository: payload.repository?.full_name,
        });
        return {
          success: false,
          message: &#39;Invalid signature&#39;,
        };
      }

      // Find matching project configuration
      const projectId = await this.findProjectForRepository(payload.repository.full_name);
      if (!projectId) {
        logger.info(&#39;No project found for repository&#39;, {
          repository: payload.repository.full_name,
        });
        return {
          success: false,
          message: &#39;No project configured for this repository&#39;,
        };
      }

      // Process the webhook event
      const webhookRequest: WebhookRequest = {
        provider,
        event,
        signature,
        payload,
        timestamp: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      };

      // Process with both built-in and custom handlers
      const builtInActions = await this.handleWebhookEvent(projectId, webhookRequest);
      const customActions = await this.handlerManager.processWebhookWithCustomHandlers(
        projectId,
        webhookRequest
      );

      const actions = [...builtInActions, ...customActions];

      // Broadcast webhook received event
      await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
        project_id: projectId,
        event_type: &#39;webhook_received&#39;,
        data: {
          provider,
          event,
          repository: payload.repository.full_name,
          ref: payload.ref,
          actions_taken: actions,
        },
      });

      return {
        success: true,
        message: &#39;Webhook processed successfully&#39;,
        actions_taken: actions,
        project_id: projectId,
      };
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;Webhook processing error&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined, {
        provider,
        event,
      });
      return {
        success: false,
        message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
      };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Verify webhook signature based on provider
   */
  private async verifySignature(
    provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;,
    signature: string | undefined,
    payload: string
  ): Promise&lt;{ valid: boolean; reason?: string }&gt; {
    if (!this.config.webhooks?.enabled) {
      return { valid: true }; // Allow if webhooks not configured
    }

    if (!signature) {
      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;No signature provided&#39; };
    }

    try {
      if (provider === &#39;github&#39;) {
        return this.verifyGitHubSignature(signature, payload);
      }
      if (provider === &#39;gitlab&#39;) {
        return this.verifyGitLabSignature(signature, payload);
      }

      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;Unknown provider&#39; };
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;Signature verification error&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);
      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;Verification failed&#39; };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Verify GitHub webhook signature (HMAC SHA-256)
   */
  private verifyGitHubSignature(
    signature: string,
    payload: string
  ): { valid: boolean; reason?: string } {
    const secret = this.config.webhooks?.github_secret || this.config.webhooks?.secret;

    if (!secret) {
      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;No GitHub secret configured&#39; };
    }

    // GitHub signature format: sha256=&lt;hex&gt;
    if (!signature.startsWith(&#39;sha256=&#39;)) {
      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;Invalid signature format&#39; };
    }

    const expectedSignature = createHmac(&#39;sha256&#39;, secret).update(payload, &#39;utf8&#39;).digest(&#39;hex&#39;);

    const providedSignature = signature.replace(&#39;sha256=&#39;, &#39;&#39;);

    const valid = timingSafeEqual(
      Buffer.from(expectedSignature, &#39;hex&#39;),
      Buffer.from(providedSignature, &#39;hex&#39;)
    );

    return { valid };
  }

  /**
   * Verify GitLab webhook signature (HMAC SHA-256)
   */
  private verifyGitLabSignature(
    signature: string,
    payload: string
  ): { valid: boolean; reason?: string } {
    const secret = this.config.webhooks?.gitlab_secret || this.config.webhooks?.secret;

    if (!secret) {
      return { valid: false, reason: &#39;No GitLab secret configured&#39; };
    }

    const expectedSignature = createHmac(&#39;sha256&#39;, secret).update(payload, &#39;utf8&#39;).digest(&#39;base64&#39;);

    const valid = timingSafeEqual(Buffer.from(expectedSignature), Buffer.from(signature));

    return { valid };
  }

  /**
   * Find project ID for a given repository
   */
  private async findProjectForRepository(repositoryFullName: string): Promise&lt;string | null&gt; {
    try {
      // For now, we&#39;ll use a simple naming convention
      // In a real implementation, this would query the database for webhook configs
      const projects = await this.db.listProjects();

      // Look for project with matching name or check if repository is in allowed list
      const allowedRepos = this.config.webhooks?.allowed_repos || [];

      if (allowedRepos.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; !allowedRepos.includes(repositoryFullName)) {
        return null;
      }

      // Simple heuristic: find project by repository name
      const repoName = repositoryFullName.split(&#39;/&#39;).pop()?.toLowerCase() || &#39;&#39;;
      const matchingProject = projects.find(
        p =&gt; p.name.toLowerCase().includes(repoName) || repoName.includes(p.name.toLowerCase())
      );

      return matchingProject?.id || projects[0]?.id || null;
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(
        &#39;Error finding project for repository&#39;,
        error instanceof Error ? error : undefined
      );
      return null;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Handle specific webhook events
   */
  private async handleWebhookEvent(projectId: string, request: WebhookRequest): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
    const actions: string[] = [];

    try {
      if (request.provider === &#39;github&#39;) {
        actions.push(...(await this.handleGitHubEvent(projectId, request)));
      } else if (request.provider === &#39;gitlab&#39;) {
        actions.push(...(await this.handleGitLabEvent(projectId, request)));
      }
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;Error handling webhook event&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);
      actions.push(&#39;Error processing event&#39;);
    }

    return actions;
  }

  /**
   * Handle GitHub webhook events
   */
  private async handleGitHubEvent(projectId: string, request: WebhookRequest): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
    const actions: string[] = [];
    const { event, payload } = request;

    switch (event) {
      case &#39;push&#39;:
        if (payload.ref &amp;&amp; payload.commits) {
          actions.push(`Received ${payload.commits.length} commits on ${payload.ref}`);

          if (this.config.webhooks?.sync_on_push) {
            // TODO: Implement sync logic
            actions.push(&#39;Triggered spec sync&#39;);
          }

          // Broadcast git push event
          await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
            project_id: projectId,
            event_type: &#39;git_push_processed&#39;,
            data: {
              provider: &#39;github&#39;,
              ref: payload.ref,
              commits: payload.commits.length,
              repository: payload.repository.full_name,
            },
          });
        }
        break;

      case &#39;pull_request&#39;:
        if (payload.pull_request &amp;&amp; payload.action) {
          actions.push(`Pull request ${payload.action}: #${payload.pull_request.id}`);

          if (payload.action === &#39;closed&#39; &amp;&amp; this.config.webhooks?.validate_on_merge) {
            // TODO: Implement validation logic
            actions.push(&#39;Triggered spec validation&#39;);
          }

          await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
            project_id: projectId,
            event_type: &#39;git_merge_processed&#39;,
            data: {
              provider: &#39;github&#39;,
              action: payload.action,
              pr_id: payload.pull_request.id,
              base_branch: payload.pull_request.base.ref,
              head_branch: payload.pull_request.head.ref,
            },
          });
        }
        break;

      default:
        actions.push(`Unhandled GitHub event: ${event}`);
    }

    return actions;
  }

  /**
   * Handle GitLab webhook events
   */
  private async handleGitLabEvent(projectId: string, request: WebhookRequest): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
    const actions: string[] = [];
    const { event, payload } = request;

    switch (event) {
      case &#39;Push Hook&#39;:
        if (payload.ref &amp;&amp; payload.commits) {
          actions.push(`Received ${payload.commits.length} commits on ${payload.ref}`);

          if (this.config.webhooks?.sync_on_push) {
            // TODO: Implement sync logic
            actions.push(&#39;Triggered spec sync&#39;);
          }

          await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
            project_id: projectId,
            event_type: &#39;git_push_processed&#39;,
            data: {
              provider: &#39;gitlab&#39;,
              ref: payload.ref,
              commits: payload.commits.length,
              repository: payload.repository.full_name,
            },
          });
        }
        break;

      case &#39;Merge Request Hook&#39;:
        if (payload.merge_request &amp;&amp; payload.action) {
          actions.push(`Merge request ${payload.action}: !${payload.merge_request.id}`);

          if (payload.action === &#39;merge&#39; &amp;&amp; this.config.webhooks?.validate_on_merge) {
            // TODO: Implement validation logic
            actions.push(&#39;Triggered spec validation&#39;);
          }

          await this.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
            project_id: projectId,
            event_type: &#39;git_merge_processed&#39;,
            data: {
              provider: &#39;gitlab&#39;,
              action: payload.action,
              mr_id: payload.merge_request.id,
              target_branch: payload.merge_request.target_branch,
              source_branch: payload.merge_request.source_branch,
            },
          });
        }
        break;

      default:
        actions.push(`Unhandled GitLab event: ${event}`);
    }

    return actions;
  }

  /**
   * Get webhook configuration for a project
   */
  async getWebhookConfig(projectId: string): Promise&lt;WebhookConfig | null&gt; {
    // TODO: Implement database storage for webhook configs
    // For now, return a basic config based on server settings
    if (!this.config.webhooks?.enabled) {
      return null;
    }

    return {
      id: generateId(),
      project_id: projectId,
      provider: &#39;github&#39;, // Default
      repository_url: &#39;&#39;,
      enabled: true,
      events: [&#39;push&#39;, &#39;pull_request&#39;],
      created_at: getCurrentTimestamp(),
      updated_at: getCurrentTimestamp(),
    };
  }

  /**
   * Create or update webhook configuration
   */
  async updateWebhookConfig(
    config: Partial&lt;WebhookConfig&gt; &amp; { project_id: string }
  ): Promise&lt;WebhookConfig&gt; {
    // TODO: Implement database storage
    const webhookConfig: WebhookConfig = {
      id: config.id || generateId(),
      project_id: config.project_id,
      provider: config.provider || &#39;github&#39;,
      repository_url: config.repository_url || &#39;&#39;,
      secret_hash: config.secret_hash,
      enabled: config.enabled ?? true,
      events: config.events || [&#39;push&#39;],
      created_at: config.created_at || getCurrentTimestamp(),
      updated_at: getCurrentTimestamp(),
    };

    logger.info(&#39;Updated webhook config&#39;, {
      projectId: config.project_id,
      provider: webhookConfig.provider,
    });

    return webhookConfig;
  }

  /**
   * Delete webhook configuration
   */
  async deleteWebhookConfig(projectId: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    // TODO: Implement database deletion
    logger.info(&#39;Deleted webhook config&#39;, { projectId });
    return true;
  }

  /**
   * Get custom handler manager for API endpoints
   */
  getHandlerManager(): CustomHandlerManager {
    return this.handlerManager;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/progress.ts
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import ora, { type Ora } from &#39;ora&#39;;
import type { ProgressBarOptions, ProgressOptions, StepProgressOptions } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

/**
 * Enhanced progress indicator utility class with step-by-step tracking
 */
export class Progress {
  private spinner: Ora;
  private startTime: number;
  private steps: Array&lt;{
    name: string;
    status: &#39;pending&#39; | &#39;running&#39; | &#39;completed&#39; | &#39;failed&#39;;
    startTime?: number;
    endTime?: number;
  }&gt;;
  private currentStep = -1;
  private totalSteps = 0;

  constructor(options: ProgressOptions) {
    this.spinner = ora({
      text: options.text,
      color: options.color || &#39;blue&#39;,
      spinner: options.spinner || &#39;dots&#39;,
    });
    this.startTime = Date.now();
    this.steps = [];
  }

  /**
   * Initialize steps for step-by-step progress tracking
   */
  addSteps(stepNames: string[]): void {
    this.steps = stepNames.map(name =&gt; ({ name, status: &#39;pending&#39; }));
    this.totalSteps = this.steps.length;
  }

  /**
   * Start the progress indicator
   */
  start(): void {
    this.spinner.start();
  }

  /**
   * Start the next step in the sequence
   */
  nextStep(stepName?: string): void {
    // Complete previous step if any
    if (this.currentStep &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; this.currentStep &lt; this.steps.length) {
      this.steps[this.currentStep].status = &#39;completed&#39;;
      this.steps[this.currentStep].endTime = Date.now();
    }

    // Move to next step
    this.currentStep++;
    if (this.currentStep &lt; this.steps.length) {
      this.steps[this.currentStep].status = &#39;running&#39;;
      this.steps[this.currentStep].startTime = Date.now();

      const currentStepName = stepName || this.steps[this.currentStep].name;
      const progress = `(${this.currentStep + 1}/${this.totalSteps})`;
      this.update(`${currentStepName} ${chalk.dim(progress)}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Mark current step as failed
   */
  failCurrentStep(error?: string): void {
    if (this.currentStep &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; this.currentStep &lt; this.steps.length) {
      this.steps[this.currentStep].status = &#39;failed&#39;;
      this.steps[this.currentStep].endTime = Date.now();

      const stepName = this.steps[this.currentStep].name;
      const errorMsg = error ? `: ${error}` : &#39;&#39;;
      this.fail(`${stepName} failed${errorMsg}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Update the progress text
   */
  update(text: string): void {
    this.spinner.text = text;
  }

  /**
   * Update with estimated time remaining
   */
  updateWithEstimate(text: string): void {
    const _elapsed = this.getElapsed();
    const estimate = this.getEstimatedTimeRemaining();
    const estimateText =
      estimate &gt; 0 ? chalk.dim(` ~${Math.round(estimate / 1000)}s remaining`) : &#39;&#39;;
    this.spinner.text = `${text}${estimateText}`;
  }

  /**
   * Mark as successful and stop
   */
  succeed(text?: string): void {
    // Complete current step if any
    if (this.currentStep &gt;= 0 &amp;&amp; this.currentStep &lt; this.steps.length) {
      this.steps[this.currentStep].status = &#39;completed&#39;;
      this.steps[this.currentStep].endTime = Date.now();
    }

    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    const message = text || this.spinner.text;
    const stepsSummary = this.totalSteps &gt; 0 ? this.getStepsSummary() : &#39;&#39;;
    this.spinner.succeed(`${message} ${chalk.dim(`(${elapsed}ms)`)}${stepsSummary}`);
  }

  /**
   * Mark as failed and stop
   */
  fail(text?: string): void {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    const message = text || this.spinner.text;
    const stepsSummary = this.totalSteps &gt; 0 ? this.getStepsSummary() : &#39;&#39;;
    this.spinner.fail(`${message} ${chalk.dim(`(${elapsed}ms)`)}${stepsSummary}`);
  }

  /**
   * Mark as warning and stop
   */
  warn(text?: string): void {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    const message = text || this.spinner.text;
    const stepsSummary = this.totalSteps &gt; 0 ? this.getStepsSummary() : &#39;&#39;;
    this.spinner.warn(`${message} ${chalk.dim(`(${elapsed}ms)`)}${stepsSummary}`);
  }

  /**
   * Stop without status
   */
  stop(): void {
    this.spinner.stop();
  }

  /**
   * Get elapsed time
   */
  getElapsed(): number {
    return Date.now() - this.startTime;
  }

  /**
   * Get estimated time remaining based on completed steps
   */
  getEstimatedTimeRemaining(): number {
    if (this.totalSteps === 0 || this.currentStep &lt; 0) return 0;

    const completedSteps = this.steps.filter(step =&gt; step.status === &#39;completed&#39;);
    if (completedSteps.length === 0) return 0;

    const avgTimePerStep =
      completedSteps.reduce((total, step) =&gt; {
        return total + ((step.endTime || Date.now()) - (step.startTime || this.startTime));
      }, 0) / completedSteps.length;

    const remainingSteps = this.totalSteps - this.currentStep - 1;
    return remainingSteps * avgTimePerStep;
  }

  /**
   * Get a summary of completed steps
   */
  getStepsSummary(): string {
    if (this.totalSteps === 0) return &#39;&#39;;

    const completed = this.steps.filter(s =&gt; s.status === &#39;completed&#39;).length;
    const failed = this.steps.filter(s =&gt; s.status === &#39;failed&#39;).length;

    if (failed &gt; 0) {
      return chalk.dim(` [${completed}/${this.totalSteps} completed, ${failed} failed]`);
    }
    return chalk.dim(` [${completed}/${this.totalSteps} completed]`);
  }

  /**
   * Get detailed steps report for debugging
   */
  getStepsReport(): string {
    if (this.totalSteps === 0) return &#39;&#39;;

    return `\n${this.steps
      .map((step, _index) =&gt; {
        const icon =
          step.status === &#39;completed&#39;
            ? &#39;✓&#39;
            : step.status === &#39;failed&#39;
              ? &#39;✗&#39;
              : step.status === &#39;running&#39;
                ? &#39;⚬&#39;
                : &#39;○&#39;;
        const color =
          step.status === &#39;completed&#39;
            ? chalk.green
            : step.status === &#39;failed&#39;
              ? chalk.red
              : step.status === &#39;running&#39;
                ? chalk.yellow
                : chalk.dim;

        const duration =
          step.startTime &amp;&amp; step.endTime
            ? ` (${step.endTime - step.startTime}ms)`
            : step.startTime &amp;&amp; !step.endTime
              ? ` (${Date.now() - step.startTime}ms ongoing)`
              : &#39;&#39;;

        return `  ${color(icon)} ${step.name}${chalk.dim(duration)}`;
      })
      .join(&#39;\n&#39;)}`;
  }
}

/**
 * Progress bar for operations with known progress (0-100%)
 */
export class ProgressBar {
  private current = 0;
  private total = 100;
  private startTime: number;
  private lastUpdate: number;
  private title: string;

  constructor(options: ProgressBarOptions) {
    this.title = options.title;
    this.total = options.total || 100;
    this.startTime = Date.now();
    this.lastUpdate = this.startTime;
  }

  /**
   * Update progress value
   */
  update(current: number, message?: string): void {
    this.current = Math.min(current, this.total);
    const now = Date.now();

    // Only update display every 100ms to avoid flickering
    if (now - this.lastUpdate &gt; 100 || this.current === this.total) {
      this.render(message);
      this.lastUpdate = now;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Increment progress by amount
   */
  increment(amount = 1, message?: string): void {
    this.update(this.current + amount, message);
  }

  /**
   * Mark as complete
   */
  complete(message?: string): void {
    this.update(this.total, message);
    console.log(); // New line after progress bar
  }

  /**
   * Render the progress bar
   */
  private render(message?: string): void {
    if (!process.stdout.isTTY) {
      // Simple text progress for non-TTY environments
      const percent = Math.round((this.current / this.total) * 100);
      console.log(`${this.title}: ${percent}% ${message || &#39;&#39;}`);
      return;
    }

    const percent = (this.current / this.total) * 100;
    const width = Math.min(40, process.stdout.columns - 30); // Leave space for text
    const filled = Math.round((width * percent) / 100);
    const empty = width - filled;

    const bar = &#39;█&#39;.repeat(filled) + &#39;░&#39;.repeat(empty);
    const percentText = `${Math.round(percent).toString().padStart(3)}%`;
    const progressText = message ? ` ${message}` : &#39;&#39;;
    const elapsed = Math.round((Date.now() - this.startTime) / 1000);
    const timeText = ` (${elapsed}s)`;

    // Clear line and render progress
    process.stdout.write(
      `\r${this.title}: [${chalk.cyan(bar)}] ${percentText}${progressText}${chalk.dim(timeText)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Create and manage multiple progress indicators
 */
export class MultiProgress {
  private progresses: Map&lt;string, Progress&gt; = new Map();

  /**
   * Add a new progress indicator
   */
  add(id: string, options: ProgressOptions): Progress {
    const progress = new Progress(options);
    this.progresses.set(id, progress);
    return progress;
  }

  /**
   * Get a progress indicator by ID
   */
  get(id: string): Progress | undefined {
    return this.progresses.get(id);
  }

  /**
   * Update all progress indicators
   */
  updateAll(text: string): void {
    this.progresses.forEach(progress =&gt; {
      progress.update(text);
    });
  }

  /**
   * Stop all progress indicators
   */
  stopAll(): void {
    this.progresses.forEach(progress =&gt; {
      progress.stop();
    });
    this.progresses.clear();
  }

  /**
   * Mark all as successful
   */
  succeedAll(text?: string): void {
    this.progresses.forEach(progress =&gt; {
      progress.succeed(text);
    });
    this.progresses.clear();
  }

  /**
   * Mark all as failed
   */
  failAll(text?: string): void {
    this.progresses.forEach(progress =&gt; {
      progress.fail(text);
    });
    this.progresses.clear();
  }
}

/**
 * Simple progress logger for non-interactive environments
 */
export class SimpleProgress {
  private startTime: number;
  private lastUpdate: number;
  private updateInterval: number;

  constructor(updateInterval = 1000) {
    this.startTime = Date.now();
    this.lastUpdate = this.startTime;
    this.updateInterval = updateInterval;
  }

  /**
   * Log progress message with timestamp
   */
  log(message: string): void {
    const now = Date.now();
    const elapsed = now - this.startTime;
    const since = now - this.lastUpdate;

    if (since &gt;= this.updateInterval) {
      console.log(`[${new Date().toISOString()}] ${message} (+${elapsed}ms)`);
      this.lastUpdate = now;
    }
  }

  /**
   * Log success message
   */
  success(message: string): void {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    console.log(chalk.green(`✓ ${message} (${elapsed}ms)`));
  }

  /**
   * Log error message
   */
  error(message: string): void {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    console.log(chalk.red(`✗ ${message} (${elapsed}ms)`));
  }

  /**
   * Log warning message
   */
  warn(message: string): void {
    const elapsed = Date.now() - this.startTime;
    console.log(chalk.yellow(`! ${message} (${elapsed}ms)`));
  }
}

/**
 * Create appropriate progress indicator based on environment and type
 */
export function createProgress(options: ProgressOptions): Progress | SimpleProgress {
  // Use simple progress in CI or non-TTY environments
  if (!process.stdout.isTTY || process.env.CI) {
    return new SimpleProgress();
  }

  return new Progress(options);
}

/**
 * Create step-based progress indicator
 */
export function createStepProgress(options: StepProgressOptions): Progress | SimpleProgress {
  const progress = createProgress({ text: options.title });

  if (progress instanceof Progress) {
    progress.addSteps(options.steps);
  }

  return progress;
}

/**
 * Create progress bar for known-length operations
 */
export function createProgressBar(options: ProgressBarOptions): ProgressBar {
  return new ProgressBar(options);
}

/**
 * Measure and report performance of an operation
 */
export async function withProgress&lt;T&gt;(
  options: ProgressOptions,
  operation: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  const progress = createProgress(options);

  if (progress instanceof Progress) {
    progress.start();
  } else {
    progress.log(options.text);
  }

  try {
    const result = await operation();

    if (progress instanceof Progress) {
      progress.succeed();
    } else {
      progress.success(options.text);
    }

    return result;
  } catch (error) {
    const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);

    if (progress instanceof Progress) {
      progress.fail(message);
    } else {
      progress.error(message);
    }

    throw error;
  }
}

/**
 * Execute multi-step operation with progress tracking
 */
export async function withStepProgress&lt;T&gt;(
  options: StepProgressOptions,
  operation: (progress: Progress | SimpleProgress) =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  const progress = createStepProgress(options);

  if (progress instanceof Progress) {
    progress.start();
  } else {
    progress.log(options.title);
  }

  try {
    const result = await operation(progress);

    if (progress instanceof Progress) {
      progress.succeed(`${options.title} completed`);
    } else {
      progress.success(options.title);
    }

    return result;
  } catch (error) {
    const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);

    if (progress instanceof Progress) {
      progress.fail(message);
    } else {
      progress.error(message);
    }

    throw error;
  }
}

/**
 * Execute operation with progress bar (for known-length operations)
 */
export async function withProgressBar&lt;T&gt;(
  options: ProgressBarOptions,
  operation: (progressBar: ProgressBar) =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;
): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
  const progressBar = createProgressBar(options);

  try {
    const result = await operation(progressBar);
    progressBar.complete(options.completeMessage || `${options.title} completed`);
    return result;
  } catch (error) {
    progressBar.complete(chalk.red(`${options.title} failed`));
    throw error;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/cue/index.ts
/**
 * CUE Manipulation Abstraction Layer
 *
 * This module provides a proper AST-based approach to CUE file manipulation,
 * replacing fragile string concatenation with validated CUE tool integration.
 *
 * Key Features:
 * - Parse CUE files using the CUE tool
 * - Manipulate CUE structures through JSON intermediate representation
 * - Format and validate using official CUE tooling
 * - Type-safe operations with proper error handling
 */

import * as os from &#39;node:os&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { CueRunner } from &#39;@arbiter/cue-runner&#39;;

/**
 * Platform-specific service types for popular cloud providers
 */
export type PlatformServiceType =
  // Generic types
  | &#39;bespoke&#39;
  | &#39;prebuilt&#39;
  // Cloudflare platform
  | &#39;cloudflare_worker&#39;
  | &#39;cloudflare_d1&#39;
  | &#39;cloudflare_kv&#39;
  | &#39;cloudflare_r2&#39;
  | &#39;cloudflare_durable_object&#39;
  // Vercel platform
  | &#39;vercel_function&#39;
  | &#39;vercel_edge_function&#39;
  | &#39;vercel_kv&#39;
  | &#39;vercel_postgres&#39;
  | &#39;vercel_blob&#39;
  // Supabase platform
  | &#39;supabase_database&#39;
  | &#39;supabase_auth&#39;
  | &#39;supabase_storage&#39;
  | &#39;supabase_functions&#39;
  | &#39;supabase_realtime&#39;;

/**
 * Configuration for a service in the CUE specification
 */
export interface ServiceConfig {
  serviceType: PlatformServiceType;
  language: string;
  type: &#39;deployment&#39; | &#39;statefulset&#39; | &#39;serverless&#39; | &#39;managed&#39;;
  sourceDirectory?: string;
  image?: string;
  // Platform-specific configurations
  platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
  runtime?: string; // e.g., &quot;durable_object&quot;, &quot;edge&quot;, &quot;nodejs18&quot;
  region?: string;
  // Standard configurations
  ports?: Array&lt;{
    name: string;
    port: number;
    targetPort: number;
  }&gt;;
  volumes?: Array&lt;{
    name: string;
    path: string;
    size?: string;
    type?: string;
  }&gt;;
  env?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
  healthCheck?: {
    path: string;
    port: number;
  };
  template?: string;
}

/**
 * Configuration for an API endpoint
 */
export interface EndpointConfig {
  method: string;
  request?: {
    $ref: string;
  };
  response?: {
    $ref: string;
  };
}

/**
 * Configuration for a database service
 */
export interface DatabaseConfig extends ServiceConfig {
  attachTo?: string;
}

/**
 * Configuration for a UI route
 */
export interface RouteConfig {
  id: string;
  path: string;
  capabilities: string[];
  components?: string[];
}

/**
 * Configuration for a user flow
 */
export interface FlowConfig {
  id: string;
  steps: Array&lt;any&gt;;
}

/**
 * Result of CUE validation
 */
export interface ValidationResult {
  valid: boolean;
  errors: string[];
}

/**
 * Main CUE manipulator class providing AST-based operations
 */
export class CUEManipulator {
  private tempDir: string;

  constructor() {
    this.tempDir = fs.mkdtempSync(path.join(os.tmpdir(), &#39;cue-manipulator-&#39;));
  }

  /**
   * Parse CUE content into a JavaScript object using the CUE tool
   */
  async parse(content: string): Promise&lt;any&gt; {
    const tempFile = path.join(this.tempDir, &#39;input.cue&#39;);
    await fs.writeFile(tempFile, content);

    try {
      const runner = this.createRunner();
      const exportResult = await runner.exportJson([tempFile]);

      if (exportResult.success &amp;&amp; exportResult.value) {
        return exportResult.value;
      }

      const firstDiagnostic = exportResult.diagnostics[0];
      const reason = firstDiagnostic?.message || exportResult.error || &#39;Unknown CUE export error&#39;;
      throw new Error(reason);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to parse CUE content: ${error}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a service to the CUE structure
   */
  async addService(content: string, serviceName: string, config: ServiceConfig): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      // Parse existing content
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Ensure services section exists
      if (!ast.services) {
        ast.services = {};
      }

      // Add the service
      ast.services[serviceName] = config;

      // Convert back to CUE and format
      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      // Fallback to direct manipulation if parsing fails (for incomplete CUE)
      return this.directServiceAdd(content, serviceName, config);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add an endpoint to the CUE structure
   */
  async addEndpoint(content: string, endpoint: string, config: EndpointConfig): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Ensure paths section exists
      if (!ast.paths) {
        ast.paths = {};
      }

      // Add the endpoint
      ast.paths[endpoint] = {
        [config.method.toLowerCase()]: {
          ...(config.request &amp;&amp; { request: config.request }),
          ...(config.response &amp;&amp; { response: config.response }),
        },
      };

      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      return this.directEndpointAdd(content, endpoint, config);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a database to the CUE structure
   */
  async addDatabase(content: string, dbName: string, config: DatabaseConfig): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Ensure services section exists
      if (!ast.services) {
        ast.services = {};
      }

      // Add the database service
      ast.services[dbName] = config;

      // If attaching to another service, add connection environment variables
      if (config.attachTo &amp;&amp; ast.services[config.attachTo]) {
        if (!ast.services[config.attachTo].env) {
          ast.services[config.attachTo].env = {};
        }

        // Generate connection string based on service type
        if (config.image) {
          // Container-based database
          const connectionString = this.generateDbConnectionString(
            config.image,
            dbName,
            config.ports?.[0]?.port || 5432
          );
          ast.services[config.attachTo].env.DATABASE_URL = connectionString;
        } else if (config.serviceType &amp;&amp; config.serviceType !== &#39;prebuilt&#39;) {
          // Platform-managed database - generate appropriate env vars
          const envVars = this.generatePlatformDbEnvVars(config.serviceType, dbName);
          Object.assign(ast.services[config.attachTo].env, envVars);
        }
      }

      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      return this.directDatabaseAdd(content, dbName, config);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a route to the UI routes array
   */
  async addRoute(content: string, route: RouteConfig): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Ensure ui.routes exists
      if (!ast.ui) {
        ast.ui = {};
      }
      if (!ast.ui.routes) {
        ast.ui.routes = [];
      }

      // Add the route
      ast.ui.routes.push(route);

      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      return this.directRouteAdd(content, route);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a flow to the flows array
   */
  async addFlow(content: string, flow: FlowConfig): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Ensure flows exists
      if (!ast.flows) {
        ast.flows = [];
      }

      // Add the flow
      ast.flows.push(flow);

      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      return this.directFlowAdd(content, flow);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Add a key-value pair to a specific section
   */
  async addToSection(content: string, section: string, key: string, value: any): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await this.parse(content);

      // Navigate to the section (support nested sections like &quot;components.schemas&quot;)
      const sections = section.split(&#39;.&#39;);
      let current = ast;

      for (const sec of sections) {
        if (!current[sec]) {
          current[sec] = {};
        }
        current = current[sec];
      }

      // Add the key-value pair
      current[key] = value;

      return await this.serialize(ast, content);
    } catch (error) {
      return this.directSectionAdd(content, section, key, value);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Serialize a JavaScript object back to formatted CUE
   */
  async serialize(ast: any, originalContent?: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      // Extract package declaration from original content if available
      let packageDeclaration = &#39;package main&#39;;
      if (originalContent) {
        const packageMatch = originalContent.match(/package\s+(\w+)/);
        if (packageMatch) {
          packageDeclaration = `package ${packageMatch[1]}`;
        }
      }

      // Use manual CUE formatting for better control
      const cueBody = this.formatCueObject(ast);
      const cueWithPackage = `${packageDeclaration}\n\n${cueBody}`;

      return await this.format(cueWithPackage);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to serialize CUE content: ${error}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Format CUE content using the CUE tool
   */
  async format(content: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    const tempFile = path.join(this.tempDir, &#39;format.cue&#39;);
    await fs.writeFile(tempFile, content);

    try {
      const runner = this.createRunner();
      const result = await runner.fmt([tempFile]);
      if (!result.success) {
        throw new Error(result.stderr || &#39;cue fmt failed&#39;);
      }

      return await fs.readFile(tempFile, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Failed to format CUE content: ${error}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate CUE content using the CUE tool
   */
  async validate(content: string): Promise&lt;ValidationResult&gt; {
    const tempFile = path.join(this.tempDir, &#39;validate.cue&#39;);
    await fs.writeFile(tempFile, content);

    try {
      const runner = this.createRunner();
      const result = await runner.vet([tempFile]);

      if (result.success) {
        return { valid: true, errors: [] };
      }

      const errors = result.diagnostics.length
        ? result.diagnostics.map(diag =&gt; diag.message)
        : [result.raw.stderr || &#39;cue vet failed&#39;];

      return { valid: false, errors };
    } catch (error) {
      const message = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
      return { valid: false, errors: [message] };
    }
  }

  private createRunner(): CueRunner {
    return new CueRunner({ cwd: this.tempDir });
  }

  /**
   * Direct service addition fallback for when parsing fails
   */
  private directServiceAdd(content: string, serviceName: string, config: ServiceConfig): string {
    const serviceBlock = this.formatCueObject(config);

    const servicesRegex = /(services:\s*{)([^}]*)(})/s;
    const match = content.match(servicesRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const newEntry = `\n\t${serviceName}: ${serviceBlock}`;
      const updated = existing.trim() ? `${existing}${newEntry}` : newEntry;
      return content.replace(servicesRegex, `$1${updated}\n$3`);
    }
    return `${content}\n\nservices: {\n\t${serviceName}: ${serviceBlock}\n}`;
  }

  /**
   * Direct endpoint addition fallback
   */
  private directEndpointAdd(content: string, endpoint: string, config: EndpointConfig): string {
    const pathBlock = this.formatCueObject({
      [config.method.toLowerCase()]: {
        ...(config.request &amp;&amp; { request: config.request }),
        ...(config.response &amp;&amp; { response: config.response }),
      },
    });

    const pathsRegex = /(paths:\s*{)([^}]*)(})/s;
    const match = content.match(pathsRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const newEntry = `\n\t&quot;${endpoint}&quot;: ${pathBlock}`;
      const updated = existing.trim() ? `${existing}${newEntry}` : newEntry;
      return content.replace(pathsRegex, `$1${updated}\n$3`);
    }
    return `${content}\n\npaths: {\n\t&quot;${endpoint}&quot;: ${pathBlock}\n}`;
  }

  /**
   * Direct database addition fallback
   */
  private directDatabaseAdd(content: string, dbName: string, config: DatabaseConfig): string {
    let result = this.directServiceAdd(content, dbName, config);

    // Add connection string to attached service if specified
    if (config.attachTo) {
      if (config.image) {
        // Container-based database
        const connectionString = this.generateDbConnectionString(
          config.image,
          dbName,
          config.ports?.[0]?.port || 5432
        );
        result = this.addEnvironmentVariable(
          result,
          config.attachTo,
          &#39;DATABASE_URL&#39;,
          connectionString
        );
      } else if (config.serviceType &amp;&amp; config.serviceType !== &#39;prebuilt&#39;) {
        // Platform-managed database - add multiple env vars
        const envVars = this.generatePlatformDbEnvVars(config.serviceType, dbName);
        for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(envVars)) {
          result = this.addEnvironmentVariable(result, config.attachTo, key, value);
        }
      }
    }

    return result;
  }

  /**
   * Direct route addition fallback
   */
  private directRouteAdd(content: string, route: RouteConfig): string {
    const routeBlock = this.formatCueObject(route);

    const routesRegex = /(ui:\s*routes:\s*\[)([^\]]*)]]/s;
    const match = content.match(routesRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const separator = existing.trim() ? &#39;,\n\t&#39; : &#39;\n\t&#39;;
      return content.replace(routesRegex, `$1${existing}${separator}${routeBlock}\n]`);
    }
    return content.replace(/ui:\s*routes:\s*\[\]/, `ui: routes: [\n\t${routeBlock}\n]`);
  }

  /**
   * Direct flow addition fallback
   */
  private directFlowAdd(content: string, flow: FlowConfig): string {
    const flowBlock = this.formatCueObject(flow);

    const flowsRegex = /(flows:\s*\[)([^\]]*)]]/s;
    const match = content.match(flowsRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const separator = existing.trim() ? &#39;,\n\t&#39; : &#39;\n\t&#39;;
      return content.replace(flowsRegex, `$1${existing}${separator}${flowBlock}\n]`);
    }
    return content.replace(/flows:\s*\[\]/, `flows: [\n\t${flowBlock}\n]`);
  }

  /**
   * Direct section addition fallback
   */
  private directSectionAdd(content: string, section: string, key: string, value: any): string {
    const valueStr = this.formatCueObject(value);

    const sectionRegex = new RegExp(`(${section.replace(&#39;.&#39;, &#39;:\\s+&#39;)}:\\s*{)([^}]*)(})`, &#39;s&#39;);
    const match = content.match(sectionRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const newEntry = `\n\t${key}: ${valueStr}`;
      const updated = existing.trim() ? `${existing}${newEntry}` : newEntry;
      return content.replace(sectionRegex, `$1${updated}\n$3`);
    }
    return `${content}\n\n${section}: {\n\t${key}: ${valueStr}\n}`;
  }

  /**
   * Add environment variable to a service
   */
  private addEnvironmentVariable(
    content: string,
    serviceName: string,
    key: string,
    value: string
  ): string {
    const envRegex = new RegExp(`(${serviceName}:\\s*{[^}]*env:\\s*{)([^}]*)(})`, &#39;s&#39;);
    const match = content.match(envRegex);

    if (match) {
      const existing = match[2];
      const newEntry = `\n\t\t${key}: &quot;${value}&quot;`;
      const updated = existing.trim() ? `${existing}${newEntry}` : newEntry;
      return content.replace(envRegex, `$1${updated}\n\t$3`);
    }
    // Add env section to service
    const serviceRegex = new RegExp(`(${serviceName}:\\s*{[^}]*)(})`, &#39;s&#39;);
    return content.replace(serviceRegex, `$1\tenv: {\n\t\t${key}: &quot;${value}&quot;\n\t}\n$2`);
  }

  /**
   * Format a JavaScript object as CUE syntax
   */
  private formatCueObject(obj: any, indent = &#39;&#39;): string {
    if (typeof obj === &#39;string&#39;) {
      return `&quot;${obj.replace(/&quot;/g, &#39;\\&quot;&#39;)}&quot;`;
    }
    if (typeof obj === &#39;number&#39; || typeof obj === &#39;boolean&#39;) {
      return String(obj);
    }

    if (Array.isArray(obj)) {
      if (obj.length === 0) {
        return &#39;[]&#39;;
      }
      const items = obj.map(item =&gt; `${indent}\t${this.formatCueObject(item, `${indent}\t`)}`);
      return `[\n${items.join(&#39;,\n&#39;)}\n${indent}]`;
    }

    if (typeof obj === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp; obj !== null) {
      const entries = Object.entries(obj);
      if (entries.length === 0) {
        return &#39;{}&#39;;
      }
      const formattedEntries = entries.map(([k, v]) =&gt; {
        const key = /^[a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*$/.test(k) ? k : `&quot;${k}&quot;`;
        return `${indent}\t${key}: ${this.formatCueObject(v, `${indent}\t`)}`;
      });
      return `{\n${formattedEntries.join(&#39;\n&#39;)}\n${indent}}`;
    }

    return String(obj);
  }

  /**
   * Generate database connection string
   */
  private generateDbConnectionString(image: string, dbName: string, port: number): string {
    if (!image) {
      throw new Error(&#39;generateDbConnectionString called with undefined image&#39;);
    }
    if (image.includes(&#39;postgres&#39;)) {
      return `postgresql://user:password@${dbName}:${port}/${dbName}`;
    }
    if (image.includes(&#39;mysql&#39;)) {
      return `mysql://user:password@${dbName}:${port}/${dbName}`;
    }
    return `db://${dbName}:${port}/${dbName}`;
  }

  /**
   * Generate platform-specific database environment variables
   */
  private generatePlatformDbEnvVars(serviceType: string, dbName: string): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
    switch (serviceType) {
      case &#39;cloudflare_d1&#39;:
        return {
          D1_DATABASE_ID: `${dbName}_id`,
          D1_DATABASE_NAME: dbName,
          DATABASE_URL: `d1://${dbName}`,
        };
      case &#39;cloudflare_kv&#39;:
        return {
          KV_NAMESPACE_ID: `${dbName}_namespace_id`,
          KV_BINDING_NAME: dbName.toUpperCase(),
        };
      case &#39;vercel_postgres&#39;:
        return {
          POSTGRES_URL: `postgres://${dbName}`,
          POSTGRES_PRISMA_URL: `postgres://${dbName}?pgbouncer=true`,
          POSTGRES_URL_NON_POOLING: `postgres://${dbName}`,
        };
      case &#39;vercel_kv&#39;:
        return {
          KV_REST_API_URL: `https://${dbName}.kv.vercel-storage.com`,
          KV_REST_API_TOKEN: `${dbName}_token`,
          KV_URL: `redis://${dbName}`,
        };
      case &#39;supabase_database&#39;:
        return {
          SUPABASE_URL: `https://${dbName}.supabase.co`,
          SUPABASE_ANON_KEY: `${dbName}_anon_key`,
          SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY: `${dbName}_service_role_key`,
          DATABASE_URL: `postgresql://${dbName}`,
        };
      default:
        return {
          DATABASE_URL: `${serviceType}://${dbName}`,
        };
    }
  }

  /**
   * Cleanup temporary files
   */
  async cleanup(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await fs.remove(this.tempDir);
  }
}

/**
 * Create a new CUE manipulator instance
 */
export function createCUEManipulator(): CUEManipulator {
  return new CUEManipulator();
}

/**
 * Helper function to validate CUE content
 */
export async function validateCUE(content: string): Promise&lt;ValidationResult&gt; {
  const manipulator = createCUEManipulator();
  try {
    return await manipulator.validate(content);
  } finally {
    await manipulator.cleanup();
  }
}

/**
 * Helper function to format CUE content
 */
export async function formatCUE(content: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const manipulator = createCUEManipulator();
  try {
    return await manipulator.format(content);
  } finally {
    await manipulator.cleanup();
  }
}
📄 examples/external-agent.ts
#!/usr/bin/env bun
/**
 * Example external agent that subscribes to spec events via NATS
 * This demonstrates how AI agents can react to specification changes
 */
import { type NatsConnection, connect } from &#39;nats&#39;;

interface NatsSpecEvent {
  topic: string;
  projectId: string;
  event: {
    project_id: string;
    event_type: string;
    data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  };
  metadata: {
    timestamp: string;
    specHash?: string;
    sequence: number;
  };
}

class SpecAnalysisAgent {
  private connection: NatsConnection | null = null;
  private name: string;

  constructor(name = &#39;SpecAnalysisAgent&#39;) {
    this.name = name;
  }

  /**
   * Connect to NATS and start listening for spec events
   */
  async start(natsUrl = &#39;nats://localhost:4222&#39;): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      console.log(`🤖 ${this.name} connecting to NATS at ${natsUrl}...`);

      this.connection = await connect({
        servers: [natsUrl],
        reconnectTimeWait: 2000,
        maxReconnectAttempts: 10,
      });

      console.log(`✅ ${this.name} connected to NATS server`);

      // Subscribe to all spec events for all projects
      // In production, you might want to filter by specific projects
      const subscription = this.connection.subscribe(&#39;spec.*.*.updated&#39;);

      console.log(`🔍 ${this.name} listening for spec events...`);

      // Process incoming events
      for await (const message of subscription) {
        try {
          const event: NatsSpecEvent = JSON.parse(message.data.toString());
          await this.processSpecEvent(event);
        } catch (error) {
          console.error(&#39;❌ Error processing message:&#39;, error);
        }
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.error(`❌ ${this.name} failed to connect to NATS:`, error);
      process.exit(1);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Process a spec event and provide AI analysis
   */
  private async processSpecEvent(event: NatsSpecEvent): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const { topic, projectId, event: specEvent, metadata } = event;

    console.log(`\n📨 ${this.name} received event:`);
    console.log(`   Topic: ${topic}`);
    console.log(`   Project: ${projectId}`);
    console.log(`   Type: ${specEvent.event_type}`);
    console.log(`   Sequence: ${metadata.sequence}`);
    console.log(`   Timestamp: ${metadata.timestamp}`);

    // Example analysis based on event type
    switch (specEvent.event_type) {
      case &#39;fragment_updated&#39;:
        await this.analyzeFragmentUpdate(projectId, specEvent);
        break;

      case &#39;validation_failed&#39;:
        await this.analyzeValidationFailure(projectId, specEvent);
        break;

      case &#39;validation_completed&#39;:
        await this.analyzeValidationSuccess(projectId, specEvent);
        break;

      case &#39;version_frozen&#39;:
        await this.analyzeVersionFreeze(projectId, specEvent);
        break;

      default:
        console.log(`   📋 No specific analysis for event type: ${specEvent.event_type}`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Analyze fragment updates for potential issues or improvements
   */
  private async analyzeFragmentUpdate(projectId: string, event: any): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(`🔍 Analyzing fragment update in project ${projectId}...`);

    // Simulate AI analysis delay
    await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 100));

    // Example analysis outputs
    const fragmentPath = event.data.path || &#39;unknown&#39;;
    const insights = [
      &#39;Fragment structure appears consistent with domain patterns&#39;,
      &#39;Consider adding validation constraints for better error messages&#39;,
      &#39;This change might benefit from additional test coverage&#39;,
    ];

    console.log(`   📊 Analysis for ${fragmentPath}:`);
    insights.forEach(insight =&gt; console.log(`      • ${insight}`));

    // In a real agent, you might:
    // - Send analysis back via NATS to another topic
    // - Store insights in a database
    // - Generate automated recommendations
    // - Trigger other automated workflows
  }

  /**
   * Analyze validation failures and suggest fixes
   */
  private async analyzeValidationFailure(projectId: string, event: any): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(`❌ Analyzing validation failure in project ${projectId}...`);

    await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 150));

    const errors = event.data.errors || [];
    const suggestions = [
      &#39;Check for circular dependencies in fragment imports&#39;,
      &#39;Ensure all required fields are properly defined&#39;,
      &#39;Validate CUE syntax and type constraints&#39;,
    ];

    console.log(`   🔧 Failure analysis (${errors.length} errors):`);
    suggestions.forEach(suggestion =&gt; console.log(`      • ${suggestion}`));

    // Real agent might publish back remediation suggestions
    if (this.connection) {
      const remediation = {
        projectId,
        agentName: this.name,
        type: &#39;validation_remediation&#39;,
        suggestions,
        timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
        originalEventSequence: event.data.sequence,
      };

      this.connection.publish(`agent.${projectId}.remediation`, JSON.stringify(remediation));
      console.log(`   📤 Published remediation suggestions to agent.${projectId}.remediation`);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Analyze successful validations for quality insights
   */
  private async analyzeValidationSuccess(projectId: string, event: any): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(`✅ Analyzing validation success in project ${projectId}...`);

    await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 80));

    const specHash = event.data.spec_hash;
    console.log(`   🎯 Validation passed for spec ${specHash}`);
    console.log(&#39;      • Spec structure is valid and consistent&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;      • All constraints are properly satisfied&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;      • Ready for potential version freeze&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Analyze version freezes for historical tracking
   */
  private async analyzeVersionFreeze(projectId: string, event: any): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(`🔒 Analyzing version freeze in project ${projectId}...`);

    const versionId = event.data.version_id;
    const specHash = event.data.spec_hash;

    console.log(`   📚 Version ${versionId} frozen with spec ${specHash}`);
    console.log(&#39;      • Milestone reached - spec locked for stability&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;      • Consider generating documentation snapshot&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;      • Good time for comprehensive testing&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Cleanup and disconnect
   */
  async stop(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.connection) {
      await this.connection.close();
      console.log(`👋 ${this.name} disconnected from NATS`);
    }
  }
}

// Main execution
if (import.meta.main) {
  const agentName = process.argv[2] || &#39;SpecAnalysisAgent&#39;;
  const natsUrl = process.env.NATS_URL || &#39;nats://localhost:4222&#39;;

  const agent = new SpecAnalysisAgent(agentName);

  // Handle graceful shutdown
  process.on(&#39;SIGINT&#39;, async () =&gt; {
    console.log(&#39;\n🛑 Shutting down agent...&#39;);
    await agent.stop();
    process.exit(0);
  });

  process.on(&#39;SIGTERM&#39;, async () =&gt; {
    console.log(&#39;\n🛑 Shutting down agent...&#39;);
    await agent.stop();
    process.exit(0);
  });

  // Start the agent
  agent.start(natsUrl).catch(error =&gt; {
    console.error(&#39;Failed to start agent:&#39;, error);
    process.exit(1);
  });
}

export { SpecAnalysisAgent };
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/templates.ts
/**
 * Templates command - Template management for Arbiter
 *
 * This command provides template management functionality:
 * - List available templates
 * - Show template details
 * - Add/update template aliases
 * - Remove template aliases
 */

import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { type TemplateAlias, templateManager } from &#39;../templates/index.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

export interface TemplatesOptions {
  verbose?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  engine?: string;
}

/**
 * Main templates command dispatcher
 */
export async function templatesCommand(
  action: string,
  name?: string,
  options: TemplatesOptions &amp; Record&lt;string, any&gt; = {},
  _config?: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    // Load template configuration
    await templateManager.loadConfig();

    switch (action) {
      case &#39;list&#39;:
        return await listTemplates(options);
      case &#39;show&#39;:
        if (!name) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template name is required for show command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await showTemplate(name, options);
      case &#39;add&#39;:
        if (!name) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template name is required for add command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await addTemplate(name, options);
      case &#39;remove&#39;:
        if (!name) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template name is required for remove command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await removeTemplate(name, options);
      case &#39;update&#39;:
        return await updateTemplates(options);
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Unknown templates action: ${action}`));
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Available actions: list, show, add, remove, update&#39;));
        return 1;
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Templates command failed:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * List all available template aliases
 */
async function listTemplates(options: TemplatesOptions): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const aliases = templateManager.getAliases();
    const entries = Object.entries(aliases);

    if (entries.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;📋 No template aliases configured&#39;));
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(&quot;Use &#39;arbiter templates add &lt;name&gt; --source &lt;source&gt;&#39; to add templates&quot;)
      );
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(JSON.stringify(aliases, null, 2));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;📋 Available Template Aliases:&#39;));
    console.log();

    // Group by engine
    const engineGroups = new Map&lt;string, Array&lt;[string, TemplateAlias]&gt;&gt;();
    for (const [name, alias] of entries) {
      if (!engineGroups.has(alias.engine)) {
        engineGroups.set(alias.engine, []);
      }
      engineGroups.get(alias.engine)?.push([name, alias]);
    }

    for (const [engine, templates] of engineGroups.entries()) {
      console.log(chalk.bold(chalk.blue(`${engine.toUpperCase()} Templates:`)));

      for (const [name, alias] of templates) {
        console.log(`  ${chalk.green(name)}`);
        console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(alias.description)}`);
        console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(`Source: ${alias.source}`)}`);

        if (alias.prerequisites &amp;&amp; alias.prerequisites.length &gt; 0) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(`Prerequisites: ${alias.prerequisites.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`)}`);
        }

        console.log();
      }
    }

    console.log(chalk.dim(&quot;Use &#39;arbiter templates show &lt;name&gt;&#39; to view template details&quot;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&quot;Use &#39;arbiter add service &lt;name&gt; --template &lt;alias&gt;&#39; to use a template&quot;));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to list templates:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Show details for a specific template alias
 */
async function showTemplate(name: string, options: TemplatesOptions): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const alias = templateManager.getAlias(name);

    if (!alias) {
      return handleTemplateNotFound(name);
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      return displayTemplateAsJson(name, alias);
    }

    return displayTemplateDetails(name, alias);
  } catch (error) {
    return handleTemplateDisplayError(error);
  }
}

/**
 * Handle template not found scenario
 */
function handleTemplateNotFound(name: string): number {
  console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Template alias &#39;${name}&#39; not found`));

  const availableTemplates = Object.keys(templateManager.getAliases());
  if (availableTemplates.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Available templates:&#39;));
    availableTemplates.forEach(t =&gt; console.log(chalk.dim(`  • ${t}`)));
  }

  return 1;
}

/**
 * Display template in JSON format
 */
function displayTemplateAsJson(name: string, alias: any): number {
  console.log(JSON.stringify({ [name]: alias }, null, 2));
  return 0;
}

/**
 * Display template details in formatted output
 */
function displayTemplateDetails(name: string, alias: any): number {
  displayTemplateHeader(name);
  displayTemplateBasicInfo(alias);
  displayTemplatePrerequisites(alias);
  displayTemplateVariables(alias);
  displayTemplateUsage(name);

  return 0;
}

/**
 * Display template header
 */
function displayTemplateHeader(name: string): void {
  console.log(chalk.cyan(`📋 Template: ${chalk.bold(name)}`));
  console.log();
}

/**
 * Display basic template information
 */
function displayTemplateBasicInfo(alias: any): void {
  console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Description:&#39;));
  console.log(`  ${alias.description}`);
  console.log();

  console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Engine:&#39;));
  console.log(`  ${alias.engine}`);
  console.log();

  console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Source:&#39;));
  console.log(`  ${alias.source}`);
  console.log();
}

/**
 * Display template prerequisites if available
 */
function displayTemplatePrerequisites(alias: any): void {
  if (alias.prerequisites &amp;&amp; alias.prerequisites.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Prerequisites:&#39;));
    alias.prerequisites.forEach((prereq: string) =&gt; {
      console.log(`  • ${prereq}`);
    });
    console.log();
  }
}

/**
 * Display template variables if available
 */
function displayTemplateVariables(alias: any): void {
  if (alias.variables &amp;&amp; Object.keys(alias.variables).length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Default Variables:&#39;));
    Object.entries(alias.variables).forEach(([key, value]) =&gt; {
      console.log(`  ${chalk.green(key)}: ${JSON.stringify(value)}`);
    });
    console.log();
  }
}

/**
 * Display template usage examples
 */
function displayTemplateUsage(name: string): void {
  console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Usage:&#39;));
  console.log(`  arbiter add service myapi --template ${name}`);
  console.log(`  arbiter add frontend web --template ${name}`);
}

/**
 * Handle template display errors
 */
function handleTemplateDisplayError(error: unknown): number {
  console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to show template:&#39;));
  console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
  return 1;
}

/**
 * Add a new template alias
 */
async function addTemplate(name: string, options: Record&lt;string, any&gt;): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const { source, description, engine = &#39;cookiecutter&#39;, prerequisites } = options;

    if (!source) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template source is required&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Use --source to specify the template source (URL, path, or repo)&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    if (!description) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template description is required&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Use --description to provide a template description&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    // Check if engine is supported
    const supportedEngines = templateManager.getEngines();
    if (!supportedEngines.includes(engine)) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Unsupported engine: ${engine}`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Supported engines: ${supportedEngines.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
      return 1;
    }

    const alias: TemplateAlias = {
      engine,
      source,
      description,
      ...(prerequisites &amp;&amp; {
        prerequisites: prerequisites.split(&#39;,&#39;).map((p: string) =&gt; p.trim()),
      }),
    };

    await templateManager.addAlias(name, alias);

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Template alias &#39;${name}&#39; added successfully`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Engine: ${engine}`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Source: ${source}`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Description: ${description}`));

    if (prerequisites) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Prerequisites: ${prerequisites}`));
    }

    console.log();
    console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Usage:&#39;));
    console.log(`  arbiter add service myapi --template ${name}`);

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to add template:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Remove a template alias
 */
async function removeTemplate(name: string, options: TemplatesOptions): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const alias = templateManager.getAlias(name);

    if (!alias) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Template alias &#39;${name}&#39; not found`));
      return 1;
    }

    await templateManager.removeAlias(name);

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Template alias &#39;${name}&#39; removed successfully`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Was: ${alias.description} (${alias.engine})`));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to remove template:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Update template configuration (reload/refresh)
 */
async function updateTemplates(options: TemplatesOptions): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔄 Updating template configuration...&#39;));

    // Reload configuration
    await templateManager.loadConfig();

    const aliases = templateManager.getAliases();
    const count = Object.keys(aliases).length;

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Template configuration updated&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Found ${count} template aliases`));

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log();
      console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Available templates:&#39;));
      Object.keys(aliases).forEach(name =&gt; {
        console.log(`  • ${name}`);
      });
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to update templates:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/github-template.ts
/**
 * GitHub Template management command
 *
 * Handles GitHub template scaffolding, generation, and management
 */

import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { FileBasedTemplateManager } from &#39;../utils/file-based-template-manager.js&#39;;

export interface GitHubTemplateOptions {
  /** List available templates */
  list?: boolean;
  /** Initialize templates from scratch */
  init?: boolean;
  /** Generate specific template type */
  generate?: string;
  /** Scaffold template files */
  scaffold?: boolean;
  /** Validate template configuration */
  validate?: boolean;
  /** Output directory for templates */
  outputDir?: string;
  /** Template discovery paths */
  discoveryPaths?: string[];
  /** Verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
  /** Force overwrite existing files */
  force?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Main GitHub template command handler
 */
export async function githubTemplateCommand(
  options: GitHubTemplateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    if (options.list) {
      return await listTemplates(options, config);
    }

    if (options.init || options.scaffold) {
      return await scaffoldTemplates(options, config);
    }

    if (options.validate) {
      return await validateTemplates(options, config);
    }

    if (options.generate) {
      return await generateTemplate(options.generate, options, config);
    }

    // Show help by default
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;Arbiter GitHub Template Management\n&#39;));
    console.log(&#39;Available commands:&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --list          List available GitHub templates&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --init          Initialize default template files&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --scaffold      Scaffold template directory structure&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --validate      Validate template configuration&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --generate TYPE Generate a specific template&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;\nTemplate types: epic, task, bug-report, feature-request&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;\nOptions:&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --output-dir DIR    Output directory for templates&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --force             Force overwrite existing files&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  --verbose           Verbose output&#39;);

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;GitHub template command failed:&#39;),
