      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * List available templates
 */
async function listTemplates(options: GitHubTemplateOptions, config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;📋 Available GitHub Templates\n&#39;));

    // Load template manager
    const templatesConfig = config.github?.templates || {};
    const templateManager = new FileBasedTemplateManager(templatesConfig, config.projectDir);

    // Discover templates in discovery paths
    const discovered = await templateManager.discoverTemplates();

    if (discovered.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No templates found. Use --init to create default templates.&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    // Group by directory
    const byDirectory: Record&lt;string, typeof discovered&gt; = {};
    discovered.forEach(template =&gt; {
      const dir = path.dirname(template.templatePath);
      if (!byDirectory[dir]) {
        byDirectory[dir] = [];
      }
      byDirectory[dir].push(template);
    });

    // Display templates by directory
    for (const [directory, templates] of Object.entries(byDirectory)) {
      console.log(chalk.cyan(`📁 ${path.relative(config.projectDir, directory)}/`));

      templates.forEach(template =&gt; {
        const filename = path.basename(template.templatePath);
        const metadata = template.metadata;

        console.log(`  • ${chalk.green(filename)}`);
        if (metadata?.name) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;Name:&#39;)} ${metadata.name}`);
        }
        if (metadata?.description) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;Description:&#39;)} ${metadata.description}`);
        }
        if (metadata?.inherits) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;Inherits:&#39;)} ${metadata.inherits}`);
        }
        console.log();
      });
    }

    // Show configured templates
    const configuredTemplates = Object.entries(templatesConfig)
      .filter(([key]) =&gt; [&#39;base&#39;, &#39;epic&#39;, &#39;task&#39;, &#39;bugReport&#39;, &#39;featureRequest&#39;].includes(key))
      .filter(([, value]) =&gt; value);

    if (configuredTemplates.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔧 Configured Templates\n&#39;));
      configuredTemplates.forEach(([type, templateRef]) =&gt; {
        console.log(`  • ${chalk.green(type)}`);
        if (&#39;file&#39; in templateRef) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;File:&#39;)} ${templateRef.file}`);
          if (templateRef.inherits) {
            console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;Inherits:&#39;)} ${templateRef.inherits}`);
          }
        } else if (&#39;templateFile&#39; in templateRef &amp;&amp; templateRef.templateFile) {
          console.log(`    ${chalk.dim(&#39;File:&#39;)} ${templateRef.templateFile}`);
        }
        console.log();
      });
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Failed to list templates:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Scaffold template files and directory structure
 */
async function scaffoldTemplates(
  options: GitHubTemplateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const outputDir =
      options.outputDir || path.join(config.projectDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates&#39;, &#39;github&#39;);

    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🏗️ Scaffolding GitHub templates...&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Output directory: ${outputDir}\n`));

    // Ensure output directory exists
    await fs.ensureDir(outputDir);

    // Copy templates from the existing created directory
    const existingTemplatesDir = path.join(config.projectDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates&#39;, &#39;github&#39;);

    const templates = [
      { name: &#39;base.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Base template for all GitHub issues&#39; },
      { name: &#39;epic.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Epic template with task overview&#39; },
      { name: &#39;task.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Task template with implementation details&#39; },
      { name: &#39;bug-report.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Bug report template with reproduction steps&#39; },
      { name: &#39;feature-request.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Feature request template with use cases&#39; },
    ];

    // Create template files
    for (const template of templates) {
      const sourcePath = path.join(existingTemplatesDir, template.name);
      const targetPath = path.join(outputDir, template.name);

      if ((await fs.pathExists(targetPath)) &amp;&amp; !options.force) {
        console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  Skipping ${template.name} (already exists)`));
        continue;
      }

      if (await fs.pathExists(sourcePath)) {
        await fs.copy(sourcePath, targetPath);
        console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Created ${template.name}`));
      } else {
        console.log(chalk.red(`❌ Source template ${template.name} not found`));
      }

      if (options.verbose) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(`   ${template.description}`));
      }
    }

    // Update or create config.json to reference templates
    await updateConfigForTemplates(config, outputDir);

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;\n🎉 Template scaffolding complete!&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Edit the template files to customize your GitHub issue templates.&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&quot;Use &#39;arbiter github-template --validate&#39; to check your templates.&quot;));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Failed to scaffold templates:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Validate template configuration and files
 */
async function validateTemplates(
  options: GitHubTemplateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔍 Validating template configuration...\n&#39;));

    const templatesConfig = config.github?.templates || {};
    const templateManager = new FileBasedTemplateManager(templatesConfig, config.projectDir);

    // Validate configuration
    const errors = await templateManager.validateTemplateConfig();

    if (errors.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ All template configurations are valid&#39;));
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.red(`❌ Found ${errors.length} validation error(s):\n`));
      errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
        console.log(chalk.red(`• ${error.field}: ${error.message}`));
      });
    }

    // Try to load each template to check for syntax errors
    const templateTypes = [&#39;epic&#39;, &#39;task&#39;, &#39;bugReport&#39;, &#39;featureRequest&#39;] as const;
    let syntaxErrors = 0;

    for (const templateType of templateTypes) {
      const templateRef = templatesConfig[templateType];
      if (!templateRef) continue;

      try {
        // Test template loading with sample data
        const sampleData = getSampleDataForTemplate(templateType);

        if (templateType === &#39;task&#39;) {
          await templateManager.generateTaskTemplate(sampleData.task, sampleData.epic);
        } else if (templateType === &#39;epic&#39;) {
          await templateManager.generateEpicTemplate(sampleData);
        } else if (templateType === &#39;bugReport&#39;) {
          await templateManager.generateBugReportTemplate(sampleData);
        } else if (templateType === &#39;featureRequest&#39;) {
          await templateManager.generateFeatureRequestTemplate(sampleData);
        }

        console.log(chalk.green(`✅ ${templateType} template syntax is valid`));
      } catch (error) {
        syntaxErrors++;
        console.log(chalk.red(`❌ ${templateType} template has syntax errors:`));
        console.log(chalk.red(`   ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`));
      }
    }

    const totalErrors = errors.length + syntaxErrors;

    if (totalErrors === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.green(&#39;\n🎉 All templates are valid and ready to use!&#39;));
      return 0;
    }
    console.log(chalk.red(`\n💥 Found ${totalErrors} error(s) in templates.`));
    return 1;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Failed to validate templates:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Generate a specific template for testing
 */
async function generateTemplate(
  templateType: string,
  options: GitHubTemplateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(`🎯 Generating ${templateType} template...\n`));

    const templatesConfig = config.github?.templates || {};
    const templateManager = new FileBasedTemplateManager(templatesConfig, config.projectDir);

    // Get sample data for the template type
    const sampleData = getSampleDataForTemplate(templateType);
    let result;

    switch (templateType.toLowerCase()) {
      case &#39;epic&#39;:
        result = await templateManager.generateEpicTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      case &#39;task&#39;:
        result = await templateManager.generateTaskTemplate(sampleData.task, sampleData.epic);
        break;
      case &#39;bug-report&#39;:
      case &#39;bug&#39;:
        result = await templateManager.generateBugReportTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      case &#39;feature-request&#39;:
      case &#39;feature&#39;:
        result = await templateManager.generateFeatureRequestTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`Unknown template type: ${templateType}`));
        console.log(&#39;Available types: epic, task, bug-report, feature-request&#39;);
        return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;Generated Template Output:\n&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`Title: ${result.title}\n`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Body:&#39;));
    console.log(result.body);

    if (result.labels.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`\nLabels: ${result.labels.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }

    if (result.assignees &amp;&amp; result.assignees.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Assignees: ${result.assignees.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`Failed to generate ${templateType} template:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Update config.json to reference template files
 */
async function updateConfigForTemplates(config: CLIConfig, templatesDir: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const configPath = path.join(config.projectDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;config.json&#39;);

  // Read existing config
  let existingConfig: any = {};
  if (await fs.pathExists(configPath)) {
    existingConfig = await fs.readJson(configPath);
  }

  // Ensure github.templates structure exists
  if (!existingConfig.github) {
    existingConfig.github = {};
  }
  if (!existingConfig.github.templates) {
    existingConfig.github.templates = {};
  }

  // Get relative path from project root
  const relativeTemplatesDir = path.relative(config.projectDir, templatesDir);

  // Update templates configuration
  existingConfig.github.templates = {
    ...existingConfig.github.templates,
    discoveryPaths: [relativeTemplatesDir, &#39;~/.arbiter/templates/github&#39;],
    defaultExtension: &#39;hbs&#39;,
    base: {
      file: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Arbiter Base Template&#39;,
        description: &#39;Base template for all Arbiter-managed GitHub issues&#39;,
      },
    },
    epic: {
      file: &#39;epic.hbs&#39;,
      inherits: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Epic&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for epic issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;epic&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    task: {
      file: &#39;task.hbs&#39;,
      inherits: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Task&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for task issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:{{type}}&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;, &#39;epic:{{epicId}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    bugReport: {
      file: &#39;bug-report.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Bug Report&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for bug report issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:bug&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    featureRequest: {
      file: &#39;feature-request.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Feature Request&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for feature request issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:feature&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
      },
    },
  };

  // Write updated config
  await fs.writeJson(configPath, existingConfig, { spaces: 2 });
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;📝 Updated .arbiter/config.json with template references&#39;));
}

/**
 * Get sample data for template testing
 */
function getSampleDataForTemplate(templateType: string): any {
  const baseData = {
    id: &#39;sample-001&#39;,
    name: &#39;Sample Item&#39;,
    description: &#39;This is a sample description for testing the template.&#39;,
    priority: &#39;high&#39;,
    status: &#39;in_progress&#39;,
    assignee: &#39;sample-user&#39;,
    estimatedHours: 8,
    acceptanceCriteria: [
      &#39;First acceptance criterion&#39;,
      &#39;Second acceptance criterion&#39;,
      &#39;Third acceptance criterion&#39;,
    ],
    dependencies: [&#39;Complete prerequisite task A&#39;, &#39;Review with stakeholders&#39;],
  };

  switch (templateType.toLowerCase()) {
    case &#39;epic&#39;:
      return {
        ...baseData,
        name: &#39;Sample Epic&#39;,
        successCriteria:
          &#39;Epic is complete when all tasks are done and users can successfully use the new feature&#39;,
        inScope: [&#39;Feature A development&#39;, &#39;Integration testing&#39;, &#39;User documentation&#39;],
        outOfScope: [&#39;Advanced analytics&#39;, &#39;Mobile app updates&#39;],
        tasks: [
          {
            id: &#39;task-001&#39;,
            name: &#39;Implement core functionality&#39;,
            type: &#39;feature&#39;,
            priority: &#39;high&#39;,
            status: &#39;todo&#39;,
            estimatedHours: 5,
          },
          {
            id: &#39;task-002&#39;,
            name: &#39;Add error handling&#39;,
            type: &#39;feature&#39;,
            priority: &#39;medium&#39;,
            status: &#39;todo&#39;,
            estimatedHours: 3,
          },
        ],
        stakeholders: [
          { role: &#39;Product Owner&#39;, username: &#39;product-owner&#39; },
          { role: &#39;Tech Lead&#39;, username: &#39;tech-lead&#39; },
        ],
      };

    case &#39;task&#39;:
      return {
        task: {
          ...baseData,
          name: &#39;Sample Task&#39;,
          type: &#39;feature&#39;,
          context: &#39;This task is needed to implement the new user authentication flow.&#39;,
          implementationNotes:
            &#39;Use the existing authentication library and extend it for SSO support.&#39;,
          testScenarios: [
            &#39;User logs in with SSO&#39;,
            &#39;User logs in with existing credentials&#39;,
            &#39;Invalid credentials are handled correctly&#39;,
          ],
          technicalNotes: &#39;Requires updating the user model and adding new API endpoints.&#39;,
          subtasks: [
            { name: &#39;Update user model&#39;, description: &#39;Add SSO fields to user schema&#39; },
            { name: &#39;Create SSO endpoints&#39;, description: &#39;Implement /auth/sso endpoints&#39; },
          ],
        },
        epic: {
          id: &#39;epic-001&#39;,
          name: &#39;User Authentication Epic&#39;,
        },
      };

    case &#39;bug-report&#39;:
    case &#39;bug&#39;:
      return {
        ...baseData,
        summary: &#39;Login button not responding on Safari&#39;,
        stepsToReproduce: [
          &#39;Open the application in Safari browser&#39;,
          &#39;Navigate to the login page&#39;,
          &quot;Click the &#39;Log In&#39; button&quot;,
          &#39;Observe that nothing happens&#39;,
        ],
        expectedBehavior: &#39;Login modal should appear when clicking the Log In button&#39;,
        actualBehavior: &#39;Clicking the button has no effect and no modal appears&#39;,
        environment: {
          os: &#39;macOS 12.6&#39;,
          browser: &#39;Safari 16.1&#39;,
          version: &#39;v2.1.0&#39;,
          additional: &#39;Issue only occurs on Safari, works fine on Chrome and Firefox&#39;,
        },
        impact: {
          affectedUsers: &#39;~15% of users using Safari browser&#39;,
          frequency: &#39;Every time user tries to log in via Safari&#39;,
          businessImpact: &#39;Users cannot access the application, leading to potential churn&#39;,
        },
        workaround: &#39;Users can use Chrome or Firefox browser as an alternative&#39;,
        severity: &#39;high&#39;,
        reportedBy: &#39;qa-tester&#39;,
      };

    case &#39;feature-request&#39;:
    case &#39;feature&#39;:
      return {
        ...baseData,
        summary: &#39;Add dark mode support&#39;,
        problemStatement:
          &#39;Many users work in low-light environments and find the current light theme straining on their eyes, especially during extended usage sessions.&#39;,
        proposedSolution:
          &#39;Implement a dark mode theme that users can toggle between light and dark modes. The preference should be saved and persist across sessions.&#39;,
        useCases: [
          {
            userType: &#39;developer&#39;,
            goal: &#39;work in low-light environments&#39;,
            benefit: &#39;I can reduce eye strain during long coding sessions&#39;,
          },
          {
            userType: &#39;designer&#39;,
            goal: &#39;review designs in different contexts&#39;,
            benefit: &#39;I can see how designs look in both light and dark themes&#39;,
          },
          {
            userType: &#39;power user&#39;,
            goal: &#39;customize my interface&#39;,
            benefit: &#39;I can personalize my workspace according to my preferences&#39;,
          },
        ],
        alternativesConsidered:
          &#39;We considered automatic dark mode based on system settings, but decided to give users explicit control over the theme choice.&#39;,
        impact: {
          potentialUsers: &#39;Survey indicates 60% of users would use dark mode&#39;,
          businessValue: &#39;Improved user satisfaction and reduced eye strain complaints&#39;,
          technicalComplexity: &#39;Medium - requires CSS theme system and preference storage&#39;,
          dependencies: &#39;None - can be implemented independently&#39;,
        },
        technicalRequirements: [
          &#39;CSS custom properties for theme switching&#39;,
          &#39;User preference storage in localStorage/database&#39;,
          &#39;Toggle component in user settings&#39;,
          &#39;Dark mode versions of all UI components&#39;,
        ],
        targetVersion: &#39;v2.2.0&#39;,
        effortEstimate: &#39;2-3 sprints&#39;,
        requestedBy: &#39;user-research-team&#39;,
      };

    default:
      return baseData;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/performance.ts
import { performance } from &#39;node:perf_hooks&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;

/**
 * Performance measurement utility for CLI operations
 */
export class PerformanceTracker {
  private measurements = new Map&lt;string, number&gt;();
  private marks = new Map&lt;string, number&gt;();

  /**
   * Start measuring an operation
   */
  mark(name: string): void {
    this.marks.set(name, performance.now());
  }

  /**
   * End measuring an operation and store the duration
   */
  measure(name: string, startMark?: string): number {
    const endTime = performance.now();
    const startTime = startMark ? this.marks.get(startMark) || 0 : this.marks.get(name) || 0;
    const duration = endTime - startTime;

    this.measurements.set(name, duration);
    return duration;
  }

  /**
   * Get measurement duration
   */
  getDuration(name: string): number | undefined {
    return this.measurements.get(name);
  }

  /**
   * Get all measurements
   */
  getAllMeasurements(): Record&lt;string, number&gt; {
    return Object.fromEntries(this.measurements);
  }

  /**
   * Manually record a measurement duration
   */
  record(name: string, duration: number): void {
    this.measurements.set(name, duration);
  }

  /**
   * Clear all measurements
   */
  clear(): void {
    this.measurements.clear();
    this.marks.clear();
  }

  /**
   * Print performance report
   */
  printReport(title = &#39;Performance Report&#39;): void {
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`\n${title}:`));

    const sorted = Array.from(this.measurements.entries()).sort(([, a], [, b]) =&gt; b - a);

    for (const [name, duration] of sorted) {
      const color = duration &lt; 100 ? &#39;green&#39; : duration &lt; 500 ? &#39;yellow&#39; : &#39;red&#39;;
      console.log(`  ${chalk[color](formatDuration(duration).padStart(8))} ${name}`);
    }

    const total = Array.from(this.measurements.values()).reduce((a, b) =&gt; a + b, 0);
    console.log(`  ${chalk.bold(formatDuration(total).padStart(8))} Total`);
  }
}

/**
 * Format duration with appropriate units
 */
export function formatDuration(ms: number): string {
  if (ms &lt; 1) {
    return `${(ms * 1000).toFixed(0)}μs`;
  }
  if (ms &lt; 1000) {
    return `${ms.toFixed(1)}ms`;
  }
  return `${(ms / 1000).toFixed(2)}s`;
}

/**
 * Measure async function execution time
 */
export async function measureAsync&lt;T&gt;(
  name: string,
  fn: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;,
  tracker?: PerformanceTracker
): Promise&lt;{ result: T; duration: number }&gt; {
  const start = performance.now();
  try {
    const result = await fn();
    const duration = performance.now() - start;

    if (tracker) {
      tracker.record(name, duration);
    }

    return { result, duration };
  } catch (error) {
    const duration = performance.now() - start;

    if (tracker) {
      tracker.record(`${name} (failed)`, duration);
    }

    throw error;
  }
}

/**
 * Measure sync function execution time
 */
export function measureSync&lt;T&gt;(
  name: string,
  fn: () =&gt; T,
  tracker?: PerformanceTracker
): { result: T; duration: number } {
  const start = performance.now();
  try {
    const result = fn();
    const duration = performance.now() - start;

    if (tracker) {
      tracker.record(name, duration);
    }

    return { result, duration };
  } catch (error) {
    const duration = performance.now() - start;

    if (tracker) {
      tracker.record(`${name} (failed)`, duration);
    }

    throw error;
  }
}

/**
 * Performance optimization configurations
 */
export const PERFORMANCE_TARGETS = {
  /** Target for check command on 10KB documents (P95) */
  CHECK_10KB_P95: 1000, // 1 second

  /** Target for API response time */
  API_RESPONSE: 200, // 200ms

  /** Target for file I/O operations */
  FILE_IO: 50, // 50ms

  /** Target for validation per file */
  VALIDATION_PER_FILE: 100, // 100ms

  /** Maximum concurrent validations */
  MAX_CONCURRENCY: 5,
};

/**
 * Check if performance targets are met
 */
export function checkPerformanceTargets(
  measurements: Record&lt;string, number&gt;,
  targets: Record&lt;string, number&gt; = PERFORMANCE_TARGETS
): {
  passed: boolean;
  violations: Array&lt;{ name: string; actual: number; target: number }&gt;;
} {
  const violations: Array&lt;{ name: string; actual: number; target: number }&gt; = [];

  for (const [name, target] of Object.entries(targets)) {
    const actual = measurements[name];
    if (actual !== undefined &amp;&amp; actual &gt; target) {
      violations.push({ name, actual, target });
    }
  }

  return {
    passed: violations.length === 0,
    violations,
  };
}

/**
 * Global performance tracker instance
 */
export const globalTracker = new PerformanceTracker();

/**
 * Decorator for measuring method performance
 */
export function measured(name?: string) {
  return (target: any, propertyName: string, descriptor: PropertyDescriptor) =&gt; {
    const method = descriptor.value;
    const measurementName = name || `${target.constructor.name}.${propertyName}`;

    descriptor.value = async function (...args: any[]) {
      const { result, duration } = await measureAsync(
        measurementName,
        () =&gt; method.apply(this, args),
        globalTracker
      );
      return result;
    };
  };
}

/**
 * Performance benchmark for CLI commands
 */
export class CLIBenchmark {
  private results: Array&lt;{
    command: string;
    args: string[];
    duration: number;
    exitCode: number;
  }&gt; = [];

  /**
   * Add benchmark result
   */
  addResult(command: string, args: string[], duration: number, exitCode: number): void {
    this.results.push({ command, args, duration, exitCode });
  }

  /**
   * Get statistics for a command
   */
  getStats(command: string): {
    count: number;
    avgDuration: number;
    minDuration: number;
    maxDuration: number;
    p95Duration: number;
    successRate: number;
  } | null {
    const commandResults = this.results.filter(r =&gt; r.command === command);

    if (commandResults.length === 0) {
      return null;
    }

    const durations = commandResults.map(r =&gt; r.duration).sort((a, b) =&gt; a - b);
    const successCount = commandResults.filter(r =&gt; r.exitCode === 0).length;

    return {
      count: commandResults.length,
      avgDuration: durations.reduce((a, b) =&gt; a + b) / durations.length,
      minDuration: durations[0],
      maxDuration: durations[durations.length - 1],
      p95Duration: durations[Math.floor(durations.length * 0.95)],
      successRate: successCount / commandResults.length,
    };
  }

  /**
   * Print benchmark report
   */
  printReport(): void {
    const commands = [...new Set(this.results.map(r =&gt; r.command))];

    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nCLI Performance Benchmark:&#39;));
    console.log(&#39;&#39;.padEnd(60, &#39;-&#39;));

    for (const command of commands) {
      const stats = this.getStats(command);
      if (!stats) continue;

      console.log(`${chalk.bold(command)}:`);
      console.log(`  Count:       ${stats.count}`);
      console.log(`  Success:     ${(stats.successRate * 100).toFixed(1)}%`);
      console.log(`  Avg:         ${formatDuration(stats.avgDuration)}`);
      console.log(`  Min:         ${formatDuration(stats.minDuration)}`);
      console.log(`  Max:         ${formatDuration(stats.maxDuration)}`);
      console.log(`  P95:         ${formatDuration(stats.p95Duration)}`);

      // Check against targets
      const target = PERFORMANCE_TARGETS.CHECK_10KB_P95;
      if (command === &#39;check&#39; &amp;&amp; stats.p95Duration &gt; target) {
        console.log(`  ${chalk.red(&#39;⚠ P95 exceeds target&#39;)} (${formatDuration(target)})`);
      } else if (command === &#39;check&#39;) {
        console.log(`  ${chalk.green(&#39;✓ P95 meets target&#39;)} (${formatDuration(target)})`);
      }

      console.log();
    }
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/types.ts
/**
 * Core domain types for Spec Workbench backend
 */

// Database entity types
export interface Project {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
}

export interface Fragment {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  path: string;
  content: string;
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
  head_revision_id?: string;
}

export interface FragmentRevision {
  id: string;
  fragment_id: string;
  revision_number: number;
  content: string;
  content_hash: string;
  author?: string;
  message?: string;
  created_at: string;
}

export interface Version {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  spec_hash: string;
  resolved_json: string;
  created_at: string;
}

export interface Event {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  event_type: EventType;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  created_at: string;
}

// Event types for real-time collaboration
export type EventType =
  | &#39;fragment_created&#39;
  | &#39;fragment_updated&#39;
  | &#39;fragment_deleted&#39;
  | &#39;fragment_revision_created&#39;
  | &#39;validation_started&#39;
  | &#39;validation_completed&#39;
  | &#39;validation_failed&#39;
  | &#39;version_frozen&#39;
  | &#39;webhook_received&#39;
  | &#39;git_push_processed&#39;
  | &#39;git_merge_processed&#39;;

// API request/response types
export interface CreateFragmentRequest {
  path: string;
  content: string;
}

export interface CreateFragmentResponse {
  id: string;
  path: string;
  created_at: string;
}

export interface ResolvedSpecResponse {
  spec_hash: string;
  resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  last_updated: string;
}

export interface ValidationRequest {
  force?: boolean;
}

export interface ValidationResponse {
  success: boolean;
  spec_hash: string;
  errors: ValidationError[];
  warnings: ValidationWarning[];
}

export interface ValidationError {
  type: &#39;schema&#39; | &#39;assertion&#39; | &#39;custom&#39;;
  message: string;
  location?: string;
  details?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface ValidationWarning {
  type: &#39;orphan_token&#39; | &#39;coverage&#39; | &#39;duplicate&#39;;
  message: string;
  location?: string;
}

// Gap analysis types
export interface GapSet {
  missing_capabilities: string[];
  orphaned_tokens: TokenReference[];
  coverage_gaps: CoverageGap[];
  duplicates: Duplicate[];
}

export interface TokenReference {
  token: string;
  defined_in: string[];
  referenced_in: string[];
}

export interface CoverageGap {
  capability: string;
  expected_coverage: number;
  actual_coverage: number;
  missing_scenarios: string[];
}

export interface Duplicate {
  type: &#39;capability&#39; | &#39;requirement&#39; | &#39;test_case&#39;;
  name: string;
  locations: string[];
}

// IR (Intermediate Representation) types for diagrams
export type IRKind =
  | &#39;flow&#39;
  | &#39;fsm&#39;
  | &#39;view&#39;
  | &#39;site&#39;
  | &#39;capabilities&#39;
  | &#39;flows&#39;
  | &#39;dependencies&#39;
  | &#39;coverage&#39;;

export interface IRResponse {
  kind: IRKind;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  generated_at: string;
}

// Version freezing
export interface FreezeRequest {
  version_name: string;
  description?: string;
}

export interface FreezeResponse {
  version_id: string;
  spec_hash: string;
  frozen_at: string;
}

// Authentication
export interface AuthContext {
  token: string;
  user_id?: string;
  project_access: string[];
  oauth_token?: any; // OAuth JWT token for scope checking
}

// External tool execution results
export interface ExternalToolResult {
  success: boolean;
  stdout: string;
  stderr: string;
  exit_code: number;
  duration_ms: number;
}

// Rate limiting
export interface RateLimitBucket {
  tokens: number;
  last_refill: number;
  max_tokens: number;
  refill_rate: number;
}

// WebSocket message types
export interface WebSocketMessage {
  type: &#39;event&#39; | &#39;error&#39; | &#39;ping&#39; | &#39;pong&#39;;
  project_id?: string;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

// NATS integration types
export interface NatsSpecEvent {
  topic: string;
  projectId: string;
  event: Omit&lt;Event, &#39;id&#39; | &#39;created_at&#39;&gt;;
  metadata: {
    timestamp: string;
    specHash?: string;
    sequence: number;
  };
}

export interface NatsConfig {
  url?: string;
  enabled: boolean;
  reconnectTimeWait: number;
  maxReconnectAttempts: number;
  topicPrefix: string;
}

// Error response structure (RFC 7807 Problem Details)
export interface ProblemDetails {
  type: string;
  title: string;
  status: number;
  detail?: string;
  instance?: string;
  [key: string]: unknown;
}

// Webhook types
export interface WebhookPayload {
  repository: {
    full_name: string;
    clone_url: string;
    default_branch?: string;
  };
  commits?: Array&lt;{
    id: string;
    message: string;
    author: {
      name: string;
      email: string;
    };
    modified?: string[];
    added?: string[];
    removed?: string[];
  }&gt;;
  ref?: string;
  before?: string;
  after?: string;
  action?: string;
  merge_request?: {
    id: number;
    state: string;
    target_branch: string;
    source_branch: string;
  };
  pull_request?: {
    id: number;
    state: string;
    base: { ref: string };
    head: { ref: string };
  };
}

export interface WebhookConfig {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;;
  repository_url: string;
  secret_hash?: string;
  enabled: boolean;
  events: WebhookEventType[];
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
}

export type WebhookEventType = &#39;push&#39; | &#39;merge_request&#39; | &#39;pull_request&#39; | &#39;tag&#39;;

export interface WebhookRequest {
  provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;;
  event: string;
  signature?: string;
  payload: WebhookPayload;
  timestamp: string;
}

export interface WebhookResponse {
  success: boolean;
  message: string;
  actions_taken?: string[];
  project_id?: string;
}

// Configuration
export interface ServerConfig {
  port: number;
  host: string;
  database_path: string;
  spec_workdir: string;
  cue_binary_path: string;
  jq_binary_path: string;
  auth_required: boolean;
  rate_limit: {
    max_tokens: number;
    refill_rate: number; // tokens per second
    window_ms: number;
  };
  external_tool_timeout_ms: number;
  websocket: {
    max_connections: number;
    ping_interval_ms: number;
  };
  nats?: NatsConfig;
  webhooks?: {
    enabled: boolean;
    secret?: string;
    github_secret?: string;
    gitlab_secret?: string;
    allowed_repos?: string[];
    sync_on_push: boolean;
    validate_on_merge: boolean;
  };
  handlers?: {
    enableAutoReload: boolean;
    maxConcurrentExecutions: number;
    defaultTimeout: number;
    defaultRetries: number;
    sandboxEnabled: boolean;
    allowedModules: string[];
    enableMetrics: boolean;
    notifications?: {
      email?: {
        mode?: &#39;disabled&#39; | &#39;log&#39; | &#39;smtp&#39;;
        from?: string;
        smtp?: {
          host?: string;
          port?: number;
          secure?: boolean;
          user?: string;
          pass?: string;
        };
      };
    };
  };
  oauth?: {
    enabled: boolean;
    mcpBaseUrl: string;
    authServerUrl: string;
    authServerPort: number;
    enableAuthServer: boolean;
    requiredScopes?: string[];
  };
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/github-templates.ts
import fs from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { getDefaultConfigPath, loadConfig, saveConfig } from &#39;../config.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, TemplateManagementOptions } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { FileBasedTemplateManager } from &#39;../utils/file-based-template-manager.js&#39;;
import {
  ConfigurableTemplateManager,
  DEFAULT_TEMPLATES_CONFIG,
} from &#39;../utils/github-template-config.js&#39;;

/**
 * GitHub Template management command - list, add, remove, and validate GitHub templates
 */
export async function githubTemplatesCommand(
  options: TemplateManagementOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    // Load current configuration
    const currentConfig = await loadConfig();
    const templateManager = new ConfigurableTemplateManager(currentConfig.github?.templates);
    const fileBasedTemplateManager = new FileBasedTemplateManager(
      currentConfig.github?.templates || {},
      config.projectDir
    );

    // List templates
    if (options.list) {
      return await listTemplates(templateManager, options.format || &#39;table&#39;);
    }

    // Show specific template
    if (options.show &amp;&amp; options.name) {
      return await showTemplate(templateManager, options.name, options.format || &#39;table&#39;);
    }

    // Validate template configuration
    if (options.validate) {
      return await validateTemplates(templateManager);
    }

    // Initialize/scaffold templates
    if (options.init || options.scaffold) {
      return await scaffoldTemplates(options, config, fileBasedTemplateManager);
    }

    // Generate template example
    if (options.generate) {
      return await generateTemplateExample(options.generate, fileBasedTemplateManager);
    }

    // Add template (interactive or from config)
    if (options.add) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  Adding custom templates via CLI is not yet implemented.&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;💡 To add custom templates, edit your .arbiter/config.json file:&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(`    ${getDefaultConfigPath()}`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;   Add templates under github.templates section&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;💡 Or use --init to scaffold file-based templates:&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;   arbiter github-templates --init&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    // Remove template
    if (options.remove &amp;&amp; options.name) {
      return await removeTemplate(options.name, currentConfig);
    }

    // Default: show available commands
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;📝 GitHub Template Management&#39;));
    console.log(&#39;&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;Available commands:&#39;);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --list                 &#39;)}List all available templates`);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --show &lt;name&gt;          &#39;)}Show details of a specific template`);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --validate             &#39;)}Validate template configuration`);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --add                  &#39;)}Add a new template (interactive)`);
    console.log(
      `${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --init                 &#39;)}Initialize/scaffold file-based templates`
    );
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --scaffold             &#39;)}Scaffold template directory structure`);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --generate &lt;type&gt;      &#39;)}Generate template example`);
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(&#39;  --remove &lt;name&gt;        &#39;)}Remove a template`);
    console.log(&#39;&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;Format options:&#39;);
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  --format table|json|yaml  Output format&#39;));
    console.log(&#39;&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;Examples:&#39;);
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  arbiter github-templates --list&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  arbiter github-templates --show epic&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  arbiter github-templates --validate&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  arbiter github-templates --list --format json&#39;));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;❌ GitHub Template management failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * List available templates
 */
async function listTemplates(
  templateManager: ConfigurableTemplateManager,
  format: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39;
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const templates = templateManager.getAvailableTemplates() as Array&lt;any&gt;;

  if (format === &#39;json&#39;) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(templates, null, 2));
    return 0;
  }

  if (format === &#39;yaml&#39;) {
    const YAML = await import(&#39;yaml&#39;);
    console.log(YAML.stringify(templates));
    return 0;
  }

  // Table format
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;📝 Available GitHub Templates&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;&#39;);

  if (templates.length === 0) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No templates configured&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Add templates to your .arbiter/config.json under github.templates&#39;));
    return 0;
  }

  const maxNameWidth = Math.max(...templates.map(t =&gt; t.name.length), 10);
  const maxTypeWidth = Math.max(...templates.map(t =&gt; t.type.length), 8);

  // Header
  const nameHeader = &#39;NAME&#39;.padEnd(maxNameWidth);
  const typeHeader = &#39;TYPE&#39;.padEnd(maxTypeWidth);
  console.log(chalk.bold(`${nameHeader} ${typeHeader} DESCRIPTION`));
  console.log(&#39;─&#39;.repeat(maxNameWidth + maxTypeWidth + 20));

  // Templates
  templates.forEach(template =&gt; {
    const name = template.name.padEnd(maxNameWidth);
    const type = template.type.padEnd(maxTypeWidth);
    const description = template.description || &#39;No description&#39;;
    console.log(`${chalk.cyan(name)} ${chalk.yellow(type)} ${chalk.dim(description)}`);
  });

  console.log(&#39;&#39;);
  console.log(chalk.dim(`Found ${templates.length} template(s)`));
  return 0;
}

/**
 * Show specific template details
 */
async function showTemplate(
  templateManager: ConfigurableTemplateManager,
  templateName: string,
  format: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39;
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const templates = templateManager.getAvailableTemplates();
  const template = templates.find(t =&gt; t.name === templateName || t.type === templateName);

  if (!template) {
    console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Template &quot;${templateName}&quot; not found`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Available templates:&#39;));
    templates.forEach(t =&gt; {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`  • ${t.name} (${t.type})`));
    });
    return 1;
  }

  if (format === &#39;json&#39;) {
    console.log(JSON.stringify(template, null, 2));
    return 0;
  }

  if (format === &#39;yaml&#39;) {
    const YAML = await import(&#39;yaml&#39;);
    console.log(YAML.stringify(template));
    return 0;
  }

  // Table format - show detailed template information
  console.log(chalk.blue(`📝 Template: ${template.name}`));
  console.log(&#39;&#39;);
  console.log(`${chalk.bold(&#39;Name:&#39;)}        ${template.name}`);
  console.log(`${chalk.bold(&#39;Type:&#39;)}        ${template.type}`);
  console.log(`${chalk.bold(&#39;Description:&#39;)} ${template.description || &#39;No description&#39;}`);
  console.log(&#39;&#39;);

  // Show template files that would be generated
  try {
    const allFiles = templateManager.generateRepositoryTemplates();
    const templateFile = Object.entries(allFiles).find(
      ([path]) =&gt; path.includes(template.type) || path.includes(template.name.toLowerCase())
    );

    if (templateFile) {
      console.log(chalk.bold(&#39;Template File:&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(templateFile[0]));
      console.log(&#39;&#39;);

      // Show first few lines of template
      const lines = templateFile[1].split(&#39;\n&#39;).slice(0, 10);
      lines.forEach(line =&gt; {
        console.log(chalk.dim(`  ${line}`));
      });

      if (templateFile[1].split(&#39;\n&#39;).length &gt; 10) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  ... (truncated)&#39;));
      }
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  Could not generate template preview&#39;));
  }

  return 0;
}

/**
 * Validate template configuration
 */
async function validateTemplates(templateManager: ConfigurableTemplateManager): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔍 Validating template configuration...&#39;));

  const errors = templateManager.validateTemplateConfig();

  if (errors.length === 0) {
    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Template configuration is valid&#39;));
    return 0;
  }

  console.log(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Template configuration has errors:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;&#39;);

  errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
    console.log(`  ${chalk.red(&#39;•&#39;)} ${chalk.bold(error.field)}: ${error.message}`);
  });

  console.log(&#39;&#39;);
  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;💡 Fix these errors in your .arbiter/config.json file&#39;));

  return 1;
}

/**
 * Remove a template from configuration
 */
async function removeTemplate(templateName: string, currentConfig: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const configPath = getDefaultConfigPath();

  // Check if template exists
  const availableTypes = [&#39;epic&#39;, &#39;task&#39;, &#39;bugReport&#39;, &#39;featureRequest&#39;] as const;
  const templateType = availableTypes.find(type =&gt; {
    const entry = currentConfig.github?.templates?.[type];
    if (!entry) {
      return type === templateName;
    }

    if (typeof entry === &#39;string&#39;) {
      return entry === templateName || type === templateName;
    }

    if (&#39;name&#39; in entry &amp;&amp; entry.name) {
      return entry.name === templateName;
    }

    return type === templateName;
  });

  if (!templateType) {
    console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Template &quot;${templateName}&quot; not found`));
    return 1;
  }

  try {
    // Create updated config without the template
    const templates = currentConfig.github?.templates
      ? { ...currentConfig.github.templates }
      : undefined;

    if (templates) {
      delete (templates as Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;)[templateType];
    }

    const updatedConfig: Partial&lt;CLIConfig&gt; = currentConfig.github
      ? {
          ...currentConfig,
          github: {
            ...currentConfig.github,
            templates: templates &amp;&amp; Object.keys(templates).length &gt; 0 ? templates : undefined,
          },
        }
      : { ...currentConfig };

    await saveConfig(updatedConfig, configPath);

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Removed template &quot;${templateName}&quot;`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Updated configuration: ${configPath}`));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;❌ Failed to remove template:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Generate templates for a project
 */
export async function generateProjectTemplates(
  outputDir = &#39;.github&#39;,
  config?: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const templateManager = new ConfigurableTemplateManager(config?.github?.templates);
  const templateFiles = templateManager.generateRepositoryTemplates();

  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;📝 Generating GitHub templates...&#39;));

  let generated = 0;
  for (const [filePath, content] of Object.entries(templateFiles)) {
    const fullPath = path.join(outputDir, filePath.replace(&#39;.github/&#39;, &#39;&#39;));

    // Ensure directory exists
    await fs.mkdir(path.dirname(fullPath), { recursive: true });

    // Write template file
    await fs.writeFile(fullPath, content);
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${filePath}`));
    generated++;
  }

  console.log(&#39;&#39;);
  console.log(chalk.green(`🎉 Generated ${generated} template file(s)`));
  console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Next steps:&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  1. Review and customize the generated templates&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  2. Commit the templates to your repository&#39;));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  3. Configure your .arbiter/config.json for custom templates&#39;));
}

/**
 * Scaffold file-based templates
 */
async function scaffoldTemplates(
  options: TemplateManagementOptions,
  config: CLIConfig,
  fileBasedTemplateManager: FileBasedTemplateManager
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const outputDir =
      options.outputDir || path.join(config.projectDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates&#39;, &#39;github&#39;);

    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🏗️ Scaffolding file-based GitHub templates...&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Output directory: ${outputDir}\n`));

    // Ensure output directory exists
    await fs.mkdir(outputDir, { recursive: true });

    // Get existing templates from the created directory
    const existingTemplatesDir = path.join(config.projectDir, &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates&#39;, &#39;github&#39;);

    const templates = [
      { name: &#39;base.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Base template for all GitHub issues&#39; },
      { name: &#39;epic.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Epic template with task overview&#39; },
      { name: &#39;task.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Task template with implementation details&#39; },
      { name: &#39;bug-report.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Bug report template with reproduction steps&#39; },
      { name: &#39;feature-request.hbs&#39;, description: &#39;Feature request template with use cases&#39; },
    ];

    let created = 0;

    // Create template files
    for (const template of templates) {
      const sourcePath = path.join(existingTemplatesDir, template.name);
      const targetPath = path.join(outputDir, template.name);

      if (
        (await fs
          .access(targetPath)
          .then(() =&gt; true)
          .catch(() =&gt; false)) &amp;&amp;
        !options.force
      ) {
        console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  Skipping ${template.name} (already exists)`));
        continue;
      }

      try {
        if (
          await fs
            .access(sourcePath)
            .then(() =&gt; true)
            .catch(() =&gt; false)
        ) {
          const content = await fs.readFile(sourcePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
          await fs.writeFile(targetPath, content);
          console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Created ${template.name}`));
          created++;
        } else {
          console.log(
            chalk.red(`❌ Source template ${template.name} not found in ${existingTemplatesDir}`)
          );
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.log(
          chalk.red(
            `❌ Failed to create ${template.name}: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
          )
        );
      }

      if (options.verbose) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(`   ${template.description}`));
      }
    }

    if (created &gt; 0) {
      // Update config.json to reference templates
      await updateConfigForTemplates(config, outputDir);

      console.log(chalk.green(`\n🎉 Scaffolded ${created} template file(s)!`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Edit the template files to customize your GitHub issue templates.&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&quot;Use &#39;arbiter github-templates --validate&#39; to check your templates.&quot;));
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n⚠️  No templates were created.&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Use --force to overwrite existing files.&#39;));
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Failed to scaffold templates:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Generate template example for testing
 */
async function generateTemplateExample(
  templateType: string,
  fileBasedTemplateManager: FileBasedTemplateManager
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(`🎯 Generating ${templateType} template example...\n`));

    // Get sample data for the template type
    const sampleData = getSampleDataForTemplate(templateType);
    let result;

    switch (templateType.toLowerCase()) {
      case &#39;epic&#39;:
        result = await fileBasedTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      case &#39;task&#39;:
        result = await fileBasedTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(
          sampleData.task,
          sampleData.epic
        );
        break;
      case &#39;bug-report&#39;:
      case &#39;bug&#39;:
        result = await fileBasedTemplateManager.generateBugReportTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      case &#39;feature-request&#39;:
      case &#39;feature&#39;:
        result = await fileBasedTemplateManager.generateFeatureRequestTemplate(sampleData);
        break;
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`Unknown template type: ${templateType}`));
        console.log(&#39;Available types: epic, task, bug-report, feature-request&#39;);
        return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;Generated Template Output:\n&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`Title: ${result.title}\n`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Body:&#39;));
    console.log(result.body);

    if (result.labels.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`\nLabels: ${result.labels.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }

    if (result.assignees &amp;&amp; result.assignees.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Assignees: ${result.assignees.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(`Failed to generate ${templateType} template:`),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Update config.json to reference template files
 */
async function updateConfigForTemplates(config: CLIConfig, templatesDir: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const configPath = getDefaultConfigPath();

  // Read existing config
  let existingConfig: any = {};
  try {
    const configContent = await fs.readFile(configPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    existingConfig = JSON.parse(configContent);
  } catch (error) {
    // Config doesn&#39;t exist or is invalid, start fresh
    existingConfig = {};
  }

  // Ensure github.templates structure exists
  if (!existingConfig.github) {
    existingConfig.github = {};
  }
  if (!existingConfig.github.templates) {
    existingConfig.github.templates = {};
  }

  // Get relative path from project root
  const relativeTemplatesDir = path.relative(config.projectDir, templatesDir);

  // Update templates configuration
  existingConfig.github.templates = {
    ...existingConfig.github.templates,
    discoveryPaths: [relativeTemplatesDir, &#39;~/.arbiter/templates/github&#39;],
    defaultExtension: &#39;hbs&#39;,
    base: {
      file: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Arbiter Base Template&#39;,
        description: &#39;Base template for all Arbiter-managed GitHub issues&#39;,
      },
    },
    epic: {
      file: &#39;epic.hbs&#39;,
      inherits: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Epic&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for epic issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;epic&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    task: {
      file: &#39;task.hbs&#39;,
      inherits: &#39;base.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Task&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for task issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:{{type}}&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;, &#39;status:{{status}}&#39;, &#39;epic:{{epicId}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    bugReport: {
      file: &#39;bug-report.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Bug Report&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for bug report issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:bug&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
      },
    },
    featureRequest: {
      file: &#39;feature-request.hbs&#39;,
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;Feature Request&#39;,
        description: &#39;Template for feature request issues&#39;,
        labels: [&#39;type:feature&#39;, &#39;priority:{{priority}}&#39;],
      },
    },
  };

  // Write updated config
  await fs.writeFile(configPath, JSON.stringify(existingConfig, null, 2));
  console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;📝 Updated .arbiter/config.json with template references&#39;));
}

/**
 * Get sample data for template testing
 */
function getSampleDataForTemplate(templateType: string): any {
  const baseData = {
    id: &#39;sample-001&#39;,
    name: &#39;Sample Item&#39;,
    description: &#39;This is a sample description for testing the template.&#39;,
    priority: &#39;high&#39;,
    status: &#39;in_progress&#39;,
    assignee: &#39;sample-user&#39;,
    estimatedHours: 8,
    acceptanceCriteria: [
      &#39;First acceptance criterion&#39;,
      &#39;Second acceptance criterion&#39;,
      &#39;Third acceptance criterion&#39;,
    ],
    dependencies: [&#39;Complete prerequisite task A&#39;, &#39;Review with stakeholders&#39;],
  };

  switch (templateType.toLowerCase()) {
    case &#39;epic&#39;:
      return {
        ...baseData,
        name: &#39;Sample Epic&#39;,
        successCriteria:
          &#39;Epic is complete when all tasks are done and users can successfully use the new feature&#39;,
        inScope: [&#39;Feature A development&#39;, &#39;Integration testing&#39;, &#39;User documentation&#39;],
        outOfScope: [&#39;Advanced analytics&#39;, &#39;Mobile app updates&#39;],
        tasks: [
          {
            id: &#39;task-001&#39;,
            name: &#39;Implement core functionality&#39;,
            type: &#39;feature&#39;,
            priority: &#39;high&#39;,
            status: &#39;todo&#39;,
            estimatedHours: 5,
          },
          {
            id: &#39;task-002&#39;,
            name: &#39;Add error handling&#39;,
            type: &#39;feature&#39;,
            priority: &#39;medium&#39;,
            status: &#39;todo&#39;,
            estimatedHours: 3,
          },
        ],
        stakeholders: [
          { role: &#39;Product Owner&#39;, username: &#39;product-owner&#39; },
          { role: &#39;Tech Lead&#39;, username: &#39;tech-lead&#39; },
        ],
      };

    case &#39;task&#39;:
      return {
        task: {
          ...baseData,
          name: &#39;Sample Task&#39;,
          type: &#39;feature&#39;,
          context: &#39;This task is needed to implement the new user authentication flow.&#39;,
          implementationNotes:
            &#39;Use the existing authentication library and extend it for SSO support.&#39;,
          testScenarios: [
            &#39;User logs in with SSO&#39;,
            &#39;User logs in with existing credentials&#39;,
            &#39;Invalid credentials are handled correctly&#39;,
          ],
          technicalNotes: &#39;Requires updating the user model and adding new API endpoints.&#39;,
          subtasks: [
            { name: &#39;Update user model&#39;, description: &#39;Add SSO fields to user schema&#39; },
            { name: &#39;Create SSO endpoints&#39;, description: &#39;Implement /auth/sso endpoints&#39; },
          ],
        },
        epic: {
          id: &#39;epic-001&#39;,
          name: &#39;User Authentication Epic&#39;,
        },
      };

    default:
      return baseData;
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/types.ts
/**
 * CLI configuration schema and types
 */

import type { SpinnerName } from &#39;cli-spinners&#39;;
import type { Spinner } from &#39;ora&#39;;

// Re-export issue types from shared package
export type {
  IssueSpec,
  ChecklistItem,
  IssueValidationConfig,
  IssueValidationResult,
} from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
export {
  DEFAULT_ISSUE_VALIDATION,
  validateIssue,
  createIssue,
  createChecklistItem,
} from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
export interface GitHubRepo {
  /** GitHub repository owner/organization (auto-detected from Git remote if not specified) */
  owner?: string;
  /** GitHub repository name (auto-detected from Git remote if not specified) */
  repo?: string;
  /** Base URL for GitHub API (defaults to github.com) */
  baseUrl?: string;
  /** Environment variable name for GitHub token (defaults to GITHUB_TOKEN) */
  tokenEnv?: string;
}

export interface GitHubSyncConfig {
  /** GitHub repository configuration */
  repository?: GitHubRepo;
  /** Mapping configuration for syncing */
  mapping?: {
    /** Epic to GitHub issue label mappings */
    epicLabels?: Record&lt;string, string[]&gt;;
    /** Task to GitHub issue label mappings */
    taskLabels?: Record&lt;string, string[]&gt;;
    /** Default labels to apply to all synced issues */
    defaultLabels?: string[];
    /** Prefix for epic issues */
    epicPrefix?: string;
    /** Prefix for task issues */
    taskPrefix?: string;
  };
  /** Sync behavior configuration */
  behavior?: {
    /** Create GitHub milestones for epics */
    createMilestones?: boolean;
    /** Close GitHub issues when tasks/epics are completed */
    autoClose?: boolean;
    /** Update GitHub issue descriptions with acceptance criteria */
    syncAcceptanceCriteria?: boolean;
    /** Sync assignees between systems */
    syncAssignees?: boolean;
  };
  /** GitHub templates configuration */
  templates?: GitHubTemplatesConfig;
}

export interface CLIConfig {
  /** API endpoint URL */
  apiUrl: string;
  /** Default timeout in milliseconds */
  timeout: number;
  /** Default output format */
  format: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39;;
  /** Enable colored output */
  color: boolean;
  /** Default project directory */
  projectDir: string;
  /** GitHub sync configuration */
  github?: GitHubSyncConfig;
}

/**
 * Command result interface for consistent error handling
 */
export interface CommandResult&lt;T = any&gt; {
  success: boolean;
  data?: T;
  error?: string;
  exitCode: number;
}

/**
 * Validation result for pretty table output
 */
export interface ValidationResult {
  file: string;
  status: &#39;valid&#39; | &#39;invalid&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
  errors: Array&lt;{
    line: number;
    column: number;
    message: string;
    severity: &#39;error&#39; | &#39;warning&#39;;
    category: string;
  }&gt;;
  warnings: Array&lt;{
    line: number;
    column: number;
    message: string;
    category: string;
  }&gt;;
  processingTime: number;
}

/**
 * Export format options
 */
export type ExportFormat =
  | &#39;openapi&#39;
  | &#39;types&#39;
  | &#39;k8s&#39;
  | &#39;terraform&#39;
  | &#39;json-schema&#39;
  | &#39;json&#39;
  | &#39;yaml&#39;;

/**
 * Progress indicator options
 */
export interface ProgressOptions {
  text: string;
  color?: &#39;blue&#39; | &#39;green&#39; | &#39;yellow&#39; | &#39;red&#39; | &#39;cyan&#39; | &#39;magenta&#39;;
  spinner?: Spinner | SpinnerName;
}

/**
 * Step-based progress options for multi-step operations
 */
export interface StepProgressOptions {
  title: string;
  steps: string[];
  color?: &#39;blue&#39; | &#39;green&#39; | &#39;yellow&#39; | &#39;red&#39; | &#39;cyan&#39; | &#39;magenta&#39;;
  spinner?: Spinner | SpinnerName;
}

/**
 * Progress bar options for operations with known progress
 */
export interface ProgressBarOptions {
  title: string;
  total?: number;
  completeMessage?: string;
}

/**
 * Project template types
 */
export interface ProjectTemplate {
  name: string;
  description: string;
  files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
  dependencies?: string[];
}

/**
 * Init command options
 */
export interface InitOptions {
  template?: string;
  name?: string;
  force?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Check command options
 */
export interface CheckOptions {
  recursive?: boolean;
  watch?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  verbose?: boolean;
  failFast?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Validate command options
 */
export interface ValidateOptions {
  schema?: string;
  config?: string;
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  strict?: boolean;
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Export command options
 */
export interface ExportOptions {
  format: ExportFormat[];
  output?: string;
  schema?: string;
  config?: string;
  minify?: boolean;
  strict?: boolean;
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Template command options
 */
export interface TemplateOptions {
  output?: string;
  format?: &#39;cue&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  list?: boolean;
  interactive?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Create command options
 */
export interface CreateOptions {
  interactive?: boolean;
  template?: string;
  output?: string;
  name?: string;
}

/**
 * Import command options
 */
export interface ImportOptions {
  global?: boolean;
  list?: boolean;
  remove?: boolean;
  validate?: boolean;
  allow?: string[];
}

/**
 * Diff command options
 */
export interface DiffOptions {
  migration?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;text&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  context?: number;
  summary?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Execute command options for Epic v2 deterministic execution
 */
export interface ExecuteOptions {
  epic: string;
  dryRun?: boolean;
  workspace?: string;
  timeout?: number;
  junit?: string;
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Test command options for unified test harness
 */
export interface TestOptions {
  epic?: string;
  types?: string[];
  junit?: string;
  timeout?: number;
  verbose?: boolean;
  parallel?: boolean;
  updateGolden?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Watch command options for file monitoring
 */
export interface WatchOptions {
  path?: string;
  agentMode?: boolean;
  debounce?: number;
  patterns?: string[];
  validate?: boolean;
  plan?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Surface command options for API extraction
 */
export interface SurfaceOptions {
  language: &#39;typescript&#39; | &#39;python&#39; | &#39;rust&#39; | &#39;go&#39; | &#39;bash&#39;;
  output?: string;
  diff?: boolean;
  includePrivate?: boolean;
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Tests command options for scaffolding and coverage
 */
export interface TestsOptions {
  language?: &#39;python&#39; | &#39;typescript&#39; | &#39;rust&#39; | &#39;go&#39; | &#39;bash&#39;;
  framework?: string;
  property?: boolean;
  output?: string;
  outputDir?: string;
  threshold?: number;
  junit?: string;
  force?: boolean;
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Version plan command options
 */
export interface VersionPlanOptions {
  /** Current surface file path */
  current?: string;
  /** Previous surface file path for comparison */
  previous?: string;
  /** Output file for version plan */
  output?: string;
  /** Enable strict mode for library compliance */
  strict?: boolean;
  /** Include all changes in analysis */
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Version release command options
 */
export interface VersionReleaseOptions {
  /** Version plan file to execute */
  plan?: string;
  /** Specific version to set (overrides plan) */
  version?: string;
  /** Changelog output file */
  changelog?: string;
  /** Enable dry-run mode (default) */
  dryRun?: boolean;
  /** Apply changes (disables dry-run) */
  apply?: boolean;
  /** Verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * IDE recommendation command options
 */
export interface IDEOptions {
  /** Editor type to generate config for */
  editor?: &#39;vscode&#39; | &#39;idea&#39; | &#39;vim&#39; | &#39;all&#39;;
  /** Force overwrite existing configuration */
  force?: boolean;
  /** Only detect project languages, don&#39;t generate config */
  detect?: boolean;
  /** Output directory for IDE configs */
  output?: string;
  /** Output directory for IDE configs (alias for output) */
  outputDir?: string;
}

/**
 * Sync command options for manifest synchronization
 */
export interface SyncOptions {
  /** Language manifests to sync */
  language?: &#39;python&#39; | &#39;typescript&#39; | &#39;rust&#39; | &#39;bash&#39; | &#39;all&#39;;
  /** Sync all detected languages */
  all?: boolean;
  /** Dry run - show what would be changed */
  dryRun?: boolean;
  /** Create backup before modifying files */
  backup?: boolean;
  /** Force overwrite conflicting sections */
  force?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Integrate command options for CI/CD generation
 */
export interface IntegrateOptions {
  /** CI provider to generate workflows for */
  provider?: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39; | &#39;azure&#39; | &#39;all&#39;;
  /** Workflow type to generate */
  type?: &#39;pr&#39; | &#39;main&#39; | &#39;release&#39; | &#39;all&#39;;
  /** Output directory for CI files */
  output?: string;
  /** Force overwrite existing workflows */
  force?: boolean;
  /** Use build matrix from assembly file */
  matrix?: boolean;
  /** Generate GitHub issue templates and configuration */
  templates?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Docs command options for documentation generation
 */
export interface DocsOptions {
  /** Output format */
  format?: &#39;markdown&#39; | &#39;html&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  /** Output file path */
  output?: string;
  /** Template to use */
  template?: string;
  /** Interactive mode */
  interactive?: boolean;
  /** Generate examples */
  examples?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Examples command options for project generation
 */
export interface ExamplesOptions {
  /** Example type */
  type?: &#39;profile&#39; | &#39;language&#39;;
  /** Specific profile to generate */
  profile?: string;
  /** Specific language to generate */
  language?: string;
  /** Output directory */
  output?: string;
  /** Generate minimal examples */
  minimal?: boolean;
  /** Generate complete examples */
  complete?: boolean;
}

/**
 * GitHub Templates Configuration
 */
export type GitHubTemplateSetSource =
  | GitHubTemplateSet
  | GitHubFileTemplateRef
  | {
      name?: string;
      description?: string;
      sections?: {
        description?: string;
        details?: Array&lt;Partial&lt;GitHubTemplateField&gt;&gt;;
        acceptanceCriteria?: string;
        dependencies?: string;
        additional?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
      };
      labels?: string[];
      validation?: GitHubTemplateValidation;
    };

export interface GitHubTemplatesConfig {
  /** Base templates that can be inherited from */
  base?: GitHubTemplateSetSource;
  /** Epic template configuration */
  epic?: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef;
  /** Task template configuration */
  task?: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef;
  /** Bug report template configuration */
  bugReport?: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef;
  /** Feature request template configuration */
  featureRequest?: GitHubTemplateConfig | GitHubFileTemplateRef;
  /** GitHub repository configuration files */
  repositoryConfig?: GitHubRepoConfig;
  /** Template discovery paths - directories to search for template files */
  discoveryPaths?: string[];
  /** Default template file extension */
  defaultExtension?: string;
}

/** Reference to a file-based template */
export interface GitHubFileTemplateRef {
  /** Path to template file (relative or absolute) */
  file: string;
  /** Optional metadata for the file template */
  metadata?: {
    name?: string;
    description?: string;
    labels?: string[];
    assignees?: string[];
  };
  /** Template to inherit from (file path or template name) */
  inherits?: string;
  /** Template generation options */
  options?: GitHubTemplateOptions;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateSet {
  /** Template name/identifier */
  name: string;
  /** Template description */
  description?: string;
  /** Template content sections */
  sections: GitHubTemplateSections;
  /** Default labels to apply */
  labels?: string[];
  /** Template validation rules */
  validation?: GitHubTemplateValidation;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateConfig {
  /** Inherit from base template (template name or file path) */
  inherits?: string;
  /** Template name/identifier */
  name?: string;
  /** Template title format */
  title?: string;
  /** Template description */
  description?: string;
  /** Custom template sections */
  sections?: Partial&lt;GitHubTemplateSections&gt;;
  /** Labels to apply */
  labels?: string[];
  /** Default assignees */
  assignees?: string[];
  /** Template validation rules */
  validation?: GitHubTemplateValidation;
  /** Template generation options */
  options?: GitHubTemplateOptions;
  /** Path to template file (if using file-based template) */
  templateFile?: string;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateSections {
  /** Description section content */
  description: string;
  /** Details table fields */
  details?: GitHubTemplateField[];
  /** Acceptance criteria section */
  acceptanceCriteria?: string;
  /** Dependencies section */
  dependencies?: string;
  /** Additional sections */
  additional?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateField {
  /** Field name */
  name: string;
  /** Field label for display */
  label: string;
  /** Whether field is required */
  required?: boolean;
  /** Field type */
  type?: &#39;text&#39; | &#39;number&#39; | &#39;date&#39; | &#39;select&#39; | &#39;boolean&#39;;
  /** Default value */
  default?: string;
  /** Validation pattern */
  pattern?: string;
  /** Help text */
  help?: string;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateValidation {
  /** Field validation rules */
  fields?: GitHubFieldValidation[];
  /** Custom validation functions */
  custom?: string[];
}

export interface GitHubFieldValidation {
  /** Field name to validate */
  field: string;
  /** Whether field is required */
  required?: boolean;
  /** Minimum length */
  minLength?: number;
  /** Maximum length */
  maxLength?: number;
  /** Regex pattern */
  pattern?: string;
  /** Allowed values */
  enum?: string[];
  /** Custom validation function name */
  validator?: string;
  /** Error message */
  errorMessage?: string;
}

export interface GitHubRepoConfig {
  /** Issue template chooser configuration */
  issueConfig?: {
    /** Allow blank issues */
    blankIssuesEnabled?: boolean;
    /** Contact links */
    contactLinks?: Array&lt;{
      name: string;
      url: string;
      about: string;
    }&gt;;
  };
  /** Labels configuration */
  labels?: GitHubLabel[];
  /** Pull request template */
  pullRequestTemplate?: string;
}

export interface GitHubLabel {
  /** Label name */
  name: string;
  /** Label color (hex without #) */
  color: string;
  /** Label description */
  description?: string;
}

export interface GitHubTemplateOptions {
  /** Include metadata in templates */
  includeMetadata?: boolean;
  /** Include Arbiter IDs for tracking */
  includeArbiterIds?: boolean;
  /** Include acceptance criteria */
  includeAcceptanceCriteria?: boolean;
  /** Include dependencies */
  includeDependencies?: boolean;
  /** Include time estimations */
  includeEstimations?: boolean;
  /** Custom field values */
  customFields?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
}

/**
 * Template management command options
 */
export interface TemplateManagementOptions {
  /** Template type */
  type?: &#39;epic&#39; | &#39;task&#39; | &#39;bug&#39; | &#39;feature&#39;;
  /** Template name */
  name?: string;
  /** List available templates */
  list?: boolean;
  /** Add new template */
  add?: boolean;
  /** Remove template */
  remove?: boolean;
  /** Validate template configuration */
  validate?: boolean;
  /** Show template details */
  show?: boolean;
  /** Output format */
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39;;
  /** Initialize/scaffold template files */
  init?: boolean;
  /** Scaffold template files */
  scaffold?: boolean;
  /** Generate template example */
  generate?: string;
  /** Output directory for templates */
  outputDir?: string;
  /** Force overwrite existing files */
  force?: boolean;
  /** Verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Explain command options for assembly explanation
 */
export interface ExplainOptions {
  /** Output format */
  format?: &#39;text&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  /** Output file path */
  output?: string;
  /** Verbose explanation */
  verbose?: boolean;
  /** Show helpful hints */
  hints?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Generate command options for code generation
 */
export interface GenerateOptions {
  /** Output directory */
  output?: string;
  /** Output directory (alternative) */
  outputDir?: string;
  /** Include CI/CD files */
  includeCi?: boolean;
  /** Force overwrite existing files */
  force?: boolean;
  /** Dry run - show what would be generated */
  dryRun?: boolean;
  /** Verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
  /** Output format */
  format?: &#39;auto&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39; | &#39;typescript&#39; | &#39;python&#39; | &#39;rust&#39; | &#39;go&#39; | &#39;shell&#39;;
  /** Sync with GitHub */
  syncGithub?: boolean;
  /** Use configuration file */
  useConfig?: boolean;
  /** Use Git remote for repository detection */
  useGitRemote?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Preview command options for deterministic planning
 */
export interface PreviewOptions {
  /** Output format */
  format?: &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39; | &#39;text&#39;;
  /** Output file path */
  output?: string;
  /** Output directory for plan file */
  outputDir?: string;
  /** Verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
  /** Include file content in preview */
  includeContent?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Rename command options for file naming migration
 */
export interface RenameOptions {
  /** Show what would be renamed without doing it */
  dryRun?: boolean;
  /** Apply the renaming changes */
  apply?: boolean;
  /** Force overwrite existing files */
  force?: boolean;
  /** Show verbose output */
  verbose?: boolean;
  /** Specific file types to rename */
  types?: string[];
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/.storybook/preview.ts
import type { Preview } from &quot;@storybook/react&quot;;
import &quot;../src/index.css&quot;;

// Import design tokens for consistent theming
import { colors } from &quot;../src/design-system/tokens&quot;;

// Import decorators
import { DesignSystemDecorator } from &quot;./decorators&quot;;

const preview: Preview = {
  parameters: {
    // Enhanced action detection
    actions: {
      argTypesRegex: &quot;^on[A-Z].*&quot;,
      handles: [&quot;mouseover&quot;, &quot;click .btn&quot;],
    },

    // Improved controls configuration
    controls: {
      expanded: true,
      sort: &quot;requiredFirst&quot;,
      matchers: {
        color: /(background|color)$/i,
        date: /Date$/i,
      },
    },

    // Enhanced documentation
    docs: {
      toc: {
        contentsSelector: &quot;.sbdocs-content&quot;,
        headingSelector: &quot;h1, h2, h3&quot;,
        ignoreSelector: &quot;#primary&quot;,
        title: &quot;Table of Contents&quot;,
        disable: false,
        unsafeTocbotOptions: {
          orderedList: false,
        },
      },
      source: {
        state: &quot;open&quot;,
        excludeDecorators: true,
      },
    },

    // Comprehensive background options using design tokens
    backgrounds: {
      default: &quot;light&quot;,
      grid: {
        cellSize: 20,
        opacity: 0.1,
        cellAmount: 5,
      },
      values: [
        { name: &quot;Pure White&quot;, value: &quot;#ffffff&quot; },
        { name: &quot;Graphite 25&quot;, value: colors.graphite[25] },
        { name: &quot;Graphite 50&quot;, value: colors.graphite[50] },
        { name: &quot;Graphite 100&quot;, value: colors.graphite[100] },

        { name: &quot;Graphite 800&quot;, value: colors.graphite[800] },
        { name: &quot;Graphite 900&quot;, value: colors.graphite[900] },

      ],

          name: &quot;Tablet Landscape&quot;,

        ],

      options: {
        checks: { &quot;color-contrast&quot;: { options: { noScroll: true } } },
        restoreScroll: true,
      },
      // Run accessibility tests automatically
      manual: false,

    // Layout configuration
    layout: &quot;centered&quot;,

    // Custom toolbars for design system testing
    toolbars: {
      designSystem: {
        title: &quot;Design System&quot;,

    // Performance monitoring

      // Configure interaction tests

      // Performance budgets for stories

        allowedMetrics: [&quot;fcp&quot;, &quot;lcp&quot;, &quot;cls&quot;],
        budgets: {
          fcp: 1000,

        },

  // Global decorators

  // Global types for custom toolbars

    designSystem: {
      name: &quot;Design System&quot;,
      description: &quot;Design system theme variant&quot;,
      defaultValue: &quot;default&quot;,

        items: [&quot;default&quot;, &quot;compact&quot;, &quot;comfortable&quot;, &quot;high-contrast&quot;],

      name: &quot;Color Scheme&quot;,
      description: &quot;Color scheme preference&quot;,
      defaultValue: &quot;light&quot;,
      toolbar: {
        icon: &quot;mirror&quot;,
        items: [&quot;light&quot;, &quot;dark&quot;, &quot;auto&quot;],
      },
    },
  },
};

export default preview;
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/epic.ts
/**
 * Epic command - Epic and task management with ordered execution
 *
 * Manages epics and their ordered tasks using sharded CUE storage
 */

import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { formatJson } from &#39;../utils/formatting.js&#39;;
import { withProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;
