import { type Epic, ShardedCUEStorage, type Task } from &#39;../utils/sharded-storage.js&#39;;

// Simple table formatting function
function formatTable(headers: string[], rows: string[][]): string {
  const table = [headers, ...rows];
  const colWidths = headers.map((_, colIndex) =&gt;
    Math.max(...table.map(row =&gt; (row[colIndex] || &#39;&#39;).length))
  );

  const formatRow = (row: string[], isHeader = false) =&gt; {
    const formattedCells = row.map((cell, idx) =&gt; (cell || &#39;&#39;).padEnd(colWidths[idx])).join(&#39; | &#39;);
    return isHeader ? chalk.cyan(formattedCells) : formattedCells;
  };

  const lines = [
    formatRow(headers, true),
    colWidths.map(w =&gt; &#39;-&#39;.repeat(w)).join(&#39;-|-&#39;),
    ...rows.map(row =&gt; formatRow(row)),
  ];

  return lines.join(&#39;\n&#39;);
}

export interface EpicOptions {
  verbose?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  status?: string;
  assignee?: string;
  priority?: string;
  shard?: string;
}

export interface EpicCreateOptions extends EpicOptions {
  name: string;
  description?: string;
  priority?: &#39;critical&#39; | &#39;high&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;low&#39;;
  owner?: string;
  assignee?: string;
  startDate?: string;
  dueDate?: string;
  labels?: string;
  tags?: string;
  allowParallelTasks?: boolean;
  autoProgress?: boolean;
  requireAllTasks?: boolean;
}

export interface TaskOptions {
  verbose?: boolean;
  format?: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39;;
  status?: string;
  type?: string;
  assignee?: string;
  priority?: string;
}

export interface TaskCreateOptions extends TaskOptions {
  epic: string;
  name?: string;
  description?: string;
  type?: &#39;feature&#39; | &#39;bug&#39; | &#39;refactor&#39; | &#39;test&#39; | &#39;docs&#39; | &#39;devops&#39; | &#39;research&#39;;
  priority?: &#39;critical&#39; | &#39;high&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;low&#39;;
  assignee?: string;
  reviewer?: string;
  dependsOn?: string;
  acceptanceCriteria?: string;
  canRunInParallel?: boolean;
  requiresReview?: boolean;
  requiresTesting?: boolean;
  blocksOtherTasks?: boolean;
  // Batch creation support
  json?: string;
  file?: string;
}

/**
 * Main epic command dispatcher
 */
export async function epicCommand(
  action: string,
  epicId: string | undefined,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const storage = new ShardedCUEStorage();

  try {
    await storage.initialize();

    switch (action) {
      case &#39;list&#39;:
        return await listEpics(storage, options, config);
      case &#39;show&#39;:
        if (!epicId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic ID is required for show command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await showEpic(storage, epicId, options, config);
      case &#39;create&#39;:
        return await createEpic(storage, options as EpicCreateOptions, config);
      case &#39;update&#39;:
        if (!epicId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic ID is required for update command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await updateEpic(storage, epicId, options, config);
      case &#39;delete&#39;:
        if (!epicId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic ID is required for delete command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await deleteEpic(storage, epicId, options, config);
      case &#39;stats&#39;:
        return await showStats(storage, options, config);
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`Unknown action: ${action}`));
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Available actions: list, show, create, update, delete, stats&#39;));
        return 1;
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic command failed:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  } finally {
    await storage.close();
  }
}

/**
 * Task command dispatcher
 */
export async function taskCommand(
  action: string,
  taskId: string | undefined,
  options: TaskOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const storage = new ShardedCUEStorage();

  try {
    await storage.initialize();

    switch (action) {
      case &#39;list&#39;:
        return await listTasks(storage, options, config);
      case &#39;show&#39;:
        if (!taskId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Task ID is required for show command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await showTask(storage, taskId, options, config);
      case &#39;create&#39;:
        return await createTask(storage, options as TaskCreateOptions, config);
      case &#39;batch&#39;:
        return await batchCreateTasks(storage, options as TaskCreateOptions, config);
      case &#39;update&#39;:
        if (!taskId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Task ID is required for update command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await updateTask(storage, taskId, options, config);
      case &#39;complete&#39;:
        if (!taskId) {
          console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Task ID is required for complete command&#39;));
          return 1;
        }
        return await completeTask(storage, taskId, options, config);
      case &#39;deps&#39;:
      case &#39;dependencies&#39;:
        return await showDependencies(storage, options, config);
      case &#39;ready&#39;:
        return await showReadyTasks(storage, options, config);
      case &#39;blocked&#39;:
        return await showBlockedTasks(storage, options, config);
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`Unknown action: ${action}`));
        console.log(
          chalk.dim(
            &#39;Available actions: list, show, create, batch, update, complete, deps, ready, blocked&#39;
          )
        );
        return 1;
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Task command failed:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  } finally {
    await storage.close();
  }
}

/**
 * List all epics
 */
async function listEpics(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Loading epics...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    const epics = await storage.listEpics(options.status);

    if (epics.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No epics found&#39;));
      if (options.status) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(`Filtered by status: ${options.status}`));
      }
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(epics));
      return 0;
    }

    // Table format
    const headers = [&#39;ID&#39;, &#39;Name&#39;, &#39;Status&#39;, &#39;Priority&#39;, &#39;Tasks&#39;, &#39;Progress&#39;, &#39;Assignee&#39;];
    const rows = epics.map(epic =&gt; {
      const completedTasks = epic.tasks?.filter(t =&gt; t.status === &#39;completed&#39;).length || 0;
      const totalTasks = epic.tasks?.length || 0;
      const progress = totalTasks &gt; 0 ? `${completedTasks}/${totalTasks}` : &#39;0/0&#39;;

      return [
        epic.id,
        epic.name,
        epic.status,
        epic.priority,
        totalTasks.toString(),
        progress,
        epic.assignee || &#39;-&#39;,
      ];
    });

    console.log(formatTable(headers, rows));

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`\nShowing ${epics.length} epic(s)`));
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Show detailed epic information
 */
async function showEpic(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  epicId: string,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: `Loading epic ${epicId}...` }, async () =&gt; {
    const epic = await storage.getEpic(epicId);

    if (!epic) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${epicId}&#39; not found`));
      return 1;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(epic));
      return 0;
    }

    // Detailed display
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`Epic: ${epic.name}`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`ID: ${epic.id}`));

    if (epic.description) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Description: ${epic.description}`));
    }

    console.log(`Status: ${getStatusColor(epic.status)}`);
    console.log(`Priority: ${getPriorityColor(epic.priority)}`);

    if (epic.assignee) {
      console.log(`Assignee: ${epic.assignee}`);
    }

    if (epic.startDate || epic.dueDate) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Dates:&#39;));
      if (epic.startDate) console.log(chalk.dim(`  Start: ${epic.startDate}`));
      if (epic.dueDate) console.log(chalk.dim(`  Due: ${epic.dueDate}`));
      if (epic.completedDate) console.log(chalk.dim(`  Completed: ${epic.completedDate}`));
    }

    if (epic.dependencies &amp;&amp; epic.dependencies.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Dependencies: ${epic.dependencies.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }

    // Show dependency-ordered tasks
    if (epic.tasks &amp;&amp; epic.tasks.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nTasks (dependency order):&#39;));

      const headers = [&#39;ID&#39;, &#39;Name&#39;, &#39;Type&#39;, &#39;Status&#39;, &#39;Dependencies&#39;, &#39;Assignee&#39;];
      const rows = epic.tasks.map(task =&gt; [
        task.id,
        task.name,
        task.type,
        task.status,
        task.dependsOn?.join(&#39;, &#39;) || &#39;-&#39;,
        task.assignee || &#39;-&#39;,
      ]);

      console.log(formatTable(headers, rows));

      // Show ready/blocked task summary
      if (options.verbose) {
        const storage = new ShardedCUEStorage();
        const readyTasks = storage.getReadyTasks(epic.tasks);
        const blockedTasks = storage.getBlockedTasks(epic.tasks);

        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;\nTask Status:&#39;));
        console.log(chalk.dim(`  Ready to start: ${readyTasks.length}`));
        console.log(chalk.dim(`  Blocked by dependencies: ${blockedTasks.length}`));
        console.log(chalk.dim(`  Total tasks: ${epic.tasks.length}`));
      }
    }

    if (options.verbose &amp;&amp; epic.arbiter) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`\nShard: ${epic.arbiter.shard || &#39;unknown&#39;}`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Package: ${epic.arbiter.cuePackage || &#39;unknown&#39;}`));
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Create a new epic
 */
async function createEpic(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: EpicCreateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!options.name) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic name is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  return await withProgress({ text: `Creating epic ${options.name}...` }, async () =&gt; {
    const epicId = generateSlug(options.name);

    // Check if epic already exists
    const existing = await storage.getEpic(epicId);
    if (existing) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${epicId}&#39; already exists`));
      return 1;
    }

    const epic: Epic = {
      id: epicId,
      name: options.name,
      description: options.description,
      priority: options.priority || &#39;medium&#39;,
      status: &#39;planning&#39;,
      owner: options.owner,
      assignee: options.assignee,
      startDate: options.startDate,
      dueDate: options.dueDate,
      tasks: [], // Start with no tasks
      labels: options.labels ? options.labels.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(s =&gt; s.trim()) : undefined,
      tags: options.tags ? options.tags.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(s =&gt; s.trim()) : undefined,
      config: {
        allowParallelTasks: options.allowParallelTasks,
        autoProgress: options.autoProgress,
        requireAllTasks: options.requireAllTasks,
      },
    };

    const shardId = await storage.addEpic(epic);

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Created epic &#39;${epic.name}&#39; (${epicId}) in shard ${shardId}`));

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Next: Add tasks with &#39;arbiter task create --epic ${epicId}&#39;`));
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Update an existing epic
 */
async function updateEpic(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  epicId: string,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: `Updating epic ${epicId}...` }, async () =&gt; {
    const epic = await storage.getEpic(epicId);

    if (!epic) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${epicId}&#39; not found`));
      return 1;
    }

    // Update fields based on options
    let updated = false;

    if (
      options.status &amp;&amp;
      [&#39;planning&#39;, &#39;in_progress&#39;, &#39;completed&#39;, &#39;cancelled&#39;].includes(options.status)
    ) {
      epic.status = options.status as Epic[&#39;status&#39;];
      updated = true;
    }

    if (options.priority &amp;&amp; [&#39;critical&#39;, &#39;high&#39;, &#39;medium&#39;, &#39;low&#39;].includes(options.priority)) {
      epic.priority = options.priority as Epic[&#39;priority&#39;];
      updated = true;
    }

    if (options.assignee !== undefined) {
      epic.assignee = options.assignee || undefined;
      updated = true;
    }

    if (!updated) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No updates specified&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    await storage.updateEpic(epic);

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Updated epic &#39;${epic.name}&#39;`));
    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Delete an epic
 */
async function deleteEpic(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  epicId: string,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  // For now, we&#39;ll just mark as cancelled rather than actually deleting
  return await updateEpic(storage, epicId, { ...options, status: &#39;cancelled&#39; }, config);
}

/**
 * Show storage statistics
 */
async function showStats(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: EpicOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Calculating statistics...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    const stats = await storage.getStats();

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(stats));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Sharded Storage Statistics:&#39;));
    console.log(`Total Shards: ${stats.totalShards}`);
    console.log(`Total Epics: ${stats.totalEpics}`);
    console.log(`Total Tasks: ${stats.totalTasks}`);
    console.log(`Average Epics per Shard: ${stats.avgEpicsPerShard.toFixed(1)}`);
    console.log(`Shard Utilization: ${stats.shardUtilization.toFixed(1)}%`);

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * List tasks (across epics or filtered)
 */
async function listTasks(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Loading tasks...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    const tasks = await storage.getOrderedTasks();

    // Apply filters
    let filteredTasks = tasks;

    if (options.status) {
      filteredTasks = filteredTasks.filter(t =&gt; t.status === options.status);
    }

    if (options.type) {
      filteredTasks = filteredTasks.filter(t =&gt; t.type === options.type);
    }

    if (options.assignee) {
      filteredTasks = filteredTasks.filter(t =&gt; t.assignee === options.assignee);
    }

    if (options.priority) {
      filteredTasks = filteredTasks.filter(t =&gt; t.priority === options.priority);
    }

    if (filteredTasks.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No tasks found&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(filteredTasks));
      return 0;
    }

    // Table format
    const headers = [&#39;ID&#39;, &#39;Name&#39;, &#39;Type&#39;, &#39;Status&#39;, &#39;Priority&#39;, &#39;Dependencies&#39;, &#39;Assignee&#39;];
    const rows = filteredTasks.map(task =&gt; [
      task.id,
      task.name,
      task.type,
      task.status,
      task.priority,
      task.dependsOn?.join(&#39;, &#39;) || &#39;-&#39;,
      task.assignee || &#39;-&#39;,
    ]);

    console.log(formatTable(headers, rows));

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`\nShowing ${filteredTasks.length} task(s)`));
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Show task details
 */
async function showTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  taskId: string,
  options: TaskOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  // Find task across all epics
  const epics = await storage.listEpics();
  let targetEpic: Epic | null = null;
  let targetTask: Task | null = null;

  for (const epic of epics) {
    const task = epic.tasks?.find(t =&gt; t.id === taskId);
    if (task) {
      targetEpic = epic;
      targetTask = task;
      break;
    }
  }

  if (!targetTask || !targetEpic) {
    console.error(chalk.red(`Task &#39;${taskId}&#39; not found`));
    return 1;
  }

  if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
    console.log(formatJson({ epic: targetEpic.id, task: targetTask }));
    return 0;
  }

  console.log(chalk.cyan(`Task: ${targetTask.name}`));
  console.log(chalk.dim(`ID: ${targetTask.id}`));
  console.log(chalk.dim(`Epic: ${targetEpic.name} (${targetEpic.id})`));

  if (targetTask.description) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Description: ${targetTask.description}`));
  }

  console.log(`Status: ${getStatusColor(targetTask.status)}`);
  console.log(`Type: ${targetTask.type}`);
  console.log(`Priority: ${getPriorityColor(targetTask.priority)}`);

  if (targetTask.assignee) {
    console.log(`Assignee: ${targetTask.assignee}`);
  }

  if (targetTask.dependsOn &amp;&amp; targetTask.dependsOn.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Depends on: ${targetTask.dependsOn.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
  }

  if (targetTask.acceptanceCriteria &amp;&amp; targetTask.acceptanceCriteria.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Acceptance Criteria:&#39;));
    targetTask.acceptanceCriteria.forEach((criteria, index) =&gt; {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`  ${index + 1}. ${criteria}`));
    });
  }

  return 0;
}

/**
 * Create a new task in an epic
 */
async function createTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskCreateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!options.epic) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic ID is required (use --epic &lt;epic-id&gt;)&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  if (!options.name) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Task name is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  try {
    await createSingleTask(storage, options.epic, options, config);
    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Batch create tasks from JSON input
 */
async function batchCreateTasks(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskCreateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!options.epic) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Epic ID is required (use --epic &lt;epic-id&gt;)&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  let tasksData: any[];

  try {
    // Get JSON data from file or command line
    if (options.file) {
      const fileContent = await fs.readFile(options.file, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      tasksData = JSON.parse(fileContent);
    } else if (options.json) {
      tasksData = JSON.parse(options.json);
    } else {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Either --json or --file is required for batch creation&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Examples:&#39;));
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(
          &#39;  arbiter task batch --epic my-epic --json \&#39;[{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Task 1&quot;,&quot;order&quot;:0},{&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Task 2&quot;,&quot;order&quot;:1}]\&#39;&#39;
        )
      );
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  arbiter task batch --epic my-epic --file tasks.json&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    if (!Array.isArray(tasksData)) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;JSON input must be an array of task objects&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    if (tasksData.length === 0) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;No tasks provided in JSON input&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    // Validate epic exists
    const epic = await storage.getEpic(options.epic);
    if (!epic) {
      console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${options.epic}&#39; not found`));
      return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.blue(`Creating ${tasksData.length} tasks in epic &#39;${options.epic}&#39;...`));

    let successCount = 0;
    let errorCount = 0;
    const errors: string[] = [];

    // Process each task
    for (let i = 0; i &lt; tasksData.length; i++) {
      const taskData = tasksData[i];

      try {
        // Validate required fields
        if (!taskData.name) {
          errors.push(`Task ${i + 1}: Missing required field &#39;name&#39;`);
          errorCount++;
          continue;
        }

        // Create task options from JSON data
        const taskOptions: TaskCreateOptions = {
          ...options,
          name: taskData.name,
          description: taskData.description,
          type: taskData.type || &#39;feature&#39;,
          priority: taskData.priority || &#39;medium&#39;,
          assignee: taskData.assignee,
          reviewer: taskData.reviewer,
          dependsOn: Array.isArray(taskData.dependsOn)
            ? taskData.dependsOn.join(&#39;,&#39;)
            : taskData.dependsOn,
          acceptanceCriteria: Array.isArray(taskData.acceptanceCriteria)
            ? taskData.acceptanceCriteria.join(&#39;,&#39;)
            : taskData.acceptanceCriteria,
          canRunInParallel: taskData.canRunInParallel,
          requiresReview: taskData.requiresReview,
          requiresTesting: taskData.requiresTesting,
          blocksOtherTasks: taskData.blocksOtherTasks,
        };

        await createSingleTask(storage, options.epic, taskOptions, config, false); // Don&#39;t show individual success messages
        successCount++;

        if (options.verbose) {
          console.log(chalk.dim(`  ✓ Created task: ${taskData.name}`));
        }
      } catch (error) {
        const errorMsg = `Task ${i + 1} (${taskData.name || &#39;unnamed&#39;}): ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`;
        errors.push(errorMsg);
        errorCount++;

        if (options.verbose) {
          console.log(chalk.red(`  ✗ Failed to create task: ${taskData.name}`));
        }
      }
    }

    // Summary
    if (successCount &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Successfully created ${successCount} task(s)`));
    }

    if (errorCount &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.red(`❌ Failed to create ${errorCount} task(s):`));
      errors.forEach(error =&gt; console.log(chalk.red(`  • ${error}`)));
      return errorCount === tasksData.length ? 1 : 0; // Return error only if all failed
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    if (error instanceof SyntaxError) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Invalid JSON format in input&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Example format:&#39;));
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(`[
  {
    &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Implement user authentication&quot;,
    &quot;description&quot;: &quot;Add login/logout functionality&quot;,
    &quot;type&quot;: &quot;feature&quot;,
    &quot;priority&quot;: &quot;high&quot;,
    &quot;order&quot;: 0,
    &quot;assignee&quot;: &quot;dev1&quot;,
    &quot;acceptanceCriteria&quot;: [&quot;User can log in&quot;, &quot;User can log out&quot;, &quot;Session persists&quot;]
  },
  {
    &quot;name&quot;: &quot;Write unit tests&quot;,
    &quot;description&quot;: &quot;Add comprehensive unit tests for auth&quot;,
    &quot;type&quot;: &quot;test&quot;, 
    &quot;priority&quot;: &quot;medium&quot;,
    &quot;order&quot;: 1,
    &quot;dependsOn&quot;: [&quot;implement-user-authentication&quot;]
  }
]`)
      );
    } else {
      console.error(
        chalk.red(
          `Batch task creation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
        )
      );
    }
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Create a single task (shared logic)
 */
async function createSingleTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  epicId: string,
  options: TaskCreateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig,
  showSuccessMessage = true
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const epic = await storage.getEpic(epicId);
  if (!epic) {
    throw new Error(`Epic &#39;${epicId}&#39; not found`);
  }

  if (!options.name) {
    throw new Error(&#39;Task name is required&#39;);
  }

  const taskId = generateSlug(options.name);

  // Check if task already exists in this epic
  if (epic.tasks?.some(t =&gt; t.id === taskId)) {
    throw new Error(`Task &#39;${taskId}&#39; already exists in epic &#39;${epicId}&#39;`);
  }

  const task: Task = {
    id: taskId,
    name: options.name,
    description: options.description,
    type: options.type || &#39;feature&#39;,
    priority: options.priority || &#39;medium&#39;,
    status: &#39;todo&#39;,
    assignee: options.assignee,
    reviewer: options.reviewer,
    dependsOn: options.dependsOn ? options.dependsOn.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(s =&gt; s.trim()) : undefined,
    acceptanceCriteria: options.acceptanceCriteria
      ? options.acceptanceCriteria.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(s =&gt; s.trim())
      : undefined,
    config: {
      canRunInParallel: options.canRunInParallel,
      requiresReview: options.requiresReview,
      requiresTesting: options.requiresTesting,
      blocksOtherTasks: options.blocksOtherTasks,
    },
  };

  // Add task to epic
  if (!epic.tasks) {
    epic.tasks = [];
  }
  epic.tasks.push(task);

  await storage.updateEpic(epic);

  if (showSuccessMessage) {
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Created task &#39;${task.name}&#39; (${taskId}) in epic &#39;${epicId}&#39;`));
    if (task.dependsOn &amp;&amp; task.dependsOn.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Dependencies: ${task.dependsOn.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Update a task
 */
async function updateTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  taskId: string,
  options: TaskOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  // Find task across all epics
  const epics = await storage.listEpics();
  let targetEpic: Epic | null = null;
  let targetTask: Task | null = null;

  for (const epic of epics) {
    const task = epic.tasks?.find(t =&gt; t.id === taskId);
    if (task) {
      targetEpic = epic;
      targetTask = task;
      break;
    }
  }

  if (!targetTask || !targetEpic) {
    console.error(chalk.red(`Task &#39;${taskId}&#39; not found`));
    return 1;
  }

  // Update fields
  let updated = false;

  if (
    options.status &amp;&amp;
    [&#39;todo&#39;, &#39;in_progress&#39;, &#39;review&#39;, &#39;testing&#39;, &#39;completed&#39;, &#39;cancelled&#39;].includes(options.status)
  ) {
    targetTask.status = options.status as Task[&#39;status&#39;];
    updated = true;
  }

  if (options.priority &amp;&amp; [&#39;critical&#39;, &#39;high&#39;, &#39;medium&#39;, &#39;low&#39;].includes(options.priority)) {
    targetTask.priority = options.priority as Task[&#39;priority&#39;];
    updated = true;
  }

  if (
    options.type &amp;&amp;
    [&#39;feature&#39;, &#39;bug&#39;, &#39;refactor&#39;, &#39;test&#39;, &#39;docs&#39;, &#39;devops&#39;, &#39;research&#39;].includes(options.type)
  ) {
    targetTask.type = options.type as Task[&#39;type&#39;];
    updated = true;
  }

  if (options.assignee !== undefined) {
    targetTask.assignee = options.assignee || undefined;
    updated = true;
  }

  if (!updated) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No updates specified&#39;));
    return 0;
  }

  await storage.updateEpic(targetEpic);

  console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Updated task &#39;${targetTask.name}&#39;`));
  return 0;
}

/**
 * Move a task to a different order position
 */
async function moveTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  taskId: string,
  options: TaskOptions &amp; { newOrder?: number },
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (options.newOrder === undefined) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;New order position is required (use --new-order &lt;number&gt;)&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  // Find task and update order
  const epics = await storage.listEpics();
  let targetEpic: Epic | null = null;
  let targetTask: Task | null = null;

  for (const epic of epics) {
    const task = epic.tasks?.find(t =&gt; t.id === taskId);
    if (task) {
      targetEpic = epic;
      targetTask = task;
      break;
    }
  }

  if (!targetTask || !targetEpic) {
    console.error(chalk.red(`Task &#39;${taskId}&#39; not found`));
    return 1;
  }

  const oldOrder = targetTask.order;
  targetTask.order = options.newOrder;

  await storage.updateEpic(targetEpic);

  console.log(
    chalk.green(`✅ Moved task &#39;${targetTask.name}&#39; from order ${oldOrder} to ${options.newOrder}`)
  );
  return 0;
}

/**
 * Mark a task as completed
 */
async function completeTask(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  taskId: string,
  options: TaskOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await updateTask(storage, taskId, { ...options, status: &#39;completed&#39; }, config);
}

/**
 * Show dependency graph and relationships
 */
async function showDependencies(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskOptions &amp; { epic?: string },
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Analyzing dependencies...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    let tasks: Task[] = [];

    if (options.epic) {
      // Show dependencies for specific epic
      const epic = await storage.getEpic(options.epic);
      if (!epic) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${options.epic}&#39; not found`));
        return 1;
      }
      tasks = epic.tasks || [];
      console.log(chalk.cyan(`Dependencies for epic: ${epic.name}`));
    } else {
      // Show dependencies across all epics
      tasks = await storage.getOrderedTasks();
      console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Dependencies across all epics:&#39;));
    }

    if (tasks.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No tasks found&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      const graph = storage.getDependencyGraph(tasks);
      console.log(formatJson(graph));
      return 0;
    }

    // Show dependency relationships
    const hasDependencies = tasks.filter(t =&gt; t.dependsOn &amp;&amp; t.dependsOn.length &gt; 0);

    if (hasDependencies.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No task dependencies found&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\nDependency Relationships:&#39;));

    for (const task of hasDependencies) {
      console.log(chalk.white(`${task.name} (${task.id})`));
      console.log(
        chalk.dim(`  Type: ${task.type} | Status: ${task.status} | Priority: ${task.priority}`)
      );

      if (task.dependsOn) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  Depends on:&#39;));
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          const depTask = tasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === depId);
          if (depTask) {
            const statusColor =
              depTask.status === &#39;completed&#39;
                ? chalk.green
                : depTask.status === &#39;in_progress&#39;
                  ? chalk.yellow
                  : chalk.gray;
            console.log(chalk.dim(`    → ${depTask.name} (${statusColor(depTask.status)})`));
          } else {
            console.log(chalk.dim(`    → ${depId} ${chalk.red(&#39;(not found)&#39;)}`));
          }
        }
      }
      console.log();
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Show tasks that are ready to start (no blocking dependencies)
 */
async function showReadyTasks(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskOptions &amp; { epic?: string },
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Finding ready tasks...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    let allTasks: Task[] = [];

    if (options.epic) {
      const epic = await storage.getEpic(options.epic);
      if (!epic) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${options.epic}&#39; not found`));
        return 1;
      }
      allTasks = epic.tasks || [];
    } else {
      allTasks = await storage.getOrderedTasks();
    }

    const readyTasks = storage.getReadyTasks(allTasks);

    if (readyTasks.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No tasks are ready to start&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(readyTasks));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(`${readyTasks.length} task(s) ready to start:`));

    const headers = [&#39;ID&#39;, &#39;Name&#39;, &#39;Type&#39;, &#39;Priority&#39;, &#39;Assignee&#39;];
    const rows = readyTasks.map(task =&gt; [
      task.id,
      task.name,
      task.type,
      task.priority,
      task.assignee || &#39;-&#39;,
    ]);

    console.log(formatTable(headers, rows));

    return 0;
  });
}

/**
 * Show tasks that are blocked by dependencies
 */
async function showBlockedTasks(
  storage: ShardedCUEStorage,
  options: TaskOptions &amp; { epic?: string },
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  return await withProgress({ text: &#39;Finding blocked tasks...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    let allTasks: Task[] = [];

    if (options.epic) {
      const epic = await storage.getEpic(options.epic);
      if (!epic) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Epic &#39;${options.epic}&#39; not found`));
        return 1;
      }
      allTasks = epic.tasks || [];
    } else {
      allTasks = await storage.getOrderedTasks();
    }

    const blockedTasks = storage.getBlockedTasks(allTasks);

    if (blockedTasks.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.green(&#39;No tasks are currently blocked&#39;));
      return 0;
    }

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(blockedTasks));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.red(`${blockedTasks.length} task(s) blocked by dependencies:`));

    for (const task of blockedTasks) {
      console.log(chalk.white(`${task.name} (${task.id})`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(`  Type: ${task.type} | Priority: ${task.priority}`));

      if (task.dependsOn) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  Waiting for:&#39;));
        for (const depId of task.dependsOn) {
          const depTask = allTasks.find(t =&gt; t.id === depId);
          if (depTask &amp;&amp; depTask.status !== &#39;completed&#39;) {
            console.log(chalk.dim(`    → ${depTask.name} (${depTask.status})`));
          }
        }
      }
      console.log();
    }

    return 0;
  });
}

// Helper functions
function generateSlug(name: string): string {
  return name
    .toLowerCase()
    .replace(/[^a-z0-9\s-]/g, &#39;&#39;)
    .replace(/\s+/g, &#39;-&#39;)
    .replace(/-+/g, &#39;-&#39;)
    .trim();
}

function getStatusColor(status: string): string {
  switch (status) {
    case &#39;completed&#39;:
      return chalk.green(status);
    case &#39;in_progress&#39;:
      return chalk.yellow(status);
    case &#39;cancelled&#39;:
      return chalk.red(status);
    default:
      return chalk.dim(status);
  }
}

function getPriorityColor(priority: string): string {
  switch (priority) {
    case &#39;critical&#39;:
      return chalk.red(priority);
    case &#39;high&#39;:
      return chalk.yellow(priority);
    case &#39;medium&#39;:
      return chalk.blue(priority);
    case &#39;low&#39;:
      return chalk.dim(priority);
    default:
      return priority;
  }
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/utils/diagramLayout.ts
/**
 * Diagram Layout Algorithms
 * Automatic positioning of components for different diagram types
 */

import {
  type DiagramComponent,
  type DiagramConnection,
  type DiagramLayer,
  DiagramLayout,
  type LayoutAlgorithm,
} from &#39;../types/architecture&#39;;

export class LayeredLayoutAlgorithm implements LayoutAlgorithm {
  name = &#39;layered&#39;;

  calculate(
    components: DiagramComponent[],
    connections: DiagramConnection[]
  ): { components: DiagramComponent[]; viewport: { width: number; height: number } } {
    // Define layer ordering
    const layerOrder: DiagramLayer[] = [
      &#39;presentation&#39;,
      &#39;application&#39;,
      &#39;service&#39;,
      &#39;data&#39;,
      &#39;external&#39;,
    ];

    // Group components by layer
    const layerGroups = this.groupByLayer(components, layerOrder);

    // Calculate positions
    const positioned = this.positionComponentsByLayer(layerGroups, layerOrder);

    // Calculate viewport size
    const viewport = this.calculateViewport(positioned);

    return { components: positioned, viewport };
  }

  private groupByLayer(
    components: DiagramComponent[],
    layerOrder: DiagramLayer[]
  ): Map&lt;DiagramLayer, DiagramComponent[]&gt; {
    const groups = new Map&lt;DiagramLayer, DiagramComponent[]&gt;();

    // Initialize groups
    layerOrder.forEach(layer =&gt; groups.set(layer, []));

    // Group components
    components.forEach(component =&gt; {
      const layer = component.layer || &#39;service&#39;;
      if (!groups.has(layer)) {
        groups.set(layer, []);
      }
      groups.get(layer)?.push(component);
    });

    return groups;
  }

  private positionComponentsByLayer(
    layerGroups: Map&lt;DiagramLayer, DiagramComponent[]&gt;,
    layerOrder: DiagramLayer[]
  ): DiagramComponent[] {
    const positioned: DiagramComponent[] = [];
    const layerHeight = 200;
    const componentSpacing = 20;
    let currentY = 60; // Start below header

    layerOrder.forEach(layer =&gt; {
      const components = layerGroups.get(layer) || [];
      if (components.length === 0) return;

      // Calculate total width needed for this layer
      const totalWidth = components.reduce((sum, comp) =&gt; sum + comp.size.width, 0);
      const totalSpacing = (components.length - 1) * componentSpacing;
      const layerWidth = totalWidth + totalSpacing;

      // Center the layer horizontally
      let currentX = Math.max(50, (800 - layerWidth) / 2);

      components.forEach(component =&gt; {
        positioned.push({
          ...component,
          position: { x: currentX, y: currentY },
        });
        currentX += component.size.width + componentSpacing;
      });

      currentY += layerHeight;
    });

    return positioned;
  }

  private calculateViewport(components: DiagramComponent[]): { width: number; height: number } {
    if (components.length === 0) {
      return { width: 800, height: 600 };
    }

    const padding = 50;
    const maxX = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.x + c.size.width));
    const maxY = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.y + c.size.height));

    return {
      width: Math.max(800, maxX + padding),
      height: Math.max(600, maxY + padding),
    };
  }
}

export class ForceDirectedLayoutAlgorithm implements LayoutAlgorithm {
  name = &#39;force_directed&#39;;

  calculate(
    components: DiagramComponent[],
    connections: DiagramConnection[]
  ): { components: DiagramComponent[]; viewport: { width: number; height: number } } {
    // Simple force-directed layout using basic physics simulation
    const positioned = [...components];
    const iterations = 50;
    const repulsionForce = 5000;
    const attractionForce = 0.1;
    const damping = 0.9;

    // Initialize random positions if not set
    positioned.forEach(component =&gt; {
      if (component.position.x === 0 &amp;&amp; component.position.y === 0) {
        component.position = {
          x: Math.random() * 600 + 100,
          y: Math.random() * 400 + 100,
        };
      }
    });

    // Track velocities
    const velocities = new Map&lt;string, { x: number; y: number }&gt;();
    positioned.forEach(comp =&gt; {
      velocities.set(comp.id, { x: 0, y: 0 });
    });

    // Simulation iterations
    for (let iter = 0; iter &lt; iterations; iter++) {
      // Reset forces
      positioned.forEach(comp =&gt; {
        const vel = velocities.get(comp.id)!;
        vel.x *= damping;
        vel.y *= damping;
      });

      // Repulsion forces (all components push each other away)
      for (let i = 0; i &lt; positioned.length; i++) {
        for (let j = i + 1; j &lt; positioned.length; j++) {
          const comp1 = positioned[i];
          const comp2 = positioned[j];
          const vel1 = velocities.get(comp1.id)!;
          const vel2 = velocities.get(comp2.id)!;

          const dx = comp2.position.x - comp1.position.x;
          const dy = comp2.position.y - comp1.position.y;
          const distance = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy) || 1;

          const force = repulsionForce / (distance * distance);
          const fx = (dx / distance) * force;
          const fy = (dy / distance) * force;

          vel1.x -= fx;
          vel1.y -= fy;
          vel2.x += fx;
          vel2.y += fy;
        }
      }

      // Attraction forces (connected components pull each other)
      connections.forEach(connection =&gt; {
        const comp1 = positioned.find(c =&gt; c.id === connection.from.componentId);
        const comp2 = positioned.find(c =&gt; c.id === connection.to.componentId);

        if (comp1 &amp;&amp; comp2) {
          const vel1 = velocities.get(comp1.id)!;
          const vel2 = velocities.get(comp2.id)!;

          const dx = comp2.position.x - comp1.position.x;
          const dy = comp2.position.y - comp1.position.y;
          const distance = Math.sqrt(dx * dx + dy * dy) || 1;

          const force = distance * attractionForce;
          const fx = (dx / distance) * force;
          const fy = (dy / distance) * force;

          vel1.x += fx;
          vel1.y += fy;
          vel2.x -= fx;
          vel2.y -= fy;
        }
      });

      // Apply velocities
      positioned.forEach(comp =&gt; {
        const vel = velocities.get(comp.id)!;
        comp.position.x += vel.x;
        comp.position.y += vel.y;

        // Keep components within bounds
        comp.position.x = Math.max(50, Math.min(750, comp.position.x));
        comp.position.y = Math.max(50, Math.min(550, comp.position.y));
      });
    }

    const viewport = this.calculateViewport(positioned);
    return { components: positioned, viewport };
  }

  private calculateViewport(components: DiagramComponent[]): { width: number; height: number } {
    if (components.length === 0) {
      return { width: 800, height: 600 };
    }

    const padding = 100;
    const maxX = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.x + c.size.width));
    const maxY = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.y + c.size.height));

    return {
      width: Math.max(800, maxX + padding),
      height: Math.max(600, maxY + padding),
    };
  }
}

export class FlowLayoutAlgorithm implements LayoutAlgorithm {
  name = &#39;flow&#39;;

  calculate(
    components: DiagramComponent[],
    connections: DiagramConnection[]
  ): { components: DiagramComponent[]; viewport: { width: number; height: number } } {
    // Organize components based on flow connections
    const positioned = [...components];

    // Find starting components (no incoming flow connections)
    const hasIncoming = new Set&lt;string&gt;();
    connections
      .filter(conn =&gt; [&#39;user_navigation&#39;, &#39;user_interaction&#39;].includes(conn.type))
      .forEach(conn =&gt; hasIncoming.add(conn.to.componentId));

    const startComponents = positioned.filter(comp =&gt; !hasIncoming.has(comp.id));
    const remainingComponents = positioned.filter(comp =&gt; hasIncoming.has(comp.id));

    // Layout in flow order
    let currentX = 50;
    const currentY = 100;
    const stepWidth = 200;
    const stepHeight = 150;

    // Position start components
    startComponents.forEach((comp, index) =&gt; {
      comp.position = { x: currentX, y: currentY + index * stepHeight };
    });

    // Position remaining components based on flow order
    const positioned_ids = new Set(startComponents.map(c =&gt; c.id));
    let currentStep = 1;

    while (positioned_ids.size &lt; positioned.length &amp;&amp; currentStep &lt; 10) {
      currentX += stepWidth;
      let yOffset = 0;

      // Find components that can be positioned in this step
      const canPosition = remainingComponents.filter(comp =&gt; {
        if (positioned_ids.has(comp.id)) return false;

        // Check if all predecessors are positioned
        const predecessors = connections
          .filter(conn =&gt; conn.to.componentId === comp.id)
          .map(conn =&gt; conn.from.componentId);

        return predecessors.length === 0 || predecessors.every(id =&gt; positioned_ids.has(id));
      });

      canPosition.forEach(comp =&gt; {
        comp.position = { x: currentX, y: currentY + yOffset };
        positioned_ids.add(comp.id);
        yOffset += stepHeight;
      });

      currentStep++;
    }

    // Position any remaining components
    remainingComponents
      .filter(comp =&gt; !positioned_ids.has(comp.id))
      .forEach((comp, index) =&gt; {
        comp.position = {
          x: currentX + stepWidth,
          y: currentY + index * stepHeight,
        };
      });

    const viewport = this.calculateViewport(positioned);
    return { components: positioned, viewport };
  }

  private calculateViewport(components: DiagramComponent[]): { width: number; height: number } {
    if (components.length === 0) {
      return { width: 800, height: 600 };
    }

    const padding = 100;
    const maxX = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.x + c.size.width));
    const maxY = Math.max(...components.map(c =&gt; c.position.y + c.size.height));

    return {
      width: Math.max(1000, maxX + padding),
      height: Math.max(600, maxY + padding),
    };
  }
}

export class DiagramLayoutEngine {
  private algorithms: Map&lt;string, LayoutAlgorithm&gt; = new Map();

  constructor() {
    this.algorithms.set(&#39;layered&#39;, new LayeredLayoutAlgorithm());
    this.algorithms.set(&#39;force_directed&#39;, new ForceDirectedLayoutAlgorithm());
    this.algorithms.set(&#39;flow&#39;, new FlowLayoutAlgorithm());
  }

  /**
   * Apply layout algorithm to components
   */
  applyLayout(
    components: DiagramComponent[],
    connections: DiagramConnection[],
    layoutType = &#39;layered&#39;
  ): { components: DiagramComponent[]; viewport: { width: number; height: number } } {
    const algorithm = this.algorithms.get(layoutType);

    if (!algorithm) {
      console.warn(`Unknown layout algorithm: ${layoutType}, falling back to layered`);
      return this.algorithms.get(&#39;layered&#39;)?.calculate(components, connections);
    }

    return algorithm.calculate(components, connections);
  }

  /**
   * Suggest best layout based on diagram characteristics
   */
  suggestLayout(components: DiagramComponent[], connections: DiagramConnection[]): string {
    // Check for flow-based connections
    const hasFlowConnections = connections.some(conn =&gt;
      [&#39;user_navigation&#39;, &#39;user_interaction&#39;].includes(conn.type)
    );

    if (hasFlowConnections) {
      return &#39;flow&#39;;
    }

    // Check for clear layer separation
    const layers = new Set(components.map(c =&gt; c.layer));
    if (layers.size &gt;= 3) {
      return &#39;layered&#39;;
    }

    // Default to force-directed for complex interconnections
    return &#39;force_directed&#39;;
  }

  /**
   * Get available layout algorithms
   */
  getAvailableLayouts(): string[] {
    return Array.from(this.algorithms.keys());
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/execute.ts
import fs from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { diffLines } from &#39;diff&#39;;
import yaml from &#39;js-yaml&#39;;
import { withStepProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;
import {
  type ExecutionReport,
  type PlanOutput,
  createOutputManager,
  shouldUseAgentMode,
} from &#39;../utils/standardized-output.js&#39;;

// Strategy interfaces for execution patterns
interface ExecutionStrategy {
  execute(plan: ExecutionPlan, options: ExecuteOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt;;
}

// Command interfaces for operation steps
interface Command {
  execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt;;
}

// Builder interface for plan construction
interface PlanBuilder {
  build(): Promise&lt;ExecutionPlan&gt;;
}

/**
 * Epic v2 execution engine with deterministic file-plan generation
 * Implements the agent-first, idempotent codegen approach from TODO.md
 */

export interface Epic {
  id: string;
  title: string;
  owners: string[];
  targets: Array&lt;{
    root: string;
    include: string[];
    exclude: string[];
  }&gt;;
  generate: Array&lt;{
    path: string;
    mode: &#39;create&#39; | &#39;patch&#39;;
    template: string;
    data: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
    guards: string[];
  }&gt;;
  contracts: {
    types: string[];
    invariants: string[];
  };
  tests: {
    static: Array&lt;{ selector: string }&gt;;
    property: Array&lt;{ name: string; cue: string }&gt;;
    golden: Array&lt;{ input: string; want: string }&gt;;
    cli: Array&lt;{ cmd: string; expectExit: number; expectRE?: string }&gt;;
  };
  rollout: {
    steps: string[];
    gates: Array&lt;{ name: string; cue: string }&gt;;
  };
  heuristics: {
    preferSmallPRs: boolean;
    maxFilesPerPR: number;
  };
  metadata?: {
    created?: string;
    updated?: string;
    version?: string;
    tags?: string[];
    priority?: &#39;low&#39; | &#39;medium&#39; | &#39;high&#39; | &#39;critical&#39;;
    complexity?: number;
  };
}

export interface FileOperation {
  path: string;
  mode: &#39;create&#39; | &#39;patch&#39;;
  content: string;
  guards: string[];
  originalExists: boolean;
  originalContent?: string;
}

export interface ExecutionPlan {
  epicId: string;
  operations: FileOperation[];
  sortedOrder: string[];
  conflicts: string[];
  guardViolations: string[];
}

export interface ExecutionSummary {
  epicId: string;
  timestamp: string;
  filesChanged: number;
  testsRun: number;
  testsPassed: number;
  contractsChecked: number;
  contractsPassed: number;
  rolloutGatesChecked: number;
  rolloutGatesPassed: number;
  overallSuccess: boolean;
  duration: number;
  results: Array&lt;{
    name: string;
    passed: boolean;
    duration?: number;
    error?: string;
    details?: any;
  }&gt;;
}

export interface ExecuteOptions {
  dryRun?: boolean;
  epic: string;
  workspace?: string;
  timeout?: number;
  junit?: string;
  verbose?: boolean;
  agentMode?: boolean;
  ndjsonOutput?: string;
}

/**
 * Epic loader class - Single responsibility: Loading and parsing epic files
 */
class EpicLoader {
  private epicPath: string;

  constructor(epicPath: string) {
    this.epicPath = epicPath;
  }

  async load(): Promise&lt;Epic&gt; {
    try {
      const content = await fs.readFile(this.epicPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

      // For now, assume the epic is in JSON format or can be parsed as such
      // In a real implementation, we&#39;d use CUE&#39;s parser
      // This is a simplified version for the prototype
      if (content.includes(&#39;package epics&#39;) || content.includes(&#39;: epics.#Epic&#39;)) {
        // CUE format - would need proper CUE parsing here
        throw new Error(&#39;CUE parsing not yet implemented - please provide JSON format for now&#39;);
      }

      // Try to parse as JSON/YAML
      let epic: Epic;
      try {
        epic = JSON.parse(content);
      } catch {
        epic = yaml.load(content) as Epic;
      }

      // Validate required fields
      this.validateEpic(epic);
      return epic;
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(
        `Failed to load epic from ${this.epicPath}: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
      );
    }
  }

  private validateEpic(epic: Epic): void {
    if (!epic.id || !epic.title || !epic.owners || !epic.generate) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Invalid epic: missing required fields (id, title, owners, generate)&#39;);
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Plan generator class - Single responsibility: Creating execution plans
 */
class PlanGenerator implements PlanBuilder {
  private epic: Epic;
  private workspace: string;

  constructor(epic: Epic, workspace: string) {
    this.epic = epic;
    this.workspace = workspace;
  }

  async build(): Promise&lt;ExecutionPlan&gt; {
    const operations: FileOperation[] = [];
    const conflicts: string[] = [];
    const guardViolations: string[] = [];

    for (const gen of this.epic.generate) {
      const operation = await this.createFileOperation(gen);
      operations.push(operation);

      // Check guards
      const violations = await this.checkGuards(operation.path, gen.guards);
      guardViolations.push(...violations);

      // Check for conflicts
      if (gen.mode === &#39;create&#39; &amp;&amp; operation.originalExists) {
        conflicts.push(`Conflict: ${gen.path} already exists but mode is &#39;create&#39;`);
      }
    }

    const sortedOrder = this.calculateSortOrder(operations);

    return {
      epicId: this.epic.id,
      operations: operations.sort(
        (a, b) =&gt; sortedOrder.indexOf(a.path) - sortedOrder.indexOf(b.path)
      ),
      sortedOrder,
      conflicts,
      guardViolations,
    };
  }

  private async createFileOperation(gen: Epic[&#39;generate&#39;][0]): Promise&lt;FileOperation&gt; {
    const fullPath = path.isAbsolute(gen.path) ? gen.path : path.join(this.workspace, gen.path);

    // Check if file exists
    let originalExists = false;
    let originalContent: string | undefined;
    try {
      originalContent = await fs.readFile(fullPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      originalExists = true;
    } catch {
      originalExists = false;
    }

    // Load and render template
    const content = await this.loadTemplate(gen.template, gen.data);

    return {
      path: fullPath,
      mode: gen.mode,
      content,
      guards: gen.guards,
      originalExists,
      originalContent,
    };
  }

  private calculateSortOrder(operations: FileOperation[]): string[] {
    return operations
      .map(op =&gt; op.path)
      .sort((a, b) =&gt; {
        const depthA = a.split(path.sep).length;
        const depthB = b.split(path.sep).length;

        if (depthA !== depthB) {
          return depthA - depthB; // Parents before children
        }

        return a.localeCompare(b); // Lexicographic order
      });
  }

  private async checkGuards(filePath: string, guards: string[]): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
    const violations: string[] = [];

    try {
      const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

      for (const guard of guards) {
        if (content.includes(guard)) {
          violations.push(`Guard violation: &quot;${guard}&quot; already exists in ${filePath}`);
        }
      }
    } catch (_error) {
      // File doesn&#39;t exist - no guard violations
    }

    return violations;
  }

  private async loadTemplate(templatePath: string, data: Record&lt;string, any&gt;): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    try {
      let content = await fs.readFile(templatePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

      // Simple template variable substitution - {{.variable}}
      for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(data)) {
        const regex = new RegExp(`\\{\\{\\.${key}\\}\\}`, &#39;g&#39;);
        content = content.replace(regex, String(value));
      }

      // Handle conditional blocks - {{if .variable}}...{{end}}
      content = content.replace(
        /\{\{if\s+\.(\w+)\}\}(.*?)\{\{end\}\}/gs,
        (_match, varName, block) =&gt; {
          return data[varName] ? block : &#39;&#39;;
        }
      );

      return content;
    } catch (error) {
      // If template file doesn&#39;t exist, treat template as inline content
      if ((error as any).code === &#39;ENOENT&#39;) {
        let content = templatePath;

        // Apply same substitutions to inline template
        for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(data)) {
          const regex = new RegExp(`\\{\\{\\.${key}\\}\\}`, &#39;g&#39;);
          content = content.replace(regex, String(value));
        }

        return content;
      }
      throw error;
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Plan executor classes - Strategy pattern for execution modes
 */
class RealExecutionStrategy implements ExecutionStrategy {
  async execute(plan: ExecutionPlan, _options: ExecuteOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    for (const operation of plan.operations) {
      await this.executeOperation(operation);
    }
  }

  private async executeOperation(operation: FileOperation): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Ensure directory exists
    const dir = path.dirname(operation.path);
    await fs.mkdir(dir, { recursive: true });

    let finalContent = operation.content;

    if (operation.mode === &#39;patch&#39; &amp;&amp; operation.originalExists &amp;&amp; operation.originalContent) {
      finalContent = this.applyPatch(operation.originalContent, operation.content);
    }

    await fs.writeFile(operation.path, finalContent, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
  }

  private applyPatch(originalContent: string, patchContent: string): string {
    // Look for ARBITER:BEGIN/END markers in patch
    const markerRegex = /\/\/\s*ARBITER:BEGIN\s+(\w+)(.*?)\/\/\s*ARBITER:END\s+\1/g;

    let result = originalContent;
    let match;

    while ((match = markerRegex.exec(patchContent)) !== null) {
      const [fullMatch, markerId, _blockContent] = match;

      // Check if this block already exists in original
      const existingBlockRegex = new RegExp(
        `//\\s*ARBITER:BEGIN\\s+${markerId}.*?//\\s*ARBITER:END\\s+${markerId}`,
        &#39;g&#39;
      );

      if (existingBlockRegex.test(result)) {
        // Replace existing block
        result = result.replace(existingBlockRegex, fullMatch.trim());
      } else {
        // Append new block
        result = `${result}\n\n${fullMatch.trim()}`;
      }
    }

    return result;
  }
}

class DryRunExecutionStrategy implements ExecutionStrategy {
  async execute(_plan: ExecutionPlan, _options: ExecuteOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // No-op for dry run - just validates the plan
  }
}

/**
 * Plan executor class - Single responsibility: Executing plans
 */
class PlanExecutor {
  private strategy: ExecutionStrategy;

  constructor(strategy: ExecutionStrategy) {
    this.strategy = strategy;
  }

  async execute(plan: ExecutionPlan, options: ExecuteOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await this.strategy.execute(plan, options);
  }
}

/**
 * Report generator class - Single responsibility: Creating execution reports
 */
class ReportGenerator {
  private workspace: string;

  constructor(workspace: string) {
    this.workspace = workspace;
  }

  generateDiff(operation: FileOperation): string {
    if (!operation.originalExists) {
      // New file
      const lines = operation.content.split(&#39;\n&#39;);
      return lines.map(line =&gt; chalk.green(`+${line}`)).join(&#39;\n&#39;);
    }

    if (!operation.originalContent) {
      return chalk.red(&#39;Error: Original content not available&#39;);
    }

    let finalContent = operation.content;
    if (operation.mode === &#39;patch&#39;) {
      finalContent = this.applyPatch(operation.originalContent, operation.content);
    }

    const diff = diffLines(operation.originalContent, finalContent);
    return diff
      .map(part =&gt; {
        const lines = part.value.split(&#39;\n&#39;).filter(line =&gt; line !== &#39;&#39;);
        if (part.added) {
          return lines.map(line =&gt; chalk.green(`+${line}`)).join(&#39;\n&#39;);
        }
        if (part.removed) {
          return lines.map(line =&gt; chalk.red(`-${line}`)).join(&#39;\n&#39;);
        }
        return lines.map(line =&gt; ` ${line}`).join(&#39;\n&#39;);
      })
      .join(&#39;\n&#39;);
  }

  createExecutionSummary(
    epic: Epic,
    plan: ExecutionPlan,
    results: ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;],
    startTime: number
  ): ExecutionSummary {
    const duration = Date.now() - startTime;
    return {
      epicId: epic.id,
      timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
      filesChanged: plan.operations.length,
      testsRun: results.length,
      testsPassed: results.filter(r =&gt; r.passed).length,
      contractsChecked: epic.contracts.types.length + epic.contracts.invariants.length,
      contractsPassed: 0, // Would be implemented with actual CUE evaluation
      rolloutGatesChecked: epic.rollout.gates.length,
      rolloutGatesPassed: 0, // Would be implemented with actual CUE evaluation
      overallSuccess: results.every(r =&gt; r.passed),
      duration,
      results,
    };
  }

  createExecutionReport(plan: ExecutionPlan, duration: number): ExecutionReport {
    return {
      apiVersion: &#39;arbiter.dev/v2&#39;,
      timestamp: Date.now(),
      command: &#39;execute&#39;,
      kind: &#39;ExecutionReport&#39;,
      applied: plan.operations.map((op, index) =&gt; ({
        id: `op-${index + 1}`,
        action: op.mode,
        target: path.relative(this.workspace, op.path),
        status: &#39;success&#39; as const,
        duration: 100, // Would track actual duration
      })),
      report: {
        totalActions: plan.operations.length,
        successful: plan.operations.length,
        failed: 0,
        skipped: 0,
        duration,
      },
    };
  }

  createPlanOutput(plan: ExecutionPlan): {
    planOutput: PlanOutput[&#39;plan&#39;];
    guards: PlanOutput[&#39;guards&#39;];
    diff: any;
  } {
    const planOutput: PlanOutput[&#39;plan&#39;] = plan.operations.map((op, index) =&gt; ({
      id: `op-${index + 1}`,
      type: &#39;file&#39; as const,
      action: op.mode === &#39;create&#39; ? (&#39;create&#39; as const) : (&#39;update&#39; as const),
      target: path.relative(this.workspace, op.path),
      content: op.content,
      dependencies: [],
      estimatedTime: 100, // milliseconds estimate
    }));

    const guards: PlanOutput[&#39;guards&#39;] = plan.guardViolations.map((violation, index) =&gt; ({
      id: `guard-${index + 1}`,
      type: &#39;constraint&#39; as const,
      description: violation,
      required: true,
    }));

    const diff = {
      added: plan.operations.filter(op =&gt; !op.originalExists).length,
      modified: plan.operations.filter(op =&gt; op.originalExists).length,
      deleted: 0,
      summary: `${plan.operations.length} operations planned`,
    };

    return { planOutput, guards, diff };
  }

  private applyPatch(originalContent: string, patchContent: string): string {
    // Look for ARBITER:BEGIN/END markers in patch
    const markerRegex = /\/\/\s*ARBITER:BEGIN\s+(\w+)(.*?)\/\/\s*ARBITER:END\s+\1/g;

    let result = originalContent;
    let match;

    while ((match = markerRegex.exec(patchContent)) !== null) {
      const [fullMatch, markerId, _blockContent] = match;

      // Check if this block already exists in original
      const existingBlockRegex = new RegExp(
        `//\\s*ARBITER:BEGIN\\s+${markerId}.*?//\\s*ARBITER:END\\s+${markerId}`,
        &#39;g&#39;
      );

      if (existingBlockRegex.test(result)) {
        // Replace existing block
        result = result.replace(existingBlockRegex, fullMatch.trim());
      } else {
        // Append new block
        result = `${result}\n\n${fullMatch.trim()}`;
      }
    }

    return result;
  }
}

/**
 * Test runner class - Single responsibility: Running and managing tests
 */
class TestRunner {
  private timeout: number;

  constructor(timeout = 30000) {
    this.timeout = timeout;
  }

  async runCliTests(tests: Epic[&#39;tests&#39;][&#39;cli&#39;]): Promise&lt;ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;]&gt; {
    const results: ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;] = [];

    for (const test of tests) {
      const result = await this.runSingleCliTest(test);
      results.push({
        name: `CLI: ${test.cmd}`,
        passed: result.passed,
        duration: result.duration,
        error: result.error,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }

  private async runSingleCliTest(test: {
    cmd: string;
    expectExit: number;
    expectRE?: string;
  }): Promise&lt;{ passed: boolean; error?: string; duration: number }&gt; {
    const startTime = Date.now();

    try {
      const { spawn } = await import(&#39;node:child_process&#39;);
      const [command, ...args] = test.cmd.split(&#39; &#39;);

      return new Promise(resolve =&gt; {
        const proc = spawn(command, args, {
          stdio: [&#39;pipe&#39;, &#39;pipe&#39;, &#39;pipe&#39;],
          timeout: this.timeout,
        });

        let stdout = &#39;&#39;;
        let stderr = &#39;&#39;;

        proc.stdout?.on(&#39;data&#39;, data =&gt; {
          stdout += data.toString();
        });

        proc.stderr?.on(&#39;data&#39;, data =&gt; {
          stderr += data.toString();
        });

        proc.on(&#39;close&#39;, code =&gt; {
          const duration = Date.now() - startTime;

          if (code !== test.expectExit) {
            resolve({
              passed: false,
              error: `Expected exit code ${test.expectExit}, got ${code}. stderr: ${stderr}`,
              duration,
            });
            return;
          }

          if (test.expectRE &amp;&amp; !new RegExp(test.expectRE).test(stdout)) {
            resolve({
              passed: false,
              error: `Output didn&#39;t match expected regex: ${test.expectRE}`,
              duration,
            });
            return;
          }

          resolve({ passed: true, duration });
        });

        proc.on(&#39;error&#39;, error =&gt; {
          resolve({
            passed: false,
            error: error.message,
            duration: Date.now() - startTime,
          });
        });
      });
    } catch (error) {
      return {
        passed: false,
        error: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
        duration: Date.now() - startTime,
      };
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Command classes - Command pattern for execution steps
 */
class LoadEpicCommand implements Command {
  private loader: EpicLoader;
  private epic: Epic | null = null;

  constructor(epicPath: string) {
    this.loader = new EpicLoader(epicPath);
  }

  async execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.epic = await this.loader.load();
  }

  getEpic(): Epic {
    if (!this.epic) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Epic not loaded - execute() must be called first&#39;);
    }
    return this.epic;
  }
}

class GeneratePlanCommand implements Command {
  private generator: PlanGenerator;
  private plan: ExecutionPlan | null = null;

  constructor(epic: Epic, workspace: string) {
    this.generator = new PlanGenerator(epic, workspace);
  }

  async execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.plan = await this.generator.build();
  }

  getPlan(): ExecutionPlan {
    if (!this.plan) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Plan not generated - execute() must be called first&#39;);
    }
    return this.plan;
  }
}

class ExecutePlanCommand implements Command {
  private executor: PlanExecutor;
  private plan: ExecutionPlan;
  private options: ExecuteOptions;

  constructor(plan: ExecutionPlan, options: ExecuteOptions) {
    const strategy = options.dryRun ? new DryRunExecutionStrategy() : new RealExecutionStrategy();
    this.executor = new PlanExecutor(strategy);
    this.plan = plan;
    this.options = options;
  }

  async execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await this.executor.execute(this.plan, this.options);
  }
}

class RunTestsCommand implements Command {
  private testRunner: TestRunner;
  private epic: Epic;
  private results: ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;] = [];
  private options: ExecuteOptions;

  constructor(epic: Epic, options: ExecuteOptions) {
    this.testRunner = new TestRunner(options.timeout || 30000);
    this.epic = epic;
    this.options = options;
  }

  async execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.epic.tests.cli?.length &gt; 0) {
      this.results = await this.testRunner.runCliTests(this.epic.tests.cli);
    }
  }

  getResults(): ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;] {
    return this.results;
  }
}

/**
 * Execution context for passing state between execution phases
 */
interface ExecutionContext {
  startTime: number;
  workspace: string;
  agentMode: boolean;
  outputManager: any;
  reportGenerator: ReportGenerator;
  epic?: Epic;
  plan?: ExecutionPlan;
  testResults?: ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;];
}

/**
 * Main orchestrator - Coordinates all execution steps using command pattern
 */
export async function executeCommand(options: ExecuteOptions): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const context = initializeExecutionContext(options);

  return withStepProgress(
    {
      title: `Executing epic: ${path.basename(options.epic)}`,
      steps: getExecutionSteps(),
      color: &#39;blue&#39;,
    },
    async progress =&gt; {
      try {
        return await executeMainWorkflow(context, options, progress);
      } catch (error) {
        return handleExecutionError(error, context);
      }
    }
  );
}

/**
 * Initialize execution context with shared state
 */
function initializeExecutionContext(options: ExecuteOptions): ExecutionContext {
  const workspace = options.workspace || process.cwd();
  const agentMode = shouldUseAgentMode(options);
  const outputManager = createOutputManager(&#39;execute&#39;, agentMode, options.ndjsonOutput);
  const reportGenerator = new ReportGenerator(workspace);

  return {
    startTime: Date.now(),
    workspace,
    agentMode,
    outputManager,
    reportGenerator,
  };
}

/**
 * Get the standard execution steps
 */
function getExecutionSteps(): string[] {
  return [
    &#39;Loading epic configuration&#39;,
    &#39;Analyzing targets and dependencies&#39;,
    &#39;Generating execution plan&#39;,
    &#39;Validating guards and constraints&#39;,
    &#39;Applying file changes&#39;,
    &#39;Running tests&#39;,
    &#39;Verifying contracts&#39;,
    &#39;Generating execution report&#39;,
  ];
}

/**
 * Execute the main workflow
 */
async function executeMainWorkflow(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  await initializeExecution(context);

  context.epic = await loadEpicConfiguration(context, options, progress);
  await analyzeTargetsAndDependencies(context, progress);

  context.plan = await generateExecutionPlan(context, progress);
  const validationResult = await validatePlanAndConstraints(context, options, progress);
  if (validationResult !== null) return validationResult;

  if (options.dryRun) {
    return await handleDryRun(
      context.plan!,
      options,
      context.outputManager,
      context.reportGenerator,
      context.workspace,
      context.agentMode
    );
  }

  await executeFileChanges(context, options, progress);
  context.testResults = await runTests(context, options, progress);
  await verifyContracts(context, progress);

  return await generateFinalReports(context, options, progress);
}

/**
 * Initialize execution phase
 */
async function initializeExecution(context: ExecutionContext): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  context.outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;plan&#39;,
    status: &#39;start&#39;,
    data: { actions: 0, guards: 0 },
  });

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Workspace: ${context.workspace}`));
  }
}

/**
 * Load and validate epic configuration
 */
async function loadEpicConfiguration(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;Epic&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Loading epic configuration&#39;);
  const loadEpicCommand = new LoadEpicCommand(options.epic);
  await loadEpicCommand.execute();
  const epic = loadEpicCommand.getEpic();

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`📋 Epic: ${epic.title} (${epic.id})`));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Owners: ${epic.owners.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
  }

  return epic;
}

/**
 * Analyze targets and dependencies
 */
async function analyzeTargetsAndDependencies(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Analyzing targets and dependencies&#39;);
  // Implementation would go here
}

/**
 * Generate execution plan
 */
async function generateExecutionPlan(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;ExecutionPlan&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Generating execution plan&#39;);
  const generatePlanCommand = new GeneratePlanCommand(context.epic!, context.workspace);
  await generatePlanCommand.execute();
  return generatePlanCommand.getPlan();
}

/**
 * Validate plan and constraints
 */
async function validatePlanAndConstraints(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;number | null&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Validating guards and constraints&#39;);

  const validationError = validatePlan(context.plan!, context.agentMode, context.outputManager);
  if (validationError) {
    context.outputManager.close();
    return validationError;
  }

  const { planOutput, guards, diff } = context.reportGenerator.createPlanOutput(context.plan!);
  await context.outputManager.writePlanFile(planOutput, guards, diff);

  context.outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;plan&#39;,
    status: &#39;complete&#39;,
    data: { actions: context.plan?.operations.length, guards: guards.length },
  });

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.green(`✓ Plan generated: ${context.plan?.operations.length} operations`));
  }

  return null;
}

/**
 * Execute file changes
 */
async function executeFileChanges(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Applying file changes&#39;);

  context.outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;execute&#39;,
    status: &#39;start&#39;,
    data: { total: context.plan?.operations.length },
  });

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n🔧 Applying changes...&#39;));
  }

  const executePlanCommand = new ExecutePlanCommand(context.plan!, options);
  await executePlanCommand.execute();

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.green(`✓ Applied ${context.plan?.operations.length} file operations`));
  }

  context.outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;execute&#39;,
    status: &#39;complete&#39;,
    data: { progress: context.plan?.operations.length, total: context.plan?.operations.length },
  });
}

/**
 * Run tests and return results
 */
async function runTests(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;]&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Running tests&#39;);

  const runTestsCommand = new RunTestsCommand(context.epic!, options);

  if (context.epic?.tests.cli?.length &gt; 0) {
    context.outputManager.emitEvent({
      phase: &#39;test&#39;,
      status: &#39;start&#39;,
      data: { tests: context.epic?.tests.cli.length },
    });

    if (!context.agentMode) {
      console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n🧪 Running CLI tests...&#39;));
    }

    await runTestsCommand.execute();
    const results = runTestsCommand.getResults();

    await logTestResults(results, context.agentMode);

    context.outputManager.emitEvent({
      phase: &#39;test&#39;,
      status: &#39;complete&#39;,
      data: {
        tests: results.length,
        passed: results.filter(r =&gt; r.passed).length,
        failed: results.filter(r =&gt; !r.passed).length,
      },
    });

    return results;
  }

  return runTestsCommand.getResults();
}

/**
 * Log test results to console
 */
async function logTestResults(
  results: ExecutionSummary[&#39;results&#39;],
  agentMode: boolean
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  if (!agentMode) {
    for (const result of results) {
      if (result.passed) {
        console.log(chalk.green(`  ✓ ${result.name} (${result.duration}ms)`));
      } else {
        console.log(chalk.red(`  ✗ ${result.name} (${result.duration}ms)`));
        if (result.error) {
          console.log(chalk.red(`    ${result.error}`));
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Verify contracts
 */
async function verifyContracts(context: ExecutionContext, progress: any): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Verifying contracts&#39;);
  // Implementation would go here
}

/**
 * Generate final reports and return exit code
 */
async function generateFinalReports(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  progress: any
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  progress.nextStep(&#39;Generating execution report&#39;);

  const duration = Date.now() - context.startTime;
  const summary = context.reportGenerator.createExecutionSummary(
    context.epic!,
    context.plan!,
    context.testResults!,
    context.startTime
  );
  const executionReport = context.reportGenerator.createExecutionReport(context.plan!, duration);

  await addJUnitReportIfNeeded(executionReport, options, context);
  await writeReportFiles(context, options, executionReport);
  await outputFinalSummary(summary, context.agentMode);

  context.outputManager.close();
  return summary.overallSuccess ? 0 : 1;
}

/**
 * Add JUnit report if needed
 */
async function addJUnitReportIfNeeded(
  executionReport: ExecutionReport,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  context: ExecutionContext
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  if (options.junit || context.testResults?.length &gt; 0) {
    executionReport.junit = {
      name: `Epic.${context.epic?.id}`,
      tests: context.testResults?.length,
      failures: context.testResults?.filter(r =&gt; !r.passed).length,
      errors: 0,
      time: (Date.now() - context.startTime) / 1000,
      testcases: context.testResults?.map(result =&gt; ({
        classname: `Epic.${context.epic?.id}`,
        name: result.name,
        time: (result.duration || 0) / 1000,
        ...(result.passed
          ? {}
          : {
              failure: {
                message: result.error || &#39;Test failed&#39;,
                type: &#39;AssertionError&#39;,
                content: result.error || &#39;Test failed&#39;,
              },
            }),
      })),
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Write report files
 */
async function writeReportFiles(
  context: ExecutionContext,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  executionReport: ExecutionReport
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  await context.outputManager.writeReportFile(executionReport);

  if (options.junit) {
    await context.outputManager.writeJUnitFile(executionReport.junit!);
  }
}

/**
 * Output final summary to console
 */
async function outputFinalSummary(summary: ExecutionSummary, agentMode: boolean): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📊 Execution Summary:&#39;));
    console.log(`  Epic: ${summary.epicId}`);
    console.log(`  Files changed: ${summary.filesChanged}`);
    console.log(`  Tests: ${summary.testsPassed}/${summary.testsRun} passed`);
    console.log(`  Duration: ${summary.duration}ms`);
    console.log(
      `  Overall: ${summary.overallSuccess ? chalk.green(&#39;SUCCESS&#39;) : chalk.red(&#39;FAILED&#39;)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Handle execution errors
 */
function handleExecutionError(error: unknown, context: ExecutionContext): number {
  const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);

  if (!context.agentMode) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Execution failed:&#39;), errorMessage);
  }

  context.outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;execute&#39;,
    status: &#39;complete&#39;,
    data: { progress: 0, total: 0 },
  });

  context.outputManager.close();
  return 2;
}

/**
 * Helper function to validate execution plan
 */
function validatePlan(plan: ExecutionPlan, agentMode: boolean, outputManager: any): number | null {
  // Check for conflicts
  if (plan.conflicts.length &gt; 0) {
    if (!agentMode) {
      console.log(chalk.red(&#39;\n❌ Conflicts detected:&#39;));
      plan.conflicts.forEach(conflict =&gt; console.log(chalk.red(`  • ${conflict}`)));
    }
    outputManager.emitEvent({
      phase: &#39;plan&#39;,
      status: &#39;error&#39;,
      error: `Conflicts detected: ${plan.conflicts.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
    });
    return 1;
  }

  // Check for guard violations
  if (plan.guardViolations.length &gt; 0) {
    if (!agentMode) {
