      console.log(chalk.red(&#39;\n❌ Guard violations:&#39;));
      plan.guardViolations.forEach(violation =&gt; console.log(chalk.red(`  • ${violation}`)));
    }
    outputManager.emitEvent({
      phase: &#39;plan&#39;,
      status: &#39;error&#39;,
      error: `Guard violations: ${plan.guardViolations.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`,
    });
    return 1;
  }

  return null;
}

/**
 * Helper function to handle dry run execution
 */
async function handleDryRun(
  plan: ExecutionPlan,
  options: ExecuteOptions,
  outputManager: any,
  reportGenerator: ReportGenerator,
  workspace: string,
  agentMode: boolean
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📝 Dry run - showing planned changes:\n&#39;));

    for (const operation of plan.operations) {
      const relativePath = path.relative(workspace, operation.path);
      console.log(chalk.bold(`📄 ${relativePath} (${operation.mode})`));

      if (options.verbose) {
        const diffText = reportGenerator.generateDiff(operation);
        console.log(diffText);
        console.log(&#39;&#39;); // Empty line separator
      }
    }

    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📊 Summary:&#39;));
    console.log(`  Files to modify: ${plan.operations.length}`);
    console.log(`  New files: ${plan.operations.filter(op =&gt; !op.originalExists).length}`);
    console.log(`  Existing files: ${plan.operations.filter(op =&gt; op.originalExists).length}`);
  }

  // Generate diff.txt file
  const diffContent = plan.operations.map(op =&gt; reportGenerator.generateDiff(op)).join(&#39;\n\n&#39;);
  await outputManager.writeDiffFile(diffContent);

  outputManager.close();
  return 0;
}

/**
 * Generate JUnit XML report
 */
function _generateJUnitXML(summary: ExecutionSummary): string {
  const testcases = summary.results
    .map(
      result =&gt; `
    &lt;testcase 
      classname=&quot;Epic.${summary.epicId}&quot; 
      name=&quot;${result.name}&quot; 
      time=&quot;${(result.duration || 0) / 1000}&quot;&gt;
      ${result.passed ? &#39;&#39; : `&lt;failure message=&quot;${result.error || &#39;Test failed&#39;}&quot;&gt;${result.error || &#39;Test failed&#39;}&lt;/failure&gt;`}
    &lt;/testcase&gt;`
    )
    .join(&#39;&#39;);

  return `&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot;?&gt;
&lt;testsuite 
  name=&quot;Epic.${summary.epicId}&quot; 
  tests=&quot;${summary.testsRun}&quot; 
  failures=&quot;${summary.testsRun - summary.testsPassed}&quot; 
  time=&quot;${summary.duration / 1000}&quot;
  timestamp=&quot;${summary.timestamp}&quot;&gt;
  ${testcases}
&lt;/testsuite&gt;`;
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/types/api.ts
/**
 * Frontend types matching backend API contracts
 * Synchronized with backend/src/types.ts
 */

// Database entity types
export interface Project {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
}

export interface Fragment {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  path: string;
  content: string;
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
}

export interface Version {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  spec_hash: string;
  resolved_json: string;
  created_at: string;
}

export interface Event {
  id: string;
  project_id: string;
  event_type: EventType;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  created_at: string;
}

// Event types for real-time collaboration
export type EventType =
  | &quot;fragment_created&quot;
  | &quot;fragment_updated&quot;
  | &quot;fragment_deleted&quot;
  | &quot;validation_started&quot;
  | &quot;validation_completed&quot;
  | &quot;validation_failed&quot;
  | &quot;version_frozen&quot;;

// API request/response types
export interface CreateFragmentRequest {
  path: string;
  content: string;
}

export interface CreateFragmentResponse {
  id: string;
  path: string;
  created_at: string;
}

export interface ResolvedSpecResponse {
  spec_hash: string;
  resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  last_updated: string;
}

export interface ValidationRequest {
  force?: boolean;
}

export interface ValidationResponse {
  success: boolean;
  spec_hash: string;
  errors: ValidationError[];
  warnings: ValidationWarning[];
}

export interface ValidationError {
  type: &quot;schema&quot; | &quot;assertion&quot; | &quot;custom&quot;;
  message: string;
  location?: string;
  details?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface ValidationWarning {
  type: &quot;orphan_token&quot; | &quot;coverage&quot; | &quot;duplicate&quot;;
  message: string;
  location?: string;
}

// Gap analysis types
export interface GapSet {
  missing_capabilities: string[];
  orphaned_tokens: TokenReference[];
  coverage_gaps: CoverageGap[];
  duplicates: Duplicate[];
}

export interface TokenReference {
  token: string;
  defined_in: string[];
  referenced_in: string[];
}

export interface CoverageGap {
  capability: string;
  expected_coverage: number;
  actual_coverage: number;
  missing_scenarios: string[];
}

export interface Duplicate {
  type: &quot;capability&quot; | &quot;requirement&quot; | &quot;test_case&quot;;
  name: string;
  locations: string[];
}

// IR (Intermediate Representation) types for diagrams
export type IRKind = &quot;flow&quot; | &quot;fsm&quot; | &quot;view&quot; | &quot;site&quot;;

export interface IRResponse {
  kind: IRKind;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  generated_at: string;
}

// Specialized IR types for different diagrams
export interface FlowIR {
  nodes: FlowNode[];
  edges: FlowEdge[];
  clusters?: FlowCluster[];
}

export interface FlowNode {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  type: &quot;start&quot; | &quot;end&quot; | &quot;process&quot; | &quot;decision&quot; | &quot;data&quot;;
  metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface FlowEdge {
  from: string;
  to: string;
  label?: string;
  type?: &quot;normal&quot; | &quot;conditional&quot; | &quot;error&quot;;
}

export interface FlowCluster {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  nodes: string[];
}

export interface SiteIR {
  routes: SiteRoute[];
  dependencies: SiteDependency[];
}

export interface SiteRoute {
  id: string;
  path: string;
  method: &quot;GET&quot; | &quot;POST&quot; | &quot;PUT&quot; | &quot;DELETE&quot; | &quot;PATCH&quot;;
  handler: string;
  dependencies: string[];
}

export interface SiteDependency {
  from: string;
  to: string;
  type: &quot;data&quot; | &quot;service&quot; | &quot;auth&quot;;
}

export interface FsmIR {
  states: FsmState[];
  transitions: FsmTransition[];
  initial: string;
  final: string[];
}

export interface FsmState {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  type: &quot;normal&quot; | &quot;initial&quot; | &quot;final&quot; | &quot;compound&quot;;
  metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface FsmTransition {
  from: string;
  to: string;
  event: string;
  guard?: string;
  action?: string;
}

export interface ViewIR {
  tokens: ViewToken[];
  connections: ViewConnection[];
  layout: ViewLayout;
}

export interface ViewToken {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  type: &quot;capability&quot; | &quot;requirement&quot; | &quot;test&quot; | &quot;data&quot;;
  position: { x: number; y: number };
  metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface ViewConnection {
  from: string;
  to: string;
  type: &quot;implements&quot; | &quot;tests&quot; | &quot;depends_on&quot; | &quot;provides&quot;;
}

export interface ViewLayout {
  width: number;
  height: number;
  padding: number;
}

// Version freezing
export interface FreezeRequest {
  version_name: string;
  description?: string;
}

export interface FreezeResponse {
  version_id: string;
  spec_hash: string;
  frozen_at: string;
}

// WebSocket message types
export interface WebSocketMessage {
  type: &quot;event&quot; | &quot;error&quot; | &quot;ping&quot; | &quot;pong&quot;;
  project_id?: string;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

// WebSocket events for real-time collaboration
export interface WsEvent {
  type: &quot;fragment_updated&quot; | &quot;resolved_updated&quot; | &quot;gaps_updated&quot; | &quot;ir_updated&quot;;
  project_id: string;
  data: WsEventData;
  timestamp: string;
  user?: string;
}

export type WsEventData =
  | WsFragmentUpdatedData
  | WsResolvedUpdatedData
  | WsGapsUpdatedData
  | WsIrUpdatedData;

export interface WsFragmentUpdatedData {
  fragment: Fragment;
  operation: &quot;created&quot; | &quot;updated&quot; | &quot;deleted&quot;;
}

export interface WsResolvedUpdatedData {
  spec_hash: string;
  resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
}

export interface WsGapsUpdatedData {
  gaps: GapSet;
  spec_hash: string;
}

export interface WsIrUpdatedData {
  kind: IRKind;
  data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  spec_hash: string;
}

// Webhook Handler types
export interface WebhookHandler {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  provider: WebhookProvider;
  event_type: string;
  enabled: boolean;
  code: string;
  created_at: string;
  updated_at: string;
  last_execution?: string;
  execution_count: number;
  success_count: number;
  error_count: number;
}

export type WebhookProvider = &quot;github&quot; | &quot;gitlab&quot; | &quot;bitbucket&quot; | &quot;slack&quot; | &quot;discord&quot; | &quot;custom&quot;;

export interface CreateHandlerRequest {
  name: string;
  provider: WebhookProvider;
  event_type: string;
  code: string;
  enabled?: boolean;
}

export interface UpdateHandlerRequest {
  name?: string;
  provider?: WebhookProvider;
  event_type?: string;
  code?: string;
  enabled?: boolean;
}

export interface HandlerExecution {
  id: string;
  handler_id: string;
  status: &quot;success&quot; | &quot;error&quot; | &quot;timeout&quot;;
  started_at: string;
  completed_at?: string;
  duration_ms?: number;
  payload: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  result?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;;
  error_message?: string;
  error_stack?: string;
}

export interface HandlerStats {
  handler_id: string;
  total_executions: number;
  successful_executions: number;
  failed_executions: number;
  avg_duration_ms: number;
  last_execution?: string;
  recent_executions: HandlerExecution[];
}

// Error response structure (RFC 7807 Problem Details)
export interface ProblemDetails {
  type: string;
  title: string;
  status: number;
  detail?: string;
  instance?: string;
  [key: string]: unknown;
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/webhook.ts
/**
 * Webhook management commands
 */
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { formatJson, formatTable } from &#39;../utils/formatting.js&#39;;
import { withProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;

export interface WebhookOptions {
  projectId?: string;
  provider?: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;;
  repository?: string;
  events?: string;
  enabled?: boolean;
  secret?: string;
  format: &#39;table&#39; | &#39;json&#39; | &#39;yaml&#39;;
  dry?: boolean;
  force?: boolean;
}

export interface WebhookConfigOptions {
  show?: boolean;
  set?: boolean;
  unset?: boolean;
  list?: boolean;
}

/**
 * List webhook configurations
 */
export async function listWebhooksCommand(
  options: WebhookOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const client = new ApiClient(config);

  try {
    const webhooksData = await withProgress({ text: &#39;Fetching webhooks...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
      const response = await client.request(&#39;/api/webhooks&#39;, {
        method: &#39;GET&#39;,
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(`Failed to fetch webhooks: ${response.statusText}`);
      }

      return response.json();
    });

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(webhooksData));
      return 0;
    }

    // Display webhook status
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📡 Webhook Configuration\n&#39;));

    console.log(`Status: ${webhooksData.enabled ? chalk.green(&#39;Enabled&#39;) : chalk.red(&#39;Disabled&#39;)}`);
    console.log(`Providers: ${webhooksData.providers.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);

    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n🔗 Endpoints:\n&#39;));
    Object.entries(webhooksData.endpoints).forEach(([provider, endpoint]) =&gt; {
      console.log(`  ${provider}: ${config.apiUrl}${endpoint}`);
    });

    if (webhooksData.configuration) {
      console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n⚙️  Configuration:\n&#39;));

      const configRows = [
        [&#39;Sync on Push&#39;, webhooksData.configuration.sync_on_push ? &#39;Yes&#39; : &#39;No&#39;],
        [&#39;Validate on Merge&#39;, webhooksData.configuration.validate_on_merge ? &#39;Yes&#39; : &#39;No&#39;],
        [&#39;Allowed Repos&#39;, String(webhooksData.configuration.allowed_repos?.length || 0)],
        [&#39;GitHub Secret&#39;, webhooksData.configuration.github_secret ? &#39;Set&#39; : &#39;Not set&#39;],
        [&#39;GitLab Secret&#39;, webhooksData.configuration.gitlab_secret ? &#39;Set&#39; : &#39;Not set&#39;],
      ];

      console.log(formatTable([&#39;Setting&#39;, &#39;Value&#39;], configRows));
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error listing webhooks:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : error
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Get webhook configuration for a specific project
 */
export async function getWebhookCommand(
  projectId: string,
  options: WebhookOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!projectId) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Error: Project ID is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  const client = new ApiClient(config);

  try {
    const webhookConfig = await withProgress(
      { text: `Getting webhook config for ${projectId}...` },
      async () =&gt; {
        const response = await client.request(`/api/webhooks/${projectId}`, {
          method: &#39;GET&#39;,
        });

        if (!response.ok) {
          if (response.status === 404) {
            throw new Error(&#39;No webhook configuration found for this project&#39;);
          }
          throw new Error(`Failed to get webhook config: ${response.statusText}`);
        }

        return response.json();
      }
    );

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(webhookConfig));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.blue(`\n📡 Webhook Configuration - ${projectId}\n`));

    const configRows = [
      [&#39;Provider&#39;, webhookConfig.provider],
      [&#39;Repository&#39;, webhookConfig.repository_url || &#39;Not set&#39;],
      [&#39;Enabled&#39;, webhookConfig.enabled ? &#39;Yes&#39; : &#39;No&#39;],
      [&#39;Events&#39;, webhookConfig.events.join(&#39;, &#39;)],
      [&#39;Created&#39;, new Date(webhookConfig.created_at).toLocaleString()],
      [&#39;Updated&#39;, new Date(webhookConfig.updated_at).toLocaleString()],
    ];

    console.log(formatTable([&#39;Property&#39;, &#39;Value&#39;], configRows));

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error getting webhook config:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : error
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Create or update webhook configuration
 */
export async function setWebhookCommand(
  projectId: string,
  options: WebhookOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!projectId) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Error: Project ID is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  if (!options.provider) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Error: Provider (--provider github|gitlab) is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  const client = new ApiClient(config);

  try {
    const webhookConfig = {
      project_id: projectId,
      provider: options.provider,
      repository_url: options.repository || &#39;&#39;,
      enabled: options.enabled ?? true,
      events: options.events ? options.events.split(&#39;,&#39;) : [&#39;push&#39;],
      secret_hash: options.secret ? Buffer.from(options.secret).toString(&#39;base64&#39;) : undefined,
    };

    if (options.dry) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;🔍 Dry run - would create/update webhook config:&#39;));
      console.log(formatJson(webhookConfig));
      return 0;
    }

    const result = await withProgress({ text: &#39;Creating/updating webhook config...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
      const response = await client.request(&#39;/api/webhooks&#39;, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        headers: {
          &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
        },
        body: JSON.stringify(webhookConfig),
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        throw new Error(`Failed to create webhook config: ${response.statusText}`);
      }

      return response.json();
    });

    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(result));
      return 0;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Webhook configuration saved successfully&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.blue(`\n📡 Configuration for ${projectId}:\n`));

    const configRows = [
      [&#39;Provider&#39;, result.provider],
      [&#39;Repository&#39;, result.repository_url || &#39;Not set&#39;],
      [&#39;Enabled&#39;, result.enabled ? &#39;Yes&#39; : &#39;No&#39;],
      [&#39;Events&#39;, result.events.join(&#39;, &#39;)],
    ];

    console.log(formatTable([&#39;Property&#39;, &#39;Value&#39;], configRows));

    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n🔗 Webhook URL:&#39;));
    console.log(`${config.apiUrl}/webhooks/${result.provider}`);

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error setting webhook config:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : error
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Delete webhook configuration
 */
export async function deleteWebhookCommand(
  projectId: string,
  options: WebhookOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!projectId) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Error: Project ID is required&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  if (!options.force) {
    console.log(
      chalk.yellow(&#39;Warning: This will delete the webhook configuration for this project.&#39;)
    );
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;Use --force to confirm deletion.&#39;));
    return 1;
  }

  const client = new ApiClient(config);

  try {
    await withProgress({ text: `Deleting webhook config for ${projectId}...` }, async () =&gt; {
      const response = await client.request(`/api/webhooks/${projectId}`, {
        method: &#39;DELETE&#39;,
      });

      if (!response.ok) {
        if (response.status === 404) {
          throw new Error(&#39;No webhook configuration found for this project&#39;);
        }
        throw new Error(`Failed to delete webhook config: ${response.statusText}`);
      }

      return response.json();
    });

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Webhook configuration deleted successfully&#39;));
    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error deleting webhook config:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : error
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Test webhook endpoint
 */
export async function testWebhookCommand(
  provider: &#39;github&#39; | &#39;gitlab&#39;,
  options: WebhookOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  if (!provider || ![&#39;github&#39;, &#39;gitlab&#39;].includes(provider)) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&quot;Error: Provider must be &#39;github&#39; or &#39;gitlab&#39;&quot;));
    return 1;
  }

  // Create a test payload based on provider
  const testPayload =
    provider === &#39;github&#39;
      ? {
          repository: {
            full_name: &#39;test/repo&#39;,
            clone_url: &#39;https://github.com/test/repo.git&#39;,
          },
          commits: [
            {
              id: &#39;abc123&#39;,
              message: &#39;Test commit&#39;,
              author: {
                name: &#39;Test User&#39;,
                email: &#39;test@example.com&#39;,
              },
            },
          ],
          ref: &#39;refs/heads/main&#39;,
        }
      : {
          repository: {
            full_name: &#39;test/repo&#39;,
            clone_url: &#39;https://gitlab.com/test/repo.git&#39;,
          },
          commits: [
            {
              id: &#39;abc123&#39;,
              message: &#39;Test commit&#39;,
              author: {
                name: &#39;Test User&#39;,
                email: &#39;test@example.com&#39;,
              },
            },
          ],
          ref: &#39;refs/heads/main&#39;,
        };

  const client = new ApiClient(config);

  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(`🧪 Testing ${provider} webhook endpoint...\n`));

    if (options.dry) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;🔍 Dry run - would send test payload:&#39;));
      console.log(formatJson(testPayload));
      return 0;
    }

    const result = await withProgress({ text: &#39;Sending test webhook...&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
      const headers: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {
        &#39;Content-Type&#39;: &#39;application/json&#39;,
      };

      // Add provider-specific headers
      if (provider === &#39;github&#39;) {
        headers[&#39;x-github-event&#39;] = &#39;push&#39;;
        if (options.secret) {
          // For testing, we&#39;ll skip signature generation
          headers[&#39;x-hub-signature-256&#39;] = &#39;sha256=test&#39;;
        }
      } else {
        headers[&#39;x-gitlab-event&#39;] = &#39;Push Hook&#39;;
        if (options.secret) {
          headers[&#39;x-gitlab-token&#39;] = options.secret;
        }
      }

      const response = await client.request(`/webhooks/${provider}`, {
        method: &#39;POST&#39;,
        headers,
        body: JSON.stringify(testPayload),
      });

      return {
        ok: response.ok,
        status: response.status,
        data: await response.json(),
      };
    });

    if (result.ok) {
      console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Webhook test successful&#39;));
      if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
        console.log(formatJson(result.data));
      } else {
        console.log(`Status: ${result.status}`);
        console.log(`Message: ${result.data.message}`);
        if (result.data.actions_taken) {
          console.log(`Actions: ${result.data.actions_taken.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);
        }
      }
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Webhook test failed&#39;));
      console.log(`Status: ${result.status}`);
      console.log(`Error: ${result.data.message || &#39;Unknown error&#39;}`);
    }

    return result.ok ? 0 : 1;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Error testing webhook:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : error
    );
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Show webhook setup instructions
 */
export function showWebhookHelp(): void {
  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📡 Webhook Setup Guide\n&#39;));

  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;1. Enable webhooks in your Arbiter server:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   export WEBHOOKS_ENABLED=true&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   export WEBHOOK_SECRET=your-secret-key&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   export GITHUB_WEBHOOK_SECRET=github-specific-secret&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   export GITLAB_WEBHOOK_SECRET=gitlab-specific-secret&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n2. Set up Cloudflare tunnel for local development:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   ./scripts/cloudflare-tunnel.sh start&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n3. Configure webhook in your repository:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   GitHub: Settings → Webhooks → Add webhook&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   GitLab: Settings → Webhooks → Add webhook&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n4. Webhook configuration:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   URL: https://your-tunnel.cfargotunnel.com/webhooks/github&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   Content type: application/json&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   Secret: (your webhook secret)&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   Events: push, pull requests (GitHub) / push, merge requests (GitLab)&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n5. Test your webhook:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook test github --secret your-secret&#39;);

  console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;\n📚 Commands:&#39;));
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook list                     - List webhook status&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook get &lt;project-id&gt;         - Get webhook config&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook set &lt;project-id&gt; [opts]  - Set webhook config&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook delete &lt;project-id&gt;      - Delete webhook config&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook test &lt;provider&gt;          - Test webhook endpoint&#39;);
  console.log(&#39;   arbiter webhook help                     - Show this help&#39;);
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/platform-detection.ts
/**
 * Platform Detection Utilities for Smart Service Configuration
 *
 * Automatically detects platform context from project structure and suggests
 * appropriate service types for Cloudflare, Vercel, and Supabase platforms.
 */

import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import type { PlatformServiceType } from &#39;../cue/index.js&#39;;

export interface PlatformContext {
  detected: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39; | &#39;unknown&#39;;
  confidence: number; // 0-1 score
  indicators: string[];
  suggestions: PlatformSuggestion[];
}

export interface PlatformSuggestion {
  serviceName: string;
  serviceType: PlatformServiceType;
  reason: string;
}

/**
 * Detect platform context from project structure and files
 */
export async function detectPlatform(projectDir = &#39;.&#39;): Promise&lt;PlatformContext&gt; {
  const indicators: string[] = [];
  let cloudflareScore = 0;
  let vercelScore = 0;
  let supabaseScore = 0;

  try {
    // Check for Cloudflare indicators
    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;wrangler.toml&#39;))) {
      cloudflareScore += 0.8;
      indicators.push(&#39;wrangler.toml found&#39;);
    }

    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;workers&#39;))) {
      cloudflareScore += 0.6;
      indicators.push(&#39;workers/ directory found&#39;);
    }

    // Check for Vercel indicators
    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;vercel.json&#39;))) {
      vercelScore += 0.8;
      indicators.push(&#39;vercel.json found&#39;);
    }

    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;.vercel&#39;))) {
      vercelScore += 0.4;
      indicators.push(&#39;.vercel/ directory found&#39;);
    }

    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;api&#39;))) {
      vercelScore += 0.3;
      indicators.push(&#39;api/ directory found&#39;);
    }

    // Check for Supabase indicators
    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;supabase&#39;))) {
      supabaseScore += 0.7;
      indicators.push(&#39;supabase/ directory found&#39;);
    }

    if (await fs.pathExists(path.join(projectDir, &#39;.env&#39;))) {
      const envContent = await fs.readFile(path.join(projectDir, &#39;.env&#39;), &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      if (envContent.includes(&#39;SUPABASE&#39;)) {
        supabaseScore += 0.5;
        indicators.push(&#39;SUPABASE env vars found&#39;);
      }
      if (envContent.includes(&#39;CLOUDFLARE&#39;)) {
        cloudflareScore += 0.3;
        indicators.push(&#39;CLOUDFLARE env vars found&#39;);
      }
      if (envContent.includes(&#39;VERCEL&#39;)) {
        vercelScore += 0.3;
        indicators.push(&#39;VERCEL env vars found&#39;);
      }
    }

    // Check package.json for platform-specific dependencies
    const packageJsonPath = path.join(projectDir, &#39;package.json&#39;);
    if (await fs.pathExists(packageJsonPath)) {
      const packageJson = await fs.readJson(packageJsonPath);
      const deps = { ...packageJson.dependencies, ...packageJson.devDependencies };

      if (deps[&#39;@cloudflare/workers-types&#39;] || deps.wrangler) {
        cloudflareScore += 0.4;
        indicators.push(&#39;Cloudflare dependencies found&#39;);
      }

      if (deps[&#39;@vercel/node&#39;] || deps.vercel) {
        vercelScore += 0.4;
        indicators.push(&#39;Vercel dependencies found&#39;);
      }

      if (deps[&#39;@supabase/supabase-js&#39;] || deps.supabase) {
        supabaseScore += 0.4;
        indicators.push(&#39;Supabase dependencies found&#39;);
      }
    }
  } catch (error) {
    // Ignore file system errors
  }

  // Determine the detected platform
  const maxScore = Math.max(cloudflareScore, vercelScore, supabaseScore);
  let detected: PlatformContext[&#39;detected&#39;] = &#39;unknown&#39;;

  if (maxScore &gt;= 0.5) {
    if (cloudflareScore === maxScore) detected = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
    else if (vercelScore === maxScore) detected = &#39;vercel&#39;;
    else if (supabaseScore === maxScore) detected = &#39;supabase&#39;;
  } else if (maxScore &gt; 0) {
    detected = &#39;kubernetes&#39;; // Default to Kubernetes if some indicators but low confidence
  }

  const suggestions = generatePlatformSuggestions(detected, projectDir);

  return {
    detected,
    confidence: maxScore,
    indicators,
    suggestions,
  };
}

/**
 * Generate platform-specific service suggestions based on detected platform
 */
function generatePlatformSuggestions(
  platform: PlatformContext[&#39;detected&#39;],
  projectDir: string
): PlatformSuggestion[] {
  const suggestions: PlatformSuggestion[] = [];

  switch (platform) {
    case &#39;cloudflare&#39;:
      suggestions.push(
        {
          serviceName: &#39;worker&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;cloudflare_worker&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Cloudflare Worker for API endpoints&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;database&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;cloudflare_d1&#39;,
          reason: &#39;D1 SQLite database instead of container&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;cache&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;cloudflare_kv&#39;,
          reason: &#39;KV store instead of Redis container&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;storage&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;cloudflare_r2&#39;,
          reason: &#39;R2 object storage for files&#39;,
        }
      );
      break;

    case &#39;vercel&#39;:
      suggestions.push(
        {
          serviceName: &#39;api&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;vercel_function&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Vercel Function for API routes&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;edge-api&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;vercel_edge_function&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Edge Function for low-latency endpoints&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;cache&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;vercel_kv&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Vercel KV for caching&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;database&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;vercel_postgres&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Vercel Postgres instead of container&#39;,
        }
      );
      break;

    case &#39;supabase&#39;:
      suggestions.push(
        {
          serviceName: &#39;database&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;supabase_database&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Supabase PostgreSQL database&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;auth&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;supabase_auth&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Supabase Authentication service&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;storage&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;supabase_storage&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Supabase Storage for files&#39;,
        },
        {
          serviceName: &#39;functions&#39;,
          serviceType: &#39;supabase_functions&#39;,
          reason: &#39;Supabase Edge Functions&#39;,
        }
      );
      break;
  }

  return suggestions;
}

/**
 * Get platform-appropriate service configuration defaults
 */
export function getPlatformServiceDefaults(serviceType: PlatformServiceType) {
  const defaults: Partial&lt;any&gt; = {};

  switch (serviceType) {
    // Cloudflare services
    case &#39;cloudflare_worker&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;serverless&#39;;
      defaults.runtime = &#39;worker&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;cloudflare_durable_object&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;serverless&#39;;
      defaults.runtime = &#39;durable_object&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;cloudflare_d1&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;sql&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;cloudflare_kv&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;key-value&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;cloudflare_r2&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;cloudflare&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;object-storage&#39;;
      break;

    // Vercel services
    case &#39;vercel_function&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;vercel&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;serverless&#39;;
      defaults.runtime = &#39;nodejs18.x&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;vercel_edge_function&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;vercel&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;serverless&#39;;
      defaults.runtime = &#39;edge-runtime&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;vercel_kv&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;vercel&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;key-value&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;vercel_postgres&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;vercel&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;sql&#39;;
      break;

    // Supabase services
    case &#39;supabase_database&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;supabase&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;postgresql&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;supabase_auth&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;supabase&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;auth&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;supabase_storage&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;supabase&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;managed&#39;;
      defaults.language = &#39;object-storage&#39;;
      break;

    case &#39;supabase_functions&#39;:
      defaults.platform = &#39;supabase&#39;;
      defaults.type = &#39;serverless&#39;;
      defaults.runtime = &#39;deno&#39;;
      break;
  }

  return defaults;
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/utils/logger.ts
/**
 * Development logging utility with configurable levels and quiet mode
 *
 * Usage:
 * 1. Import: import { createLogger } from &#39;./utils/logger&#39;;
 * 2. Create: const log = createLogger(&#39;ComponentName&#39;);
 * 3. Use: log.info(&#39;Message&#39;, data);
 *
 * Log levels (set via VITE_LOG_LEVEL in .env.development):
 * - SILENT (0): No output
 * - ERROR (1): Only errors
 * - WARN (2): Errors and warnings
 * - INFO (3): Errors, warnings, and info (default for quiet dev)
 * - DEBUG (4): Verbose debugging
 * - TRACE (5): Extremely verbose (render state, ping/pong, etc.)
 *
 * Runtime control (in browser console):
 * - __arbiterLogger.setLevel(&#39;DEBUG&#39;) or __arbiterLogger.setLevel(4)
 * - __arbiterLogger.current() - shows current level
 */

export enum LogLevel {
  SILENT = 0,
  ERROR = 1,
  WARN = 2,
  INFO = 3,
  DEBUG = 4,
  TRACE = 5,
}

export interface LoggerConfig {
  level: LogLevel;
  enableColors: boolean;
  enableTimestamps: boolean;
}

class Logger {
  private config: LoggerConfig = {
    level: this.getDefaultLogLevel(),
    enableColors: true,
    enableTimestamps: false,
  };

  private getDefaultLogLevel(): LogLevel {
    // Check environment variables
    const envLevel = import.meta.env.VITE_LOG_LEVEL;
    if (envLevel) {
      const level = LogLevel[envLevel.toUpperCase() as keyof typeof LogLevel];
      if (level !== undefined) return level;
    }

    // Default to INFO in development, WARN in production
    return import.meta.env.DEV ? LogLevel.INFO : LogLevel.WARN;
  }

  setLevel(level: LogLevel) {
    this.config.level = level;
  }

  setConfig(config: Partial&lt;LoggerConfig&gt;) {
    this.config = { ...this.config, ...config };
  }

  private formatMessage(
    level: string,
    category: string,
    message: string,
    ...args: any[]
  ): [string, ...any[]] {
    const parts = [];

    if (this.config.enableTimestamps) {
      parts.push(new Date().toISOString().substring(11, 23));
    }

    if (this.config.enableColors) {
      const colors = {
        ERROR: &#39;\x1b[31m&#39;, // red
        WARN: &#39;\x1b[33m&#39;, // yellow
        INFO: &#39;\x1b[36m&#39;, // cyan
        DEBUG: &#39;\x1b[32m&#39;, // green
        TRACE: &#39;\x1b[35m&#39;, // magenta
        RESET: &#39;\x1b[0m&#39;,
      };
      parts.push(`${colors[level as keyof typeof colors] || &#39;&#39;}[${level}]${colors.RESET}`);
    } else {
      parts.push(`[${level}]`);
    }

    if (category) {
      parts.push(`[${category}]`);
    }

    parts.push(message);

    return [parts.join(&#39; &#39;), ...args];
  }

  error(category: string, message: string, ...args: any[]) {
    if (this.config.level &gt;= LogLevel.ERROR) {
      console.error(...this.formatMessage(&#39;ERROR&#39;, category, message, ...args));
    }
  }

  warn(category: string, message: string, ...args: any[]) {
    if (this.config.level &gt;= LogLevel.WARN) {
      console.warn(...this.formatMessage(&#39;WARN&#39;, category, message, ...args));
    }
  }

  info(category: string, message: string, ...args: any[]) {
    if (this.config.level &gt;= LogLevel.INFO) {
      console.info(...this.formatMessage(&#39;INFO&#39;, category, message, ...args));
    }
  }

  debug(category: string, message: string, ...args: any[]) {
    if (this.config.level &gt;= LogLevel.DEBUG) {
      console.log(...this.formatMessage(&#39;DEBUG&#39;, category, message, ...args));
    }
  }

  trace(category: string, message: string, ...args: any[]) {
    if (this.config.level &gt;= LogLevel.TRACE) {
      console.log(...this.formatMessage(&#39;TRACE&#39;, category, message, ...args));
    }
  }

  // Convenience methods for common logging patterns
  wsEvent(event: any) {
    this.debug(&#39;WebSocket&#39;, &#39;Event received:&#39;, event);
  }

  wsConnection(status: &#39;connected&#39; | &#39;disconnected&#39; | &#39;reconnecting&#39;, details?: any) {
    this.info(&#39;WebSocket&#39;, `Connection ${status}`, details);
  }

  wsError(message: string, error?: any) {
    this.error(&#39;WebSocket&#39;, message, error);
  }

  appInit(step: string, data?: any) {
    this.debug(&#39;App&#39;, `Initialization: ${step}`, data);
  }

  editorSetup(message: string, data?: any) {
    this.debug(&#39;Editor&#39;, message, data);
  }

  apiRequest(method: string, url: string, data?: any) {
    this.trace(&#39;API&#39;, `${method.toUpperCase()} ${url}`, data);
  }

  apiResponse(method: string, url: string, status: number, data?: any) {
    if (status &gt;= 400) {
      this.error(&#39;API&#39;, `${method.toUpperCase()} ${url} - ${status}`, data);
    } else {
      this.trace(&#39;API&#39;, `${method.toUpperCase()} ${url} - ${status}`, data);
    }
  }
}

// Export singleton instance
export const logger = new Logger();

// Export convenience function to create category-specific loggers
export function createLogger(category: string) {
  return {
    error: (message: string, ...args: any[]) =&gt; logger.error(category, message, ...args),
    warn: (message: string, ...args: any[]) =&gt; logger.warn(category, message, ...args),
    info: (message: string, ...args: any[]) =&gt; logger.info(category, message, ...args),
    debug: (message: string, ...args: any[]) =&gt; logger.debug(category, message, ...args),
    trace: (message: string, ...args: any[]) =&gt; logger.trace(category, message, ...args),
  };
}

// Export types
export type CategoryLogger = ReturnType&lt;typeof createLogger&gt;;

// Development helper: Add to window object for runtime control
if (import.meta.env.DEV &amp;&amp; typeof window !== &#39;undefined&#39;) {
  (window as any).__arbiterLogger = {
    setLevel: (level: string | number) =&gt; {
      const logLevel =
        typeof level === &#39;string&#39; ? LogLevel[level.toUpperCase() as keyof typeof LogLevel] : level;
      if (logLevel !== undefined) {
        logger.setLevel(logLevel);
        console.log(`Log level set to: ${LogLevel[logLevel]}`);
      }
    },
    levels: LogLevel,
    current: () =&gt; LogLevel[logger.config.level],
  };
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/validate.ts
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, ValidateOptions, ValidationResult } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import {
  formatErrorDetails,
  formatJson,
  formatSummary,
  formatValidationTable,
  formatWarningDetails,
} from &#39;../utils/formatting.js&#39;;
import { withProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;

/**
 * Validate command implementation
 * Explicit validation with schema and config options
 */
export async function validateCommand(
  files: string[],
  options: ValidateOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    if (files.length === 0) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;No files specified for validation&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    // Resolve file paths
    const resolvedFiles = await resolveFiles(files, config.projectDir);

    if (resolvedFiles.length === 0) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;No valid files found&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.dim(`Validating ${resolvedFiles.length} files`));

    // Load schema if specified
    let schemaContent: string | undefined;
    if (options.schema) {
      try {
        schemaContent = await fs.readFile(options.schema, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      } catch (_error) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Cannot read schema file: ${options.schema}`));
        return 1;
      }
    }

    // Load config if specified
    let configContent: string | undefined;
    if (options.config) {
      try {
        configContent = await fs.readFile(options.config, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      } catch (_error) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Cannot read config file: ${options.config}`));
        return 1;
      }
    }

    // Validate files
    const results = await validateFiles(
      resolvedFiles,
      config,
      options,
      schemaContent,
      configContent
    );

    // Format and display results
    if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
      console.log(formatJson(results, config.color));
    } else {
      displayResults(results, options, config);
    }

    // Determine exit code
    const hasErrors = results.some(r =&gt; r.status === &#39;invalid&#39; || r.status === &#39;error&#39;);
    return hasErrors ? 1 : 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Validate command failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 2;
  }
}

/**
 * Resolve and validate file paths
 */
async function resolveFiles(files: string[], cwd: string): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
  const resolved: string[] = [];

  for (const file of files) {
    const fullPath = path.resolve(cwd, file);

    try {
      const stats = await fs.stat(fullPath);
      if (stats.isFile()) {
        resolved.push(fullPath);
      } else if (stats.isDirectory()) {
        // Find .cue files in directory
        const dirFiles = await fs.readdir(fullPath);
        const cueFiles = dirFiles.filter(f =&gt; f.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;)).map(f =&gt; path.join(fullPath, f));
        resolved.push(...cueFiles);
      }
    } catch (_error) {
      console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Cannot access ${file}`));
    }
  }

  return resolved;
}

/**
 * Validate multiple files with enhanced options
 */
async function validateFiles(
  files: string[],
  config: CLIConfig,
  options: ValidateOptions,
  schemaContent?: string,
  configContent?: string
): Promise&lt;ValidationResult[]&gt; {
  const apiClient = await initializeValidationClient(config);

  return withProgress({ text: `Validating ${files.length} files...`, color: &#39;blue&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    return await processValidationFiles(files, apiClient, options, schemaContent, configContent);
  });
}

/**
 * Initialize and verify API client for validation
 */
async function initializeValidationClient(config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;ApiClient&gt; {
  const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);

  const healthCheck = await apiClient.health();
  if (!healthCheck.success) {
    throw new Error(`Cannot connect to Arbiter server: ${healthCheck.error}`);
  }

  return apiClient;
}

/**
 * Process validation for all files
 */
async function processValidationFiles(
  files: string[],
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  options: ValidateOptions,
  schemaContent?: string,
  configContent?: string
): Promise&lt;ValidationResult[]&gt; {
  const results: ValidationResult[] = [];

  for (const file of files) {
    const result = await validateSingleFile(file, apiClient, options, schemaContent, configContent);
    results.push(result);

    if (options.verbose) {
      displayValidationProgress(result, file);
    }
  }

  return results;
}

/**
 * Display validation progress for a single file
 */
function displayValidationProgress(result: ValidationResult, file: string): void {
  const status = getValidationStatusIcon(result.status);
  console.log(`${status} ${path.basename(file)}`);
}

/**
 * Get appropriate icon for validation status
 */
function getValidationStatusIcon(status: string): string {
  switch (status) {
    case &#39;valid&#39;:
      return chalk.green(&#39;✓&#39;);
    case &#39;invalid&#39;:
      return chalk.red(&#39;✗&#39;);
    default:
      return chalk.yellow(&#39;!&#39;);
  }
}

/**
 * Validate a single file with schema and config
 */
async function validateSingleFile(
  filePath: string,
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  options: ValidateOptions,
  schemaContent?: string,
  configContent?: string
): Promise&lt;ValidationResult&gt; {
  const startTime = Date.now();

  try {
    // Read file content
    const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

    // Combine content with schema and config if provided
    let fullContent = content;

    if (schemaContent) {
      fullContent = `${schemaContent}\n\n${fullContent}`;
    }

    if (configContent) {
      fullContent = `${fullContent}\n\n${configContent}`;
    }

    // Validate using API
    const validationResult = await apiClient.validate(fullContent, {
      strict: options.strict,
    });

    if (!validationResult.success || !validationResult.data) {
      return {
        file: path.basename(filePath),
        status: &#39;error&#39;,
        errors: [
          {
            line: 0,
            column: 0,
            message: validationResult.error || &#39;Unknown validation error&#39;,
            severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
            category: &#39;api&#39;,
          },
        ],
        warnings: [],
        processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
      };
    }

    const data = validationResult.data;

    // Process errors
    const errors =
      data.errors?.map(error =&gt; ({
        line: error.line || 0,
        column: error.column || 0,
        message: error.message,
        severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
        category: &#39;validation&#39;,
      })) || [];

    // Process warnings
    const warnings =
      data.warnings?.map(warning =&gt; ({
        line: warning.line || 0,
        column: warning.column || 0,
        message: warning.message,
        category: &#39;validation&#39;,
      })) || [];

    // In strict mode, treat warnings as errors
    if (options.strict &amp;&amp; warnings.length &gt; 0) {
      warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; {
        errors.push({
          line: warning.line,
          column: warning.column,
          message: warning.message,
          severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
          category: warning.category,
        });
      });
    }

    const status = data.success &amp;&amp; (!options.strict || warnings.length === 0) ? &#39;valid&#39; : &#39;invalid&#39;;

    return {
      file: path.basename(filePath),
      status,
      errors,
      warnings: options.strict ? [] : warnings, // Clear warnings in strict mode since they become errors
      processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    return {
      file: path.basename(filePath),
      status: &#39;error&#39;,
      errors: [
        {
          line: 0,
          column: 0,
          message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
          severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
          category: &#39;system&#39;,
        },
      ],
      warnings: [],
      processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Display validation results with proper formatting
 */
function displayResults(
  results: ValidationResult[],
  options: ValidateOptions,
  _config: CLIConfig
): void {
  // Show table
  console.log(`\n${formatValidationTable(results)}`);

  // Show detailed errors if present
  if (options.verbose || results.some(r =&gt; r.errors.length &gt; 0)) {
    const errorDetails = formatErrorDetails(results);
    if (errorDetails) {
      console.log(errorDetails);
    }
  }

  // Show warnings if verbose and not in strict mode
  if (options.verbose &amp;&amp; !options.strict &amp;&amp; results.some(r =&gt; r.warnings.length &gt; 0)) {
    const warningDetails = formatWarningDetails(results);
    if (warningDetails) {
      console.log(warningDetails);
    }
  }

  // Show summary
  console.log(formatSummary(results));

  // Show strict mode note if enabled
  if (options.strict) {
    console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;\nNote: Running in strict mode (warnings treated as errors)&#39;));
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/file-watcher.ts
import chokidar from &quot;chokidar&quot;;
import { debounce } from &quot;./debounce.js&quot;;

export interface FileWatcherOptions {
  /** Paths or patterns to watch */
  paths: string[];
  /** Debounce delay in milliseconds (250-400ms per spec) */
  debounce?: number;
  /** Whether to output NDJSON for agent consumption */
  agentMode?: boolean;
  /** Custom file patterns to watch */
  patterns?: string[];
  /** Ignore patterns */
  ignored?: string[];
}

export interface WatchEvent {
  type: &quot;add&quot; | &quot;change&quot; | &quot;unlink&quot; | &quot;addDir&quot; | &quot;unlinkDir&quot;;
  path: string;
  timestamp: number;
}

export interface WatchBatch {
  events: WatchEvent[];
  timestamp: number;
  debounceWindow: number;
}

/**
 * Cross-platform file watcher with debouncing and burst coalescing
 * Implements requirements from arbiter.assembly.cue for 250-400ms debouncing
 */
export class FileWatcher {
  private watcher: chokidar.FSWatcher | null = null;
  private debouncedHandler: ((...args: any[]) =&gt; void) | null = null;
  private eventQueue: WatchEvent[] = [];
  private options: Required&lt;FileWatcherOptions&gt;;

  constructor(options: FileWatcherOptions) {
    this.options = {
      paths: options.paths,
      debounce: Math.max(250, Math.min(400, options.debounce ?? 300)), // Enforce spec limits
      agentMode: options.agentMode ?? false,
      patterns: options.patterns ?? [
        &quot;**/*.cue&quot;,
        &quot;**/arbiter.assembly.cue&quot;,
        &quot;**/*.json&quot;,
        &quot;**/*.yaml&quot;,
        &quot;**/*.yml&quot;,
      ],
      ignored: options.ignored ?? [
        &quot;node_modules/**&quot;,
        &quot;.git/**&quot;,
        &quot;dist/**&quot;,
        &quot;build/**&quot;,
        &quot;target/**&quot;,
        &quot;**/.DS_Store&quot;,
        &quot;**/Thumbs.db&quot;,
      ],
    };
  }

  /**
   * Start watching files
   */
  async start(onBatch: (batch: WatchBatch) =&gt; Promise&lt;void&gt;): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.watcher) {
      throw new Error(&quot;Watcher is already running&quot;);
    }

    // Create debounced handler for burst coalescing
    this.debouncedHandler = debounce(async () =&gt; {
      if (this.eventQueue.length &gt; 0) {
        const batch: WatchBatch = {
          events: [...this.eventQueue],
          timestamp: Date.now(),
          debounceWindow: this.options.debounce,
        };

        // Clear the queue before processing
        this.eventQueue = [];

        try {
          await onBatch(batch);
        } catch (error) {
          if (this.options.agentMode) {
            console.log(
              JSON.stringify({
                type: &quot;error&quot;,
                message: `Watch batch processing failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
                timestamp: Date.now(),
              }),
            );
          } else {
            console.error(
              `Watch batch processing failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
            );
          }
        }
      }
    }, this.options.debounce);

    // Initialize chokidar watcher
    this.watcher = chokidar.watch(this.options.paths, {
      ignored: this.options.ignored,
      persistent: true,
      ignoreInitial: false,
      followSymlinks: false, // Per spec: no symlinks for exFAT/Windows compatibility
      depth: undefined,
      awaitWriteFinish: {
        stabilityThreshold: 100,
        pollInterval: 50,
      },
      atomic: true, // Support atomic writes
    });

    // Set up event handlers
    const handleEvent = (type: WatchEvent[&quot;type&quot;]) =&gt; (path: string) =&gt; {
      // Filter by patterns if specified
      if (this.options.patterns.length &gt; 0) {
        const matchesPattern = this.options.patterns.some((pattern) =&gt; {
          // Simple glob matching - could be enhanced with a proper glob library
          const regexPattern = pattern
            .replace(/\*\*/g, &quot;.*&quot;)
            .replace(/\*/g, &quot;[^/]*&quot;)
            .replace(/\./g, &quot;\\.&quot;);
          return new RegExp(regexPattern).test(path);
        });

        if (!matchesPattern) {
          return;
        }
      }

      const event: WatchEvent = {
        type,
        path,
        timestamp: Date.now(),
      };

      this.eventQueue.push(event);

      if (this.options.agentMode) {
        // Emit individual event for agent consumption
        console.log(
          JSON.stringify({
            type: &quot;file_event&quot;,
            event,
            queueSize: this.eventQueue.length,
          }),
        );
      }

      // Trigger debounced batch processing
      this.debouncedHandler?.();
    };

    this.watcher
      .on(&quot;add&quot;, handleEvent(&quot;add&quot;))
      .on(&quot;change&quot;, handleEvent(&quot;change&quot;))
      .on(&quot;unlink&quot;, handleEvent(&quot;unlink&quot;))
      .on(&quot;addDir&quot;, handleEvent(&quot;addDir&quot;))
      .on(&quot;unlinkDir&quot;, handleEvent(&quot;unlinkDir&quot;))
      .on(&quot;error&quot;, (error) =&gt; {
        if (this.options.agentMode) {
          console.log(
            JSON.stringify({
              type: &quot;watcher_error&quot;,
              message: error.message,
              timestamp: Date.now(),
            }),
          );
        } else {
          console.error(&quot;File watcher error:&quot;, error);
        }
      })
      .on(&quot;ready&quot;, () =&gt; {
        if (this.options.agentMode) {
          console.log(
            JSON.stringify({
              type: &quot;watcher_ready&quot;,
              paths: this.options.paths,
              patterns: this.options.patterns,
              debounce: this.options.debounce,
              timestamp: Date.now(),
            }),
          );
        } else {
          console.log(
            `🔍 Watching ${this.options.paths.join(&quot;, &quot;)} (debounce: ${this.options.debounce}ms)`,
          );
        }
      });

    return new Promise((resolve) =&gt; {
      this.watcher?.on(&quot;ready&quot;, () =&gt; resolve());
    });
  }

  /**
   * Stop the file watcher
   */
  async stop(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (this.watcher) {
      await this.watcher.close();
      this.watcher = null;
    }

    this.debouncedHandler = null;
    this.eventQueue = [];
  }

  /**
   * Get current watch statistics
   */
  getStats(): {
    isWatching: boolean;
    paths: string[];
    patterns: string[];
    debounce: number;
    queueSize: number;
  } {
    return {
      isWatching: this.watcher !== null,
      paths: this.options.paths,
      patterns: this.options.patterns,
      debounce: this.options.debounce,
      queueSize: this.eventQueue.length,
    };
  }
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/formatting.ts
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import Table from &#39;cli-table3&#39;;
import type { ValidationResult } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

/**
 * Format validation results as a pretty table
 */
export function formatValidationTable(results: ValidationResult[]): string {
  if (results.length === 0) {
    return chalk.green(&#39;✓ No files to validate&#39;);
  }

  const table = new Table({
    head: [
      chalk.cyan(&#39;File&#39;),
      chalk.cyan(&#39;Status&#39;),
      chalk.cyan(&#39;Errors&#39;),
      chalk.cyan(&#39;Warnings&#39;),
      chalk.cyan(&#39;Time (ms)&#39;),
    ],
    style: {
      head: [],
      border: [&#39;dim&#39;],
    },
  });

  results.forEach(result =&gt; {
    const statusColor =
      result.status === &#39;valid&#39; ? &#39;green&#39; : result.status === &#39;invalid&#39; ? &#39;red&#39; : &#39;yellow&#39;;
    const statusSymbol = result.status === &#39;valid&#39; ? &#39;✓&#39; : result.status === &#39;invalid&#39; ? &#39;✗&#39; : &#39;!&#39;;

    table.push([
      result.file,
      chalk[statusColor](`${statusSymbol} ${result.status}`),
      result.errors.length &gt; 0 ? chalk.red(result.errors.length.toString()) : chalk.dim(&#39;0&#39;),
      result.warnings.length &gt; 0 ? chalk.yellow(result.warnings.length.toString()) : chalk.dim(&#39;0&#39;),
      formatTime(result.processingTime),
    ]);
  });

  return table.toString();
}

/**
 * Format detailed error information
 */
export function formatErrorDetails(results: ValidationResult[]): string {
  const errorResults = results.filter(r =&gt; r.errors.length &gt; 0);

  if (errorResults.length === 0) {
    return &#39;&#39;;
  }

  let output = `\n${chalk.red.bold(&#39;Validation Errors:&#39;)}\n`;

  errorResults.forEach(result =&gt; {
    output += `\n${chalk.underline(result.file)}:\n`;

    result.errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
      const location = `${error.line}:${error.column}`;
      const category = chalk.dim(`[${error.category}]`);
      output += `  ${chalk.red(&#39;error&#39;)} ${category} ${location} ${error.message}\n`;
    });
  });

  return output;
}

/**
 * Format warning information
 */
export function formatWarningDetails(results: ValidationResult[]): string {
  const warningResults = results.filter(r =&gt; r.warnings.length &gt; 0);

  if (warningResults.length === 0) {
    return &#39;&#39;;
  }

  let output = `\n${chalk.yellow.bold(&#39;Validation Warnings:&#39;)}\n`;

  warningResults.forEach(result =&gt; {
    output += `\n${chalk.underline(result.file)}:\n`;

    result.warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; {
      const location = `${warning.line}:${warning.column}`;
      const category = chalk.dim(`[${warning.category}]`);
      output += `  ${chalk.yellow(&#39;warning&#39;)} ${category} ${location} ${warning.message}\n`;
    });
  });

  return output;
}

/**
 * Format summary statistics
 */
export function formatSummary(results: ValidationResult[]): string {
  if (results.length === 0) {
    return chalk.dim(&#39;No files processed&#39;);
  }

  const valid = results.filter(r =&gt; r.status === &#39;valid&#39;).length;
  const invalid = results.filter(r =&gt; r.status === &#39;invalid&#39;).length;
  const errors = results.filter(r =&gt; r.status === &#39;error&#39;).length;

  const totalErrors = results.reduce((sum, r) =&gt; sum + r.errors.length, 0);
  const totalWarnings = results.reduce((sum, r) =&gt; sum + r.warnings.length, 0);
  const totalTime = results.reduce((sum, r) =&gt; sum + r.processingTime, 0);

  let summary = `\n${chalk.bold(&#39;Summary:&#39;)} `;

  if (valid &gt; 0) {
    summary += chalk.green(`${valid} valid`);
  }

  if (invalid &gt; 0) {
    if (valid &gt; 0) summary += &#39;, &#39;;
    summary += chalk.red(`${invalid} invalid`);
  }

  if (errors &gt; 0) {
    if (valid &gt; 0 || invalid &gt; 0) summary += &#39;, &#39;;
    summary += chalk.yellow(`${errors} errors`);
  }

  summary += ` (${results.length} total)`;

  if (totalErrors &gt; 0) {
    summary += `\n${chalk.red(`${totalErrors} errors`)}`;
  }

  if (totalWarnings &gt; 0) {
    summary += `${totalErrors &gt; 0 ? &#39;, &#39; : &#39;\n&#39;}${chalk.yellow(`${totalWarnings} warnings`)}`;
  }

  summary += `\nProcessed in ${formatTime(totalTime)}`;

  return summary;
}

/**
 * Format time in milliseconds with appropriate units
 */
export function formatTime(ms: number): string {
  if (ms &lt; 1000) {
    return chalk.dim(`${ms}ms`);
  }
  if (ms &lt; 60000) {
    return chalk.dim(`${(ms / 1000).toFixed(2)}s`);
  }
  const minutes = Math.floor(ms / 60000);
  const seconds = ((ms % 60000) / 1000).toFixed(0);
  return chalk.dim(`${minutes}m ${seconds}s`);
}

/**
 * Format JSON output with colors
 */
export function formatJson(data: any, color = true): string {
  const json = JSON.stringify(data, null, 2);

  if (!color) {
    return json;
  }

  // Basic JSON syntax highlighting
  return json
    .replace(/(&quot;.*?&quot;)\s*:/g, (_, key) =&gt; `${chalk.blue(key)}:`)
    .replace(/:\s*(&quot;.*?&quot;)/g, (_, value) =&gt; `: ${chalk.green(value)}`)
    .replace(/:\s*(true|false|null)/g, (_, value) =&gt; `: ${chalk.yellow(value)}`)
    .replace(/:\s*(\d+\.?\d*)/g, (_, value) =&gt; `: ${chalk.magenta(value)}`);
}

/**
 * Format file size in human readable format
 */
export function formatFileSize(bytes: number): string {
  const sizes = [&#39;B&#39;, &#39;KB&#39;, &#39;MB&#39;, &#39;GB&#39;];
  if (bytes === 0) return &#39;0 B&#39;;

  const i = Math.floor(Math.log(bytes) / Math.log(1024));
  const size = (bytes / 1024 ** i).toFixed(1);

  return chalk.dim(`${size} ${sizes[i]}`);
}

/**
 * Create a textual progress bar representation
 */
export function createTextProgressBar(current: number, total: number, width = 40): string {
  const percentage = Math.round((current / total) * 100);
  const filled = Math.round((current / total) * width);
  const empty = width - filled;

  const bar = &#39;█&#39;.repeat(filled) + &#39;░&#39;.repeat(empty);

  return `${chalk.cyan(bar)} ${chalk.bold(`${percentage}%`)} (${current}/${total})`;
}

/**
 * Format exit code message
 */
export function formatExitMessage(exitCode: number, operation: string): string {
  switch (exitCode) {
    case 0:
      return chalk.green(`✓ ${operation} completed successfully`);
    case 1:
      return chalk.red(`✗ ${operation} failed with validation errors`);
    case 2:
      return chalk.red(`✗ ${operation} failed with system errors`);
    default:
      return chalk.red(`✗ ${operation} failed with unknown error (exit code: ${exitCode})`);
  }
}

/**
 * Format data as a table with headers and rows
 */
export function formatTable(headers: string[], rows: string[][]): string {
  if (rows.length === 0) {
    return chalk.dim(&#39;No data to display&#39;);
  }

  const table = new Table({
    head: headers.map(header =&gt; chalk.cyan(header)),
    style: {
      head: [],
      border: [&#39;dim&#39;],
    },
  });

  rows.forEach(row =&gt; {
    table.push(row);
  });

  return table.toString();
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/add.ts
/**
 * Add command - Compositional interface for building specifications
 *
 * COMPLETELY REWRITTEN to use proper AST-based CUE manipulation
 * instead of fragile string concatenation.
 *
 * This command allows users to incrementally build up their project specification
 * stored under the .arbiter/ directory through discrete, validated operations
 * using the CUE tool.
 */

import * as path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import {
  type DatabaseConfig,
  type EndpointConfig,
  type FlowConfig,
  type PlatformServiceType,
  type RouteConfig,
  type ServiceConfig,
  createCUEManipulator,
  formatCUE,
  validateCUE,
} from &#39;../cue/index.js&#39;;
import {
  type VariableContext,
  extractVariablesFromCue,
  templateManager,
} from &#39;../templates/index.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { detectPlatform, getPlatformServiceDefaults } from &#39;../utils/platform-detection.js&#39;;

export interface AddOptions {
  verbose?: boolean;
  dryRun?: boolean;
  force?: boolean;
  template?: string;
}

/**
 * Main add command dispatcher
 */
export async function addCommand(
  subcommand: string,
  name: string,
  options: AddOptions &amp; Record&lt;string, any&gt;,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const manipulator = createCUEManipulator();

  try {
    console.log(chalk.blue(`🔧 Adding ${subcommand}: ${name}`));

    // Get existing assembly content from sharded storage in service
    const assemblyPath = path.resolve(&#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;assembly.cue&#39;); // Move to .arbiter directory
    let assemblyContent = &#39;&#39;;

    // Initialize API client to try getting existing specification from sharded storage
    const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);

    try {
      // First try to get the specification from the service&#39;s sharded storage
      const storedSpec = await apiClient.getSpecification(&#39;assembly&#39;, assemblyPath);
      if (storedSpec.success &amp;&amp; storedSpec.data &amp;&amp; storedSpec.data.content) {
        assemblyContent = storedSpec.data.content;
        if (options.verbose) {
          console.log(
            chalk.dim(&#39;📡 Retrieved existing specification from service (sharded storage)&#39;)
          );
        }
      } else {
        throw new Error(&#39;No stored specification found&#39;);
      }
    } catch (_apiError) {
      // Fallback to local .arbiter storage only
      if (fs.existsSync(assemblyPath)) {
        assemblyContent = fs.readFileSync(assemblyPath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
        if (options.verbose) {
          console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;📁 Retrieved existing specification from .arbiter directory&#39;));
        }
      } else {
        // Initialize with basic structure
        console.log(
          chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  No existing specification found. Creating new specification...&#39;)
        );
        assemblyContent = await initializeAssembly();
      }
    }

    let updatedContent = assemblyContent;

    // Route to appropriate handler using AST-based manipulation
    switch (subcommand) {
      case &#39;service&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addService(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;endpoint&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addEndpoint(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;route&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addRoute(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;flow&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addFlow(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;load-balancer&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addLoadBalancer(manipulator, assemblyContent, options);
        break;
      case &#39;database&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addDatabase(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;cache&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addCache(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;locator&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addLocator(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;schema&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addSchema(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;package&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addPackage(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;component&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addComponent(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      case &#39;module&#39;:
        updatedContent = await addModule(manipulator, assemblyContent, name, options);
        break;
      default:
        console.error(chalk.red(`❌ Unknown subcommand: ${subcommand}`));
        console.log(
          chalk.dim(
            &#39;Available subcommands: service, endpoint, route, flow, load-balancer, database, cache, locator, schema, package, component, module&#39;
          )
        );
        return 1;
    }

    // Validate the updated content using CUE tool
    const validationResult = await validateCUE(updatedContent);
    if (!validationResult.valid) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ CUE validation failed:&#39;));
      validationResult.errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
        console.error(chalk.red(`  • ${error}`));
      });
      return 1;
    }

    // Store specification in service or preview changes
    if (options.dryRun) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;🔍 Dry run - changes that would be made:&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(showDiff(assemblyContent, updatedContent)));
    } else {
      // Initialize API client and store specification in service database
      const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);

      try {
        // Determine shard type based on subcommand
        const shardType = getShardTypeForSubcommand(subcommand);

        // Store the updated CUE specification in the service with sharding
        const storeResult = await apiClient.storeSpecification({
          content: updatedContent,
          type: shardType,
          path: assemblyPath,
          shard: shardType, // Use shard type as shard identifier
        });

        if (storeResult.success) {
          console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Updated specification in service (${subcommand}: ${name})`));
          console.log(
            chalk.dim(&#39;💡 CUE files will be generated to .arbiter/ when specification is complete&#39;)
          );

          if (storeResult.data?.shard) {
            console.log(chalk.dim(`   Stored in shard: ${storeResult.data.shard}`));
          }

          if (options.verbose) {
            console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Added configuration:&#39;));
            console.log(chalk.dim(showDiff(assemblyContent, updatedContent)));
          }
        } else {
          throw new Error(storeResult.error || &#39;Failed to store specification&#39;);
        }
      } catch (apiError) {
        // Fallback to file system if API is not available
        console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  Service unavailable, storing locally as fallback&#39;));

        // Ensure .arbiter directory exists
        await fs.ensureDir(&#39;.arbiter&#39;);

        // Write to .arbiter directory
        await fs.writeFile(assemblyPath, updatedContent, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
        console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Updated ${path.basename(assemblyPath)} (local fallback)`));
      }
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Failed to add component:&#39;));
    console.error(chalk.red(error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)));
    return 1;
  } finally {
    await manipulator.cleanup();
  }
}

/**
 * Initialize a new assembly file with basic structure
 */
async function initializeAssembly(): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const projectName = path.basename(process.cwd());

  const content = `package ${projectName.replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/g, &#39;&#39;)}

// Auto-generated arbiter.assembly.cue
// Build your specification incrementally with: arbiter add &lt;component&gt;

product: {
  name: &quot;${toTitleCase(projectName)}&quot;
  goals: [&quot;Application goals will be defined here&quot;]
}

ui: routes: []

locators: {}

flows: []

// V1 compatibility structure
config: {
  language: &quot;typescript&quot;
  kind: &quot;service&quot;
}

metadata: {
  name: &quot;${projectName}&quot;
  version: &quot;1.0.0&quot;
}

deployment: {
  target: &quot;kubernetes&quot;
}

services: {}`;

  // Format using CUE tool
  return await formatCUE(content);
}

/**
 * Add a service using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addService(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  serviceName: string,
  options: {
    language?: string;
    port?: number;
    image?: string;
    directory?: string;
    template?: string;
    platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
    serviceType?: PlatformServiceType;
    [key: string]: any;
  }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const { language = &#39;typescript&#39;, port, image, directory, template } = options;

  // If template is specified, use template-based generation
  if (template) {
    return await addServiceWithTemplate(manipulator, content, serviceName, options);
  }

  // Detect platform context if not explicitly specified
  let platformContext;
  if (!options.platform &amp;&amp; !options.serviceType) {
    platformContext = await detectPlatform();

    if (platformContext.detected !== &#39;unknown&#39; &amp;&amp; platformContext.confidence &gt; 0.3) {
      console.log(
        chalk.cyan(
          `🔍 Detected ${platformContext.detected} platform (${Math.round(platformContext.confidence * 100)}% confidence)`
        )
      );

      // Show platform-specific suggestions
      if (platformContext.suggestions.length &gt; 0) {
        console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;💡 Platform-specific suggestions:&#39;));
        for (const suggestion of platformContext.suggestions) {
          console.log(
            chalk.dim(`  • Use --service-type ${suggestion.serviceType} for ${suggestion.reason}`)
          );
        }
        console.log(
          chalk.dim(&#39;  • Or use --platform kubernetes for traditional container deployment&#39;)
        );
      }
    }
  }

  // Determine service type and create proper config
  const isPrebuilt = !!image;
  let serviceConfig: ServiceConfig;

  if (options.serviceType) {
    // Use explicitly specified platform-specific service type
    const platformDefaults = getPlatformServiceDefaults(options.serviceType);
    serviceConfig = {
      serviceType: options.serviceType,
      language: platformDefaults.language || language,
      type: platformDefaults.type || &#39;serverless&#39;,
      ...(platformDefaults.platform &amp;&amp; { platform: platformDefaults.platform }),
      ...(platformDefaults.runtime &amp;&amp; { runtime: platformDefaults.runtime }),
      ...(directory &amp;&amp; { sourceDirectory: directory }),
      ...(port &amp;&amp; { ports: [{ name: &#39;http&#39;, port, targetPort: port }] }),
    };
  } else if (isPrebuilt) {
    // Container-based service
    serviceConfig = {
      serviceType: &#39;prebuilt&#39;,
      language: &#39;container&#39;,
      type:
        image &amp;&amp; (image.includes(&#39;postgres&#39;) || image.includes(&#39;mysql&#39;))
          ? &#39;statefulset&#39;
          : &#39;deployment&#39;,
      image: image!,
      ...(port &amp;&amp; { ports: [{ name: &#39;main&#39;, port, targetPort: port }] }),
    };
  } else {
    // Traditional bespoke service
    serviceConfig = {
      serviceType: &#39;bespoke&#39;,
      language,
      type: &#39;deployment&#39;,
      sourceDirectory: directory || `./src/${serviceName}`,
      ...(port &amp;&amp; { ports: [{ name: &#39;http&#39;, port, targetPort: port }] }),
    };
  }

  // Add service using AST manipulation
  let updatedContent = await manipulator.addService(content, serviceName, serviceConfig);

  // If this creates a UI service, add route to v2 structure
  if (!isPrebuilt &amp;&amp; (language === &#39;typescript&#39; || language === &#39;javascript&#39;)) {
    const routeConfig: RouteConfig = {
      id: `${serviceName}:main`,
      path: port === 3000 ? &#39;/&#39; : `/${serviceName}`,
      capabilities: [&#39;view&#39;],
      components: [`${toTitleCase(serviceName)}Page`],
    };
    updatedContent = await manipulator.addRoute(updatedContent, routeConfig);

    // Add basic locator
    const locatorKey = `page:${serviceName}`;
    const locatorValue = `[data-testid=&quot;${serviceName}-page&quot;]`;
    updatedContent = await manipulator.addToSection(
      updatedContent,
      &#39;locators&#39;,
      locatorKey,
      locatorValue
    );
  }

  return updatedContent;
}

/**
 * Service template options
 */
interface ServiceTemplateOptions {
  language?: string;
  port?: number;
  image?: string;
  directory?: string;
  template?: string;
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Add a service using a template (with AST-based CUE manipulation)
 */
async function addServiceWithTemplate(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  serviceName: string,
  options: ServiceTemplateOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const { template, directory = `./src/${serviceName}` } = options;

  if (!template) {
    throw new Error(&#39;Template name is required for template-based generation&#39;);
  }

  try {
    await validateTemplateExists(template);
    await executeTemplate(serviceName, template, content, directory, options);
    const serviceConfig = createTemplateServiceConfig(serviceName, directory, options);

    let updatedContent = await manipulator.addService(content, serviceName, serviceConfig);

    if (shouldAddUIComponents(options)) {
      updatedContent = await addUIComponentsForService(
        manipulator,
        updatedContent,
        serviceName,
        options
      );
    }

    return updatedContent;
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(
      `Template generation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Validate that template exists in template manager
 */
async function validateTemplateExists(template: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  await templateManager.loadConfig();

  const alias = templateManager.getAlias(template);
  if (!alias) {
    const availableTemplates = Object.keys(templateManager.getAliases());
    throw new Error(
      `Template &#39;${template}&#39; not found. Available templates: ${availableTemplates.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Execute template generation
 */
async function executeTemplate(
  serviceName: string,
  template: string,
  content: string,
  directory: string,
  options: ServiceTemplateOptions
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  console.log(chalk.blue(`🔧 Generating service &#39;${serviceName}&#39; using template &#39;${template}&#39;`));

  const variables = extractVariablesFromCue(content, serviceName);
  variables.serviceName = serviceName;
  if (options.language) variables.language = options.language;
  if (options.port) variables.port = options.port;

  await fs.ensureDir(path.resolve(directory));
  await templateManager.executeTemplate(template, path.resolve(directory), variables);

  console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Template &#39;${template}&#39; applied successfully to &#39;${directory}&#39;`));
}

/**
 * Create service configuration for template-based service
 */
function createTemplateServiceConfig(
  serviceName: string,
  directory: string,
  options: ServiceTemplateOptions
): ServiceConfig {
  return {
    serviceType: &#39;bespoke&#39;,
    language: options.language || &#39;typescript&#39;,
    type: &#39;deployment&#39;,
    sourceDirectory: directory,
    template: options.template!,
    ...(options.port &amp;&amp; {
      ports: [{ name: &#39;http&#39;, port: options.port, targetPort: options.port }],
    }),
  };
}

/**
 * Check if UI components should be added
 */
function shouldAddUIComponents(options: ServiceTemplateOptions): boolean {
  return !options.image &amp;&amp; (options.language === &#39;typescript&#39; || options.language === &#39;javascript&#39;);
}

/**
 * Add UI components and routes for service
 */
