async function addUIComponentsForService(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  serviceName: string,
  options: ServiceTemplateOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const routeConfig: RouteConfig = {
    id: `${serviceName}:main`,
    path: options.port === 3000 ? &#39;/&#39; : `/${serviceName}`,
    capabilities: [&#39;view&#39;],
    components: [`${toTitleCase(serviceName)}Page`],
  };

  let updatedContent = await manipulator.addRoute(content, routeConfig);

  const locatorKey = `page:${serviceName}`;
  const locatorValue = `[data-testid=&quot;${serviceName}-page&quot;]`;
  updatedContent = await manipulator.addToSection(
    updatedContent,
    &#39;locators&#39;,
    locatorKey,
    locatorValue
  );

  return updatedContent;
}

/**
 * Add an API endpoint using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addEndpoint(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  endpoint: string,
  options: {
    service?: string;
    method?: string;
    returns?: string;
    accepts?: string;
    [key: string]: any;
  }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const { service = &#39;api&#39;, method = &#39;GET&#39;, returns, accepts } = options;

  // Ensure the service exists by parsing the content
  try {
    const ast = await manipulator.parse(content);
    if (!ast.services || !ast.services[service]) {
      throw new Error(
        `Service &quot;${service}&quot; not found. Add it first with: arbiter add service ${service}`
      );
    }
  } catch (parseError) {
    // Fallback check for service existence
    if (!content.includes(`${service}:`)) {
      throw new Error(
        `Service &quot;${service}&quot; not found. Add it first with: arbiter add service ${service}`
      );
    }
  }

  // Build endpoint configuration
  const endpointConfig: EndpointConfig = {
    method,
    ...(accepts &amp;&amp; { request: { $ref: `#/components/schemas/${accepts}` } }),
    ...(returns &amp;&amp; { response: { $ref: `#/components/schemas/${returns}` } }),
  };

  // Add endpoint using AST manipulation
  let updatedContent = await manipulator.addEndpoint(content, endpoint, endpointConfig);

  // Add health check validation for health endpoints
  if (endpoint === &#39;/health&#39; || endpoint.endsWith(&#39;/health&#39;)) {
    const healthCheck = {
      path: endpoint,
      port: 3000,
    };

    // Update the service with health check info
    try {
      const ast = await manipulator.parse(updatedContent);
      if (!ast.services[service].healthCheck) {
        ast.services[service].healthCheck = healthCheck;
        updatedContent = await manipulator.serialize(ast, updatedContent);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      // Fallback: try to add health check directly
      console.warn(&#39;Could not add health check via AST, health endpoint added to paths only&#39;);
    }
  }

  return updatedContent;
}

/**
 * Add a UI route using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addRoute(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  routePath: string,
  options: { id?: string; capabilities?: string; components?: string; [key: string]: any }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const routeId = options.id || generateRouteId(routePath);
  const capabilities = options.capabilities
    ? options.capabilities.split(&#39;,&#39;).map((s: string) =&gt; s.trim())
    : [&#39;view&#39;];
  const components = options.components
    ? options.components.split(&#39;,&#39;).map((s: string) =&gt; s.trim())
    : [];

  const routeConfig: RouteConfig = {
    id: routeId,
    path: routePath,
    capabilities,
    ...(components.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; { components }),
  };

  return await manipulator.addRoute(content, routeConfig);
}

/**
 * Flow configuration options
 */
interface FlowOptions {
  from?: string;
  to?: string;
  endpoint?: string;
  expect?: string;
  steps?: string;
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Flow step types
 */
type FlowStep =
  | { visit: string }
  | { click: string }
  | { expect: { locator: string; state: string } }
  | { expect_api: { method: string; path: string; status: number } };

/**
 * Add a user flow using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addFlow(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  flowId: string,
  options: FlowOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const flowSteps = generateFlowSteps(options);
  const flowConfig: FlowConfig = {
    id: flowId,
    steps: flowSteps,
  };

  return await manipulator.addFlow(content, flowConfig);
}

/**
 * Generate flow steps based on options
 */
function generateFlowSteps(options: FlowOptions): FlowStep[] {
  if (options.steps) {
    return parseCustomSteps(options.steps);
  }

  if (options.from &amp;&amp; options.to) {
    return generateNavigationFlow(options.from, options.to);
  }

  if (options.endpoint) {
    return generateApiHealthFlow(options.endpoint, options.expect || &#39;200&#39;);
  }

  throw new Error(&#39;Flow must specify either --from/--to, --endpoint, or --steps&#39;);
}

/**
 * Parse custom steps from JSON string
 */
function parseCustomSteps(stepsJson: string): FlowStep[] {
  try {
    return JSON.parse(stepsJson);
  } catch {
    throw new Error(&#39;Invalid steps format. Expected JSON array.&#39;);
  }
}

/**
 * Generate navigation flow between pages
 */
function generateNavigationFlow(from: string, to: string): FlowStep[] {
  return [
    { visit: from },
    { click: `btn:goto-${to}` },
    { expect: { locator: `page:${to}`, state: &#39;visible&#39; } },
  ];
}

/**
 * Generate API health check flow
 */
function generateApiHealthFlow(endpoint: string, expectedStatus: string): FlowStep[] {
  return [
    { expect_api: { method: &#39;GET&#39;, path: endpoint, status: Number.parseInt(expectedStatus) } },
  ];
}

/**
 * Validate that target service exists in content
 */
function validateTargetServiceExists(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  target: string
): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
  return new Promise(async resolve =&gt; {
    try {
      const ast = await manipulator.parse(content);
      resolve(!!ast.services?.[target]);
    } catch {
      resolve(content.includes(`${target}:`));
    }
  });
}

/**
 * Create load balancer service configuration
 */
function createLoadBalancerConfig(): ServiceConfig {
  return {
    serviceType: &#39;prebuilt&#39;,
    language: &#39;container&#39;,
    type: &#39;deployment&#39;,
    image: &#39;nginx:alpine&#39;,
    ports: [{ name: &#39;http&#39;, port: 80, targetPort: 80 }],
    template: &#39;nginx-loadbalancer&#39;,
  };
}

/**
 * Add health check to target service
 */
async function addHealthCheckToTarget(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  target: string,
  healthCheck: string
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  try {
    const ast = await manipulator.parse(content);
    if (!ast.services[target].healthCheck) {
      ast.services[target].healthCheck = {
        path: healthCheck,
        port: 3000,
      };
      return await manipulator.serialize(ast, content);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.warn(`Could not add health check to target service ${target}`);
  }
  return content;
}

/**
 * Load balancer options interface
 */
interface LoadBalancerOptions {
  target?: string;
  healthCheck?: string;
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Load balancer configuration parameters
 */
interface LoadBalancerParams {
  target: string;
  healthCheck: string;
}

/**
 * Add load balancer using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addLoadBalancer(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  options: LoadBalancerOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const params = validateAndNormalizeLoadBalancerOptions(options);
  await ensureTargetServiceExists(manipulator, content, params.target);

  return await createLoadBalancerWithHealthCheck(manipulator, content, params);
}

/**
 * Validate and normalize load balancer options
 */
function validateAndNormalizeLoadBalancerOptions(options: LoadBalancerOptions): LoadBalancerParams {
  const { target, healthCheck = &#39;/health&#39; } = options;

  if (!target) {
    throw new Error(&#39;Load balancer requires --target service&#39;);
  }

  return { target, healthCheck };
}

/**
 * Ensure target service exists, throw error if not found
 */
async function ensureTargetServiceExists(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  target: string
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const targetExists = await validateTargetServiceExists(manipulator, content, target);
  if (!targetExists) {
    throw new Error(`Target service &quot;${target}&quot; not found`);
  }
}

/**
 * Create load balancer service and configure health check
 */
async function createLoadBalancerWithHealthCheck(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  params: LoadBalancerParams
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const lbConfig = createLoadBalancerConfig();
  let updatedContent = await manipulator.addService(content, &#39;loadbalancer&#39;, lbConfig);

  updatedContent = await addHealthCheckToTarget(
    manipulator,
    updatedContent,
    params.target,
    params.healthCheck
  );

  return updatedContent;
}

/**
 * Add database using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addDatabase(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  dbName: string,
  options: DatabaseAddOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const dbOptions = normalizeDatabaseOptions(options);

  if (dbOptions.template) {
    await handleTemplateBasedDatabaseCreation(dbName, content, dbOptions);
  }

  const dbConfig = createDatabaseConfiguration(dbName, dbOptions);
  return await manipulator.addDatabase(content, dbName, dbConfig);
}

/**
 * Database add options interface
 */
interface DatabaseAddOptions {
  attachTo?: string;
  image?: string;
  port?: number;
  template?: string;
  serviceType?: PlatformServiceType;
  platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Normalized database options with defaults
 */
interface NormalizedDatabaseOptions {
  attachTo?: string;
  image: string;
  port: number;
  template?: string;
  serviceType?: PlatformServiceType;
  platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
}

/**
 * Database configuration defaults
 */
const DATABASE_DEFAULTS = {
  image: &#39;postgres:15&#39;,
  port: 5432,
  volumeSize: &#39;50Gi&#39;,
} as const;

/**
 * Normalize database options with defaults
 */
function normalizeDatabaseOptions(options: DatabaseAddOptions): NormalizedDatabaseOptions {
  return {
    attachTo: options.attachTo,
    image: options.image ?? DATABASE_DEFAULTS.image,
    port: options.port ?? DATABASE_DEFAULTS.port,
    template: options.template,
    serviceType: options.serviceType,
    platform: options.platform,
  };
}

/**
 * Handle template-based database creation
 */
async function handleTemplateBasedDatabaseCreation(
  dbName: string,
  content: string,
  options: NormalizedDatabaseOptions
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  try {
    await templateManager.loadConfig();

    validateTemplateExistsSync(options.template!);

    console.log(
      chalk.blue(`🔧 Generating database &#39;${dbName}&#39; using template &#39;${options.template}&#39;`)
    );

    const variables = prepareTemplateVariables(content, dbName, options);
    const targetDir = `./database/${dbName}`;

    await templateManager.executeTemplate(options.template!, path.resolve(targetDir), variables);

    console.log(
      chalk.green(`✅ Database template &#39;${options.template}&#39; applied to &#39;${targetDir}&#39;`)
    );
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(
      `Database template generation failed: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Validate template exists synchronously and throw error if not found
 */
function validateTemplateExistsSync(template: string): void {
  const alias = templateManager.getAlias(template);
  if (!alias) {
    const availableTemplates = Object.keys(templateManager.getAliases());
    throw new Error(
      `Template &#39;${template}&#39; not found. Available templates: ${availableTemplates.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Prepare template variables for database generation
 */
function prepareTemplateVariables(
  content: string,
  dbName: string,
  options: NormalizedDatabaseOptions
): VariableContext {
  const variables = extractVariablesFromCue(content, dbName);

  variables.databaseName = dbName;
  variables.attachTo = options.attachTo;
  variables.image = options.image;
  variables.port = options.port;
  variables.database = {
    type: options.serviceType || &#39;postgres&#39;,
    name: dbName,
    port: options.port,
  };

  if (options.serviceType) {
    variables.serviceType = options.serviceType;
  }

  if (options.platform) {
    variables.platform = options.platform;
  }

  if (!variables.projectName) {
    variables.projectName = dbName;
  }

  if (!variables.serviceName) {
    variables.serviceName = dbName;
  }

  return variables;
}

/**
 * Create database configuration object
 */
function createDatabaseConfiguration(
  dbName: string,
  options: NormalizedDatabaseOptions
): DatabaseConfig {
  // Check for platform-specific service types
  if (options.serviceType &amp;&amp; options.serviceType !== &#39;prebuilt&#39;) {
    const platformDefaults = getPlatformServiceDefaults(options.serviceType);
    return {
      serviceType: options.serviceType,
      language: platformDefaults.language || &#39;sql&#39;,
      type: platformDefaults.type || &#39;managed&#39;,
      ...(platformDefaults.platform &amp;&amp; { platform: platformDefaults.platform }),
      ...(platformDefaults.runtime &amp;&amp; { runtime: platformDefaults.runtime }),
      ...(options.attachTo &amp;&amp; { attachTo: options.attachTo }),
      // Platform-managed services don&#39;t need traditional container config
    };
  }

  // Traditional container-based database
  return {
    serviceType: &#39;prebuilt&#39;,
    language: &#39;container&#39;,
    type: &#39;statefulset&#39;,
    image: options.image,
    ports: [{ name: &#39;db&#39;, port: options.port, targetPort: options.port }],
    volumes: [createDatabaseVolume(options.image)],
    env: generateDbEnvVars(options.image, dbName),
    ...(options.attachTo &amp;&amp; { attachTo: options.attachTo }),
  };
}

/**
 * Create database volume configuration based on image type
 */
function createDatabaseVolume(image: string): VolumeConfig {
  if (!image) {
    // Default path for undefined image
    return {
      name: &#39;data&#39;,
      path: &#39;/var/lib/data&#39;,
      size: DATABASE_DEFAULTS.volumeSize,
      type: &#39;persistentVolumeClaim&#39;,
    };
  }

  const dataPath = image.includes(&#39;postgres&#39;) ? &#39;/var/lib/postgresql/data&#39; : &#39;/var/lib/mysql&#39;;

  return {
    name: &#39;data&#39;,
    path: dataPath,
    size: DATABASE_DEFAULTS.volumeSize,
    type: &#39;persistentVolumeClaim&#39;,
  };
}

/**
 * Volume configuration interface
 */
interface VolumeConfig {
  name: string;
  path: string;
  size: string;
  type: string;
}

/**
 * Cache service configuration options
 */
interface CacheServiceOptions {
  attachTo?: string;
  image?: string;
  port?: number;
  serviceType?: PlatformServiceType;
  platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Cache configuration with defaults
 */
interface CacheConfig {
  attachTo?: string;
  image?: string;
  port?: number;
  serviceType?: PlatformServiceType;
  platform?: &#39;cloudflare&#39; | &#39;vercel&#39; | &#39;supabase&#39; | &#39;kubernetes&#39;;
}

/**
 * Default cache configuration
 */
const CACHE_DEFAULTS = {
  image: &#39;redis:7-alpine&#39;,
  port: 6379,
  volumeSize: &#39;10Gi&#39;,
} as const;

/**
 * Add cache service using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addCache(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  cacheName: string,
  options: CacheServiceOptions
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const cacheConfig = normalizeCacheOptions(options);
  const serviceConfig = createCacheServiceConfig(cacheConfig);

  let updatedContent = await manipulator.addService(content, cacheName, serviceConfig);

  if (cacheConfig.attachTo) {
    updatedContent = await attachCacheToService(
      manipulator,
      updatedContent,
      cacheName,
      cacheConfig
    );
  }

  return updatedContent;
}

/**
 * Normalize cache options with defaults
 */
function normalizeCacheOptions(options: CacheServiceOptions): CacheConfig {
  return {
    attachTo: options.attachTo,
    image: options.image ?? (options.serviceType ? undefined : CACHE_DEFAULTS.image),
    port: options.port ?? (options.serviceType ? undefined : CACHE_DEFAULTS.port),
    serviceType: options.serviceType,
    platform: options.platform,
  };
}

/**
 * Create cache service configuration
 */
function createCacheServiceConfig(config: CacheConfig): ServiceConfig {
  // Check for platform-specific service types
  if (config.serviceType &amp;&amp; config.serviceType !== &#39;prebuilt&#39;) {
    const platformDefaults = getPlatformServiceDefaults(config.serviceType);
    return {
      serviceType: config.serviceType,
      language: platformDefaults.language || &#39;key-value&#39;,
      type: platformDefaults.type || &#39;managed&#39;,
      ...(platformDefaults.platform &amp;&amp; { platform: platformDefaults.platform }),
      ...(platformDefaults.runtime &amp;&amp; { runtime: platformDefaults.runtime }),
      ...(config.attachTo &amp;&amp; { attachTo: config.attachTo }),
      // Platform-managed caches don&#39;t need traditional container config
    };
  }

  // Traditional container-based cache
  return {
    serviceType: &#39;prebuilt&#39;,
    language: &#39;container&#39;,
    type: &#39;deployment&#39;,
    image: config.image!,
    ports: [{ name: &#39;cache&#39;, port: config.port!, targetPort: config.port! }],
    volumes: [{ name: &#39;data&#39;, path: &#39;/data&#39;, size: CACHE_DEFAULTS.volumeSize }],
  };
}

/**
 * Attach cache connection to target service
 */
async function attachCacheToService(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  cacheName: string,
  config: CacheConfig
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  try {
    const ast = await manipulator.parse(content);
    if (ast.services?.[config.attachTo!]) {
      if (!ast.services[config.attachTo!].env) {
        ast.services[config.attachTo!].env = {};
      }

      // Generate environment variables based on cache type
      let envVars: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {};

      if (config.serviceType &amp;&amp; config.serviceType !== &#39;prebuilt&#39;) {
        // Platform-managed cache - use platform-specific env vars
        envVars = generatePlatformCacheEnvVars(config.serviceType, cacheName);
      } else {
        // Traditional container-based cache
        envVars = { REDIS_URL: `redis://${cacheName}:${config.port}` };
      }

      Object.assign(ast.services[config.attachTo!].env, envVars);
      return await manipulator.serialize(ast, content);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    console.warn(`Could not add cache connection to service ${config.attachTo}`);
  }
  return content;
}

/**
 * Add locator using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addLocator(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  locatorKey: string,
  options: { selector?: string; [key: string]: any }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const { selector } = options;

  if (!selector) {
    throw new Error(&#39;Locator requires --selector&#39;);
  }

  return await manipulator.addToSection(content, &#39;locators&#39;, locatorKey, selector);
}

/**
 * Add schema using AST-based manipulation
 */
async function addSchema(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  schemaName: string,
  options: { example?: string; rules?: string; [key: string]: any }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const { example, rules } = options;

  const schemaConfig: any = {};

  if (example) {
    try {
      schemaConfig.example = JSON.parse(example);
    } catch {
      throw new Error(&#39;Invalid example format. Expected JSON.&#39;);
    }
  }

  if (rules) {
    try {
      schemaConfig.rules = JSON.parse(rules);
    } catch {
      throw new Error(&#39;Invalid rules format. Expected JSON.&#39;);
    }
  }

  return await manipulator.addToSection(content, &#39;components.schemas&#39;, schemaName, schemaConfig);
}

/**
 * Add a reusable package/library
 */
async function addPackage(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  name: string,
  options: AddOptions &amp; {
    language?: string;
    directory?: string;
    exports?: string;
    version?: string;
  }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const packageName = name.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9-]/g, &#39;-&#39;);

  const packageConfig: any = {
    name: packageName,
    type: &#39;package&#39;,
    language: options.language || &#39;typescript&#39;,
    version: options.version || &#39;0.1.0&#39;,
    directory: options.directory || `packages/${packageName}`,
  };

  if (options.exports) {
    packageConfig.exports = options.exports.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(e =&gt; e.trim());
  }

  return await manipulator.addToSection(content, &#39;components.packages&#39;, packageName, packageConfig);
}

/**
 * Add a UI component
 */
async function addComponent(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  name: string,
  options: AddOptions &amp; {
    framework?: string;
    directory?: string;
    props?: string;
    stories?: boolean;
  }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const componentName = name.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9-]/g, &#39;-&#39;);

  const componentConfig: any = {
    name: componentName,
    type: &#39;component&#39;,
    framework: options.framework || &#39;react&#39;,
    directory: options.directory || `src/components/${componentName}`,
  };

  if (options.props) {
    componentConfig.props = options.props.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(p =&gt; p.trim());
  }

  if (options.stories) {
    componentConfig.storybook = true;
  }

  return await manipulator.addToSection(content, &#39;components.ui&#39;, componentName, componentConfig);
}

/**
 * Add a standalone module
 */
async function addModule(
  manipulator: any,
  content: string,
  name: string,
  options: AddOptions &amp; {
    language?: string;
    directory?: string;
    functions?: string;
    types?: string;
  }
): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const moduleName = name.toLowerCase().replace(/[^a-z0-9-]/g, &#39;-&#39;);

  const moduleConfig: any = {
    name: moduleName,
    type: &#39;module&#39;,
    language: options.language || &#39;typescript&#39;,
    directory: options.directory || `src/modules/${moduleName}`,
  };

  if (options.functions) {
    moduleConfig.functions = options.functions.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(f =&gt; f.trim());
  }

  if (options.types) {
    moduleConfig.types = options.types.split(&#39;,&#39;).map(t =&gt; t.trim());
  }

  return await manipulator.addToSection(content, &#39;components.modules&#39;, moduleName, moduleConfig);
}

// Helper functions
function generateDbEnvVars(image: string, dbName: string): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
  if (!image) return {};

  if (image.includes(&#39;postgres&#39;)) {
    return {
      POSTGRES_DB: dbName,
      POSTGRES_USER: &#39;user&#39;,
      POSTGRES_PASSWORD: &#39;password&#39;,
    };
  }
  if (image.includes(&#39;mysql&#39;)) {
    return {
      MYSQL_DATABASE: dbName,
      MYSQL_USER: &#39;user&#39;,
      MYSQL_PASSWORD: &#39;password&#39;,
      MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD: &#39;rootpassword&#39;,
    };
  }
  return {};
}

/**
 * Generate platform-specific cache environment variables
 */
function generatePlatformCacheEnvVars(
  serviceType: string,
  cacheName: string
): Record&lt;string, string&gt; {
  switch (serviceType) {
    case &#39;cloudflare_kv&#39;:
      return {
        KV_NAMESPACE_ID: `${cacheName}_namespace_id`,
        KV_BINDING_NAME: cacheName.toUpperCase(),
        CACHE_URL: `kv://${cacheName}`,
      };
    case &#39;vercel_kv&#39;:
      return {
        KV_REST_API_URL: `https://${cacheName}.kv.vercel-storage.com`,
        KV_REST_API_TOKEN: `${cacheName}_token`,
        KV_URL: `redis://${cacheName}`,
        CACHE_URL: `vercel-kv://${cacheName}`,
      };
    default:
      return {
        CACHE_URL: `${serviceType}://${cacheName}`,
      };
  }
}

function generateRouteId(path: string): string {
  const segments = path.split(&#39;/&#39;).filter(Boolean);
  if (segments.length === 0) return &#39;home:main&#39;;
  if (segments.length === 1) return `${segments[0]}:main`;
  return segments.join(&#39;:&#39;);
}

function toTitleCase(str: string): string {
  return str.replace(/\w\S*/g, txt =&gt; txt.charAt(0).toUpperCase() + txt.substr(1).toLowerCase());
}

function showDiff(oldContent: string, newContent: string): string {
  // Simple diff showing what was added
  const oldLines = oldContent.split(&#39;\n&#39;);
  const newLines = newContent.split(&#39;\n&#39;);

  const addedLines = newLines.filter(line =&gt; !oldLines.includes(line));
  return addedLines.map(line =&gt; `+ ${line}`).join(&#39;\n&#39;);
}

/**
 * Determine shard type based on add subcommand for better organization
 */
function getShardTypeForSubcommand(subcommand: string): string {
  const shardMapping: Record&lt;string, string&gt; = {
    service: &#39;services&#39;,
    endpoint: &#39;endpoints&#39;,
    route: &#39;routes&#39;,
    flow: &#39;flows&#39;,
    database: &#39;services&#39;, // Databases go with services
    &#39;load-balancer&#39;: &#39;services&#39;, // Load balancers go with services
    schema: &#39;schemas&#39;,
    locator: &#39;locators&#39;,
  };

  return shardMapping[subcommand] || &#39;assembly&#39;;
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/watch.ts
import { readFile } from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { FileWatcher, type WatchBatch } from &#39;../utils/file-watcher.js&#39;;
import { createOutputManager, shouldUseAgentMode } from &#39;../utils/standardized-output.js&#39;;
import type { StandardizedOutputManager } from &#39;../utils/standardized-output.js&#39;;

export interface WatchOptions {
  /** Path to watch (default: current directory) */
  path?: string;
  /** Enable agent mode (NDJSON output) */
  agentMode?: boolean;
  /** Output NDJSON to file instead of stdout */
  ndjsonOutput?: string;
  /** Debounce delay in milliseconds */
  debounce?: number;
  /** Custom patterns to watch */
  patterns?: string[];
  /** Run validation pipeline on changes */
  validate?: boolean;
  /** Run planning pipeline on changes */
  plan?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Watch command implementation
 * Monitors files and runs validation/planning pipelines according to the spec
 */
export async function watchCommand(options: WatchOptions, config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const watchPath = options.path || &#39;.&#39;;
  const agentMode = shouldUseAgentMode(options);
  const debounce = options.debounce || 300;

  // Create output manager
  const outputManager = createOutputManager(&#39;watch&#39;, agentMode, options.ndjsonOutput);

  try {
    const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);

    // Test API connection first
    const healthResult = await apiClient.health();
    if (!healthResult.success) {
      if (agentMode) {
        outputManager.emitEvent({
          phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
          status: &#39;error&#39;,
          error: &#39;connection_failed&#39;,
          data: {
            message: `API server unavailable: ${healthResult.error}`,
          },
        });
      } else {
        console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ API server unavailable:&#39;), healthResult.error);
        console.error(chalk.dim(&#39;Make sure the Arbiter server is running&#39;));
      }
      return 1;
    }

    // Emit watch start event
    outputManager.emitEvent({
      phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
      status: &#39;start&#39;,
      data: {
        path: watchPath,
        debounce,
        patterns: options.patterns || [
          &#39;**/*.cue&#39;,
          &#39;**/.arbiter/**/*.cue&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.json&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.yaml&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.yml&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.ts&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.js&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.py&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.rs&#39;,
          &#39;**/*.go&#39;,
        ],
      },
    });

    if (!agentMode) {
      console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Connected to Arbiter API&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.blue(`🔍 Starting file watcher for: ${watchPath}`));
      console.log(chalk.dim(`Debounce: ${debounce}ms | Agent mode: ${agentMode}`));
    }

    const watcher = new FileWatcher({
      paths: [watchPath],
      debounce,
      agentMode,
      patterns: options.patterns || [
        &#39;**/*.cue&#39;,
        &#39;**/.arbiter/**/*.cue&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.json&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.yaml&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.yml&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.ts&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.js&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.py&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.rs&#39;,
        &#39;**/*.go&#39;,
      ],
    });

    // Set up graceful shutdown
    const cleanup = async () =&gt; {
      if (agentMode) {
        outputManager.emitEvent({
          phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
          status: &#39;complete&#39;,
          data: { reason: &#39;shutdown_requested&#39; },
        });
      } else {
        console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n🛑 Shutting down file watcher...&#39;));
      }
      await watcher.stop();
      outputManager.close();
      process.exit(0);
    };

    process.on(&#39;SIGINT&#39;, cleanup);
    process.on(&#39;SIGTERM&#39;, cleanup);

    // Start watching with batch processing
    await watcher.start(async (batch: WatchBatch) =&gt; {
      await processBatch(batch, apiClient, options, config, outputManager);
    });

    // Keep the process running
    return new Promise&lt;number&gt;(() =&gt; {
      // Never resolve - this runs indefinitely until interrupted
    });
  } catch (error) {
    const errorMessage = error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error);
    if (agentMode) {
      outputManager.emitEvent({
        phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
        status: &#39;error&#39;,
        error: &#39;watch_failed&#39;,
        data: {
          message: `Watch command failed: ${errorMessage}`,
        },
      });
    } else {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;❌ Watch command failed:&#39;), errorMessage);
    }
    outputManager.close();
    return 1;
  }
}

/**
 * Process a batch of file change events
 */
async function processBatch(
  batch: WatchBatch,
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  options: WatchOptions,
  _config: CLIConfig,
  outputManager: StandardizedOutputManager
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const agentMode = shouldUseAgentMode(options);

  // Get changed file paths for event data
  const changedFiles = batch.events
    .filter(e =&gt; e.type !== &#39;unlink&#39; &amp;&amp; e.type !== &#39;unlinkDir&#39;)
    .map(e =&gt; e.path);

  // Emit watch change event
  outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
    status: &#39;progress&#39;,
    data: {
      changed: changedFiles,
      eventCount: batch.events.length,
      debounceWindow: batch.debounceWindow,
    },
  });

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.cyan(`\n📝 Processing ${batch.events.length} file changes...`));
  }

  // Group events by file type for efficient processing
  const cueFiles: string[] = [];
  const otherFiles: string[] = [];

  for (const event of batch.events) {
    if (event.type === &#39;unlink&#39; || event.type === &#39;unlinkDir&#39;) {
      continue; // Skip deleted files
    }

    if (event.path.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;)) {
      cueFiles.push(event.path);
    } else {
      otherFiles.push(event.path);
    }
  }

  let validateResult: any = null;
  let surfaceResult: any = null;
  let planResult: any = null;

  // Process CUE files first (validation)
  if (cueFiles.length &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; options.validate !== false) {
    validateResult = await validateFiles(cueFiles, apiClient, agentMode);
  }

  // Run planning if requested and assembly file changed
  const assemblyChanged = batch.events.some(e =&gt; {
    if (e.type === &#39;unlink&#39;) return false;
    if (!e.path.endsWith(&#39;assembly.cue&#39;)) return false;
    return e.path.includes(`${path.sep}.arbiter${path.sep}`) || e.path.includes(`.arbiter/`);
  });

  if (assemblyChanged &amp;&amp; options.plan) {
    planResult = await runPlanning(apiClient, agentMode);
  }

  // Surface analysis for code files
  const codeFiles = otherFiles.filter(f =&gt; /\.(ts|js|py|rs|go)$/.test(f));

  if (codeFiles.length &gt; 0) {
    surfaceResult = await analyzeSurface(codeFiles, agentMode);
  }

  // Emit final watch event with results
  outputManager.emitEvent({
    phase: &#39;watch&#39;,
    status: &#39;complete&#39;,
    data: {
      changed: changedFiles,
      validate: validateResult,
      surface: surfaceResult,
      gates: planResult,
      processedFiles: {
        cue: cueFiles.length,
        code: codeFiles.length,
        other: otherFiles.length - codeFiles.length,
      },
    },
  });

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;✅ Batch processing complete&#39;));
  }
}

/**
 * Validate CUE files
 */
async function validateFiles(
  files: string[],
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  agentMode: boolean
): Promise&lt;{ valid: number; invalid: number; errors: string[] }&gt; {
  const results = { valid: 0, invalid: 0, errors: [] as string[] };

  for (const file of files) {
    await validateSingleFileInWatch(file, apiClient, agentMode, results);
  }

  return results;
}

/**
 * Validate a single file during watch mode
 */
async function validateSingleFileInWatch(
  file: string,
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  agentMode: boolean,
  results: { valid: number; invalid: number; errors: string[] }
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  try {
    const content = await readFile(file, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    const result = await apiClient.validate(content);

    if (result.success) {
      handleValidationSuccess(file, agentMode, results);
    } else {
      handleValidationFailure(file, result, agentMode, results);
    }
  } catch (error) {
    handleValidationError(file, error, agentMode, results);
  }
}

/**
 * Handle successful validation
 */
function handleValidationSuccess(
  file: string,
  agentMode: boolean,
  results: { valid: number; invalid: number; errors: string[] }
): void {
  results.valid++;
  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.green(`  ✅ ${file} - Valid`));
  }
}

/**
 * Handle validation failure
 */
function handleValidationFailure(
  file: string,
  result: any,
  agentMode: boolean,
  results: { valid: number; invalid: number; errors: string[] }
): void {
  results.invalid++;
  const error = `${file}: ${result.error || &#39;Validation failed&#39;}`;
  results.errors.push(error);

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.red(`  ❌ ${file} - ${result.error || &#39;Validation failed&#39;}`));
    displayValidationErrors(result.data?.errors);
  }
}

/**
 * Display detailed validation errors
 */
function displayValidationErrors(errors?: string[]): void {
  if (errors) {
    errors.forEach(error =&gt; {
      console.log(chalk.red(`     ${error}`));
    });
  }
}

/**
 * Handle file read or processing errors
 */
function handleValidationError(
  file: string,
  error: unknown,
  agentMode: boolean,
  results: { valid: number; invalid: number; errors: string[] }
): void {
  results.invalid++;
  const errorMsg = `${file}: Read error - ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`;
  results.errors.push(errorMsg);

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(
      chalk.red(
        `  ❌ ${file} - Read error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
      )
    );
  }
}

/**
 * Run planning pipeline
 */
async function runPlanning(
  _apiClient: ApiClient,
  agentMode: boolean
): Promise&lt;{ status: string; message: string }&gt; {
  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;  📋 Running planning pipeline...&#39;));
  }

  // This would integrate with the planning API when available
  // For now, just return the status
  const result = {
    status: &#39;not_implemented&#39;,
    message: &#39;Planning pipeline not yet implemented&#39;,
  };

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;  ⚠️  Planning pipeline not yet implemented&#39;));
  }

  return result;
}

/**
 * Analyze API surface of code files
 */
async function analyzeSurface(
  files: string[],
  agentMode: boolean
): Promise&lt;{ status: string; message: string; files: number }&gt; {
  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.blue(`  🔍 Analyzing API surface for ${files.length} code files...`));
  }

  // This would integrate with the surface analysis when implemented
  // For now, just return the status
  const result = {
    status: &#39;not_implemented&#39;,
    message: &#39;Surface analysis not yet implemented&#39;,
    files: files.length,
  };

  if (!agentMode) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;  ⚠️  Surface analysis not yet implemented&#39;));
  }

  return result;
}
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/ide.ts
import fs from &#39;node:fs/promises&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, IDEOptions } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

interface ProjectLanguage {
  name: string;
  detected: boolean;
  files: string[];
  extensions: string[];
}

/**
 * Detect project languages based on file patterns
 */
async function detectProjectLanguages(projectPath: string): Promise&lt;ProjectLanguage[]&gt; {
  const languages: ProjectLanguage[] = [
    {
      name: &#39;cue&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;bradleyjkemp.vscode-cue&#39;],
    },
    {
      name: &#39;typescript&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;ms-vscode.vscode-typescript-next&#39;, &#39;bradlc.vscode-tailwindcss&#39;],
    },
    {
      name: &#39;python&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;ms-python.python&#39;, &#39;ms-python.black-formatter&#39;],
    },
    {
      name: &#39;rust&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;rust-lang.rust-analyzer&#39;, &#39;serayuzgur.crates&#39;],
    },
    {
      name: &#39;go&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;golang.go&#39;],
    },
    {
      name: &#39;bash&#39;,
      detected: false,
      files: [],
      extensions: [&#39;timonwong.shellcheck&#39;, &#39;foxundermoon.shell-format&#39;],
    },
  ];

  async function scanDirectory(dir: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      const entries = await fs.readdir(dir, { withFileTypes: true });

      for (const entry of entries) {
        const fullPath = path.join(dir, entry.name);
        const relativePath = path.relative(projectPath, fullPath);

        if (entry.isDirectory()) {
          // Skip common ignore directories
          if (
            [&#39;node_modules&#39;, &#39;.git&#39;, &#39;dist&#39;, &#39;build&#39;, &#39;target&#39;, &#39;.next&#39;, &#39;__pycache__&#39;].includes(
              entry.name
            )
          ) {
            continue;
          }
          await scanDirectory(fullPath);
        } else {
          // Check file extensions and patterns
          const ext = path.extname(entry.name).toLowerCase();
          const basename = entry.name.toLowerCase();

          // CUE files
          if (ext === &#39;.cue&#39;) {
            languages[0].detected = true;
            languages[0].files.push(relativePath);
          }
          // TypeScript/JavaScript
          else if (
            [&#39;.ts&#39;, &#39;.tsx&#39;, &#39;.js&#39;, &#39;.jsx&#39;].includes(ext) ||
            [&#39;package.json&#39;, &#39;tsconfig.json&#39;].includes(basename)
          ) {
            languages[1].detected = true;
            languages[1].files.push(relativePath);
          }
          // Python
          else if (ext === &#39;.py&#39; || [&#39;pyproject.toml&#39;, &#39;requirements.txt&#39;].includes(basename)) {
            languages[2].detected = true;
            languages[2].files.push(relativePath);
          }
          // Rust
          else if (ext === &#39;.rs&#39; || [&#39;cargo.toml&#39;, &#39;cargo.lock&#39;].includes(basename)) {
            languages[3].detected = true;
            languages[3].files.push(relativePath);
          }
          // Go
          else if (ext === &#39;.go&#39; || [&#39;go.mod&#39;, &#39;go.sum&#39;].includes(basename)) {
            languages[4].detected = true;
            languages[4].files.push(relativePath);
          }
          // Bash
          else if (ext === &#39;.sh&#39; || basename === &#39;makefile&#39;) {
            languages[5].detected = true;
            languages[5].files.push(relativePath);
          }
        }
      }
    } catch (_error) {
      // Skip directories we can&#39;t read
      return;
    }
  }

  await scanDirectory(projectPath);
  return languages.filter(lang =&gt; lang.detected);
}

/**
 * Generate VS Code configuration
 */
async function generateVSCodeConfig(
  languages: ProjectLanguage[],
  projectPath: string,
  force: boolean,
  outputDir?: string
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const vscodeDir = path.join(outputDir || projectPath, &#39;.vscode&#39;);
  await fs.mkdir(vscodeDir, { recursive: true });

  // Generate all VS Code configuration files
  await generateExtensionsConfig(languages, vscodeDir, force);
  await generateTasksConfig(languages, vscodeDir, force);
}

/**
 * Generate extensions.json configuration
 */
async function generateExtensionsConfig(
  languages: ProjectLanguage[],
  vscodeDir: string,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const allExtensions = collectRequiredExtensions(languages);
  const extensionsConfig = {
    recommendations: Array.from(allExtensions).sort(),
  };

  const extensionsPath = path.join(vscodeDir, &#39;extensions.json&#39;);
  await writeConfigFile(extensionsPath, extensionsConfig, force);
}

/**
 * Collect all required VS Code extensions for detected languages
 */
function collectRequiredExtensions(languages: ProjectLanguage[]): Set&lt;string&gt; {
  const allExtensions = new Set&lt;string&gt;();

  // Add recommended extensions for detected languages
  for (const lang of languages) {
    for (const ext of lang.extensions) {
      allExtensions.add(ext);
    }
  }

  // Add Arbiter-specific extensions
  allExtensions.add(&#39;bradleyjkemp.vscode-cue&#39;); // CUE language support
  allExtensions.add(&#39;ms-vscode.vscode-json&#39;); // JSON support
  allExtensions.add(&#39;redhat.vscode-yaml&#39;); // YAML support

  return allExtensions;
}

/**
 * Write a configuration file, respecting the force flag
 */
async function writeConfigFile(filePath: string, config: any, force: boolean): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  let shouldWrite = force;

  if (!force) {
    try {
      const existingContent = JSON.parse(await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf8&#39;));
      // Merge with existing config
      Object.assign(existingContent, config);
      await fs.writeFile(filePath, JSON.stringify(existingContent, null, 2));
      console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Merged configuration into ${filePath}`));
      return;
    } catch {
      shouldWrite = true;
    }
  }

  if (shouldWrite) {
    await fs.writeFile(filePath, JSON.stringify(config, null, 2));
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${filePath}`));
  }
}

/**
 * Create base Arbiter tasks for VS Code
 */
function createArbiterTasks(): any[] {
  return [
    {
      label: &#39;Arbiter: Check&#39;,
      type: &#39;shell&#39;,
      command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
      args: [&#39;check&#39;, &#39;--format&#39;, &#39;json&#39;],
      group: &#39;build&#39;,
      presentation: {
        echo: true,
        reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
        focus: false,
        panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        clear: true,
      },
      problemMatcher: {
        owner: &#39;arbiter-check&#39;,
        fileLocation: [&#39;relative&#39;, &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;],
        pattern: [
          {
            regexp: &#39;^ERROR\\s+(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+)\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
            file: 1,
            line: 2,
            column: 3,
            message: 4,
            severity: &#39;error&#39;,
          },
        ],
      },
    },
    {
      label: &#39;Arbiter: Watch&#39;,
      type: &#39;shell&#39;,
      command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
      args: [&#39;watch&#39;],
      group: &#39;build&#39;,
      isBackground: true,
      presentation: {
        echo: true,
        reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
        focus: false,
        panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
      },
      problemMatcher: {
        owner: &#39;arbiter-watch&#39;,
        fileLocation: [&#39;relative&#39;, &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;],
        background: {
          activeOnStart: true,
          beginsPattern: &#39;^🔍 Watching for changes&#39;,
          endsPattern: &#39;^✅ All files validated&#39;,
        },
      },
    },
  ];
}

/**
 * Create language-specific tasks
 */
function createLanguageSpecificTasks(languages: ProjectLanguage[]): any[] {
  const tasks = [];

  for (const lang of languages) {
    if (lang.name === &#39;typescript&#39;) {
      tasks.push({
        label: `${lang.name}: Build`,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;npm&#39;,
        args: [&#39;run&#39;, &#39;build&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
      });
    } else if (lang.name === &#39;python&#39;) {
      tasks.push({
        label: `${lang.name}: Test`,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;python&#39;,
        args: [&#39;-m&#39;, &#39;pytest&#39;],
        group: &#39;test&#39;,
      });
    }
    // Add more language-specific tasks as needed
  }

  return tasks;
}

/**
 * Generate tasks.json configuration
 */
async function generateTasksConfig(
  languages: ProjectLanguage[],
  vscodeDir: string,
  force: boolean
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const baseTasks = createArbiterTasks();
  const languageTasks = createLanguageSpecificTasks(languages);

  const tasksConfig: any = {
    tasks: [
      {
        label: &#39;Arbiter: Check&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
        args: [&#39;check&#39;, &#39;--format&#39;, &#39;json&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
          clear: true,
        },
        problemMatcher: {
          owner: &#39;arbiter-check&#39;,
          fileLocation: [&#39;relative&#39;, &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;],
          pattern: [
            {
              regexp: &#39;^ERROR\\s+(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+)\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
              file: 1,
              line: 2,
              column: 3,
              message: 4,
              severity: &#39;error&#39;,
            },
            {
              regexp: &#39;^WARNING\\s+(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+)\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
              file: 1,
              line: 2,
              column: 3,
              message: 4,
              severity: &#39;warning&#39;,
            },
            {
              regexp: &#39;^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(error|warning):\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
              file: 1,
              line: 2,
              column: 3,
              severity: 4,
              message: 5,
            },
          ],
        },
      },
      {
        label: &#39;CUE: Format&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;cue&#39;,
        args: [&#39;fmt&#39;, &#39;${file}&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: false,
          reveal: &#39;never&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        },
        problemMatcher: [],
      },
      {
        label: &#39;CUE: Format All&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;cue&#39;,
        args: [&#39;fmt&#39;, &#39;./...&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;silent&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        },
        problemMatcher: [],
      },
      {
        label: &#39;Arbiter: Watch&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
        args: [&#39;watch&#39;, &#39;--agent-mode&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        isBackground: true,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;dedicated&#39;,
          clear: true,
        },
        problemMatcher: {
          owner: &#39;arbiter-watch&#39;,
          fileLocation: [&#39;relative&#39;, &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;],
          pattern: [
            {
              regexp:
                &#39;^\\s*&quot;file&quot;:\\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;,\\s*&quot;line&quot;:\\s*(\\d+),\\s*&quot;column&quot;:\\s*(\\d+),\\s*&quot;severity&quot;:\\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;,\\s*&quot;message&quot;:\\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;&#39;,
              file: 1,
              line: 2,
              column: 3,
              severity: 4,
              message: 5,
            },
          ],
          background: {
            activeOnStart: true,
            beginsPattern: &#39;^.*&quot;event&quot;:\\s*&quot;watch_start&quot;.*$&#39;,
            endsPattern: &#39;^.*&quot;event&quot;:\\s*&quot;validation_complete&quot;.*$&#39;,
          },
        },
      },
      {
        label: &#39;Arbiter: Generate Surface&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
        args: [&#39;surface&#39;, &#39;typescript&#39;, &#39;--output&#39;, &#39;surface.json&#39;, &#39;--verbose&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        },
        problemMatcher: {
          owner: &#39;arbiter-surface&#39;,
          fileLocation: [&#39;relative&#39;, &#39;${workspaceFolder}&#39;],
          pattern: {
            regexp: &#39;^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(warning|error):\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
            file: 1,
            line: 2,
            column: 3,
            severity: 4,
            message: 5,
          },
        },
      },
      {
        label: &#39;Arbiter: Sync Manifests&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
        args: [&#39;sync&#39;, &#39;--all&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        },
      },
      {
        label: &#39;Arbiter: Generate CI&#39;,
        type: &#39;shell&#39;,
        command: &#39;arbiter&#39;,
        args: [&#39;integrate&#39;, &#39;--force&#39;],
        group: &#39;build&#39;,
        presentation: {
          echo: true,
          reveal: &#39;always&#39;,
          focus: false,
          panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
        },
      },
    ],
  };

  // Add language-specific tasks
  if (languages.some(l =&gt; l.name === &#39;typescript&#39;)) {
    tasksConfig.tasks.push({
      label: &#39;TypeScript: Build&#39;,
      type: &#39;typescript&#39;,
      tsconfig: &#39;tsconfig.json&#39;,
      group: &#39;build&#39;,
      presentation: {
        echo: true,
        reveal: &#39;silent&#39;,
        focus: false,
        panel: &#39;shared&#39;,
      },
      problemMatcher: &#39;$tsc&#39;,
    });
  }

  const tasksPath = path.join(vscodeDir, &#39;tasks.json&#39;);
  let shouldWriteTasks = force;

  if (!force) {
    try {
      await fs.access(tasksPath);
      console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  ${tasksPath} already exists. Use --force to overwrite.`));
    } catch {
      shouldWriteTasks = true;
    }
  }

  if (shouldWriteTasks) {
    await fs.writeFile(tasksPath, JSON.stringify(tasksConfig, null, 2));
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${tasksPath}`));
  }

  // Generate settings.json with enhanced CUE support and save-time formatting
  const settings: any = {
    &#39;[cue]&#39;: {
      &#39;editor.insertSpaces&#39;: true,
      &#39;editor.tabSize&#39;: 2,
      &#39;editor.detectIndentation&#39;: false,
      &#39;editor.formatOnSave&#39;: true,
      &#39;editor.formatOnType&#39;: true,
      &#39;editor.formatOnPaste&#39;: true,
      &#39;editor.defaultFormatter&#39;: &#39;bradleyjkemp.vscode-cue&#39;,
    },
    &#39;files.associations&#39;: {
      &#39;*.cue&#39;: &#39;cue&#39;,
      &#39;arbiter.assembly.cue&#39;: &#39;cue&#39;,
      &#39;*.assembly.cue&#39;: &#39;cue&#39;,
    },
    &#39;cue.useLanguageServer&#39;: true,
    &#39;cue.formatting.enabled&#39;: true,
    &#39;editor.rulers&#39;: [80, 120],
    &#39;editor.quickSuggestions&#39;: {
      other: true,
      comments: false,
      strings: true,
    },
    &#39;editor.suggestSelection&#39;: &#39;first&#39;,
    &#39;editor.wordBasedSuggestions&#39;: false,
    // Save actions for CUE files
    &#39;editor.codeActionsOnSave&#39;: {
      &#39;source.organizeImports&#39;: true,
      &#39;source.fixAll&#39;: true,
    },
    // Arbiter-specific file associations
    &#39;files.exclude&#39;: {
      &#39;**/*.log&#39;: true,
      &#39;**/node_modules&#39;: true,
      &#39;**/dist&#39;: true,
      &#39;**/build&#39;: true,
      &#39;**/.git&#39;: true,
    },
    // Problem matcher integration
    &#39;problemMatcher.pattern&#39;: [
      {
        name: &#39;arbiter-cue&#39;,
        regexp: &#39;^(.*):(\\d+):(\\d+):\\s+(warning|error):\\s+(.*)$&#39;,
        file: 1,
        line: 2,
        column: 3,
        severity: 4,
        message: 5,
      },
    ],
    // Workspace-specific Arbiter settings
    &#39;arbiter.autoFormat&#39;: true,
    &#39;arbiter.validateOnSave&#39;: true,
    &#39;arbiter.showInlineErrors&#39;: true,
  };

  const settingsPath = path.join(vscodeDir, &#39;settings.json&#39;);
  let shouldWriteSettings = force;

  if (!force) {
    try {
      const existingSettings = JSON.parse(await fs.readFile(settingsPath, &#39;utf8&#39;));
      // Merge with existing settings
      Object.assign(existingSettings, settings);
      await fs.writeFile(settingsPath, JSON.stringify(existingSettings, null, 2));
      console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Merged settings into ${settingsPath}`));
    } catch {
      shouldWriteSettings = true;
    }
  }

  if (shouldWriteSettings) {
    await fs.writeFile(settingsPath, JSON.stringify(settings, null, 2));
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${settingsPath}`));
  }
}

/**
 * Generate JetBrains IDE configuration (IntelliJ IDEA, etc.)
 */
async function generateIDEAConfig(
  _languages: ProjectLanguage[],
  projectPath: string,
  force: boolean,
  outputDir?: string
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const ideaDir = path.join(outputDir || projectPath, &#39;.idea&#39;);

  try {
    await fs.mkdir(ideaDir, { recursive: true });

    // Generate file watcher for CUE files
    const watchersConfig = `&lt;?xml version=&quot;1.0&quot; encoding=&quot;UTF-8&quot;?&gt;
&lt;project version=&quot;4&quot;&gt;
  &lt;component name=&quot;ProjectTasksOptions&quot;&gt;
    &lt;TaskOptions isEnabled=&quot;true&quot;&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;arguments&quot; value=&quot;check&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;checkSyntaxErrors&quot; value=&quot;true&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;description&quot; value=&quot;Arbiter CUE validation&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;exitCodeBehavior&quot; value=&quot;ERROR&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;fileExtension&quot; value=&quot;cue&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;immediateSync&quot; value=&quot;false&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;name&quot; value=&quot;Arbiter Check&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;output&quot; value=&quot;$FileDir$&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;outputFilters&quot;&gt;
        &lt;array /&gt;
      &lt;/option&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;outputFromStdout&quot; value=&quot;false&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;program&quot; value=&quot;arbiter&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;runOnExternalChanges&quot; value=&quot;false&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;scopeName&quot; value=&quot;Project Files&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;trackOnlyRoot&quot; value=&quot;true&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;option name=&quot;workingDir&quot; value=&quot;$ProjectFileDir$&quot; /&gt;
      &lt;envs /&gt;
    &lt;/TaskOptions&gt;
  &lt;/component&gt;
&lt;/project&gt;`;

    const watchersPath = path.join(ideaDir, &#39;watchers.xml&#39;);
    if (
      force ||
      !(await fs.access(watchersPath).then(
        () =&gt; true,
        () =&gt; false
      ))
    ) {
      await fs.writeFile(watchersPath, watchersConfig);
      console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${watchersPath}`));
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  ${watchersPath} already exists. Use --force to overwrite.`));
    }
  } catch (_error) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  Could not generate IntelliJ IDEA configuration&#39;));
  }
}

/**
 * Generate Vim configuration
 */
async function generateVimConfig(
  _languages: ProjectLanguage[],
  projectPath: string,
  force: boolean,
  outputDir?: string
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const vimrcPath = path.join(outputDir || projectPath, &#39;.vimrc.local&#39;);

  const vimConfig = `&quot; Arbiter CUE configuration for Vim
&quot; Install cue.vim plugin: https://github.com/jjo/vim-cue

&quot; CUE file settings
autocmd BufNewFile,BufRead *.cue set filetype=cue
autocmd FileType cue setlocal tabstop=2 shiftwidth=2 expandtab

&quot; Arbiter integration
command! ArbiterCheck !arbiter check
command! ArbiterWatch !arbiter watch &amp;

&quot; Key mappings
nnoremap &lt;leader&gt;ac :ArbiterCheck&lt;CR&gt;
nnoremap &lt;leader&gt;aw :ArbiterWatch&lt;CR&gt;
`;

  if (
    force ||
    !(await fs.access(vimrcPath).then(
      () =&gt; true,
      () =&gt; false
    ))
  ) {
    await fs.writeFile(vimrcPath, vimConfig);
    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Generated ${vimrcPath}`));
    console.log(
      chalk.dim(&#39;   Add &quot;source .vimrc.local&quot; to your ~/.vimrc to use this configuration&#39;)
    );
  } else {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(`⚠️  ${vimrcPath} already exists. Use --force to overwrite.`));
  }
}

/**
 * IDE recommend command implementation
 */
export async function ideCommand(options: IDEOptions, _config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    const projectPath = process.cwd();
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔧 Arbiter IDE recommendation system&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.dim(`Project: ${projectPath}`));

    // Detect project languages
    console.log(chalk.blue(&#39;🔍 Detecting project languages...&#39;));
    const languages = await detectProjectLanguages(projectPath);

    if (languages.length === 0) {
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;⚠️  No supported languages detected in project&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;Supported: CUE, TypeScript, Python, Rust, Go, Bash&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(`✅ Detected ${languages.length} language(s):`));
    for (const lang of languages) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(`  • ${lang.name} (${lang.files.length} files)`));
    }

    // If only detecting, return early
    if (options.detect) {
      console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;\n📋 Language Detection Summary:&#39;));
      for (const lang of languages) {
        console.log(
          `${chalk.bold(lang.name)}: ${chalk.green(&#39;✓&#39;)} (${lang.files.slice(0, 3).join(&#39;, &#39;)}${lang.files.length &gt; 3 ? &#39;...&#39; : &#39;&#39;})`
        );
      }
      return 0;
    }

    // Generate IDE configurations
    const editor = options.editor || &#39;vscode&#39;;
    const force = options.force || false;
    const outputDir = options.outputDir || options.output;

    if (outputDir) {
      console.log(chalk.blue(`\n🛠️  Generating ${editor} configuration in ${outputDir}...`));
    } else {
      console.log(chalk.blue(`\n🛠️  Generating ${editor} configuration...`));
    }

    switch (editor) {
      case &#39;vscode&#39;:
        await generateVSCodeConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        break;
      case &#39;idea&#39;:
        await generateIDEAConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        break;
      case &#39;vim&#39;:
        await generateVimConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        break;
      case &#39;all&#39;:
        await generateVSCodeConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        await generateIDEAConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        await generateVimConfig(languages, projectPath, force, outputDir);
        break;
      default:
        console.log(chalk.red(`❌ Unknown editor: ${editor}`));
        return 1;
    }

    console.log(chalk.green(&#39;\n🎉 IDE configuration generated successfully!&#39;));
    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Next steps:&#39;));

    if (editor === &#39;vscode&#39; || editor === &#39;all&#39;) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  1. Restart VS Code to load new configuration&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  2. Install recommended extensions when prompted&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  3. Use Ctrl+Shift+P → &quot;Tasks: Run Task&quot; → &quot;Arbiter: Check&quot;&#39;));
    }

    if (editor === &#39;idea&#39; || editor === &#39;all&#39;) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  1. Restart IntelliJ IDEA&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  2. Enable file watchers in Settings → Tools → File Watchers&#39;));
    }

    if (editor === &#39;vim&#39; || editor === &#39;all&#39;) {
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  1. Install cue.vim plugin for CUE syntax highlighting&#39;));
      console.log(chalk.dim(&#39;  2. Add &quot;source .vimrc.local&quot; to your ~/.vimrc&#39;));
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;❌ IDE configuration failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 1;
  }
}
📄 apps/api/src/migrations/run.ts
#!/usr/bin/env bun
/**
 * Database migration runner
 */
import { Database } from &#39;bun:sqlite&#39;;
import { existsSync } from &#39;node:fs&#39;;
import { drizzle } from &#39;drizzle-orm/bun-sqlite&#39;;
import { migrate } from &#39;drizzle-orm/bun-sqlite/migrator&#39;;
import { logger } from &#39;../utils.ts&#39;;

interface Migration {
  id: string;
  name: string;
  up: string;
  down?: string;
}

const migrations: Migration[] = [
  {
    id: &#39;001&#39;,
    name: &#39;initial_schema&#39;,
    up: `
      -- Enable WAL mode for better concurrent access
      PRAGMA journal_mode = WAL;
      PRAGMA synchronous = NORMAL;
      PRAGMA cache_size = 1000;
      PRAGMA temp_store = memory;

      -- Create tables
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS projects (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        name TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        updated_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;))
      );

      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS fragments (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        path TEXT NOT NULL,
        content TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        updated_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
        UNIQUE (project_id, path)
      );

      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS versions (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        spec_hash TEXT NOT NULL,
        resolved_json TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE,
        UNIQUE (project_id, spec_hash)
      );

      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS events (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        project_id TEXT NOT NULL,
        event_type TEXT NOT NULL,
        data TEXT NOT NULL,
        created_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;)),
        FOREIGN KEY (project_id) REFERENCES projects (id) ON DELETE CASCADE
      );

      -- Create indices for performance
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragments_project_id ON fragments (project_id);
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_fragments_path ON fragments (project_id, path);
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_versions_project_id ON versions (project_id);
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_versions_hash ON versions (spec_hash);
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_events_project_id ON events (project_id);
      CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_events_created_at ON events (created_at DESC);

      -- Trigger to update updated_at on projects
      CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS update_projects_updated_at
      AFTER UPDATE ON projects
      FOR EACH ROW
      BEGIN
        UPDATE projects SET updated_at = datetime(&#39;now&#39;) WHERE id = NEW.id;
      END;

      -- Trigger to update updated_at on fragments
      CREATE TRIGGER IF NOT EXISTS update_fragments_updated_at
      AFTER UPDATE ON fragments
      FOR EACH ROW
      BEGIN
        UPDATE fragments SET updated_at = datetime(&#39;now&#39;) WHERE id = NEW.id;
      END;
    `,
    down: `
      DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS update_fragments_updated_at;
      DROP TRIGGER IF EXISTS update_projects_updated_at;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_events_created_at;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_events_project_id;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_versions_hash;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_versions_project_id;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_fragments_path;
      DROP INDEX IF EXISTS idx_fragments_project_id;
      DROP TABLE IF EXISTS events;
      DROP TABLE IF EXISTS versions;
      DROP TABLE IF EXISTS fragments;
      DROP TABLE IF EXISTS projects;
    `,
  },
];

class MigrationRunner {
  private db: Database;

  constructor(dbPath: string) {
    this.db = new Database(dbPath, { create: true });
    this.initializeMigrationTable();
  }

  private initializeMigrationTable(): void {
    this.db.exec(`
      CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS migrations (
        id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
        name TEXT NOT NULL,
        applied_at TEXT NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime(&#39;now&#39;))
      )
    `);
  }

  private getAppliedMigrations(): Set&lt;string&gt; {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;SELECT id FROM migrations&#39;);
    const results = stmt.all() as { id: string }[];
    return new Set(results.map(r =&gt; r.id));
  }

  private recordMigration(id: string, name: string): void {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;INSERT INTO migrations (id, name) VALUES (?, ?)&#39;);
    stmt.run(id, name);
  }

  private removeMigration(id: string): void {
    const stmt = this.db.prepare(&#39;DELETE FROM migrations WHERE id = ?&#39;);
    stmt.run(id);
  }

  async runMigrations(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await this.runDrizzleMigrations();

    const applied = this.getAppliedMigrations();
    const pending = migrations.filter(m =&gt; !applied.has(m.id));

    if (pending.length === 0) {
      logger.info(&#39;No pending migrations&#39;);
      return;
    }

    logger.info(`Running ${pending.length} pending migrations`);

    for (const migration of pending) {
      try {
        logger.info(`Applying migration: ${migration.id} - ${migration.name}`);

        // Execute migration (some commands can&#39;t be in transactions)
        this.db.exec(migration.up);
        this.recordMigration(migration.id, migration.name);

        logger.info(`✅ Migration ${migration.id} applied successfully`);
      } catch (error) {
        logger.error(
          `❌ Migration ${migration.id} failed`,
          error instanceof Error ? error : undefined
        );
        throw error;
      }
    }

    logger.info(&#39;All migrations completed successfully&#39;);
  }

  private async runDrizzleMigrations(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const migrationsDir = new URL(&#39;../../drizzle&#39;, import.meta.url).pathname;

    if (!existsSync(migrationsDir)) {
      return;
    }

    logger.info(&#39;Running Drizzle migrations&#39;, { migrationsDir });

    try {
      await migrate(drizzle(this.db), { migrationsFolder: migrationsDir });
      logger.info(&#39;Drizzle migrations completed successfully&#39;);
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(&#39;Drizzle migrations failed&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);
      throw error;
    }
  }

  async rollbackMigration(id: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const migration = migrations.find(m =&gt; m.id === id);

    if (!migration) {
      throw new Error(`Migration ${id} not found`);
    }

    if (!migration.down) {
      throw new Error(`Migration ${id} has no rollback script`);
    }

    const applied = this.getAppliedMigrations();

    if (!applied.has(id)) {
      throw new Error(`Migration ${id} has not been applied`);
    }

    try {
      logger.info(`Rolling back migration: ${migration.id} - ${migration.name}`);

      // Execute rollback
      this.db.exec(migration.down!);
      this.removeMigration(migration.id);

      logger.info(`✅ Migration ${migration.id} rolled back successfully`);
    } catch (error) {
      logger.error(
        `❌ Rollback of migration ${migration.id} failed`,
        error instanceof Error ? error : undefined
      );
      throw error;
    }
  }

  listMigrations(): void {
    const applied = this.getAppliedMigrations();

    logger.info(&#39;Migration Status:&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;==================&#39;);

    for (const migration of migrations) {
      const status = applied.has(migration.id) ? &#39;✅ Applied&#39; : &#39;⏳ Pending&#39;;
      console.log(`${status} ${migration.id} - ${migration.name}`);
    }
  }

  close(): void {
    this.db.close();
  }
}

// CLI interface
async function main() {
  const dbPath = process.env.DATABASE_PATH || &#39;./spec_workbench.db&#39;;
  const runner = new MigrationRunner(dbPath);

  try {
    const command = process.argv[2];

    switch (command) {
      case &#39;up&#39;:
        await runner.runMigrations();
        break;

      case &#39;down&#39;: {
        const migrationId = process.argv[3];
        if (!migrationId) {
          console.error(&#39;Usage: bun run migrate down &lt;migration_id&gt;&#39;);
          process.exit(1);
        }
        await runner.rollbackMigration(migrationId);
        break;
      }

      case &#39;status&#39;:
        runner.listMigrations();
        break;

      default:
        // Default to running migrations
        await runner.runMigrations();
        break;
    }
  } catch (error) {
    logger.error(&#39;Migration failed&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error : undefined);
    process.exit(1);
  } finally {
    runner.close();
  }
}

if (import.meta.main) {
  main();
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/debounce.ts
/**
 * Debounce utility function
 * Delays function execution until after a specified delay has elapsed since its last invocation
 */
export function debounce&lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; any&gt;(
  func: T,
  delay: number,
): (...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) =&gt; void {
  let timeoutId: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;

  return function debounced(...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) {
    if (timeoutId !== null) {
      clearTimeout(timeoutId);
    }

    timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; {
      func(...args);
      timeoutId = null;
    }, delay);
  };
}

/**
 * Throttle utility function
 * Ensures function is called at most once per specified interval
 */
export function throttle&lt;T extends (...args: any[]) =&gt; any&gt;(
  func: T,
  interval: number,
): (...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) =&gt; void {
  let lastCallTime = 0;
  let timeoutId: NodeJS.Timeout | null = null;

  return function throttled(...args: Parameters&lt;T&gt;) {
    const now = Date.now();
    const timeSinceLastCall = now - lastCallTime;

    if (timeSinceLastCall &gt;= interval) {
      lastCallTime = now;
      func(...args);
    } else if (timeoutId === null) {
      const remainingTime = interval - timeSinceLastCall;
      timeoutId = setTimeout(() =&gt; {
        lastCallTime = Date.now();
        func(...args);
        timeoutId = null;
      }, remainingTime);
    }
  };
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/.storybook/main.ts
import type { StorybookConfig } from &quot;@storybook/react-vite&quot;;

const config: StorybookConfig = {
  stories: [&quot;../src/**/*.stories.@(js|jsx|ts|tsx)&quot;],
  addons: [
    &quot;@storybook/addon-essentials&quot;,
    &quot;@storybook/addon-a11y&quot;,
    &quot;@storybook/addon-docs&quot;,
    &quot;@storybook/addon-interactions&quot;,
  ],
  framework: {
    name: &quot;@storybook/react-vite&quot;,
    options: {},
  },
  typescript: {
    check: false,
  },
  core: {
    disableTelemetry: true,
  },
};

export default config;
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/vite-env.d.ts
/// &lt;reference types=&quot;vite/client&quot; /&gt;
📄 apps/api/src/specEngine.ts
/**
 * Spec validation engine with CUE and jq integration
 */
import { join } from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import type {
  CoverageGap,
  Duplicate,
  ExternalToolResult,
  Fragment,
  GapSet,
  ServerConfig,
  TokenReference,
  ValidationError,
  ValidationWarning,
} from &#39;./types.ts&#39;;
import { CueRunner, type CueDiagnostic } from &#39;@arbiter/cue-runner&#39;;
import { computeSpecHash, ensureDir, executeCommand, formatCUE, generateId, logger } from &#39;./utils.ts&#39;;

/**
 * Interface for assertion configurations
 */
interface AssertionConfig {
  query: string;
  description: string;
  threshold?: number;
  type?: string;
}

/**
 * Interface for assertion commands
 */
interface AssertionCommand {
  execute(tempFilePath: string, jqBinaryPath: string): Promise&lt;ValidationError | null&gt;;
  getConfig(): AssertionConfig;
}

/**
 * Result of assertion processing
 */
interface AssertionResult {
  success: boolean;
  value?: number;
  error?: string;
}

/**
 * Manages temporary file creation and cleanup
 */
class TempFileManager {
  private tempFile: string;

  constructor(_data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;) {
    this.tempFile = `/tmp/resolved_${generateId()}.json`;
  }

  async create(data: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const resolvedJson = JSON.stringify(data, null, 2);
    await Bun.write(this.tempFile, resolvedJson);
  }

  getPath(): string {
    return this.tempFile;
  }

  async cleanup(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      const exists = await Bun.file(this.tempFile).exists();
      if (exists) {
        await Bun.write(this.tempFile, &#39;&#39;);
      }
    } catch {
      // Ignore cleanup errors
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Processes and parses assertion results
 */
class AssertionResultProcessor {
  static processCommandResult(result: any): AssertionResult {
    if (result.success) {
      const value = Number.parseInt(result.stdout.trim(), 10) || 0;
      return { success: true, value };
    }
    return { success: false, error: result.stderr };
  }

  static createValidationError(
    config: AssertionConfig,
    result: AssertionResult,
    errorType:
      | &#39;execution&#39;
      | &#39;command_failed&#39;
      | &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39;
      | &#39;minimum_not_met&#39; = &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39;,
    error?: Error
  ): ValidationError {
    if (error) {
      return {
        type: &#39;assertion&#39;,
        message: `jq execution error for ${config.description}`,
        details: {
          query: config.query,
          error: error.message,
        },
      };
    }

    if (!result.success) {
      return {
        type: &#39;assertion&#39;,
        message: `jq assertion failed: ${config.description}`,
        details: {
          query: config.query,
          error: result.error,
        },
      };
    }

    // Create appropriate error message based on error type
    let message: string;
    switch (errorType) {
      case &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39;:
        message = `${config.description}: expected &lt;= ${config.threshold}, got ${result.value}`;
        break;
      case &#39;minimum_not_met&#39;:
        message = `${config.description}: expected &gt;= ${config.threshold}, got ${result.value}`;
        break;
      default:
        message = `${config.description}: assertion failed`;
    }

    return {
      type: &#39;assertion&#39;,
      message,
      details: {
        query: config.query,
        value: result.value,
        threshold: config.threshold,
      },
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Base template for assertion execution
 */
abstract class AbstractAssertionCommand implements AssertionCommand {
  protected config: AssertionConfig;

  constructor(config: AssertionConfig) {
    this.config = config;
  }

  async execute(tempFilePath: string, jqBinaryPath: string): Promise&lt;ValidationError | null&gt; {
    try {
      const commandResult = await this.executeJqCommand(tempFilePath, jqBinaryPath);
      const result = AssertionResultProcessor.processCommandResult(commandResult);

      if (!result.success) {
        return AssertionResultProcessor.createValidationError(
          this.config,
          result,
          &#39;command_failed&#39;
        );
      }

      if (this.shouldCreateError(result)) {
        return AssertionResultProcessor.createValidationError(
          this.config,
          result,
          this.getErrorType()
        );
      }

      return null;
    } catch (error) {
      return AssertionResultProcessor.createValidationError(
        this.config,
        { success: false },
        &#39;execution&#39;,
        error instanceof Error ? error : new Error(&#39;Unknown error&#39;)
      );
    }
  }

  protected abstract shouldCreateError(result: AssertionResult): boolean;
  protected abstract getErrorType(): &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39; | &#39;minimum_not_met&#39;;

  protected async executeJqCommand(tempFilePath: string, jqBinaryPath: string): Promise&lt;any&gt; {
    return executeCommand(jqBinaryPath, [this.config.query, tempFilePath], { timeout: 5000 });
  }

  getConfig(): AssertionConfig {
    return this.config;
  }
}

/**
 * Command for threshold-based assertions
 */
class ThresholdAssertionCommand extends AbstractAssertionCommand {
  protected shouldCreateError(result: AssertionResult): boolean {
    // For threshold assertions, we fail when the value exceeds the threshold
    // For &quot;unresolved tokens&quot;, threshold=0 means we fail if there are ANY (&gt;0)
    return (
      this.config.threshold !== undefined &amp;&amp;
      result.value !== undefined &amp;&amp;
      result.value &gt; this.config.threshold
    );
  }

  protected getErrorType(): &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39; | &#39;minimum_not_met&#39; {
    return &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Command for minimum threshold assertions (must be &gt;= threshold)
 */
class MinimumThresholdCommand extends AbstractAssertionCommand {
  protected shouldCreateError(result: AssertionResult): boolean {
    return (
      this.config.threshold !== undefined &amp;&amp;
      result.value !== undefined &amp;&amp;
      result.value &lt; this.config.threshold
    );
  }

  protected getErrorType(): &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39; | &#39;minimum_not_met&#39; {
    return &#39;minimum_not_met&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * Command for existence-based assertions
 */
class ExistenceAssertionCommand extends AbstractAssertionCommand {
  protected shouldCreateError(result: AssertionResult): boolean {
    return result.value === 0; // Fail if nothing exists
  }

  protected getErrorType(): &#39;threshold_exceeded&#39; | &#39;minimum_not_met&#39; {
    return &#39;minimum_not_met&#39;; // Existence is essentially minimum threshold of 1
  }
}

/**
 * Builder for creating assertion commands
 */
class AssertionCommandBuilder {
  private config: Partial&lt;AssertionConfig&gt; = {};

  static create(): AssertionCommandBuilder {
    return new AssertionCommandBuilder();
  }

  query(query: string): AssertionCommandBuilder {
    this.config.query = query;
    return this;
  }

  description(description: string): AssertionCommandBuilder {
    this.config.description = description;
    return this;
  }

  threshold(threshold: number): AssertionCommandBuilder {
    this.config.threshold = threshold;
    return this;
