📄 apps/web/frontend/src/types/ui.ts
/**
 * UI-specific types for frontend state management
 */

import type {
  Fragment,
  GapSet,
  IRResponse,
  Project,
  ValidationError,
  ValidationWarning,
} from &#39;./api&#39;;

// Application state
export interface AppState {
  // Core data
  currentProject: Project | null;
  projects: Project[];
  fragments: Fragment[];
  resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; | null;
  gaps: GapSet | null;
  irs: Record&lt;string, IRResponse&gt;;

  // UI state
  activeFragmentId: string | null;
  isLoading: boolean;
  error: string | null;

  // Editor state
  unsavedChanges: Set&lt;string&gt;;
  editorContent: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;

  // Connection state
  isConnected: boolean;
  reconnectAttempts: number;
  lastSync: string | null;

  // Validation state
  validationErrors: ValidationError[];
  validationWarnings: ValidationWarning[];
  isValidating: boolean;
  lastValidation: string | null;
  specHash: string | null;

  // CUE file state
  selectedCueFile: string | null;
  availableCueFiles: string[];
}

// Tab types - separate left and right tab groups
export type LeftTab = &#39;source&#39; | &#39;friendly&#39;;
export type RightTab =
  | &#39;flow&#39;
  | &#39;site&#39;
  | &#39;fsm&#39;
  | &#39;view&#39;
  | &#39;gaps&#39;
  | &#39;resolved&#39;
  | &#39;architecture&#39;
  | &#39;handlers&#39;;

// Legacy type for backwards compatibility
export type DiagramTab = LeftTab | RightTab;

// UI actions
export type AppAction =
  | { type: &#39;SET_PROJECT&#39;; payload: Project | null }
  | { type: &#39;SET_PROJECTS&#39;; payload: Project[] }
  | { type: &#39;SET_CURRENT_PROJECT&#39;; payload: Project }
  | { type: &#39;SET_FRAGMENTS&#39;; payload: Fragment[] }
  | { type: &#39;UPDATE_FRAGMENT&#39;; payload: Fragment }
  | { type: &#39;DELETE_FRAGMENT&#39;; payload: string }
  | { type: &#39;SET_RESOLVED&#39;; payload: { resolved: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;; specHash: string } }
  | { type: &#39;SET_GAPS&#39;; payload: GapSet }
  | { type: &#39;SET_IR&#39;; payload: { kind: string; data: IRResponse } }
  | { type: &#39;SET_ACTIVE_FRAGMENT&#39;; payload: string | null }
  | { type: &#39;SET_LOADING&#39;; payload: boolean }
  | { type: &#39;SET_ERROR&#39;; payload: string | null }
  | { type: &#39;SET_EDITOR_CONTENT&#39;; payload: { fragmentId: string; content: string } }
  | { type: &#39;MARK_UNSAVED&#39;; payload: string }
  | { type: &#39;MARK_SAVED&#39;; payload: string }
  | { type: &#39;SET_CONNECTION_STATUS&#39;; payload: boolean }
  | { type: &#39;INCREMENT_RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS&#39; }
  | { type: &#39;RESET_RECONNECT_ATTEMPTS&#39; }
  | { type: &#39;SET_LAST_SYNC&#39;; payload: string }
  | {
      type: &#39;SET_VALIDATION_STATE&#39;;
      payload: {
        errors: ValidationError[];
        warnings: ValidationWarning[];
        isValidating: boolean;
        lastValidation: string | null;
        specHash: string | null;
      };
    }
  | { type: &#39;SET_SELECTED_CUE_FILE&#39;; payload: string | null }
  | { type: &#39;SET_AVAILABLE_CUE_FILES&#39;; payload: string[] };

// Component props
export interface SplitPaneProps {
  children: [React.ReactNode, React.ReactNode];
  defaultSize?: number | string;
  minSize?: number | string;
  maxSize?: number | string;
  allowResize?: boolean;
  split?: &#39;vertical&#39; | &#39;horizontal&#39;;
  className?: string;
}

export interface TabsProps {
  activeTab: string;
  onTabChange: (tab: string) =&gt; void;
  tabs: TabItem[];
  className?: string;
}

export interface TabItem {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  content: React.ReactNode;
  disabled?: boolean;
  badge?: string | number;
}

// File tree types
export interface FileTreeItem {
  id: string;
  path: string;
  type: &#39;file&#39; | &#39;directory&#39;;
  children?: FileTreeItem[];
  hasUnsavedChanges?: boolean;
}

// Monaco editor types
export interface EditorProps {
  value: string;
  onChange: (value: string) =&gt; void;
  onSave?: () =&gt; void;
  language?: string;
  theme?: string;
  options?: any;
  className?: string;
}

// Diagram renderer types
export interface DiagramRendererProps {
  data: any;
  loading?: boolean;
  error?: string;
  className?: string;
}

export interface MermaidDiagramProps extends DiagramRendererProps {
  data: string; // Mermaid text
}

export interface GraphvizDiagramProps extends DiagramRendererProps {
  data: string; // DOT notation
}

export interface ExcalidrawDiagramProps extends DiagramRendererProps {
  data: any; // Excalidraw scene data
  onDataChange?: (data: any) =&gt; void;
}

// Toast notification types
export interface ToastNotification {
  id: string;
  type: &#39;info&#39; | &#39;success&#39; | &#39;warning&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
  message: string;
  duration?: number;
  timestamp: string;
  user?: string;
}

// WebSocket connection types
export interface WebSocketState {
  isConnected: boolean;
  reconnectAttempts: number;
  lastPing: string | null;
  connectionId: string | null;
}

// Worker message types
export interface WorkerMessage {
  id: string;
  type: &#39;render&#39; | &#39;response&#39; | &#39;error&#39;;
  data: any;
}

export interface WorkerResponse extends WorkerMessage {
  type: &#39;response&#39;;
  success: boolean;
  result?: any;
  error?: string;
  duration?: number;
}

// Coverage meter types
export interface CoverageMeterProps {
  label: string;
  current: number;
  target: number;
  unit?: string;
  showPercentage?: boolean;
  className?: string;
}

// Interactive gaps types
export interface GapItemProps {
  type: &#39;missing_capability&#39; | &#39;orphaned_token&#39; | &#39;coverage_gap&#39; | &#39;duplicate&#39;;
  data: any;
  onResolve?: (id: string) =&gt; void;
  onNavigate?: (location: string) =&gt; void;
}

// Performance monitoring types
export interface PerformanceMetrics {
  initialLoadTime: number;
  wsEventProcessingTime: number;
  diagramRenderTime: Record&lt;string, number&gt;;
  editorResponseTime: number;
  lastMeasured: string;
}

// Cache types
export interface CacheEntry&lt;T = any&gt; {
  data: T;
  timestamp: string;
  specHash: string;
  expiresAt?: string;
}

export interface CacheManager {
  get&lt;T&gt;(key: string): CacheEntry&lt;T&gt; | null;
  set&lt;T&gt;(key: string, data: T, specHash: string, ttl?: number): void;
  invalidate(specHash: string): void;
  clear(): void;
}

// Error boundary types
export interface ErrorInfo {
  componentStack: string;
  errorBoundary?: string;
}

export interface ErrorBoundaryState {
  hasError: boolean;
  error: Error | null;
  errorInfo: ErrorInfo | null;
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/components/Layout/SplitPane.tsx
/**
 * Resizable split pane component
 */

import React, { useState, useRef, useEffect, useCallback } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { clsx } from &#39;clsx&#39;;
import type { SplitPaneProps } from &#39;../../types/ui&#39;;

export function SplitPane({
  children,
  defaultSize = &#39;50%&#39;,
  minSize = &#39;200px&#39;,
  maxSize = &#39;80%&#39;,
  allowResize = true,
  split = &#39;vertical&#39;,
  className,
}: SplitPaneProps) {
  const [size, setSize] = useState&lt;string&gt;(
    typeof defaultSize === &#39;string&#39; ? defaultSize : `${defaultSize}px`
  );
  const [isDragging, setIsDragging] = useState(false);

  const containerRef = useRef&lt;HTMLDivElement&gt;(null);
  const resizerRef = useRef&lt;HTMLDivElement&gt;(null);

  // Convert size to pixels for calculations
  const getPixelSize = useCallback((sizeStr: string, containerSize: number): number =&gt; {
    if (sizeStr.endsWith(&#39;%&#39;)) {
      return (parseFloat(sizeStr) / 100) * containerSize;
    }
    return parseFloat(sizeStr);
  }, []);

  // Handle mouse down on resizer
  const handleMouseDown = useCallback(
    (e: React.MouseEvent) =&gt; {
      if (!allowResize) return;

      e.preventDefault();
      setIsDragging(true);
    },
    [allowResize]
  );

  // Handle mouse move during drag
  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    if (!isDragging || !containerRef.current) return;

    const handleMouseMove = (e: MouseEvent) =&gt; {
      if (!containerRef.current) return;

      const containerRect = containerRef.current.getBoundingClientRect();
      const containerSize = split === &#39;vertical&#39; ? containerRect.width : containerRect.height;
      const offset =
        split === &#39;vertical&#39; ? e.clientX - containerRect.left : e.clientY - containerRect.top;

      // Calculate percentage
      const percentage = (offset / containerSize) * 100;

      // Apply constraints
      const minPixels = getPixelSize(
        typeof minSize === &#39;string&#39; ? minSize : `${minSize}px`,
        containerSize
      );
      const maxPixels = getPixelSize(
        typeof maxSize === &#39;string&#39; ? maxSize : `${maxSize}px`,
        containerSize
      );
      const minPercentage = (minPixels / containerSize) * 100;
      const maxPercentage = (maxPixels / containerSize) * 100;

      const clampedPercentage = Math.max(minPercentage, Math.min(maxPercentage, percentage));
      setSize(`${clampedPercentage}%`);
    };

    const handleMouseUp = () =&gt; {
      setIsDragging(false);
    };

    document.addEventListener(&#39;mousemove&#39;, handleMouseMove);
    document.addEventListener(&#39;mouseup&#39;, handleMouseUp);
    document.body.style.cursor = split === &#39;vertical&#39; ? &#39;col-resize&#39; : &#39;row-resize&#39;;
    document.body.style.userSelect = &#39;none&#39;;

    return () =&gt; {
      document.removeEventListener(&#39;mousemove&#39;, handleMouseMove);
      document.removeEventListener(&#39;mouseup&#39;, handleMouseUp);
      document.body.style.cursor = &#39;&#39;;
      document.body.style.userSelect = &#39;&#39;;
    };
  }, [isDragging, split, getPixelSize, minSize, maxSize]);

  const isVertical = split === &#39;vertical&#39;;
  const [leftPane, rightPane] = children;

  return (
    &lt;div
      ref={containerRef}
      className={clsx(
        &#39;flex h-full w-full overflow-hidden&#39;,
        isVertical ? &#39;flex-row&#39; : &#39;flex-col&#39;,
        className
      )}
    &gt;
      {/* First pane */}
      &lt;div
        className=&quot;relative overflow-hidden&quot;
        style={{
          [isVertical ? &#39;width&#39; : &#39;height&#39;]: size,
          [isVertical ? &#39;height&#39; : &#39;width&#39;]: &#39;100%&#39;,
        }}
      &gt;
        {leftPane}
      &lt;/div&gt;

      {/* Resizer */}
      {allowResize &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;div
          ref={resizerRef}
          className={clsx(
            &#39;bg-gray-300 hover:bg-gray-400 transition-colors duration-150 flex-shrink-0&#39;,
            isVertical ? &#39;w-1 cursor-col-resize hover:w-2&#39; : &#39;h-1 cursor-row-resize hover:h-2&#39;,
            isDragging &amp;&amp; (isVertical ? &#39;w-2 bg-blue-500&#39; : &#39;h-2 bg-blue-500&#39;)
          )}
          onMouseDown={handleMouseDown}
        /&gt;
      )}

      {/* Second pane */}
      &lt;div
        className=&quot;flex-1 overflow-hidden&quot;
        style={{
          [isVertical ? &#39;width&#39; : &#39;height&#39;]: `calc(100% - ${size} - 4px)`,
        }}
      &gt;
        {rightPane}
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
}

export default SplitPane;
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/components/diagrams/MermaidRenderer.tsx
import React, { useEffect, useRef, useState } from &#39;react&#39;;
import mermaid from &#39;mermaid&#39;;
import { AlertCircle, RefreshCw } from &#39;lucide-react&#39;;

interface MermaidRendererProps {
  chart: string;
  className?: string;
  title?: string;
}

export const MermaidRenderer: React.FC&lt;MermaidRendererProps&gt; = ({
  chart,
  className = &#39;&#39;,
  title,
}) =&gt; {
  const containerRef = useRef&lt;HTMLDivElement&gt;(null);
  const [error, setError] = useState&lt;string | null&gt;(null);
  const [isLoading, setIsLoading] = useState(true);

  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    // Initialize mermaid with modern configuration
    mermaid.initialize({
      startOnLoad: true,
      theme: &#39;default&#39;,
      securityLevel: &#39;loose&#39;,
      fontFamily: &#39;Inter, system-ui, sans-serif&#39;,
      flowchart: {
        useMaxWidth: true,
        htmlLabels: true,
        curve: &#39;basis&#39;,
        padding: 20,
      },
      sequence: {
        useMaxWidth: true,
        rightAngles: false,
        showSequenceNumbers: true,
      },
      gantt: {
        useMaxWidth: true,
        leftPadding: 75,
        gridLineStartPadding: 35,
        fontSize: 11,
      },
      state: {
        useMaxWidth: true,
      },
    });
  }, []);

  const renderChart = async () =&gt; {
    if (!containerRef.current || !chart) return;

    try {
      setIsLoading(true);
      setError(null);

      // Clear previous content
      containerRef.current.innerHTML = &#39;&#39;;

      // Generate unique ID for this diagram
      const diagramId = `mermaid-${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`;

      // Render the diagram
      const { svg } = await mermaid.render(diagramId, chart);

      // Insert the SVG into the container
      containerRef.current.innerHTML = svg;

      // Make sure the SVG is responsive
      const svgElement = containerRef.current.querySelector(&#39;svg&#39;);
      if (svgElement) {
        svgElement.style.maxWidth = &#39;100%&#39;;
        svgElement.style.height = &#39;auto&#39;;
        svgElement.style.display = &#39;block&#39;;
        svgElement.style.margin = &#39;0 auto&#39;;
      }
    } catch (err) {
      console.error(&#39;Failed to render mermaid diagram:&#39;, err);
      setError(err instanceof Error ? err.message : &#39;Failed to render diagram&#39;);
    } finally {
      setIsLoading(false);
    }
  };

  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    renderChart();
  }, [chart]);

  const handleRetry = () =&gt; {
    renderChart();
  };

  if (isLoading) {
    return (
      &lt;div className={`flex items-center justify-center min-h-[200px] ${className}`}&gt;
        &lt;div className=&quot;text-center&quot;&gt;
          &lt;RefreshCw className=&quot;w-8 h-8 animate-spin text-blue-600 mx-auto mb-2&quot; /&gt;
          &lt;p className=&quot;text-gray-600&quot;&gt;Rendering diagram...&lt;/p&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    );
  }

  if (error) {
    return (
      &lt;div className={`flex items-center justify-center min-h-[200px] ${className}`}&gt;
        &lt;div className=&quot;text-center max-w-md&quot;&gt;
          &lt;AlertCircle className=&quot;w-12 h-12 text-red-500 mx-auto mb-4&quot; /&gt;
          &lt;h4 className=&quot;text-red-700 font-medium mb-2&quot;&gt;Diagram Render Error&lt;/h4&gt;
          &lt;p className=&quot;text-red-600 text-sm mb-4&quot;&gt;{error}&lt;/p&gt;
          &lt;button
            onClick={handleRetry}
            className=&quot;inline-flex items-center gap-2 px-4 py-2 bg-red-100 text-red-800 rounded-md hover:bg-red-200 transition-colors&quot;
          &gt;
            &lt;RefreshCw className=&quot;w-4 h-4&quot; /&gt;
            Retry
          &lt;/button&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    );
  }

  return (
    &lt;div className={className}&gt;
      {title &amp;&amp; &lt;h4 className=&quot;text-sm font-semibold text-gray-700 mb-4 text-center&quot;&gt;{title}&lt;/h4&gt;}
      &lt;div className=&quot;bg-white rounded-lg border border-gray-200 p-4&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div
          ref={containerRef}
          className=&quot;mermaid-container flex items-center justify-center min-h-[200px]&quot;
        /&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
};

export default MermaidRenderer;
📄 packages/cli/src/constraints/index.ts
import { EventEmitter } from &#39;node:events&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import {
  ConstraintViolationError,
  type Constraints,
  DEFAULT_CONSTRAINTS,
  constrainedOperation,
  globalConstraintEnforcer,
} from &#39;./core.js&#39;;
import {
  type FileSystemOperation,
  bundleStandalone,
  copyStandalone,
  globalFileSystemConstraints,
  safeFileOperation,
} from &#39;./filesystem.js&#39;;
import {
  type IdempotentOperation,
  globalIdempotencyValidator,
  validateIdempotentEdits,
  withIdempotencyValidation,
} from &#39;./idempotency.js&#39;;
import {
  type SandboxValidator,
  type SandboxedOperation,
  createSandboxValidator,
  initializeSandboxConfig,
} from &#39;./sandbox.js&#39;;
import {
  LATEST_API_VERSION,
  ensureLatestSchema,
  globalSchemaValidator,
  validateReadData,
} from &#39;./schema.js&#39;;

/**
 * Comprehensive constraint violation summary
 */
export interface ConstraintViolationSummary {
  totalViolations: number;
  byConstraint: Record&lt;string, number&gt;;
  criticalViolations: string[];
  suggestions: string[];
  complianceRate: number;
}

/**
 * Constraint system status
 */
export interface ConstraintSystemStatus {
  isHealthy: boolean;
  constraints: Constraints;
  violations: ConstraintViolationSummary;
  sandbox: {
    activeOperations: number;
    complianceRate: number;
  };
  fileSystem: {
    symlinks: number;
    invalidPaths: number;
  };
  idempotency: {
    cacheSize: number;
    validations: number;
  };
  schema: {
    latestVersion: string;
    deprecatedWarnings: number;
  };
}

/**
 * Master constraint system that coordinates all constraint enforcement
 */
export class ConstraintSystem extends EventEmitter {
  private readonly config: CLIConfig;
  private readonly constraints: Constraints;
  private readonly sandboxValidator: SandboxValidator;
  private readonly violationCounts = new Map&lt;string, number&gt;();

  constructor(config: CLIConfig, constraints: Partial&lt;Constraints&gt; = {}) {
    super();

    this.config = config;
    this.constraints = { ...DEFAULT_CONSTRAINTS, ...constraints };
    this.sandboxValidator = createSandboxValidator(config);

    // Initialize global configurations
    initializeSandboxConfig(config);

    // Set up event listeners for violation tracking
    this.setupViolationTracking();

    // Start background maintenance tasks
    this.startMaintenanceTasks();
  }

  /**
   * Execute any operation with comprehensive constraint enforcement
   */
  async executeWithConstraints&lt;T&gt;(
    operation: string,
    operationType: {
      sandbox?: SandboxedOperation;
      filesystem?: FileSystemOperation;
      idempotent?: IdempotentOperation;
    },
    executor: () =&gt; Promise&lt;T&gt;,
    metadata?: Record&lt;string, unknown&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;T&gt; {
    return constrainedOperation(
      operation,
      async () =&gt; {
        // Start sandbox tracking if applicable
        let sandboxOperationId: string | undefined;
        if (operationType.sandbox) {
          sandboxOperationId = this.sandboxValidator.startOperation(operationType.sandbox);
        }

        try {
          let result: T;

          // Apply idempotency validation if needed
          if (operationType.idempotent) {
            result = await withIdempotencyValidation(
              operationType.idempotent,
              { operation, metadata },
              executor
            );
          } else {
            result = await executor();
          }

          // Validate result schema if it looks like API data
          if (this.isApiData(result)) {
            ensureLatestSchema(result);
          }

          return result;
        } finally {
          // End sandbox tracking
          if (operationType.sandbox &amp;&amp; sandboxOperationId) {
            this.sandboxValidator.endOperation(operationType.sandbox, sandboxOperationId);
          }
        }
      },
      metadata
    );
  }

  /**
   * Validate file operation with all relevant constraints
   */
  async validateFileOperation(
    operation: FileSystemOperation,
    filePaths: string[],
    operationId?: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    for (const filePath of filePaths) {
      await globalFileSystemConstraints.validatePath(filePath, operation, operationId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate payload sizes for all files
   */
  private validateFilePayloads(files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;, operationId: string): void {
    for (const [_path, content] of Object.entries(files)) {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.validatePayloadSize(content, operationId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Ensure schema compliance for JSON files
   */
  private ensureSchemaCompliance(files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;): void {
    for (const [_path, content] of Object.entries(files)) {
      try {
        const parsed = JSON.parse(content);
        if (this.isApiData(parsed)) {
          ensureLatestSchema(parsed);
        }
      } catch {
        // Not JSON, skip schema validation
      }
    }
  }

  /**
   * Export files with constraint enforcement
   */
  async exportWithConstraints(
    files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
    outputDir: string,
    format?: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const operationId = this.startExportOperation(files, outputDir, format);

    try {
      await this.performConstrainedExport(files, outputDir, operationId);
    } finally {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Start export operation with proper metadata tracking
   */
  private startExportOperation(
    files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
    outputDir: string,
    format?: string
  ): string {
    return globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(&#39;constrained_export&#39;, {
      fileCount: Object.keys(files).length,
      outputDir,
      format,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Perform the constrained export with all validation steps
   */
  private async performConstrainedExport(
    files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
    outputDir: string,
    operationId: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    this.validateFilePayloads(files, operationId);
    await this.executeFileSystemExport(files, outputDir, operationId);
    this.ensureSchemaCompliance(files);
  }

  /**
   * Execute the file system export operation
   */
  private async executeFileSystemExport(
    files: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
    outputDir: string,
    operationId: string
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    await globalFileSystemConstraints.exportFiles(files, outputDir, operationId);
  }

  /**
   * Bundle files with constraint enforcement
   */
  async bundleWithConstraints(files: string[], outputDir: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const operationId = globalConstraintEnforcer.startOperation(&#39;constrained_bundle&#39;, {
      fileCount: files.length,
      outputDir,
    });

    try {
      // Validate all file paths first
      await this.validateFileOperation(&#39;bundle&#39;, files, operationId);

      // Use standalone copy bundling (no symlinks)
      await bundleStandalone(files, outputDir, operationId);
    } finally {
      globalConstraintEnforcer.endOperation(operationId);
    }
  }

  /**
   * Validate API response with schema and payload constraints
   */
  validateApiResponse(data: unknown, operationId?: string): unknown {
    // Validate payload size
    globalConstraintEnforcer.validatePayloadSize(data, operationId);

    // Validate schema for read operations
    if (this.isApiData(data)) {
      return validateReadData(data, operationId);
    }

    return data;
  }

  /**
   * Get comprehensive constraint system status
   */
  getSystemStatus(): ConstraintSystemStatus {
    const _constraintStatus = globalConstraintEnforcer.getConstraintStatus();
    const sandboxStatus = this.sandboxValidator.getSandboxStatus();
    const fsStatus = globalFileSystemConstraints.getConstraintStatus();
    const idempotencyStats = globalIdempotencyValidator.getValidationStats();

    const totalViolations = Array.from(this.violationCounts.values()).reduce((a, b) =&gt; a + b, 0);
    const complianceRate = totalViolations &gt; 0 ? Math.max(0, 100 - totalViolations * 10) : 100;

    return {
      isHealthy: totalViolations === 0 &amp;&amp; complianceRate &gt; 95,
      constraints: this.constraints,
      violations: {
        totalViolations,
        byConstraint: Object.fromEntries(this.violationCounts),
        criticalViolations: this.getCriticalViolations(),
        suggestions: this.getImprovementSuggestions(),
        complianceRate,
      },
      sandbox: {
        activeOperations: sandboxStatus.activeOperations.length,
        complianceRate: sandboxStatus.complianceRate,
      },
      fileSystem: {
        symlinks: fsStatus.violations.symlinks,
        invalidPaths: fsStatus.violations.invalidPaths,
      },
      idempotency: {
        cacheSize: idempotencyStats.cacheSize,
        validations: idempotencyStats.validations,
      },
      schema: {
        latestVersion: LATEST_API_VERSION,
        deprecatedWarnings: 0, // Would be tracked via events
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Generate constraint compliance report
   */
  generateComplianceReport(): string {
    const status = this.getSystemStatus();
    const lines: string[] = [];

    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;🛡️  Constraint System Status&#39;));
    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    // Overall health
    const healthColor = status.isHealthy ? chalk.green : chalk.red;
    const healthStatus = status.isHealthy ? &#39;HEALTHY&#39; : &#39;VIOLATIONS DETECTED&#39;;
    lines.push(`Overall Status: ${healthColor(healthStatus)}`);
    lines.push(`Compliance Rate: ${this.formatComplianceRate(status.violations.complianceRate)}`);
    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    // Constraint details
    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Constraint Limits:&#39;));
    lines.push(`  Max Payload Size: ${this.formatBytes(status.constraints.maxPayloadSize)}`);
    lines.push(`  Max Operation Time: ${status.constraints.maxOperationTime}ms`);
    lines.push(
      `  Rate Limit: ${status.constraints.rateLimit.requests} req/${status.constraints.rateLimit.windowMs}ms`
    );
    lines.push(`  API Version: ${status.constraints.apiVersion}`);
    lines.push(`  Symlink Depth: ${status.constraints.maxSymlinkDepth} (symlinks forbidden)`);
    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    // Violations
    if (status.violations.totalViolations &gt; 0) {
      lines.push(chalk.bold(chalk.red(&#39;Violations:&#39;)));
      for (const [constraint, count] of Object.entries(status.violations.byConstraint)) {
        if (count &gt; 0) {
          lines.push(`  ${chalk.red(&#39;✗&#39;)} ${constraint}: ${count} violations`);
        }
      }

      if (status.violations.criticalViolations.length &gt; 0) {
        lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
        lines.push(chalk.bold(chalk.red(&#39;Critical Issues:&#39;)));
        for (const critical of status.violations.criticalViolations) {
          lines.push(`  ${chalk.red(&#39;⚠&#39;)} ${critical}`);
        }
      }

      lines.push(&#39;&#39;);
      lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Suggestions:&#39;));
      for (const suggestion of status.violations.suggestions) {
        lines.push(`  ${chalk.yellow(&#39;💡&#39;)} ${suggestion}`);
      }
    } else {
      lines.push(chalk.green(&#39;✅ No constraint violations detected&#39;));
    }

    lines.push(&#39;&#39;);

    // Component status
    lines.push(chalk.bold(&#39;Component Status:&#39;));
    lines.push(
      `  Sandbox: ${status.sandbox.activeOperations} active ops, ${status.sandbox.complianceRate.toFixed(1)}% compliant`
    );
    lines.push(
      `  File System: ${status.fileSystem.symlinks} symlinks, ${status.fileSystem.invalidPaths} invalid paths`
    );
    lines.push(
      `  Idempotency: ${status.idempotency.cacheSize} cached, ${status.idempotency.validations} validated`
    );
    lines.push(
      `  Schema: version ${status.schema.latestVersion}, ${status.schema.deprecatedWarnings} warnings`
    );

    return lines.join(&#39;\n&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Cleanup and shutdown constraint system
   */
  async shutdown(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    // Clear idempotency cache
    globalIdempotencyValidator.clearExpiredCache();

    // Remove all listeners
    this.removeAllListeners();
    globalConstraintEnforcer.removeAllListeners();

    this.emit(&#39;constraint_system:shutdown&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Set up violation tracking across all constraint modules
   */
  private setupViolationTracking(): void {
    // Track violations from core enforcer
    globalConstraintEnforcer.on(&#39;constraint:violation&#39;, event =&gt; {
      this.incrementViolationCount(event.constraint);
      this.emit(&#39;violation&#39;, {
        constraint: event.constraint,
        violation: event.violation,
        timestamp: Date.now(),
      });
    });

    // Track performance violations
    globalConstraintEnforcer.on(&#39;operation:end&#39;, event =&gt; {
      if (event.duration &gt; this.constraints.maxOperationTime) {
        this.incrementViolationCount(&#39;maxOperationTime&#39;);
      }
    });
  }

  /**
   * Start background maintenance tasks
   */
  private startMaintenanceTasks(): void {
    // Clean up expired idempotency cache every 5 minutes
    setInterval(
      () =&gt; {
        globalIdempotencyValidator.clearExpiredCache();
      },
      5 * 60 * 1000
    );

    // Reset violation counts daily
    setInterval(
      () =&gt; {
        this.violationCounts.clear();
        this.emit(&#39;violation_counts:reset&#39;);
      },
      24 * 60 * 60 * 1000
    );
  }

  /**
   * Check if data looks like API envelope data
   */
  private isApiData(data: unknown): data is Record&lt;string, unknown&gt; {
    return typeof data === &#39;object&#39; &amp;&amp; data !== null &amp;&amp; &#39;apiVersion&#39; in data &amp;&amp; &#39;kind&#39; in data;
  }

  /**
   * Increment violation count for a constraint
   */
  private incrementViolationCount(constraint: string): void {
    const current = this.violationCounts.get(constraint) || 0;
    this.violationCounts.set(constraint, current + 1);
  }

  /**
   * Get critical violations that need immediate attention
   */
  private getCriticalViolations(): string[] {
    const critical: string[] = [];

    for (const [constraint, count] of this.violationCounts.entries()) {
      if (count &gt; 0) {
        switch (constraint) {
          case &#39;maxPayloadSize&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Payload size limits exceeded - requests/responses too large&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;maxOperationTime&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Operations taking too long - performance issues detected&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;sandboxCompliance&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Direct tool execution detected - must use server endpoints&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;symlinkPrevention&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Symlinks detected - must use standalone file copies&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;apiVersion&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Outdated API versions in use - must use latest schema&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;idempotency&#39;:
            critical.push(&#39;Non-idempotent operations detected - results are inconsistent&#39;);
            break;
        }
      }
    }

    return critical;
  }

  /**
   * Get improvement suggestions based on violations
   */
  private getImprovementSuggestions(): string[] {
    const suggestions: string[] = [];

    for (const [constraint, count] of this.violationCounts.entries()) {
      if (count &gt; 0) {
        switch (constraint) {
          case &#39;maxPayloadSize&#39;:
            suggestions.push(&#39;Consider pagination or compression for large datasets&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;maxOperationTime&#39;:
            suggestions.push(&#39;Optimize algorithms or implement caching for better performance&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;rateLimit&#39;:
            suggestions.push(&#39;Implement request queuing or batch operations&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;sandboxCompliance&#39;:
            suggestions.push(
              &#39;Ensure all analyze/validate operations use API client instead of direct tools&#39;
            );
            break;
          case &#39;symlinkPrevention&#39;:
            suggestions.push(&#39;Use file copying utilities that create standalone copies&#39;);
            break;
          case &#39;apiVersion&#39;:
            suggestions.push(`Update all schemas to use API version ${LATEST_API_VERSION}`);
            break;
        }
      }
    }

    return suggestions;
  }

  /**
   * Format compliance rate with appropriate colors
   */
  private formatComplianceRate(rate: number): string {
    if (rate &gt;= 95) return chalk.green(`${rate.toFixed(1)}%`);
    if (rate &gt;= 80) return chalk.yellow(`${rate.toFixed(1)}%`);
    return chalk.red(`${rate.toFixed(1)}%`);
  }

  /**
   * Format bytes in human-readable format
   */
  private formatBytes(bytes: number): string {
    if (bytes === 0) return &#39;0 B&#39;;

    const k = 1024;
    const sizes = [&#39;B&#39;, &#39;KB&#39;, &#39;MB&#39;, &#39;GB&#39;];
    const i = Math.floor(Math.log(bytes) / Math.log(k));

    return `${Number.parseFloat((bytes / k ** i).toFixed(2))} ${sizes[i]}`;
  }
}

// Export all constraint components and utilities
export {
  // Core
  globalConstraintEnforcer,
  constrainedOperation,
  ConstraintViolationError,
  DEFAULT_CONSTRAINTS,
  type Constraints,
  // Sandbox
  createSandboxValidator,
  initializeSandboxConfig,
  type SandboxedOperation,
  type SandboxValidator,
  // Schema
  globalSchemaValidator,
  ensureLatestSchema,
  validateReadData,
  LATEST_API_VERSION,
  // File System
  globalFileSystemConstraints,
  copyStandalone,
  bundleStandalone,
  safeFileOperation,
  type FileSystemOperation,
  // Idempotency
  globalIdempotencyValidator,
  withIdempotencyValidation,
  validateIdempotentEdits,
  type IdempotentOperation,
};

/**
 * Create and initialize constraint system for CLI
 */
export function createConstraintSystem(
  config: CLIConfig,
  constraints?: Partial&lt;Constraints&gt;
): ConstraintSystem {
  return new ConstraintSystem(config, constraints);
}

/**
 * Global constraint system instance (initialized by CLI)
 */
let globalConstraintSystem: ConstraintSystem | null = null;

/**
 * Initialize global constraint system
 */
export function initializeGlobalConstraintSystem(
  config: CLIConfig,
  constraints?: Partial&lt;Constraints&gt;
): ConstraintSystem {
  globalConstraintSystem = new ConstraintSystem(config, constraints);
  return globalConstraintSystem;
}

/**
 * Get global constraint system (throws if not initialized)
 */
export function getGlobalConstraintSystem(): ConstraintSystem {
  if (!globalConstraintSystem) {
    throw new Error(
      &#39;Constraint system not initialized. Call initializeGlobalConstraintSystem first.&#39;
    );
  }
  return globalConstraintSystem;
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/components/diagrams/NetworkDiagram.tsx
import React, { useEffect, useRef } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { Network } from &#39;vis-network&#39;;
import { DataSet } from &#39;vis-data&#39;;

interface NetworkNode {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  group?: string;
  color?: string;
  shape?: string;
  size?: number;
}

interface NetworkEdge {
  id?: string;
  from: string;
  to: string;
  label?: string;
  arrows?: string;
  color?: string;
  dashes?: boolean;
}

interface NetworkDiagramProps {
  nodes: NetworkNode[];
  edges: NetworkEdge[];
  className?: string;
  title?: string;
  options?: any;
}

export const NetworkDiagram: React.FC&lt;NetworkDiagramProps&gt; = ({
  nodes,
  edges,
  className = &#39;&#39;,
  title,
  options = {},
}) =&gt; {
  const containerRef = useRef&lt;HTMLDivElement&gt;(null);
  const networkRef = useRef&lt;Network | null&gt;(null);

  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    if (!containerRef.current) return;

    // Create DataSets
    const nodeDataSet = new DataSet(nodes);
    const edgeDataSet = new DataSet(edges);

    // Default options
    const defaultOptions = {
      nodes: {
        borderWidth: 2,
        borderWidthSelected: 4,
        chosen: true,
        font: {
          size: 12,
          color: &#39;#343a40&#39;,
          face: &#39;Inter, system-ui, sans-serif&#39;,
        },
        scaling: {
          min: 10,
          max: 30,
        },
        shadow: {
          enabled: true,
          color: &#39;rgba(0,0,0,0.1)&#39;,
          size: 5,
          x: 2,
          y: 2,
        },
      },
      edges: {
        width: 2,
        color: {
          color: &#39;#848484&#39;,
          highlight: &#39;#2563eb&#39;,
          hover: &#39;#3b82f6&#39;,
        },
        smooth: {
          type: &#39;cubicBezier&#39;,
          forceDirection: &#39;horizontal&#39;,
          roundness: 0.4,
        },
        arrows: {
          to: {
            enabled: true,
            scaleFactor: 0.8,
          },
        },
        font: {
          size: 11,
          color: &#39;#6b7280&#39;,
          align: &#39;middle&#39;,
          background: &#39;rgba(255,255,255,0.8)&#39;,
          strokeWidth: 0,
        },
      },
      physics: {
        enabled: true,
        stabilization: {
          enabled: true,
          iterations: 100,
          updateInterval: 25,
        },
        barnesHut: {
          gravitationalConstant: -2000,
          centralGravity: 0.3,
          springLength: 150,
          springConstant: 0.04,
          damping: 0.09,
          avoidOverlap: 0.1,
        },
      },
      interaction: {
        hover: true,
        zoomView: true,
        dragView: true,
        selectConnectedEdges: false,
        tooltipDelay: 200,
      },
      layout: {
        improvedLayout: true,
        clusterThreshold: 150,
      },
      ...options,
    };

    // Create network
    const data = {
      nodes: nodeDataSet,
      edges: edgeDataSet,
    };

    networkRef.current = new Network(containerRef.current, data, defaultOptions);

    // Add event listeners
    networkRef.current.on(&#39;click&#39;, params =&gt; {
      if (params.nodes.length &gt; 0) {
        console.log(&#39;Node clicked:&#39;, params.nodes[0]);
      }
    });

    networkRef.current.on(&#39;hoverNode&#39;, params =&gt; {
      document.body.style.cursor = &#39;pointer&#39;;
    });

    networkRef.current.on(&#39;blurNode&#39;, () =&gt; {
      document.body.style.cursor = &#39;default&#39;;
    });

    // Cleanup function
    return () =&gt; {
      if (networkRef.current) {
        networkRef.current.destroy();
        networkRef.current = null;
      }
      document.body.style.cursor = &#39;default&#39;;
    };
  }, [nodes, edges, options]);

  return (
    &lt;div className={className}&gt;
      {title &amp;&amp; &lt;h4 className=&quot;text-sm font-semibold text-gray-700 mb-4 text-center&quot;&gt;{title}&lt;/h4&gt;}
      &lt;div className=&quot;bg-white rounded-lg border border-gray-200 overflow-hidden&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div ref={containerRef} className=&quot;w-full h-96&quot; style={{ minHeight: &#39;400px&#39; }} /&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
};

export default NetworkDiagram;
📄 packages/cli/src/validation/__tests__/debug-spec.test.ts
/**
 * Debug test to understand what warnings are being generated
 */

import { describe, expect, it } from &#39;bun:test&#39;;
import type { AppSpec } from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
import { validateSpecification } from &#39;../warnings.js&#39;;

describe(&#39;Debug Spec Warnings&#39;, () =&gt; {
  it(&#39;should debug complete spec warnings&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const completeValidSpec: any = {
      product: {
        name: &#39;Test Product&#39;,
        goals: [&#39;Achieve high performance&#39;, &#39;Ensure reliability&#39;],
      },
      metadata: {
        name: &#39;test-project&#39;,
        version: &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
        description: &#39;A comprehensive test project&#39;,
      },
      services: {},
      ui: { routes: [] },
      tests: [
        {
          name: &#39;Unit Tests&#39;,
          type: &#39;unit&#39;,
          cases: [{ name: &#39;test case&#39;, assertion: &#39;should work&#39; }],
        },
        {
          name: &#39;Integration Tests&#39;,
          type: &#39;integration&#39;,
          cases: [{ name: &#39;integration test&#39;, assertion: &#39;should integrate&#39; }],
        },
        {
          name: &#39;E2E Tests&#39;,
          type: &#39;e2e&#39;,
          cases: [{ name: &#39;e2e test&#39;, assertion: &#39;should work end-to-end&#39; }],
        },
      ],
      security: {
        authentication: { type: &#39;oauth2&#39; },
        authorization: { rbac: true },
      },
      performance: {
        sla: { responseTime: &#39;&lt; 200ms&#39;, availability: &#39;99.9%&#39; },
      },
      observability: {
        logging: { level: &#39;info&#39;, format: &#39;json&#39; },
        monitoring: { metrics: [&#39;response_time&#39;, &#39;error_rate&#39;] },
      },
      environments: {
        development: { name: &#39;dev&#39; },
        production: { name: &#39;prod&#39; },
      },
    };

    const result = validateSpecification(completeValidSpec);

    console.log(&#39;Complete spec validation result:&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;Has warnings:&#39;, result.hasWarnings);
    console.log(&#39;Has errors:&#39;, result.hasErrors);
    console.log(&#39;Warning count:&#39;, result.warnings.length);
    console.log(
      &#39;Warnings:&#39;,
      result.warnings.map(w =&gt; `${w.category}: ${w.message}`)
    );

    expect(result).toBeDefined();
  });
});
📄 packages/cli/example-script-template.sh
#!/bin/bash

# Example script-based template for Arbiter
# This demonstrates how to create a simple template using shell scripts

echo &quot;🔧 Setting up service: $TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME&quot;
echo &quot;📁 Target directory: $TEMPLATE_DESTINATION&quot;
echo &quot;🏷️  Project: $TEMPLATE_PROJECTNAME&quot;

# Create directory structure
mkdir -p &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/src&quot;
mkdir -p &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/tests&quot;
mkdir -p &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/docs&quot;

# Create main service file
cat &gt; &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/src/index.ts&quot; &lt;&lt; EOF
/**
 * ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME} Service
 * Generated by Arbiter Template System
 */

export class ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service {
  constructor() {
    console.log(&#39;${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^} service initialized&#39;);
  }

  async start(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(&#39;Starting ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME} service...&#39;);
    // Add your service logic here
  }

  async stop(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(&#39;Stopping ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME} service...&#39;);
    // Add cleanup logic here
  }
}

export default ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service;
EOF

# Create package.json
cat &gt; &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/package.json&quot; &lt;&lt; EOF
{
  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;${TEMPLATE_PROJECTNAME,,}-${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME}&quot;,
  &quot;version&quot;: &quot;1.0.0&quot;,
  &quot;description&quot;: &quot;${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^} service for ${TEMPLATE_PROJECTNAME}&quot;,
  &quot;main&quot;: &quot;src/index.ts&quot;,
  &quot;scripts&quot;: {
    &quot;dev&quot;: &quot;tsx watch src/index.ts&quot;,
    &quot;build&quot;: &quot;tsc&quot;,
    &quot;start&quot;: &quot;node dist/index.js&quot;,
    &quot;test&quot;: &quot;jest&quot;
  },
  &quot;dependencies&quot;: {
    &quot;tsx&quot;: &quot;^4.0.0&quot;
  },
  &quot;devDependencies&quot;: {
    &quot;typescript&quot;: &quot;^5.0.0&quot;,
    &quot;@types/node&quot;: &quot;^20.0.0&quot;,
    &quot;jest&quot;: &quot;^29.0.0&quot;
  }
}
EOF

# Create TypeScript config
cat &gt; &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/tsconfig.json&quot; &lt;&lt; EOF
{
  &quot;compilerOptions&quot;: {
    &quot;target&quot;: &quot;ES2022&quot;,
    &quot;module&quot;: &quot;ESNext&quot;,
    &quot;moduleResolution&quot;: &quot;node&quot;,
    &quot;esModuleInterop&quot;: true,
    &quot;allowSyntheticDefaultImports&quot;: true,
    &quot;strict&quot;: true,
    &quot;skipLibCheck&quot;: true,
    &quot;forceConsistentCasingInFileNames&quot;: true,
    &quot;outDir&quot;: &quot;./dist&quot;,
    &quot;rootDir&quot;: &quot;./src&quot;
  },
  &quot;include&quot;: [&quot;src/**/*&quot;],
  &quot;exclude&quot;: [&quot;node_modules&quot;, &quot;dist&quot;, &quot;tests&quot;]
}
EOF

# Create test file
cat &gt; &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/tests/${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME}.test.ts&quot; &lt;&lt; EOF
import ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service from &#39;../src/index&#39;;

describe(&#39;${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service&#39;, () =&gt; {
  let service: ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service;

  beforeEach(() =&gt; {
    service = new ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service();
  });

  it(&#39;should initialize correctly&#39;, () =&gt; {
    expect(service).toBeInstanceOf(${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^}Service);
  });

  it(&#39;should start without errors&#39;, async () =&gt; {
    await expect(service.start()).resolves.not.toThrow();
  });

  it(&#39;should stop without errors&#39;, async () =&gt; {
    await expect(service.stop()).resolves.not.toThrow();
  });
});
EOF

# Create README
cat &gt; &quot;$TEMPLATE_DESTINATION/README.md&quot; &lt;&lt; EOF
# ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME^} Service

Generated by Arbiter Template System for the **${TEMPLATE_PROJECTNAME}** project.

## Description

This is the ${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME} service, part of the ${TEMPLATE_PROJECTNAME} application.

## Development

\`\`\`bash
# Install dependencies
npm install

# Start development server
npm run dev

# Run tests
npm test

# Build for production
npm run build

# Start production server
npm start
\`\`\`

## Configuration

The service can be configured through environment variables or configuration files.

## API

Document your API endpoints here.

## Testing

Run the test suite with:

\`\`\`bash
npm test
\`\`\`

## Deployment

This service is configured to be deployed via Arbiter&#39;s deployment system.
EOF

echo &quot;✅ Template applied successfully to $TEMPLATE_DESTINATION&quot;
echo &quot;📝 Files created:&quot;
echo &quot;   - src/index.ts&quot;
echo &quot;   - package.json&quot;
echo &quot;   - tsconfig.json&quot;
echo &quot;   - tests/${TEMPLATE_SERVICENAME}.test.ts&quot;
echo &quot;   - README.md&quot;

echo &quot;&quot;
echo &quot;🚀 Next steps:&quot;
echo &quot;   1. cd $TEMPLATE_DESTINATION&quot;
echo &quot;   2. npm install&quot;
echo &quot;   3. npm run dev&quot;
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/design-system/components/StatusBadge.tsx
/**
 * StatusBadge Component - Design System
 * Professional status indicators with comprehensive variants and states
 * Designed for developer tools with sophisticated graphite theme
 */

import React, { type ReactNode } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { clsx } from &#39;clsx&#39;;
import { statusVariants, sizeVariants, cn } from &#39;../variants&#39;;

export interface StatusBadgeProps {
  /** Status variant determines the color scheme */
  variant?:
    | &#39;success&#39;
    | &#39;warning&#39;
    | &#39;error&#39;
    | &#39;info&#39;
    | &#39;neutral&#39;
    | &#39;pending&#39;
    | &#39;active&#39;
    | &#39;inactive&#39;;

  /** Badge style appearance */
  style?: &#39;solid&#39; | &#39;outlined&#39; | &#39;subtle&#39;;

  /** Badge size */
  size?: &#39;xs&#39; | &#39;sm&#39; | &#39;md&#39; | &#39;lg&#39;;

  /** Whether to show a dot indicator */
  showDot?: boolean;

  /** Whether the dot should pulse (for active states) */
  pulse?: boolean;

  /** Icon to display (overrides dot) */
  icon?: ReactNode;

  /** Whether the badge has a loading state */
  loading?: boolean;

  /** Badge content */
  children: ReactNode;

  /** Custom className for additional styling */
  className?: string;
}

const sizeClasses = {
  xs: {
    badge: &#39;px-2 py-0.5 text-xs&#39;,
    icon: &#39;h-3 w-3&#39;,
    dot: &#39;h-1.5 w-1.5&#39;,
    gap: &#39;gap-1&#39;,
  },
  sm: {
    badge: &#39;px-2.5 py-1 text-xs&#39;,
    icon: &#39;h-3.5 w-3.5&#39;,
    dot: &#39;h-2 w-2&#39;,
    gap: &#39;gap-1.5&#39;,
  },
  md: {
    badge: &#39;px-3 py-1.5 text-sm&#39;,
    icon: &#39;h-4 w-4&#39;,
    dot: &#39;h-2.5 w-2.5&#39;,
    gap: &#39;gap-2&#39;,
  },
  lg: {
    badge: &#39;px-4 py-2 text-base&#39;,
    icon: &#39;h-5 w-5&#39;,
    dot: &#39;h-3 w-3&#39;,
    gap: &#39;gap-2&#39;,
  },
} as const;

// Extended status variants with additional semantic meanings
const extendedStatusVariants = {
  ...statusVariants,
  pending: {
    bg: &#39;bg-amber-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-amber-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-amber-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-amber-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-amber-500&#39;,
  },
  active: {
    bg: &#39;bg-green-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-green-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-green-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-green-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-green-500&#39;,
  },
  inactive: {
    bg: &#39;bg-graphite-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-graphite-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-graphite-600&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-graphite-400&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-graphite-400&#39;,
  },
};

export function StatusBadge({
  variant = &#39;neutral&#39;,
  style = &#39;solid&#39;,
  size = &#39;sm&#39;,
  showDot = false,
  pulse = false,
  icon,
  loading = false,
  children,
  className,
}: StatusBadgeProps) {
  const status = extendedStatusVariants[variant];
  const sizeClass = sizeClasses[size];

  // Style variants
  const getStyleClasses = () =&gt; {
    switch (style) {
      case &#39;solid&#39;:
        return cn(status.bg, status.border, status.text);
      case &#39;outlined&#39;:
        return cn(&#39;bg-transparent border-2&#39;, status.border, status.text);
      case &#39;subtle&#39;:
        return cn(status.bg, &#39;border-transparent&#39;, status.text);
      default:
        return cn(status.bg, status.border, status.text);
    }
  };

  const badgeClasses = cn(
    // Base styles
    &#39;inline-flex items-center font-medium rounded-full border transition-all duration-150&#39;,

    // Size styles
    sizeClass.badge,
    sizeClass.gap,

    // Style variant classes
    getStyleClasses(),

    // Loading state
    loading &amp;&amp; &#39;opacity-75&#39;,

    // Custom className
    className
  );

  const renderIndicator = () =&gt; {
    if (loading) {
      return (
        &lt;div
          className={cn(
            &#39;flex-shrink-0 border-2 border-current border-t-transparent rounded-full animate-spin&#39;,
            sizeClass.dot
          )}
        /&gt;
      );
    }

    if (icon) {
      return &lt;span className={cn(&#39;flex-shrink-0&#39;, status.icon, sizeClass.icon)}&gt;{icon}&lt;/span&gt;;
    }

    if (showDot) {
      return (
        &lt;span
          className={cn(
            &#39;flex-shrink-0 rounded-full&#39;,
            status.dot,
            sizeClass.dot,
            pulse &amp;&amp; &#39;animate-pulse&#39;
          )}
        /&gt;
      );
    }

    return null;
  };

  return (
    &lt;span className={badgeClasses}&gt;
      {renderIndicator()}
      &lt;span&gt;{children}&lt;/span&gt;
    &lt;/span&gt;
  );
}

export default StatusBadge;
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/export.ts
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, ExportFormat, ExportOptions } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { withProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;

/**
 * Export command implementation
 * Export CUE configurations to various formats
 */
export async function exportCommand(
  inputFiles: string[],
  options: ExportOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  try {
    if (inputFiles.length === 0) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;No input files specified&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    // Resolve input files
    const resolvedFiles = await resolveInputFiles(inputFiles, config.projectDir);

    if (resolvedFiles.length === 0) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;No valid input files found&#39;));
      return 1;
    }

    // Combine all input files
    const combinedContent = await combineInputFiles(resolvedFiles);

    // Load schema and config if specified
    let fullContent = combinedContent;

    if (options.schema) {
      try {
        const schemaContent = await fs.readFile(options.schema, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
        fullContent = `${schemaContent}\n\n${fullContent}`;
      } catch (_error) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Cannot read schema file: ${options.schema}`));
        return 1;
      }
    }

    if (options.config) {
      try {
        const configContent = await fs.readFile(options.config, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
        fullContent = `${fullContent}\n\n${configContent}`;
      } catch (_error) {
        console.error(chalk.red(`Cannot read config file: ${options.config}`));
        return 1;
      }
    }

    // Export to requested formats
    for (const format of options.format) {
      await exportToFormat(fullContent, format, options, config);
    }

    return 0;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Export command failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 2;
  }
}

/**
 * Resolve and validate input file paths
 */
async function resolveInputFiles(files: string[], cwd: string): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
  const resolved: string[] = [];

  for (const file of files) {
    const fullPath = path.resolve(cwd, file);

    try {
      const stats = await fs.stat(fullPath);
      if (stats.isFile()) {
        if (path.extname(fullPath) === &#39;.cue&#39;) {
          resolved.push(fullPath);
        }
      } else if (stats.isDirectory()) {
        // Find all .cue files in directory recursively
        const dirFiles = await findCueFilesRecursive(fullPath);
        resolved.push(...dirFiles);
      }
    } catch (_error) {
      console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Cannot access ${file}`));
    }
  }

  return resolved;
}

/**
 * Find CUE files recursively in a directory
 */
async function findCueFilesRecursive(dir: string): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
  const files: string[] = [];
  const entries = await fs.readdir(dir, { withFileTypes: true });

  for (const entry of entries) {
    const fullPath = path.join(dir, entry.name);

    if (entry.isDirectory() &amp;&amp; !shouldSkipDirectory(entry.name)) {
      const subFiles = await findCueFilesRecursive(fullPath);
      files.push(...subFiles);
    } else if (entry.isFile() &amp;&amp; entry.name.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;)) {
      files.push(fullPath);
    }
  }

  return files;
}

/**
 * Check if directory should be skipped
 */
function shouldSkipDirectory(name: string): boolean {
  const skipDirs = [&#39;node_modules&#39;, &#39;.git&#39;, &#39;dist&#39;, &#39;build&#39;, &#39;.vscode&#39;, &#39;.idea&#39;];
  return skipDirs.includes(name) || name.startsWith(&#39;.&#39;);
}

/**
 * Combine multiple input files into one
 */
async function combineInputFiles(files: string[]): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  const contents: string[] = [];

  for (const file of files) {
    try {
      const content = await fs.readFile(file, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
      contents.push(`// File: ${path.basename(file)}\n${content}`);
    } catch (_error) {
      console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Cannot read ${file}`));
    }
  }

  return contents.join(&#39;\n\n&#39;);
}

/**
 * Export content to a specific format using the new export API
 */
async function exportToFormat(
  content: string,
  format: ExportFormat,
  options: ExportOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);

  return withProgress({ text: `Exporting to ${format} format...`, color: &#39;green&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    const exportResult = await apiClient.export(content, format, {
      strict: options.strict,
      includeExamples: true,
      outputMode: &#39;single&#39;,
    });

    if (!exportResult.success || !exportResult.data) {
      throw new Error(`Export failed: ${exportResult.error}`);
    }

    const result = exportResult.data;

    // Handle export errors
    if (!result.success) {
      if (result.warnings &amp;&amp; result.warnings.length &gt; 0) {
        result.warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; {
          console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: ${warning}`));
        });
      }
      throw new Error(result.error || &#39;Export failed&#39;);
    }

    // Handle warnings
    if (result.warnings &amp;&amp; result.warnings.length &gt; 0) {
      result.warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; {
        console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: ${warning}`));
      });
    }

    // Process export files
    if (result.files &amp;&amp; result.files.length &gt; 0) {
      for (const file of result.files) {
        await outputFile(file, options, format);
      }

      // Show export metadata
      if (result.metadata &amp;&amp; options.verbose) {
        console.log(chalk.gray(&#39;\nExport metadata:&#39;));
        console.log(chalk.gray(`  Generated: ${result.metadata.generatedAt}`));
        console.log(chalk.gray(`  Detected tags: ${result.metadata.detectedTags.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`));
        console.log(
          chalk.gray(`  Exported schemas: ${result.metadata.exportedSchemas.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`)
        );
      }
    } else {
      // Fallback: single output
      const outputContent = JSON.stringify(result, null, 2);
      await outputContent_(outputContent, format, options);
    }
  });
}

/**
 * Output a single file from export result
 */
async function outputFile(
  file: { name: string; content: string; format: ExportFormat },
  options: ExportOptions,
  requestedFormat: ExportFormat
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const formattedContent = applyContentFormatting(file.content, requestedFormat, options);

  if (options.output) {
    await writeToFileSystem(file, formattedContent, options.output);
  } else {
    outputToConsole(file.name, formattedContent);
  }
}

/**
 * Apply content formatting based on format and options
 */
function applyContentFormatting(
  content: string,
  requestedFormat: ExportFormat,
  options: ExportOptions
): string {
  if (requestedFormat === &#39;json&#39; &amp;&amp; options.minify) {
    return minifyJsonContent(content);
  }
  return content;
}

/**
 * Minify JSON content safely
 */
function minifyJsonContent(content: string): string {
  try {
    const parsed = JSON.parse(content);
    return JSON.stringify(parsed);
  } catch {
    // Keep original if not valid JSON
    return content;
  }
}

/**
 * Write content to filesystem with path resolution
 */
async function writeToFileSystem(
  file: { name: string; format: ExportFormat },
  content: string,
  outputPath: string
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const resolvedPath = await resolveOutputPath(outputPath, file.name);
  await fs.writeFile(resolvedPath, content, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
  console.log(chalk.green(`✓ Exported ${file.format} to ${resolvedPath}`));
}

/**
 * Resolve output path (directory vs file)
 */
async function resolveOutputPath(outputPath: string, fileName: string): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
  try {
    const stats = await fs.stat(outputPath);
    if (stats.isDirectory()) {
      return path.join(outputPath, fileName);
    }
  } catch {
    // Path doesn&#39;t exist, treat as file
  }
  return outputPath;
}

/**
 * Output content to console
 */
function outputToConsole(fileName: string, content: string): void {
  console.log(chalk.blue(`--- ${fileName} ---`));
  console.log(content);
}

/**
 * Output content directly (fallback method)
 */
async function outputContent_(
  content: string,
  format: ExportFormat,
  options: ExportOptions
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  if (options.output) {
    let outputPath = options.output;

    // If output is a directory, generate filename
    try {
      const stats = await fs.stat(outputPath);
      if (stats.isDirectory()) {
        const extension = getDefaultExtension(format);
        const filename = `export.${extension}`;
        outputPath = path.join(outputPath, filename);
      }
    } catch {
      // Path doesn&#39;t exist, treat as file
    }

    await fs.writeFile(outputPath, content, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    console.log(chalk.green(`✓ Exported ${format} to ${outputPath}`));
  } else {
    // Output to stdout
    console.log(content);
  }
}

/**
 * Get default file extension for format
 */
function getDefaultExtension(format: ExportFormat): string {
  switch (format) {
    case &#39;openapi&#39;:
      return &#39;openapi.yaml&#39;;
    case &#39;types&#39;:
      return &#39;d.ts&#39;;
    case &#39;k8s&#39;:
      return &#39;k8s.yaml&#39;;
    case &#39;terraform&#39;:
      return &#39;tf&#39;;
    case &#39;json-schema&#39;:
      return &#39;schema.json&#39;;
    default:
      return &#39;txt&#39;;
  }
}

/**
 * List available export formats from the API
 */
export async function listFormats(config: CLIConfig): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  try {
    const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);
    const result = await apiClient.getSupportedFormats();

    if (!result.success || !result.data) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to get supported formats from API&#39;));
      console.error(chalk.red(`Error: ${result.error}`));

      // Fallback to static list
      console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\nFallback - Static format list:&#39;));
      const fallbackFormats = [
        {
          format: &#39;openapi&#39;,
          description: &#39;OpenAPI 3.1 specification&#39;,
          example: &#39;// #OpenAPI api-v1&#39;,
        },
        {
          format: &#39;types&#39;,
          description: &#39;TypeScript type definitions&#39;,
          example: &#39;// #TypeScript models&#39;,
        },
        { format: &#39;k8s&#39;, description: &#39;Kubernetes YAML manifests&#39;, example: &#39;// #K8s deployment&#39; },
        {
          format: &#39;terraform&#39;,
          description: &#39;Terraform HCL configuration&#39;,
          example: &#39;// #Terraform infrastructure&#39;,
        },
        {
          format: &#39;json-schema&#39;,
          description: &#39;JSON Schema specification&#39;,
          example: &#39;// #JsonSchema validation&#39;,
        },
      ];

      printFormats(fallbackFormats);
      return;
    }

    console.log(chalk.cyan(&#39;Available export formats:&#39;));
    console.log();

    printFormats(result.data);

    console.log();
    console.log(chalk.gray(&#39;Note: Exports require explicit tagging in your CUE schema.&#39;));
    console.log(
      chalk.gray(&#39;Add comments like &quot;// #OpenAPI api-v1&quot; to enable export for that format.&#39;)
    );
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Failed to list formats:&#39;), error);
  }
}

/**
 * Print formats in a consistent format
 */
function printFormats(
  formats: Array&lt;{ format: string; description: string; example: string }&gt;
): void {
  formats.forEach(format =&gt; {
    console.log(`${chalk.green(format.format.padEnd(12))} ${format.description}`);
    console.log(`${&#39; &#39;.repeat(14)}${chalk.gray(format.example)}`);
    console.log();
  });
}

  &quot;main&quot;: &quot;./dist/index.js&quot;,
  &quot;bin&quot;: {
    &quot;arbiter&quot;: &quot;./dist/cli.js&quot;
  },
  &quot;scripts&quot;: {
    &quot;build&quot;: &quot;mkdir -p dist &amp;&amp; mkdir -p dist/commands &amp;&amp; bun build src/cli.ts --outdir dist --target=node --format=esm --external commander --external chalk --external fs-extra --external yaml --external zod --external glob --external chokidar --external diff --external uuid &amp;&amp; bun build src/index.ts --outdir dist --target=node --format=esm --external commander --external chalk --external fs-extra --external yaml --external zod --external glob --external chokidar --external diff --external uuid &amp;&amp; bun build src/config.ts --outdir dist --target=node --format=esm --external commander --external chalk --external fs-extra --external yaml --external zod --external glob --external chokidar --external diff --external uuid &amp;&amp; bun build src/api-client.ts --outdir dist --target=node --format=esm --external commander --external chalk --external fs-extra --external yaml --external zod --external glob --external chokidar --external diff --external uuid &amp;&amp; bun build src/commands/*.ts --outdir dist/commands --target=node --format=esm --external commander --external chalk --external fs-extra --external yaml --external zod --external glob --external chokidar --external diff --external uuid&quot;,
