📄 packages/cli/src/commands/check-constrained.ts
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import { translateCueErrors } from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;
import { glob } from &#39;glob&#39;;
import { ApiClient } from &#39;../api-client.js&#39;;
import { ConstraintViolationError, getGlobalConstraintSystem } from &#39;../constraints/index.js&#39;;
import type { CLIConfig, CheckOptions, ValidationResult } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import {
  formatErrorDetails,
  formatFileSize,
  formatJson,
  formatSummary,
  formatValidationTable,
  formatWarningDetails,
} from &#39;../utils/formatting.js&#39;;
import { withProgress } from &#39;../utils/progress.js&#39;;

/**
 * Enhanced check command with comprehensive constraint enforcement
 * Implements all &quot;Don&#39;ts&quot; from TODO.md section 13
 */
export async function checkCommandConstrained(
  patterns: string[],
  options: CheckOptions,
  config: CLIConfig
): Promise&lt;number&gt; {
  const constraintSystem = getGlobalConstraintSystem();

  try {
    return await constraintSystem.executeWithConstraints(
      &#39;check&#39;,
      {
        sandbox: &#39;check&#39;,
        filesystem: &#39;read&#39;,
        idempotent: &#39;validate&#39;,
      },
      async () =&gt; {
        // Use default pattern if none provided
        if (patterns.length === 0) {
          patterns = [&#39;**/*.cue&#39;];
        }

        // Find all matching files with constraint validation
        const files = await findCueFilesConstrained(patterns, {
          recursive: options.recursive ?? true,
          cwd: config.projectDir,
        });

        if (files.length === 0) {
          console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;No CUE files found&#39;));
          return 0;
        }

        console.log(chalk.dim(`Found ${files.length} CUE files`));

        // Validate files with full constraint enforcement
        const results = await validateFilesConstrained(files, config, options);

        // Format and display results
        if (options.format === &#39;json&#39;) {
          const output = formatJson(results, config.color);
          // Validate JSON output payload size
          constraintSystem.validateApiResponse(output);
          console.log(output);
        } else {
          displayResultsConstrained(results, options, config);
        }

        // Generate constraint compliance report if verbose
        if (options.verbose) {
          console.log(`\n${constraintSystem.generateComplianceReport()}`);
        }

        // Determine exit code
        const hasErrors = results.some(r =&gt; r.status === &#39;invalid&#39; || r.status === &#39;error&#39;);
        return hasErrors ? 1 : 0;
      },
      {
        patterns: patterns.length,
        recursive: options.recursive,
        format: options.format,
      }
    );
  } catch (error) {
    if (error instanceof ConstraintViolationError) {
      console.error(chalk.red(&#39;Constraint violation:&#39;), error.message);
      console.error(chalk.dim(&#39;Details:&#39;), JSON.stringify(error.details, null, 2));
      return 2; // Constraint violation exit code
    }

    console.error(
      chalk.red(&#39;Check command failed:&#39;),
      error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)
    );
    return 2;
  }
}

/**
 * Find CUE files with file system constraint validation
 */
async function findCueFilesConstrained(
  patterns: string[],
  options: {
    recursive: boolean;
    cwd: string;
  }
): Promise&lt;string[]&gt; {
  const constraintSystem = getGlobalConstraintSystem();

  // Validate working directory path
  await constraintSystem.validateFileOperation(&#39;read&#39;, [options.cwd]);

  const allFiles: string[] = [];

  for (const pattern of patterns) {
    const files = await glob(pattern, {
      cwd: options.cwd,
      absolute: true,
      ignore: [&#39;**/node_modules/**&#39;, &#39;**/.git/**&#39;, &#39;**/dist/**&#39;, &#39;**/build/**&#39;],
    });

    // Validate each found file path
    await constraintSystem.validateFileOperation(&#39;read&#39;, files);

    allFiles.push(...files);
  }

  // Remove duplicates and sort
  return [...new Set(allFiles)].sort();
}

/**
 * Validate multiple files with comprehensive constraint enforcement
 */
async function validateFilesConstrained(
  files: string[],
  config: CLIConfig,
  options: CheckOptions
): Promise&lt;ValidationResult[]&gt; {
  const constraintSystem = getGlobalConstraintSystem();
  const apiClient = new ApiClient(config);
  const results: ValidationResult[] = [];

  // Check server health first with sandbox compliance
  const healthCheck = await apiClient.health();
  if (!healthCheck.success) {
    throw new Error(`Cannot connect to Arbiter server: ${healthCheck.error}`);
  }

  let _processedCount = 0;
  const progressText = `Validating ${files.length} files...`;

  return withProgress({ text: progressText, color: &#39;blue&#39; }, async () =&gt; {
    // Process files with constrained concurrency (respects rate limiting)
    const concurrency = 1; // Enforce ~1 rps rate limit
    const chunks = chunkArray(files, concurrency);

    for (const chunk of chunks) {
      const chunkResults: ValidationResult[] = [];

      // Process chunk sequentially to respect rate limits
      for (const file of chunk) {
        try {
          const result = await validateFileConstrained(file, apiClient, options, constraintSystem);
          chunkResults.push(result);
          _processedCount++;

          if (options.verbose) {
            const status =
              result.status === &#39;valid&#39;
                ? chalk.green(&#39;✓&#39;)
                : result.status === &#39;invalid&#39;
                  ? chalk.red(&#39;✗&#39;)
                  : chalk.yellow(&#39;!&#39;);
            console.log(`${status} ${path.relative(config.projectDir, file)}`);
          }

          // Enforce rate limiting between requests
          await new Promise(resolve =&gt; setTimeout(resolve, 1100)); // Slightly over 1 second for ~1 rps
        } catch (error) {
          if (error instanceof ConstraintViolationError) {
            console.error(
              chalk.red(`Constraint violation in ${path.basename(file)}:`),
              error.message
            );

            // Create error result for constraint violations
            chunkResults.push({
              file: path.basename(file),
              status: &#39;error&#39;,
              errors: [
                {
                  line: 0,
                  column: 0,
                  message: `Constraint violation: ${error.constraint} - ${error.message}`,
                  severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
                  category: &#39;constraint&#39;,
                },
              ],
              warnings: [],
              processingTime: 0,
            });
          } else {
            throw error;
          }
        }
      }

      results.push(...chunkResults);

      // Fail fast if requested and we have errors
      if (options.failFast &amp;&amp; chunkResults.some(r =&gt; r.status !== &#39;valid&#39;)) {
        break;
      }
    }

    return results;
  });
}

/**
 * Validate a single file with comprehensive constraint enforcement
 */
async function validateFileConstrained(
  filePath: string,
  apiClient: ApiClient,
  _options: CheckOptions,
  constraintSystem: ReturnType&lt;typeof getGlobalConstraintSystem&gt;
): Promise&lt;ValidationResult&gt; {
  const startTime = Date.now();

  try {
    // Validate file path constraints
    await constraintSystem.validateFileOperation(&#39;read&#39;, [filePath]);

    // Check if file exists and is readable
    const stats = await fs.stat(filePath);
    if (!stats.isFile()) {
      return {
        file: path.basename(filePath),
        status: &#39;error&#39;,
        errors: [
          {
            line: 0,
            column: 0,
            message: &#39;Not a file&#39;,
            severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
            category: &#39;system&#39;,
          },
        ],
        warnings: [],
        processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
      };
    }

    // Enforce payload size limit (64 KB)
    const maxSize = 64 * 1024; // 64 KB constraint
    if (stats.size &gt; maxSize) {
      return {
        file: path.basename(filePath),
        status: &#39;error&#39;,
        errors: [
          {
            line: 0,
            column: 0,
            message: `File too large (${formatFileSize(stats.size)}), maximum allowed: ${formatFileSize(maxSize)}`,
            severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
            category: &#39;constraint&#39;,
          },
        ],
        warnings: [],
        processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
      };
    }

    // Read file content
    const content = await fs.readFile(filePath, &#39;utf-8&#39;);

    // Validate content payload size
    constraintSystem.validateApiResponse(content);

    // Validate using API (sandbox compliant)
    const validationResult = await apiClient.validate(content);

    // Validate API response constraints
    const _validatedResponse = constraintSystem.validateApiResponse(validationResult);

    if (!validationResult.success || !validationResult.data) {
      return {
        file: path.basename(filePath),
        status: &#39;error&#39;,
        errors: [
          {
            line: 0,
            column: 0,
            message: validationResult.error || &#39;Unknown validation error&#39;,
            severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
            category: &#39;api&#39;,
          },
        ],
        warnings: [],
        processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
      };
    }

    const data = validationResult.data;

    // Process errors with enhanced translation
    const errors =
      data.errors?.map(error =&gt; {
        const translated = translateCueErrors(error.message);
        return {
          line: error.line || 0,
          column: error.column || 0,
          message: translated[0]?.friendlyMessage || error.message,
          severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
          category: translated[0]?.category || &#39;validation&#39;,
        };
      }) || [];

    // Process warnings
    const warnings =
      data.warnings?.map(warning =&gt; ({
        line: warning.line || 0,
        column: warning.column || 0,
        message: warning.message,
        category: &#39;validation&#39;,
      })) || [];

    const status = data.success ? &#39;valid&#39; : &#39;invalid&#39;;
    const processingTime = Date.now() - startTime;

    // Enforce operation time constraint (≤750 ms)
    if (processingTime &gt; 750) {
      console.warn(
        chalk.yellow(
          `Warning: ${path.basename(filePath)} took ${processingTime}ms (&gt;750ms constraint)`
        )
      );
    }

    return {
      file: path.basename(filePath),
      status,
      errors,
      warnings,
      processingTime,
    };
  } catch (error) {
    if (error instanceof ConstraintViolationError) {
      throw error; // Let constraint violations bubble up
    }

    return {
      file: path.basename(filePath),
      status: &#39;error&#39;,
      errors: [
        {
          line: 0,
          column: 0,
          message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error),
          severity: &#39;error&#39; as const,
          category: &#39;system&#39;,
        },
      ],
      warnings: [],
      processingTime: Date.now() - startTime,
    };
  }
}

/**
 * Display validation results with constraint compliance information
 */
function displayResultsConstrained(
  results: ValidationResult[],
  options: CheckOptions,
  _config: CLIConfig
): void {
  // Show table
  console.log(`\n${formatValidationTable(results)}`);

  // Show constraint compliance summary
  const constraintSystem = getGlobalConstraintSystem();
  const status = constraintSystem.getSystemStatus();

  if (!status.isHealthy) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;\n⚠️  Constraint Violations Detected:&#39;));
    for (const critical of status.violations.criticalViolations) {
      console.log(`   ${chalk.red(&#39;•&#39;)} ${critical}`);
    }
  }

  // Show detailed errors if present
  if (options.verbose || results.some(r =&gt; r.errors.length &gt; 0)) {
    const errorDetails = formatErrorDetails(results);
    if (errorDetails) {
      console.log(errorDetails);
    }
  }

  // Show warnings if verbose or if there are warnings
  if (options.verbose || results.some(r =&gt; r.warnings.length &gt; 0)) {
    const warningDetails = formatWarningDetails(results);
    if (warningDetails) {
      console.log(warningDetails);
    }
  }

  // Show summary with constraint compliance
  console.log(formatSummary(results));

  // Show performance summary
  const totalTime = results.reduce((sum, r) =&gt; sum + r.processingTime, 0);
  const avgTime = totalTime / results.length;
  const maxTime = Math.max(...results.map(r =&gt; r.processingTime));

  console.log(
    chalk.dim(
      `Performance: avg ${Math.round(avgTime)}ms, max ${Math.round(maxTime)}ms, total ${Math.round(totalTime)}ms`
    )
  );

  if (maxTime &gt; 750) {
    console.log(chalk.yellow(&#39;Warning: Some operations exceeded 750ms constraint&#39;));
  }
}

/**
 * Utility to chunk array for batch processing
 */
function chunkArray&lt;T&gt;(array: T[], size: number): T[][] {
  const chunks: T[][] = [];
  for (let i = 0; i &lt; array.length; i += size) {
    chunks.push(array.slice(i, i + size));
  }
  return chunks;
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/design-system/variants.ts
/**
 * Component Variant Patterns
 * Consistent styling patterns for different component states and variants
 */

import { clsx } from &#39;clsx&#39;;

// Base component classes
export const baseClasses = {
  // Focus ring for interactive elements
  focusRing: &#39;focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-blue-500 focus:ring-offset-2&#39;,

  // Transitions
  transition: &#39;transition-all duration-150 ease-in-out&#39;,

  // Typography
  text: {
    xs: &#39;text-xs&#39;,
    sm: &#39;text-sm&#39;,
    base: &#39;text-base&#39;,
    lg: &#39;text-lg&#39;,
    xl: &#39;text-xl&#39;,
  },

  // Spacing
  spacing: {
    xs: &#39;px-2 py-1&#39;,
    sm: &#39;px-3 py-1.5&#39;,
    md: &#39;px-4 py-2&#39;,
    lg: &#39;px-6 py-3&#39;,
    xl: &#39;px-8 py-4&#39;,
  },

  // Border radius
  rounded: {
    none: &#39;rounded-none&#39;,
    sm: &#39;rounded-sm&#39;,
    md: &#39;rounded&#39;,
    lg: &#39;rounded-lg&#39;,
    xl: &#39;rounded-xl&#39;,
    full: &#39;rounded-full&#39;,
  },
} as const;

// Button variants
export const buttonVariants = {
  // Primary button - main actions
  primary: clsx(
    &#39;bg-blue-600 hover:bg-blue-700 active:bg-blue-800&#39;,
    &#39;text-white font-medium&#39;,
    &#39;border border-transparent&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-gray-300 disabled:text-gray-500 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&#39;,
    baseClasses.transition,
    baseClasses.focusRing
  ),

  // Secondary button - secondary actions
  secondary: clsx(
    &#39;bg-graphite-100 hover:bg-graphite-200 active:bg-graphite-300&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-700 font-medium&#39;,
    &#39;border border-graphite-300&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-gray-50 disabled:text-gray-400 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&#39;,
    baseClasses.transition,
    baseClasses.focusRing
  ),

  // Ghost button - subtle actions
  ghost: clsx(
    &#39;bg-transparent hover:bg-graphite-100 active:bg-graphite-200&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-600 hover:text-graphite-700&#39;,
    &#39;border border-transparent&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:text-gray-400 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&#39;,
    baseClasses.transition,
    baseClasses.focusRing
  ),

  // Danger button - destructive actions
  danger: clsx(
    &#39;bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 active:bg-red-800&#39;,
    &#39;text-white font-medium&#39;,
    &#39;border border-transparent&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-gray-300 disabled:text-gray-500 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&#39;,
    baseClasses.transition,
    baseClasses.focusRing
  ),
} as const;

// Input variants
export const inputVariants = {
  // Default input
  default: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-graphite-300&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-900 placeholder:text-graphite-400&#39;,
    &#39;hover:border-graphite-400 focus:border-blue-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-blue-500&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-graphite-50 disabled:text-graphite-500 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:border-graphite-200&#39;,
    &#39;outline-none transition-all duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Error state
  error: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-red-300&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-900 placeholder:text-graphite-400&#39;,
    &#39;hover:border-red-400 focus:border-red-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-red-500&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-red-50 disabled:text-red-300 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:border-red-200&#39;,
    &#39;outline-none transition-all duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Warning state
  warning: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-amber-300&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-900 placeholder:text-graphite-400&#39;,
    &#39;hover:border-amber-400 focus:border-amber-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-amber-500&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-amber-50 disabled:text-amber-300 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:border-amber-200&#39;,
    &#39;outline-none transition-all duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Success state
  success: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-emerald-300&#39;,
    &#39;text-graphite-900 placeholder:text-graphite-400&#39;,
    &#39;hover:border-emerald-400 focus:border-emerald-500 focus:ring-1 focus:ring-emerald-500&#39;,
    &#39;disabled:bg-emerald-50 disabled:text-emerald-300 disabled:cursor-not-allowed disabled:border-emerald-200&#39;,
    &#39;outline-none transition-all duration-150&#39;
  ),
} as const;

// Card variants
export const cardVariants = {
  // Default card
  default: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-graphite-200&#39;,
    &#39;shadow-sm hover:shadow-md&#39;,
    &#39;transition-shadow duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Interactive card (clickable)
  interactive: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-graphite-200&#39;,
    &#39;shadow-sm hover:shadow-md hover:border-graphite-300&#39;,
    &#39;cursor-pointer transition-all duration-150&#39;,
    baseClasses.focusRing
  ),

  // Elevated card
  elevated: clsx(
    &#39;bg-white border border-graphite-200&#39;,
    &#39;shadow-md hover:shadow-lg&#39;,
    &#39;transition-shadow duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Outlined card
  outlined: clsx(
    &#39;bg-transparent border-2 border-graphite-300&#39;,
    &#39;hover:border-graphite-400 hover:bg-graphite-50&#39;,
    &#39;transition-all duration-150&#39;
  ),

  // Ghost card
  ghost: clsx(
    &#39;bg-transparent border-0 shadow-none&#39;,
    &#39;hover:bg-graphite-50&#39;,
    &#39;transition-colors duration-150&#39;
  ),
} as const;

// Status indicator variants
export const statusVariants = {
  success: {
    bg: &#39;bg-emerald-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-emerald-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-emerald-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-emerald-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-emerald-500&#39;,
  },
  warning: {
    bg: &#39;bg-amber-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-amber-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-amber-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-amber-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-amber-500&#39;,
  },
  error: {
    bg: &#39;bg-red-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-red-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-red-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-red-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-red-500&#39;,
  },
  info: {
    bg: &#39;bg-blue-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-blue-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-blue-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-blue-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-blue-500&#39;,
  },
  neutral: {
    bg: &#39;bg-graphite-50&#39;,
    border: &#39;border-graphite-200&#39;,
    text: &#39;text-graphite-700&#39;,
    icon: &#39;text-graphite-500&#39;,
    dot: &#39;bg-graphite-500&#39;,
  },
} as const;

// Size variants
export const sizeVariants = {
  button: {
    xs: clsx(baseClasses.spacing.xs, baseClasses.text.xs, baseClasses.rounded.sm),
    sm: clsx(baseClasses.spacing.sm, baseClasses.text.sm, baseClasses.rounded.md),
    md: clsx(baseClasses.spacing.md, baseClasses.text.base, baseClasses.rounded.md),
    lg: clsx(baseClasses.spacing.lg, baseClasses.text.lg, baseClasses.rounded.lg),
    xl: clsx(baseClasses.spacing.xl, baseClasses.text.xl, baseClasses.rounded.lg),
  },

  input: {
    sm: clsx(&#39;px-3 py-1.5&#39;, baseClasses.text.sm, baseClasses.rounded.md),
    md: clsx(&#39;px-3 py-2&#39;, baseClasses.text.base, baseClasses.rounded.md),
    lg: clsx(&#39;px-4 py-3&#39;, baseClasses.text.lg, baseClasses.rounded.lg),
  },

  icon: {
    xs: &#39;h-3 w-3&#39;,
    sm: &#39;h-4 w-4&#39;,
    md: &#39;h-5 w-5&#39;,
    lg: &#39;h-6 w-6&#39;,
    xl: &#39;h-8 w-8&#39;,
  },
} as const;

// Animation variants
export const animationVariants = {
  fadeIn: &#39;animate-in fade-in duration-200&#39;,
  fadeOut: &#39;animate-out fade-out duration-200&#39;,
  slideInFromTop: &#39;animate-in slide-in-from-top-2 duration-200&#39;,
  slideInFromBottom: &#39;animate-in slide-in-from-bottom-2 duration-200&#39;,
  slideInFromLeft: &#39;animate-in slide-in-from-left-2 duration-200&#39;,
  slideInFromRight: &#39;animate-in slide-in-from-right-2 duration-200&#39;,
  scaleIn: &#39;animate-in zoom-in-95 duration-200&#39;,
  scaleOut: &#39;animate-out zoom-out-95 duration-200&#39;,
} as const;

// Utility function to create variant classes
export function createVariant(
  base: string,
  variants: Record&lt;string, string&gt;,
  defaultVariant = &#39;default&#39;
) {
  return (variant?: string) =&gt; clsx(base, variants[variant || defaultVariant]);
}

// Utility function to merge classes with variants
export function cn(...classes: (string | undefined | null | false)[]): string {
  return clsx(...classes);
}
📄 packages/cli/src/utils/github-sync.ts
import { Octokit } from &#39;@octokit/rest&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import type { GitHubSyncConfig, IssueSpec } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;
import { FileBasedTemplateManager } from &#39;./file-based-template-manager.js&#39;;
import { ConfigurableTemplateManager } from &#39;./github-template-config.js&#39;;
import { GitHubTemplateManager, type GitHubTemplateOptions } from &#39;./github-templates.js&#39;;
import type { Epic, Task } from &#39;./sharded-storage.js&#39;;

export interface GitHubIssue {
  number: number;
  title: string;
  body?: string;
  state: &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;;
  labels: string[];
  milestone?: {
    number: number;
    title: string;
  };
  assignee?: {
    login: string;
  };
}

/** Enhanced GitHub issue template based on exact issue schema */
export interface GitHubIssueTemplate extends IssueSpec {
  /** Additional GitHub-specific fields */
  assignees?: string[];
  milestone?: number;
  projects?: number[];
}

export interface GitHubMilestone {
  number: number;
  title: string;
  state: &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;;
  description?: string;
}

export interface SyncResult {
  action: &#39;created&#39; | &#39;updated&#39; | &#39;skipped&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;;
  type: &#39;epic&#39; | &#39;task&#39; | &#39;milestone&#39;;
  itemId: string;
  githubNumber?: number;
  details?: string;
}

export interface SyncPreview {
  epics: {
    create: Epic[];
    update: Array&lt;{ epic: Epic; existing: GitHubIssue }&gt;;
    close: Array&lt;{ epic: Epic; existing: GitHubIssue }&gt;;
  };
  tasks: {
    create: Task[];
    update: Array&lt;{ task: Task; existing: GitHubIssue }&gt;;
    close: Array&lt;{ task: Task; existing: GitHubIssue }&gt;;
  };
  milestones: {
    create: Epic[];
    update: Array&lt;{ epic: Epic; existing: GitHubMilestone }&gt;;
    close: Array&lt;{ epic: Epic; existing: GitHubMilestone }&gt;;
  };
}

export class GitHubSyncClient {
  private octokit: Octokit;
  private config: GitHubSyncConfig;
  private templateManager: GitHubTemplateManager;
  private configurableTemplateManager: ConfigurableTemplateManager;
  private fileBasedTemplateManager: FileBasedTemplateManager;
  private issueCache: Map&lt;string, GitHubIssue&gt; = new Map();
  private milestoneCache: Map&lt;string, GitHubMilestone&gt; = new Map();

  constructor(config: GitHubSyncConfig) {
    this.config = config;
    this.templateManager = new GitHubTemplateManager();
    this.configurableTemplateManager = new ConfigurableTemplateManager(config.templates);
    this.fileBasedTemplateManager = new FileBasedTemplateManager(config.templates || {});

    // Get GitHub token from configured environment variable
    const tokenEnvName = config.repository.tokenEnv || &#39;GITHUB_TOKEN&#39;;
    const token =
      process.env[tokenEnvName] || process.env.GITHUB_TOKEN || process.env.ARBITER_GITHUB_TOKEN;

    if (!token) {
      const envVarMessage =
        tokenEnvName !== &#39;GITHUB_TOKEN&#39;
          ? `${tokenEnvName} (or GITHUB_TOKEN as fallback)`
          : &#39;GITHUB_TOKEN&#39;;

      throw new Error(
        `GitHub token not found. Set the ${envVarMessage} environment variable.\nTo create a token:\n1. Go to https://github.com/settings/tokens\n2. Generate a new token with &#39;repo&#39; scope\n3. Set ${tokenEnvName}=your_token_here in your environment`
      );
    }

    this.octokit = new Octokit({
      auth: token,
      baseUrl: config.repository.baseUrl || &#39;https://api.github.com&#39;,
    });
  }

  /**
   * Generate a preview of what would be synced without making changes
   */
  async generateSyncPreview(epics: Epic[]): Promise&lt;SyncPreview&gt; {
    await this.loadExistingData();

    const preview: SyncPreview = {
      epics: { create: [], update: [], close: [] },
      tasks: { create: [], update: [], close: [] },
      milestones: { create: [], update: [], close: [] },
    };

    // Process epics
    for (const epic of epics) {
      const epicTitle = await this.generateEpicTitle(epic);
      const existingIssue = this.findExistingIssue(epicTitle, epic.id);

      if (!existingIssue) {
        preview.epics.create.push(epic);
      } else if (await this.shouldUpdateEpic(epic, existingIssue)) {
        preview.epics.update.push({ epic, existing: existingIssue });
      }

      if (epic.status === &#39;completed&#39; || epic.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) {
        if (existingIssue &amp;&amp; existingIssue.state === &#39;open&#39;) {
          preview.epics.close.push({ epic, existing: existingIssue });
        }
      }

      // Process milestone for epic
      if (this.config.behavior?.createMilestones) {
        const milestoneTitle = this.generateMilestoneTitle(epic);
        const existingMilestone = this.findExistingMilestone(milestoneTitle, epic.id);

        if (!existingMilestone) {
          preview.milestones.create.push(epic);
        } else if (this.shouldUpdateMilestone(epic, existingMilestone)) {
          preview.milestones.update.push({ epic, existing: existingMilestone });
        }

        if (epic.status === &#39;completed&#39; || epic.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) {
          if (existingMilestone &amp;&amp; existingMilestone.state === &#39;open&#39;) {
            preview.milestones.close.push({ epic, existing: existingMilestone });
          }
        }
      }

      // Process tasks for this epic
      for (const task of epic.tasks) {
        const taskTitle = await this.generateTaskTitle(task, epic);
        const existingTaskIssue = this.findExistingIssue(taskTitle, task.id);

        if (!existingTaskIssue) {
          preview.tasks.create.push(task);
        } else if (await this.shouldUpdateTask(task, existingTaskIssue, epic)) {
          preview.tasks.update.push({ task, existing: existingTaskIssue });
        }

        if (task.status === &#39;completed&#39; || task.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) {
          if (existingTaskIssue &amp;&amp; existingTaskIssue.state === &#39;open&#39;) {
            preview.tasks.close.push({ task, existing: existingTaskIssue });
          }
        }
      }
    }

    return preview;
  }

  /**
   * Sync epics and tasks to GitHub (idempotent operation)
   */
  async syncToGitHub(epics: Epic[], dryRun = false): Promise&lt;SyncResult[]&gt; {
    const results: SyncResult[] = [];

    if (dryRun) {
      const preview = await this.generateSyncPreview(epics);
      return this.convertPreviewToResults(preview);
    }

    await this.loadExistingData();

    // Process epics
    for (const epic of epics) {
      const epicResults = await this.syncEpic(epic);
      results.push(...epicResults);

      // Process tasks for this epic
      for (const task of epic.tasks) {
        const taskResults = await this.syncTask(task, epic);
        results.push(...taskResults);
      }
    }

    return results;
  }

  /**
   * Load existing GitHub issues and milestones into cache
   */
  private async loadExistingData(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const { owner, repo } = this.config.repository;

    try {
      // Load issues
      const issues = await this.octokit.paginate(this.octokit.rest.issues.listForRepo, {
        owner,
        repo,
        state: &#39;all&#39;,
        per_page: 100,
      });

      for (const issue of issues) {
        if (!issue.pull_request) {
          // Exclude PRs
          const githubIssue: GitHubIssue = {
            number: issue.number,
            title: issue.title,
            body: issue.body || undefined,
            state: issue.state as &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;,
            labels: issue.labels.map(label =&gt;
              typeof label === &#39;string&#39; ? label : label.name || &#39;&#39;
            ),
            milestone: issue.milestone
              ? {
                  number: issue.milestone.number,
                  title: issue.milestone.title,
                }
              : undefined,
            assignee: issue.assignee
              ? {
                  login: issue.assignee.login,
                }
              : undefined,
          };

          this.issueCache.set(issue.title, githubIssue);

          // Also cache by arbiter ID if present in body
          const arbiterIdMatch = issue.body?.match(/&lt;!-- arbiter-id: ([^\\s]+) --&gt;/);
          if (arbiterIdMatch) {
            this.issueCache.set(`arbiter:${arbiterIdMatch[1]}`, githubIssue);
          }
        }
      }

      // Load milestones if needed
      if (this.config.behavior?.createMilestones) {
        const milestones = await this.octokit.paginate(this.octokit.rest.issues.listMilestones, {
          owner,
          repo,
          state: &#39;all&#39;,
          per_page: 100,
        });

        for (const milestone of milestones) {
          const githubMilestone: GitHubMilestone = {
            number: milestone.number,
            title: milestone.title,
            state: milestone.state as &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;,
            description: milestone.description || undefined,
          };

          this.milestoneCache.set(milestone.title, githubMilestone);

          // Also cache by arbiter ID if present in description
          const arbiterIdMatch = milestone.description?.match(/&lt;!-- arbiter-id: ([^\\s]+) --&gt;/);
          if (arbiterIdMatch) {
            this.milestoneCache.set(`arbiter:${arbiterIdMatch[1]}`, githubMilestone);
          }
        }
      }
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(
        `Failed to load existing GitHub data: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`
      );
    }
  }

  /**
   * Sync a single epic to GitHub
   */
  private async syncEpic(epic: Epic): Promise&lt;SyncResult[]&gt; {
    const results: SyncResult[] = [];
    const { owner, repo } = this.config.repository;

    try {
      const epicTitle = await this.generateEpicTitle(epic);
      const existingIssue = this.findExistingIssue(epicTitle, epic.id);

      if (!existingIssue) {
        // Create new epic issue using file-based template system (fallback to configurable)
        let template;
        try {
          template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        } catch (error) {
          // Fallback to configurable template manager
          template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        }

        // Map semantic labels to GitHub labels
        const mappedLabels = this.mapSemanticLabels(template.labels, &#39;epic&#39;, epic);

        const newIssue = await this.octokit.rest.issues.create({
          owner,
          repo,
          title: template.title,
          body: template.body,
          labels: mappedLabels,
          assignees:
            this.config.behavior?.syncAssignees &amp;&amp; template.assignees
              ? template.assignees
              : undefined,
        });

        this.issueCache.set(epicTitle, {
          number: newIssue.data.number,
          title: newIssue.data.title,
          body: newIssue.data.body || undefined,
          state: newIssue.data.state as &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;,
          labels: newIssue.data.labels.map(l =&gt; (typeof l === &#39;string&#39; ? l : l.name || &#39;&#39;)),
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;created&#39;,
          type: &#39;epic&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: newIssue.data.number,
          details: `Created GitHub issue #${newIssue.data.number}`,
        });
      } else if (await this.shouldUpdateEpic(epic, existingIssue)) {
        // Update existing epic issue using file-based template system (fallback to configurable)
        let template;
        try {
          template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        } catch (error) {
          // Fallback to configurable template manager
          template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        }

        // Map semantic labels to GitHub labels
        const mappedLabels = this.mapSemanticLabels(template.labels, &#39;epic&#39;, epic);

        await this.octokit.rest.issues.update({
          owner,
          repo,
          issue_number: existingIssue.number,
          title: template.title,
          body: template.body,
          labels: mappedLabels,
          assignees:
            this.config.behavior?.syncAssignees &amp;&amp; template.assignees
              ? template.assignees
              : undefined,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;updated&#39;,
          type: &#39;epic&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `Updated GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      } else {
        results.push({
          action: &#39;skipped&#39;,
          type: &#39;epic&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `No changes needed for GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      }

      // Handle epic completion/cancellation
      if (
        (epic.status === &#39;completed&#39; || epic.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) &amp;&amp;
        existingIssue &amp;&amp;
        existingIssue.state === &#39;open&#39; &amp;&amp;
        this.config.behavior?.autoClose
      ) {
        await this.octokit.rest.issues.update({
          owner,
          repo,
          issue_number: existingIssue.number,
          state: &#39;closed&#39;,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;closed&#39;,
          type: &#39;epic&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `Closed GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      }

      // Handle milestone creation/update
      if (this.config.behavior?.createMilestones) {
        const milestoneResults = await this.syncEpicMilestone(epic);
        results.push(...milestoneResults);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;skipped&#39;,
        type: &#39;epic&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Failed to sync epic: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }

  /**
   * Sync a single task to GitHub
   */
  private async syncTask(task: Task, epic: Epic): Promise&lt;SyncResult[]&gt; {
    const results: SyncResult[] = [];
    const { owner, repo } = this.config.repository;

    try {
      const taskTitle = await this.generateTaskTitle(task, epic);
      const existingIssue = this.findExistingIssue(taskTitle, task.id);

      if (!existingIssue) {
        // Create new task issue using file-based template system (fallback to configurable)
        let template;
        try {
          template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        } catch (error) {
          // Fallback to configurable template manager
          template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        }
        const milestone = this.findMilestoneForEpic(epic);

        // Map semantic labels to GitHub labels
        const mappedLabels = this.mapSemanticLabels(template.labels, &#39;task&#39;, task);

        const newIssue = await this.octokit.rest.issues.create({
          owner,
          repo,
          title: template.title,
          body: template.body,
          labels: mappedLabels,
          assignees:
            this.config.behavior?.syncAssignees &amp;&amp; template.assignees
              ? template.assignees
              : undefined,
          milestone: milestone?.number,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;created&#39;,
          type: &#39;task&#39;,
          itemId: task.id,
          githubNumber: newIssue.data.number,
          details: `Created GitHub issue #${newIssue.data.number}`,
        });
      } else if (await this.shouldUpdateTask(task, existingIssue, epic)) {
        // Update existing task issue using file-based template system (fallback to configurable)
        let template;
        try {
          template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        } catch (error) {
          // Fallback to configurable template manager
          template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
            includeMetadata: true,
            includeArbiterIds: true,
            includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
            includeDependencies: true,
            includeEstimations: true,
          });
        }
        const milestone = this.findMilestoneForEpic(epic);

        // Map semantic labels to GitHub labels
        const mappedLabels = this.mapSemanticLabels(template.labels, &#39;task&#39;, task);

        await this.octokit.rest.issues.update({
          owner,
          repo,
          issue_number: existingIssue.number,
          title: template.title,
          body: template.body,
          labels: mappedLabels,
          assignees:
            this.config.behavior?.syncAssignees &amp;&amp; template.assignees
              ? template.assignees
              : undefined,
          milestone: milestone?.number,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;updated&#39;,
          type: &#39;task&#39;,
          itemId: task.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `Updated GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      } else {
        results.push({
          action: &#39;skipped&#39;,
          type: &#39;task&#39;,
          itemId: task.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `No changes needed for GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      }

      // Handle task completion/cancellation
      if (
        (task.status === &#39;completed&#39; || task.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) &amp;&amp;
        existingIssue &amp;&amp;
        existingIssue.state === &#39;open&#39; &amp;&amp;
        this.config.behavior?.autoClose
      ) {
        await this.octokit.rest.issues.update({
          owner,
          repo,
          issue_number: existingIssue.number,
          state: &#39;closed&#39;,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;closed&#39;,
          type: &#39;task&#39;,
          itemId: task.id,
          githubNumber: existingIssue.number,
          details: `Closed GitHub issue #${existingIssue.number}`,
        });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;skipped&#39;,
        type: &#39;task&#39;,
        itemId: task.id,
        details: `Failed to sync task: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }

  /**
   * Sync milestone for an epic
   */
  private async syncEpicMilestone(epic: Epic): Promise&lt;SyncResult[]&gt; {
    const results: SyncResult[] = [];
    const { owner, repo } = this.config.repository;

    try {
      const milestoneTitle = this.generateMilestoneTitle(epic);
      const existingMilestone = this.findExistingMilestone(milestoneTitle, epic.id);

      if (!existingMilestone) {
        // Create new milestone
        const description = this.generateMilestoneDescription(epic);
        const dueDate = epic.dueDate ? new Date(epic.dueDate).toISOString() : undefined;

        const newMilestone = await this.octokit.rest.issues.createMilestone({
          owner,
          repo,
          title: milestoneTitle,
          description,
          due_on: dueDate,
        });

        this.milestoneCache.set(milestoneTitle, {
          number: newMilestone.data.number,
          title: newMilestone.data.title,
          state: newMilestone.data.state as &#39;open&#39; | &#39;closed&#39;,
          description: newMilestone.data.description || undefined,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;created&#39;,
          type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: newMilestone.data.number,
          details: `Created GitHub milestone #${newMilestone.data.number}`,
        });
      } else if (this.shouldUpdateMilestone(epic, existingMilestone)) {
        // Update existing milestone
        const description = this.generateMilestoneDescription(epic);
        const dueDate = epic.dueDate ? new Date(epic.dueDate).toISOString() : undefined;

        await this.octokit.rest.issues.updateMilestone({
          owner,
          repo,
          milestone_number: existingMilestone.number,
          title: milestoneTitle,
          description,
          due_on: dueDate,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;updated&#39;,
          type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: existingMilestone.number,
          details: `Updated GitHub milestone #${existingMilestone.number}`,
        });
      }

      // Handle milestone completion
      if (
        (epic.status === &#39;completed&#39; || epic.status === &#39;cancelled&#39;) &amp;&amp;
        existingMilestone &amp;&amp;
        existingMilestone.state === &#39;open&#39;
      ) {
        await this.octokit.rest.issues.updateMilestone({
          owner,
          repo,
          milestone_number: existingMilestone.number,
          state: &#39;closed&#39;,
        });

        results.push({
          action: &#39;closed&#39;,
          type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
          itemId: epic.id,
          githubNumber: existingMilestone.number,
          details: `Closed GitHub milestone #${existingMilestone.number}`,
        });
      }
    } catch (error) {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;skipped&#39;,
        type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Failed to sync milestone: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : String(error)}`,
      });
    }

    return results;
  }

  // Helper methods for generating GitHub content (kept for milestone support)

  private async generateEpicTitle(epic: Epic): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    // Use file-based template manager for consistency (fallback to configurable)
    try {
      const template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic);
      return template.title;
    } catch {
      // Fallback to configurable template manager
      const template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic);
      return template.title;
    }
  }

  private async generateTaskTitle(task: Task, epic: Epic): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    // Use file-based template manager for consistency (fallback to configurable)
    try {
      const template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic);
      return template.title;
    } catch {
      // Fallback to configurable template manager
      const template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic);
      return template.title;
    }
  }

  private generateMilestoneTitle(epic: Epic): string {
    return `Epic: ${epic.name}`;
  }

  private generateMilestoneDescription(epic: Epic): string {
    let description = `&lt;!-- arbiter-id: ${epic.id} --&gt;\n\n`;

    if (epic.description) {
      description += `${epic.description}\n\n`;
    }

    description += `Arbiter Epic: ${epic.name}\n`;
    description += `Tasks: ${epic.tasks.length}\n`;

    if (epic.estimatedHours) {
      const totalEstimated = epic.tasks.reduce((sum, task) =&gt; sum + (task.estimatedHours || 0), 0);
      description += `Estimated Hours: ${totalEstimated}\n`;
    }

    return description;
  }

  // Helper methods for finding existing items

  private findExistingIssue(title: string, arbiterId: string): GitHubIssue | undefined {
    // First try to find by arbiter ID
    const byId = this.issueCache.get(`arbiter:${arbiterId}`);
    if (byId) return byId;

    // Then try by title
    return this.issueCache.get(title);
  }

  private findExistingMilestone(title: string, arbiterId: string): GitHubMilestone | undefined {
    // First try to find by arbiter ID
    const byId = this.milestoneCache.get(`arbiter:${arbiterId}`);
    if (byId) return byId;

    // Then try by title
    return this.milestoneCache.get(title);
  }

  private findMilestoneForEpic(epic: Epic): GitHubMilestone | undefined {
    if (!this.config.behavior?.createMilestones) return undefined;

    const milestoneTitle = this.generateMilestoneTitle(epic);
    return this.findExistingMilestone(milestoneTitle, epic.id);
  }

  // Helper methods for determining if updates are needed

  private async shouldUpdateEpic(epic: Epic, existingIssue: GitHubIssue): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    let template;
    try {
      template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
        includeMetadata: true,
        includeArbiterIds: true,
        includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
        includeDependencies: true,
        includeEstimations: true,
      });
    } catch (error) {
      // Fallback to configurable template manager
      template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateEpicTemplate(epic, {
        includeMetadata: true,
        includeArbiterIds: true,
        includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
        includeDependencies: true,
        includeEstimations: true,
      });
    }

    return existingIssue.title !== template.title || existingIssue.body !== template.body;
  }

  private async shouldUpdateTask(
    task: Task,
    existingIssue: GitHubIssue,
    epic: Epic
  ): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    let template;
    try {
      template = await this.fileBasedTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
        includeMetadata: true,
        includeArbiterIds: true,
        includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
        includeDependencies: true,
        includeEstimations: true,
      });
    } catch (error) {
      // Fallback to configurable template manager
      template = this.configurableTemplateManager.generateTaskTemplate(task, epic, {
        includeMetadata: true,
        includeArbiterIds: true,
        includeAcceptanceCriteria: true,
        includeDependencies: true,
        includeEstimations: true,
      });
    }

    return existingIssue.title !== template.title || existingIssue.body !== template.body;
  }

  private shouldUpdateMilestone(epic: Epic, existingMilestone: GitHubMilestone): boolean {
    const expectedTitle = this.generateMilestoneTitle(epic);
    const expectedDescription = this.generateMilestoneDescription(epic);

    return (
      existingMilestone.title !== expectedTitle ||
      existingMilestone.description !== expectedDescription
    );
  }

  /**
   * Map semantic labels to GitHub/GitLab platform labels
   */
  private mapSemanticLabels(
    labels: string[],
    itemType: &#39;epic&#39; | &#39;task&#39;,
    item: Epic | Task
  ): string[] {
    const mappedLabels: string[] = [];

    // Add default labels from configuration
    if (this.config.mapping.defaultLabels) {
      mappedLabels.push(...this.config.mapping.defaultLabels);
    }

    // Map semantic labels using configuration
    for (const label of labels) {
      // Check type-specific mappings first
      const typeSpecificLabels =
        itemType === &#39;epic&#39;
          ? this.config.mapping.epicLabels?.[label]
          : this.config.mapping.taskLabels?.[label];

      if (typeSpecificLabels) {
        mappedLabels.push(...typeSpecificLabels);
      } else {
        // Use label as-is if no mapping found
        mappedLabels.push(label);
      }
    }

    // Add contextual labels based on item properties
    if (itemType === &#39;epic&#39;) {
      const epic = item as Epic;
      mappedLabels.push(`priority:${epic.priority}`);
      mappedLabels.push(`status:${epic.status}`);
      mappedLabels.push(&#39;type:epic&#39;);
    } else {
      const task = item as Task;
      mappedLabels.push(`priority:${task.priority}`);
      mappedLabels.push(`status:${task.status}`);
      mappedLabels.push(`type:${task.type}`);
    }

    // Add prefix labels if configured
    const prefix =
      itemType === &#39;epic&#39; ? this.config.mapping.epicPrefix : this.config.mapping.taskPrefix;
    if (prefix) {
      mappedLabels.unshift(prefix);
    }

    // Remove duplicates and return
    return Array.from(new Set(mappedLabels)).filter(label =&gt; label.trim() !== &#39;&#39;);
  }

  // Helper method to convert preview to results format
  private convertPreviewToResults(preview: SyncPreview): SyncResult[] {
    const results: SyncResult[] = [];

    // Process epics
    preview.epics.create.forEach(epic =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;created&#39;,
        type: &#39;epic&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would create epic: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.epics.update.forEach(({ epic }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;updated&#39;,
        type: &#39;epic&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would update epic: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.epics.close.forEach(({ epic }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;closed&#39;,
        type: &#39;epic&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would close epic: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    // Process tasks
    preview.tasks.create.forEach(task =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;created&#39;,
        type: &#39;task&#39;,
        itemId: task.id,
        details: `Would create task: ${task.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.tasks.update.forEach(({ task }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;updated&#39;,
        type: &#39;task&#39;,
        itemId: task.id,
        details: `Would update task: ${task.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.tasks.close.forEach(({ task }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;closed&#39;,
        type: &#39;task&#39;,
        itemId: task.id,
        details: `Would close task: ${task.name}`,
      });
    });

    // Process milestones
    preview.milestones.create.forEach(epic =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;created&#39;,
        type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would create milestone: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.milestones.update.forEach(({ epic }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;updated&#39;,
        type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would update milestone: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    preview.milestones.close.forEach(({ epic }) =&gt; {
      results.push({
        action: &#39;closed&#39;,
        type: &#39;milestone&#39;,
        itemId: epic.id,
        details: `Would close milestone: ${epic.name}`,
      });
    });

    return results;
  }
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/design-system/components/Sidebar.tsx
/**
 * Sidebar Component - Design System
 * Professional sidebar navigation with collapsible sections and elegant hierarchy
 * Designed for developer tools with sophisticated graphite theme
 */

import React, { useState, type ReactNode } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { clsx } from &#39;clsx&#39;;
import {
  ChevronRight,
  ChevronDown,
  Folder,
  FolderOpen,
  File,
  Settings,
  Users,
  Home,
  Search,
} from &#39;lucide-react&#39;;
import { cn } from &#39;../variants&#39;;

export interface SidebarNavItem {
  id: string;
  label: string;
  icon?: ReactNode;
  href?: string;
  active?: boolean;
  badge?: string | number;
  children?: SidebarNavItem[];
  collapsible?: boolean;
  collapsed?: boolean;
  onClick?: () =&gt; void;
}

export interface SidebarProps {
  /** Navigation items */
  items: SidebarNavItem[];

  /** Whether the sidebar is collapsed */
  collapsed?: boolean;

  /** Sidebar width when expanded */
  width?: &#39;sm&#39; | &#39;md&#39; | &#39;lg&#39;;

  /** Callback when an item is clicked */
  onItemClick?: (item: SidebarNavItem) =&gt; void;

  /** Callback when a collapsible section is toggled */
  onToggle?: (itemId: string, collapsed: boolean) =&gt; void;

  /** Header content */
  header?: ReactNode;

  /** Footer content */
  footer?: ReactNode;

  /** Custom className */
  className?: string;

  /** Whether to show tooltips when collapsed */
  showTooltips?: boolean;
}

const widthClasses = {
  sm: &#39;w-48&#39;,
  md: &#39;w-64&#39;,
  lg: &#39;w-80&#39;,
} as const;

const collapsedWidth = &#39;w-14&#39;;

function NavItemComponent({
  item,
  level = 0,
  collapsed = false,
  onItemClick,
  onToggle,
}: {
  item: SidebarNavItem;
  level?: number;
  collapsed?: boolean;
  onItemClick?: (item: SidebarNavItem) =&gt; void;
  onToggle?: (itemId: string, collapsed: boolean) =&gt; void;
}) {
  const [isCollapsed, setIsCollapsed] = useState(item.collapsed || false);
  const hasChildren = item.children &amp;&amp; item.children.length &gt; 0;
  const isActive = item.active;

  const handleClick = () =&gt; {
    if (item.collapsible &amp;&amp; hasChildren) {
      const newCollapsed = !isCollapsed;
      setIsCollapsed(newCollapsed);
      onToggle?.(item.id, newCollapsed);
    }

    if (item.onClick) {
      item.onClick();
    }

    onItemClick?.(item);
  };

  const itemContent = (
    &lt;div
      className={cn(
        &#39;group flex items-center gap-2 px-3 py-2 rounded-md cursor-pointer transition-all duration-150&#39;,
        &#39;text-sm font-medium&#39;,

        // Indentation for nested items
        level &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; !collapsed &amp;&amp; `ml-${level * 4}`,

        // Active state
        isActive &amp;&amp; &#39;bg-blue-50 text-blue-700 border-r-2 border-blue-500&#39;,

        // Hover state
        !isActive &amp;&amp; &#39;text-graphite-700 hover:bg-graphite-100 hover:text-graphite-900&#39;,

        // Collapsed state
        collapsed &amp;&amp; &#39;justify-center px-2&#39;
      )}
      onClick={handleClick}
      role=&quot;button&quot;
      tabIndex={0}
      onKeyDown={e =&gt; {
        if (e.key === &#39;Enter&#39; || e.key === &#39; &#39;) {
          e.preventDefault();
          handleClick();
        }
      }}
    &gt;
      {/* Collapse/expand icon */}
      {hasChildren &amp;&amp; item.collapsible &amp;&amp; !collapsed &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;span className=&quot;flex-shrink-0 text-graphite-400&quot;&gt;
          {isCollapsed ? &lt;ChevronRight className=&quot;h-4 w-4&quot; /&gt; : &lt;ChevronDown className=&quot;h-4 w-4&quot; /&gt;}
        &lt;/span&gt;
      )}

      {/* Item icon */}
      {item.icon &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;span
          className={cn(
            &#39;flex-shrink-0&#39;,
            isActive ? &#39;text-blue-600&#39; : &#39;text-graphite-500 group-hover:text-graphite-700&#39;,
            hasChildren &amp;&amp; item.collapsible &amp;&amp; !collapsed &amp;&amp; &#39;ml-0&#39;
          )}
        &gt;
          {item.icon}
        &lt;/span&gt;
      )}

      {/* Item label */}
      {!collapsed &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;&gt;
          &lt;span className=&quot;flex-1 truncate&quot;&gt;{item.label}&lt;/span&gt;

          {/* Badge */}
          {item.badge &amp;&amp; (
            &lt;span
              className={cn(
                &#39;inline-flex items-center justify-center px-2 py-0.5 rounded-full text-xs font-medium&#39;,
                isActive
                  ? &#39;bg-blue-100 text-blue-700&#39;
                  : &#39;bg-graphite-100 text-graphite-600 group-hover:bg-graphite-200&#39;
              )}
            &gt;
              {item.badge}
            &lt;/span&gt;
          )}
        &lt;/&gt;
      )}
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );

  return (
    &lt;li className=&quot;relative&quot;&gt;
      {collapsed &amp;&amp; item.label ? (
        &lt;div title={item.label} className=&quot;relative&quot;&gt;
          {itemContent}
        &lt;/div&gt;
      ) : (
        itemContent
      )}

      {/* Children */}
      {hasChildren &amp;&amp; !isCollapsed &amp;&amp; !collapsed &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;ul className=&quot;mt-1 space-y-1&quot;&gt;
          {item.children!.map(child =&gt; (
            &lt;NavItemComponent
              key={child.id}
              item={child}
              level={level + 1}
              collapsed={collapsed}
              onItemClick={onItemClick}
              onToggle={onToggle}
            /&gt;
          ))}
        &lt;/ul&gt;
      )}
    &lt;/li&gt;
  );
}

export function Sidebar({
  items,
  collapsed = false,
  width = &#39;md&#39;,
  onItemClick,
  onToggle,
  header,
  footer,
  className,
  showTooltips = true,
}: SidebarProps) {
  return (
    &lt;aside
      className={cn(
        &#39;flex flex-col h-full bg-white border-r border-graphite-200 transition-all duration-200&#39;,
        collapsed ? collapsedWidth : widthClasses[width],
        className
      )}
    &gt;
      {/* Header */}
      {header &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;div className={cn(&#39;flex-shrink-0 p-4 border-b border-graphite-200&#39;, collapsed &amp;&amp; &#39;px-2&#39;)}&gt;
          {header}
        &lt;/div&gt;
      )}

      {/* Navigation */}
      &lt;nav className=&quot;flex-1 overflow-y-auto py-4&quot;&gt;
        &lt;ul className=&quot;space-y-1 px-2&quot;&gt;
          {items.map(item =&gt; (
            &lt;NavItemComponent
              key={item.id}
              item={item}
              collapsed={collapsed}
              onItemClick={onItemClick}
              onToggle={onToggle}
            /&gt;
          ))}
        &lt;/ul&gt;
      &lt;/nav&gt;

      {/* Footer */}
      {footer &amp;&amp; (
        &lt;div className={cn(&#39;flex-shrink-0 p-4 border-t border-graphite-200&#39;, collapsed &amp;&amp; &#39;px-2&#39;)}&gt;
          {footer}
        &lt;/div&gt;
      )}
    &lt;/aside&gt;
  );
}

// Convenience components for common navigation items
export const sidebarIcons = {
  Home,
  Folder,
  FolderOpen,
  File,
  Settings,
  Users,
  Search,
} as const;

export default Sidebar;
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/services/websocket.ts
/**
 * WebSocket service for real-time communication
 */

import type { WebSocketMessage, WsEvent } from &#39;../types/api&#39;;
import { createLogger } from &#39;../utils/logger&#39;;

const log = createLogger(&#39;WebSocket&#39;);

export type WebSocketEventHandler = (event: WsEvent) =&gt; void;

export interface TimerService {
  setTimeout(callback: () =&gt; void, delay: number): number;
  setInterval(callback: () =&gt; void, delay: number): number;
  clearTimeout(timerId: number): void;
  clearInterval(timerId: number): void;
}

export interface LocationService {
  protocol: string;
  host: string;
}

export interface WebSocketFactory {
  create(url: string): WebSocket;
}

export interface WebSocketDependencies {
  timerService?: TimerService;
  locationService?: LocationService;
  webSocketFactory?: WebSocketFactory;
}

export interface WebSocketOptions extends WebSocketDependencies {
  reconnectInterval?: number;
  maxReconnectAttempts?: number;
  pingInterval?: number;
  onConnect?: () =&gt; void;
  onDisconnect?: () =&gt; void;
  onReconnect?: (attempt: number) =&gt; void;
  onError?: (error: Event) =&gt; void;
}

// Default implementations for production use
const defaultTimerService: TimerService = {
  setTimeout: (callback: () =&gt; void, delay: number) =&gt; window.setTimeout(callback, delay),
  setInterval: (callback: () =&gt; void, delay: number) =&gt; window.setInterval(callback, delay),
  clearTimeout: (timerId: number) =&gt; window.clearTimeout(timerId),
  clearInterval: (timerId: number) =&gt; window.clearInterval(timerId),
};

const defaultLocationService: LocationService = {
  get protocol() {
    return window.location.protocol;
  },
  get host() {
    return window.location.host;
  },
};

const defaultWebSocketFactory: WebSocketFactory = {
  create: (url: string) =&gt; new WebSocket(url),
};

class WebSocketService {
  private ws: WebSocket | null = null;
  private reconnectTimer: number | null = null;
  private pingTimer: number | null = null;
  private reconnectAttempts = 0;
  private isManuallyDisconnected = false;
  private eventHandlers = new Set&lt;WebSocketEventHandler&gt;();
  private messageQueue: WebSocketMessage[] = [];
  private wsUrl: string | null = null;

  private readonly timerService: TimerService;
  private readonly locationService: LocationService;
  private readonly webSocketFactory: WebSocketFactory;

  private readonly options: Required&lt;Omit&lt;WebSocketOptions, keyof WebSocketDependencies&gt;&gt; = {
    reconnectInterval: 5000, // 5 seconds
    maxReconnectAttempts: 10,
    pingInterval: 30000, // 30 seconds
    onConnect: () =&gt; {},
    onDisconnect: () =&gt; {},
    onReconnect: () =&gt; {},
    onError: () =&gt; {},
  };

  constructor(options: WebSocketOptions = {}) {
    // Extract dependencies from options
    const { timerService, locationService, webSocketFactory, ...wsOptions } = options;

    // Set up dependencies with defaults
    this.timerService = timerService || defaultTimerService;
    this.locationService = locationService || defaultLocationService;
    this.webSocketFactory = webSocketFactory || defaultWebSocketFactory;

    // Merge websocket options
    this.options = { ...this.options, ...wsOptions };
  }

  connect(projectId: string): void {
    if (this.ws?.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
      return; // Already connected
    }

    this.isManuallyDisconnected = false;
    const protocol = this.locationService.protocol === &#39;https:&#39; ? &#39;wss:&#39; : &#39;ws:&#39;;
    // Use API server port (5050) instead of frontend port for WebSocket connection
    this.wsUrl = `${protocol}//localhost:5050/ws?project_id=${projectId}`;

    try {
      this.ws = this.webSocketFactory.create(this.wsUrl);
      this.setupEventListeners();
    } catch (error) {
      log.error(&#39;Failed to create WebSocket connection:&#39;, error);
      this.scheduleReconnect();
    }
  }

  disconnect(): void {
    this.isManuallyDisconnected = true;
    this.clearTimers();

    if (this.ws) {
      this.ws.close(1000, &#39;Manual disconnect&#39;);
      this.ws = null;
    }

    this.reconnectAttempts = 0;
  }

  send(message: WebSocketMessage): void {
    if (this.ws?.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
      this.ws.send(JSON.stringify(message));
    } else {
      // Queue message for when connection is restored
      this.messageQueue.push(message);
      log.debug(&#39;WebSocket not connected, queuing message:&#39;, message);
    }
  }

  subscribe(handler: WebSocketEventHandler): () =&gt; void {
    this.eventHandlers.add(handler);

    // Return unsubscribe function
    return () =&gt; {
      this.eventHandlers.delete(handler);
    };
  }

  isConnected(): boolean {
    return this.ws?.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN;
  }

  getReconnectAttempts(): number {
    return this.reconnectAttempts;
  }

  private setupEventListeners(): void {
    if (!this.ws) return;

    this.ws.addEventListener(&#39;open&#39;, this.handleOpen.bind(this));
    this.ws.addEventListener(&#39;message&#39;, this.handleMessage.bind(this));
    this.ws.addEventListener(&#39;close&#39;, this.handleClose.bind(this));
    this.ws.addEventListener(&#39;error&#39;, this.handleError.bind(this));
  }

  private handleOpen(): void {
    log.info(&#39;WebSocket connected&#39;);
    this.reconnectAttempts = 0;
    this.options.onConnect();

    // Send queued messages
    while (this.messageQueue.length &gt; 0) {
      const message = this.messageQueue.shift();
      if (message) {
        this.send(message);
      }
    }

    // Start ping interval
    this.startPingInterval();
  }

  private handleMessage(event: MessageEvent): void {
    try {
      const message: WebSocketMessage = JSON.parse(event.data);

      switch (message.type) {
        case &#39;event&#39;:
          this.handleEventMessage(message);
          break;

        case &#39;error&#39;:
          log.error(&#39;WebSocket server error:&#39;, message.data);
          break;

        case &#39;pong&#39;:
          // Server responded to ping
          log.trace(&#39;Received pong from server&#39;);
          break;

        case &#39;ping&#39;:
          // Server sent ping, respond with pong
          log.trace(&#39;Received ping from server, responding with pong&#39;);
          this.send({ type: &#39;pong&#39;, data: {} });
          break;

        default:
          log.warn(&#39;Unknown WebSocket message type:&#39;, message);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      log.error(&#39;Failed to parse WebSocket message:&#39;, error);
    }
  }

  private handleEventMessage(message: WebSocketMessage): void {
    try {
      const rawEvent = message.data as any;

      // Handle different event formats from server
      const wsEvent: WsEvent = {
        type: rawEvent.type || rawEvent.event_type,
        project_id: rawEvent.project_id,
        timestamp: rawEvent.timestamp,
        data: rawEvent.data,
      };

      // Validate event structure - connection_established events don&#39;t need project_id
      if (!wsEvent.type || !wsEvent.timestamp) {
        log.warn(&#39;Invalid WebSocket event structure:&#39;, rawEvent);
        return;
      }

      // Skip project-specific events if we don&#39;t have a project_id (except connection_established)
      if (!wsEvent.project_id &amp;&amp; wsEvent.type !== &#39;connection_established&#39;) {
        log.debug(&#39;Skipping non-project event:&#39;, wsEvent.type);
        return;
      }

      log.debug(&#39;Processing WebSocket event:&#39;, {
        type: wsEvent.type,
        project_id: wsEvent.project_id,
      });

      // Notify all subscribers
      this.eventHandlers.forEach(handler =&gt; {
        try {
          handler(wsEvent);
        } catch (error) {
          log.error(&#39;Error in WebSocket event handler:&#39;, error);
        }
      });
    } catch (error) {
      log.error(&#39;Failed to handle WebSocket event:&#39;, error);
    }
  }

  private handleClose(event: CloseEvent): void {
    log.info(&#39;WebSocket disconnected:&#39;, { code: event.code, reason: event.reason });
    this.clearTimers();
    this.options.onDisconnect();

    if (!this.isManuallyDisconnected &amp;&amp; event.code !== 1000) {
      this.scheduleReconnect();
    }
  }

  private handleError(event: Event): void {
    log.error(&#39;WebSocket error:&#39;, event);
    this.options.onError(event);
  }

  private scheduleReconnect(): void {
    if (
      this.isManuallyDisconnected ||
      this.reconnectAttempts &gt;= this.options.maxReconnectAttempts
    ) {
      log.warn(&#39;Max reconnect attempts reached or manually disconnected&#39;);
      return;
    }

    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      this.timerService.clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer);
    }

    this.reconnectAttempts++;
    log.info(
      `Scheduling WebSocket reconnect attempt ${this.reconnectAttempts}/${this.options.maxReconnectAttempts} in ${this.options.reconnectInterval}ms`
    );

    this.reconnectTimer = this.timerService.setTimeout(() =&gt; {
      this.options.onReconnect(this.reconnectAttempts);
      this.reconnect();
    }, this.options.reconnectInterval);
  }

  private reconnect(): void {
    if (this.isManuallyDisconnected) {
      return;
    }

    // Use stored URL instead of relying on WebSocket instance
    if (!this.wsUrl) {
      log.error(&#39;Cannot reconnect: no previous URL available&#39;);
      return;
    }

    const urlParams = new URLSearchParams(this.wsUrl.split(&#39;?&#39;)[1]);
    const projectId = urlParams.get(&#39;project_id&#39;);

    if (!projectId) {
      log.error(&#39;Cannot reconnect: no project ID available&#39;);
      return;
    }

    this.connect(projectId);
  }

  private startPingInterval(): void {
    this.clearPingTimer();

    this.pingTimer = this.timerService.setInterval(() =&gt; {
      if (this.ws?.readyState === WebSocket.OPEN) {
        this.send({
          type: &#39;ping&#39;,
          data: { timestamp: new Date().toISOString() },
        });
        log.trace(&#39;Ping sent to server&#39;);
      }
    }, this.options.pingInterval);
  }

  private clearTimers(): void {
    this.clearReconnectTimer();
    this.clearPingTimer();
  }

  private clearReconnectTimer(): void {
    if (this.reconnectTimer) {
      this.timerService.clearTimeout(this.reconnectTimer);
      this.reconnectTimer = null;
    }
  }

  private clearPingTimer(): void {
    if (this.pingTimer) {
      this.timerService.clearInterval(this.pingTimer);
      this.pingTimer = null;
    }
  }
}

// Export factory function to create WebSocket service instances
export function createWebSocketService(options: WebSocketOptions = {}): WebSocketService {
  return new WebSocketService(options);
}

// Export singleton instance for global use
export const wsService = createWebSocketService();

    animation: none;
  }
}

.btn:focus,
.file-tree-item:focus {
  outline: 2px solid #007bff;
  outline-offset: 2px;
}

/* Print styles */
@media print {
  .top-bar,
  .tabs {
    display: none;
  }
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/App.tsx
import React, { useEffect } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { ToastContainer } from &#39;react-toastify&#39;;
import &#39;react-toastify/dist/ReactToastify.css&#39;;

// Providers
import { QueryProvider } from &#39;./providers/QueryProvider&#39;;
import {
  ProjectProvider,
  useCurrentProject,
  useSetCurrentProject,
} from &#39;./contexts/ProjectContext&#39;;

// Stores
import { useUiStore, useTabs } from &#39;./stores/ui-store&#39;;

// Hooks
import { useProjects } from &#39;./hooks/api-hooks&#39;;
import { useWebSocket } from &#39;./hooks/useWebSocket&#39;;

// Components
import TopBar from &#39;./components/Layout/TopBar&#39;;
import SplitPane from &#39;./components/Layout/SplitPane&#39;;
import Tabs from &#39;./components/Layout/Tabs&#39;;
import {
  FlowDiagram,
  FriendlyDiagram,
  SourceDiagram,
  FsmDiagram,
  ViewDiagram,
  SiteDiagram,
  GapsChecklist,
  ResolvedViewer,
  ArchitectureDiagram,
} from &#39;./components/diagrams&#39;;
import { Handlers } from &#39;./components/Handlers&#39;;

import type { DiagramTab, LeftTab, RightTab } from &#39;./types/ui&#39;;

// Main app content with modern state management
function AppContent() {
  // Store state
  const { leftTab, rightTab, setLeftTab, setRightTab } = useTabs();
  const currentProject = useCurrentProject();
  const setCurrentProject = useSetCurrentProject();

  // Server state
  const { data: projects } = useProjects();

  // Initialize WebSocket connection
  useWebSocket(currentProject?.id || null, {
    autoReconnect: true,
    showToastNotifications: true,
  });

  // Initialize first project if available
  useEffect(() =&gt; {
    if (!currentProject &amp;&amp; projects &amp;&amp; projects.length &gt; 0) {
      setCurrentProject(projects[0]);
      console.log(&#39;Set initial project:&#39;, projects[0]);
    }
  }, [currentProject, projects, setCurrentProject]);

  const diagramTabs = [
    {
      id: &#39;flow&#39;,
      label: &#39;Flow&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;FlowDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Flow Diagram&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;site&#39;,
      label: &#39;Site&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;SiteDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Site DAG&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;fsm&#39;,
      label: &#39;FSM&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;FsmDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;FSM Diagram&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;view&#39;,
      label: &#39;View&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;ViewDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;View Wireframes&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;gaps&#39;,
      label: &#39;Gaps&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;GapsChecklist projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Gaps Checklist&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;resolved&#39;,
      label: &#39;Resolved&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;ResolvedViewer projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Resolved JSON&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;architecture&#39;,
      label: &#39;Architecture&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;ArchitectureDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;System Architecture&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;handlers&#39;,
      label: &#39;Handlers&#39;,
      content: &lt;Handlers /&gt;,
    },
  ];

  const editorTabs = [
    {
      id: &#39;source&#39;,
      label: &#39;Source&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;SourceDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Source Code&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
    {
      id: &#39;friendly&#39;,
      label: &#39;Friendly&#39;,
      content: currentProject ? (
        &lt;FriendlyDiagram projectId={currentProject.id} /&gt;
      ) : (
        &lt;DiagramPlaceholder type=&quot;Friendly Diagram&quot; /&gt;
      ),
    },
  ];

  return (
    &lt;div className=&quot;h-full flex flex-col bg-gray-50&quot;&gt;
      {/* Top navigation bar */}
      &lt;TopBar className=&quot;flex-shrink-0&quot; /&gt;

      {/* Main content area */}
      &lt;div className=&quot;flex-1 overflow-hidden&quot;&gt;
        &lt;SplitPane defaultSize=&quot;40%&quot; minSize=&quot;300px&quot; maxSize=&quot;70%&quot; split=&quot;vertical&quot;&gt;
          {/* Left pane - Editor with tabs (Source &amp; Friendly) */}
          &lt;div className=&quot;h-full bg-white border-r border-gray-200&quot;&gt;
            &lt;Tabs
              activeTab={leftTab}
              onTabChange={tab =&gt; setLeftTab(tab as LeftTab)}
              tabs={editorTabs}
              className=&quot;h-full&quot;
            /&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;

          {/* Right pane - Diagrams */}
          &lt;div className=&quot;h-full bg-white&quot;&gt;
            &lt;Tabs
              activeTab={rightTab}
              onTabChange={tab =&gt; setRightTab(tab as RightTab)}
              tabs={diagramTabs}
              className=&quot;h-full&quot;
            /&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;
        &lt;/SplitPane&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
}

// Placeholder component for diagrams
function DiagramPlaceholder({ type }: { type: string }) {
  return (
    &lt;div className=&quot;diagram-container&quot;&gt;
      &lt;div className=&quot;diagram-loading&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div className=&quot;text-center&quot;&gt;
          &lt;div className=&quot;spinner h-8 w-8 mb-4 mx-auto&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
          &lt;p&gt;{type} coming soon...&lt;/p&gt;
          &lt;p className=&quot;text-sm text-gray-400 mt-2&quot;&gt;
            This will render interactive diagrams from the backend IR
          &lt;/p&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  );
}

// Error boundary component
class ErrorBoundary extends React.Component&lt;
  { children: React.ReactNode },
  { hasError: boolean; error: Error | null }
&gt; {
  constructor(props: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
    super(props);
    this.state = { hasError: false, error: null };
  }

  static getDerivedStateFromError(error: Error) {
    return { hasError: true, error };
  }

  componentDidCatch(error: Error, errorInfo: React.ErrorInfo) {
    console.error(&#39;Error boundary caught an error:&#39;, error, errorInfo);
  }

  render() {
    if (this.state.hasError) {
      return (
        &lt;div className=&quot;error-boundary&quot;&gt;
          &lt;h2&gt;Something went wrong&lt;/h2&gt;
          &lt;p className=&quot;text-gray-600 mb-4&quot;&gt;The application encountered an unexpected error.&lt;/p&gt;
          &lt;details className=&quot;text-left&quot;&gt;
            &lt;summary className=&quot;cursor-pointer text-blue-600 hover:text-blue-700&quot;&gt;
              Error Details
            &lt;/summary&gt;
            &lt;pre className=&quot;mt-2&quot;&gt;{this.state.error?.stack}&lt;/pre&gt;
          &lt;/details&gt;
          &lt;button
            className=&quot;mt-4 px-4 py-2 bg-blue-600 text-white rounded hover:bg-blue-700&quot;
            onClick={() =&gt; window.location.reload()}
          &gt;
            Reload Page
          &lt;/button&gt;
        &lt;/div&gt;
      );
    }

    return this.props.children;
  }
}

// Main App component with all providers
function App() {
  return (
    &lt;ErrorBoundary&gt;
      &lt;QueryProvider&gt;
        &lt;ProjectProvider&gt;
