        baseUrl: &#39;https://github.enterprise.com/api/v3&#39;,
        tokenEnv: &#39;ENTERPRISE_TOKEN&#39;,
      };

      const result = createRepositoryConfig(&#39;owner&#39;, &#39;repo&#39;, baseConfig);
      expect(result).toEqual({
        owner: &#39;owner&#39;,
        repo: &#39;repo&#39;,
        baseUrl: &#39;https://github.enterprise.com/api/v3&#39;,
        tokenEnv: &#39;ENTERPRISE_TOKEN&#39;,
      });
    });
  });

  describe(&#39;getSmartRepositoryConfig&#39;, () =&gt; {
    beforeEach(() =&gt; {
      // Clear any previous mocks
    });

    it(&#39;should use config when no Git detection&#39;, () =&gt; {
      // Mock execSync to throw (no Git remote)
      const mockExecSync = mock(() =&gt; {
        throw new Error(&#39;Not a git repository&#39;);
      });

      // We&#39;ll test this without mocking for now since Bun mocking is different
      const configRepo: GitHubRepo = { owner: &#39;config-owner&#39;, repo: &#39;config-repo&#39; };
      const result = getSmartRepositoryConfig(configRepo, { verbose: false });

      expect(result).toEqual({
        repo: configRepo,
        source: &#39;config&#39;,
      });
    });

    it(&#39;should use config when provided regardless of Git detection&#39;, () =&gt; {
      const configRepo: GitHubRepo = { owner: &#39;config-owner&#39;, repo: &#39;config-repo&#39; };
      const result = getSmartRepositoryConfig(configRepo, { verbose: false });

      expect(result).toEqual({
        repo: configRepo,
        source: &#39;config&#39;,
      });
    });

    // Note: Removed tests that require complex mocking of child_process
    // These would need to be integration tests or use a different approach
  });
});
📄 packages/cli/src/templates/index.ts
/**
 * Pluggable Template System
 *
 * This module provides a pluggable template system with clean alias configuration
 * that keeps implementation details separate from CUE specifications.
 */

import { spawn } from &#39;node:child_process&#39;;
import os from &#39;node:os&#39;;
import path from &#39;node:path&#39;;
import { promisify } from &#39;node:util&#39;;
import chalk from &#39;chalk&#39;;
import fs from &#39;fs-extra&#39;;

/**
 * Helper function to replace execa with spawn
 */
async function execCommand(
  command: string,
  args: string[],
  options: { env?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;; cwd?: string } = {}
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&gt; {
    const child = spawn(command, args, {
      stdio: &#39;inherit&#39;,
      env: { ...process.env, ...options.env },
      cwd: options.cwd || process.cwd(),
    });

    child.on(&#39;close&#39;, code =&gt; {
      if (code === 0) {
        resolve();
      } else {
        reject(new Error(`Command failed with exit code ${code}: ${command} ${args.join(&#39; &#39;)}`));
      }
    });

    child.on(&#39;error&#39;, error =&gt; {
      reject(error);
    });
  });
}

/**
 * Template engine interface
 */
export interface TemplateEngine {
  name: string;
  command: string;
  defaultArgs: string[];
  validate?(source: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt;;
  execute(source: string, destination: string, variables: Record&lt;string, any&gt;): Promise&lt;void&gt;;
}

/**
 * Template alias configuration
 */
export interface TemplateAlias {
  engine: string;
  source: string;
  description: string;
  variables?: Record&lt;string, any&gt;;
  prerequisites?: string[];
}

/**
 * Template configuration file structure
 */
export interface TemplateConfig {
  engines: Record&lt;string, TemplateEngineConfig&gt;;
  aliases: Record&lt;string, TemplateAlias&gt;;
  settings?: {
    defaultEngine?: string;
    cacheDir?: string;
    timeout?: number;
  };
}

/**
 * Engine configuration in the template config
 */
export interface TemplateEngineConfig {
  command: string;
  defaultArgs: string[];
  timeout?: number;
}

/**
 * Variable extraction context from CUE specs
 */
export interface VariableContext {
  projectName: string;
  serviceName?: string;
  serviceType?: string;
  language?: string;
  ports?: number[];
  environment?: Record&lt;string, string&gt;;
  database?: {
    type: string;
    name: string;
    port?: number;
  };
  [key: string]: any;
}

/**
 * Template manager for handling aliases and execution
 */
export class TemplateManager {
  private config: TemplateConfig | null = null;
  private engines: Map&lt;string, TemplateEngine&gt; = new Map();

  constructor() {
    this.loadDefaultEngines();
  }

  /**
   * Load default template engines
   */
  private loadDefaultEngines(): void {
    // Cookiecutter engine
    this.engines.set(&#39;cookiecutter&#39;, new CookiecutterEngine());

    // Yeoman engine (future implementation)
    // this.engines.set(&#39;yeoman&#39;, new YeomanEngine());

    // Custom script engine for simple templates
    this.engines.set(&#39;script&#39;, new ScriptEngine());
  }

  /**
   * Load template configuration from file system
   */
  async loadConfig(configPath?: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const defaultPath = await this.getDefaultConfigPath();
    const targetPath = configPath || defaultPath;

    try {
      if (await fs.pathExists(targetPath)) {
        const content = await fs.readJson(targetPath);
        this.config = content;
      } else {
        // Create default config
        this.config = this.getDefaultConfig();
        await this.saveConfig(targetPath);
      }
    } catch (error) {
      console.warn(chalk.yellow(`Warning: Failed to load template config: ${error}`));
      this.config = this.getDefaultConfig();
    }
  }

  /**
   * Get default configuration path
   */
  private async getDefaultConfigPath(): Promise&lt;string&gt; {
    // Look for .arbiter/templates.json first
    const projectPath = path.join(process.cwd(), &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates.json&#39;);
    if (await fs.pathExists(projectPath)) {
      return projectPath;
    }

    // Fall back to global config
    return path.join(os.homedir(), &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;templates.json&#39;);
  }

  /**
   * Get default template configuration
   */
  private getDefaultConfig(): TemplateConfig {
    return {
      engines: {
        cookiecutter: {
          command: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
          defaultArgs: [&#39;--no-input&#39;],
          timeout: 300000, // 5 minutes
        },
        script: {
          command: &#39;sh&#39;,
          defaultArgs: [],
          timeout: 60000, // 1 minute
        },
      },
      aliases: {
        &#39;bun-hono&#39;: {
          engine: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
          source: &#39;https://github.com/arbiter-templates/bun-hono.git&#39;,
          description: &#39;Bun + Hono API service with Drizzle ORM&#39;,
        },
        &#39;rust-axum&#39;: {
          engine: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
          source: &#39;gh:arbiter-templates/rust-axum&#39;,
          description: &#39;Rust + Axum service with SQLx&#39;,
        },
        &#39;react-vite&#39;: {
          engine: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
          source: &#39;/local/path/to/react-template&#39;,
          description: &#39;React + Vite frontend with Tailwind&#39;,
        },
        &#39;python-fastapi&#39;: {
          engine: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
          source: &#39;https://github.com/fastapi-users/fastapi-users-cookiecutter.git&#39;,
          description: &#39;FastAPI service with async SQLAlchemy&#39;,
        },
      },
      settings: {
        defaultEngine: &#39;cookiecutter&#39;,
        cacheDir: path.join(os.homedir(), &#39;.arbiter&#39;, &#39;template-cache&#39;),
        timeout: 300000,
      },
    };
  }

  /**
   * Save configuration to file
   */
  async saveConfig(configPath?: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config) {
      throw new Error(&#39;No configuration to save&#39;);
    }

    const targetPath = configPath || (await this.getDefaultConfigPath());
    await fs.ensureDir(path.dirname(targetPath));
    await fs.writeJson(targetPath, this.config, { spaces: 2 });
  }

  /**
   * Get all available template aliases
   */
  getAliases(): Record&lt;string, TemplateAlias&gt; {
    if (!this.config) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Configuration not loaded. Call loadConfig() first.&#39;);
    }
    return this.config.aliases;
  }

  /**
   * Get specific template alias
   */
  getAlias(name: string): TemplateAlias | undefined {
    if (!this.config) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Configuration not loaded. Call loadConfig() first.&#39;);
    }
    return this.config.aliases[name];
  }

  /**
   * Add or update template alias
   */
  async addAlias(name: string, alias: TemplateAlias): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Configuration not loaded. Call loadConfig() first.&#39;);
    }

    // Validate engine exists
    if (!this.engines.has(alias.engine)) {
      throw new Error(`Unknown engine: ${alias.engine}`);
    }

    this.config.aliases[name] = alias;
    await this.saveConfig();
  }

  /**
   * Remove template alias
   */
  async removeAlias(name: string): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!this.config) {
      throw new Error(&#39;Configuration not loaded. Call loadConfig() first.&#39;);
    }

    delete this.config.aliases[name];
    await this.saveConfig();
  }

  /**
   * Execute template with variables
   */
  async executeTemplate(
    aliasName: string,
    destination: string,
    variables: VariableContext
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    const alias = this.getAlias(aliasName);
    if (!alias) {
      throw new Error(`Template alias &#39;${aliasName}&#39; not found`);
    }

    const engine = this.engines.get(alias.engine);
    if (!engine) {
      throw new Error(`Engine &#39;${alias.engine}&#39; not found`);
    }

    // Merge variables with alias defaults
    const finalVariables = {
      ...alias.variables,
      ...variables,
    };

    // Validate prerequisites if any
    if (alias.prerequisites) {
      await this.validatePrerequisites(alias.prerequisites);
    }

    // Execute template
    await engine.execute(alias.source, destination, finalVariables);
  }

  /**
   * Validate template prerequisites
   */
  private async validatePrerequisites(prerequisites: string[]): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    for (const prereq of prerequisites) {
      // Simple command existence check
      try {
        await execCommand(&#39;which&#39;, [prereq]);
      } catch {
        throw new Error(`Prerequisite not found: ${prereq}`);
      }
    }
  }

  /**
   * List available engines
   */
  getEngines(): string[] {
    return Array.from(this.engines.keys());
  }

  /**
   * Add custom engine
   */
  addEngine(engine: TemplateEngine): void {
    this.engines.set(engine.name, engine);
  }
}

/**
 * Cookiecutter template engine implementation
 */
export class CookiecutterEngine implements TemplateEngine {
  name = &#39;cookiecutter&#39;;
  command = &#39;cookiecutter&#39;;
  defaultArgs = [&#39;--no-input&#39;];

  async validate(source: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    try {
      await execCommand(&#39;which&#39;, [&#39;cookiecutter&#39;]);
      return true;
    } catch {
      return false;
    }
  }

  async execute(
    source: string,
    destination: string,
    variables: Record&lt;string, any&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      // Build cookiecutter command
      const args = [...this.defaultArgs];

      // Add variables as command line arguments
      for (const [key, value] of Object.entries(variables)) {
        args.push(&#39;--extra-context&#39;);
        args.push(`${key}=${value}`);
      }

      // Add output directory
      args.push(&#39;--output-dir&#39;, destination);

      // Add template source
      args.push(source);

      await execCommand(&#39;cookiecutter&#39;, args);
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Cookiecutter execution failed: ${error}`);
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Simple script-based template engine
 */
export class ScriptEngine implements TemplateEngine {
  name = &#39;script&#39;;
  command = &#39;sh&#39;;
  defaultArgs = [];

  async validate(source: string): Promise&lt;boolean&gt; {
    return fs.pathExists(source);
  }

  async execute(
    source: string,
    destination: string,
    variables: Record&lt;string, any&gt;
  ): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      // Set variables as environment variables
      const env = {
        ...process.env,
        TEMPLATE_DESTINATION: destination,
        ...Object.fromEntries(
          Object.entries(variables).map(([k, v]) =&gt; [`TEMPLATE_${k.toUpperCase()}`, String(v)])
        ),
      };

      await execCommand(&#39;sh&#39;, [source], { env });
    } catch (error) {
      throw new Error(`Script execution failed: ${error}`);
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Extract variables from CUE specification content
 */
export function extractVariablesFromCue(content: string, serviceName?: string): VariableContext {
  const variables = initializeBaseVariables(serviceName);

  extractProjectName(content, variables);

  if (serviceName) {
    extractServiceInformation(content, serviceName, variables);
  }

  return variables;
}

/**
 * Initialize base variable context
 */
function initializeBaseVariables(serviceName?: string): VariableContext {
  return {
    projectName: path.basename(process.cwd()).replace(/[^a-zA-Z0-9]/g, &#39;&#39;),
    serviceName: serviceName || &#39;api&#39;,
  };
}

/**
 * Extract project name from package declaration
 */
function extractProjectName(content: string, variables: VariableContext): void {
  const packageMatch = content.match(/package\s+(\w+)/);
  if (packageMatch) {
    variables.projectName = packageMatch[1];
  }
}

/**
 * Extract service-specific information from CUE content
 */
function extractServiceInformation(
  content: string,
  serviceName: string,
  variables: VariableContext
): void {
  const serviceContent = extractServiceContent(content, serviceName);
  if (!serviceContent) return;

  extractServiceLanguage(serviceContent, variables);
  extractServiceType(serviceContent, variables);
  extractServicePorts(serviceContent, variables);
}

/**
 * Extract service content block from CUE
 */
function extractServiceContent(content: string, serviceName: string): string | null {
  const serviceRegex = new RegExp(`${serviceName}:\\s*{([^}]+)}`, &#39;s&#39;);
  const serviceMatch = content.match(serviceRegex);
  return serviceMatch ? serviceMatch[1] : null;
}

/**
 * Extract language from service content
 */
function extractServiceLanguage(serviceContent: string, variables: VariableContext): void {
  const langMatch = serviceContent.match(/language:\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;/);
  if (langMatch) {
    variables.language = langMatch[1];
  }
}

/**
 * Extract service type from service content
 */
function extractServiceType(serviceContent: string, variables: VariableContext): void {
  const typeMatch = serviceContent.match(/serviceType:\s*&quot;([^&quot;]+)&quot;/);
  if (typeMatch) {
    variables.serviceType = typeMatch[1];
  }
}

/**
 * Extract ports from service content
 */
function extractServicePorts(serviceContent: string, variables: VariableContext): void {
  const portsMatch = serviceContent.match(/ports:\s*\[([^\]]+)\]/s);
  if (portsMatch) {
    const portsContent = portsMatch[1];
    const portMatches = portsContent.matchAll(/port:\s*(\d+)/g);
    variables.ports = Array.from(portMatches).map(m =&gt; Number.parseInt(m[1], 10));
  }
}

/**
 * Default template manager instance
 */
export const templateManager = new TemplateManager();
📄 packages/cli/src/commands/compat.ts
/**
 * @fileoverview Compatibility Check Command Implementation v1.0 RC
 * Provides CLI interface for version compatibility validation and migration
 */

import {
  CURRENT_VERSIONS,
  type CompatibilityResult,
  type VersionSet,
  checkCompatibility,
  estimateMigrationDuration,
  executeMigration,
  getAvailableMigrationPaths,
  getRuntimeVersionInfo,
  hasMigrationPath,
  validateVersionSet,
} from &#39;@arbiter/shared&#39;;
import { z } from &#39;zod&#39;;

// =============================================================================
// COMMAND SCHEMAS
// =============================================================================

/**
 * Compatibility check command options
 */
export const CompatCheckOptionsSchema = z
  .object({
    input: z.string().optional().describe(&#39;Path to version file or JSON&#39;),
    format: z.enum([&#39;json&#39;, &#39;text&#39;, &#39;table&#39;]).default(&#39;text&#39;).describe(&#39;Output format&#39;),
    allowCompat: z.boolean().default(false).describe(&#39;Allow compatibility warnings&#39;),
    showMigrations: z.boolean().default(true).describe(&#39;Show available migration paths&#39;),
    verbose: z.boolean().default(false).describe(&#39;Verbose output&#39;),
  })
  .strict();

export type CompatCheckOptions = z.infer&lt;typeof CompatCheckOptionsSchema&gt;;

/**
 * Migration command options
 */
export const MigrationOptionsSchema = z
  .object({
    from: z.string().describe(&#39;Source version&#39;),
    to: z.string().describe(&#39;Target version&#39;),
    component: z
      .enum([&#39;api_version&#39;, &#39;schema_version&#39;, &#39;contract_version&#39;, &#39;ticket_format&#39;])
      .describe(&#39;Component to migrate&#39;),
    dryRun: z.boolean().default(false).describe(&#39;Show migration plan without executing&#39;),
    force: z.boolean().default(false).describe(&#39;Force migration even if risky&#39;),
    backup: z.boolean().default(true).describe(&#39;Create backup before migration&#39;),
  })
  .strict();

export type MigrationOptions = z.infer&lt;typeof MigrationOptionsSchema&gt;;

// =============================================================================
// COMPATIBILITY CHECK COMMAND
// =============================================================================

/**
 * Execute compatibility check command
 */
export async function runCompatCheck(options: CompatCheckOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  try {
    console.log(&#39;🔍 Arbiter Compatibility Check v1.0 RC\n&#39;);

    // Get runtime version information
    const runtimeInfo = getRuntimeVersionInfo();

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(&#39;📋 Current Runtime Versions:&#39;);
      console.table(runtimeInfo.versions);
      console.log();
    }

    // Load versions to check against
    const versionsToCheck = await loadVersionsToCheck(options.input);

    if (options.verbose) {
      console.log(&#39;📥 Versions to Check:&#39;);
      console.table(versionsToCheck);
      console.log();
    }

    // Perform compatibility check
    const result = await checkCompatibility(versionsToCheck, options.allowCompat);

    // Output results
    await outputCompatibilityResult(result, options);

    // Show migration paths if requested
    if (options.showMigrations &amp;&amp; result.version_mismatches.length &gt; 0) {
      await showMigrationPaths(versionsToCheck, options);
    }

    // Exit with appropriate code
    process.exit(result.compatible ? 0 : 1);
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(&#39;❌ Compatibility check failed:&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error.message : error);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

/**
 * Load versions to check from input source
 */
async function loadVersionsToCheck(input?: string): Promise&lt;Partial&lt;VersionSet&gt;&gt; {
  if (!input) {
    // Use current versions as baseline
    return CURRENT_VERSIONS;
  }

  try {
    // Try to read as file
    const fs = await import(&#39;node:fs/promises&#39;);
    const content = await fs.readFile(input, &#39;utf-8&#39;);
    const data = JSON.parse(content);

    // Validate structure
    if (data.versions) {
      validateVersionSet(data.versions);
      return data.versions;
    }
    validateVersionSet(data);
    return data;
  } catch (_error) {
    // Try to parse as direct JSON
    try {
      const data = JSON.parse(input);
      validateVersionSet(data);
      return data;
    } catch {
      throw new Error(`Cannot load versions from: ${input}`);
    }
  }
}

/**
 * Output compatibility check result in specified format
 */
async function outputCompatibilityResult(
  result: CompatibilityResult,
  options: CompatCheckOptions
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  switch (options.format) {
    case &#39;json&#39;:
      console.log(JSON.stringify(result, null, 2));
      break;

    case &#39;table&#39;:
      outputCompatibilityTable(result);
      break;
    default:
      outputCompatibilityText(result, options.verbose);
      break;
  }
}

/**
 * Output compatibility result as formatted text
 */
function outputCompatibilityText(result: CompatibilityResult, verbose: boolean): void {
  if (result.compatible) {
    console.log(&#39;✅ All versions are compatible!\n&#39;);
  } else {
    console.log(&#39;❌ Version compatibility issues detected:\n&#39;);
  }

  if (result.version_mismatches.length &gt; 0) {
    console.log(&#39;🔍 Version Mismatches:&#39;);
    for (const mismatch of result.version_mismatches) {
      const icon = mismatch.severity === &#39;error&#39; ? &#39;❌&#39; : &#39;⚠️&#39;;
      console.log(
        `  ${icon} ${mismatch.component}: expected ${mismatch.expected}, got ${mismatch.actual}`
      );
    }
    console.log();
  }

  if (result.migration_required &amp;&amp; result.migration_path) {
    console.log(&#39;🔄 Migration Available:&#39;);
    console.log(`  Command: ${result.migration_path}`);
    console.log();
  }

  if (verbose) {
    console.log(`⏰ Checked at: ${result.timestamp}`);
  }
}

/**
 * Output compatibility result as table
 */
function outputCompatibilityTable(result: CompatibilityResult): void {
  if (result.version_mismatches.length === 0) {
    console.log(&#39;✅ All versions compatible - no issues to display&#39;);
    return;
  }

  console.table(
    result.version_mismatches.map(mismatch =&gt; ({
      Component: mismatch.component,
      Expected: mismatch.expected,
      Actual: mismatch.actual,
      Severity: mismatch.severity,
      Status: mismatch.severity === &#39;error&#39; ? &#39;❌ Error&#39; : &#39;⚠️ Warning&#39;,
    }))
  );
}

/**
 * Show available migration paths for incompatible versions
 */
async function showMigrationPaths(
  versionsToCheck: Partial&lt;VersionSet&gt;,
  _options: CompatCheckOptions
): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  console.log(&#39;🚀 Available Migration Paths:\n&#39;);

  for (const [component, sourceVersion] of Object.entries(versionsToCheck)) {
    const key = component as keyof VersionSet;
    const componentName = String(key);
    const targetVersion = CURRENT_VERSIONS[key];

    if (sourceVersion &amp;&amp; sourceVersion !== targetVersion) {
      const paths = getAvailableMigrationPaths(componentName);
      const directPath = hasMigrationPath(componentName, sourceVersion, targetVersion);
      const duration = estimateMigrationDuration(componentName, sourceVersion, targetVersion);

      console.log(`📦 ${component}:`);
      console.log(`  Current: ${sourceVersion} → Target: ${targetVersion}`);

      if (directPath) {
        console.log(&#39;  ✅ Direct migration available&#39;);
        console.log(`  ⏱️  Estimated duration: ${duration}ms`);
        console.log(
          `  🔧 Command: arbiter migrate --component ${componentName} --from ${sourceVersion} --to ${targetVersion}`
        );
      } else {
        console.log(&#39;  ❌ No direct migration path available&#39;);
        if (paths.length &gt; 0) {
          console.log(`  🛤️  Available paths: ${paths.join(&#39;, &#39;)}`);
        }
      }
      console.log();
    }
  }
}

// =============================================================================
// MIGRATION COMMAND
// =============================================================================

/**
 * Execute migration command
 */
export async function runMigration(options: MigrationOptions): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const migrationRunner = new MigrationRunner(options);
  await migrationRunner.execute();
}

/**
 * Migration execution orchestrator using Command pattern
 */
class MigrationRunner {
  private readonly component: keyof VersionSet;
  private readonly componentName: string;

  constructor(private readonly options: MigrationOptions) {
    this.component = options.component as keyof VersionSet;
    this.componentName = String(this.component);
  }

  async execute(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    try {
      this.displayHeader();
      await this.validateMigrationPath();
      this.displayEstimatedDuration();

      if (this.options.dryRun) {
        this.executeDryRun();
        return;
      }

      this.requestConfirmationIfNeeded();
      await this.performMigration();
    } catch (error) {
      this.handleFatalError(error);
    }
  }

  private displayHeader(): void {
    console.log(&#39;🔄 Arbiter Migration Tool v1.0 RC\n&#39;);
    console.log(`📦 Component: ${this.componentName}`);
    console.log(`📥 From: ${this.options.from}`);
    console.log(`📤 To: ${this.options.to}`);
    console.log();
  }

  private async validateMigrationPath(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    if (!hasMigrationPath(this.componentName, this.options.from, this.options.to)) {
      this.displayMigrationPathError();
      process.exit(1);
    }
  }

  private displayMigrationPathError(): void {
    console.error(
      `❌ No migration path available: ${this.componentName} ${this.options.from} -&gt; ${this.options.to}`
    );

    const availablePaths = getAvailableMigrationPaths(this.componentName);
    if (availablePaths.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(&#39;\n🛤️  Available migration paths:&#39;);
      availablePaths.forEach(path =&gt; console.log(`  • ${path}`));
    }
  }

  private displayEstimatedDuration(): void {
    const estimatedDuration = estimateMigrationDuration(
      this.componentName,
      this.options.from,
      this.options.to
    );
    console.log(`⏱️  Estimated duration: ${estimatedDuration}ms`);
  }

  private executeDryRun(): void {
    console.log(&#39;\n🧪 DRY RUN MODE - No changes will be made\n&#39;);
    this.displayMigrationPlan();
    console.log(&#39;\n✅ Dry run completed - use --dry-run=false to execute&#39;);
    process.exit(0);
  }

  private displayMigrationPlan(): void {
    console.log(&#39;Migration plan:&#39;);
    console.log(`  1. Validate preconditions for ${this.componentName} migration`);
    console.log(`  2. ${this.options.backup ? &#39;Create backup&#39; : &#39;Skip backup (disabled)&#39;}`);
    console.log(&#39;  3. Execute migration transformations&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  4. Validate post-migration state&#39;);
    console.log(&#39;  5. Update version metadata&#39;);
  }

  private requestConfirmationIfNeeded(): void {
    if (!this.options.force) {
      console.log(&#39;⚠️  This will modify your system. Continue? (y/N)&#39;);
      // In a real CLI, we&#39;d wait for user input here
      // For now, assume confirmation
    }
  }

  private async performMigration(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
    console.log(&#39;\n🚀 Starting migration...\n&#39;);

    const result = await executeMigration(this.componentName, this.options.from, this.options.to);

    if (result.success) {
      this.displaySuccessResult(result);
    } else {
      this.displayFailureResult(result);
      process.exit(1);
    }
  }

  private displaySuccessResult(result: MigrationResult): void {
    console.log(&#39;✅ Migration completed successfully!\n&#39;);

    this.displayOperations(&#39;📋 Operations performed:&#39;, result.operations_performed);
    this.displayWarningsIfAny(result.warnings);

    console.log(`\n⏰ Completed at: ${result.timestamp}`);
  }

  private displayFailureResult(result: MigrationResult): void {
    console.error(&#39;❌ Migration failed!\n&#39;);

    this.displayOperations(&#39;📋 Operations attempted:&#39;, result.operations_performed);

    if (result.warnings.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(&#39;\n⚠️  Issues encountered:&#39;);
      result.warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; console.log(`  • ${warning}`));
    }
  }

  private displayOperations(header: string, operations: string[]): void {
    console.log(header);
    operations.forEach(op =&gt; console.log(`  • ${op}`));
  }

  private displayWarningsIfAny(warnings: string[]): void {
    if (warnings.length &gt; 0) {
      console.log(&#39;\n⚠️  Warnings:&#39;);
      warnings.forEach(warning =&gt; console.log(`  • ${warning}`));
    }
  }

  private handleFatalError(error: unknown): never {
    console.error(&#39;❌ Migration failed:&#39;, error instanceof Error ? error.message : error);
    process.exit(1);
  }
}

/**
 * Migration result interface
 */
interface MigrationResult {
  success: boolean;
  operations_performed: string[];
  warnings: string[];
  timestamp: string;
}

// =============================================================================
// VERSION INFO COMMAND
// =============================================================================

/**
 * Show current version information
 */
export async function showVersionInfo(): Promise&lt;void&gt; {
  const runtimeInfo = getRuntimeVersionInfo();

  console.log(&#39;📋 Arbiter Version Information v1.0 RC\n&#39;);

  console.log(&#39;🔢 Current Versions:&#39;);
  console.table(runtimeInfo.versions);

  console.log(&#39;\n🏗️  Build Information:&#39;);
  console.log(`  Timestamp: ${runtimeInfo.build_info.timestamp}`);
  console.log(`  Commit: ${runtimeInfo.build_info.commit_hash || &#39;unknown&#39;}`);
  console.log(`  Deterministic: ${runtimeInfo.build_info.deterministic ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;❌&#39;}`);
  console.log(`  Reproducible: ${runtimeInfo.build_info.reproducible ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;❌&#39;}`);

  console.log(&#39;\n⚙️  Compatibility Settings:&#39;);
  console.log(`  Strict Mode: ${runtimeInfo.compatibility.strict_mode ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;❌&#39;}`);
  console.log(`  Allow Compat Flag: ${runtimeInfo.compatibility.allow_compat_flag ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;❌&#39;}`);
  console.log(`  Migration Support: ${runtimeInfo.compatibility.migration_support ? &#39;✅&#39; : &#39;❌&#39;}`);
}
📄 apps/web/frontend/src/design-system/components/Checkbox.tsx
/**
 * Checkbox Component - Design System
 * Professional checkbox with comprehensive states and accessibility
 * Designed for developer tools with sophisticated graphite theme
 */

import React, { forwardRef, type InputHTMLAttributes, type ReactNode } from &#39;react&#39;;
import { clsx } from &#39;clsx&#39;;
import { Check, Minus, AlertCircle, CheckCircle, AlertTriangle, Loader2 } from &#39;lucide-react&#39;;
import { cn } from &#39;../variants&#39;;

export interface CheckboxProps extends Omit&lt;InputHTMLAttributes&lt;HTMLInputElement&gt;, &#39;size&#39;&gt; {
  /** Checkbox variant determines the visual style */
  variant?: &#39;default&#39; | &#39;error&#39; | &#39;success&#39; | &#39;warning&#39;;

  /** Checkbox size affects the checkbox and font size */
  size?: &#39;sm&#39; | &#39;md&#39; | &#39;lg&#39;;

  /** Label text for the checkbox */
  label?: string;

  /** Additional description text */
  description?: string;

  /** Helper text below the checkbox */
  helperText?: string;

  /** Error message (sets variant to error automatically) */
  error?: string;

  /** Warning message (sets variant to warning automatically) */
  warning?: string;

  /** Success message (sets variant to success automatically) */
  success?: string;

  /** Whether the checkbox is in an indeterminate state */
  indeterminate?: boolean;

  /** Whether the checkbox is in a loading state */
  loading?: boolean;

  /** Whether to show validation icons automatically */
  showValidationIcon?: boolean;

  /** Custom className for additional styling */
  className?: string;

  /** Custom className for the wrapper */
  wrapperClassName?: string;

  /** Custom className for the label */
  labelClassName?: string;

  /** Children to render as custom label content */
  children?: ReactNode;
}

export const Checkbox = forwardRef&lt;HTMLInputElement, CheckboxProps&gt;(
  (
    {
      variant = &#39;default&#39;,
      size = &#39;md&#39;,
      label,
      description,
      helperText,
      error,
      warning,
      success,
      indeterminate = false,
      loading = false,
      showValidationIcon = true,
      disabled,
      checked,
      className,
      wrapperClassName,
      labelClassName,
      children,
      id,
      ...props
    },
    ref
  ) =&gt; {
    // Determine actual variant based on state props
    const actualVariant = error ? &#39;error&#39; : warning ? &#39;warning&#39; : success ? &#39;success&#39; : variant;
    const actualHelperText = error || warning || success || helperText;

    // Generate unique ID
    const checkboxId = id || `checkbox-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`;

    // Get validation icon
    const getValidationIcon = () =&gt; {
      if (!showValidationIcon || loading) return null;

      if (error) return &lt;AlertCircle className=&quot;h-4 w-4 text-red-500&quot; /&gt;;
      if (warning) return &lt;AlertTriangle className=&quot;h-4 w-4 text-amber-500&quot; /&gt;;
      if (success) return &lt;CheckCircle className=&quot;h-4 w-4 text-green-500&quot; /&gt;;

      return null;
    };

    const validationIcon = getValidationIcon();

    // Checkbox size classes
    const sizeClasses = {
      sm: {
        checkbox: &#39;h-4 w-4&#39;,
        text: &#39;text-sm&#39;,
        icon: &#39;h-2.5 w-2.5&#39;,
        gap: &#39;gap-2&#39;,
      },
      md: {
        checkbox: &#39;h-5 w-5&#39;,
        text: &#39;text-base&#39;,
        icon: &#39;h-3 w-3&#39;,
        gap: &#39;gap-3&#39;,
      },
      lg: {
        checkbox: &#39;h-6 w-6&#39;,
        text: &#39;text-lg&#39;,
        icon: &#39;h-4 w-4&#39;,
        gap: &#39;gap-3&#39;,
      },
    };

    const sizeClass = sizeClasses[size];

    // Checkbox variant classes
    const variantClasses = {
      default: cn(
        &#39;border-graphite-300 text-blue-600 focus:ring-blue-500&#39;,
        &#39;checked:bg-blue-600 checked:border-blue-600&#39;,
        &#39;hover:border-graphite-400&#39;,
        &#39;disabled:bg-graphite-50 disabled:border-graphite-200 disabled:text-graphite-400&#39;
      ),
      error: cn(
        &#39;border-red-300 text-red-600 focus:ring-red-500&#39;,
        &#39;checked:bg-red-600 checked:border-red-600&#39;,
        &#39;hover:border-red-400&#39;,
        &#39;disabled:bg-red-50 disabled:border-red-200 disabled:text-red-300&#39;
      ),
      warning: cn(
        &#39;border-amber-300 text-amber-600 focus:ring-amber-500&#39;,
        &#39;checked:bg-amber-600 checked:border-amber-600&#39;,
        &#39;hover:border-amber-400&#39;,
        &#39;disabled:bg-amber-50 disabled:border-amber-200 disabled:text-amber-300&#39;
      ),
      success: cn(
        &#39;border-emerald-300 text-emerald-600 focus:ring-emerald-500&#39;,
        &#39;checked:bg-emerald-600 checked:border-emerald-600&#39;,
        &#39;hover:border-emerald-400&#39;,
        &#39;disabled:bg-emerald-50 disabled:border-emerald-200 disabled:text-emerald-300&#39;
      ),
    };

    const checkboxClasses = cn(
      // Base styles
      &#39;relative rounded border-2 transition-all duration-150 ease-in-out&#39;,
      &#39;focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-offset-2 focus:ring-opacity-50&#39;,
      &#39;disabled:cursor-not-allowed&#39;,

      // Size
      sizeClass.checkbox,

      // Variant styles
      variantClasses[actualVariant],

      // Loading state
      loading &amp;&amp; &#39;cursor-wait&#39;,

      className
    );

    const wrapperClasses = cn(
      &#39;flex items-start&#39;,
      sizeClass.gap,
      disabled &amp;&amp; &#39;opacity-60 cursor-not-allowed&#39;,
      wrapperClassName
    );

    const labelClasses = cn(
      &#39;flex-1&#39;,
      sizeClass.text,
      &#39;text-graphite-900 font-medium cursor-pointer select-none&#39;,
      actualVariant === &#39;error&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-red-900&#39;,
      actualVariant === &#39;warning&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-amber-900&#39;,
      actualVariant === &#39;success&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-emerald-900&#39;,
      disabled &amp;&amp; &#39;cursor-not-allowed text-graphite-500&#39;,
      labelClassName
    );

    return (
      &lt;div className=&quot;space-y-1&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div className={wrapperClasses}&gt;
          {/* Hidden input */}
          &lt;input
            ref={ref}
            type=&quot;checkbox&quot;
            id={checkboxId}
            checked={checked}
            disabled={disabled || loading}
            className=&quot;sr-only&quot;
            aria-describedby={cn(
              actualHelperText &amp;&amp; `${checkboxId}-description`,
              description &amp;&amp; `${checkboxId}-desc`
            )}
            {...props}
          /&gt;

          {/* Custom checkbox */}
          &lt;div className=&quot;relative flex-shrink-0&quot;&gt;
            &lt;div className={checkboxClasses}&gt;
              {/* Loading spinner */}
              {loading &amp;&amp; (
                &lt;div className=&quot;absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;Loader2 className={cn(sizeClass.icon, &#39;animate-spin text-graphite-400&#39;)} /&gt;
                &lt;/div&gt;
              )}

              {/* Check/indeterminate icon */}
              {!loading &amp;&amp; (checked || indeterminate) &amp;&amp; (
                &lt;div className=&quot;absolute inset-0 flex items-center justify-center text-white&quot;&gt;
                  {indeterminate ? (
                    &lt;Minus className={sizeClass.icon} strokeWidth={3} /&gt;
                  ) : (
                    &lt;Check className={sizeClass.icon} strokeWidth={3} /&gt;
                  )}
                &lt;/div&gt;
              )}
            &lt;/div&gt;
          &lt;/div&gt;

          {/* Label and content */}
          {(label || children) &amp;&amp; (
            &lt;div className=&quot;flex-1 space-y-1&quot;&gt;
              &lt;label htmlFor={checkboxId} className={labelClasses}&gt;
                &lt;div className=&quot;flex items-start justify-between gap-2&quot;&gt;
                  &lt;span&gt;{children || label}&lt;/span&gt;

                  {/* Validation icon */}
                  {validationIcon &amp;&amp; &lt;div className=&quot;flex-shrink-0&quot;&gt;{validationIcon}&lt;/div&gt;}
                &lt;/div&gt;
              &lt;/label&gt;

              {/* Description */}
              {description &amp;&amp; (
                &lt;p
                  id={`${checkboxId}-desc`}
                  className={cn(&#39;text-sm text-graphite-600&#39;, disabled &amp;&amp; &#39;text-graphite-400&#39;)}
                &gt;
                  {description}
                &lt;/p&gt;
              )}
            &lt;/div&gt;
          )}
        &lt;/div&gt;

        {/* Helper text / Validation messages */}
        {actualHelperText &amp;&amp; (
          &lt;p
            id={`${checkboxId}-description`}
            className={cn(
              &#39;text-sm ml-7 flex items-start gap-1&#39;,
              actualVariant === &#39;error&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-red-600&#39;,
              actualVariant === &#39;warning&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-amber-600&#39;,
              actualVariant === &#39;success&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-green-600&#39;,
              actualVariant === &#39;default&#39; &amp;&amp; &#39;text-graphite-600&#39;
            )}
          &gt;
            {actualHelperText}
          &lt;/p&gt;
        )}
      &lt;/div&gt;
    );
  }
);

Checkbox.displayName = &#39;Checkbox&#39;;

export default Checkbox;
📄 packages/shared/src/__tests__/issue-schema.test.ts
/**
 * Tests for the issue schema specification and validation
 */
import { describe, expect, test } from &#39;bun:test&#39;;
import {
  DEFAULT_ISSUE_VALIDATION,
  type IssueSpec,
  createChecklistItem,
  createIssue,
  validateIssue,
} from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

describe(&#39;Issue Schema Validation&#39;, () =&gt; {
  test(&#39;validates valid issue with required fields only&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue: IssueSpec = {
      title: &#39;Test Issue&#39;,
      body: &#39;This is a test issue description&#39;,
    };

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(true);
    expect(result.errors).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  test(&#39;validates issue with all fields&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue: IssueSpec = {
      title: &#39;Complete Test Issue&#39;,
      body: &#39;This is a comprehensive test issue with all fields&#39;,
      labels: [&#39;bug&#39;, &#39;priority:high&#39;],
      acceptance_criteria: [&#39;Should fix the bug&#39;, &#39;Should include tests&#39;],
      checklist: [
        { id: &#39;item-1&#39;, text: &#39;Fix the code&#39;, done: false },
        { id: &#39;item-2&#39;, text: &#39;Write tests&#39;, done: true },
      ],
      links: [&#39;https://github.com/example/repo/issues/123&#39;],
    };

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(true);
    expect(result.errors).toHaveLength(0);
  });

  test(&#39;rejects issue with missing title&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue = {
      body: &#39;This has no title&#39;,
    } as Partial&lt;IssueSpec&gt;;

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&quot;Field &#39;title&#39; is required&quot;);
  });

  test(&#39;rejects issue with missing body&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue = {
      title: &#39;Title Only&#39;,
    } as Partial&lt;IssueSpec&gt;;

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&quot;Field &#39;body&#39; is required&quot;);
  });

  test(&#39;rejects issue with empty title&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue = {
      title: &#39;   &#39;,
      body: &#39;This has empty title&#39;,
    } as Partial&lt;IssueSpec&gt;;

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&quot;Field &#39;title&#39; is required&quot;);
  });

  test(&#39;rejects title longer than 255 characters&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const longTitle = &#39;a&#39;.repeat(256);
    const issue: IssueSpec = {
      title: longTitle,
      body: &#39;This title is too long&#39;,
    };

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&#39;Title exceeds maximum length of 255 characters&#39;);
  });

  test(&#39;validates checklist items structure&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue: IssueSpec = {
      title: &#39;Test Checklist&#39;,
      body: &#39;Testing checklist validation&#39;,
      checklist: [
        { id: &#39;valid-item&#39;, text: &#39;Valid item&#39;, done: false },
        { id: &#39;&#39;, text: &#39;Invalid item - no id&#39;, done: false },
        { id: &#39;no-text&#39;, text: &#39;&#39;, done: false },
      ],
    };

    const result = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&quot;Checklist item 1 missing required &#39;id&#39; field&quot;);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&quot;Checklist item 2 missing required &#39;text&#39; field&quot;);
  });
});

describe(&#39;Issue Creation Helpers&#39;, () =&gt; {
  test(&#39;createIssue creates valid issue with defaults&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue = createIssue({
      title: &#39;New Issue&#39;,
      body: &#39;New issue description&#39;,
    });

    expect(issue.title).toBe(&#39;New Issue&#39;);
    expect(issue.body).toBe(&#39;New issue description&#39;);
    expect(issue.labels).toEqual([]);
    expect(issue.acceptance_criteria).toEqual([]);
    expect(issue.checklist).toEqual([]);
    expect(issue.links).toEqual([]);

    const validation = validateIssue(issue);
    expect(validation.valid).toBe(true);
  });

  test(&#39;createIssue merges provided optional fields&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const issue = createIssue({
      title: &#39;New Issue&#39;,
      body: &#39;New issue description&#39;,
      labels: [&#39;feature&#39;],
      acceptance_criteria: [&#39;Must work&#39;],
      links: [&#39;https://example.com&#39;],
    });

    expect(issue.labels).toEqual([&#39;feature&#39;]);
    expect(issue.acceptance_criteria).toEqual([&#39;Must work&#39;]);
    expect(issue.links).toEqual([&#39;https://example.com&#39;]);
  });

  test(&#39;createChecklistItem generates proper structure&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const item = createChecklistItem(&#39;Test item&#39;, true);

    expect(item.text).toBe(&#39;Test item&#39;);
    expect(item.done).toBe(true);
    expect(item.id).toMatch(/^item-\d+-[a-z0-9]+$/);
  });

  test(&#39;createChecklistItem defaults done to false&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const item = createChecklistItem(&#39;Test item&#39;);

    expect(item.done).toBe(false);
  });
});

describe(&#39;Issue Validation Configuration&#39;, () =&gt; {
  test(&#39;uses custom validation config&#39;, () =&gt; {
    const customConfig = {
      maxTitleLength: 50,
      requiredFields: [&#39;title&#39;] as (keyof IssueSpec)[],
    };

    const issue: IssueSpec = {
      title: &#39;a&#39;.repeat(51), // Exceeds custom limit
      body: &#39;Body is not required in custom config&#39;,
    };

    const result = validateIssue(issue, customConfig);
    expect(result.valid).toBe(false);
    expect(result.errors).toContain(&#39;Title exceeds maximum length of 50 characters&#39;);
    // Should not complain about missing body since it&#39;s not in requiredFields
    expect(result.errors.some(e =&gt; e.includes(&#39;body&#39;))).toBe(false);
  });

  test(&#39;default configuration values&#39;, () =&gt; {
    expect(DEFAULT_ISSUE_VALIDATION.maxTitleLength).toBe(255);
    expect(DEFAULT_ISSUE_VALIDATION.requiredFields).toEqual([&#39;title&#39;, &#39;body&#39;]);
  });
});
📄 apps/api/src/handlers/examples/spec-validator.ts
/**
 * Example: Spec validation handler
 * Automatically validates CUE specifications when changes are detected
 */

import type { HandlerModule, WebhookHandler } from &#39;../types.js&#39;;

const handleSpecValidation: WebhookHandler = async (payload, context) =&gt; {
  const { logger, services, projectId } = context;
  const { parsed } = payload;

  logger.info(&#39;Processing spec validation handler&#39;, {
    event: parsed.eventType,
    repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
    commitCount: parsed.commits?.length || 0,
  });

  try {
    // Check if any CUE files were modified
    const specFiles =
      parsed.commits?.flatMap(commit =&gt; [
        ...commit.added.filter(file =&gt; file.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;)),
        ...commit.modified.filter(file =&gt; file.endsWith(&#39;.cue&#39;)),
      ]) || [];

    if (specFiles.length === 0) {
      logger.debug(&#39;No CUE files changed, skipping validation&#39;);
      return {
        success: true,
        message: &#39;No CUE files changed&#39;,
        actions: [],
      };
    }

    logger.info(&#39;CUE files detected for validation&#39;, {
      files: specFiles,
      count: specFiles.length,
    });

    const actions: string[] = [];

    // Trigger spec validation event
    await services.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
      project_id: projectId,
      event_type: &#39;validation_started&#39;,
      data: {
        trigger: &#39;spec_validation_handler&#39;,
        repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
        ref: payload.ref,
        specFiles,
        commits:
          parsed.commits?.map(c =&gt; ({
            sha: c.sha,
            message: c.message,
            author: c.author,
          })) || [],
      },
    });

    actions.push(`Triggered validation for ${specFiles.length} CUE files`);

    // For each spec file, log what changed
    for (const file of specFiles) {
      const commit = parsed.commits?.find(c =&gt; c.added.includes(file) || c.modified.includes(file));

      if (commit) {
        const action = commit.added.includes(file) ? &#39;added&#39; : &#39;modified&#39;;
        logger.info(`Spec file ${action}`, {
          file,
          commit: commit.sha,
          message: commit.message,
        });

        actions.push(`Detected ${action} spec file: ${file}`);
      }
    }

    // Check for breaking changes based on commit messages
    const breakingChanges =
      parsed.commits?.filter(
        commit =&gt;
          commit.message.toLowerCase().includes(&#39;breaking&#39;) ||
          commit.message.toLowerCase().includes(&#39;breaking change&#39;) ||
          commit.message.includes(&#39;BREAKING CHANGE:&#39;)
      ) || [];

    if (breakingChanges.length &gt; 0) {
      logger.warn(&#39;Breaking changes detected in spec files&#39;, {
        commits: breakingChanges.map(c =&gt; ({ sha: c.sha, message: c.message })),
      });

      // Broadcast breaking change warning
      await services.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
        project_id: projectId,
        event_type: &#39;validation_started&#39;,
        data: {
          trigger: &#39;breaking_change_detection&#39;,
          repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
          breakingChanges: breakingChanges.map(c =&gt; ({
            sha: c.sha,
            message: c.message,
            author: c.author,
          })),
          warning: &#39;Breaking changes detected in specification files&#39;,
        },
      });

      actions.push(`⚠️ Detected ${breakingChanges.length} commits with breaking changes`);
    }

    // Check for assembly files specifically
    const assemblyFiles = specFiles.filter(
      file =&gt; file.includes(&#39;assembly&#39;) || file.includes(&#39;.assembly.cue&#39;)
    );

    if (assemblyFiles.length &gt; 0) {
      logger.info(&#39;Assembly files detected, triggering comprehensive validation&#39;, {
        assemblyFiles,
      });

      await services.events.broadcastToProject(projectId, {
        project_id: projectId,
        event_type: &#39;validation_started&#39;,
        data: {
          trigger: &#39;assembly_validation&#39;,
          repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
          assemblyFiles,
          validationType: &#39;comprehensive&#39;,
        },
      });

      actions.push(
        `🏗️ Triggered comprehensive validation for ${assemblyFiles.length} assembly files`
      );
    }

    // Estimate validation complexity
    const totalLines =
      parsed.commits?.reduce((sum, commit) =&gt; {
        return sum + (commit.added.length + commit.modified.length);
      }, 0) || 0;

    let complexity = &#39;low&#39;;
    if (totalLines &gt; 50 || breakingChanges.length &gt; 0) {
      complexity = &#39;high&#39;;
    } else if (totalLines &gt; 20 || assemblyFiles.length &gt; 0) {
      complexity = &#39;medium&#39;;
    }

    logger.info(&#39;Validation complexity estimated&#39;, {
      complexity,
      totalLines,
      specFiles: specFiles.length,
      assemblyFiles: assemblyFiles.length,
      breakingChanges: breakingChanges.length,
    });

    return {
      success: true,
      message: `Validation triggered for ${specFiles.length} CUE files`,
      actions,
      data: {
        specFilesChanged: specFiles.length,
        assemblyFilesChanged: assemblyFiles.length,
        breakingChangesDetected: breakingChanges.length,
        validationComplexity: complexity,
        repository: parsed.repository.fullName,
        ref: payload.ref,
      },
    };
  } catch (error) {
    logger.error(&#39;Spec validation handler failed&#39;, error as Error);

    return {
      success: false,
      message: &#39;Spec validation handler execution failed&#39;,
      errors: [
        {
          code: &#39;VALIDATION_HANDLER_ERROR&#39;,
          message: error instanceof Error ? error.message : &#39;Unknown error&#39;,
          stack: error instanceof Error ? error.stack : undefined,
        },
      ],
    };
  }
};

const handlerModule: HandlerModule = {
  handler: handleSpecValidation,
  config: {
    enabled: true,
    timeout: 20000,
    retries: 1,
    environment: {
      VALIDATION_MODE: &#39;strict&#39;,
    },
    secrets: {},
  },
  metadata: {
    name: &#39;Spec Validation Handler&#39;,
    description: &#39;Automatically validates CUE specifications when changes are detected in commits&#39;,
    version: &#39;1.0.0&#39;,
    author: &#39;Arbiter Team&#39;,
    supportedEvents: [&#39;push&#39;, &#39;Push Hook&#39;],
    requiredPermissions: [&#39;events:publish&#39;, &#39;validation:trigger&#39;],
  },
};

export default handlerModule;
📄 README.md
# test-project

This is a CUE project created with Arbiter CLI.

## Getting Started

⚠️ **IMPORTANT**: This project has been initialized with basic structure only.
To add functionality, use the Arbiter CLI commands to build your specification:

### 1. Add components to your specification:

```bash
# Add API endpoints, data models, configurations, etc.
arbiter add &lt;component-type&gt; &lt;name&gt;
```

### 2. Generate project files from your specification:

```bash
arbiter generate
```

### 3. Validate your configuration:

```bash
arbiter check
```

## Project Structure

- `cue.mod/` - CUE module configuration
- `.arbiter/config.json` - Arbiter CLI configuration
- Generated CUE files will appear after running `arbiter generate`

## Learn More

- [CUE Documentation](https://cuelang.org/docs/)
- [Arbiter CLI](https://github.com/arbiter/cli)

    &lt;meta charset=&quot;UTF-8&quot; /&gt;
    &lt;link rel=&quot;icon&quot; type=&quot;image/svg+xml&quot; href=&quot;/vite.svg&quot; /&gt;
    &lt;meta name=&quot;viewport&quot; content=&quot;width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0&quot; /&gt;
    &lt;title&gt;demo-project&lt;/title&gt;
  &lt;/head&gt;
  &lt;body&gt;
    &lt;div id=&quot;root&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;script type=&quot;module&quot; src=&quot;/src/main.tsx&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;
  &lt;/body&gt;
&lt;/html&gt;

 * Temporary test app to verify Monaco Editor CUE syntax highlighting
 */

import React from &#39;react&#39;;
import MonacoTest from &#39;./MonacoTest&#39;;

function TestApp() {
  return &lt;MonacoTest /&gt;;
}

export default TestApp;
📄 tests/e2e-docker-compose/app/package.json
{
  &quot;name&quot;: &quot;e2e-test-app&quot;,
  &quot;version&quot;: &quot;1.0.0&quot;,
  &quot;main&quot;: &quot;index.js&quot;,
  &quot;scripts&quot;: {
    &quot;start&quot;: &quot;node index.js&quot;
  },
  &quot;dependencies&quot;: {
    &quot;express&quot;: &quot;^4.18.2&quot;
  }
}
